column13: I would recommend but only for the tableside S'mores. I thought the burger and tots were just "ok". The fried pickles had a tasteless batter that didn't stick well to the spear. The decor seemed very dated.

We decided to try this place since we made a last minute decision to eat in Boulder. Our favorite places didn't have any open reservations. There were only two pizza sizes large or small. The large was way too big for two people. The wood holder for the pizza took up most of the table and was uncomfortable for the third person in our party tto eat his pasta. The pizza was okay- could have used just a bit more cheese. One of our toppings was spinach. It wasn't cooked with the pizza, but was tossed on top. There was so much of it, it was hard to eat the pizza. Service was drop and go, but the waitress was friendly. There are so many better options in Boulder. This is a last resort.
Unusual locale cuisine items, ample portions, great presentation, very well prepared and delicious, perhaps a bit pricey. Service was great without being fawning.
The food here was absolutely fabulous. I have not been to any Vietnamese place that has this good food. Ana Mandara is good but this is better.

We chose a restaurant with a coastal sunset.Dine LA week;we ordered both choices from the prix fixe menu. My peach starter:The unripe peaches were served grilled, but harder than an apple. On the other hand, my husband's ceviche was delicious. For the entrees: I had salmon,topped and overpowered by a chopped tomato topping that tasted like it came out of a can. The other entree had a nearly inedible,tough,chewy steak and very tender well-seasoned roast beef, but the eggplant was like leather. The meal was saved by dessert:Olive oil cake with a whole blueberry drizzle and a hazelnut mocha pastry,and rich chocolate lava cake gratis for our anniversary. Bravo to their pastry chef. Our server had a disapproving manner. Return for dessert only!

We were the only party eating there for lunch on a sunny Saturday. The owner (who is also the chef?) was friendly. We had the goat curry and the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Tandoori chicken. The plates are small for the price and, although I guess the area is more expensive in general, 3 pieces of thigh meat does not equal 1/2 chicken which is how the Tandoori chicken was described. The curries were delicious, not the flavors I expected, but also not spicy at all. Naan was great, but $2.50 for 1 piece?? Overall, can't fault the food but I'll still go elsewhere next time.

column4: 315 Old Santa Fe Trail Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: My French husband and I truly appreciated the French flair of the restaurant as well as the food itself and the presentation! We had the duck and the lamb, followed by the creme brulee and the pots de creme, and shared all with each other. The duck and the lamb were outstanding paired together, as well as the desserts! I would actually suggest them as pairings in a single dish for the menu. We originally were going to have the beef, which was mentioned on the specials board, but were surprised to learn upon requesting it to the waitstaff, that it would take 40 minutes to prepare, even rare, which is our preference. It would have been nice to have this mentioned on the board as well as the menu.

column4: 5225 Belt Line Road Suite 220 Dallas, TX  75254
column13: We love Houlihan's. Great food and excellent service by Heather. Would love to see some specials for dinner - if only on weekends. Thanks.
Food quality and service were very good!
Great restaurant with amazing menu! The almond crusted tilapia is fantastic!
Excellent food with impeccable service. High end food but down to earth service; my 17-year old felt just as comfortable as he would anywhere else thanks to such great service.

column4: 4290 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: the food was good & reasonably priced.a very good place for a banquet.

column4: 645 So Cache St. Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: The duck special on our Saturday night dinner was under cooked and the mashed potatoes on several of our groups dinner had a dry, instant flavor. We'll give them the benefit of the doubt and try it again in a few months. The facility is stunning, at the base of Snow King, with beautiful views. The service was decent and the wine list was okay. Pure foodies might want to pass on this place, but the location and views are worth checking out.
We enjoyed the chef inspired creative meal for two. The ambiance is lively but a bit too noisy for large groups. We would like to see more variety of choices on the menu in the future.

The outstanding food completely overcomes the poor service. Actually, the servers worked very hard and were very cheerful (and apologetic) but they are just very understaffed. There were 6 of us, and we had lamb, chicken, salmon and veggie dishes. My tandoori Salmon was the best salmon I have ever had, anywhere. Apricot chicken, lamb dishes, everything was excellent. One exception was the Naan. We ordered garlic naan, got plain naan, and then discovered that it was actually the garlic version, just so mild no one could taste the garlic. But this little place could become the next Amber India, which started in a little strip mall store front similar to this place. It's that good. The drive from SF to Petaluma was absolutely worth it.
Great wait staff and great food. If u are expecting to enjoy your food, this is the place. Quantity is just righ. Highly impressed
The Meal was Good the Gelato Was Great!A great Dining experience.
Refreshing and authentic without the pretension.

We arrived in time for the sunset special. The meal and service were very good. they offered a childrens menu for our kids and their food was also very good. Because we were there early, the dining room was mostly empty so the place was quiet. We were given a nice table by the window, with a beautiful view of the sunset over the ocean.

Breakfast burritos and green chili are the best! Tried the pesole too which was very good! I always enjoy the great service and food made with fresh ingredients - housemaid tortillas with organic flour - yum! Also, where else can you get chocolate cake (and other delicious deserts) to help put out the green chili fire left in your mouth? I wonder why this restaurant isn't busier. I think it is just a gem waiting to be discovered.

column4: 10250 Santa Monica Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90067
column13: Excellent outing at Rock Sugar. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. They remembered to put a candle on the dessert per my note on Open Table to celebrate my wife's birthday.Location - great location and parking is such a breeze in the mall parking. Great ambiance within the restaurant - romantic.Food - Very delicious and flavorful. Chicken samosas were delicious. Overall the food was very tasty and we all had a great time.

column4: Elevation Hotel -  500 Gothic Rd. Mt. Crested Butte, CO  81225
column13: Not a good dining experience.
IT was delicious and often go there for a good time!

column4: 4321 West Flamingo Road Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: Was good, but nothing spectacular as far as Vegas Dining goes. The 'amuse bouche' was tunafish salad on crackers... like I make my 3 year old for snacks. The scallops were enormous and perfectly cooked.

column4: 1203 N Loop 1604 W  #101 San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: The best flounder we've ever had! - fresh, moist and perfectly prepared with a light, delicious sauce. Our waitress was charming, friendly and extremely efficient. We highly recommend this restaurant.

The Golden Beetle has an exceptional bar with hand-made bitters. Make sure to order off of their cocktail list or ask the barkeep for a suggestion. The restaurant is lovely with black and white photographs from the Mediterranean. Our server was very nice and was unobtrusive without ignoring us. My favorite dish was the cucumber and jalapeno salad.
Met a collegue for lunch food was great and was not so noisy i couldn't hear him across the table. we had a good time and the server was great!

column4: 675 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94301
column13: Restaurant Soleil has an excellent brunch with the standard but also some very unusual offerings. All are high quality and delicious. There is an emphasis on Asian style salads and appetizers, in addition to fresh fish, fruits, breads, cheeses, roast beef, eggs, sausages, sweets, and a chocolate fountain! The service is attentive and friendly. The brunch is very reasonably priced, especially when considering the quality of the food. The ambiance is elegant and suitable for special occasions.
Love love love Aslam's! The service is the best in the city, the food is oh so tasty - and we always have such a fantastic time.

Awesome Food, Great Wine and Drink List, Chef Rathburn, and his upper level Team makes his rounds and visits each table to greet them and Thank them for having dinner tonight. What a gem to find a place that takes the time to do this. Will return often and with many guest.

Abacus is an unpretentious neighborhood joint that delivers beautifully in arms of a well-prepared meal. It's small and unremarkable in decor (the art on the walls was a somewhat geeky collection of Batman toys) but we came for dinner and that did not disappoint. Excellent, flavorful dishes, with lovely presentation and clean, expert preparation. I was able to eat my short ribswith chopsticks (!) the meat simply fell away from the bone. And the tuna with a subtle, complex ginger wasabe glaze was exquisite. We'll be back, you should try it too!
One of the best dinning spots in the Monterey area with great food and service

We love Panchos, the shrimp tacos are tasty and the Mole enchiladas are very good. Mole is a very difficult sauce and they do a nice job. Not too sweet and not too spicy. Crispy chips and awesome margaritas. Also great live band on Friday and Saturday nights. Top talent musicians that play with big bands like Stevie Nicks, Alice Cooper etc.

column4: 10543 W. Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90064
column13: Great beer and sausage selection!!

column4: 2201 Uptown Loop NE Suite 1A Albuquerque, NM  87110
column13: The space, the service, the food: AWESOME!

Very nice restaurant, though it was uncomfortably hot, with the exception of the entry hall which was very well air conditioned. The food was great, though the cook needs to be informed of the difference between medium rare and well done.
We had the most delicious and relaxing dinner! will certainly frequent Tilth! amazing!!
We eat here about once a month, so what more could I say.

column4: Bellagio Hotel & Casino 3600 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Overall, disappointing.

Incredible food, dishes perfectly prepared and presented under the direction of Chef Matt Colgan, interesting ingredient combinations, fantastic international wine list of little known wines from remote areas of Greece, southwestern France, Spain, Yugoslavia (Bosnia, etc), Hungary, Austria, etc... and a lovely bartender named Rich who recommended the Gruner Veltliner tasting, plus suggested an incredible red, an indigenous velvety full bodied Greek wine from the Peloponnesos area pf Greece...I bought the last two bottles...Go there! Plus, it's a great value..

column4: 11211 Point East Drive Rancho Cordova, CA  95742
column13: We sat outside which was a mistake. The adjacent freeway noise was overwhelming. The wait staff was uniformed and abrupt. The food was mediocre at best. I recently built a wood fired pizza oven in my backyard. I don't yet know what I am doing but my pizzas are much better than the one I had at the Fromaggio. They must be used to serving captives at the hotel. They certainly won't attract non-guests. The only good thing I have to say is that the wine list was affordable.

column4: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Great place to eat.La Canterra was such a great place to take my wife on her 30th b-day.We both loved the ambiance,food and service indeed...Will be back again

column4: 747 Market St, 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: I was very disappointed with my experience at Blu. Although they had a decent-sized wine list, we were told that the only wine that they had available was the house wine. Additionally, my food was over-cooked and my friend's order came out incorrectly and had to be re-done. There was no apology issued by the server, who appeared to be more interested in mingling with her co-workers than actually serving. This was an absolutely horrible experience and one that I would not recommend to anyone. Considering the location of this restaurant, the Four Seasons, I expected more.

Menu heavily slanted toward meat eaters. Limited choices of fish, fowl or vegetarian dishes. Salad was excellent. Main courses presented with flair but nothing out of the ordinary. Very very noisy due to high ceilings. If you like meat, this would be a good choice with many offerings.

I really liked everything there. The food is awesome, drinks are good and the band was hot. My only complaint is that we were asked to leave as they had another reservation for our table right as the band began to play. We were still ready to buy more drinks and listen to the band. We got there at 7:30 and the band didn't get on stage until 9 pm. With it being a Friday night there was no where to sit at the bar so we left. Which was unfortunate as we really wanted to stay hear the band and have a few more drinks. I will definitely recommend it and will be going back. I will just make sure to make a later reservation so that we can enjoy the band more.

column1: Addison at The Grand Del Mar
column4: 5200 Grand Del Mar Way San Diego, CA  92130
column13: This is truly a fine dining experience that we were fortunate to have had.

The service was terrible. Our server admitted it was her first day and it showed. Service was painfully slow though the restaurant was mostly empty. She asked for our drink orders before giving us a drink menu, didn't know anything about the menu (including how to even pronounce the names of the dishes), walked away before we could finish ordering our food, and didn't bring bread plates when she brought out the bread.
Very much enjoyed the prix fixe lunch for Dine LA. Loved the spinach and cheese empanada and Manager's salad!

column1: Adriatic Grill - Italian Cuisine & Wine Bar
column13: After previously having a bad experience at the Adriatric Grill, I decided to give it a try again with a friend for lunch. We ate at the bar and the bartender served us. She was not that friendly, slow with service even though the bar was dead during lunch, didn't offer bread like the surrounding tables had, didn't refill our water, was slow to offer another alcoholic beverage (we were only on our first drink), and we had to wait forever for our check even though we asked for it twice and the waitress only had 1 other table! This is the second time I had a bad experience; really wanted to like the place but I probably won't go back. Bad service is a NO NO, especially when the server isn't busy. Worked in the restaurant biz for yrs NO EXCUSE

Excellent, as always. Food, ambience, and service--all top-notch. The only small negative: a very loud person who stood, at the next table, and spoke long and loudly to people seated there. He was so loud, we couldn't continue our own conversation. Shame on him--no manners! But an intervention from the staff would have been much appreciated! Otherwise, an extremely pleasant experience in every resepct.

Our third visit to Afghan Grill. The appetizer Sampler was a very generous portion for 4 people, and serves as a wonderful introduction to the menu. Also highly recommend the Aush, a hearty, highly flavorful soup. Personal service that was right on the money.

We had a group of 17 (from White Rock, Canada) and went to the Newport seafood Grill to celebrate finishing the Seattle to Portland bike ride. The service and food were excellent - especially given that we had such a large group! Thanks for accommodating such a large group!

column4: 2015 Monterey Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: I have been there for lunch several times, and this time four of us tried breakfast. The menu has many choices, and they are not just your average bacon and eggs. I had the corned beef Eggs Benedict, and it was outstanding. The corned beef was homemade and delicious, the presentation was excellent. My friend raved about her omelette with smoked salmon, and her husband said the pancakes and apple sausage were very good. Most breakfast are accompanied with your choice of a homemade blueberry or apple streusel muffin, or an English muffin. We all had the homemade muffins, which came with a small cup of warm whole blackberry preserves! Our waiter was very accommodating and met our requests for minor changes graciously. I will go back.
I had the calamari that was stuffed with bread herbs anchovies etc ,,,,I tell you how good it was,,,I wouldn't share it,,,,yuuuummmmmeeeeee
Wonderful time with my mother and 5 year old daughter and for a great cause, "There with Care!"
Excellent service and food as always!

column4: 10820 W. Charleston Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89135
column13: We frequent Agave often. This trip, friends from Canada were visiting and they were my guests. We had an absolutely delightful lunch - trying several appetizers and sharing them. The guacamole with chiptloes is always my favorite, but for the first time, we tried the fajitas (shrimp and chicken). The best fajitas I ever tasted. Our waiter was Francisco and I hope next trip he will be there. I will ask for him.
I have always had delicious food at this place...and the atmosphere is so peaceful, I almost feel like I am in Italy!

column4: 1300 S. Main St Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Stanford's is a becutiful restaurant. The staff, from the moment you enter, is friendly and efficient. There was very little waiting time for anything we ordered to appear. The crowd seemed to be older, and the food was rather on the heavy side. For example, salads were overly dressed. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, which was good, but very oily and greasy. This place is so perfect-looking it's a shame to have the food not quite up to par with the atmosphere.
Had a really great dinner fob was superb! Best kept secret in Houston.

column1: Club M at The Grand Del Mar
column4: 5200 Grand Del Mar Way San Diego, CA  92130
column13: The entire evening experience was great, from the food and service, to the really entertaining dance band Pete Johnson. Really enjoyed the night and would certainly come back when they are playing again, just made for a perfectly fun time.
The Mezza Platter was wonderful but the Tajines were so bland and boring I cannot recommend them.

We had the best evening in July to enjoy the outdoor patio. It was beautiful. The only thing that was of a concern is that the sun was in everyone's eyes. I thought they should have foreseen this issue before the dinner instead of spending time during dinner trying to correct the problem. The food was excellent and the patio had a fabulous ambiance. We were a table of 10 and had a wonderful evening.

column4: 1017 Paseo Del Pueblo Norte Taos, NM  87529
column13: Food and service was excellent. It also has one of the best views in Taos. There is a good menu selection for carnivores but may need a few vegetarian entrees.

column4: 3950 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: This is a beautiful (contemporary) restaurant - it is the new version of the classic casino steak restaurant - high end food and price. The beef is always the best (and it should be), was disappointed with the leg of lamb, but the sides and salads are really good and interesting. The heirloom tomato salad very the best thing we eat, the onion rings/mac-cheese/pop-overs were delicious. The desserts were nice, but nothing special. The service is very good, very pleasant and very comfortable.I would recommend Stripsteak. I will return, but this time focus of the beef menu.
The Dunraven is the restaurant to go to in Estes Park. It is always very busy. We have been going there for many years, and this time the food was better than ever and our service was excellent.

The food is fantastic Lebanese with great variety and interesting choices, like the fried cauliflower. There is no alcohol. They served beer and wine years ago but they are down the block from a mosque so that may have had an influence. The Middle Eastern tea served in glass cups is delicious and they keep refilling it.

This is the third time we've been to Cafe Malaga, and it seems to get better each time. The outdoor dining is wonderful with live music on the weekends. The food is good. We had the paella this time, and gave it an 8 out of a possible 10. We'll go back when we want decent food and great atmosphere.

Excellent food. Everything we had was fantastic. We came with a group of 9 and they accommodated us well. Only thing was that it took a while for us to get our entrees, but they were very polite about it, and kept apologizing for the food taking so long (because they had only 1 cook that day), but once it came out, we were all pleased with the entrees. Very pleasant surprise! A hidden away gem in Pacific Grove.
Our waiter, Austin, was awesome. Very friendly and helpful and made our dining experience enjoyable. Food was also great!
Had a great overall experience! It was my first time eating there but I will certainly go back!
The Italian sausage with mustard/cognac sauce is terrific!! All the food is good and the waitstaff is knowlegable and friendy. Nice addition to the Park City dining scene.

Beautiful restaurant set in an old residence. Although on a busy street, it is well shielded by trees which keep the interior quiet and provide an nice view. We ate inside, but there is a nice, shaded patio dining area.

Bring a flashlight--so dark can barely see menu or food- should've been our 1st clue! My birthday on Tues evening told on reservation-we were only table! Ordered Osso Bucco--but they didnt' have any of it or Saltimbocca. Was told the lobster tail was only 2-3 oz so no point there. Got the ravioli---there was no oxtail ragu that I could see- very bland (no salt/pepper on table) with very little & filling. Sent it back & ordered Chicken Marengo w/Shrimp, Scallops & Crabmeat--was way too salty-my husband uses a LOT of salt & even said it was over salted (we guessed they were making up for bland dish before). I sent it back & ate nothing-I usually don't do that. He ordered the pork chops which was okay. Too expensive--especially for bland food.
Very expensive, even for Hawaii.

My friends and I had a truely enjoyable brunch at this new and upcoming restaurant. I loved that the food was tasty but really healthy at the same time. I left feeling full, but not weighed down. I would highly recommend this restaurant.
I didn't eat much, but the food I tasted was very good. The servers were attentive & friendly. The noise level was a bit high, but very energetic.

The food is too heavily oriented toward curry dishes and not enough variety in dishes without curry. Also, the noise level was so high that it was impossible to have a conversation without an enormous amount of effort. We did not stay for that reason.

We celebrated our anniversary at Saltbox and shared several small plates so we could taste it all. The service was fantastic and the food was amazing. You have to try the "Off the Beeten Path" drink. It's delicious and unlike anything we'd ever had! Cheers to Saltbox!

column1: Blue Stove at Nordstroms - Santa Monica
column13: Very impressed with the food for a restaurant inside a department store.
Great venue and service, but marginal food and several wines not available.

Once we were seated and handed menus our first thought was to leave. The menu was written very oddly as the food items seemed buried in the photos and descriptions of drinks. We stayed and enjoyed the food greatly. Ahi tuna was wonderful as were the salads that contained an eclectic set of ingredients. Dessert was a fun selection of old favorites with a twist.

column4: 10999 N. Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd Scottsdale, AZ  85259
column13: our favorite neighborhood Italian Restaurant

While the food was excellent the service was not. They automatically charge 17% on top of your bill for service which unfortunately seemed to translate into sub-par service. I'm not sure if it was just the evening I was there or if this is the case because of the 17% added to the bill. That said the food was excellent and everything we ordered was cooked perfectly and tasted great.

Perhaps this was a good seafood restaurant in years gone by but those days may have passed. The Alioto Green Salad comprised stale pine nuts, tough old fennel root, and zero vinaigrette. The Crab Bisque was unremarkable. The Linguini with eggplant and crab was actually spaghetti in tomato sauce with a rumor of eggplant and two bites of crab. ( Also Fishermans wharf on Sunday evening rarely sees a taxi, so be prepared to wait 30 minutes or drive yourself.)
Better than other places in town to take visiting family for seafood

column4: 4501 W Coast Hwy Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: Much better than the last time we visited.

column4: Gondola Station Saint Sophia c/o 565 Mountain Village BLVD Telluride, CO  81435
column13: We have been here for 3 weeks and was our favorite restaurant. The view, service, menu, always meets our expectations.

column4: Top of North Peak Mtn Keystone, CO  80435
column13: Had a very nice anniversary dinner.
Price was fair as was the food.

We've been coming in for a few years and have never been disappointed. The only reason we don't come more often is because we'd order everything. We always find something new to try and have loved each discovery.

column1: Twigs Bistro & Martini Bar - River Park Square
column13: Food and drinks were good, but I couldn't believe this place is in a downtown mall that charges for parking and they don't validate. For that reason, I wouldn't return to this location.

column4: 751 N Virgil Avenue Los Angeles, CA  90029
column13: The service was so good, the food was very good, the wine list was very good. The parking was very bad, the waitress told us next time park on the northside of the footbridge and walk over.

The food and view was fantastic, however, we were overcharged on our bill by $100! We almost left before noticing and had to go back. The waitress wasn't even sorry, and she didn't even try to act surprised. Its too bad, because we really enjoyed our meal, but that kind of ruined the experience for us.
Great food, but wine list needs improvement.

column1: Amaya at The Grand Del Mar
column4: 5300 Grand Del Mar Court San Diego, CA  92130
column13: I live in the neighborhood and decided to give Amaya a fourth try. Food is mediocre at best. I've tried the seabass (cold and fishy, meat was dark, bottom of the barrel quality), I've tried the halibut (lukewarm and very small not much flavor), I tried their shrimp scampi dish, cold shrimp on top of a hard vegetable with a sauce that looked and tasted liked it came out of a jar. The service is okay. Ruth's Chris in Carmel Valley is the best for food, ambiance and service!

column4: 2290 El Camino Real Suite 9 Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: This meal was not Amber's finest. Mixed vegetable dish was too salty; eggplant overcooked. My experience is that ordering from the menu gets better (but more expensive) results

column4: 25 Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: beautiful restaurant, went there for Sunday brunch... am not so familiar with Indian cuisine so it was a great introduction as I got to try a lot of different dishes, from dosas to masalas. They had a lot of vegetarian masalas and all had great flavors. Brunch came with mimosas, which made it an excellent value. I recommend it... come early though to beat the crowd....

This was my third time back. The food was outstanding as usual. We did the 7 course option this time. It was fantastic! We had venison, beef wellington (deconstructed), a perfectly cooked cod, and a lovely Baked Alaska. The sauces were perfect for each dish, and each piece of protein was cooked to perfection. The portions were just right and we left comfortably full but not stuffed. This meal compares favorably to the meals we had in Paris in May, and that's really saying something!

column4: 1454 Camino del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014-2510
column13: Chef Randy Gruber grows his own herbs, the menu is seasonal and the restaurant is unpretentious. Service is attentive but the wait staff don't hover. The portions are generous - two could split a salad although the salads are so good, you'll want your own. The noise level is low so you can actually have a good conversation inside. The patio is dog-friendly complete with dog bowls and biscuits. The side sidewalkpatio has ocean views. The halibut is always excellent and the pastas never disappoint.
Comfortable, great service, good food and nice view.

Food was outstanding as well as the wine list. Only concern was that our waiter was not knowledgable of the menu items or the wine list. We were basically on our own. He was very nervous when asked any questions.

column4: 21 Waterway Avenue Ste. 130 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: We put on the reservation notes that we were celebrating a birthday and they brought out a piece of cake complimentary without us having to tell them at the restaurant.

column4: 2538 San Vicente Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90402
column13: We went for dinner one night when the kids were busy on their own adventures. Had a nice dinner for two with delicious complex pumpkin torte appetizer, vegan potato leek soup, pork chop, halibut, chocolate torte and creme carmel deserts,, all excellent with friendly attentive service. Great for adults, noticed huge wine selection, not really a kid place, is on higher price end about 60$ / person full dinner w tax tip, not including alcohol.

column1: Grandviews at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco
column13: Great view, good food, waiter forgot about us

Our reservations for a party of 8 at 2pm on a weekend were met with a nice woman but an empty, unprepared restaurant. She fixed the table for us while we waited. Even though there were no other patrons, service was slow. The ambience was blah. The food was only so-so. My mom liked her falafel sandwich but my chicken breast was over seasoned with cardamon. I would not go again.

column1: Mission Grille - Marriott Downtown San Francisco
column13: When in San Francisco for conferences, this is the IDEAL place to plan for meetings. The servers know when to take orders, take care of refills and pick up plates while you're managing meetings w/your customers. I have spent 3-4 hours there when I had meeting after meeting. I will always go back! Management, hosting and service personnel got to know my name. It made it personal and so very pleasant.
Not very many choices for brunch.

column4: 820 N. MacArthur Blvd Oklahoma City, OK  73127
column13: This place is one of a kind. It is by far the best place I have eaten in OK. 5 course meal, private dining, mood lifting with music, and a special visit from owner.

column4: 2415 N. Main Ave San Antonio, TX  78212
column13: Way above expectations in every way.

column4: 5425 Landmark Place D109 Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: Good to mix it up and go w/ Greek food - they are pretty good at what they do at Yanni's. A little pricey if you get the specials but if you stick w/ the standard greek fare on the regular menu the pricing is reasonable. Decent place to enjoy after a movie at Landmark.

The maki and sushi are quite good, but we waited 45 minutes to get our food, while our teenaged kids had their food within 15 minutes. This would have made sense if they ordered off the "other side" of the menu (prepared food), but everyone ordered sushi or maki. Therefore, we couldn't eat together The pomegranate mohito was delicious. Our server was friendly, but flustered by the amount of time stuff was taking to come out of the kitchen. We were frustrated, too, especially given that we arrived at 6pm, when the restaurant opened.

The only difference between these franchises is the personality of the cook. If he has no personality, it's bland. In our case, we had a wonderful time on a Friday night. Our server, a caucasion raised in Japan was sensational. From the juggling act with the knives and utinsels, to the jokes he told (lame, but funny), the evening was very entertaining. I had the seafood combo of lobster, shrimp and scallops and all we cooked to perfection, including the extra garlic butter cooked in as I requested. My date had the Mango Shrimp, a newer item and it rocked!! Very pleased with the night, but strongly suggest reservations. This place fills up at 5pm with alot of Angel fans dining before the games.

column4: 321 W. Katella Avenue Suite 105 Anaheim, CA  92802
column13: So great to have Roy's so close to Disneyland--we love Roy's in Hawaii (and miss it since it left Denver), and this branch doesn't disappoint. Very busy when we went (Friday night) so glad we made reservations. Food was quite tasty, service was really great.

We dined here again last evening for my birthday and everything was just perfect! The dinner was excellent. We both had Shrimp Cocktails, their famos "Chopped Salad" and steaks. Of course, can't forget the delishous dessert! All was just wonderful. The service, by our server, Mike was impeckable, the Manager Bill Yates ALWAYS makes us feel special when we are there as he does other guests. He is so gracious to go to each table to check on his guests. WE LOVE to go here. Can't wait til the next time ! ! !

Great place but reservations don't matter. We showed up 2 minutes afterOur reservation time and had to fight with the hostess toObtain the specified booth in the reservation we made. All in all great place

column4: 41 East Gish Rd. San Jose, CA  95112
column13: I've taken work teams here a few times now and its always a big hit. The atmosphere and decor is so unique and fun. The food is very good and the service is great. Of course the belly dancers are a particular favorite!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: great neighborhood restaurant, wonderful food, friendly-efficient service. there was fresh, wild fish on the menu; perfectly prepared! I'll be back!
Expensive but worth every dime. It is our "special occasion" lunch spot and have never been dissapointed.

The food here is fabulous! The menu is small, but the ingredients are fresh and the flavors vibrant. We ate on the early side - before the theater, so it was quiet and enjoyable. Our server was knowledgeable and on top of things. We would definitely go back!

I love the atmosphere of the Old San Francisco...so friendly, warm, fun, and so unique. A beautiful bar and the girl swinging and hitting the bell are just a part of the fantastic ambience. But what was particularly amazing was the quality of ALL the dishes we tried, not just the steaks! Amazing food at such a reasonable price. Other steak houses charge much more for the steak and all the sides are extra. But OSF provides a salad and your choice of 2 side dishes with your steak...all for less than you would pay just for the steak at other fine steakhouses. We definitely will return to try other dishes. We highly recommend this place without reservation!

I find the idea of sitting and watching the chef prepare our food and talk to us about what he's doing. He changed the menu at the last minute because of what he found at the farmers market. He is very passionate about food and would recommend this to anyone who is a foodie or wants a personal brunch experience.
From beginning to end, the evening was a joy and the food and drink from Basin was great.
Food was great. Services was very slow. Appeared short staffed that night. Several surrounding tables that arrived after us dined and left well before us. No less than 6 different people served us.

Friends in town on June 15, 6 ppl total. Place was empty- open tables, empty chairs, host/hostesses hugging, holding hands, playing w/ their phones, and paying no attention to customers. They slaughtered eggs benedict, toast wasn't toasted, eggs were WAY overcooked, the home fries were overcooked and flavorless, think stale/chewy cardboard. Chicken fried steak was burnt/overcooked. We spoke to manager, he said they were busier than expected (though there was a farmer's market outside and the place was EMPTY). Got charged for a dish we turned back AND it arrived well after everyone else had finished their meal AND came out on tiny bread plates. We'll think 3x before returning.
lovely restaurant with an important chef - lovely

column4: 10455 E Pinnacle Peak Pkwy (Not Pinnacle Peak Road) Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: Beautiful location and enjoyable atmosphere. Service was wonderful.

We've never been disappointed in La Bruschetta. Even when it's crowded, our reservation is honored within a very few minutes. The food, the service and the fact that you can talk to your dinner guests without shouting makes this restaurant one of our very favorites!
Always yummy food. The Thai Salad with peanut sauce dressing is the best salad in Bend. The Orange Chicken is addicting. Most dishes, including the salad are big enough to share.

The food was excellent and very reasonably priced. the service was outstanding and very accommodating. The only drawbacks are (1) difficult parking and (2) the food doesn't come out together; e.g., if you have a party of 4 or even 2, one party's food will come out first and then another dish some 5 mins later, which doesn't work well. They need to work on the kitchen but other than that, I will definitely recommend this place and will keep going back.

column1: Bourbon Steak at The Fairmont Scottsdale Princess
column13: Although we enjoyed the experience, we found it stuffy and overpriced.

column4: 2931 East Coast Highway Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: Had not visited for a few years and was good as ever.

column4: 3255 W. Village Dr. Teton Village, WY  83025
column13: Lovely,romantic restaurant at base of ski lift. Fondue for two was fun. Though it's more of a grown up restaurant they had an excellent kid menue and made the kids feel very welcome.

We ordered the pan-fried halibut with corn and poblano cream, and tomatillo salsa. An amazing, delicious, satisfying dish. Service was attentive and friendly. The only (slightly) dissatisfying thing was the wine list. It was hard to find something appealing, especially by the glass. I would suggest more Washington syrahs, cabernet sauvignons and red blends. I would add a couple sauvignon blancs from New Zealand_since they do them better than almost anyone_and a seasonal rose wine from Provence. The current list seems like an afterthought, rather than much thought going into it. Otherwise, great experience.
Exceeded my expectations. Food was very good, especially the burger.

column4: 1716 W Horizon Ridge Pkwy Suite 100 Henderson, NV  89012
column13: There were some very odd tasting dishes for an Italian restaurant. Eggplant Parmigiana unusual taste & my sons dish was in a white sauce that was way too creamy.
Amazing sushi. Everything we ordered was amazing.
We celebrated our anniversary and had a wonderful meal. The food and service were both excellent. We would highly recommend this restaurant!
As always, the food was fresh and fantastic and the wait staff was incredible.
Bar food, drinks during happy hour a great deal!

column4: 3600 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: This was one of my top five (5) meals. I was with my two nephews who thought the food was great.

column4: 3244 Youngfield Suite G Wheat Ridge, CO  80033
column13: Local place with great food, service and decor

column4: 3668 Lake Tahoe Blvd Ste G South Lake Tahoe, CA  96150
column13: Fun place. More wine bar than restaurant but food good and eclectic. Great place to try many different wines.

column4: 555 South Main Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: Reservations are neccesary. I've been there 2x for high tea & both times were wonderful! Excellent tea & food. Don't eat before you go! Lovely atmosphere. There is a harpist! You don't feel rushed @all & feelfree to linger over your tea. Nice way to spend an afternoon.
Good service, but abysmal food and drinks.

Loved this hidden gem, in Pasadena. I'm a jazz fan an was pleasantly surprise at the house band and that they would accommodate a request. The food was ideal and the price right. I can't wait to go back, maybe for brunch and spend more time enjoying the ambiance. Great place to hide from the world and enjoy your time
Our server was fantastic and very attentive. Great happy hour!

Though food and service are outstanding what makes this dining scene fantastic is that they've paid attention to the noise or lack thereof and created a serene, comfortable space where friends can visit without shouting - a rarity in North County - or anywhere.Go - go - go - and express your appreciation for this gem!

Food was fair. Wait staff seemed capable, but kitchen was clearly struggling, and lacked management overall. 50% occupied on a Saturday night told the whole story. They need Gordon Ramsey before they loose the rest of their business.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: If you are looking for a fun place to have a very different dining experience than look no further than Straw! Our 15 yr old son saw the restaurant on a TV show and begged us to visit while in SF. We booked our reservation the night before on OpenTable and thank goodness as they turned away a number of people while we were there. The place seats less than 40 people and you don't want to leave so they don't turn very quick. The food is just like the website says, Carnival Fare! We had the RingMaster, the Waffle Monte Christo and the Bearded Lady. Have some appetizers and dessert to get the whole food experience. Everything is fresh and cooked to perfection.
Excellent food!! Our waiter was awesome

column4: 20751 N. Pima Road Suite 120 Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: Service was great. We shared a bunch of appetisers during happy hour and loved all of them!

column4: 2905 E. Skyline Drive Suite 168 Tucson, AZ  85718
column13: We tried several dishes the Halibut, Beef Medallions, Lamb, and Chicken. All dishes tasted very good.

I have been to Arnoldi's several times. This night I hope was an exception. The service was very slow and we waited over an hour just to get our food. It appeared they were short staffed but never given an apology and was charged a 20% gratuity since we had a party of 8. We sat outside and once it became cold they turned on heater but they were not working.

column4: 16091 North Arrowhead Fountains Center Peoria, AZ  85382
column13: The service was not that great. The waiting staff was rude and disrespectful. One couple from my table got their food about 10 minutes ahead of every one else. The lasagna was dry and hard. It was just an overall unpleasant experience
Food was nothing special and it was overpriced.

column1: Art Restaurant & Lounge at the Four Seasons Seattle
column13: The view over the sound was beautiful - if you had the right table. Ours was partially blocked by a big pillar. The service was very attentive and timely. The food however, was OK. Oyster sampler was good but their service of mignonette in a plastic flute was difficult. Their version of Caprese Salad with Maple Balsamic drizzle was interesting. I had Salmon over crab mashed potatoes - just OK, my wife had the Gnocchi with Fava Beans - very good. The menu overall was nothing special to warrant another visit soon.
Very nice, good food, good service, however, too noisy

column4: 800 Bagby Street, Suite 400 Hobby Center of the Performing Arts Houston, TX  77002
column13: We picked this restaurant for its convenience when attending a play at the Hobby Center. For just that alone it was perfect! But then came the fabulous food, fantastic service and fun atmosphere! It is a ten out of ten!

One of my favorite restaurants. Our guests and my husband and I have always had a good experience when we dine at Arturos. We just took my step-son and his wife for the second time and he sighed during his meal and said "I just really like this restaurant".

column4: 60 San Leandro Marina San Leandro, CA  94577
column13: Horatio's is our number one go to restaurant for all our special occassions and for when we just want to treat ourselves to a really great dinner. The staff, chefs and managers are always friendly. Service is excellent.

I am not a lover of nuevelle style, but it was a welcome option to the mostly fried fish restaurants on the island. The view from the room is spectacular . The piped in music was awful. The music was far less elegant than the food and the room. They need a soIATA piano and live music, which you can get in the lobby with the throngs.Overr all it was a, wonderful dining experience. It was my wife"s birthday. What did they give her? A candle and a small peace of chocolate next to the desert. Had she not ordered desert I am sure she would have received -0-. Of course they have no obligation to do anything, but once they did something they should have done it with more grace.There is no dress code: some wear jeans or shorts.

column1: Sycuan Grill - Sycuan Golf and Tennis Resort
column13: We've been here for the BBQ nights before and we loved it. The first time we sat outside and loved everything, this time I got a call about 3 hours before our reservation letting us know there was a private event outside and we'd have to sit inside. We figured it would be fine.

This restaurant is about the experience! While the food was quite good, what really made the evening memorable was the attentive service from the owners, the overall ambiance, and last, but not least, the interactive entertainment. I would highly recommend this restaurant.
Mother's Day - food was less than normal, not bad but not great either. Service was also sporadic - good for a while then non-existent then good again.

column1: The Restaurant at The St. Regis Aspen Resort
column13: Beautiful restaurant, great staff and great presentation. The food is outstanding.

column1: Chefs Club by Food & Wine - St. Regis Aspen
column13: The Chef__s Club raises the bar in Aspen to a level on par with NY and LA restaurants. Service is outstanding and the food is even better. We tried the three course dinner tasting menu and started with the warm green asparagus, and followed with the grilled prime bistecca fiorentina, which was perfectly prepared, and finished off with the caramelized brioche and chocolate malt semi freddo for dessert. We paired the meal with a fine (and reasonably priced) bottle of red wine that was recommended by the very knowledgeable sommelier.To get the full experience, make sure you request a seat at the Chef__s tasting table, which gives you a view in to the kitchen and you can watch and talk with the chef__s as the food is prepared.

column4: Hilton Americas Houston 1600 Lamar St. Houston, TX  77010
column13: It was my birthday and I received a call from Spencer's to ask I'd I would like a private dining area which was very thoughtful. The service was fantastic, we had an appetizer, dinner and drinks served in less than an hour. The food was divine. We had the crab cakes, filet mignon, and the New York strip steak and the food was cooked to perfection. The atmosphere was quiet and romantic. We live in Houston, but plan to spend the night at the hotel and enjoy another lovely dinner real soon.

column4: 300 Pacific Coast Highway Suite 112 Huntington Beach, CA  92648
column13: Did not eat there. Walked into a bar area with booths ringing the room. No one is there to greet you and there was a note saying to seat yourself. Problem, there were no seats available. Worst thing was the ear-splitting noise that hit you the minute you opened the door. It was deafening "music" at a volume I haven't heard at major concerts. The four of us would not have had dinner there if we did find a seat because of the noise. We left and went somewhere else for dinner. Couldn't tell anyone we were leaving or to cancel our "reservation" because the only employee visible was the bartender and we couldn't make eye contact with him.

The special once a year lobster fest dinner was terriffic. We shared our meal family style and everyone loved each of the choices. We brought our own wine, which you can do at a few Austin restaurants, and were very appreciative of the service that they provide to accomodate our own wine. We enjoy this restaurant all the time and highly recommend it.
We had a wonderful time at Asti and would definitely come back any day. The ambiance is nice, the food was great and the staff is very professional!
Excellent food - all fresh, local produce and I swear our trout was swimming in Gore creek that morning. Extensive, reasonably priced wine list. Highly recommended.
The food is simple, classic French cuisine. The quality is very good, and the service personable. A good place in Scottsdale to go for something different. The pastries are delicious!

column1: Aurea - The Stanford Court, a Renaissance Hotel
column13: The food was good, the service was great, but not a great place for dates.

Looked like they were a bit understaffed, with only two wait-staff, and the gentleman who welcomed us appeared to be the manager rather than the normal maitre d'. As a result sevice was slightly slower than expected, but when they were with us, was very good.
Excellent food in a casual family friendly environment

As a former food service worker,I have been privledged to work and eat at various locales and have finally found an establishment that provides everything I have always wanted.Good food,service,atmosphere,and price ,all has been met with some above and beyond techniques.I would highley reccommend this establishment to any and all patrons for the sole vpurpose of going out and enjoying your meal on your timetable.

We left the experience with a "meh" feeling. The service was slow. It was apparent that they were under staffed on the evening of July 4th. They were trying...the busboy was friendly and accommodating as he could be. The ceviche was fishy and room temperature. Salsa wasn't refilled. This was necessary as we ran out of salsa during the long ansences in service. The frozen margaritas had probably been sitting in the window for a while as they arrived partially melted. The salted rim wasn't really.

Had access to a private room for our party of 14. Food was great, atmosphere was fantastic. Service needed quite a bit of work. Our server couldn't handle 14. Could have used a second set of hands. Even if it was just for water refills. Had a hard time getting second round of drinks. Had to go look for our server on a few occasions.

It was our anniversary and i ordered flowers for our table but they never arrived so the reservationist offered to go get us flowers. The waitress was fantastic and friendly and really made our special nite special. We ordered off there summer menu and really enjoyed our lite summer meal. The dessert was out of this world. Flemings is the perfect place for a romantic evening.
Good quality steaks, excellent service. Nice that they don't nickel and dime you for every side order. We had the NY Strip streaks and they were excellent.

column4: 11410 Century Oaks Terrace The Domain Austin, TX  78758
column13: Love the generous portion sizes and the unique offerings.

Steak was not very good. The butter seasoning they use it too rich. This gave us stomach problems later in the night and the day after. We were expecting much more fine cuisine than just steak and sides. The price was too much for the lack of creativity in the food preparation and design. The place is known for pork chops, but we discovered that later and probably should have ordered that. But, shouldn't a steakhouse be known for steak?

This wasn't our first visit to Roaring Fork. As always, the waitstaff was excellent, helpful and friendly. The food was perfect and exactly as we ordered - as well as absolutely delicious. (Especially the grits served with the bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin!) Our recent visit just ensured we'd be back again soon.

column4: 11506 Century Oaks Terrace Suite 100 Austin, TX  78758
column13: We love this restaurant! It has never failed to come through with awesome offerings. Our waitperson was great (Marquae) and the manager stopped by our table to see if we were enjoying our meal. His name is Emmanuel. These are all great people who make you feel welcome. Again, we really like this gem of a restaurant at the Domain.

The hostess sat us next to a loud table, when there was plenty of room in the restaurant. One waiter (I didn't get her name) saw we were uncomfortable and moved us. We mentioned several times it was my birthday - and nothing special was done. I asked the waiter not to put our order in too soon after appetizers, but he did anyway. My scallops were good, but the asparagus was so salty I had to send it back. My husband's pork chop was not done all the way through, so it had to go back to be re-fired. We had been here 3 years ago for our anniversary and it was very nice. Not sure we'll go back.
Excellent location, ambience, good food, good wine. Third time here visiting from CA in three years. Quality remains

This was a great place for an anniversary dinner. We tried everything from drinks to desserts and were well pleased. The staff was friendly and always working. I'd definitely recommend this place for a date night. Try the peanut butter and chocolate pie!
We enjoyed our lunch. Many great menu items to choose. Would be kid friendly if the kid food (mac n cheese) wasn't spicy. Manager and wait staff very friendly and helpful.

column1: Inn at the Park / Top of the Park Restaurant
column13: Our waiter Frank was awesome!!! Food was terrific!! Gotta go back!!!

column1: Cabana Cafe at The Beverly Hills Hotel
column4: Cabana Cafe at the Beverly Hills Hotel 9641 Sunset Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Nice but a little warm. The service is great. The food is good especially the hummus and naan and the burger. Menu at the Polo Lounge is better for lunch and the atmosphere is a little more lively,
A favorite spot for us, we decided on SIP for our anniversary dinner. It always feels like a special occasion even though we often just meet friends for a glass of wine and conversation.
Food and service were excellent. I only gave a "very good" for "Ambiance" because the ceiling was lined with plastic (b/c of a leak, we were told).

column4: 301 E. Las Colinas Blvd Suite 301 Irving, TX  75039
column13: This was our 2nd visit to Jinbeh and we recommend this restaurant as a great place for sushi and teppanyaki. The chef this visit didn't season the food enough but it was still a great experience...we love that the chefs just cook and don't need to add all the banging of knives or throwing of rice.

column4: 3211 Providence Drive Cuddy Hall Anchorage, AK  99508
column13: Great value, relaxing atmosphere.

I was disappointed in the service this time. It took so much time to even get a glass of water. I'm not sure why, but it seemed we were just a bother to them. I wondered if they were just angry that we used OpenTable to make the reservation.

Our party of four had a very pleasant experience, good food and good service made for an enjoyable meal. The menu has many vegetarian dishes, which was good for our group, and the chef was able to adapt a dish to our requirement. Very pleasant and friendly service from our waiter and drinks server, and a friendly welcome form the owner, made us feel very welcome. Service was efficient and allowed just the right amount of time between starters and entrees. I would recommend this restaurant and would eat there again.

column1: The Steakhouse at Azul La Jolla
column13: THe food was good and n icely presented.
Disappointed with the fried tofu (appetizer) but everything else was excellent (as always). Service has been consistently good lately.

I can't say enough good things about this visit. My boyfriend and I have always enjoyed dining here, but this dinner was the best. Due to traffic, we arrived late, and now we were going to be rushed to dine before our play started. The hostess was kind enough to seat us promptly near the door, and our waiter David made suggestions to help us pick a quick meal. David also got drinks and the bill to us quickly to help expedite the process. He was wonderful about making sure we had a great time at dinner, but still left us time to walk to the Alley. I look forward to returning soon, but this time for a more relaxed dining experience. Thanks for saving the evening!

column4: 1330 Wirt Rd Suite D Houston, TX  77055
column13: Had the veal parm and it was the best I've had in a very long time. Very tender veal with an excellent crusting. My buddy had a roasted chicken dish and his only comment was he'll be back again for the same. Our server was very attentive and helpful. Barbara, the owner, stopped by to thank us for coming; I thought that was very classy. This is a great place to have lunch and we'll be back.

column4: 44 E Blithedale Avenue Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: Always enjoy this great spot...friends, too, enjoy menu!

column1: Black Angus Steakhouse - San Diego Kearny
column4: 5247 Kearny Villa Road San Diego, CA  92123
column13: Consistently excellent food. Our server was a little unfocused, but everyone has those kinds of days. Our filets were cooked to perfection. One member of our party had had recent open heart surgery and needed to eliminate salt. This was communicated to the server who did a good job communicating it to the chef. The manager did not make the rounds on this particular evening; something he normally does.

We were looking for something fast and not terrible. We got what we expected from this chain ... decent burgers with efficient service. Nothing spectacular but certainly a notch above the average burger joint.

Had a wonderful meal and so did my guests. We left nothing on our plates. The mud pie was outstanding. I have a sweettooth and so do my guests. Can't wait till I can have another day to go to THE BLACK ANGUS.
We enjoy going every time. The last occassion was my wife's birthday with the family.
One of the better experiences I have had eating out.

We were promptly seated by the hostess and quickly greeted by our server. Drinks were generous and delicious. Food was well prepared and served in a friendly, timely manner. The server was attentive throughout and accurate in every aspect of of his service.

column4: 3195 N. Main Street Pleasant Hill, CA  94523
column13: Best service and food quality combination I've had in awhile. It was a great meal!

MY 16yr old son had just arrived home from Japan on a summer school trip and all he wanted to eat was steak and potato, Cattle Co hit it right on the money the steak was cooked to perfection and extremely delicious. We have been before for birthdays and such. But this was a fabulous treat for my son to have an ALL AMERICAN MEAL here.

We really enjoyed the abundant amount of yummy food! HOWever the server was a little off we had to ask for her a few times. it's like she brought out bill before our dinner finish and we putting in our desert requests. wierd huh??
Food was prepared as ordered and served promptly. Tasted good. Coffee was excellent.

The food and service were wonderful. We had a party of 10 for my mothers 70th birthday. Unfortunatly there was no special acknowledgment for my mom's birthday, our party sang happy birthday to her. The biggest problem was the restraunt was way to cold. It was 80 degrees outside and about 68 degrees inside, our whole party was bundled up. We asked if the AC could be turned down, the waitress said she would talk to the manager, not sure if she did or the manager did not want to reduce the AC. Every table sits under an air vent so there is no getting away from the breeze.
Very small portions of food.
We go there often. Food and service is consistantly good.
Excellent food. Friendly service. Passionate manage team. Highly rated overall.
Always enjoy this place. WE were celebrating a birthday and our waiter, Aljandra, was outstanding. Food, as always, was fabulous!
Dale our waiter is outstanding and the reason we come back every month.
Black Angus is consistently good -- it's where we go when we crave a steak. Sides are great too. Always very good service.

column4: 740 E. El Camino Real Sunnyvale, CA  94087
column13: The food is "good" but nothing to write home about... we had a fantastic waitress which made our experience very pleasant & even better! It's not the world's best steakhouse but it is consistent & yummy. The bread they bring to your table is one of the best things!!

column1: Black Angus Steakhouse - San Diego Friars Rd.
column13: Two steaks were not cooked properly and the waiter disappeared for too long of a time. We had empty glasses for a long time. The waiter was polite and nice, but lacking in quality service.
Black Angus is what to be expected of a Black Angus: decent food, neighborhood (chain) restaurant. It is nothing special but if you want decent food at a good price, then this is the place.

column4: 290 E. Hospitality Lane San Bernardino, CA  92408
column13: The restaurant was not full, but the host tried to talk us intovisiting the bar before dinner. Poor start for dining.

The steak is not as good like before. Kind of on the chewy/tough side. Service was very good and efficient. They were kind enough to exchange my friend's steak to prime rib, since her steak was too tough. My recommendations is, buy better quality meats.
While Balck Angus continues to call their large shrimp "pawms" the steaks and prime rib are always good. Black Angus Marketing: Real pawns are huge. This borders false advertisement.
I had a lot of fun. The steak was so good!

Everything was rushed from the get go. Food was dropped off, waiter came to check on us at the end of the meal, never got refills on iced tea and never got lemon to go with my ice tea after asking twice for it. Server was nice and friendly especially to my 3 small children, but obviously he was busy on a Friday night around 8:15, though place was not crowded by any means. Just appeared he had way too many tables that he could handle. Even got our check wrong. Better steakhouses out there. This was suppose to be under new management/owner, but seems it really hasn't changed from previously. We will never go back. Felt like we should have just gone to Denny's.
The employees always make it a priority to make sure the people dining have the most enjoyable dinner possible. Price is good.

the time of my reservation has not been respected this time. I made my reservation at 6.30pm, we arrive at 6.30pm (coz we are just beside the restaurant at the red roof inn), and the person at the desk makes us wait during 15-20min to wait an available table.
Customer service was awesome, food was great, atmosphere was wonderfully.All in all great experience.
Server, Arlene, was EXCELLENT!!! Our special, ribs, shrimp, & steak was great. Had enough for dinner next night. Great value.

column4: 1011 Blossom Hill Rd. San Jose, CA  95123
column13: Once again wonderful meal. Our server was awesome!
Always a pleasure dining at Black Angus-Bakersfield, CA.
Kinda disappointed...the Riverside location was better than this one but our waiter Craig was awesome
Staff is upbeat and friendly. Service was prompt. Steaks are tasty. Love the green beans with bacon! Good value.

My wife and I always dine at Black Angus each time we crave for a real gooooood steak dinner. It is always cooked to a perfection, scrumptous, juicy and melts in your mouth.Their NY steak coupled with the house merlot is a perfect combination and the price is right. Of course, the service is excellent too!

I LOVE being able to make a reservation. When we arrived our table was ready and it was close to the door as we had requested, since one of our party is disabled and can't walk very far. The server was really good and served us quickly and efficiently. The food was terrific!
We were visiting and had a great experience.

Top-notch food and service, as always; and the 30%-off coupon I was emailed by Black Angus was honored even though no worker at the location had seen that coupon before. And they let us have the larger filet mignon for the $3 higher price shown on the menu, even though we were getting the Campfire Dinner. The server hads to check with the manager on both and came back with positives on both.
Wait person was excellent. Filet Mignon was overdone. Not the waitpersons fault at all.
Our server was very attentive & very polite, great service. Guess it was the manager that was going around checking on everyone which was very nice of her.

The food was excellent, the waiter was not real welcoming and friendly, she asked us if we needed anything and when my husband asked for steak sauce she never returned it. it doesn't matter we like the restaurant and we will return. thank you this is the second time we have had this same waitress and she was not friendly last time either. thank you
Excellent steaks, variety of menu items. Discount coupons always available. New feature of accepting reservations is appreciated.

column4: 14724 E Indiana Ave Spokane Valley, WA  99216
column13: Server was rude, didn't accept coupon I had from signing up for Black Angus Prime club for my birthday for a free dessert just because our meal already came with one.

We took my 9 year old for his birthday to Black Angus, Goodyear, As always, our server Roy was excellent. Everyone from the hostess, to the manager and bus boy were all friendly. Enjoyed it very much. I'm sure we will be back for the next birthday celebration!

I have been going to Black Angus Steak Restaurants for around 35 years. They have the best Ambiance of any place I can think of. Outback is good, but what a noisy place to go to! The booths are always nice and quiet.This particular Restaurant is as good as it gets. The waitress was Super!The Steak and Specials are always wonderful. The $15.99 Special that I had with the Steak, Shrimp, Ribs, and Two Sides are just fantastic. I know that Claim Jumpers is trying to match your deal at $14.99, and they are a good restaurant too.I don't knock any of you guys! We all have to be competitve and try in this economy.Thank you!
once again we were not disappointed

all the dishes were heavily flavored with salt/MSG. I was incredibly thirsty after the meal as were all my companion. The shrimp in the blanket had an ammonia taste to it, so not the freshest ingredient.

column4: 2308 S Union Avenue Los Angeles, CA  90007
column13: The noise level isn't just energetic, it's loud and difficult to hear others. There are some items they make really well (break pudding, scallop, hamburger), and then there are some which fall flat. If the service were more consistently good, I'd patron this restaurant more often.

column4: Doubletree Sonoma 1 Doubletree Drive Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: My husband and myself loved everything about our dining experience. We dinned for lunch wich worked out perfect because most of the tourist dine for breakfast and dinner. We were seated in a cozy room with the fireplace going just the two of us! Lunch was excellent starting off with the potato bisque soup,then we had the rueben panini.Great service,food and atmosphere.

We went looking for a steakhouse, after so much seafood in California. The steaks were ok, but not great. The fish was also good. the service was a little slow and lacking. We were a group of 8, and to order dessert the waitress gave us 2 dessert menus!!!Also, some of us in the group wanted a expresso coffee after dinner, and they don't have.

column4: 7166 Carmel Valley Rd. Carmel Valley, CA  93923
column13: I'm a car guy. Love Thursday nights.....great car stuff collection. Great place to bring friends from out of town.

column4: 9777 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89183
column13: As always, generous portions of quality food at generous prices.
MMM-mmm wonderful... Life is good!!

This was my second visit to Sacramento Ca Benihana. I've been to many other Benihana including their branch in Ginza Tokyo many times. I ordered same order as I did this time, Hibachi Chateaubriand. Meat they served me was far from Chateaubriand this time. Restaurant know meat was not Chateaubriand and Chef should also know. I realized one of Chateaubriand we order, which came to me wasn't proper Chateaubriand cut and has too much fat portion in it. I tried to eat but it wasn't what I expected and told Chef to call manager and told him that this is not Chateaubriand. It was a big disappointment for me that Benihana serves this kind of food to customers and it was the worst experience.

column4: 5946 South Holly Street Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: Excellent food and great service
This was an amazing experience. Just a little too noisy. Crab cakes, wedge salad and steaks are incredible!! Not to mention the view! Phenomenal!
A wonderful meal, but a bit pricey.

Small place on Ventura. Almost walked out as no one was there when walked in - had to turn my wife around. Boy did she change her mind! The manager was great - food awesome. Manager spent time with us talking about many Persian traditions. we all did kabobs, which were excellent. And their specialty rices - out of this world. Will be back again when we visit the area.
Excellent dinner and Ritz service
We stayed quite a while catching up with friends we hadn't seen in a while...the waiter did not rush us. The prime rib was perfect and so was the catch of the day. I would definitely go back.

column4: 34471 The Street of Golden Lantern Dana Point, CA  92629
column13: Incredible food with attentive service. Very quiet night (Sunday) with only a few tables occupied made it a very enjoyable experience. We'll be back.

column4: 2171 Avenida De La Playa La Jolla, CA  92037
column13: Early service was disappointing, perhaps due to the dinner rush (6:30 Saturday reservation) but improved during our visit. Food was incredible.

column4: 3900 D Bel Aire Plaza Napa, CA  94558
column13: big disappointment in foodfirst full rack of ribs were bone dry

column4: 10690 Southern Highlands Pkwy Las Vegas, NV  89141
column13: A great place to experience a variety of dishes, reasonably priced. Good wines.
Ristorante Allegria provided another excellent experience. Great food. Great service.

This was one of the best dining experience we had. John was the best waiter. The food was excellent. We can't think of anything for them to improve. They got the quality and customer service right on.

column4: 4499 Admiralty Way Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: This was a Sunday buffet brunch that even my father, who doesn't particularly enjoy buffets, raved about. Was definitely worth the drive over the hill from the Valley, and we will come again.

Food is great, ambienece is great for those not stuck on table 60, as we were. This is the table you assign to walk-ins, not those with a reservation. Service is lacking for those fortunate enough to be sat at this table. The server was non existent, imagine watching all the tables around you getting great service while you are being ignored. This is what happens when you place a table in the middle of a walkway all by itself. Then to top that off, assign this table to a server in a completely different part of the restaurant. Yes service was awful, but I blame the restaurant's management for not paying attention to guests needs.

This is formerly Houston's and they maintain the same menu and level of service. The Baked Potato Soup is delicious. The grilled chicken salad is huge and a long-time favorite from the Houston's days.

We love Bastien's. I knew this place as a teenager over fifty years ago, so it is very special. Had a problem this time, spoke to Jeannine Bastian about it later, and she handled it professionally and beautifully. Give it a try, you will like it.

column4: 2131 Shelter Island Dr. San Diego, CA  92106
column13: Nice view and good atmosphere. Food was decent, although it wasn't the best food.

column4: Highland Village- 4007 Westheimer Rd Houston, TX  77027
column13: We took our 3 kids and celebrated Father's Day here. It was a very nice experience -- great view of the Apple Store and the busy retail area below. The service was outstanding and very accommodating to our children's desires. I would definately eat there again and can see how this would be come an annual tradition for Father's Day.

column4: 8841 N. Alpine Loop Rd. Sundance, UT  84604
column13: Food was good, the service good, but slow. It took a while for the server to recognized we were in the building. The seating is somewhat crowded making conversation less than private. It was much like joining stranger for dinner.

column1: Venga Venga Cantina and Tequila Bar
column13: Made a reservation for 8:30, showed up at 8:15, didn't get seated until 9:05, even though there were plenty of tables available that just needed to be bussed. Got our drink order wrong and it took 4 different attempts to get it fixed. Finally, the tortilla soup was actually a cream based soup instead of what you would normally expect.

There is a new chef here and that is a good thing because when we were here a year ago the food quality had declined from previous years. The new chef has simply set a new high standard. Appetizers to dessert were special. Foodies will appreciate the flavors and care this chef puts into his work. Awesome. Well worth a visit.

I've read good and poor reviews of Beano's. I think the experience has a lot to do with expectations. It's no more expensive than any fine dining restaurant if you have 5 courses. The selections were varied and interesting. The wine list was good, but did have more of a mark-up than most. The food and service were very good. Mostly, one should go for the event! It's a beautiful setting, deer and hummingbirds right outside the open window. Shuttle up in a clean van (even then, it's a bumpy ride), take the tractor if you don't mind dust and fumes, or ride horses up if that's your thing. Wearing jeans and boots is totally acceptable. Spend some time at the bar or outside on the deck.

column1: JW Marriott San Antonio - Cibolo Moon
column13: The wine list is very limited.... very few choices if you are into wine. The menu is also limited. Very pleasant atmosphere and decor... nice view of the JW Marriott grounds.

column1: H3 Ranch at the Stockyards Hotel
column4: 109 East Exchange Ave. Fort Worth, TX  76164
column13: The food was excellent! The noise was a little too loud, but I will be coming back!
unbelievably expensive! more expensive than a high end new york steakhouse. completely unjustified.

The food was a 50% hit and miss. Some gems and some flops. There was a tendency to over salt a number of dishes including the brined roast chicken entree. The goat cheese dessert was pretty great. I can't recommend the wine pairings...they were pretty uninspired. I won't go again; for the price there is better elsewhere. The chef has talent which was evident in many of the flavor combinations although our party sensed that perhaps it has gotten a little routine and it misses the passion and excitement of serving great food.

column4: 5662 La Jolla Blvd. La Jolla, CA  92037
column13: Service was great. Very attentive. the food its always awesome and different. Love the daily specials.

We arrived for our reservation at few minutes before 6:00 p.m. Our reservation was at six. We were seated right away and service began immediately. We had our choice of seats and were seated in a room by ourselves. We asked for that area. The service was very good and so was the food. All of us were impressed by both. The portions were good. Some of use asked for bags to take what we could not eat home. The ambiance was good. The prices were good.The only criticism I have is the location. I would recommend this restaurant.
Good neighborhood find. Good service and terrific waitress.

It's an energetic place, very social place, Love the atmosphere. If you don't prefer to share your meal with strangers then this isn't the place for you, since you are forced to socialize with your fellow table mates whom some you won't even know. The pricing is a bit High which is basically on special occasions , we won't be able to afford to come here on a monthly basis. The food was divine!

This is the first unfavorable review I have written on Open Table. My meal had several problems. I told the polite waiter I cannot eat tomatoes or peppers. He warned me not to order the paella and said the salmon was safe. It arrived coated in tomatoes, but he told me the tomatoes were just added, not cooked in. I scraped them off to find the salmon was very undercooked, not seared. It was uncooked. When I again got his attention I sent it back to be cooked. Two strikes so far. When it returned to me it was considerably smaller than before, but not cooked much more. He should have replaced it. By now we are in compensation territory. None was offered. I won't return and will warn others.

column4: 10916 West Pico Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90064-2112
column13: W have been to Jaipur many times. It is closwe to the Landmark Theater so we go there before a Movie.If one goes early the service is great. If you go when the crowd hits you have to wait for your diner

I would highly recommend Bella Saratoga -It's fabulous. The three of us went there for a pre-concert dinner and had the halibut. Everyone raves about the bread and it lived up to its reputation. Clam chowder was so good it could have stood alone as an entree. Watch out that you don't order too much-.The one let down was the calamari appetizer. The pieces were varying in size, taste and quality with some being too chewy and others like shoe leather and tough. No overall consistency. Almost seemed like they were prepared at different times and heaped into one pile.We didn't get to sample the desserts as we were so full from dinner. We did observe a couple across the way who had order the Tiramisu. They were smiling.
We have celebrated our anniversary. Everything was great. Nice interior, great food, excellent service.

column4: 27911 Seco Canyon Rd. Santa Clarita, CA  91350
column13: Very quiet Saturday noon. Courteous service. Chicken Marsala and Salmon risotto were both excellent. Best minestrone I've had in a while.

Our experience at Bella was magnificant. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and appeared to be a seasoned waiter. His service was perfect, just attentive enough. The prices were good as well. My hubby and I went for a "get away" week end and we will return. Thank you Bella

The staff was attentive and downright charming, and the food was outstanding as always. We told them what time we needed to be done by in order to catch our movie, and they took care of us with plenty of time to spare, without anything feeling rushed. And it's hard to beat going home with a "tomorrow pasta" as well!

column1: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Bellevue
column13: Our group found the space really loud, and the service very inconsistent.
Disappointed for once... maybe because of father's day rush? Way too much butter!!
