To make a very long review short, the 4 apps we FINALLY got were the catfish beignet, the street tacos, the pan dumplings, and the tableside guac. All were excellent, as was the bartender Kavin. 5 star all the way. My "main" problem is that we waited for 20 minutes after being seated for someone to come around to offer drinks or give us water, nothing. husband went to the bar for us. finished drinks and decided to go try to get food in the bar. Kaven took care of us personally. we had been in the bar earlier so he was almost as livid as us that we never got even one bit of serice. Plus it was by birthday and our fist visit, plus we just moved to town, so it was all very disappointing, except the food and Kavin. Probably won't be back

column4: 6305 Waterford Blvd Suite 100 Oklahoma City, OK  73118
column13: The new and improved Bellini's! The new menu is outstanding! The new, smaller (but quite plentiful) food portions are much better - you leave feeling very pleasantly satisfied instead of over-stuffed and miserable. Bravo! to the new management and much better cuisine!!
Good food however, a little on the pricey side. Beautiful view from the second floor.

column1: Duck Club at Lafayette Park Hotel
column13: Our food is usually quite good at the Duck Club, the venue is always pleasant, and the prices are reasonable. That only leaves the element of service and hospitality and on this visit they were both lacking. There were two servers working and one, although she served the booth next to us and has served us before, chose to walk past us each time without a greeting of any kind. Our server, new to us, seemed to be totally disinterested in our presence. When bill paying time came she almost dropped the bill on the table and ran. As we had not criticized anything during our visit this behavior was inexplicable.

column1: Aroma Bakery and Cafe La Jolla
column4: 909 Prospect St. Suite 100 La Jolla, CA  92037
column13: It was a very busy day, there was a special event going on.

column4: 375 SW Powerhouse Drive STE 130 Bend, OR  97702
column13: The staff at Flatbread couldn't have been more accommodating. We were seated in a back room to avoid most of the noise in the main dining area and the reasonably loud music that plays constantly in the background. The food was very good -- we had a great pizza that is one of the 5 Naples-certified. The crust was chewy and the toppings fresh. I would definitely return if I'm in the area.
Our chef was a lot of fun and very engaging

column4: 5840 Legacy Circle Suite D130 Plano, TX  75024
column13: We had a great experience. Went there for my husband's 35th birthday and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Our waitress kept our drinks filled and was very attentive. I've been to several hibachi places over the years, and I can say this was one of the best experiences. No complaints! :)
We were there for our twelfth anniversary. My food was way over salted. The wine was way over priced. For the price we paid we expected more from a recommended fine dining experience.

We've been twice now. The first time for a romantic sit down date night and the second for happy hour for my birthday. Both were completely different but wonderful! Le Rendez-vous is right down the street but we had no idea it had such amazing food and a great happy hour.

column4: 12457 Rancho Bernardo Road San Diego, CA  92128
column13: Our first impression upon being seated was that the restaurant was extremely noisy - too noisy for quiet conversation. Two of us ordered the halibut that came with some pea puree and vanilla sauce under the fish. The vanilla just threw the entire meal off - was NOT a pleasing or complimentary flavor to this plate - and pretty well ruined the wonderful taste of the halibut. The fish was cooked perfectly so did not need any distraction from it. Not sure who would think that vanilla was complimentary to fish. The other 2 diners had the scallops and beef bourginon - both enjoyed their meal but said the meat portions were extremely skimpy for the price paid.

I did not feel like the table server really knew the menu.She did not know the ingredients on the luncheon menu.She did not interact well with the ladies at the table.I said this was a special occassion and it was not even mentioned.I wrotethis on the reservation but like I said it was not mentioned. Any one mentioning thebirthday would have been nice. I am not sure we had the best view in the restaurant andthere were not only 2 other tables being used in the restaurant. I would ratherhave faced the gulf thana parking lot.

column4: 3720 S. Las Vegas Blvd. #260 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Our dinner experience was really great. We saw they ad oysters on the menu but didn't have Oysters Rockefeller, we asked the waiter and he asked the chef and the chef agreed to make them. Well I have to tell yoiu they were probably the best we have ever had. A definate reccommend on any trip to Vegas.

Food and service were great. The waiter really took the time to make us feel welcome. Eva was there for some type of fundraiser so it was cool to see the owner actually there. Too many times stars just buy in or lend their name to a restaurant and never take an interest. The bread they bring you was sooo good. Portions are small but just right. Wasn't too expensive. It feels like you are inside of a fancy old aircraft hanger. I can't wait to go back.

The food was good. The wine list seemed to be adequate but there was almost no description of the wine type or attributes or even color. Our young waitress was even more clueless about the wine, to the point of asking us which wine we wanted when we ask which was a less-dry variety. We had to suggest that she go to the bartender and ask.

Vincent,s is a fabulous restaurant. The food is some of the best I have experienced. We felt like we were in Vincent's home for a special dinner party. He visits each table to chat, and makes you feel special. The beef wellington was perfectly prepared. His sauces compliment the entre' without over powering the flavor of the meat. 5 star in every respect!

column4: 143 S. Cedros Ave. Suite T Solana Beach, CA  92075
column13: The service was super!!!! It is very low key. Really a neighborhood restaurant. I was not expecting it. But the food was good.

column1: Lodo's Bar and Grill - Highlands Ranch
column4: 8545 S. Quebec St. Highlands Ranch, CO  80126
column13: We did get an outside table with great outdoor views. The service was a bit slow. A couple of the orders were delivered incorrectly. My wife had to wait 20 minus for two slices of bread that were supposed be part of the meal. Overall, we were meeting friends and had a nice time.. The splashing was a nice touch.
Great high end seafood in SF. Come for the ambiance, the service, but especially the food. There is even great "turf" to go with the surf. Enjoy!

I have NEVER had a bad meal at Il Fornaio. The foos is consistantly amazing and our waiter RUDY, is like no other, he is smart, kind and makes us feel like the most important people in the world. I have breakfast their every Friday morning and have for 6+ years and occassionally lunch or dinner. THE BEST FOOD and best staff around. I HIGHLY recommend it!

column4: 246 N. Canon Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: The bone-in filet mignon and porterhouse steak are delicious.

column4: 344 N. Camden Dr. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: The best of everything! The best Chinese food, the best service the best atmosphere although very loud.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Beverly Hills
column4: 224 South Beverly Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90212
column13: Went because of DineLA event. The appetizers and entrees were ok, nothing spectacular. The dessert was awful. It was too sour and almost impossible to eat. No other dessert choices. Our $45.00 was not well spent.

column1: Porter's Restaurant - Poppy Ridge Golf Course
column13: When we arrived we waited at the podium and were ignored until we had been standing there for a while and the chef motioned us over to him and we told him we had a reservation. We got seated at an outside table with a view of the golf course which was very nice. They had a birthday party going on so I don't know if that was why the service was slow or if they were short on waitstaff, but once we ordered we waited about 40 minutes before the food was delivered. The food was very good, good enough that we would give the restaurtant another try thinking maybe they were having an off day.

column4: 9570 Wilshire Blvd. Barneys New York Beverly Hills, CA  90212
column13: Food was tasty but nothing special, basically a classy deli; Service can be a little slow during lunch rush.

I've been to Hibiscus on several occassions and can honestly say the food is always delicious. It's a great place for a date or even to catch up with your girlfriends. I always recommend sharing the plates and trying several things out, especially the mac-n-cheese!

My wife and I celebrated our 17th wedding anniversary at Biba and we both felt it was a memorable moment. The food was excellant (my wife had the lasaga and I had the marinated grilled chicken) and prepared to perfection; our waitress was most congenial and shared some humorous conversation with us; and the atmosphere was both lively and pleasant (we love the combination of old/new world decor). All and all it was another pleasurable eating experience at Biba.

Friday night was really busy. Since we didn't make our decision on wine right away it, it took waiter quite some time to get back to us. Another table that came in after us brought their own wine so waiter spent lots of time opening theirs before he came back for our order. So be decisive or bring in your own wine. Gespacho and Salmon were best ever!!!! Of course it IS salmon season.
This is a neighborhood bar setting. The food is always good, it's a little loud, but always a good choice for BBQ.
Julia's is a quaint bistro with friendly service and a nice variety on the menu!

This is a beautiful little Persian restaurant tucked into a little "hole in the wall" behind a gas station, but it is well worth looking for. The ambiance and decor is quiet and lovely, the food is DIVINE, and the service is the ONLY thing I can complain about. There was one hostess working who also acted as our waitress, and another staff member who appeared to be training a third. While there were only 4 tables occupied, we still had to hunt down the hostess/waitress several times throughout the meal. It probably was a fluke and I'll definitely be going back for the food. But then I'd go back for the food even if the service didn't get any better!
Excellent food. Best Indian resturant in Seattle area.Curried mussels were fantastic.

I had the sand dab special, that came with a soup or salad. I chose the caesar salad. The salad and the entree wasn't anything I would want to order again. Nothing special. My friend liked his lamb dish.
We met friends for lunch, our first time there, not theirs. We all thought the food was marvelous, the atmosphere was friendly, the service was top rate.

column4: 800 W. Memorial Road Oklahoma City, OK  73114
column13: Me and my wife went here for our anniversery. I had the bone in ribeye...she had the salmon. We had a salad and crab cake to start. All the food was great. The service was also great. My only problem with the place is the price. I wish i was a big enough high roller to eat here regualerly but im not. Even hough the food was really good....I can go somewhere like Cattlemans 3 times for the same price. I see no reason to charge 41 dollars for a steak with no sides!
Just okay, the Asian salad I had was soaked in dressing and far to much Hoisin sauce was used

column4: 610 W. Lionshead Cr. C-200 Vail, CO  81657
column13: As usual good value. Took a new neighbor who echoed our view.
Interesting menu - definitely a cut above the typical Mexican restaurant. Great margaritas!
Great place to watch a game. Drinks are somewhat expensive but service is good.
Great food and service, as always.

column4: 400 W. Parkwood Ave/F.M.528 Ste. 100 Friendswood, TX  77546
column13: Excellent Sunday Brunch at a very reasonable price. It was advertized as a jazz brunch so I expected live music but was disappointed, although the piped music was quite nice.

The lettuce in the salad was stale, the grilled chicken was completely dry. The servers were very attentive and nice, however this did not make up for the poor quality of the food. This restaurant should not be on Open Table.
As Always, Bisetti's ia a great place to begin the weekend with perfect food and service
Would give the food two stars if it had been at temperature.

We made a special road trip out here for a friend's birthday. Unfortunately, we missed the last tour (4pm), but did settle in on the outside patio for a few rounds of beer (excellent) and some appetizers. The beer list is fantastic, the food is just so-so. The pretzels tasted like they were deep fried, the kim chee was not worthy of being "housemade", and everything is pricey!!! It is worth a trip to experience once, my only gripe (being from LA), is that someone has to drive home!

After having a fantastic dinner complimented by friendly, informed & fast service my wife and I went to the bar because we had a great port with dessert but forgot the name of it. None other than the owner/chef himself noticed us go from our table to the bar and came over to ask if everything was ok. We told him everything was terrific, we just wanted the name of the port. He not only answered that question but said that if we liked port we might like some other selections he had. He then poured us each several samples of ports and talked about what foods each would go with, he was very excited and and animated about it. We got the impression that he loves what he does and we walked out of there feeling pampered. They are gracious people!

Excellent waiter, excellent food. Great for groups, just make sure you have a reservation. Here's the only problem - we had a 7:30 reservation on a Friday night and we didn't get seated until 8. No apologies given...strange. And rude. This isn't NYC or LA...it's the Marina in San Francisco. That shouldn't happen here.
My wife and I dine at Casanova's any time we are in Maui. We enjoy the food and the employees are great. Thanks for a great time.

This was our 1st time here (found it on Open Table!) and we'll be back. Love the traditional bistro menu...mussels, bouillabaisse, etc. My sweetbreads, though fried (not my favorite method of prep), were not overcooked and the caper sauce was very good. The mizuna tarragon brie salad was a delicious whole meal in itself. Hubby wasn't thrilled with the lamb sirloin special because it didn't taste like lamb (it seems like they're breeding the flavor out of lamb these days, just like tomatoes) but portions were very generous. Service was friendly and helpful. The noise level is near ear-damaging when the restaurant fills up. The "by the glass" wine list was very short and didn't include basic information on the source or vintner.

column4: 345 Lincoln Ave, Suite 105 Steamboat Springs, CO  80487
column13: Never had a bad meal here and this time wasn't an exception. The shrimp was succulent and the pasta tasty. The salad was crispy and had a bouquet of flavors. One of my favorite places in Steamboat to dine.

Now that Pinot Bistro is gone, this place should get more business. They have a good hand with fish. Have enjoyed it for 20 years.I fondly remeber the old Bistro in BH (1970's)where the chocolate souffle was perfected and continued here.

The food was good but the service was not. Bread that should have come with the appetizer arrived at the table at the exact same time as our dinner salads. No plates were cleared before the dinner arrived meaning that we had to move things around and hold the plates until the waiter had hands empty to take them from us. I was left with no fork with dinner and had to get one myself from another empty table since I couldn't get the waiters attention.

Our waitress was terrific ... we arrived early and they gladly seated us. The variety and the value of the menu was terrific! We really couldn't think of something to say that they could have improved upon. A fabulous dining experience with good friends.
slightly above average for a main dining room. Very noisy.

column4: 340 East Basse Road, Suite 101 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: LOVED the food!! I thought about it the whole next day!!! The happy hour prices were not so happy, but the food more than made up for the price of the wine.

column4: 260 E. Colorado Blvd. Suite 203 Pasadena, CA  91101
column13: No matter which El Cholo I go to, I always wonder why in the world I come back. The ambiance at the El Cholo in Pasadena is vibrant and fun, but the food is bad, bad, bad. My pork was dry and flavorless. The taste of many items, e.g. tamales and chili rellenos are virtually interchangeable. There is no nuance to the seasonings; even the chips were oversalted. If you want sophisticated, thoughtful, authentic Mexican food FLEE to a different restaurant.

column4: 2709 Main Street Hill Santa Monica, CA  90405
column13: Chinois and Wolfgang Puck remain brilliant examples of some of the best things in life... delicious, fresh, healthy, aesthetically appealing dishes .. and wonderful service.

column4: 445 N. Palm Canyon Dr. Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: I liked this place a lot and will definitely go back! The margaritas are awesome and the food is really good. Fun place to be!

Great food and service. We lucked out when our blue hawaiian helicopter pilot recommended this local place. To top it off, there was a 12 piece swing band playing that night. Again, thanks for your mobile app which made it so easy to book a reservation for our party of six.

column4: 7952 E. Pacific Coastal Highway Newport Beach, CA  92657
column13: Bluefin was some of the freshest and most creative sushi we have ever had. Located right in a mall between Laguna and Newport Beach. We enjoyed this restaurant very much and would definitely return if in the area again.
Always excellent food (raw and cooked). Very friendly service. Very friendly to our 3 and 5 year old kids. Very consistent. Keeps us coming back every week or two!
Great food, great dining experience; i have never been let down at this restaurant.

column1: BluEmber at Rancho Las Palmas Resort & Spa
column4: 41000 Bob Hope Dr Rancho Mirage, CA  92270
column13: Too many kids running around, we took friend there for a relaxing evening.

column4: 48 E. Beaver Creek Blvd 48 E. Beaver Creek Blvd Avon, CO  81620
column13: Service was very harried at first. Drinks took a very long time to come, and 1 was only 2/3 full when it arrived. They did correct this quickly with a fresh cocktail. Food was good, but priced higher than I would have expected I'm Avon. Vail prices down valley...

It is so nice to enjoy a restaurant where everything is first class. The service has always been fabulous and the food is outstanding. It is our first choice for quality & service. Thank you for maintaining such high standards.

Our food was excellent as it should have been for the upscale prices. The singer/musician was talented and relaxing. Our one complaint would be that after noting that we had 3 teens with us they tried to put us in a round booth in a back corner that would have been hot in July. We ate at BRB with another family one other time during the winter and they put our kids in that booth and the adults in an adjoining booth. I can understand that for 6 kids that were younger at the time. But I was a little insulted as our teens are now 18, 16, and 15 and very well-behaved. They did give us a better table when I mentioned how hot that corner would be. Snobbery is very unappealing to me so I would not go to BRB again.

column4: 193 E. Gore Creek Drive Vail, CO  81657
column13: A restaurant that would be perfect for Restaurant Impossible....everything seems tired...the owner, the space...nothings seems organized. A good location, the servers are hard working but the owner needs to get a new groove. A good location in Vail, but a very disappointing experience. I would not return.

Prime rib was good cut of meat. Cooked medium, not medium rare. Bread could use an upgrade. Would prefer that the butter was not in patties that you had to unwrap. House salad could use some croutons. Having said this, my wife and I had apleasant, relaxed meal that overall we enjoyed.

column4: 1100 South Flower Street Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: Greatrestaurant -- ticks all the boxes!
The food and the beer were fantastic, but the service was really SLOWWW. 20+ minutes between checking on our group was a long time.

My family went to Blue Fish for a celebration. The food and plating was excellent. However, the plates they served it on were way too large for the table. We were shuffling plates, drinks, etc. all evening. While the place is popular, the music (techno style) was way too loud; it was hard to carry on a conversation. I would recommend if you go to enjoy your company, eat outside on their patio.
We celebrated a birthday at The Boat Club and had a wonderful dinner. The steaks were perfectly prepared, our server was superb (ask for Clayton!), and the music entertainment enjoyable.
Great food! LAMB GNOCCHI was awesome!
We had an excellent dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House. The view was very nice, the food was very good and our waitress was exceptional.We highly recommend this restaurant!
only minus....not really a JAZZ lounge!
always go before The Geffen and am never disappointed. Great service and wonderful Italian cuisine.

column1: Bob's Steak and Chop House - Dallas on Lemmon
column13: since Bob sold this place the service has gone down. it took us for ever for the server to take our order. food is still good, but not the same treat it used to me.

column1: Bob's Steak and Chop House - Fort Worth
column13: I loved the dining room as soon as I walked in! Cozy yet elegant. Noise level was low and you could easily carry on conversation with each other. The drinks from the bar were great followed by the excellent choice of appetizers. The shrimp cocktail and crab cake were the best! Our entrees were very good and we appreciated the input from our waiter on the specials. Desserts were wonderful! The chocolate/peanut butter sundae was our favorite and large enough to share! Would recommend for special occasion or out of town guests.
Food and service were wonderful!

column1: Bob's Steak & Chop House Dallas on Lamar
column4: 555 S. Lamar Located in the Omni Dallas Hotel Dallas, TX  75202
column13: Bob's is by far the best steakhouse and the location on Lamar in the Omni is brand new and very unique
Food was perfect, along with what is probably the best scenic views in all of North Texas! Truly a special place.

column4: 219 East Houston Street Suite 275 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The food was good and the service excellent. The decor is nice, but the lack of attention to detail during the construction phase of decorating is obvious. The interior design is also lacking a certain elegance that is more common in upscale dining in NY.

Great Brazilian restaurant, salad bar was plentiful with meats, cheeses etc. Dinner rolls were exceptionally great. The different kinds of meat were excellent and all cooked and spiced perfect. It was a great meal for myself and my other 10 guests.

Great Salads and Pizzas. It is always noisy (music too loud) at this location so not a good place for a quiet romantic dinner and hard to hear in a large group..but the food and service are excellent.

We had a wonderful anniversary dinner here. We were greeted with a "Happy Anniversary" and there was a nice card at our table as well. Our server, Therese, was wonderful! Very personable, warm and willing to make recommendations for both food and wine. Our fondue was fantastic and we had a lovely quiet table.

The Georgian is one of my favorite places to eat in Seattle. I've had several dinners there with both excellent food and service. I was excited to take a friend there for lunch recently; expecting the same high standards of service. However, I couldn't have been more dissapointed. The service was disorganized and forgetful - I never ended up getting the drink I ordered at the beginning of my meal, and my original waiter never came back to the table. Our glasses remained empty during the meal and it took a long time to flag anyone down to even bring more water. The food was not up to the Georgian's high dinner standards either - portions were very small for the price and even the clam chowder was bland. Only worth going for dinner.

column1: Bolero Tapas Bar and Spanish Grill
column4: 200 S. Oklahoma Ste #140 Oklahoma City, OK  73104
column13: This was our second visit to Bolero. Since our first trip was so great, we couldn't wait to bring our out-of-town guests to show off. They had never been to a tapas bar before and Bolero did not fail to impress. The food was very good, our server was pleasant, attentive and responsive to special requests - all in all, just exactly what you want out of a special dinner. Thank you for making us look like great hosts!
We bought $55 for dinner for two and the food's quality was bad.
Spinach paneer and mango lassi's were delicious. The chicken was a little dry.

column4: 651 H Maloney Street Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Great job at representing Polish food. Very comforting and familiar. My 81 year old father was very interested in trying Bona and afterward wanted to know when we were coming back so he could try everything on the menu!

The quesadilla was excellent! This was the first time I tried a non-traditional BBQ dish and it really exceeded my expectations. Everyone else in my party got BBQ and praised the dishes as usual. My only concern was the local flight of beers which I ordered was not very good. I told the waitress and she agreed with me.

column4: Dolores St. between Ocean & 7th Avenue Carmel-By-The-Sea, CA  93921
column13: Wonderful complimentary appetizer: bowl of hummus, 20 tiny olives, 5 wedges of beets, slices of squash!

We chose to eat here on a ladies weekend. We are from Denver and none of us had spent any significant time in Grand Junction. The reviews and menu looked great for 626 on Rood. The salads used fresh greens, but were VERY lightly dressed, but the main course was wonderful. I noticed a display of gorgeous ripe heirloom tomatoes and asked for one to be sliced to accompany our meal. There was some hesitation, but eventually the waiter agreed and the chef made a delightful caprese salad. We asked the waiter for recommendations on other places to check out that night and he happily directed us to some local bars and breweries. It was a good experience overall and I will dine here again when I visit GJ

We went for a a pre-theatre meal because they have a deal that you can get a free dessert when you show your ticket. The waitress was very helpful in that she understood that we were in a time crunch so she put in our order quickly and that things would be brought out as they were done cooking. That being said, I got the sashimi hamachi, my friend got the lamb chops, and my friend and her mom got two other tapas like items that needed real cooking and my dish came out dead last a good 10 minutes after everyone else's. They also didn't really even check to see what was wrong. The yuzu sauce on the hamachi was incredibly salty, more than I was expecting but the quality of the fish was good. The experience was marred by the timing and the host
Always the best of experiences.
Excited to try something new - however I wanted the food to be vibrant and flavor explosions but the food was ok

We wanted to dine in a steakhouse that wasn't too formal and this place fit the bill. The atmosphere is dominated by the large bar area in the front of the restaurant which was completely full at 4:30PM on a Friday afternoon. The dining area, on the other hand, was completely empty. As another reviewer noted, you only get happy hour prices in the bar. My wife ordered the Seared Tuna to start which she said was yummy. Our son didn't care for the corn bread so our server brought out french bread for him without our asking for it. We ordered the dual mini filet mignons (4 oz. each), one Diane and one Gorganzola. They were both very tasty! The drink prices are steep ($10 for a cocktail) which is probably why the bar was packed.

Expectations low due to being a hotel restaurant, but service was lacking - a student not quite knowing what to do, the meals were minimal and do not compare to Omni, Westin, Marriot, or other local high end hotel restaurants.

column4: 8941 Elk Grove Boulevard Elk Grove, CA  95624
column13: This is a fantastic restaurant. The food is great from the quality to the taste. The service is friendly and prices are reasonable for what's offered. We never feel rushed while dining. Although the location is not the greatest, once inside the food and beverages will transport you to a whole other place. This is a local favorite! We can wait to go back to try brunch, we hear it's amazing.
Our service was awful, we will not be returning to the Boulder location.

column1: The Vintage Room at The Reserve Golf Course
column13: Great place to eat! Don't miss it!

This place is just amazing. The first time my wife and I discovered this restaurant was three years ago and we just happened to be in town for a seminar, we live in L.A. So, we decided to look this place up online and were so happy to have found it, YES!! Food is so good that we couldn't leave Dallas before having a nice meal at this place. Food is outstanding, I am confident to say that all their dishes are fantastic, even though we've only had three of them... anyone's palate will definitely enjoy their dishes.

We had not been to Roots in over a year since our last visit was disappointing. However, this time the filet mignon was excellent and although as other reviews mentioned the prices can be a little high, I don't mind paying that if the steak is done properly. The service was also noteworthy. I would definitely recommend it again to friends.
Great wine and delicious pizza...both make for a great combination!
Ordinary chinese food at extraordinary prices.
this is by far one of the best dinner experiences my wife and I have had in ages. perfect on every level and we would recommend to anyone!
we enjoyed the food and service, but was very hot and cramped

The food and the ambiance are great! We go back there whenever my fiance and I want to treat ourselves or their is a special occasion, this time we were celebrating his birthday. This visit we were surprised with a lunch deal, buy one traditional meal and get the second half off. We were thrilled about this until we got the bill and saw we were paying $7 for two Iced Teas, we drink iced tea every where we go and $3.50 for tea is going overboard.We can get better and cheaper tea at Starbucks, next time I will be sticking with water.

If you want a quite romantic place to celebrate a special occasion, i.e. anniversary etc. this is not the place. The noise level is off the charts. We had a hard time conversing across a table for two.

Was there with 5 of my girlfriends. Wanted more ambiance than say Olive Garden. Buca di Beppo never disappoints in food or ambiance. No one but myself had been there before and the ladies were all thrilled with my choice of restaurants. We'll be back!
Great service and Fantastic food!!!!
The food was pretty good, but unfortunately not as delicious as I hoped.

I attended this restaurant for a quick getaway with my wife while staying at the Montage. The restaurant is a nice compliment to the hotel. I had a pork chop dish and my wife had free range chicken. She loved the chicken. The pork chop was wanting for $40. If you can walk out of here for under $100, you're a bargain hunter. The prices followed the overall theme of the hotel. Overall, the food was less than what I paid for. I could have spent the same money at La Caille and had much better quality.

column1: Shula's Steak House - Hyatt Regency Houston
column13: Excellent, the service and food OUTSTANDING!
I and my now fiancee went to Brenner's for my proposal to her. The staff was notified and took care of everything in an incredibly classy way

column4: 303 N Santa Cruz Ave Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: Food is always excellent and fresh.
Excellent seafood in residential neighborhood. all fish fresh and wild caught.

column1: The Tavern At St. Michael's Square
column13: Service was slow, kind of cranky. Food was well cooked but didnt have much flavor. The bar was full, we sat in the dining area, the bar noise was kind of overwhelming. Food took forever to arrive, even a salad. And the kicker? A stray dog happened to wander in somehow....

Buffalo burger was boring. French frys were kind if tasteless. Ordered grilled veggies w kids meals aThey were butter sauted squash. Mist kids hate squash. Green beans, brocolli, even peas and carrots would have been better for them.Server was great!!!
really enjoyed the variety of champagne cocktails!
Overall great experience!!! Food, Drink, Service all top notch! I have been there a half dozen times and will keep going back, it is never a bad choice!
It's the Meddlesome Moth for more of a hipster crowd. Keeps getting better as it matures.

column4: 7161 Bishop Rd. Suite G-1 Plano, TX  75024
column13: Food and service good - had been better on other occasions, but still better than most restaurants

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - Houston
column13: I loved everything about the House of Blues experience. I dis noy like the parking situation but that is no fault of HOB. Everything on the menu is responsibly priced and I had the best burger ever. I will come again.

The food was outstanding - a little spendy, but well worth the price. Definitely need reservations. The noise level was very high, made it difficult to talk to the person sitting across the table from you.
Great place for margaritas, energetic ambiance, surprisingly good food.

column4: 3790 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column8: New York New York Hotel & Casino
column13: The ribeye was ok. It was cooked perfect to rare, but lacked any real flavor, also the marbling was mainly tissue.

column1: Gumbo's Steak and Seafood - Bee Cave
column13: Salmon Robert is always excellent. Salads are always crisp and fresh. Highly recomend.

column4: 15 East South Temple 10th Floor Salt Lake City, UT  84150
column13: This is such a great place for special occasions. You can even pre-order flowers and have them placed on the table.

I went for my birthday and it was fantastic. The food is delicious, and it's fun watching the chef prepare your food in front of you. You even get ice cream/sorbet/sherbet with your meal. I would love to go again.

column4: 615 Flatiron Market Place Drive Broomfield, CO  80021
column13: Beautiful place, our server was super nice, funny and friendly. Lots of food had 5 people order 3 small dishes and a small salad, had a lot of left overs.

Our visit to Pecan Grill was marred by a couple of miscues by the staff. First, a waiter spilled a glass of iced tea on us, good thing it wasn't red wine. Second, the Open Table reservation was never input into the system, so we received an email asking why we never showed up. In retrospect, the spilled tea was a good thing, as it gave us an event that the management remembered and they cleared up our points.

column4: 2824 North Pennsylvania Avenue Oklahoma City, OK  73107
column13: The food and service are great. A great place to get gourmet cuisine in a contemporary dining atmoshpere.

What a great little restaurant! Wonderful spread of cheeses, salamis, olives,etc served as appetizer and my salmon was cooked perfect. Loved it. Brunellos is fairly close to my home, and I think I've found my new favorite in the area.
Had a by nice business lunch here. Great food!
Excellent sushi place! Service could have been better but there was a table of 50 there so I am sure that took away from a lot of others. Def will still be back though.

A great place for people who love wine but get intimidated by large wine lists. The staff is very helpful when ordering vino and even let you try almost any wine before you buy it. Oh, and the food is incredible.
Outdoor table was great. Service is always good. Chip sandwich is great

column4: 17550 Bernardo Oaks Dr San Diego, CA  92128
column13: This was my husband and my favorite place for breakfast and lunch. We would come to relax and enjoy the scenery of the golf course (my husband was a golf lover) and enjoy a glass of wine and good food. After he died, I had trouble coming back but eventually wanted to share the beauty of the place. When I started my meet up group "The Young 60's" I knew that I would bring them to the Veranda for coffee and breakfast. They loved it and we might make it one of our coffee places. The food is great, the service is wonderful and this is a place to put on your list as favorites.

If you like a lot of Basil in your sauces; Spaghetti, Pizza, etc. you will love their food.In my opinion, way to heavy on the basil and it ruined the taste of both mentioned. We could not eat the pizza and finished on a portion of our spaghetti.Nice looking restaurant, friendly staff, they just need a new sauce recipe.Selling a pizza for less does not make it taste better or mean you will get repeat business!
I loved their Ossobuco. The service was excellent!

Winters is a lovely little town, restaurant in an old bldg. with interesting decor. Menu prices very high for the quality of food served. A sirloin steak is a sirloin steak, tough and chewy, not worth $37.00. Served with a baked potato,veggies and a salad all about the same quality as Denny's. Nothing special. They didnot serve us the bread that came with the dinner and had to ask two people for butter for the potato. The service was about you would expect on a busy night but nice waiter and he did the best he could.
extremely pleasant and attentive service. smaller portions meant to be shared by 2, and not cheap..but nice quality and tasty

column4: 2441 E Coast Hwy Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: Great crab cakes and lobster, but my rib eye was so salty I couldn't eat it.Our waiter was terrible.Overpriced for the quality of food and service. I do not recommend this establishment.
Another great experience! A can't miss restuarant.

column4: 247 Avenida del norte Redondo Beach, CA  90277
column13: Loved the prosciutto pizza, the meatball appetizer special and the scampi! Will be back for night out with the girls!

Very friendly and helpful staff, quick service and personal attention; chef made a table visit to check on our satisfaction, food was great. Our second visit and a birthday celebration. They took good care of us!

column4: 1037 Monterey St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: I had the sea bass. It was overcooked. I like the sides of potatoes, carrot, and spinach. My friend had the chicken breast. He said he liked it.
I scheduled a dinner meeting for 6 people. They were very accommodating in seating us in a separate area. The service was quick and attentive and the food was delicious. We were very pleased.
First time visit and we will be back - great food, wonderful service and pleasant atmosphere.
I've tried a lot of teppanyaki places, this one was supposed to be good-was not impressed.I'll stick to my other places Sakura Chaya Tokyo Cuisine - Fresno, CA

column4: 5255 Kearny Villa Road San Diego, CA  92123
column13: Outstanding steaks. Service and attentiveness of the staff is a definite plus. Friendly environment, saw a number of regulars who knew the staff and management by name. We were here several weeks ago and needed to come back to celebrate a special occasion.

I made resercvations for the Retro party and dinner! I soooo enjoyed the old song that you dont typically hear in a nightclub or dinner/supper club; I was not disappointed. I was tranformed by the outfits that were worn and the music! I would return again, especially for a retro party!The waitress, Hailey, made our night very enjoyable.

OK, it wasn't the best food I've had but the views and the service made up for it. Outstanding service! Haven't had service like this since our last cruise! It's like having a weekend mountain get away within the city. Just needs a little improvement on the food to be prefect.

column4: 11677 San Vicente Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90049
column13: Their fresh trout is one of the best seafood dishes anywhere. Also the chopped wedge starter salad is excellent and could be a small meal in itself.

column4: 1440 N Jantzen Beach Ctr Portland, OR  97217
column13: Food was delicious. Excellent service.

column4: 857 West John W Carpenter Freeway Irving, TX  75039
column13: Delightful venue, but the actual food left a bit to be desired. My prime rib was excellent, the "smoky" fried chicken less so, the Kobe beef tacos so-so, the stacked brisket buns very messy, and the Texas onion rings perfectly battered and fried . . . but so large that it was difficult to actually eat them. Wonderful service, Tito's Iced Tea was fantastic, and the wine list was adequate.

This was our second visit, and it was just as good as the first. It's a casual, but very earnest place. My brother is becoming addicted to the cassoulet. If I lived in the area I would probably eat here weekly.

My first experience at Caesars was in 1968. Not much has changed...which happens to be a good thing. When you sit down you truly feel like you are in a restaurant in Rome or Florence. The food has always been very good. Their 7-course meal is defintely something to try, even if you don't eat a lot. They do have take home boxes! The waiters have all been there forever and although they seem a bit stiff, they are very efficient and handle every request without missing a beat. The bar is usually crowded on Friday and Saturday nights and again, the bartender has been around forever. It is truly a neighborhood feel with a touch of true Italy. When you go just check out the clientele. That says a lot about the place!
Nice little restaurant at Seattle Center. Food is fair. Will not rush back. Too many good restaurants in the area. But adequate for a simple dinner.
Great food, great service. The server was prompt and polite. The food was great and the desert fabulous. I wouldn't change a thing.

This is my neighborhood local go-to place: because not only is the food wonderful, the dishes well thought out, the service terrific and the ambiance very good.. but because I am always made to feel special when I walk through the door. Go, now.. and again, soon!
Excellent food and service. Very reasonable prices.
We had Mother's Day brunch. Food was good. The omelet station and waffle station were awesome! The best part though, was the view! Every seat was a great seat!
Had a large group for dinner and it was quiet enough to carry on a conversation.Food was diverse and good. Everyone had a great time.

column4: 36889 N. Tom Darlington Dr Carefree, AZ  85377
column13: The food was great tasting. But, for the prices (fair-Moderate) I think the serving staff would have given off a better vibe for the place if they would have worn a casual oxford shirt instead of the faded and "ragged" T-shirts.
French cuisine, the appetizers where really good. Also the filet and the halibut where good.

column4: 235 S. La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA  90211
column13: We had a wonderful meal here-- we told our host that we needed to leave at a particular time to catch a film at the Saban theater and we were assured it would not be a problem. They kept their promise. Our meal was good and the wait staff made us feel at home. The wine list was also good. We will definitely be back and were glad to find out about local delivery- although I am not sure we would want to give up the cafe experience.
Excellent food - fun atmosphere

column4: 4451 Admiralty Way Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: Good night at Cafe del Rey. Wasnt quite up to the usual standard though overall. Great option though out of the Marina selection for a slightly higher-end experience.

column4: 563 W Los Angeles Ave Moorpark, CA  93021
column13: Great service. Our waitress was very good and charming.
The food was excellent. We ate there two times in a short stay in Jackson and loved it both times. The hard part was deciding what to have.

Growing up in Florida I lived on a good Cubano and fried sweet plantains. Living in Colorado these last several years neither of those were anywhere to be found. Cafe Habana was a wonderful spot that brought back fond memories of my childhood. The ambiance was beautiful, the food was delicious and the drinks were expertly mixed. Our server seemed a bit shy and we did have to wait to order another round for quite a bit with empty glasses and no water but overall, this place was very good and we will absolutely be back!

Staff was not prepared to switch from breakfast to brunch menus. My breakfast order was cold when served. Service was slow and not attentive. Reserved table was not acceptable when offered. Requested a different table and was seated at a booth which was better.

column4: 2647 East Coast Highway Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: Loved being outside in the gorgeous garden.Excellent beet salad.

column4: Cafe Luna - San Diego San Diego, CA  92128
column13: We needed a great Friday night place and found one. Excellent wait staff. Made a reservation for next week before we left.

column1: Cafe on the Green at the Four Seasons Dallas
column13: Six business associates for dinner.The service was perfect. The food was perfect.Loud enough to cover our conversation and quiet enough we could hear each other without yelling.

column4: 700 West Fifth St. Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: We had a wonderful evening! The wine pairings were excellemt and delightful!
As always, the food and service in this place were excellent. I have been coming here for many years, and somehow they manage to keep improving. Highly recommended!

column4: 360 N. Rodeo Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: I'd mostly recommend it because the wait staff was accommodating and it's the only dining establishment with outdoor seating on Rodeo Dr., which makes for cool people watching. As personable as the wait staff were, they weren't very attentive. We had to wait at long intervals to get their attention, and they never proactively checked on us to see how our food was. However, they let me change my reservation time three times, and they charged my friends a lower price for their entrees since my friends had mistakenly been given an older menu with lower pricing. That was beyond accommodating. Overall, the food was good, but not worth the cost. You're paying for Rodeo Dr., not for the grilled cheese.
Great food, service and anbiance. A bit noisey though.
Big price small portions. The food was very good but overpriced for what you get.

I love this place. It's great for a casual, good quality meal. They have live ebi and abalone. The uni, mackerel and giant clam is always fresh and they have real wasabi if you ask for it. You expect it at Matsuhisa or Nobu but it's rare everywhere else in L.A.
A gem! Delicious food! Nice menu selections, unique, yet there's something for everyone. Charming outdoor eating area, with friendly atmosphere and great service. We'll definitely be back. Thanks!

Although difficult to find in a strip mall(their building is at an angle), lunch at Cafe Torre was a very good experience. The diners looked mainly from the nearby business community. Their lunch specials were very well priced, with generous portions. Our lunches were tasty and well-presented. Wines by the glass, though pricey, were very good. The server was business-like, but adequate. We were celebrating a special occasion, and the restaurant presented the celebrant with a complimentary dessert. We will definitely be back, this time for dinner!
A surprising gem. A nice neighborhood restaurant with excellent cooking.
Great spot for a relaxing lunch. The staff was warm and welcoming and the food fresh and delicious. They make their desserts in-house including the lady fingers for the tiramisu.

column4: 779 E 300 S Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: This is my favorite lunch spot and I was curious to see how it fared for dinner. Everything was delicious. We had the pasta, the mahi-mahi and the artichoke. Everything was spot on, but the artichoke was to die for.
Always good, well-priced food in a casual, friendly atmosphere. Don't miss their Amaretto Sours. They are the BEST!

Food was very good but service was on the slow side. We sat down at 7:30pm, ordered two apps and two dishes. It took about an hour for everything to come out. The restaurant wasn't extremely packed either, it's a very small place to begin with. We wanted more rice so we ordered it as a side and there was enough for 2 spoons. I thought "they charge $2 for that??" Quite ridiculous... The server lady wasn't rude but wasn't friendly either. I'd go there for the food with plenty of time to spare.
We had the lunch buffet, and it was fabulous. However, just be mindful that the $5 iced tea is not included in the price and seems overpriced. I mean, come on, it's just iced tea!

column4: 1054 SW Camano Drive Camano Island, WA  98282
column13: While Camano Island may be limited in their selection of places to dine out, what they do have are wonderful. The restaurant looks out over Saratoga Passage and Whidbey Island; what could be better. Michelle was an excellant waitperson and made our special occasion dinner even more special.

column4: 34505 N. Scottsdale Road, Suite G2 Scottsdale, AZ  85262
column13: I would say the spotted donkey had some of the best Mexican food that ever touched my mouth! We started off with the chips & salsa with guacamole that was very good. I got the stuffed pepper with pulled pork, omg, it was so delicous my husband took a bite and he is not a pork guy and was impressed with how good it tasted. We even got desert, I never had fried ice cream so my husband & I split it, no one person could eat that alone, wow It was fabulous!
The food here was just out of this world.

Good place for happy hour. I heard they can be strict when it comes to the dress code during evenings. Only complaint is the staff does not address tables with a screaming children. It was during happy hour, the table was the only table with a child in the entire place, and the kid was about 5 years old and screaming the entire time. It ruined our experience and we left earlier than planned.
This is old school dining - predictable: white table cloths, specials, blah menu, service that is rote.

During the brunch on the patio I felt the music was too loud--I feel it would have been better if it were turned down a bit allowing for conversation at the table (and as I looked around most table groups were attempting to have discussions.) Thanks--the food and was great and the service very good!

We had a large group of 8 people. We had made reservations about a week ahead of time. We were first shown a table shown a table for 6 people and two high chairs. The table we were given was slightly larger, but still a booth. Even though it is an Italian restaurant, it doesn't seem to be family friendly for large groups. We had gone to the Buca in Universal City and had a nice round table for 8 people. So much nicer! We LOVED the food, so if you are a small group, no problem!

column4: 100 East Meadow Dr. Unit 24 Vail, CO  81657
column13: Campo di Fiori has long been one of our favorite restaurants in Vail. Hostess Audrey makes you feel like you are part of the family. Hugs for all arriving and on departure. We had our wedding rehearsal dinner here three years ago and it was perfect even for large groups!!!

column4: 545 Newport Center Drive Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: Our wait person was tremendously helpful. Made great recommendations for food and wine. He kept the evening moving when we told him we had a concert to get to by 7:30. Woudl go back again.
Enjoyed a beautiful view and good food. Hostess and service staff were very accommodating.

From being given one of the best tables in the house by owner emeritus Chris Canlis to finding our car waiting for us when we stepped outside, the evening couldn't have been more perfect. The butter-poached lobster, hamachi appetizer, and mille feuille dessert were especially memorable.

I chose Cannery in hopes that it would be a romantic experience. While the lighting and ambience set the mood, it was difficult to have a conversation with the noise level. I'm not complaining about it, it was just unexpected. The staff was very nice, notably the bussers.

column4: 3377 Las Vegas Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Was our first time and we will return!
Food was very good. Not busy so was quiet. Nice service

Went here before seeing American Idiot when it was happy hour. The sauce for the chicken satay was very good, had the spring rolls and those were delicious as well. Dinner we had pumpkin curry shrimp, ground chicken with basil & chile, tofu & eggplant, & mango shrimp. All were good. Brown rice was really good. Not huge portions which was great for us. High quality food, & reasonably priced.

We were a bit worried when we arrived on time and were asked to wait to be seated next door in the Art School dorm lobby. All concerns vanished when the food arrived - delicious, and a great value. We were just a little rushed, but overall a great place.
Great place for a very nice evening out!!

column4: 5775 E Santa Ana Canyon Road Anaheim Hills, CA  92807
column13: We celebrated my mother's 89th birthday at Canyon Restaurant and had a memorable meal. We were all very happy and agreed to return for future family eventsMy mother plans to hold her red-hatter event here.

We were quite disappointed with our dining experience at Capellini. We were one of three tables, yet, service was quite slow. Our waitress (or was she the bartender) was friendly and knowledgeable enough, but seemed to be busy at the bar and was only around to take our order. The pizza that I ordered had a very tough crust. At the end of our meal, we had to flag someone down because the group of employees that was there was too busy talking among themselves to notice that we had been done eating. The only reason that we had decided to have lunch there was because I had a gift certificate, so at least we didn't have to spend any of our own money there.
This resturant was very noisy! You could not even have a conversation in this place!
Super delicious, less busy earlier in theWeekend day
The food was nice and the restaurant had great decorations. We had a good time and had good conversations.
Worse Chicken Fried Steak I've ever had in my life!! Re-made & it was just as awful! Great Mac & Cheese however & my husband enjoyed his Meatloaf...
Good but expensive/ Parking terrible
The menu is large & interesting & the flavors scrumptious! Lots of interesting spices & food combinations in the Peruvian mode. If you're looking for something different, try Piqueos!

The best parts were the wine list by far, followed by the selection of food on the menu which was prepared well and was an eclectic mix of interesting and delicious dishes. The negative was that the menu had at lest a couple of miss-prints that resulted in me getting a dish with surprise ingredients. The staff was all over it and made me a pizza quickly. It was delicious. Be sure to take advantage of the free parking just around the corner on 9th, but not on a day the Padre baseball team is in town.

We had a fantastic time. We dined for our daughter's 15th birthday so it's definitely kid friendly and the service was impeccable. Come hungry since the portions are huge even when you order the small. This is a place you share food.

This place got my attention for their recently added brunch menu. Have to admit, I did not have their brunch as the selection was limited. However lunch was really good! This place has an awesome outside area. Great for drinks, apps and friends. Considering restaurant prides its menu on organic, freshly made dishes made to order. You will have a bit of a wait for your food. If you are not in a rush, this is a great place to dine.

column4: Ocean Avenue & Monte Verde St Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA  93921
column13: Dinner with family. Food was delicious. Service most accommodating.
I had the seabass for lunch and it was delicious. Very fresh and the tomato sauce that it was served with was really good. I wouldn't definitely got there again.
The food was good, but if you are watching your calories, go elsewhere. Whew !

column4: 10463 Santa Monica Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90025
column13: Great food, good wind, fast and friendly service. Not sure how you csn ask for more than that. I recommend the Black and White Pizza as a appitizer. Been here three times and its always great. Love this place! Wish I lived closer.
I loved my appetizer and main course-- the veggies were really flavorful! My husband loved his steak.

Interesting place. A bit too loud. Not much vegetarian fare, which is to be expected in an Irish pub. However, there are plenty of Irish cheeses that could be added to the menu as a cheese plate. My friend loves the live music there!

column4: 343 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
column13: Good food at a fair price. The hot soft pretzel bites (appetizer) were exceptional. The tasty soap was served hot. The BBQ chicken and BBQ platter entrees were both good. We did note that bread and butter were not served with the meal (ok with us). CJ's Grill is recommended for a decent meal at a fair price.

column4: 2850 East Tropicana Ave Las Vegas, NV  89121
column13: Best no frills Italian food in Vegas I've found thus far. Everything was moderately priced, delicious, delicious, delicious (from apps to dessert)and a well priced and complimentary wine list. Service was excellent and well grounded. The Live music is just an atmospheric bonus as Frank Devito kept us in stiches, catered to guest song requests and played classics (you mother can appreciate- a lot of Sinatra). Hands down a great time, and a trip down nostalgic lane.
We love Casa Mia and go as often as we can. Nantes was perfect, as always. The food is consistently delicious.

The female bartender has always been good (some of the other ones have been rude at times) and the food also quite good. The focaccia at this location (they don't seem to have it in the Kahului location...why???) is outstanding.

column4: 125 East Palace Avenue Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: I love thIs place. The food is always great and the singing service is fabulous.

I had been to this restaurant several times in the past, but this experience was truly disappointing. The waiter kept bringing us the wrong food (and charged us for it!), forgot to place the right food and drink orders, and what was supposed to be a nice, leisurely dinner before a concert turned into an all night affair. Food was ok, but there is better in Aspen (Kenichi or Matsu), but the oudoor dining right on the mall was the highlight.All in all is was a disappointment unfortunately.

Great food and wine, we had three courses each. Each one was amazing, particularly the chocolate fondue. Washed it down with bottle of bordeux, again perfect. Small restaurant and great friendly service. Would recommend!

The food was good, although there are fewer choices than previously offered. We had asked to have a special dessert with a candle for the birthday girl, but the server answered to a call for the bill by our guest and we were never offered dessert, so no celebratory finish.It did not seem right to me that my guest was given the bill without the server conferring with me as I had identified myself as the reservation holder and the host when we arrived.
great restaurant, great food, only turn off was the manager was pushy for us to exit to accommodate a book reservation. that was a completely turn OFF!

Starter - Seafood Chowder - Superb. Lots of seafood and perfectly spiced with a bit of bite. My wife ordered the Fruit and Nut Salad in the entree size, and immediately said it was lifeless. I tried it as well and agreed, totally lethargic. While it was supposed to be finished with a blueberry brandy vinaigrette, any hint of dressing was barely detectable. Maybe this was geared toward the summer geriatric tourists, and that is fine, but other diners should be warned. I ordered Wild Mushroom Fettuccine, and while it was good, the fettuccine itself was overcooked. Great atmosphere and live music. And the service is outstanding. Next time, double down on the seafood chowder.

column4: 1700 Coyote Point Dr San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Our table was reserved for us, and it was just what we wanted. There was no maitre D' to check in with, so I had no way to indicate that we were an "open table" party.The food was mediocre. The salad was soggy, and had few of the ingredients that were promised: two spiced walnut halves, few other items.Three of us ate salad and no bread was offered. The wrap that one of us ordered was very generous in size. The prices were very reasonable. It was not loud and it was also what we wanted because we were there to see one another.

column4: 300 East Wigwam Blvd Litchfield Park, AZ  85340
column13: The service was outstanding. The dining room needs to be seriously spruced up; new paint, etc.
Good food overall. Not the cleanest place it could be.
Love the mushrooms! We will be back.

Nice atmosphere, nice music (not overwhelming so you could appreciate it), very pleasant place to attend with friends.The parking lot was crammed, which you can expect on a Saturday evening, but the table was ready on time, the reservation was properly managed and we could linger at the end of the dinner without feeling pushed out.One important thing: prima il dolce, e soltanto dopo il caff !

column1: Ristorante Cavour at the Hotel Granduca
column13: It is my second visit to the restaurant. Again I was very pleased with the food and especially the service. The sommelier was great, he suggested a great wine for our dinner. The restaurant manager,the captain and the staff was awsome, the chef came to my table and explained us the food.Will be back soon. I can not wait.

column4: 4000 Canyons Resort Dr. Park City, UT  84098
column13: Mariah was great. Food delicious.

column1: CB Grille in Copper Mountain Village
column13: Excellent food and service. A cut above all other establishments at Copper.

column4: Mirage Hotel & Casino 3400 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Average food. Average service. Not worth tte money - $ 100 per person with no drinks.
One of our favorite restaurants. Food quality and taste always fantastic.
I have never had a bad meal at Citrus City Grille! Everything on the menu is delicious and the service is attentive and friendly.

column1: Oro at The Emily Morgan Hotel
column4: 705 E Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Went on a Friday night, we're just looking for a decent place for dinner. Menu on website was not what was available, but we did not have a hard time finding things to eat. Food was delicious. Service left a little bit to be desired, but wouldn't keep us from going back. Very cool building. Definitely recommend giving it a try.
Excellent at always!!! One of my Favorites!

As Carmel residents, we had not been to Christopher's in quite awhile. Must say that they promote their "local" wines but we did not find many recognizable local wines on the list. They were pushing some wines from Argentina and Chile. They were out of several wines, limiting our choices. Dinner entrees were okay but not great. Salmon was supposed to be local. From the color, it looked like it was farm-raised salmon (local fresh has more color and is in season right now). The BBQ short rib should have been cooked to falling off the bone. Mashed potatoes were very ordinary. We shared a salad, a bottle of local chardonnay, and each had an entree. With a 16% tip it cost us $132. I don't think we will go back; it wasn't worth the price.

several of us at our table were a little disappointed in our waitress: Because we didn't want french fries with our panini's she said" Oh, you can substitute anything you want" so we chose salads. When the bill came, it was $2.00 dollarsmore for each of us. We had no idea we wsould be charged extra for the change and she said it like you just substitute something easily. We felt a little fooled by that. I did tell her, that at the time of the change, she just preface it with the fact that it is $200 more. The restaurant makes money because we gave you back your french fries. Think about that.

column4: Hilton San Francisco 750 Kearny Street San Francisco, CA  94108
column13: waiter services are not consistent. There is a waiter (Joe) won't serve you and being rude just because your table is not assigned to him for serving.

the staff is nice, the food was decent. i am a big fan of salmon sashimi, and have had my share of it at many restaurants. the quality of the salmon was actually pretty decent, but it was the first time ever that i found bone in my sashimi. and not just in one piece, but two! and they were pretty long bones too
Great service and Travis took car of us very well!
This is a good restaurant. My wife's Chateaubriand was not medium well as requested.
It couldn't be better. The food is outstanding with great service.
Don't let the location on busy Lincoln Boulevard discourage you - this is a wonderful little restaurant with friendly staff and delicious food.

This is a place we frequent and the food and service have always been good. I take my grandson there and he likes to make his own pizza. I like the veriety of choices on the menu and I will continue to eat there and would recommend it to others.

The food at Dillions was amazing. The server was great and always available. The two man band was very entertaining. It was our 10th anniversary so they gave my wife wine and a choice of any desert for free. All in all a great place to dine!

column4: 10250 Santa Monica Blvd. #206 Los Angeles, CA  90067
column13: Great food, had DineLA lunch, will return again!

column4: 5400 West Century Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90045
column13: As always, the Daily Grill is firing on all cylinders.

The food surpassed our expectations. Great shrimp a la diabla appetizer as part of the dineLA menu. Seabass and short ribs were also very good. Desserts also excellent with the berry shortcake a bit better than the intense chocolate. Special kudos to the manager who helped create a meal for a toddler with dairy allergies. Very, very thoughtful, and the child loved it. This was a medium price meal in the dineLA special, but better than many of the more expensive dinners I've had at other restaurants. I'd be very happy to go again.

I would wager that anyone who has posted a favorable review for Blackfinn also has The Olive Garden as one of their favorites. Once you open the menu, you can tell: from Sysco food trucks to your table. Not bad food, but in no "way fit for foodies".Bachelorette party location, high school dinner date option, or lunch with you coworkers - all appropriate here.

An excellent experience overall. Good food, outstanding service and fine atmosphere. While we desired to dine outdoors the 100 plus degree temperature would have made it a long time. I asked for a table at the window and we were positively accommodated. We look forward to our next meal at Cottonwood!
Always an enjoyable experience - without a doubt the best steakhouse in the Champions area.

My boyfriend and I have a tradition of going to Benihana together on our birthdays. The restaurant never disappoints. The food and service are excellent and Benihana is the perfect place for an intimate dinner with your loved ones. Also, I hadn't previously thought of it, but there was a group across from us with a 5 year old. Benihana is also the perfect place to take children; they offer a kids menu and the showmanship of the chef is sure to amaze!

This was our first visit to Buca, and after the experience we had, it will not be our last! Our server was very knowledgeable, friendly and checked on us frequently. Our food was delicious and brought out fast. This was a huge plus for us because we have a 9 month old and the fast service ensured we were able to enjoy our dinner. Thank you and you will definitely see us again!!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler
column13: Fleming's is the place for outstanding prime rib. Tender, moist, and flavorful execution. Ask about the Sunday prime rib special. Wonderfully attentive service as well.

column4: 3111 W. Chandler Boulevard Chandler Fashion Center Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: I have eaten here seval time and it is always hit and miss.. Tonight was a big miss, and I don't plan on going back anytime soon. We order sushi and it came to the table a hour after we arrived. A few minutes later the entree's were sent to the table. Water glasses were empty most of the meal. The sushi was good. The entree's ranged from great (steak flatbread) to awful (meatloaf).

This was our first time experience to Roy's and selected it via the Opentable website. What a great selection. Our servers were excellent, friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. They're "keepers". You'll be pampered!!!
Awesome as always. Have not had a bad dish yet.
Our favaorite Seattle restraurant!
Great food with a charming head chef. Service could have been better but really enjoyed the escargots and duck.
Great off-the-menu options for appetizers and entrees. Nice ambiance. Attentive wait staff. Fresh vegetables, especially the mushrooms!

column4: 15600 Northeast 8th Street Suite J-1 Bellevue, WA  98008
column13: I like the neighborhood feel of Crossroads Bar & Grill, located in Bellevue's Crossroad Mall. Our meals are always well prepared, and the service is done with a smile.

column4: 168 E Gore Creek Dr. Vail, CO  81657
column13: What a pleasant surprise to find a new sushi restaurant in Vail Village! The service was wonderful and the food excellent. They had not only the usual sushi fare but also some designer dishes that were wonderful! We will go back regularly!
Food was terrific and we had a great time. The sunset view was unbelievable!

column4: 34442 Street of the Green Lantern Dana Point, CA  92629
column13: Exceptional Food and Excellent Service!

column4: 737 Pearl St. Suite 110 La Jolla, CA  92037
column13: My family has a few Thai friends, one who often cooks us Thai food. So we know what good Thai curry and pad Thai are like. We thought this restaurant which has been around for over a year in La Jolla would have to be pretty decent to make it thus far. However It was very sub- par and truthfully there are so many great restaurants in this area. Don't waste your time on this one unless you don't want to go far and want a decent but not great meal.

Everything is fantastic about this place - the staff, the decor, the menu (both food and drinks). This was my third visit and it just keeps getting better. We love that they have a HUGE (for Rockridge) dog-friendly patio. The menu changes just enough to keep it exciting while maintaining some of the favorites. Bonus: sustainable meats and local produce whenever possible. I think you will discover it is very easy to fall in love with TOAST.

Service was great. Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable. Even though the very small restaurant was full, we never waited too long for the wait staff to come check on us. I would strongly suggest reservations. The place is small and does get a little noisy. The food was amazing. I will be going back.
Delicious as always. Chef Mav's new menu is his best yet!
Fantastic, as usual. Love the folksy nature of the dishes and the high quality of the ingredients.

1. Food was excellent. 2. However, we ordered two entrees and one was delivered almost 15 minutes after the first. Unsatisfactory. 3. Waiter kept calling me and my wife "guys!" We're old enough to be his parents, and I doubt that he calls his parents "guys." 4. Lighting too bright. Absolutely no ambience in this restaurant.
Nice neighborhood restaurant in a good location. Food is enjoyable but nothing remarkable. Waiter was attentive and well intentioned.
We have always had outstanding food at this wonderful restaurant. The wait staff is just as outstanding.
Outstanding dining experience. Ogden, Utah is extremely fortunate to have such five star restaurant. It seems like a top restaurant in NYC except the wait staff is friendlier!

Not a professional restaurant. Really should not be on open table. We had a group Of 12. This was for a business dinner.There is not ambiance. It is a store front with a bunch of metal tables and chairs.No decor, period.Wait staff nice, polite, but absolutely not trained nor professional. Food was fine, presentations poor. I Had aChicken in in wine sauce, that was poorly platedAnd the presentation, there wasn't presentation. It looked very bad on the plate. Bluntly, not a restaurant for folks looking to entertain customers.

Foodwise, it was a little hit or miss. The pasta was delicious, the melon soup was awful. The oysters were fresh, but several were in spawning stage. The chocolate dessert was delicious, but there was no summer fruit dessert (like cobbler, pie, etc.) and no sorbet in a place as hot as Sacramento. A little more attention to things like this would make this place outstanding and fit for foodies.

column4: 3717 E. Indian School Rd. Phoenix, AZ  85018
column13: Excellent experience however they seemed to be "out" of a fair amount of key items on the menu. After our server rattled of 4-5 items that we could not order, I chose the green chile pork stew...and was told after my order that they were out of Corn bread...a key component of their "Homestyle food". We dined at 7:30 on a Saturday. Not 9pm.

Nice oysters and martinis and very good crispy calamari. Beautiful yummy prime rib too. The only downfall of the meal was the Wild Boar Ribs dish which was awful! They were such a strong flavor and had a desicated texture indicating they had been frozen for a long, long time. Wild Boar can be so good this was a shocker.
been to many high end dinning restaurants this is by far and away the very best all other pale in comparison !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Excellent french country food with some California offerings as well.

column4: 7042 E. Indian School Rd. Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Always have good food & a pleasant experience at Eddie Matneys!

column4: 123 N Main Street Lake Elsinore, CA  92530
column13: Skyla was the most awesome waitress. Food was superior.
We love it there. Chef Henry has magnificent food choices. Everything is always prepared and displayed esquisitively.

upscale style, good ingredients, well prepared. We had two lite courses and shared one entree and shared one dessert. Ample for a sumptuous but not too too heavy dinner on a Thursday. The French fusion to Japanese has some odd aspects, tho not offending (just different) --- example: a classic richly creamy sauce served with a seared-near-sushi style tuna gave a "different" mix of an almost vanilla with the tuna. The textures, of course, work. Wine list fine --- proportionately higher priced than the menu. Dessert offerings satisfying but not supremely memorable, and properly priced --- special occasions call for preordering the Baked Alaska (a classic) or Souffle.

My wife loved going to the riverwalk, she was enamored with both our waiter and the chef as they both came over to meet us a couple of times and find out the reason for our visit and get to know just a little about us.
Would request a table in the main dining room . Noise level and ambiance are issues if seated in the secondary room.
Pappo has recently remodeled it's bar and menu. I think the old menu was better with more upscale choices. And even though the long old brick wall is attractive, it makes the room too noisy.
Some of the best seafood I have ever had!!! Great Chef!!!

The food was average. Nothing special. The restaurant was understaffed the night we had dinner, so service was slow. But the staff were really trying to pull it together and they did the best they could. They remained friendly and were working as fast as possible to service the customers (they had a big party in the back room, plus the diners in the front). The bartender was really great - tending bar, waiting tables, checking people out, etc. There is no ambiance in the restaurant. Very "cold" feeling. So, they need better food and more decorations, as the staff could really pull off a great restaurant if they had something great to serve.

column4: 40711 Murrieta Hot Springs Road Murrieta, CA  92563
column13: We always have a great meal here. It was very quiet as it was a Monday night but we had a full choice of bar and menu items. Our server was very attentive and made great suggestions when asked for his recommendations. Portions are always generous. The special shrimp/crab stuffed raviolis were delicious. Although located in a small mall off of Murieta Hot Springs Rd. the ambiance once inside is intimate and gracious. A nice place for a romantic dinner or appetizers and drinks at the bar.

what a wonderful restaurant. don't let the name make you think this is just a Mexican restaurant. Manuel's lives up to its name as far as creative cuisine. For example who would have thought of a blueberry basil mojito? I would highly recommend this restaurant.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: we ordered 2 pork chop dinners....both dry,overcooked and tasteless with no sauce. bread was so-so, appetizer of grilled asparagus was mediocre with dried up thin tiny spears. prices were in line with better restaurants but this was NOT one of them

column4: 2802 W. Colorado Ave Colorado Springs, CO  80904
column13: We appreciated the ambience of Paravicinis, but felt the food was a bit rich. Perhaps that was because of what we ordered, but providing more healthy options for Italian food would be great.

Menu heavily slanted toward "in" foods, like lamb tongue and lamb neck. Would have liked to see more fish and chicken with interesting finishes. Meals were flavorful, nicely presented, good sized portions. Menu is a la carte, so things like veggies and potatoes must be added. Moderate wine list, but nice choices. A small restaurant with pleasant but ordinary atomosphere.
It was a pleasant surprise as I just moved into the neighborhood. I feel confident, I will frequent this place.

The menu seemed a bit old-fashioned. As though the menu was designed in the 1980s and not updated since. I ate a lamb dish that just had too much stuff going on: bacon and too much sweet sauce. A simpler grilled lamb chop with a sauce on the side would have been better.

We walked in and the menu was about a 1/3 of the items as their menu on line was. The chef was not around and the waitress could not answer questions about what was available outside of a very tiny menu -- we actually walked out before ordering as it seemed like a disaster in the works

column4: 300 Fillmore Street Unit K Denver, CO  80206
