column13: Gluten free menu is nice, but waited 5 minutes for a host to seat us. Then the bar didn't have the ingredients for TWO different cocktails I ordered. Then I received my chicken parmesan and it was completely blackened. Very disappointing.

column1: Hapa Sushi Grill & Sake Bar - Cherry Creek
column13: A frequent visitor to Hapa. Best sushi in Cherry Creek.

Nice Staff. Fun Wine Selection. Food is not really interesting. Flat bread with little toppings isn't much different than (overpriced) thin crust pizza. Not sure about the wine vending machine. It's a fun idea just seemed out of place. Overall, Vinue Wine Bar seemed to be lacking in flavor and atmosphere.

column4: 322 N Spokane Falls Ct Spokane, WA  99201
column13: This was our first trip to Spokane and we definitely chose the right restaurant. It sits along the river and a beautiful park. The Spencer Steak (ribeye) was great and so was Elk Chop. Service was attentive but not intrusive. The 3 of us easily shared the bread pudding.

Dining at The Steak House reminded me of what a traditional steakhouse should be. Caesar salad, steak au poivre and steak Diane are prepared tableside. There is a classic pre-dinner drinks cart, a gorgeous dessert selection and courteous, professional servers. Small touches like an amuse bouche and palette cleansing sorbet between courses made this a special, wonderful dining experience.

column4: 44250 Town Center Way, Suite C1 Palm Desert, CA  92260
column13: Always a lovely place to spend the evening. The service is excellent, the French bistro fare authentic and unpretentious. Pierre is a delightful chef and host.

The monkfish and duck confit were both dry. Husband thought the salad of frisee and potatoes and bacon was very good. Creme brulee o.k., but not top notch. Service was good when we were among the few people in the restaurant. Once it picked up, service dropped off. Also, the tables are so tight together, I snagged my sweater badly on the corner of the zinc table when I slipped between them. Not very pleasant. I'm not a large person.
We celebrated our 42nd anniversary the 18th and everything was perfect!
Wait staff was outstanding...... rate them 10 of 10

column4: 129 East Fremont Street Golden Nugget Las Vegas, NV  89101
column13: I think the server forgot about us after we ordered appetizers. We were done eating the apps before we were asked for our meal order. This was lunchtime. Otherwise, everything was very good.
The ocean view coupled with pleasant ambiance and food makes this a favorite of mine. The Charthouses create this at all their locations.

column4: 106 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
column13: Not up to the Charts Hose in Alexandria or Annapolis

column1: Chart House Restaurant - Marina del Rey
column4: 13950 Panay Way Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: Having personalized menus reflecting our anniversary was a nice touch.
Been coming to Charthouse since we moved to Monterey ten years ago. One of our "go to" places for family special dinners and to show off our town to guests. Always a great time and food.

column4: 2801 Coast Highway, West Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: The Chart House has been an old standard for our family since we were kids. The ambiance of the Newport Beach location is still as classy and up-to-date. No dated feel to the nautical motif and exposed wood ceilings. We went to celebrate my Birthday and it is a great place for this. Not too noisy but not dead either.

Waiter served the men first every time water, menus, salads , entree and dessert. He was spending his time talking to other waiter or waitresses at the computer just a few feet from our table. Food was good but nothing outstanding. Not in any hurry to return.

We've come here many times, this most recent visit was our first with the new management - and what a pleasant surprise! The occasion was Bastille Day and they had a very nice prix fixe menu which had a really nice depth and variety to it. The food had definitely not suffered at all with the departure of the one of the principal partners a year or so ago - very happy about that! The wine was a bonus, as well, with our choice nicely rounding out the evening. Thank you Chou Chou just for being!

Decided to try this restraunt after many years. We had a nice table looking over the restraunt and some waterfront views. Our waitress was very nice, slow, but attentive. We apreciated the time between salads,the meals and desert (highlight). Our waters stayed empty most of the night, refilled once. The meal (primerib) was overcooked and very dry and the plate was not very well prepped. The other meal was a special, shrimp trio. The shrimp were overcooked and not well presented on the plane plate. Each plate could have had more items accompanying the meals.We were not pleasaed with the experience and we were ready to leave.
I've only been a couple times but both have left me pleased with the experience. The combination of the view, the food, and the service, are just amazing.

column4: 231 Yacht Club Way Redondo Beach, CA  90277
column13: Our service was good, I was on a special diet and was able to make substitutions to my entree. Both the server and the manager handled an issue with a meal immediately, without an issue. The location of the restaurant is beautiful, with windows faceing the ocean, just be careful with the time of day if facing the window, the sun can be blinding, bring your sunglasses. We saw dolphins in the ocean while dining. Disappointed to learn area hotel guest rank over other reservations for a window table. Local residents refer people to the restaurant as well and we rank 2nd, all window requests should be treated equal.
THe singing was wonderful. The food just ok. A very limited menu, although at reasonable price. Wish the food had been better and the evening would have been outstanding.

My experience at Sally's on the water was fantastic. I went there during Comic Con because the outstanding reviews that it had already received. The smoked scallop chowder was to die for and a great way to start the meal off and was not too heavy of an appetizer. From that I went on to the raw tuna with a seaweed and sesame seed side mixed with a vinaigrette dressing. For the main course I had the grilled seafood platter with a base of hash and side of asparagus. The fish was cooked to perfection. The desert that i had was the Trio de Gelato with the rose flavor being my favorite.I only had one issue with them. It was that the staff starting off was slow to get our orders and serve my group drinks. Thank you for the wonderful food!
Service was great. Food was good. Location - sits right across the street from the wharf. No view of the water.

Great food, super knowledgeable and super attentive staff, nice wine list at a moderate price with excellent pairing recommendations from waiter (and owner, who obviously cares about his guests' experience). A wonderfully therapeutic foodie escape evening; looking forward to my next chance to go here!
Noise level a bit too high for my liking, but the food and service were excellent. My third visit and I will definitely return.
Good brunch...ok cocktails...ok service. We should come try dinner.
great surprise on broadway....salmon with artichokes and tomatoes could not have been better....friend had scampi...also delicious with big shrimp. Huge salads....everything fresh and well presented

Service was fantastic - we had no problem changing our reservation and they held the table for us. While we were looking over the menu they brought over a complementary appetizer. Food was very good and they had some of the best Bloody Marys I've ever had.

It would take up to much space to describe the mess that is this restaurant, but in summary.Atmosphere: cartoons on the wall as you enter near the bar area, then trying to be more upscale and elegant at the tables. Pick a concept/direction and go with itService Staff: unknowledgeable, not very friendly, food stains on their attire, didn__t even know there was specials until we left the restaurant and saw them on the board, etc..Food: horrendous menu concept, presentation/plating of the food was bad and unprofessional, and the food itself was completely tasteless.

column1: Vida Loca Mexican Bar and Grill
column13: First time there...celebrating a birthday...it was a lot of fun and the food was very good.

column4: 260 South 1300 East Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: The meal was excellent and the location is great. On the outside it looks like a nice little cafe and on the inside it's like being in a ship. The only improvement would be the service slowed a bit towards the end of our meal and my husband waited a bit for his soda to be refilled (only at the end). Overall, I give it an A+ and I look forward to coming back soon.
Wonderful food service was excellent highly recommended

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - Dallas
column13: Dropped in on a Wednesday night after attending a release party for a Samsung cell phone. The manager greeted us and offered a free desert. However, the service was very slow, the server we had not very energetic or helpful and the jambalya was fair at best. I guess this venue is good for music, but falls short as a restaurant.

column4: 3645 W. Starr Pass Blvd. Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: Great atmosphere and excellent food, the best BBQ I've had in the city - It equals any BBQ I've eaten in my wife's home town of San Antonio, TX. It is also the most expensive BBQ I've ever eaten, $63 total for dinner and a drink each for two people, about double what I would expect from past experiences here and in San Antonio. I assume this is due to the restaurant's location in a swanky golf resort. I'll definitely go back for more, but, due to the price, it won't be a weekly visit

Outstanding service and the food is also superb! The Prime Rib is some of the best I've had- Sat at the bar for a bit and had a great time- Case, the Bartender , offered great service and conversation. Laurenzo's has become my Wife's and I new "spot"!
We celanrated my friends birthday! We chose the patio as it was a beautiful dayShe loved her Southwest salad and I enjoyed the lobster salad. Very peacefulAnd quiet so we could talk.
Our server, Ben, was especially good. Helpful with the menu. Friendly, but didn't interrupt the flow of our conversation. A seasoned professional. Try the gumbo. It was delicious.

This is one of my wife's favorite places, and we've never had a bad meal here. Portion sizes are generous, and relatively inexpensive. Ask for a booth if you want privacy and low light. Nice atmosphere.

Our server was knowledgable without being pretentious. The food was sophisticated using seasonal ingredients. We had a Parmesan encrusted goat cheese salad, lobster pot pie, tomato and mozarella pizza, and gruyere mashed potatoes. The last was a little bland. Desserts were phenominal and artistic. Wine list and scotch selection were adequate and reasonably priced. We were very pleased.
Food wasn't bad, but wasn't special either. Also took alot longer than we were expecting.

My husband, adult son and I were looking forward to returning to Christy's, having been more than happy with Christy Bono's previous restaurants. Unfortunately, it didn't quite live up to our expectations. Nothing specifically wrong with the decor...just not very exciting. The food was good, but not great. My heirloom tomato salad with buratta was very disappointing. It was smothered in balsamic vinegar and olive oil and was spread all over the plate; no definition. My Farfalle Pollo was good, but I wouldn't order it again. We all agreed it would get a "7" out of 10, and that was being generous. We were hoping for so much more...

This is turning into one of our favorites. A nice break from the very high end, glamoruous restuarants that all have a price tag to match. One example is our Tanq 10 martini's here are $11.75, at Talivera they are $18. Typcially they run around $15-$16 so I nice savings. Also, the setting is a comfortable retro ambiance set on a man-made lake with lots of windows. One of the best fish selections in the Valley with just about every preparation method available. We had grilled halibut and it was perfect! The servers are mediocre but not offensive.
This is our "special" place to go, anytime we're celebrating us and being in love this is where we go

column4: 1520 Lake Pointe Parkway #500 Sugar Land, TX  77478
column13: We love Churrascos, and this was our second time to the Sugar Land location. We came to celebrate a birthday. The waitstaff was exceptional, and the location and view were outstanding. This is a perfect spot for small groups, as well as large. Our group ordered fish and steaks, and everyone was delighted with their meals. Thank you for making this a special occasion for all.
Great food as always. We've been there many time but first time for Sunday buffet. It was great.
BEST THAI IN BOULDER!! EAT HERE!!
The food was excellent from the warm bread, to the green lipped mussels and the unique pizza options
Cibo's is conveniently located on Alvarado street. My husband and I tried it after an early movie at the Osio. The menu was interesting Italian and was good overall.
Excellent butternut squash pasta! Fun, well designed restaurant; always attentive service.

column4: 617 S. Olive St. Los Angeles, CA  90014
column13: For the price food should have been outstanding, it wasn't. Meal was average. Service outstanding, and the room is a throwback to a '30s time.

My new favorite! i have live here for 8 years an only recently went to this neighborhood restaurant and I am so pleased I finally tried it. The service is friendly and professional, the food maybe the best in North County and the prices are reasonable. I love the wood fire in the bar and the Pizza is wonderful. Try it, you won't be disappointed.
Elegant ambiance 27 floors above the desert. Great views. Outstanding food. The macaroni lobster side dish was superb! A perfect spot for that very special occasion!

column4: 702 Lindero Canyon Road # 704 Oak Park, CA  91377
column13: This is one of our new neighborhood gems. we look forward to many more opportunities to dine at Cigale Cafe alone and with friends.

We LOVE Cilantro's....Courtney called us to let us know the server we requested Jeanette was not going to be on for our 5:30 p.m. reservation..what amazing customer service. We of course waited for our favorite server...always a smile, great communication and knows what we like:~)

column4: 2350 E. Harmony Road Fort Collins, CO  80528
column13: The food was good, not excellent. it is a solid place to go

We will definitely come back. This was special occasion. My wife's birthday. It was perfect for our small group, Great, quick service. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The food was very good, but not exceptional. excellent portions. We had a lot of take home.The drinks were excellent. The views of Fisherman Warf's steet scene (and at the back tables) docked fishing boots was pleasant. Oh, I mentioned in the Open Table coments that this was my wife's birthday and after we ate the waiters brought an Ice cream sunday with a burning candle and sang Happy Birthday - she/we looved it!

Food was pretty delicious, smaller portions so don't expect to take anything home. Prices where a little high for what it was IMO. I'm not dying to go back, but may someday if need a new place to take a date. Though definitely not a first date.

column4: 1600 N Indian Canyon Dr Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Its my 3rd time dining here, the food is excellent but the service is questionable. We always wait about 10 minutes before anyone even comes by, then this time the waiter came by and offered water, and was doing his pitch for bottled water, and we said just regular, and he snuffed his face and said "TAP", we were kind of shocked. Like I said food is always excellent but I would suggest you take some of the staff from the SIDEBAR and bring them over to get the great level of service you would expect at this restaurant. Definitely have the mussels, and the roquefort crusted filet.
Not to much food on the menu to choose from but great view and atmosphere.
Brunch rules weren't very clear. Didn't realize you couldn't order off regular menu and brunch menu. Should have a lower price for seniors like the kids price.

column4: 150 East Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Great food all around.Shrimp appetizers were plentiful and filling. 1 order was enough for two.Tomato salad was also delicious.Kristi, our waitress, recommended the Snapper which was very good and complemented by the caramelized onion and whatever type of grain it was served over.The original bottle of wine I ordered was out of stock but she recommended an excellent replacement. Which we went out and bought a bottle for the house.Thank you Kristi for your excellent service and charming personality.Slight draw back was the extreme quietness of the restaurant. There was no low playing or mild mood music and I could hear nearby conversations. The clanking of people dining was also noticeable due how quiet it was.

column1: Citrus at Hotel Valencia Santana Row
column13: Great place for that special occasion. They have space outside to accommodate the larger group. Or if preferred, the more intimate indoor dining for privacy with that special someone on a special occasion. I was there with my wife to celebrate our 11th anniversary and service was attentive, knowledgeable, professional but friendly. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a dining experience with that significant someone.
Best steakhouse in the valley! Love this place!!ce
Filet was very good. NY strip.....not so much. Waiter had very little experience. Brought check to table without offering desert menu.

Mighta been the company or the perfect soft Summer evening in Austin, but Wednesday night at Paggi House was almost perfect. Helpful somalier confirmed my interest in an Anderson Valley pinot (off the full and interesting list); she had Caprese salad with perfect, fresh local tomatoes and a frozen pannacotta that they freeze and them melt onto it before they serve it -- fantastic. I had some sort of butter lettuce, pears, nuts, cheese and vanilla vinaigrette salad thing, and it was also excellent. We split the pork tenderloin with roasted peaches - very reasonable "split" fee and a perfect amount of food so we had room for desert. German chocolate tart with smoked caramel ice cream was the best part of the meal. Just outstanding.
We went for brunch. Very nice restaurant! Great service, and a very nice sunday brunch! We liked all the food items we tried, and thought it was a good value! We will definitly be back!!!
Food was outstanding and the staff was beyond outstsnding. Highly recomend the fish-n-chips and the french dip.

Everyone was so nice & courteous from our arrival to the minute we were walking out. The service was fast & courteous. The food was delicious. First time dining at this location but will definitely be back.
Short menu, but very thoughtful dishes. Friendly staff members. Cozy space.

column1: Clay Oven Indian Restaurant - West Portal
column4: 385 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: We have been to Clay Oven many times. However, this time there was no lamb dish which was a disappointment and several of the items were really overly hot" to the mouth. With this said, we will be back.

column1: Clay Oven Cuisine of India - San Mateo
column13: Was not impressed with this restaurant.The lunch buffet was not very interesting. It might have been better to just do alacarte menus, if the choice was going to be so sparse.my guest liked the food, but I think that's because he found a habanero in the salad that kicked it up a notch.I guess the food quality was ok, but not outstanding as an Indian restaurant in San Mateo.Atmosphere seemed a little boring too (until the car alarm started going off outside :( )
Food was excellent but it was a little more pricy than I expected. Entrees (we ordered) were in the $45 price range and everything else (salads, side dishes) was separately priced and around $8 each.

column4: 6380 S. Fiddlers Green Circle Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: The chic decore invites lively conversation. Excellent food, the halibut and JaegerschnItzel were perfectly prepared. We had no room for dessert, although the tray looked fabulous. This is a restaurant were you know, time and again the food and service are outstanding!

Everything was very good with the following exceptions:The roasted lamb was tough, andThe napkins are the worst I have experienced. They were like cheap dish towels that left my black slacks all covered with white polled pieces from my waist to my calfskin. After dinner and my complaint I was advised that they also have black cloth napkins; after the damage was done. In addition, I was told that their lint brush had been stolen.

column4: Waldorf AstoriaLaquinta Resort & Spa 49499 Eisenhower Drive La Quinta, CA  92253
column13: We had a very good dinner. The food was excellent. The service was excellent. The fish and chips was better than what we had at a restaurant specializing seafood. The french dip roast beef sandwich was also excellent. The chef gave us an flatbread appetizer that was so good that we would probably have ordered it if we had known. The lollipop ice-cream that they gave us complimentary was great. Definitely would go back if we are in the area again.

The service was awesome. She helped us get what we wanted on the menu to the point that we had to come back later in the week to have our favorites before we left. Favorites? The Clam Chowder and the Blackened Swordfish. Our waitress even gave us recommendations on what to do in walking distance and places to go around town.

column4: 10250 Santa Monica Blvd., Ste. 220 Los Angeles, CA  90067
column13: I went for taco tuesday and was pleasantly surprised. I haven't been to the L.A. location before because I didn't enjoy the food at the Vegas spot. So either the food's gotten better or my standards have fallen.... or perhaps, it was the insanely good cucumber margarita that swayed me. Whatever the reason, here's the price breakdown $5 for 2 good sized tacos or $3 for 1; CASH ONLY. The tortillas taste homemade and you can choose flour or corn (get the corn!!!). If Pink Taco reads this..... offer either a spicier hot sauce or jalapenos at the salsa bar!!! Upside to doing this besides making fire seekers happy, we'll drink more :)

column4: 845 Market Street - 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: Continues to be the best steak house in town. Jeff is the most amazing server!!!
Terrific!Loved the casual environment and music of Jess Petty.Will recommend to all my friends.

column4: 3400 West Olive Avenue (in The Pinnacle Building) Burbank, CA  91505
column13: We waited too long to order and steak was cold.

The service was excellent. The cuisine, I will be back! However, I would like to request a specialty offer, when the host approaches the table: "Our special tonight is Prime Rib." I am saddened that Prime Rib is no longer offered. The Prime Rib-eye was excellent, but we prefer the Prime Rib. The Lemon Souffle was greatly appreciated for the celebration, of our 9th anniversary. I loved the fresh cream with a hint of sugar sprinkles attached to the Souffle. And I truthfully, do not prefer desserts that are lemony, but your Souffle with the fresh cream: it was sinfully tastey! It was very good! I will recommend Morton's!
Although the food and service was good - it was way over-priced. Dinner for 2 was equal to a dinner for 4 the night before at Taste of Texas - and much better food at Taste of Texas.

The service was outstanding the waitstaff very courteous, knowledgeable and friendly. I would just make a suggestion that fresh cracked pepper be offered with the arrival of certain dishes, especially the salad course. We used the table pepper but it is simply not the same. We observed a pepper grinder at another table whose diners were having a Caesar salad course.

column4: 435 S. La Cienega Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90048
column13: Experience was OK, but not exceptional. Salads were oversized and not that wonderful. Of the two steaks ordered, one was overdone. One of us ordered a side of asparagus, which consisted of three woody stalks. The deserts were average. There are many better steakhouse choices in LA.

column4: 74-880 Country Club Drive Palm Desert, CA  92260
column13: Service was excellent. Sometimes almost to a fault
Food was good but not awesome. Convenient to Keller and they made a good effort to make sure we were on time for the play. Good wine list but super expensive.

column4: 300 E. Crockett Street Suite 283 San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Staff was exceptional. First class service.

Excellent steak as always; glad to see the mac and cheese back on the menu. Miss the special authentic NY cheesecake. We were celebrating a birthday so having a personalized birthday greeting printed on our menus was a very nice touch!
Morton's is one of our favorite Restaurants that we go to, we always get great service and exceptionally great food

Quality of food was excellent - however it seemed as the personel had to much to do - too busy which showed to some extent on the service provided. The waiters mixed the orders between us and had to change the plates a couple of times.We were there some 25 years ago and remembered that time that the meat were presented to you before it was cooked.
Start-to-finish, a wonderful dining experience. Dishes were beautiful, perfectly cooked and generously portioned. Service was seamless and decor impeccable.

column4: Forum Shops Caesars Palace 3500 Las Vegas Blvd. S. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: best restaurant at Cesear's Palace!
The best steak I have ever had. The black truffle butter is a great pair with the filet. Would definitely go back.

We were seated at a lovely table and served by a very attentive wait staff. Very friendly and knowledgeable and quite professional. Food was excellent. No corkage fees, so we brought our favourite wine. Gotta love that! A great night out!
Excellent service. Professional wait staff. Superior food cooked to perfection. We will be back.

My husband and I had such a wonderful dining experience. Never had been here before but we will be back often! The foods was amazing and our server was so nice and accommodating. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal. :)

Food not only tasted great, but we were impressed with the presentation--everything looked awesome with obvious attention to detail. Service was attentive and pleasant--we had a great experience at this restaurant and will absolutely be back!

We went to Texas Spice for dinner, on the 4th of July. This happened to be one of the few restaurants that was open that day. We tried the dinner buffet. The selections and food was good, nothing out of the ordinary. We ordered a couple of drinks and they turned out fine. The restaurant changes an automatic 18% gratuity on the buffet, even for parties with 2 adults and a 4 year old. For that level for gratuity the service is definitely lacking - it was slow and erroneous. We were initialy charged for our 4 year old, after bringing that to the attention of the waiter he took it off, but still somehow managed to keep the original gratuity amount on it. So, another round of corrections, before we could pay and be out of there.
I found the food to be outstanding for its limited selection. A great wine selection too. The wait service was good but could be more proactive.

column4: One Pico Blvd Santa Monica, CA  90405
column13: Great location; right on the beach. Food is OK but went at sunsetand a great place to spend a summer evening.

Great rolls and menu options, food was terrific. Fish was fresh and tasty. Service was a little cold but not bad. Tons of drink choices, lively scene. Loved the wood walls and outdoor vibe. I'd definitely go back when in the Seattle area.
The food was excellent though the menu for lunch is less extensive than it used to be.

column4: 835 Hyde Street Suite B San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: This was the last night before my daughter left for two months, so we decided to do dinner out. I checked open table to see what was available for 4 people at 7 and we ended up at Colombini. The menu was appealing and we had a great variety of dishes to choose from. Honestly, between the slow service and the sub-par entrees, I would only go back for the appetizers. Honestly, I could prepare better Italian food at home and saved on the corkage fee.

It was a first visit for all four of us. The waitress had several dinner recommendations and was very pleasant. I chose the Salmon with a lemon, butter, caper and olive sauce served over pasta. The food was good but not wonderful. At this price point and with the location's history, I expected more. What I didn't expect, though, for my co-diner's fixings for her baked potato to be served in small plastic cups, as well as the parmesan cheese. When I asked my friends how their food was the answer was, "I am not disappointed."
Overall, my food was bland. I had the salmon with rice and veggies, all very dry. The service was prompt and friendly though. Maybe I'll go again and try a different dish.

Fantastic meal and service. Brought guests from France and they both felt this was one of the best meals they have had in the USA. The Friday night jazz combo put the entire evening over the top. Definitely would recommend the crab cakes and the surf and turf.

Everything was great. I was hoping sitting outside would be a little less noisy but there were definitely moments when we couldn't hear each other speak (due to the traffic on the streets and the music). Other than that everything was GREAT!
It would be nice if they had a better choice of beers to go along with the large wine list.
Incredible food!! Everything was amazing.
wonderful food-wonderful service

We've ordered the famous crab combo which comes with a salad and tiramisu desert. The serving size of the salad was pretty good but the main entree was very small without any sides. Besides that, the garlic sauce was too salty and it practically covered up the taste of the crab. As for the desert, the tiramisu was very poorly made with very little cheese and I can dare say tasteless.

THIS WAS MY SECOND VISIT. THE FOOD WAS FABULOUS, INTERESTING, HIGHLY UNUSUAL. THE STAFF WAS VERY HELPFUL IN SUGGESTING AND EXPLAINING A NOVEL MENU. A VERY DIFFERENT DINING EXPERIENCE THAN IN THE INDIAN PLACES WE HAVE COME TO EXPECT. I'M GOING BACK AND I HAVE TO DRIVE ACROSS THE BAY TO DO IT.I GO TO THE MARSH THEATRE IN S.F. FAIRLY OFTEN AND IT IS ONLY ONE BLOCK AWAY - SO YOU CAN PARK ONCE FOR THEATRE AND DINNER AND THERE ARE AT LEAST TWO BIG PARKING LOTS VERY CLOSE.

column4: 1922 Oak Park Blvd Pleasant Hill, CA  94523
column13: We really enjoyed eating here. Very nice, varied menu. Quiet atmosphere, never felt rushed. Plan to go back and sample more of the menu over the next few months.

column4: 15323 N Scottsdale Rd suite E1-160 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: What a wonderful experience. Great food, great service, great drinks. Courses were well timed, staff was well informed, professional and very happy to serve. Our birthday celebration could not have been better. Thanks!
Service was very good, not rushed and the views are excellent.
I have eaten here numerous. Food and service are always lovely.
Unique and flavorful. Great experience

We had never eaten there before and were pleasantly surprised and plan to come back again. In our party of four, everyone thought their food was fantastic. It took our waiter a bit to get to us but he was very friendly and we were shocked at how fast the food came out- maybe that's why the waiter does not come to the table right away. The older blonde hostess that sat us was not very friendly and did not seem to enjoy her job- she was the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of five. If you get a friendly cheerful front host/hostess you will completely rock!
Great service, good food. The restaurant is a bit small and it's easy to hear people's conversations. I overheard a Klansman talking negative towards Mexicans. Otherwise, the staff were great!

column4: 1420 E. Southlake Blvd Suite 168 Southlake, TX  76092
column13: Very broad menu. Good sushi. Overall a great experience.

Came from out of town & made reservation early in the week. Not happy with table given, and so we accommodated with patio table. But it was in the brick corner & HOT. Moved ourselves over, and it was way cooler. Our server Shawn was wonderful. Will be back!
We brought visitors from the midwest, and they thoroughly enjoyed themselves. Good wine, excellent food, responsive service, and a magnificent day to be outside with a lovely view.
Food was wonderful. The clam juice was great and it has a nice atmosphere as it has been there from 1800's. Would go back anytime I am in San Fran! Very close to airport.

column4: 55 North La Cienega Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90211
column13: amazing restaurant will go again
The Food and Service were both Excellent!
I enjoyed dining at the Tree Haus Bistro. I plan on dining there again. Excellent service and food.

column4: 7870 W Tropical Pkwy Las Vegas, NV  89149-4568
column13: When a restaurant is packed and the service level exceeds expectation, you know you've found a great place... the food was delicious, of course!
I've been there before and the food was excellent. On July 4th, the food selection wasn't as good as a regular day's luncheon.

column4: Waldorf Astoria Laquinta Resort & Spa 56150 PGA Blvd La Quinta, CA  92253
column13: This is the Club House Restaurant for the PGA West Stadium Course. Outstanding view of the Nicklaus Course. Great staff. Learned on this weekend trip that Ernie's has a Bloody Mary Buffet Set up on the Weekend. All of the wide spectrum of ingredients are out for you to blend your own Bloody Mary. The food is alway fresh and innovative. I have never been disappointed dining here!
They didn't show my reservation. ONly until I pulled up my email from you were were seated

column1: Bistro Lancaster at The Lancaster Hotel
column13: Classic restaurant in the Houston theater district, part of a boutique hotel. Dining room reminds one of a small restaurant in London. We have been going there for many years in conjunction with Alley Theatre performances.

A hidden gem. Food was very good. Lobster tacos al pastor reminiscent of Mexico City. Risotto with speck smooth and yummy flavors. Tuna tartar and burrata appetizers both delicious. Only disappointment was the beignets. Heavy and a bit greasy.

We had dinner here on our wedding night...the patio is wonderful, looking out at the ocean. Service could have been a little more attentive. Food was very good. Overall, we enjoyed it but not my favorite restaurant on Kauai.

Our waiter/waitress never came to check on our table. I had to waive to a worker for refills on drinks. It was an overall horrible experience. I have always enjoyed Benihana so I was very disappointed when I left.

column4: 3500 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Was expecting great experience from ratings, but anything but. Servicer was 3 for 3 in getting courses incorrect. Food was pretty average. Coolest thing about experience was view of strip and ambiance. Solid joint but wouldn't "recommend" vs other like options on strip.
Excellent food but extremely expensive. The bill caught us off guard.

column4: 225 North Canon Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Great view, but kind of a lot for an average salad.

column4: Pier 3, The Embarcadero San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: I'm SO Glad I found this restaurant. Started out at the bar indoors with a creative cocktail. Sat at the outside tables for dinner. The food was clean and delicious. Some of our friends were not vegan like my boyfriend and I but they LOVED the food anyway, just as we did. And the desserts were mouth-watering...I had the Peach and blueberry tart with almond ice cream and my friend had the blueberry coconut cheesecake. I don't live in SF but my mouth has been watering for my wasabi plant burger since I left. I think we will be back this Saturday for my mom's birthday! : )
Singapore noodles did not have very much flavor at all
Delicious, authentic food and very good service.
We sat outside and the atmosphere was great. The food and drinks are overpriced and were not good.

Wonderful experience from top to bottom. The food and service was incredible. We were seated in the private wine cellar area which was encased with an iron gate and candles. Very romantic and secluded. By far the best dinner that we had while visiting San Diego. We can__t wait to return and Candelas will be number one on our list.

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: This is one of our favorite restaurants in the area. Always great atmosphere, great service and excellent food. You can't really go wrong with Della Terra.
Our favorite restaurant, over and over again.

Max's Le Zinc is a gem of his own creation. Fabulous French cuisine, an outstanding Bordeaux, incredible desserts, and lots of choices, all good. Took my 22 year old daughter with her sister and two friends and had an incredible dinner for five where everybody loved what they ate and drank. Marvelous! Bravo Max!
They don't have a huge menu, but they do everything very well. The pear ravioli is amazing, and the family size easily served 4, along with some flatbreads, we were stuffed and had leftovers.
The food was over priced for what you got--we waited 15 minutes before we got water or anyone came to our table and the noise level was too much--for the cost I would definately go else where
Really enjoyed the entire meal and experience. The wine list has some gems at a reasonable (not excessive) markup.

Everything about our dinner at Tango was great. We had eaten there once before when they first opened and things were even better this time. They are very accomodating, the wait staff was knowlegable and they gave us a booth as we had requested. Even when almost every table was occupied, it wasn't noisy.

I was out in Boulder doing a campus visit with my son. We like all types of ethnic food and Mediterranean is one of our favorites. We had fun sitting outside in a nicely appointed courtyard. The noise level was less outside than inside and it was a beautiful night to eat outside. Our food was fabulous and the service was friendly and efficient. I will definitely be back to this restaurant. Kudos to the chef !!!!!
Definitely a wonderful restaurant. Go there for the beautiful views of Dallas.
The best meal we had in Napa! Great food, great service, and much more affordable than anywhere else we ate.

We had a large group with last minute changes and Dana and her staff was extremely helpful and flexible. We had a wonderful time and the people in our party were extremely pleased and impressed with the venue and food!
Excellent paella! Great sangria. Most tapas were well prepared but flavor profiles were a bit simplistic.

My wife and I have dined at Coohills many times. Many of favorites (pizza, sliders, spinach etc.) are included on the bar menu, but the main dining menu is also very good. We wish Coq au Vin was on the main menu all the time. An exceptional list of wines are offered. Service is outstanding, especially Jamie at the bar.
Good food but not good enough for that price...

Copperleaf proved, once again to be a pleasure. We dined outside and were lucky to have a Jazz group playing (Apparently, Cederbrook has a Jazz series during the summer - could be a plus when arranging dinner). As with many good restuarant's Copperleaf focuses on locally sourced and sustainable purveyors. My porcini and fig appetizer was simply fantastic. The lamb was good, however it lacked adequate seasoning and was overcooked (medium vs. medium rare). My wife had the vegetarian main - beautifully presented, good flavors - another excellent dish. We will return again, this place continues to improve and impress; just need to season a bit better and get the meat temperature to order.

Mother's Day Brunch our 2nd year in a row! Food absolutely wonderful, we all had a different crepe, all very tasty. We sat outside last year, weather great. Cool and rainy this year, so sat inside where it is very 'cosy' and 'noisy' but still enjoyed our day. Staff very accommadating and pleasant!
I am a regular customer at a variety of Brigantine Restaurants in the San Diego area. I have always liked the variety of choices, the good food, and the great service.

Excellent food, great service, good outdoor dining - especially with the heaters. The owner walked around and checked on folks -- he had a sincere interest in his diner's positive experience. It was a very pleasant evening. We will be back when we are in that area.

An odd experience. Gorgeous location, yet the way the servers behave, you'd think you were in a roadhouse. Carts full of dishes rattling so loudly you had to pause your conversation til they passed by, wheeled right down the middle of the dining room. A waitress admiring my friend's dress actually reached down and stroked the fabric! Most unsettling of all, my waitress picked up the wine menu before we had opened it, and started to take it away. Confused, I asked her to leave it for us, and she said "Well, this is the Reserve list, $50 and up only." !!!! I was flaggergasted. As if it were somehow unthinkable to her that we might order a nice bottle of wine?! (which we did btw). Bizarre. Food was decent but not good enough to come back here.

column1: Market Cafe at Loews Coronado Bay Resort
column4: 4000 Loews Coronado Bay Road Coronado, CA  92118
column13: I was dissappointed upon arrival to see such an informal atmosphere and even more dissappointed when I saw the menu. We expected a steak house as I have read in the profile of the hotel's website, that this cafe transformed into a steak house at dinner time, it was still a cafe with only steak burgers in the menu, but no real steaks. Well, we were already there after driving a bit so, we decided to stay. The chicken achiote that I ordered, had more the taste of a saffron chicken rather than achiote. Being a pretty decent gourmet cook myself, I was greatly dissappointed to the Father's Day celebration I planned for my husband.
Truly the gem of Telluride; Everything is always delicious and the specials are a real bonus. The calamari appetizer in curry with shishido peppers was heavenly!

column4: 14439 NW Military Highway Suite 100 San Antonio, TX  78231
column13: As usual, food and service were wonderful. I had the lamb chops - so delicious! One of my dining partners had the stuffed chicken and she was very happy with her entree. Will definitely be back!

Rack of Lamb is so tender and yummy as well as Chilean Sea Bass!We really enjoyed the cuisine at Mastro's and also celebratedmy mom's birthday here. The chocolate cake with the whippedcream are a great match!

column4: 3333 Bristol Street, Suite 2802 Costa Mesa, CA  92626
column13: Service was quick and attentive and the food was delicious. It's surprising that everything was under 475 calories! I especially liked the mini indulgences; they were a perfect end to an enjoyable meal. The ambiance of the restaurant was also classy and great for a romantic date night. I will keep this place in mind if I ever want a restaurant for a special occasion.

We were celebrating my son's engagement and we could not have asked for more perfect service or food. When we got to our table (a nice quiet booth), it was decorated with confetti hearts and there was a note of congratulations for my son and his fiancee. Then, while we were looking at the menu, they brought us 4 flutes of champagne for a toast! The service and food were incomparable and our server was extremely helpful, suggesting several items when we had questions. We were never rushed or hurried and our meal lasted over 3 hours - it was a wonderful evening. At the conclusion of the meal, they brought us a piece of flourless chocolate cake to share. All of these little extras make this a VERY SPECIAL place to celebrate a special event.

column4: Jackson Hole Mountain Resort Teton Village, WY  83925
column13: We had the four course dinner with wine pairings. Service was the outstanding memory and our waiter was very knowledgable about the wines he poured. Yes the view was wonderful, but once the sun has set, there are not enough lights on the mountain and valley to make it spectacular. The interior lighting is too bright and the huge windows become mostly black mirrors. The interior design is on the cheap side of the spectrum. What you go there for is the view.
Be like a ghost and disappear from this location - overpriced old food and trying to be something they are not - they have great drinks and bar service - look for food elsewhere

An overall enjoyable experience. We were seated promptly upon arrival time of our reservation and service was prompt and pleasant. Food was good quality. Would definitely eat there again the next time I visit San Francisco.

column4: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines Rd. Cedar Creek, TX  78612
column13: The meal, the atmosphere and the service were worth every penny of it.

column4: 2800 West Coast Highway Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: With the remodel this isn't the quiet place it was. Our group left when the music started. The open patio allowed the cigarette smoke to come into the restaurant and wasn't pleasant for dinners. Food and.service were great as usual, but our group will do take out from now on. Too bad.

I have used open table for years and years particularly for business meals when traveling. This is the first time I have felt the need to respond to a "rate your experience" request.I have recently begun to use open table to search for local places and have never had a bad result, until now. When I use open table I feel assured the place will have a level of overall quality. This place was horrible. I'm puzzled as to how a restaurant like this could score a spot on open table. What has happened to your criteria? The place was very grungy looking. The service was horrible and the food was worse! Now I don't feel as confident when using your website to choose a restaurant. Please, take this place OFF your website.
Great food & excellent service!Open Table Ap is great!

The food and margeriritas was great and our waitress was awesome!The largest complaint I have is that they did not check me in on Ooen Table to receive my points. I then received an email from Open Table saying I was not checked in, but if it was a mistake to let the know. I explained that I have never missed a reservation and what was ordered and my points were update very quickly.The second largest complaint was regarding their valet service. Valet is $3.75 do we give them a $5 when we were ready leave which it then took 10-15 minutes to get the car at which point the guy was asking us to pay valet again!

Both the appetizers and wine were wonderful... We had the calamari and the stuffed peppers. The entrees however were a huge disappointment .My husband had the veal parm... The veal was terribly tough and covered with a flavorless tomato sauce. My choice was the mushroom "pillows". I am a huge fan of mushroom ravioli and thought it would be similar...it wasn't and was an overall unpleasant dish. Our wait staff... two terrific ladies, we're attentive and most pleasant. We should have complained about the entrees but we didn't, mainly because of their exceptional service!!!

I went there to celebrate a birthday with friends...our experience was great! We had great service, an amazing view of the sea caves and La Jolla Cove, and great food! Our waiter went out of his way to fill our specific request...and our champagne was kept filled before we even noticed it was low (we went for the champagne brunch) And the seafood was outstanding- the crab especially was sweet and good! Thank you Crab Catcher for a great day with friends!
Amazing food a bit pricey but well worth it!!! Food was delicious and the experience was so fun I really enjoyed myself!!!!
We enjoyed a wonderful meal as usual!

We have always liked Crappitos,however after bringing two couples there for dinner recently, we were very disappointed. We went on a Wednesday evening and even though we were one of just a few tables in the entire place, it took forever to get our food. My martini was made incorrectly and one of the dishes ordered was incorrect as well.The food was mediocre. Don't know if there was a different cook, but we were disappointed.
I love the relaxed feel of this place. Service is always well-timed and friendly! Recommend Peter Be's Brewpub...

What a marvelous time my wife and i had at this wonderful restaurant! The food was excellent, the wine was great and the service was very timely and friendly! This really made our special night (Anniversary) one to remember!

My husband and I were there to celebrate his 60th birthday and our 40th wedding anniversary. The service staff was great, food was excellent, and the manager came over to congratulate us. The perfect start for a special evening.

column4: 67 West 100 South Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: The best sushi we have had in a long time! Great atmosphere & service too! Great find!

column4: Mirage Hotel & Casino 3400 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: I went to dinner on a Saturday night with a friend. We were seated promptly but our waiter didn't come until we flagged down someone. He let us know he couldn't find our waiter but would take our order and give it to her once she was found. The manager came to our table to apologize and picked up our soups. Two different waiters tried to take my wine glass before I ordered any. The food was good but not worth sitting through the sub par service. I don't think I'll be going back.
Service was great, but steaks weren't cooked properly. Mine was too well done; my daughter's was not done enough
The food is consistently good. The atmosphere is upbeat and lively. The service is always attentive.

Excellent service and fantastic food makes for a great dining experience. The assortment of options is huge and both the pasta dish and risotto entrees were delicious. Specials every day increase the likelihood that you will find the perfect meal. wine list is also extensive. Desserts are mostly gelato creations but it is real gelato. Friday night (and I believe Saturday too) starting at 6:30 the restaurant has a great performing duo. Nice music and the singer has a very nice voice. they are soft and not intrusive. A great dinner was had by everyone in my party.

This was our first visit and we went for dinner for our Anniversary. It couldn't have been nicer. You are greeted immediately; the staff is friendly and so accomodating. Their cocktails of which we had several were really good! The bread is out of this world; fresh and hot out of the oven! We shared a the small house (Mista) salad and the portion for sharing was just perfect. The Lobster Raviolli was delicious! We are looking to going back in a couple of weeks when my in-laws are in town for a visit!

Very upscale menu and wine list, on the high side. Sadly they only serve Italian wines of which there were pages and pages from all sectors of Italy. There were a few in the $50 range, but most were from there into the hundred dollar range. Corkage charge of $30 would discourage people bringing their own modest price wines. Not being versed in Italian wines, it was difficult for me to select something I could afford, though the wine steward offered to help. Tables were crowded and the crowd being well energized, it was very difficult to hold a conversation. I would recommend this restaurant only to sophisticated diners who were not concerned with the noise.

column4: 72595 El Paseo Ave Palm Desert, CA  92260
column13: Mushroom soup continues to be awesome. Good food great service.
This dining experence at the hands of KCC students was most enjoyable. The food gourmet; the view incomparable; and the wait help cheerful and helpful. Best kept "secret" in Kahala.
The service was good and entertaining. Food was very good. Justr a little pricey.
Awesome as usual.... Lamb sandwich A+

Maitre'd Marty worked as our server as normal wait staff had several large parties while we were there. Marty's service was attentive and his suggestions from the dessert menu at the end of the meal were delicious.

column4: 6541 E Tanque Verde Rd Suite 7 Tucson, AZ  85715
column13: Dakota Cafe is always upbeat, fun and delicious. Try them for lunch, for happy hour or for dinner. And don't forget they are Tucson's #1 caterer!
We returned after last week because we wanted to try the lunch buffet. Great value for $9.99. One of our favorite restaurants.
I was not happy with my experience there. I wanted to see the cook put on a show and have fun. We were rushed through the presentation and dinner. Not a fun time.

column4: 4023 Oak Lawn Ave Suite 110 Suite 11o Dallas, TX  75219
column13: Great food and exceptional service
The food was tender and flavorful, the ambiance good. What happened to the shrimp sauce, though? That was ALWAYS my favorite!

column4: 8687 North Central Expressway North Park Center Dallas, TX  75225
column13: As always, an excellent meal, with attentive staff and great food.

column4: Hotel Crescent Court, 400 Crescent Court Dallas, TX  75201
column13: Service is top notch and the food is awesome!
Had a great time. I had been to the Perry's in Austin and wanted to take my mother and sister there for the Pork Chop. We all loved it!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - North Dallas
column13: Ruth's Chris' Steakhouse is still the best steak in Dallas.
Wonderful food and service as always.
Food was good- service was bad.
We had a great experience at Buca. The service was great, the food was excellent, and we are looking forward to returning very soon.

column1: The Grill on the Alley - Dallas
column13: Overall, it was a pretty good place and a good meal. I would say, though, for the price, there are probably better options. They had quite an extensive wine list. The food was above average to good and the service was exceptional; there were only a few tables taken on a Friday night at 8 pm. Sadly, the one behind us was and they were the loudest in the restaurant and, honestly, they were out of place. When you're paying a premium for a dining experience, you expect everything to be perfect: scale of 1 to 10...7
I almost drove by it, because I was traveling out of town. All of the staff were very friendly & the food was delicious ! I will definetely recommend it to anyone.
Red Sauce was not as good as I remember it in the past.

Our second time at DaMarco - creatures of habit that we are, our wine selection and entree were the same as previous, except the Steak Florentine for two had been elevated to an even higher grade cut of beef. Exceptional, but that uplift in the cut of meat raised the price of an already pricey dish by over 50%. It was worth it, but we'll definitely be students of the remainder of the menu next time.

Not good! 1st, if you order a glass of wine, it cost $8, BUT IT IS 1/2 A GASS OF WINE. seriously 1/2 glass. 4 sips and your glass is empty. Even the waiters agreed it was small, but it is not hr call. The food, well, for a turkey dinner, NOT, it was processed meat. not good. they may be ok for lunch.
Our European guest provided the best compliment about Damian's...she said it made her feel like she was back home. Wonderful food, great wine and a nice quiet atmosphere!

column4: Hilton Santa Clara 4949 Great America Parkway Santa Clara, CA  95054
column13: Server was not knowlegable about the dish I ordered from the regular menu.Ahi was bad with soggy vegetables.

column1: Firefly Tapas Kitchen & Bar West Sahara
column4: 9560 W Sahara Ave Las Vegas, NV  89117
column13: We come here every time we are in Vegas. If you love Tapas, you will have a lot of fun with the variety of choices. The Sangria is tasty as well. Vibrant atmosphere and we have always had great service.

When we arrived, our table was ready even though we were early. However, the wait person did not ask for our drink order for 15 minutes - we had hoped to get happy hour prices. When we inquired about happy hour, we were told that it was over even though we had been sitting there for 15 minutes.There were lots of young kids which is great if you want a place that is kid friendly. It happens that we did not. We left the restaurant without ordering.
Loved this new little gem in wash park

This place exceeded all expectations. The food is outstanding. Every dish is executed superbly, and usually with some manner of unusual twist that makes it all the more special. Just feet away from the Presidio on a quiet side street. Pet friendly -- they let us sit outside with our dog.

Finding a good restaurant not affliated with the "Las Vegas Strip" is wonderful. It was such a pleasure to dine at Giada's. Warm friendly servers an attentive owner and a great meal all added up to a very nice experience. We will return.

column4: 7554 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90046
column13: A lovely place to meet a good friend for conversation or even a good spot for a first date. The owners have curated a very good wine list and are very helpful and knowledgeable, and the menu of smallish bites is consistently fresh and delicious.
I have never been disappointed here. Great cuts, great wine, great views, great service. It is the steakhouse to beat in the area.

Six of us went for my 90 yr. Old father's anniversary. The table had a great view of the water and boats, and then they brought a complimentary dessert to the anniversary couple. Service was outstanding, and our waiter kept us laughing. It's expensive, though.
A favorite haunt with my dad. The best steaks in Seattle.

It was my daughter's birthday and she loves India Food and wanted to try Taj Mahal. We loved it. Homestyle cooking from scratch and a beautiful husband and wife team. The service was amazing and the food was exceptional. There was four of us and we tried a variety of dishes and all were great. And they catered to our request for a dairy free experience.
Went with a friend for a quiet, nice dinner. That's what we had. The food was very good.

Our service was very slow and our server forgot to bring drinks and the bill.The outdoor setting was lovely until they turned on very bright, annoying lights and the mesquitos can out. Might go back for lunch, but never dinner.
THIS IS MY SECOND TIME AT FORBES MILL/DANVILLE. BOTH TIMES HAVE BEEN OUTSTANDING AND WILL BE BACK VERY SOON

I chose this place based on various reviews. I would never go back. We had a very nice seat and a great waiter, but that was the highlight of the evening. The food was just plain. We started out with steamed mussels and claims in a light sauce. The mussels tasted old and the broth was not worth dipping your bread in. We next had the fried calamari. It had no flavor until I added some salt and pepper to it. The red sauce for dipping was beyond bad--it had no flavor. After those two strike outs, we skipped an entree. This palce was packed, but I would never go back when there are so many great restaurnats in the North Beach area.

This is a top-notch restaurant. Food is excellent. Service is great. It's a small restaurant so tables are very close together...if you're looking for a quiet, intimate dinner this probably isn't the restaurant for you. If you want something lively then this is your place!

column4: 200 N. Seguin Ave. New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: Excellent find! The lamb was the best I've ever had. The food was as good as any upscale restaurant in New Braunfles if not better.
The bar food is excellent! Try the pulled pork and Angus beef sliders!
Overall a nice experience.Personally, we would have liked to have some more choices of cheese fondue - on the more spicey end.
Excellent food and service as usual. The salmon special was great!

column4: 9800 Hyatt Resort Drive San Antonio, TX  78251
column13: Great food and the hotel is a beautiful place to walk off that great meal!

We were looking for a spot to unwind from a busy week at work. We had heard about Hyatt's renovation and the new Shor Restaurant. The Shor was a perfect choice! We enjoyed the Sunset Dinner Special on the terrace with views of Waikiki Beach. The umbrella was lighted as the sun set and the torch lights were flickering as the gentle tradewinds danced around our table. It was so-o-o relaxing!. The chef came around to ask us how we enjoyed our dinner and chatted for awhile. Dinner, of course, was delicious! From the appetizer to the steaks to the dessert...perfection! Our server, Brad, was Johnny on the spot, catering to our every wish. The only annoyance was the regular arrivals of the bell ringing trolley on Kalakaua. But we'll be back!!!

This is a true gem located in the Marriott Camelback Inn. Great food, the enchilada's and carnita's are awesome. Patron hand shaken marg's and ice cold beers. I live in the valley and this is one of my favorites! Highly recommended!

column4: 10830 West Pico Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90064
column13: Still a great lunch spot. Not sure why they changed it to table service.and hosts. It has been half empty on every visit since.then. awas always packed before.the change. Sad part is I don't think the prices are much if any higher, but I'm sure the old clientel perceives it as less of a value.
Fantastic breakfast, we went multiple times during our recent trip to the area. Food is amazing.

Food was great, the waiter was nice. A little noisy with the garage beeping every so often. Towards the end of the night the waiter seemed really busy because of all the ppl coming in, but otherwise I liked it and would come back.
Thanks for another fabulous Brunch this past Sunday.......great food, service and DJ spinning some cool music!
Great meal. Very helpful service. Interesting menu options.

column4: 615 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA  90036
column13: Great, great food and a fun little place to dine. Everyone is very friendly and nice. The food is fresh and interesting and the bread is warm and delicious - a find!!!
We celebrated Father's Day at 10 Below and enjoyed our meal.
Great place overall food service, will be coming back soon
Need to change the menu. We eat here often and getting tired of it...but that said, it is still a good place to eat. Staff is always nice.
The atmosphere is to die for and the food is hearty and comforting. Staff is outstanding. Friendly and professional
Food was good. Waitress was new, needs a litle more supervision.

column4: 16270 E. Arapahoe Rd. Unit 202 Foxfield, CO  80016
column13: For whatever reason, it seemed as if food was rushed out. Appetizer not all that hot and burgers were both undercooked. We were in a hurry and did not make anyone aware. Both of our stomachs were a little queasy later in the day.
Beautiful view on a warm clear day made up for slowish food delivery.
Great lunch. Quiet and great food.

column4: 255 E Flamingo Rd Las Vegas, NV  89169
column13: I have been eating here for years. The food is better than ever.

column4: 20753 N. Pima Road Bldg. R Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: I was very impressed with Flemings associates hospitality.

column4: 3900 Las Vegas Blvd South Luxor Hotel & Casino Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Average. Expect more at $100+ per person

Service was very slow; not just our table. Could have been the kitchen. Menu was very good. Loved the watercress salad. The scalpel dish was over-salted; over-heard next table remark on this as well. Still, I'd be willing to go back.

column4: 0057 Edwards Access Road PO Box 1254 Edwards, CO  81632
column13: Food was real fresh... I probably wouldn't go there for a hot date, but good fresh food?... ABSOLUTELY

column4: 3020 N. St. Helena Hwy Suite A Saint Helena, CA  94574
column13: Stopped for lunch in between visiting vineyards. Quick service. Nice variety of food choices. Fine beer selection

I ordered the swordfish and I thought it was dry with seasonings I didn't care for. I had my husband taste it and we called the waitress over. She took the plate to the chef and came back and told us that they were removing it from the menu because it smelled strong. They didn't charge us for the meal. Overall it was a good experience and we would go back there again.My husband had the salmon and it was very good!

Living just across the street from this restaurant is a very convienent way to get a light dinner prepared with excellence. Tonight was a bit different with a wedding party invading the bar after their dinner in a private room. QA nice quiet meal with excellent live music deraded into an uncomfortable ordeal. Some of the group actually apologized to me, but the majority of the partiers were young and disrespectful idiots trying to out talk each other which raised the vloume level to unbearable.

column1: De La Tierra at El Monte Sagrado Resort
column13: We were guests at the resort and decided to dine here on our first night since it was easy. Overall the food was good. Be aware that the portion sizes are more than adequate, even for the small plates. I had elk that was outstanding -- probably the best I've ever had. We had appetizers that were nice and my wife's entree was good too. On the negative side, the entrees were brought out before we had finished our appetizers. The wine we ordered was not at the right temperature - they did warn us of this to be fair and attempted to chill it, but that took awhile. I think any wine offered should be available at the proper temperature. The service was friendly. Overall, no big complaints and quality food, just not great from a service view.

column1: 1500 OCEAN at the Hotel Del Coronado
column13: Awesome dinner just a few hundred yards from the coast. The wait-staff was excellent. The food likewise. We had two varieties of fish (Bass and Grouper). The waiter described everything in detail, answered questions, polite, the whole nine-yards. But not stuffy and overdone either. Just right.

column1: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House - Dallas
column13: Too noisy. Televisions all over dining room, not great setting. Piano player or canned music at same time

column1: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Denver
column4: 8100 E. Orchard Rd Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: Fabulous!!!Dinner service was superb!Caring staffHighly recommendWill be back again & again!!

column1: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Ft. Worth
column13: I ordered a strip, medium rare. When it came, it was medium well, but it still tasted good. I mentioned to the waitress that is was overdone, and at first I thought I got the standard brush-off you often get when this happens, so I proceeded to eat.

column1: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House - Houston
column13: everything was wonderful. food was great and we had a very attentive waiter

column4: 6106 Paseo Delicias Rancho Santa Fe, CA  92067
column13: Delicias has up'd its game. Paul McCabe has done wonders to this well-known restaurant. The food was innovative and delicious. The concept with small, medium and larger plates let my girlfriends and I share a very social meal - exactly what we wanted. The room has been updated and has a touch of modern thrown in. I wish they would've done a little more, only because Paul's food and effervescent personality deserves it. I'll be back.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Del Mar
column4: 11582 El Camino Real San Diego, CA  92130
column13: You can always depend on friendly service, consistently high quality, well prepared food. A hit with locals and visitors alike.

Our server Juan was fantastic. The seafood cannelloni appetizer is to die for if you like a vodka cream sauce. I used the bread to eat the excess sauce. The Cesar salad is excellent and they make fresh Cesar salad dressing at table side. My son who does not like anchovies in his Cesar Salad but really enjoyed this Salad. He was surprised how good it was with it (they use a paste that enhanced the flavors). The veal Milanese is huge so bring a big appetite. I do not drink coffee black but I did, It is with the four different liquors, spices and various zest used this after dinner coffee was excellent; so if you want something out of the ordinary, you should order the cafe diablo. Also the preparation is table side is a spectacle in its self

This has become my favorite restaurant in Dallas. Grandma Minnie's fried chicken is excellent. The starters continue to get better (new favorite is the pimento cheese). Even the bread basket is a delight. I bring everyone here when I have friends come into town.
First time diners; the food delicious, surroundings quiet and even intimate on Mother's Day, and service was top notch. We'll be back often.
A unique venue to entertain business clients. The restaurant helps create a memorable experience that clients will talk about well into the future.

column4: 500 16th Street,  16th St. Mall Promenade Denver, CO  80202
column13: Love the Fried Zuchinni. Had Shrimp and Chicken Pasta also very good.
I love benihana, it's fun, the food is great, and the birthday certificate is fabulous.
Good food as always. The service was a little lacking. Waitress forgot extra salad dressing as requested and then disappeared for about 20 mins.

Being from out of town, we had no idea what to expect, and were pleasantly surprised to find a lovely deck, nice decor and knowledgeable staff. But the food was what really stood out. The best steak I've had in a long time. And the staff knew their wines. The waiter was a bit harried and took too long bringing the drinks, but otherwise fine.

column4: 3000 E. First Avenue Cherry Creek Mall Denver, CO  80206
column13: I really like Kona Grill. The lunch special is a good bargain and provides a good helping of food that is very healthy. The main restaurant is rather dark, so I'd recommend the outdoor patio as long as the weather is good. We had an excellent waiter, very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.
excellent halibut and spinach ravioli. you've got it down
Service and Food were both GREAT!
We celebrated our 49th wedding anniversary with friends and had the chef prepare a special 5-course meal. Everything was fantastic.

column4: 8000 East Belleview Ave #C-10 Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: Great food and service as always.
always a pleasure. visitors never tire of the physical building and the experience within.

column4: 8000 East Belleview Avenue Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: Waiter was really busy, just a tad slow, but otherwise it was a great lunch - thanks!

column4: 241 North Main St. Cedar City, UT  84720
column13: My salad suffered from an overkill of too much cheese. I didn't think veggies could be cooked to taste pleasantly different, I was right. The chicken was great, the bread was great and my drink, for UTAH was very good. Three other members of the party were very pleased with their meals.
waiter is a gem very friendly and great personally. we always ask for him when we dine there.
Food and service is always outstanding . . . a hidden gem, if you can get beyond the hotel atmosphere.

I was in Phoenix on business and this is exactly the kind of place I like to seek out when I travel. The space is modern with clean lines and generally dark colors, but not over the top. Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive and didn't try to steer us in any particular direction on food choices. My friend and I shared several small plates and absolutely everything was perfectly prepared without being over the top. The pork belly sopes were a particular favorite of mine, but kudos to the kitchen on prepping perfect roasted asparagus-- harder than it sounds. The bar didn't disappoint either, with nicely prepared, well-balanced cocktails. Mixology is fashionable again, thankfully, and this bar knows how to do it right.
We were very pleased overall. Great desserts!

column4: 78-085 Avenida La fonda La Quinta, CA  92253
column13: Sam, the GM, took the time for a personal touch to our Anniversary. Desert Sage was recommended by friends in the area and it did not disappoint.

column4: 101 Henry Adams Street San Francisco, CA  94107
column13: amazingly open atrium space great for parties and special events!david mirabelli really has it going on at this perry's location making it a perfect place for large groups/events in the design center/newbie dot com area with zynga/advent and adobe software, sf's mini silicon valley!

column4: 209 E. Pleasant Run Road Desoto, TX  75115
column13: Loved loved the chicken and waffles with collard greens!! The best chicken EVER!

column4: 302 South Market St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: My reservation was made on the 20th, intended for the 21st. In the face of a busy night, the management accomodated us immediately. The service was fast and the food excellent.

column1: Del Frisco's Grille - McKinney Ave - Dallas
column13: Food and service were excellent. Noise level was over the top - difficult to carry on a conversations. Also, the restaurant temperature was too hot. Some in our party were actually sweating. Need to crank up the air conditioner.
This place knows it's business. Service, food quality, atmospere could not have been better.

column4: 13813 Fiji Way Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: The overall experience was great! The staff was very attentive to my wife's birthday, treated her special with songs and candles in the desert. We ate outdoors in the patio area for the atmosphere. While the sun was still up they provided umbrellas over the tables and after sunset, set up heaters and firepits to ward off the evening chill. Be prepared to defend your food from marauding seagulls if you choose eat outside as we had. There was one that was particularly bold.
The reception person was not welcoming at all---Felt like he wasnt happy with his job. When I asked him a basic seating question, he was curt. Very curt. Wrong attitude in the service industry.
a very well runned restaurant with the owner, david, on top of everything. good food and wonderful service. would not hesitate to return.

column4: 395 Santa Monica Place #306N Santa Monica, CA  90401
column13: Went there for Dine LA and will definitely go back.
As always, everything was excellent!! Have never had a bad experience in the 20+ years we've gone there!

column4: Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino 3770 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Worst service EVER! I don't think I've had such a distant wistress. For example when we asked for water and we finally got it, it was set to the far edge of the table, it was almost wierd. I ordered a strawberry margarita and it had zero alcohol in it and I sure don't remember ordering a virgin one. Complete waste of time and money!!!!!
THEY DIDN'T KNOW HOW TO CHECK ME IN WITH OPEN TABLE, SO I'M SO HAPPY TO KNOW IT WAS ACCOMPLISHED THE FOLLOWING DAY.
Not as good as in the past. Attention to food preparation fell below previous visits. Service was less attentive as well. In general, an off night.

column4: 1600 Champa St. On the 16th Street Mall @ Champa Street Denver, CO  80202
column13: We were seated on time, and the service staff were very helpful. They handled two late arrivals with speed. The food was very good, and everyone's order was accurate. We had a good time!

column4: 202 Grand Avenue South San Francisco, CA  94080
column13: Great food & service. Highly recommend!
Had an amazing experience. This was definitely worth the wait, after trying to get a table 4 times.. this was quite surprising and delicious.
The food was artistically prepared and served. It was a treat to our palates. The service was friendly, attentive and not pushy.

Our group thought the food was excellent - the presentations were very professional, and everything was fresh and perfectly prepared. We thought the waitstaff could be trained a bit on providing additional information and recommendations for food and wine, but overall the service was very good and attentive. We will definitely come back.

I've eaten a Black Cat twice now and both times have been 5-star experiences. Their food is seasonal, creative, and has multiple layers of flavored that compliment one another beautifully. It's one of the first places I think of when a special occasion comes up. The ambiance is very cozy-chic; they want you to feel welcomed and comfortable without compromising 5-star dining ambiance. You also get to see the chefs at work which is neat. This past time we had the homemade bread, kalamata olive ice cream over a basil salad, chilled carrot and citrus soup, a roasted beet and chvre salad, a spicy greens salad with hazelnut mousse, the summer polenta cake with vegetables, and the salmon. Everything was incredible.

Nothing special, certainly did not live up to its billing. I had the shortribs which at $29 or so were not worth the money. I would not go back. The place was so empty, I am not sure they will be in business long.

I have been to Campton Place several times and it never fails to impress. The food nd wine are superb. My date and I shared ricotta dumplings as an appetizer, along with the lobster. Dumplings were fantastic. Lobster seemed a bit undercooked and wasn't much food. Duck and .alaskan halibut entrees both up superb, quite flavorful. Cherry sauce on duck really added to the flavor. Chocolate dessert was relatively light and beautifully presented.

Great night out my wife and I had, we were in town for vacation for one week, our great friends baby sat for us and my wife and I went out on a date night in the gas lamp district like we did many years ago, so I looked up opentable and found this fantastic indian restaurant , food was amazing , wine was half price, so we had two lol, Tuesday night ! Overall great night out, plus we got 1000 points on opentable for this visit, thanks guys.

column4: 106 Paseo Del Pueblo Norte Taos, NM  87571
column13: Enjoyed a good meal and a reasonably priced bottle of good winefor a decent price. Graham's grille serves three meals a day and is one of the nicer establishments in Tao's.

column4: 10355 N. LaCanada Dr Oro Valley, AZ  85737
column13: Creative menu with interesting fresh food options and appealing and scrumptious desserts in particular. Given that the restaurant was nearly empty, the rushed and disruptive service was somewhat disappointing. Also waiter was not particularly knowledgeable and, at times, difficult to find.

The food was exceptional! We went with a group of six, and we all loved the food! The service was very good as well. The dancer was very friendly and made my husband's birthday fun! Our server was a bit slow on drinks but no big deal. Everything else made up for it and I would recommend it to others and we plan to go there many more times! What a great place.
Thank you Josh for setting us up with an outstanding Kenichi experience! The whole Thai-style fish was amazing. Nice touch with the garlic scapes.

I found my filet to be nothing memorable, and the risotto had large chunks of herbs with the stems still on making it hard and unpleasant to eat - felt like I was eating grass with my meal. Also at least one gnat was flying around our table for the entire meal - ugh. There was no delay at all between courses. Some might like this but I felt we were rushed out the door since we were the first seating of the night. Others at the table loved their entrees - swordfish and bison ribeye were very good.
