We had a large party - 6 adults, 6 children. It was not a busy night at the restaurant and we were accommodated nicely, although it seems it would have been problematic on another night. Service was perfunctory but satisfactory (especially given our large size), but the food is mediocre. Would return if someone I was with wanted to go but would not suggest going there again.

Afraid my second time at Poisha was a disappointment. Restaurant was incredibly loud this time and we were shoehorned into a tight corner where we could hear (and be heard by) everyone in the restaurant. Service was friendly although very slow. And the pasta sauce tasted like it was fresh out of a jar. Won't be too quick to go back again.

We ate there a year ago and it was absolutely delicious. This time was awful. The steak tasted like old meat and was like shoe leather. Both of us got the steak and hated it. It was a truly disappointing meal. I will never dine there again.

First, the live music by the Euphoria Brass Band was fantastic. The $5 BBQ and house wines were wonderful; notably high quality and low price. MUSIC 7 DAYS A WEEK!The sour note? The staff had no clue how to handle the live music and dining combination:staff did not understand the BBQ ticket system and reservations were ignored resulting in those who planned ahead ending up with their meal out of sight or sound of the entertainment because of people without reservations.
Food and service were very good. Only objection was that you have to ask for prix fixe menu. They do not volunteer that it exists.

column4: 6107 N. Scottsdale Rd Suite 110 Scottsdale, AZ  85250
column13: We went to dinner early so the noise level was still low enough for us to talk. Music on the patio was just starting as we were leaving so we sat on the patio and had another glass of wine and listen for at least an hour. Van and Melanie were great and sang "our" type of music. They went around to the tables at their break and we found out about her dog and pot bellied pig rescue facility. Nice people. We will be back for the great food and music.

column4: 6101 West Century Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90045
column13: The food is outstanding! Really world class and comparable to places in Italy. The aroma when you first walked into the restaurant already draws you in. I ordered the pappardelle with marsala wine sauce and it was just mouthwatering. The pasta was fresh and the sauce/ingredients were rich and delicious! My friend ordered the squid ink pasta and it was full of seafood with a slight spicyness to it. My friend loved it. We also ordered the chocolate cake paired with hazelnut gelato. The chocolate cake was a little dry but still good. But the hazelnut ice cream was tasty that it compensated for the cake. Just a marvelous place and will definitely return!!!
This a fantastic restaurant to take someone who you want to impress and it is always consistent!

It is not often you can find a better restaurant like Los Equipales to dine individually, as a couple, or as a small or large group, and you can make reservations! Here you will experience warm, friendly hospitality, excellent service, candlelight, linen covered tables, and delicious Mexican Crusine. It is a great place for special occasions or for lunch or a dinner night out inside or out on the patio. Erika is the owner and will always greet you with her special smile.

This was our third dinner at La Mer and the first with their new chef. It continues to be our nominee for the best restaurant in Hawaii. It has a good location, lovely ambiance, outstanding service, excellent food, and a fine wine list. La Mer is formal by Hawaiian standards so not best bet for kids but great for adults who appreciate fine dining.
Seafood night is outstanding and a favorite of club members.

column4: 28234 N. Tatum Blvd Cave Creek, AZ  85331
column13: Can be depended on for a fabulous meal!

It was in my wife's 85th birthday anniversary, and we appreciated the nice touch of a complimentary dessert. We also liked the considerate manner of our server. It wasn't AZInn's fault tat the next table was loud.

column4: 1501 West Sahara Avenue Las Vegas, NV  89102
column13: We are locals and love this hotel. We love the bar and the ambiance of the bar. We've wanted to try the restaurant for a long time. Sadly, we won't go back here to eat. I will say that the bread basket was really good.

column1: Palm Court at The Scottsdale Resort
column13: Some of the best table side service at any restaurant we have ever been too. Banana's Foster prepared table side was off the chart. Great summer 5 course wine pairing at great price.

column1: The Lodge Restaurant at Black Butte Ranch
column4: 12930 Hawks Beard Black Butte Ranch, OR  97759
column13: Always outstanding. Impossible to beat the ambiance, view, food and service anywhere in Central Oregon!

THe tomoto basil soup with sausage was my favorite of the meal. Crispy skinned red fish on avocado puree with seasonal vegatables was a terific mix of flavors. While I went to dinner early (5:45) I was surprised how quiet it was on a Friday night??
We had an excellent experience at The Lariat.

We began the evening in the elegant bar with a glass of champagne. In the restaurant our waiter had difficulty in explaining the very complicated menus and I felt his frustration with us several times. He tried to be friendly and accomodating. The food was not great; however, I am a foodie and have eaten at many of the world's outstanding restaurants. Our table was in front of a picture window where we watched for 3 hours the sun set over San Francisco, the bay bridge and the bay. Fantastic.

One of our favorite restaurants in the desert! The food is always served at the correct temperature and is always perfectly prepared. The Dover sole is unbelievably delicious. Ask for Steve to serve you. He is funny, knows the menu backwards and forwards and you are sure to have a wonderful and memorable meal.
View is great, service was also great, the food however didnt thrill us. We went for seafood and I am sure there are better seafood restaurants in Seattle.

It is with a heavy heart that I write this review. I live close to Baleen and was hoping to have found a new spot to frequent with my husband. Unfortunately, this restaurant will not make the list. We went to Baleen for lunch on Sunday. My $22 salad arrived to the table soggy from all of the dressing and my husband's hamburger was over cooked. I would have mentioned it to the waiter but I only saw him twice; once when he took our order then again when he dropped off our bill. On a positive note, the outdoor seating is great, especially on a sunny day.

What an outstanding restaurant - a real gem! As a visitor to the area we would probably make this our first visit on each return. Wonderful menu with just the right amount of creativity - none of the dishes got away from the chef in terms of complexity and execution. Very highest quality ingredients and very fair pricing. For a small, almost hidden restaurant the choices were wide ranging. The chef's experiences in France come through in each of the dishes.
Great staff and very cool atmosphere.

column4: 211 Old Santa Fe Trail Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Patio dining was delightful.Early bird special dinner was well worth the cost - all dishes were very flavorful and presented well.Would return on our next trip to Santa Fe

column4: 139 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Osteria Coppa is one of our "go to" restaurants for dinner, after a movie for a drink, with friends and business dinners. It is consistently excellent cuisine and they easily accommodate food allergies. We love it!

column4: 1404 West Vacation Road San Diego, CA  92109
column13: I had made my request prior to arriving though Open Table. The restaurant has an rude hostess. "are there 4 of you?" Duh..1.me.2.my husband..3.my dad and 4 My Mom (in a wheelchair) The only people in the entire front of the restaurant. She decided to walk us into the dining room through every table moving every chair to clear way for the wheelchair. We could have been taken better path to the table. We were told the outside could not really work?Every request prior to arriving was not met.I left with my family,AND DID NOT EAT THERE.Unacceptable.I was hoping that Baleen was like I remember in the past.Upscale with Amazing food. Baleen changed and not for the better. The manager was helpful but I would rather eat somewhere else.

It is an incredible to find a restaurant that maintains high quality food in an area where tourists flock. The King Fisher restaurant added an incredible place to eat in a special resort at the Sleeping Lady. The food and wine selection are outstanding, the buffet style is different compared to the typical buffets in Las Vegas, the server made sure that food are not wasted yet everyone will have plenty of opportunity to have seconds, thirds, etc. and still maintain fresh food. There is no doubt in my mind return here pretty soon and recommend this restaurant, and Sleeping Lady Resort, to others who seeks a combination of relaxation, wilderness, and exellent food.

Thursday night and it was quiet and not crowded. They provided us with a nice booth by window for two. Very prompt service good food all around.It was about $150 for two with three glasses of wnie, appetizer, salads, entree, and deserts.

I will never understand why HR recruits people that are not customer service oriented. I felt like he was doing us a favor....The bus boy came to offer some pastries and my friend and I talked at the same time to him, he rudely replied "I cannot listen to you when you are both speaking at the same time"...Food was so, so... I thought it would be at the level of other brunches, like La Valencia or Hotel Del (for the price). Maybe if service was better, I would've felt food was better. I was also surprised that their valet parking offered only 3 dlls validation.....La Valencia and Hotel Del, which are on the top of my list, offered complimentary parking to their guests...with proper validation...It was my birthday, was a so so experience...

column1: BOTERO Encore at Wynn Las Vegas
column4: 3131 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Lovely venue and attentive staff make this worth every penny!
Great food and service as always. I'm sad to hear the restaurant is being sold. I will miss those fantastic gnocchi. I've had homemade for all my life and Graziano's gnocchi is fabulous!

column4: 9882 S. Santa Monica Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90212
column13: Consistently exceptional food and attentive service! Can't wait to go back!

column4: 22701 Pelican Hill Road South Newport Coast, CA  92657
column13: Outstanding in all respects. Definitely a "special treat", not a weekly place for my husband and me. Expensive, but the quality of the food and service and ambiance makes it a wonderful venue. If you want to impress for a birthday or annivesary you can't go wrong with Andrea's.

column1: Lucy Restaurant and Bar at Bardessono
column13: When we were there the restraint was very quiet. Our waiter was to over the top & trying to hard to please. Our dinner was very good until we got to the dessert. We were not crazy about the one our waiter was enthusiastic about. The staff was generally attentive & we never had to look for someone to give us more water or anything we may have needed.

HALEKULANI has been in the history of Waikiki for many many years. As I was a travel director for 13 years here in Hawaii, I was able to stay at the Halekulani in the years from 1981 to 1994. I must say that, although I came back to Waikiki in 2005, after teaching at The Univesity of the Thai Chamber of Commerce in Bangkok, Thailand, Waikiki and the "Aloha Spirit" has deminished.
very slow service which seemed to be due to a slow kitchen and not the servers

column4: 459 Prospect Way Half Moon Bay, CA  94038
column13: Great food and service. Always a great meal when we come here. Highly reccomended

column4: 106 N. Guadalupe St. Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Service was very marginal. Could have been better. The good was good though. Slightly disapointed because it came so highly recommended I expected more.

I love this place: nice staff, good service, and mostly excellent food (though this last time the chicken kabobs were overcooked). Their stuffed eggplant (vegetarian) was surprisingly wonderful. My only complaint is that sitting outside at the tables farthest from the street is torture as the sun goes down and hits you head on. I don't see how they can prevent that, but now that I know, I will never sit outside there at that hour again (we started "frying" around 6:30 PM in mid-summer).
We went here as a result of all the reviews we had seen on Open Table.

Food overall was very good, service adequate but not as attentive as it should have been considering how few tables were filled. Expected a bustling crowd on a Friday night but the place was pretty dead which did not add to the overall experience.

My husband and I took my dad here for his birthday dinner. We asked to be seated outside so we could enjoy the view. All the food was tasty. Our server was great as well. The ducks are kind of hilarious because they just stand there and stare at you, like a dog begging for food!Overall I think this is a great spot for couples for a casual romantic dinner or for special occasions.

Delicious and creative food. We sat outside since it was noisy inside with the musical performance. We were happy we brought our hats and gloves since they didn't have any heating elements available. Order extra caramel with the ginger cake!

column4: 2000 Fashion Show Drive Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Was not particularly impressed. Menu was limited. They were out of the filet minion and we had to settle for the rib eye (which was excellent). Pasta was average. But the salmon was great as well. They have dumped the fixed price menu. So likely to be more expensive now. Overall given the choices available in Vegas I would not say there is anything standout about this place.
Our waiter Yeyson was friendly, informative and efficient.

column4: 510 San Anselmo Ave San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: Wonderful, warm, friendly. Food was great. Service was personal and perfect.
Seemed like there weren't enough waiters to patrons ratio.

column4: 3263 Camino Del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014
column13: I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere, and will come back, but the parking was horrendous.
We are from California heading to a wedding in Sandpoint and someone on the plane recommended this restaurant. So pleased I would return in a minute.

column4: 2520 Columbia House Blvd. Suite 108 Vancouver, WA  98661
column13: We had a great meal. The pork chop was delicious and my halibut was done perfectly with fresh seasonal vegetables. The menu was varied with a number of choices for anyones taste.We plan to return and enjoy the ambiance and good food again.. It was very nice to fine this type of resturant so close to home.
Have had fabulous time here before with excellent servers....not the case this time. Food fantastic. Servers rushed, unfriendly, adequate.
Pricey and menu was limited, but what we had (halibut and salmon and salads) was very good. Not great, but very good. Nice view of the marina and service was very good also.

My husband and I went looking for an 0ld school vibe and got it in spades. If you enjoy piano bars with a disco ball, attentive and friendly service, great cocktails and are looking for a bit of the desert from the 60s you will love.

column4: 120 Country Club Drive Ste 29 Incline Village, NV  89451
column13: Food is good but service is lacking.

column4: 423 West 300 South, Suite 150 Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Dojo is not your usual sushi bar, although it is a sushi bar. The sushi was fresh and just the right temperature. The 9 piece plate included some unusual pieces, like a quail egg surrounded by roe. The sashimi was also very good. The soba noodles were only ok. The service was fantastic, very attentive and very clearly aiming to please.

column4: 100 Wailea Golf Club Dr. Wailea, HI  96753
column13: Our first time dining at Gannons. Beautiful setting and excellent service. The food does not live up to the view. Specifically I thought the gazpacho and fish were too salty. Hopefully just an off night.
Loved it all- very creative and unfussy. Keep it going on folks!

column4: Beverly Hilton 9876 Wilshire Blvd Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Not very impressed with atmosphere. Food OK. Waitress was attentive. We were practically the only ones there.
Fun atmosphere! Good food and prompt service. Generous helpings and very taisty. Fairly priced.

column4: 6795 So. Virginia Street Suite H Reno, NV  89511
column13: First visit to this cafe. We went for our wedding anniversary. We were treated very well. We felt very welcome. The food was good, it was hot and tasty. not exceptional, but good. We have had alot worst in other places. We will go back, nice place, decent service, decent prices. Ambiance was spartan: very euro styled.

column4: 3600D N. Capital of Texas Hwy. Austin, TX  78746
column13: We came here for happy hour, we were blown away by the service and food. Started off with the stuffed meatballs and PEI mussels, we also ordered the spinach and margarita pizza. We were a large party and our server Sarah was really on top of things. We loved the drinks Trento offers, especially the hummingbird with prosecco and st Germaine. Definitely bringing friends back for happy hour.

column1: TAPS Fish House & Brewery - Dos Lagos
column13: Enjoyed the piano entertainment.

column4: 440 S. Rampart at Tivoli Village Las Vegas, NV  89145
column13: Really surprised that the hostess actually checked me in. When I walked in she had a bit of attitude and didn't really care what name was on the reservation,as she grabbed menus and walked back without even looking at the computer. Besides that the waiter and bartender were very much on top of things, they made the experience better. loved the milk shakes and the burgers were pretty delicious to, I would recommend for more of a lunch outing rather then dinner.

For a place that hypes itself one of the best "independent" steakhouses, it has a long way to go. Its closer to the quality level of a chain place like Outback. In a bigger city with more high-end choices, it wouldn't survive (my wife and I don't live in Lubbock). True greatness shows in the details. Our menus both had different choices/prices. Waiter was switched. Salads drowned in dressing. Bread never came without multiple reminders. Sauteed mushrooms tasted sour. The steaks, fortunately, were very good but not served with advertised accompaniments, but a huge lump of bland julienned vegetables instead. Maybe they were off their game on this Wednesday night. Or maybe they aren't truly great. Neither is an acceptable outcome for my money.

Tulio continues in its fine tradition of providing great food in a wonderful trattoria setting. I missed some old favorites from the menu and would love to have these brought back, but the food was terrific, the service pleasant and the atmosphere convivial.

I really want to like this place, but they just can't seem to get their act together. The food ranges from "OK" to "Outstanding" - same with the service! We were there for Sunday Brunch and the memosas were great. Three of the six entrees were "outstanding" - the fried chicken with waffles, the steak and eggs and the pork chop. The other three, not so much - green eggs & ham, duck confit hash and breakfast pizza - they were not bad, just not much to them. Very little ham and very little duck; the pizza was unremarkable. Just not what we expect for the price.

column4: 1297 Bishops Lodge Rd Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Continues the Bishop's Lodge reputation for quiet elegance. Sunday Brunch was outstanding.

column4: 900 Front Street Suite A 101 Lahaina, HI  96761
column13: On vacation here and went back twice in one week. Duck and lobster ravioli were great!
we had a wonderful time! excellent food and service. We were celebrating our honeymoon and my husband's 40th birthday.

column4: 241 S San Pedro St Los Angeles, CA  90012-3808
column13: A delicious, unique meal and excellent service!

column4: 18740 Stone Oak Parkway San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Awesome service and food. Standout was attention to detail.

Due to two young children we have waited a long time to try Formaggio Grill. Our wait finally ended last weekend! The menu choices were very unique compared to other restaurants in the area and we were very happy with the service. The food was prepared as requested and presentation was wonderful.
My food was ok, but they served everything at room temp. I think my food would have been a lot better had it been served hot.

Austin is a great venue for food. 1866 is definitely worth visiting. It is more of a cafe as advertised so the menu is a little limited, but what is available is tasty. Give it a try among several others in the downtown area.

column1: Arizona Grand Resort- The Lobby Grill
column4: 8000 S Arizona Grand Pkwy Phoenix, AZ  85044
column13: View is nice. Sandwiches were okay but the fries were soggy and greasy. Was hoping for more but will probably try one more tomr because the location and view from the dining room are so nice.
Both entrees were exceptional, ahi appetizer awesome, salad not so much. The service was impeccable---Cooper was perfect was his suggestions and engaging. Would definitely make a return visit

column4: 450 108th Avenue Northeast City Center Plaza Bellevue, WA  98004
column13: Impeccable service and great food. Went with the carved porterhouse for two. Great concept and great taste. We did medium rare and that was the way to go. Wicked Shrimp for an appetizer was key. We'll be back!

column4: 7555 E. Eagle Crest Dr. Mesa, AZ  85207
column13: We ate there the last few days before a scheduled renovation. They had all of their menu items available on their standard menu but there was still enough choices. The food was excellent and the service was friendly and efficient.I can't wait for them to reopen.

column4: 612 S. Flower St. Los Angeles, CA  90017
column13: I've had lunch at this Daily Grill for a very long time. Lately, there has definitely been a change in the quality of the food and it isn't in a positive direction. The food just isn't as good as it used to be. For example, the shredded lettuce in the Cobb salad is dry, they have reduced the amount of cheese in the salad and it basically has no flavor. They changed the Thai Chicken Salad on the 600 calorie menu and ruined it. They have narrowed the sourdough bread so that most of it is crust. I am afraid this Daily Grill has lost its way.

We have been to this Twigs several times and have always found it delightful. However, we were disappointed at the reception we received on this occasion. The hostess was not very friendly and the wait staff seemed to be over-worked. Although our server was somewhat friendly, he always seemed to be in a hurry while attending to us. We definitely felt as though the other customers were of more importance. It may have been that the least experienced wait staff was on duty that particular evening. But we didn't feel very welcome at the restaurant that evening, Sorry.
Very good for a business dinner, the rare downtown restaurant with combination of delicious food, and private, quiet atmospherics permitting conversation.

The review about the interior looking like a Denny's was a little severe but it does need some work. What impressed me was the way the waiter reacted when my partner though the wine had turned. She handed it to me and I concurred that something was wrong. He didn't protest in the least and brought us another selection. This seems to logical but not always the way it works. The food was fine, not great but good. They were so charming that I'd go back to taste a few more dishes particularly given the lack of good options in this area.
All was Purrrfect as always.Keep up the great job all staff and management of Durant's.
Noisy! Good food, but don't plan on having a conversation.

The food we had was excellent. We would definitely go again. Menu not a long one but what we had was very good. Happy patrons who were obviously enjoying themselves including the drinks and the meals.

column4: 2424 Van Ness St San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: always a good dining experience

column1: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
column13: I had not eaten at Bob's until this week. Their food is excellent and we had a quite booth off the main dining room. I would definitely recommend Bob's as a very good restaurant for having a business lunch.

column4: 6600 S. Quebec Suite A Centennial, CO  80112
column13: This is an old favorite. The live music overwhelms the tiny little bar. I had asked for a quiet booth so we could hear, just that age, and we did have a nice table (booth) in the back. The service was good/attentive, would like to see a newer, fresher menu.We'll go again.
Chicken nachos and fried avocado were terrific. The rest was pretty average Mexican fare

column4: 8335 Park Meadows Center Drive Lone Tree, CO  80124
column13: Back on the right track, the place has been great lately

Everything was wonderful! I when I made the reservation on Open Table, I added that we were celebrating our 25th anniversary. When we arrived at our table there were rose petals and notes on our menus wishing us a happy anniversary. They then provided us with a complimentary appetizer and dessert. Everything was absolutely wonderful!
The environment was charming and located in a convenient location with free parking across the street. Service was exceptional. Food was fair.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Duck confit jambalaya was fantastic. Food is mildly spicy at most for NewOrleans fare. Waiter was very "hip," using tone and body language as if we were his "bros," which could be interpreted as rude or classless for a place of this reputation and price point.

Fresh Bistro is from the same people who bring Seattle Herban Feast, and it is one of a growing pantheon of superior dining choices in West Seattle. We are regulars for brunch (which they serve until 3, a full hour longer than their local competition) and we have tried pretty much everything on that menu. Don't miss the coffee cake!

Who thought healthy food can taste so good? We were hesitant to go to Graces 5 due to the fact the restaurant focuses on "healthy" food. We were pleasantly surprised to discover the amount of flavor that the chef was able to bring out. We will definitely go back.

column4: 1133 Newport Center Drive Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: Our first visit to celebrate Mom's 81st birthday and it was a wonderful experience! We had to call twice to change the reservation time but each time the hostess was sweet and gracious. The service was exceptionally friendly and the food was FABULOUS! Flat iron steak was one of the best steaks I have ever had, super cauliflower soup, awesome apple pie! We all had a blast!!

column1: House of BIG FISH and Ice Cold Beer
column4: 540 South Coast Highway Suite 200 Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: Great food and service in a happening beach restaurant.

column4: 780 North Lake Boulevard Tahoe City, CA  96145
column13: Several in our party of 11 found the food to be a little bland. The highlight was the short ribs.

My girlfriend and I have been to Berryhill three times, all for special occasions, and each time have had a fantastic experience. The food is great, the atmosphere is nice, and most importantly, the service is exemplary. They give enough time in between courses so that we can enjoy our meal and have a great experience. We highly recommend going to Berryhill.

I just didn't think it was as special and different as the website made it seem. The menu structure could use some organizing. I think the idea behind the restaurant is awesome. This place has great potential. I think it is really up to the staff to know their product and help create that foodie excitement.

Visited on a Thursday night, when a live string quartet was playing in the back courtyard. Was given a table a little too close to the gas heaters, but as a single diner was steered towards that section on the restaurant. Staff were happy to change the rice accompanying the Duck a l'orange to potato when ordering. Meal was okay but sauce wasn't quite on target. Location a little less that ideal, south of Folsom in a less attractive neighborhood, but not too far from convention center.

column4: 5200 Mowry Avenue Suite M Fremont, CA  94538
column13: Reasonably priced, great food, good service. Can't ask for much more.
A bit miserly with the injera. At other Ethiopian restaurants, they often brought an entire basket with more than just a piece per diner.

column1: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
column13: Great place with great food; a little loud for conversation

Delicious, imaginative asian food. Loved the pork belly & watermelon salad. Our waiter provided outstanding recommendations on food and beverage. Normally we drink wine, but the cocktail list was so intriguing that my husband and I sampled 4 different drinks. We have already told our friends about the restaurant and will be going back often.
The live music was great! Portions were too small for the price. Not very good quality food. Good Service.

We arrived a few minutes early for our 10:00 brunch reservation. Not realizing that they didn't open until ten, we hung around outside on the sidewalk. The staff was very friendly, and let us in at 10:00 on the dot. The restaurant is small and cozy, so I'm glad we had reservations, as it filled up quick! They had a great little menu, with options for both breakfast and lunch. I got the crab benedict, which was awesome! The hollandaise sauce was terrific, and their breakfast potatoes were mouthwatering. A great find, and close to 16th Street Bart, which made it easy to get back to the East Bay after brunch.
Eat your heart out Aspen! Six89 remains the Best restaurant in the entire Roaring Fork Valley!!

It doesn't get any better than the Slanted Door on a warm San Francisco evening. The wait staff is very knowledgeable and does not hesitate to make recommendations. I really appreciate this, especially when you enjoy so many of the selections. The food is fresh and perfectly prepared. The dish aromas allow you to pause to enjoy the food even before tasting. I would like more California wines in the "by the glass" selection. Otherwise, anther perfect dining experience - fabulous food and friends - good drinks.

I took my brother to lunch who is visiting from out of town.It was my first visit as well. I found the menu interestingand though I was looking for more choice, I settled with a standard(Orange Chicken) while my brother ordered the Summer Rice.My dish came over cooked... dry chicken and I do not do so well.My brothers dish was wonderful. They took back my dish and offeredto make another, but my experiences in restaurants teach me to say"no thank you, I am not interested in chancing it again". Since the menu is limiting(though interesting) and my diet not allowing much of the other choices, I passed.They handled the situation very well and I may give it a chance another time oncethis experience fades. The staff is

If you are NOT in a rush and are looking to enjoy a meal, this is a great restaurant. The service is slow. We actually never got water, only the drinks we ordered. It took a while for a server to check on us/take our orders, but once he did, the food came out quickly. For us, it was perfect because we were catching up on our lives for the past year! We weren't in any hurry. I recommend the drunken noodles, especially if you like a little spicy! The Thai Tea was ok, but lacking in flavor a little. Pad Thai is ok. The curry looks delicious, and I'll try it next time! Parking is street, but you can find it nearby at night easily.
Amazing food, great service, well done job

column4: 2049 Fillmore St @ California San Francisco, CA  94115
column13: I think this is a better drinks/appetizers or dinner place. Brunch was meh. And the price was high for meh.

We were staying in Bend for a concert and thought The Phoenix would be a good restaurant to hit up on our way. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly and the food was delicious. We ordered off the 3 course menu and got quite a bit of food. My husband had the salmon piccata and I had the fish and chips. They brought us fresh baked bread and we would definitely when vacationing in Bend again.

Great spot in Glenwood Springs--service was fantastic, very friendly and attentive but not overly so, got on well with kids. Wonderful to have well prepared and tasty food with a good kids' menu that goes beyond standard fare (though includes it as well).

column4: 400 N. Broadway Suite 102 Santa Ana, CA  92701
column13: The burger and truffle fries were perfection. Server was very personable and eager to help. This was our first time to The Crosby, but we're already planning on coming back and bringing friends.

I'm a fan of Slanted Door and since I couldn't get a booking there for our group of 8, we decided to try Wo Hing General Store. It was terrific. Our group ranges from vegan, to kosher, to meat lovers...everyone was happy and found dishes that were outstanding. The waiter was very helpful in explaining items. And the cocktails are a nice change of pace, and presented in lovely vintage glasses. All in all this was a great experience and I would add it to my short list of SF favorites.
The pistacio crusted mahi mahi and shrimp and grits were fantastic. We look forward to going back for seconds.
MALA was great. They have a great Gluten Free menu, only thing missing was a gluten free beer. The food and service was great and the view was FANTASTIC. Would not hesitate to go again.

I love Communal. I have been there a handful of times for lunch and once for dinner. The food is divine and the mention changes so often that there is always something new and tasty to try. Oh and they service is some of the best. It is a popular place so making a reservation is always a good idea. The place has personality and really is so so yummy. Worth the cost.
Amazing food, sophisticated menu items, perfect casual and attentive service, unbelievable that this place is in Utah County! Worth the trip down from Salt Lake. Will be back and bring friends.
Service was a little slow, food was presented well and tasty.

Hot Spot in the truest sence of the word... 84 degrees INSIDE. Excuse was because of high ceilings... ummmm, heat rises. Then manager would adjust A/C... I was sitting across from thermostat which was never touched BUT I could read the numbers... now 86!!! Oh, then was told it was because of the heat outside... it was 84. Stear clear unless you like dining in a sauna. Too bad because the food was good and seems like a nice place, maybe a winter find.

column4: 344 El Camino Real San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: Dinner at Creola was even better than lunch! From the street it looks desolate, empty even, only to step inside to the vibrant, positive energy of a bustling restaurant filled with good food. The staff is very professional and good humored, focused on creating an enjoyable dining experience. (They even watch out that you don't park in a towable parking space.) Their hush puppies are a must. The crab cake excellent. Cat fish melts in your mouth and the etouffee is better than I remember from New Orleans. Wow! Our whole group of five loved our dinner there. AND we didn't have to shout to talk with each other even though the restaurant was packed.
Loved this place! All five of us loved our meals and they had my favorite wine! We will definitely be back!
Love. Love. Love Chez Nous! We have never been disappointed!

column4: 401 Silver Lake Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90026
column13: Everything is good here, its hard to go wrong! The food is absolutely outstanding! I recommend trying the yucca fries!
Very noisy which detracted from the beautiful view.
If you plan on talking to your friends on a weekend evening make other plans because the accoustics are terrible.The food is amazing and the tequila and Margaritas are the best in Sacramento.
good solid food; attracts an older Laurelhurst crowd & groups

It's not really a place for kids but we took our three kids and it worked outfine. There was no kids menue but the portion will do for 11 and up. Upstairs dinning is superb! Drinks are on point. I put scenic view but it's not really scenic. It's still beautiful to sit out there at night.

column4: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: I recently took my daughter to Las Vegas for the first time. I wanted to take her for a special dinner on our last night there, a friend recommended the Eiffel Tower Restaurant. The view was incredible!! The food was first class. I will recommend it to everyone I talk too.

Upper West is a great find, especially if you are going to a show at McCabe's Guitar Shop, a couple short blocks West on Pico Blvd. At McCabes' suggestion, we parked across the street from Upper West, in the lot behind the US Bank building (Free parking after 6 PM).

column4: 2304 San Diego Ave. San Diego, CA  92110
column13: Euro-Mexican food, in the sense of going back to its native roots. Many kinds of mole, corn fungus (cuitlacoche), unusual and rich flavors. Replace wine cave with tequila menu and museum. Good place to take visitors from cities with rich and unusual dining and show them what San Diego offers.

column1: El Bizcocho at Rancho Bernardo Inn
column4: 17550 Bernardo Oaks Dr San Diego, CA  92128
column13: we love love love el bizcocho for sunday brunch!!!

column4: 345 Pacific Coast Hwy 101,Suite C2 Encinitas, CA  92024
column13: Good restaurant Open Table reservation with them is worthless because they don't have anyone following through with them. Call directly instead.
Service was great. We had a great experience at this place. Our waiter was the best.

Had a bit of a problem getting my kid's burger right... What's so difficult about 'a burger & a bun". All the kid wanted was the meat & the bread. It took forever to get his food. He was the last one to eat -- and it still came out with sauce on it.

column4: 4450 East Sam Houston Parkway South #A Pasadena, TX  77505
column13: Yum, yum, yum!!! As an Italian American I don't typically eat Italian food out at restaurants, but the meal I had a Napoli was authentic and delicious! I have been to Houston twice, and have enjoyed two meals at this restaurant.

column1: Andres Bouchee Bistro and Wine Bar
column13: We're foodies,but also want everything else-- service and atmosphere. We happwned to be in Carme3 on our anniversary, and chose Andre's based on the reviews, menu, and a walk-by--bingo! It was perfect!
We had a 5:30 reservation and we were seated immediately upon arrival. Excellent service and food.

Avanti's has been a noticeable part of the Phoenix Restaurant scene for as long as we can remember. One of our favorite special spots years ago we had not had much contact withAvanti for some years. Still a class place with menu selections and quality that is among the best you can find.
This was amazing place to eat! The service by Kat was unbelievable. She was the best server that I have ever had!
always a great restaurant for a business lunch, food always good and service excellent

On a Monday, we were seated right away on their lovely outdoor patio. There were quite a few tables and they were about 85% full. Chips and salsa were brought immediately with drink order and the food was good. We will go back to try other items.
Wonderful Latin flavors...so much more than just Mexican
Food was delicious. Service was wonderful and friendly. Will be happy to go back.

column4: 2015 E. Park Place El Segundo, CA  90245
column13: If I go to a restaurant in Denmark is it to enjoy the food and sit and talk and we use may be longer time in the rstaurant than people in US, because we had the fdeeling that we have to rush and be finish quick.
This is a quaint little place that is great for a laid back meal with friends. Very relaxing.

Beautiful restaurant. Virtually empty at lunchtime. Parking is difficult. They give you a voucher for the lot next door, but it turned out to be good for only $2.50 of a much higher amount. Would have been ok if that were explained.

column4: 163 North La Cienega Beverly Hills, CA  90211
column13: We dined here as a part of the Dine L.A. deals and lunch was delicious! The deal was a great price and the food was amazing. I will be back!

We went to celebrate our Anniversary, and it was very good. The waiter was good, but a little doting. We ordered a price fix special, and it had the most wonderful burger on it, from Waygu beef. It was fabulous!

Food was good although my husband had to send his tuna steak back and because of the incident they were very accommodating and offered us dessert.I didn't think the decor was so fabulous. I almost felt like I was in an upscale dinner. And we didn't have a few so I cannot comment on this.I would probably try some other resaurants that we didn't have time for on our next visit.

column1: Twigs Bistro and Martini Bar - Kennewick
column4: 1321 N. Columbia Center Blvd Kennewick, WA  98336
column13: I've heard this place was just "okay" from friends and family. But I wanted to see for myself so I went here for my birthday. I ordered pepper salmon, because family gave me a few tips on what was good etc. My salmon was "okay" it came with rice and it tasted like it was microwaved! That killed my whole entire appetite.
The Flamenco dancing was great. The food was so-so. The guacamole was very good. It wasn't clear there was a cover for the Flamenco dancing on the website.

column4: 3055 S. Parker Rd A 108 Aurora, CO  80014
column13: We have been a few times to the Bent Noodle in Aurora and really enjoy it. The food is good and the ambiance is comfortable and relaxing.
Contineu to go back for the food and service - both are very good.

column4: 22332 El Paseo Rancho Santa Margarita, CA  92688
column13: Very nice experience all around! Plenty of food selections and the portions allowed for me to take home enough for another meal! Enjoyed seeing Robert, your general manager, as he previously worked at another restaurant I frequented. Kristen was our server and she was very attentive to our needs.

column1: Grand Cafe at Omni Los Angeles
column4: 251 South Olive St. Los Angeles, CA  90012
column13: A great place to have brunch. Not a lot of variety. But what they do have I loved. And unlimited mimosas!

Food and service is the same as other buca's, but my biggest grip is with the parking. You can valet or park it your self but you have to pay either way. Floor plan is a bit small, but it gets the job done.

We've brunches and dined at Las Canarias many times in our frequent visits to San Antonio.. It deserves the high praise it has garnered on this site, Zagat guides and elsewhere. Incredible service with thoughtfully, well prepared food. Really a gem of San Antonio dining!

We went to Amuse on the recommendation of a friend, who tunes in to great restaurants. I say that because we arrived with high expectations. The service and the atmosphere lived up to them. The food fell short. It was competently prepared but not the memorable experience we had imagined. The prawn appetizer was the exception: it was excellent. My salad was bland and overdressed. We split the salmon as our main course. The blini with it had no flavor at all. And the pickled onion and cucumber preparation didn't quite come off. The chocolate truffle cake, which we had with chocolate truffle ice cream because we're not fond of coffee ice cream and they didn't have vanilla, finished the meal on a good note.

column4: 10700 Kuykendahl Rd. Suite F The Woodlands, TX  77381
column13: I had a great time at this place. Received great service and everyone was extremely friendly.

column4: 1972 N. Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA  90027
column13: The sushis are very very good, the food is fresh, the service is very pleasant.The prices are a not really cheap, that is why I do not rate 5 stars but this is a nice place to go, I will return...If you like sushi, you won't be disappointed.
The service at Il Covo is exceptional, the food is amazing, the ambiance is perfection. This is the perfect restaurant to take a date to;)

column4: 1237 Prospect St Ste P La Jolla, CA  92037
column13: Fantastic! Food was delicious. I plan on returning to experience other wonderful dishes.

column4: 416 Agua Fria St Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Was good last time we were able to find it open.
Great food and great service. Love the new salads as well!!

column4: 707 E Fort Union Blvd. Midvale, UT  84047
column13: We all loved our dinner...the salads there are exceptional!!
Our party of five had a wonderful time at the Pino Alto Restaurant. The entire staff that we met was wonderful and we enjoyed the food very much. I have already recommended it to friends.

column1: Garden Terrace at The Inverness Hotel
column13: I have heard about the Sunday brunch at the Inverness for many years. We are lucky in Denver to have several wonderful choices but I really think the Inverness is not the best. It is very cookie cutter and very loud. Lots of little kids running around unescorted by parents who just don't care and are too busy getting ready for their tee times or spa appointments. The breakfast food is one small step about Village Inn or Denny's when it comes to pancakes and waffles, bacon an sausage. No eggs except for the omelet guy who by 9:45 had a 30 minute wait and whose product was sub par. Yea they had a big seafood selection which I didn't try and they had some good desert but overall for 90 bucks for 2 with the mimosas it was a disapointment

column1: SWB at the Hyatt Regency Austin
column13: This was recommended to me by a GSR at another hotel, and it was the worst experience I've ever had, bar none. We only saw our server twice, but when she brought us the check, she was friendly as can be. It took 45 minutes to get our food and we got it before people who were there far before we were. It seemed as though the staff and kitchen couldnt handle the magnitude of service that was there. You should probably get an entire new crew. I went down to the concierge, who was probably the friendliest person I came across. Kudos to her. She was the only person who made us feel welcome in the entire place.
The restaurant was a nice 'older house' converted into a restaurant with a contemporary setting. The food was good and set up as expected and very good. Adam and the rest of the team served us well.

Overall experience was satisfactory. We had a reservation and got seated on time. Quality of the food was ok, nothing to write home about. One of the three brunch orders was incorrect, the waiter got it wrong as he was new and didn't write it down. My son ate it anyway as he was hungry and we had a ferry to catch as we were on our way to a baseball game. We will go back and give it another try.
The service was amazing and will keep me coming back! The decor was super cute and one of a kind. The brunch we had was good, but not amazing.
A local place to see for the bar. On that note, menu is limited, fried bar food. View and ambiance are the highlight here.

column4: 350 Smith Ranch Rd San Rafael, CA  94903
column13: I was able to get an early dinner reservation there so we could go over to the nearby movie theater afterwards. Easy to find with plenty of free parking, the staff was friendly, the service was great, and the food was delicious!

column4: 548 Agua Fria Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Continues to be a favorite for a romantic dinner!
Food was terrible! Especially the bread or fried dishes like dumplings and pancakes to moo shoo pork. Also very little shrimp or chicken in main dishes

Del INTI is our favorite GO TO place when we want a pop of flavor and several small plates for variety. Every dish we have had here is amazing! The service is friendly, atmosphere is elegant yet comfortable, and we can open table so we never have to wait. We love their ceviche options, the octopus is heavenly, and the quinoa is a must have every time.
Huge portions perfect for splitting and good wine choices!

Waitress told us early bird was only good for the first hour after they opened. When I told her the internet said till 6"30 and our reservatin was for 6, she suddenly found menus that did say till 6:30. They did hor the early bird.We all enjoyed the food very much and loved being outside.The four of us felt that she had been instructed to do that.
Great, great, great. Food - great. Service - great. Wine - great.
Even though the restaurant only had a few tables occupied, it took 30 minutes for us to get our food.

Had not been to El Torito Grill for ages. Seeing it on Open Table reminded us about it. The guacamole, made at our table was the best we have had in ages. My husband loved the lobster quesadilla and my chicken was really good. We will be back.
A buffet brunch with a vary of choices. Great Banana Foster.
Great food especially the steak and shrimp fajits

We thoroughly enjoyed your food, wines, and service. Your staff are well trained and most helpful. We feel that you are as good as most excellent European restuarants, in respect of excellent food and wines, and the beautiful setting and ambience of your domaine.we will certainly come again when we are in the area, as we do not live within easy reach.We have already recommended you to mant other people.

I would describe Hy's in the following manner: superb food, highly attentive staff, wonderful environment. We could not have been more impressed with these aspects. Of course you get what you pay for...Hy's is pricey, but not overwhelming. They way they grill the steaks is heavenly...worth every cent in my opinion. Also, try the strawberry ice cream surprise - FLAMBE! Exquisite after a big meal. The place is a bit hard to find, but the directions from Open Table got us right there.
Tastes authentic! Almost like how mama made it.

column4: 8868 W. Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: Excellent authentic Italian food. Charming restaurant with great service and a very good wine list.

Nice outdoor patio with lots of shading. Also has heat lamps for those cooler days. Food was excellent. We had the calamari appetizer, which was perfect for 2 to share. The salads were delicious, as were our entrees. I highly reccommend the ciopinno, which was generously stocked with lots of seafood (including a small lobster tail)and a delicious broth. Hubby had the lobster roll, which also had generous-sized portion of lobster. we managed to save room for a shared dessert - the ice cream sundae, which was topped with caramelized banana and cashews - a perfect end to a perfect meal. :)

Pastas were very good, marinara sauce was excellent. Caesar salad was dressed to our specifications bu $2 to add two measly anchovies seems steep. One diner in our group had the pasta special (marinara sauce) with a few minor changes and it was delicious, the house-made Italian sausage was a standout. Another diner order the veal saltimboca which was poor - overly floured, flat flavors, served with thin mashed potatoes and properly cooked veggies. Probably avoid the meats here, go for the pastas. Bartender was excellent, pours are generous. Glass wine offerings are few but very good.
The corn soup was amazing. Everything else was very tasty.

column4: 160 Jefferson St, Upper Level San Francisco, CA  94133
column13: The food was very good. The desserts were a disappointment. The apples were hard in the apple pie tart and it was very dry. Not worth the calories. Great view of the bay. Good to bring people from out of town.

column4: 7700 Las Vegas Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89123
column13: Great service! Loved the piano player-he could play everything and anything by memory. A few too many screaming brats who could have been isolated by themselves in a place further away from the piano. However, overall a good dining experience based in good cuisine!

As usual, had a wonderful experience. Our waiter, Gerardo, was very attentive and suggested just the right pairings. Michael's drinks were excellent. And the owner, Marco, was welcoming everyone and making them feel at home.Most highly recommended.
We love to celebrate at Cafe Santorini!

column4: 16081 San Dieguito Rd. Rancho Santa Fe, CA  92067
column13: We just LOVE Dolce! It's great fun to bring guests along for their first visit! So HAPPY to have this restaurant in the neighborhood!

column4: 16278 South Pacific Coast Highway Huntington Beach, CA  92649
column13: Good food , good service in an polynesian atmosphere.

The best tables are at the front windows, which you need to request at the time you make a reservation. The view is spectacular!! Service was good but not great, as they are very busy.Food was also good but not great. The calamari appetizer is excellent!

column4: 475 E. Strawberry Drive Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: While the food and service was outstanding, the noise level was unbearable. Unfortunately we selected a Saturday evening that included a loud live band. We had no idea that there was going to be live music when we booked with OT. I'm not sure whether the music is recurring on the weekends but I suggest, if you want a conversation of any type, this is not the place to be! Otherwise our waiter was exceptional with an in depth knowledge of the menu specials as he described at least 6 of them to us. The scallops were incredible! The Chef paid a visit to our table - we were able to find out a little about his impressive background. I would definitely go again, just not when a live band is playing!

column1: Gigi's Asian Bistro and Dumpling Bar
column13: We were a little nervous about our choice of eateries upon entering from the lack-luster Westheimer entrance. The outdoor seating area is not taken care of and the actual door is not obvious. The bar area could use a little face-lift love as well. The main dining area is pretty, decorated with hanging cherry blossom branches. Even though the decor was stimulating, we couldn't get past being able to see out into the mall, which took away from our overall experience. Our waiter was very attentive and promptly served our food. The calamari was perfectly crispy and the cocktails were delicious. The entrees were also very tasty and served steaming hot. 9/10 for food - 10/10 for service. Did not meet our expectations for atmosphere.

Good place and didn't mid us ordering multiple starters. However, the reason we had multiple starters was because we were hungry, the portions are ok but after a day without food you might want to think bigger.

We came across town to celebrate a birthday for lunch, and pretty much rolled out of the restaurant. 1/2 the group had the buffet. We had fried Chicken, sweet potatoes, chicken fried steak, meatloaf,fried catfish, waffles, cornbread mac n cheese, oh did I say waffles? And to top it all off we had peach cobbler. Pomosa for the birthay girl... what more can we ask for? It was the perfect lunch outing.
Great place with great service. Order the mushroom soup!!!

Overall, my first experience at Michel's was great. We went there for my parents anniversary dinner and they sat us on a table close to the beach (nice)! The service was impeccable, the waiter and bussers were all great. It's just that I was a little disappointed in the food. They made the caesar salad at our table and used some ingredients from scratch but the dressing itself was already made. My parents used to come here and loved watching them make the salad from scratch and were a little disappointed they don't do that anymore. I had the special - steak with madeira sauce - it was ok. Should've tried a seafood dish. Cherries jubilee :) They brought out a special decadence cake for my parents, which it turned out they charged us for!
Innovative, beautifully presented creations by Daniel Montuk - great combinations of flavors and textures make this a destination dining experience.
Loved the fresh ingredients on the menu. Also love the weekly changing menu. A great find in Rockwall!
Great place. I brought a group of friends who were impressed. We'll all go back to Scratch!

column4: 6203 Capital of Texas Hwy Austin, TX  78731
column13: Siena has become our favorite Italian restaurant in Austin. Both the food and the service are outstanding!

column4: 122 Vintage Park Boulevard Suite A Houston, TX  77070
column13: I love this place! The food is delicious and service couldn't be better? Prices are reasonable and it's become our favorite place to dine.
Celebrated our friends's 98th BD and had a wonderful time in the private room.

Been here several times over the last few years. Never disappointed in the food or the can't be beat organic beer!!! Great bar and dinner scene for couples, singles and families. What could be finer!!

Everyone in family loved the place. Sat in bar for tropical drinks before dinner. 1944 Mai Tai was super. Watched an awesome sunset, then went in for dinner. Service was great. Food excellent. Would recommend Miso Butterfish, superb.
Outstanding food, service and presentation. They do it right.
Very dark, a bit stuffy, overly formal for my taste.

column4: 423 A Shoreline VIllage Drive Long Beach, CA  90802
column13: This is definitely not a "foodie" place. The food isn't bad, but the real reason to eat here is the beer list, which is excellent.

column1: Buca di Beppo - Excalibur Las Vegas
column4: 3850 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Not impressed with the hostess. No smile and in rush to seat us which was odd because we had such an early reservation there was very few patrons waiting and eating. Our watitress was good overall!

I really enjoy eating at E by SW. On this night our group of 4 was placed at one of the smallest tables in the Thi Food portion of the restaurant. There were many larger tables for 4 that were vacant but they passed them by...

column1: The Falls Prime Steakhouse - Palm Springs
column4: 155 South Palm Canyon Drive Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Dining service and food was very good. Before dinner we went to sit in the beautiful outside bar and got an "attitude" from the main male bartender so we just went in to eat.
I believe this is the best Mexican restaurant in Ventura County. The food is always fresh and well made, and in ample portions. Efficient service, too. A very pleasant place for dinner.

column4: 31 N Tejon St. Colorado Springs, CO  80903
column13: Although it was a bit noisy, the service and food made up for it.

We were visiting from North Carolina and a friend suggested us having dinner at her favorites, House of Nanking or Fang. She claimed they served the best Chinese in San Fran! We were able to make a reservation at Fang. Mr. Fang was awesome! He took our menus from us and just started sending food out. We did let him know that we were there for the "famous" sesame chicken and were not interested in any seafood dishes. Everything we ate was delicious! Also, we enjoyed $4 glasses of wine! Will definitely be back next time we are in town!

column4: 189 The Grove Drive Los Angeles, CA  90036
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Dependable menu, generous portions, comfortable oasis in a crowded LA hotspot

column4: 2600 Campus Dr. Suite B Lafayette, CO  80026
column13: Its countertop service except on Sunday when they will serve you. Food was good, but ambiance disappointing for Easter brunch locale.
One of the best Italian restaurants I know !
All courses were excellent and a great value. Wonderful appetizers. The service was attentive and well timed.

First time to visit Farro's. Risotto and grilled shrimp and peas app was awesome. Great fresh and herby pastas had by all. Great service and delicious Chianti recommendation. We'll be back for reasonable prices and quality Italian food!

column4: 454 East 300 South Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: Good staff, great food, nice ambiance, and a good wine list to boot! Been there before and will be back again. Had a dinner with 10 people and it was perfect!
A fine place but not for us: too noisy for us and though convenient and good service, food was only passable so not a good match.

Took some friends there for their first time. They (and we) will be back. This is a nice quiet place with good Italian food even though I suspect the owner is not Italian. A little too much green onion in the carbonara but otherwise it was fine.

column4: 8980 University Center Lane San Diego, CA  92122
column13: Great food.Everything we ate was delicious.Great service.Very knowledgeable, helpful, always right there, without being intrusive.Enjoyed it a lot!

Dave's was special enough (in a bad way) to merit the time to write this and save you from the experience. They announced multiple meat items that would be available in 20 minutes - since someone had forgotten to start the food cooking in time. When "slow cooked" meat is timed to 10's of minutes, you know it isn't even slow cooked. That should have warned me. More importantly, service was the worst I have ever experienced. Very slow, then the waiter brought the wrong dish. When my friend complained, the waiter said it was OK since he only will charge us for the dish he did bring... Many side items were left out since they ran out of items. Through all this, the service was very slow and remarkably inattentive.
The food is generous and the wait staff very friendly.
really fun and yummy. nice staff. super food.
Great restaurant that is waway from town with great atmosphere, delicious food, and great service.
Great food! Service wasn't stellar as the place was really busy and only one server. Tried the O and G because of Seattle Restaurant Week. Will def come back. Their lamb meatballs were wonderful.
Best Indian food in the valley.
Food was amazing: sea scallops, halibut, prawns and pasta, corn chowder, ravioli. We were all happy with our dishes. Spring Fling drink was yummy! (I had two!!)

First time here and we'll definitely be back. Ceviche was fresh and delicious. Tacos were awesome. 10 yr old at the meatballs and fell in love. Home-made chips and salsas. Margaritas are good and strong. Highly recommend a reservation.

column4: 4480 Paradise Rd, Ste 100 Las Vegas, NV  89169
column13: Been going to Ferraro's since before it relocated. We've never ever had a bad meal or bad experience of any kind. It was our 32nd Anniversary and we chose to celebrate it here. That day's Chef's special included Dover Sole, a favorite of Diane's. In fact, she had been hoping it would be on the menu. Done perfectly and deboned at the table. I ordered the 8 oz filet which was cooked exactly as I ordered. And ... it really was Prime quality. I commented that it was either the best or second best I had in these past several years. We shared a half bottle of Cabernet with dinner. To top it off, they brought us an excellent slice of Tiramisu, unrequested and at no charge, for us to share for our Anniversary.All in all, the evening was splendid

column4: Bellagio Hotel & Casino 3600 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: My first time there,and it met my expectations.I will definitely go back for other special occasions.

While everyone was wonderful at your location the food was average at best. I can say I was a bit disapointed as I give the HIGHEST marks for "Jake's Crawfish". Maybe it was what I ordered or just got a bad round. I don't think I will be dining there again.
Consistently good. Never a shortage of fresh seafood choices.

I checked the reviews before dinning, it had a 4 star rating overall. I wonder how this could be as my rating was 2 stars and we eat out often. It makes me wonder how the reviews are tracked and if they are accurate. I was very disappointed.

We've been to Fresca any number of times and always find the food fun, interesting and totally delicious. It's not fancy. It's not a "dining out" experience but somehow we enjoy it much more than all the "latest greatest" trendy places San Franciscans so seem to love. Among the four of us we tasted all manner of choices on the menu, the Fresca "ensalada", ceviche, paella, scallops and all were delicious, the fried plantain chips addictive. Of special note is an appetizer called 'causa' with tuna tartare, smoked trout, potatoes and some diced veggies. Yummy food, down to earth food or, at least, down to Peru and worth the trip.
Always a favorite stop. The fresh specials were wonderful this time. Fresh produce from the owners farm paired with the freshest fish.

Don't let the pushy woman outside the restaurant scare you away. The views are great (make a reservation so you can sit by the window to watch the pelicans and the seals) and the food is fresh and very well prepared. Family friendly but the noise level is slightly louder.
Great food, good prices, worth checking out!

column4: 982 S. Westlake Blvd. Westlake Village, CA  91361
column13: Great find! Good food ( Hawaiian Ahi, incredible). Service was excellent.

column4: 5100 Clayton Rd Suite A14 Concord, CA  94521
column13: We we seated immediately at a lovely table by the window. Our servers were attentive and helpful. Our dinners were delicious. We will return to this shopping center gem.

Fireside is a unique dining experience. The Raclette cheese served with cured meats (delicious prosciutto), mustards and chutney is the highlight for us. But the roasted lamb is close behind. And this time there was a leg of duck that was to die for. And it is simply amazing how they transform the dining room from a ski resort during the day into a warm restaurant at night. I highly recommend Fireside Dining.
This was some of the best fish I have ever eaten! Excellent! I had the orange roughy and my friend had the Colorado Sea Bass. Both were outstanding! Service was great. I would go there again.

Dramatic art-deco styling in spacious and conveniently located restaurant. Don't think of this as just another hotel restaurant - Five has its own style. The menu is pretty typical (though ambitious) california/french fare. Great cocktails.

column4: 3801 East Coast Highway Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: We had a very enjoyable dinner at the Five Crown Reseraunt. We were celebrating our 60th Wedding Anniversary and were treated with great service and the food was excellent

Celebrated a birthday with dinner at the Five Palms. Location was convenient, dining was romantic, and service was prompt. Everything was wonderful, not to mention the spectacular sunset from the outdoor dining.

column4: 315 First Street Suite 201 Lake Oswego, OR  97034
column13: eVerything about Fivespice exudes YOU - they want YOU to enjoy, partake, request, and come back. Love this place and will definitely go back again and again.

column4: On 6th Avenue between Dolores & San Carlos Carmel-by-the-Sea, CA  93921
column13: Service was excellent, they were attentive and "watched out" for us the entire meal.

Flame aspires to be a premium steakhouse and falls short. My steak was of poor quality, chewy with a number of inedible bites left on the plate. It was prepared "medium" but was requested "medium rare." Given this experience and the prices, Flame is overpriced. My gold standard would be a steakhouse like the Palm. Flame is average with a ways to go to achieve its aspirations. Had an excellent bottle of wine.

column4: 620 E. Flamingo Road Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Superb meal at Roy's and wonderful to leave the Strip for a while (easy bus journey on 202).
We had a nice experience and will probably go back in the future.

column4: 2540 Tenderfoot Hill Street Colorado Springs, CO  80906
column13: Nothing on menu without meat. Excellent server.

column4: 10151 N. Cabrillo Highway El Granada, CA  94018
column13: The ambiance was really nice. Our waiter was friendly, attentive and informed. The food was outstanding. It was a very enjoyable experience. Definitely will be going back often.

The location and seating outside is nice. The coffee and service by Simon was excellent and the food was very typical, please season the eggs! I would recommend as the food is good it is just not great.

column1: Flights Wine and Coffee - A Wine Cafe
column13: Way too expensive for such small portions. Also, would have been nice if someone told us about what we were drinking rather than just giving us a little list.
Great food, a bit spendy but great food.
Loved the food and service! The place is an oasis in a waterfront neighborhood. Calamari is huge and delicious. Gret Cioppino,
We enjoyed our night out in Pacific Heights. Kids enjoyed the restaurant. Wish they had the option for a smaller steak for kids.Sea bass was excellent!!

We took our son for his birthday dinner. The service was good. Our water glasses where filled as needed. The food was good and well prepared. The noise level was low and we were able to have a pleasant visit. I ordered wine and the steam of the glass was very sticky. After bringing it to the attention of the waiter, I was promptly brought another glass, but with less wine then the original.
As you can see most of my ratings are grand! The only thing we didn't like was the vacuum cleaners being used at the end of our meals.

column4: 148 S. Barrington Ave. Los Angeles, CA  90049
column13: Brentwood is always a guaranteed excellent, fun dining experience. Exceptional service.

column4: 22 East 100 South Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: Unfortunately, the Open Table description of this restaurant and its food has nothing to do with Martine's lunch menu. There isn't anything wrong with this menu nor there is anything special about it. One can have exactly the same lunch at any other place.My fault. Me and my wife were looking for a pleasant lunch and I was careless enough not to check the lunch menu on Martine's website. At the restaurant we were disappointed, however, stayed and ate, and the service was good, and the food was not bad, but not what we came for.
What a find! In the middle of nowhere...this is a must stop if you are in the area. Food was excellent as was the service. Ambience is like being out in the French countryside.

column4: 6380 A East Pacific Coast Highway Long Beach, CA  90803
column13: Great restaurant - seems the music got loud a little too soon

No one tells you valet parking is not available until after 6 pm our reservation was at 530 literally we drove around 30 mins trying to find a parking spotWe spent 350.00 for three people and the food was not even fit to take home to the dogWe had crab cake and calamari appetizers the calamari was okWe had spinach salad and tomato mozzarella salad both were okWe had tenderloin with lobster tail sliced on top overlooked sauce wasn't badBoth entrees of filet Oscar were cold and cooked medium rare but were so tuff and without flavor you couldn't eat itThe sides were all cold and clumped because they were cold lobster Mac and geese , au gratin potatoes, creamed spinachNo favor to any of the food bland and all entrees were cold
Excellent at always!!! Great Ribeye with the Carne Asada Rub and Prickley Pear Mararitas!!

column4: 935 East Fort Union Boulevard Midvale, UT  84047
column13: Great Place, our family loved and enjoyed our experience!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Ft. Worth
column13: Highly recommend the cowboy Ribeye Steak - to die for !!!
Food was wonderful and our server, Bonnie, was fabulous.
Great food. Amazing queso. Reasonably priced.

Unfortunatly 2 of the burgers tht were ordered well were red in the middle. Didn't finish and did not seem to bother the staff / manager very much. Very hard for me to send back food when the kitchen already got it wrong.
We really enjoyed our first experience at Frank Fat's. The food was very good, nice atmosphere and excellent service. We will definitely return and have alreay told others of our experience at Fat's.
Slow service, no water bottle refills, had to ask for same drink order three times, and crying children dropping dishes didn't make the night what I thougt it would be, but the food was good.

Ate at Campanula on a Saturday night before seeing Beach Blanket Babylon. Everything was delicious and the service was very good. Our table was right next to the window with a view of colorful and active North Beach.
Consistently one of the very best in the Pearl, or even in Portland!

Great food- and better service. They accommodated our gluten-free needs with no problem. We are from out of town, but they are clearly a popular restaurant with the locals, as we saw several customers arrive that the staff were obviously familiar and friendly with. Would definitely return here.

column4: 55 West 100 South Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Great patio, good food, poor service, almost non existant.

column4: 48 Market Street Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Really good food. Exceptional service.

First time user of Open Table and it couldn't have gone better. We booked a table for 8, arrived 15 minutes early, and everything was ready for us. I expected a larger crowd at 7:30 on a Friday night, but the light turnout only enhanced our experience as the waitstaff was able to meet our needs expeditously. The sea food cheesecake was surprisingly fantastic as I had never put seafood and cheesecake together in my mind. The scallops were done very well. Out of the 8 in our party, and 8 different meals, the only criticism was the bread pudding was slightly on the dry side. The actual presentation was as impressive as the photos on the website. We will be back with more friends next time.

column4: The Adolphus Hotel 1321 Commerce St. Dallas, TX  75202
column13: This is my favorite restaurant for special occasions. It's classy, the food is reliably excellent as is the service. It's expensive but you get what you pay for here.

column4: 1513 South 1500 East Salt Lake City, UT  84105
column13: This was my first time at Fresco after years of my wife and I wanting to go there for a nice dinner date. We loved Fresco! What a gem! Nothing "cuter," as my wife would say, and nothing nicer for a nice date with my wife, as I would say.

I remember coming to this restaurant several years ago and loving the food. So I decided to come back and see if it's still the same. Amazing food and service! If you're in the glendale area and you're in the mood for some good italian. Check this place out!
Pork chop dish was crazy salty. Had to take a bite of potato or beans with every piece. Nicoise salad portion was on the skimpy side
Consistently great food and even better service.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Fresno
column13: The service was outstanding! Probably the BEST service I have ever had. The food was really good, but SO high priced! For me, that put a downer on the whole experience, even though we went there because I had gift cards that I'd received for my birthday. I personally would rather go to somewhere less expensive. I guess I'm not a real "foodie" and just can't see spending that much money on a dinner. And to top it off, the noise level was UNREAL! We couldn't hear each other talk. As we were leaving, we walked through the bar area. It was so much quieter in the bar on a Saturday evening than in the restaurant!

column4: 7844 N. Blackstone Avenue Suite 500 Fresno, CA  93720
column13: Food was fantastic. The service was really slow. An hour and a half to get our salads. The waiter was really nice and knew his food, but the wait to get out of there was about 3 hours.
Great server named Moses! Food was delicious with a great atmosphere. Overall great customer service with fine dining!
The best restaurant in Amarillo - locally owned - wonderful menu - distinct, classy decor - terrific bar - a must!
Food was not as good as we expected, the service was not great and it was fairly loud. The atmosphere is fun and the cocktails and dessert were great.

column1: Fuego at La Posada de Santa Fe
column4: 330 East Palace Ave Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Little on the expensive side, for what you get - but very tasty food. Filet mignon was great.Lovely wines and delicious desserts. Worth a stroll around the hotel to absorb the history and look at the art.
Food was delicious and very inexpensive. I would definately return.

column4: 45 North B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Fusion Peruvian Grill is a hidden neighborhood gem. It's away from the core of downtown, but don't let that deter you from checking it out. The food is FANTASTIC - plentiful, beautifully presented, and truly delicious.

The customer service was absolutely superb. We made reservations for a patio table at 6:45pm. When we arrived we were informed that some guests had been here since 4pm and they had not anticipated them remaining so long. They offered us a free cocktail while they sorted out the situation. We were still seated on the patio by 7:10pm.

Food was very good but bad location. Hard to get into the parking lot and limited parking. Valet was overwhelmed. Inside it was very crowded with tables too close to each other and so loud I had a hard time conducting my business lunch.
Girls Night Out was perfect. The menu and wine selections were good. The food, as well as the service, were excellent.

column4: 452 South Fair Oaks Ave. Pasadena, CA  91105
column13: We travel to Pasadena frequently for weekend get-a-ways. Gale's is just south of the "Old Pasadena" area and was unknown to us. Thanks to OpenTable we found Gales and now have a new favorite place to dine. The menu has a large variety of choices with daily specials. The parmesan incrusted pork chop special is to die for. Gales food is prepared with fresh herbs and other seasonings which shows the imagination of a great chef. We enjoyed our meals so much we ate there the following evening. On both evenings our meals were outstanding. The wine list is fair priced which included some very hard to find Calif wines. If you need to be convinced further, this is where the locals dine.

Good food but in a noisy intersection and poor location. Got there just before the dinner rush so the food wasn't as fresh as it could be for the price we paid. We were the only ones there and the employees were very kind and attentive. Air conditioning also felt like it was broken. For the first time eating Brazilian food, I would give them a second chance during a peak time.

This one of the best dining experiences I have ever had! The food is exceptional especially the...wait for it...sweet breads appetizer. The wait staff is very attentive and the all work together seamlessly. Gar_on is a perfect place to bring your sweetie for a special dinner or a small group of friends to have a great time especially if they appreciate creative and well-prepared food. But make sure to bring a credit card with a nice credit limit because it won't be inexpensive but it will be worth every cent you pay. Bon Appetit!
On July 8th, 2012, my wife and I celebrated our 6th year anniversary at Bucca di Beppo in Anaheim.
clicked on 5 stars but won not take. the staff is always friendly, maitr d is very nice and food great, service is fast or leisure

Every time we've been to Garfield's, the food has been outstanding. Incredible flavors and beautiful presentation. We love being able to sit outside and enjoy a view that makes you feel like you're anywhere but Las Vegas. The quiet, unhurried atmosphere is perfect.
