It was so noisy- We could not hear each other speak.

column1: Vitrine - St Regis Hotel San Francisco
column4: 125 Third Street 4th Floor San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: They have great customer service. No matter how picky you might be, they are very concerned about your enjoyment of your meal. We enjoyed ourselves a lot on that morning.
We were in Santa Fe for a month and ate there 4 times, so obviously we like it. All the waitstaff do a good job, but the hostesses are really outstanding in accommodating our seating requests.

column4: 111 West 4th Street Suite 15 Ft. Worth, TX  76102
column13: This was an incredible dining experience. We had two waiters, one of which was in training. We had great interaction with both and they were amazing. They were very fun and entertaining. We were unsure of what to get since only 1/2 of us had ever done fondue. The training waiter took over and made great suggestions to help us plan our meal. He made excellent wine and beer suggestions that complimented the food nicely. We were there over 3 hours and it seemed like 45 minutes. This is due to fact that we were having such a great time! The waiters were very patient with us every step of the way. Now, on to the food. The appetizers were amazing! The main course was so filling and dessert was heavenly! You need to eat here, but with a group!
The experience was phenomenal! Great food, great service, and great atmosphere. Had a great time.
There wasn't anything special about the restaurant. I was hoping for something a bit nicer than a regualr mexican food restaurant, but I would have had a good of any experience and food as Macayo's.

My Dad and I came for dinner before seeing The Hunger Games movie.I am 16 and my dad is 47. He has had Indian food before, but I have not, so he let mechoose the restaurant. I eat all types of ethnic food and I am a good eater...I had a great time at Gateway To India...The food was awesome and I was able to talk with my Dad and catch up without it being too noisy. I asked Mom to make our reservation and it worked out great on Open Table! We will be back! Emily Meyer, age 16,Gig Harbor, WA
The food and service were god, but the view and the property are outstanding. Great place to celebrate a special occasion or yours have a great meal with a great view.

Our party of 4 all enjoyed the food and the selection was excellent. Have been there multiple times and always have a pleasant experience. The waite staff was very attentive but not overly so which sometimes I find a problem in upscale restaurants.We all had something different and each was very good.

column4: 7401 Lone Star Drive, Suite B120 Plano, TX  75024
column13: We love the beer and the burgers, great atmisphere

column4: 10720 South Holiday Park Drive 160 West Sandy, UT  84070
column13: We love Carvers...it is always a good treat when we go there for special occations!
Extremely noisy and busy with large parties. Fair service and fair food. I knew they had a vegetarian menu but it was never offered. I had to ask for it.

First time guest and was very impressed! Excellent food and service and was pleasantly surprised by the entertainment, which was wonderful. We can't wait until they reopen in September! Thank you for a very enjoyable evening.

column4: 255 N. First Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Everything was great. Got a table on the corner, was lil bit too dark so we needed candle which dod not really help that much. Great german food!

column4: 9001 Santa Monica Boulevard Los Angeles, CA  90069
column13: I went there for a quick meal with a friend. We had surf and turf, and a glass of wine. It was all fine, not outstanding but the meat was well prepared and the lobster wasn't overcooked. We had a booth on the side so didn't get a sense of the whole restaurant which was winding down by the time we came in at 9:30. Our waiter was friendly and provided a good service to us. It was a bit pricey given we only had one course.

Great location, view and restaurant floor plan...but the facility needs to be enhanced if to be taken really seriously. The wooden floors and poor ceiling acoustics make the place sound very noisy, like a military cafeteria. Interior look is pretty drab, most notably the fake half columns, only to be made up for by the window views. Again, this is another Temecula, volume oriented, operation that lacks intimacy and personality. Too bad...

column1: Glen Ellen Inn Oyster Grill & Martini Bar
column13: The outdoor patio area is a beautiful area to dine. Our waiter was attentive, but not intrusive. My only criticism would be that the reviews and our waiter all said that the petite filet was the best dish on the menu. Out of a party of 6, 3 of us ordered it for that reason and we were all disappointed. It was good, but not remarkable. I would definitely go again, but that would not be what I would order. The breads were outstanding!
Enjoyed the evening. First time at 1515 and was quite impressed. Will be back.

column4: 450 Marsh Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: The Ciopinno was very good. The Oso Bucco was good but could use something other than saffron rice with the dish. That made it too heavy overall. Waitor described a crab soup as a special. I expected some crab in it but it was just all liquid. Maybe I did fully understand the description.
Amazing view of the beach from the terrace seating, delicious cuisine, excellent service!!!

column4: 2000 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89104
column13: Amazing, but we had a booth rather than a table right in front of the window would have pref'd the window seat but wasnt asked apart from this amazing!!!!!!! Special mention to Doug our waiter, lovely friendly and nothing was to much trouble, great night thanks sooo much, x

Frankly I was disappointed.Several friends have enthusiastically recommended it. The amount of food was above average.Presentation average. The waiter was attentive,order delivery time average. I might go back once to confirm my impression,but there are better places to eat,closer to home,Desserts looked good,but priced high.Everything seemed Very SALTY. Sorry!

The food is very good and has the genuine taste of the german dishes. The wiener schnitzel is absolutely awesome. Try to avoid the pick hours when it can be crowded and when they fall short of waiting staff.
Excellent dinner selections and the food was outstanding.
Food was wonderful had the best table in the bar. and the singer on Saturday was delightful. We had a great evening.
The food, service, ambiance and wine were excellant.

The selection of beer is very good. I was a little let down on the food however it could have the choices made that night. Service could have been better. We waited almost 20 minutes just to get the credit card processed. A little slow for me on the service.
This really is one of the best spots under Larimer Square. Visit, enjoy and relax- the city stops and the food and team are amazing.

The food has always been excellent, but this is a very noisy restaurnat! Especially when the mariachis begin playing, which while fun in sparing amounts can be overbearing when the linger too long in one section, which they frequently do. Surprisingly, the margaritas on our last vist were sub-par, the house VERY sour and the cadillac over-marnier'ed AND the server got them wrong, delivering the Cadillac to my wife and the house to me. Also the cadillac was served in a standard glass tumbler, not the bowl it typically deserves. In fairness we typically get great margaritas here but these were extremely dissapointing, and the service was so poor we didn't get the chance to notify the server.

column1: Morels French Steakhouse & Bistro - Las Vegas
column4: 3325 Las Vegas Boulevard South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: WE WERE A PARTY OF 5 AND ENJOYED THE COMPANY VERY MUCH, WE ENJOYED SO MUCH WE WENT FOR BREAKFAST THE NEXT MORNING!!! WE WERE STAYING IN THE PALAZZO HOTEL, BEAUTIFUL

column4: 7570 Royal Street East Park City, UT  84060
column13: Food not as good as expected but good. Selection surprisingly limited. Service outstanding. Was special occasion (80th birthday) as noted when made reservation. Expected at least a candle on the $10 desert, but nothing.
We've been going to Momo'sfor years...the food is consistently excellent,atmosphere, very pleasant and the staff WONDERFUL.
Love the french fries. Sonora salad was great.
loved it - everytime we have been back we make depot hotel our first nite out

Great environment to enjoy conversation with friends. Service was very personal and real. There was no push to hurry up and get you in and out. The end result was I enjoyed a relaxing evening out with an excellent selection of varied dishes. I definitely will have to return to try more dishes as well as the numerous wine selections. Whenever I dine, I enjoy the surprises you get when you try the specials of the day. I tried the Penne Gianfranco dish and truly enjoyed my meal with a smile.

column4: 2224 E Williams Field Road Gilbert, AZ  85295
column13: We had a great time and wonderful food as usual
Gilda's is one of the best Italian restaurants in Portland...while the service can be a little too slow, it is usually worth the wait for any of Marco's pasta dishes.

column4: 7500 E. Doubletree Ranch Road Hyatt Regency Scottsdale Resort and Spa at Gainey Ranch Scottsdale, AZ  85258
column13: It was just O'kay...Our server was great but messed up twice on our food and added extra drinks to our tab (which is always awkward to point out).

Servers were attentive and very cordial. Hostess had no problem accomodating my request for a table for 4 even though we were a couple.Presentation and cuisine were outstanding. Had dinner on first night; then returned for lunch the following day.
The food was very good and the service was very personable right down to the handshake and thank-you on the way out the door. Felt it was a bit on the expensive side, but no regrets.

The dishes were overpriced...$26 for a sole entree! Service was spotty and too "familiar" for the type of establishment this restaurant trys to be. No explanation came about why our wine was so slow in coming to the table. Then the sommelier arrived saying the service person came back from the cellar with a Margaux. Give me a break. The waiter could have explained about the delay, but was too busy walking around. The wine list was limiting, but interesting. This is not a restaurant to frequent more than every five years. Professionalism needs to be taught to the service staff.
Very disappointing. Crowded, loud, reminded us of a slightly fancy Denny's. The fried calamari appetizer was overcooked, as was the linguine in CANNED clam sauce. We expected better.

column4: 6770 N Sunrise Blvd Suite G-211 Glendale, AZ  85305
column13: When you walk in and the first person you see is the hostess and she can't even greet you with a smile it turns you off completely! I even tried to joke with her and nothing! It was 115 outside and she asked us if we wanted to sit outside... Really? Then she seats us and plops down the menus and walks away! Our waiter took his time to get to our table he was ok nothing special. Once we received our sushi it was sub par nothing great I think for the price it should of been a whole lot better, presentation was sloppy. The vegi ramen was great but my teriyaki salmon was horrible. I would try it again to see if things are better and only order the soup. They really need a nice hostess that knows customer service and knows how to smile.
We love the lasagna. It is our favorite and we gothere especially to have it. Yummm.
Chamberlain's Fish Market Grill is a great value. I think it is one of the very best restaurants for the money in DFW. Very good atmosphere, great food and very reasonable prices.

Incredible service, best steak I have ever had. The evening was to celebrate a birthday. It was perfect from start to finish and it was due to Morton's. The personalized menu and complimentary photo were a great touch.

column4: 1641 W. Sunflower Avenue Santa Ana, CA  92704
column13: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner at Morton's - delicious food, attentive service, and great ambiance. The staff went out of their way to make it special evening for us!

I've been going to Morton's now for a couple of years. And I have loved it until I went this last Friday which was July 20th. I usually get the steak and seafood. I found that that Morton's had went up on there dish which I didn't like. But they also took away some food or decreased the portion size. So they increased the price and took away food. That's not right. I spoke to the manager a woman aNd she pretty much told me that it was corporate that changed it and that dish was made for the less fortunate during the economy fall. So that was rude. I felt she was calling my poor. I spend 160 dollars. And she called me poor. I won't be going to Morton's anymore.

column4: 311 Washington Blvd. Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: Fun haven't been there in a long time. Food was greater

We loved the atmosphere; moderately quiet,not distracting; The steak was just right, tender, succulent, and just enough for out pallet; spinach salad was great, and the dessert, chocolate mousse, carrot cake was outstanding; the service was spectacular; what a great dining experience; will be coming back soon.

column4: 13509 Highland Park Blvd. Oklahoma City, OK  73120
column13: Okay, when they first opened there were a few things that needed some improvement! However, it would be a shame not to give this restaurant another try! Because Avanti is nearby we decided to give it another try after a couple of disappointing incidents when they first opened. This is one of the finest restaurants in this city. Several months ago I tried the Lemoncello Chicken on the menu! Since then I have returned over and over again to satisfy my craving for it. Recently I tried the Tarragon Seafood on Orzo. Shrimp, scallops, langoustine, and spinach and roma tomatoes! Now I will have a real problem deciding what to order and what to try next. Give them a try. I would put their food up against any restaurant in OKC!
Great cheese bar. Service could not be better.
Service, food, drinks and ambiance were excellent.

The night we dined there, the sommelier was somewhat snooty, which took some of the gloss off of their overall service. Otherwise, I highly recommend this neighborhood find to whoever enjoys fine dining without pretension.

Party of 7 and we had a wonderful evening in the garden. Food was great, drinks were great and staff kept us comfortable. Perfect summer dining. Also, kitchen was willing to accommodate my food allergies with a delicious variation on a menu item.
Pleasant service. Really bland salad (Pulled chicken). Dark inside, cramped table against a post, ambiance is cold metal feeling.

We booked through Open Table and had to wait for about 15 mins to be seated because our table wasn't ready. The service was painfully slow. The food was ok, but the mashed potatoes tasted like it had waited too long under the heating lights or maybe reheated. It was a bit disappointing as it was recommended to me as one of the best restaurants in Capitola.
As usual, the ribs were perfect
Good food....but very loud inside.

asked the waitress for reading glasses (to read menu), she immediately replied that the restaurant doesn't provide reading glasses. Then I asked the reception for glasses, & they gave me 2 pairs to try on. The waitress isn't customer friendly, the worst I had for years. This is my 5th time at the restaurant in the past 3 months, all prior waiters (all guys) were great.need to change their computer setting. For 6 people dinning, 20% tips was added to the bill already, but the restaurant also ADDED TAX ON TIPS.Due to live band, restaurant was super noisy, difficult to hear each other talking.

column4: 415 West Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924
column13: Everything but the service was great!! Our waiter was very slow and inattentive. He seemed to be more interested in going home than doing his job. 25 minutes before closing the couple who were seated next to us were told to hurry up and give him their order as the kitchen was about to close!!!!! We have been to this restaurant many times as it is very close to our vacation home in Carmel Valley. In the past it has always been excellent in all areas.
The evening was delightful. A couple of people raved about their meals, I on the other hand thought everything was far too saucy. The old Cafe Madrid did not have meals with HEAVY sauces.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Hotel Park City
column13: My wife and I enjoy eating at Ruth's Chris Steak Houses when we travel. We are accustomed to having filets that are buttery and melt in your mouth. The filets that we ordered were sizzling on the plate when they arrived. However, my wife's medium well filet had no pink and my medium filet had to be chewed too much. While the filets would have been exceptional at another restaurant, at Ruth's Chris Steak House they were only good. We will continue to enjoy filets at the next travel stop with a Ruth's Chris Steak House.
Don't order the Asian Black Cod. Not good here.

My prime rib was just okay, but still pretty tasty. I think mainly because it wasn't particularly warm, I knocked a couple of stars off the food. Also, the place is in need of a rehaul. The '70s architecture and theme were great for everyone, but the '70s was the '70s and I'm sorry, but as disco and cocaine are out, so should be the decor. But since I never was into disco or cocaine, and I have young kids who love airplanes (okay, me too), this was a great place for them to watch incoming flights into LAX and for me to see some really cool old planes. I got some great photos also, if that is what you're into. Kids had a great time and because that is all I care about, overall this is a 4-star restaurant. Thanks.

We made early dinner reservation and request for window table to view the water. Three sides of the restaurant have bay view. We were the first to be seated and were given the southwest corner window with a great view of San Fran and the Bay and also romantic for myself and my gal. The service we experienced was great. Everyone was friendly, the manager came by several times to ensure our meal was meeting our expectations. A lady at a nearby table made a request for a crab cocktail not on the menu and her request was accomodated. To me, that is a sign of great service. As far as the food, we felt it was delicious, well prepared, and unpretentious. I felt as though the staff really cared. I would recommend!!!

column4: 670 N Kendall Drive San Bernardino, CA  92407
column13: Brunch was delicious, service was courteous and helpful, would recommend to friends and family.
ERarly evening dinner. The buffet was outstanding with great prime rib, seafood, etc. Waiter very attentive and helpful. Wonderful view of the Port turning basin, tugs, cargo ships and barges.

My first trip to San Francisco and I wanted to eat somewhere not too expensive on the waterfront. This was a great spot, it required driving across the Golden Gate Bridge and nice drive on the other side. The outdoor seating are is very pleasant in spite of an occassional encroachment by a seagull or pigeon.The food was good and the service commendable. The only complaint was that we ordered a pitcher of margaritas and were brought the frozen variety, expecting on the rocks. She didn't ask if we wanted the frozen (and we neglected to specify)All in all a pleasant evening.
The food was Ok but not worth the price.

column4: 230 Point of the Pines Colorado Springs, CO  80919
column13: We took a friend from out of town to dinner. The view is terrific and the food wasgood. Nice wine list, good service. They didn't have decaf coffee and the waitress was apologetic. We couldn't tell if they were really out of it or if they just didn't want to make a pot for two cups.I would take anyone there as it is a lovely place and the food is good and the ambiance isoutstanding for colorado springs.

column1: The Grand Oak Steakhouse and Bar
column13: The food was great and the ambience wonderful. Our waitress was not good at all. She was rude and seemed mad. We couldn't figure out what was going on. She had a lot of tables but she doesn't need to take it out on the customers. Specially at a restaurant like this. She forgot my husband's drink. When we were done eating, we stared at our plates for about fifteen minutes before anyone ever came to take them. The waitress didn't bother to check on us during dinner. She took our desert order and brought us our coffee. Then she disappeared again, we just couldn't find her half the time. I think for a restaurant like this, they need more wait staff. The food is always exceptional.
Food was very good - the mussels served in a very flavorful broth, generous quantities of fresh green arugula with the steak, the swordfish surprisingly and attractively presented in a bowl.

Just not very good at all. The picture is slighty deceiving, nothing more than a take out place with a few tables. Would easily forgive the decor if the food was good..... The Alfredo sauce was from a jar, there was absolutely no way it was homemade. How can an Italian restuarant serve canned alfredo sauce? We waited nearly an hour for our food to arrive, with only 1 other table taken in the restaurant. The food did not come out at the same time. I would sadly say, just avoid this place.
Above average Denver sushi restaurant with nice Happy Hour pricing.

I was very disappointed that the wonderful salads I had read about in a review in our local paper were only available at lunchtime. That was the purpose of my visit this time. My grandson and I were the only people in the place, which was not a real pleasant experience.
Always a treat to visit everytime I am in Vegas. My favorite steakhouse.
But the bottle of wine was unexpectidly very expensive... we were not told.... Next time will be asking ahead,,,, otherwise, we like the booking online and the servise was excellent !!!Thank You
Food and service remarkably good. Only downside is noise level when crowded. Hard surfaces on walls and ceiling provide no damping.
We enjoyed our anniversary dinner here very much. The salmon was wonderful!
consistently good. host/owner very good

location location locationFood was only passing the last couple times here. Used to be so good.Worst was when they ran out of bread and set a plate of hamburger buns on the table and expected us to not know they were hamburger buns. It was great for a laugh though.

column4: 1126 Morro St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: Great spot for tapas and drinks. I would of given it a five had it not been undergoing construction.
Very sad that Grand Cafe will be moving from their current location as it has great ambiance and convenient for downtowners.

It just keeps delivering week and week. I think I have been there 4 Fridays this summer espcially with their promotion of 50% off wines by the bottle.The locally grown produce is magically transformed to delight the most discerning diner and the entrees present a solid selection of meats, fish , poultry.And I really appreciate them allowing one to order from the bar bistro menu for those times when an entree is too much.I sat there watching the "mixed" milieu outside and thought this place reminds me of being in NYC.

column4: 2230 Shelter Island Dr San Diego, CA  92106
column13: Started off with happy hour beverages. What a delight and a treat. We had appetizers through the night with great company and remained out on the balcony for several hours. Wonderful views, very good food and service.

We had a small group (4) for a business dinner. One of the attendees had been to the restaurant for group events before. Unfortunately the server was less than attentive, despite there being a very light attendance at the restaurant. After the cocktails were served, service fell off dramatically. Appetizers were served and it was evident that she put the dinner orders in right away and wanted to hurry up with the entrees. One of the attendees used to own a restaurant and was very disappointed. We selected the restaurant based on other reviews, but will not return.

The food was outstanding. My husband likes steak/chicken while I prefer seafood. Excellent choices for both of us. The shrimp scampi was wonderful and the pecan crusted chicken breast was perfectly cooked and flavorful. Service was timely and friendly. Love the wine list.

We enjoyed the Indian food very much, and our first visit to their Studio City locationwhile we had only been to the Woodland Hills location before. We also learned some of their fabulous cooking is done by their talented Grandmother in the kitchen! The food was delicious!
The food was very good and the staff was very nice. I'd go back for seconds.

column4: Hilton Bayfront 1 Park Boulevard San Diego, CA  92101
column13: Jorge was the prefect waiter and the chefs preparation was top rate. Food options should keep the vast majority very happy. Portion size was perfect to make it a dinning experience vice a stuffing. Mai tai was great.
Food is always excellent at Etta's. I wasn't too fond of getting charged for bread. Our server was too serious. She didn't smile even once.

column4: 1535 NE Butte Road Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: We add reservation for 5:30 and we were the only ones dining the entire time. Nobody else there. We felt like we had to whisper. No music either.

column1: The Grill on the Alley - Beverly Hills
column13: The Grill is definitely at the top of my restaurant list --- I love it. Consistently great!!!

column4: 129 E. Fremont Street The Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino Las Vegas, NV  89101
column13: Such a great place to eat. We go here every year with our kids.

column4: 1020 N. San Vicente Blvd West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: NOTE- It must be noted that Boxwood Cafe and Gordon Ramsay's is NOT owned by Gordon Ramsay. The restaurant was sold by Ramsay in late 2009 to The London hotel, who had permission to keep the "Gordon Ramsay" name, despite his lack of involvement in the restaurant and menu. Do NOT expect Ramsay quality food.
Really terrific staff...bartenders were great, waitstaff was excellent! Food was perfectly prepared! Delicious!
Great food, good service and very nice place to dine. Food was served very fast, and the service was attentive and friendly.
My wife and I love the ambiance at Gregg's
Tender prime rib; however, lacking in flavor. The kitschy atmosphere is fun for what it is, but the overall dining experience leaves something to be desired. Weird wait staff and sub-par food.
Went on a wednesday, so the place was pretty quiet. Close proximity seating was pleasant, we met a nice couple and chatted for a few minutes. potential to get loud on a busy night.

column1: Bistro Alex at Hotel Sorella CityCentre
column13: The food was excellent and prepared perfectly. The filet was tender, well seasoned and perfectly cooked. The duck breast was outstanding. The macaroni and cheese was disappointing, though.

Good food, fish was exceptional. Ordered a Jordan Cab, which they didnt have, brought out a replacement Chianti that was good-- but would have been better if I was able to choose the replacement. Wine inventories seem to be permanently outdated in a lot of establishments, be wary if wine selection is why you're going.

i took my mom for her birthday,to the steak house. The server did not look at us in the eyes. she just mentioned her name,& asked what we want to drink. We gave her are order. Someone else brought us our drinks after a long wait. furthermore the food was ok i ordered the prime rib. it was not salted enough for me. my mom had the salmon. she said it taste good but the portion was small. anyway not the best birthday,but we where there two years ago had a great time then. like the view.
simple food done well. try the succatash with okra, unusual and very good

column4: 925 W John Carpenter Fwy Irving, TX  75039
column13: Eaten there a few times over the last month. Definitely a little on the pricier side given location, but sushi is very good and well prepared

While this is "fine dining" in a small town with limited options, it is not the best place in the area. The service was slow, and the food was good but not at a good value considering the portion size and cost. This is a place you go to if you do not care about the cost and you want a good glass of wine with your meal. There is an extensive wine list.
Sommelier Brian Kalliel is world-class. Well beyond knowing his wine, he is funny, personable, and a joy to spend time with.
Great service and food. Cant wait to go back

column4: 223 Twin Dolphin Dr Redwood City, CA  94065
column13: Great ambiance. Food is hit and miss for dinner. The ceviche is excellent--generous serving of shrimp (promised crab but mostly shrimp) don't expect it to have much heat. The halibut on the spa menu sounded promising. The serving was generous--so generous I found it challenging to believe that the sauteed zucchini, quinuoa, and halibut was less than 300 calories. Very tasty and unfortunate that the halibut was overcooked. My guest's New York steak was supposed to be medium rare and was medium rare only at one end of the steak and medium well at the other. The service was oddly uneven. Not many people dining there, plenty of staff and still we waited unusually long to order, then the waiter did not serve our food--the knife was knocked down.

column4: 606 North Robertson Blvd. West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: So this was my first time at Sur. It is definitely not be my last. Last time i was in LA, I tried the Lounge next door and it was a little bit more happening than the restaurant, but still good. For starters, the shrimp/crab crab cakes were the bomb! I wanted like 8 more! For dinner I had the Chicken Enchiladas with here incredible. The staff was nice, ambience was nice, and the bill at the end wasn't too bad. It's definitely not cheap, but not so bad. Will go back probably a few more times when I visit LA.
Went to the new location on 17th for my husbands birthday. Awesome crab cakes, tilapia was amazing , service was great. We will be back for sure.

column4: 1400 Research Forest Drive The Woodlands, TX  77381
column13: A year ago, I would have highly recommended this place. As a matter of fact, I took some friends there because of the experience we had previously. But this time was not nearly the experience we had in the past. We made a reservation and we still had to wait 15 - 20 minutes for a table. While well flavored, most of the steak was dry. The parmesean pork and sausage is still excellent though. The waiter was nice, but long stretches of time would pass between the servers visits to the table. My husband and I left feeling that we would not return.
This is an average steakhouse. I probably wouldn't drive out of my way to go back.

If you're in the mood for a nice glass of wine with dinner, stick with an Italian place - Ethiopian "wine" is awful. Staff here is very sweet and genuine but there is a language barrier and no real sense of customer service. Food WAS great, though...

column1: Hachi Japanese Fusion Sushi & Sake Lounge
column4: 1711 W. El Camino Real #B Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: Terrible parking situation, so try to car pool. Food was pretty good, but I would stick to the main food strips nearby next time. I'm unlikely yo return.

The food was quite good, however they were out of the Halibut that night ( as well as iced tea). The atmosphere is vibrant. Our service was fair at best. The waitress was not attentive at all, rarely stopped by the table to check on drinks/food/etc. A good find right near Elliott Bay book company.

column4: 3333 Bear Street, Suite 320 Costa Mesa, CA  92626
column13: The food was excellent and the service was superb. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

column4: 101 Golf Course Drive Rohnert Park, CA  94928
column13: Third time here. great food each time. friendly and attentive staff.

column4: 22195 El Paseo, Ste 110 Rancho Santa Margarita, CA  92688
column13: I got the grilled artichoke, which was amazing. It was so good I could have ordered another one. And then the edamame which also was amazing. And for the main course I got the pork chop with bacon cheddar mashed potatoes and it was incredible. Everything about Hanna's was outstanding. The food, the service, and the scene is worth every penny. I will definitely be coming back to Hanna's!!
Excellent food, nearly empty on a Friday eve around 9PM. Not fancy, but finding ANY restaurant in SF where you can actually talk is noteworthy.

We have been going to the Orange Hill Restaurant for many years and in particular when we have visitors from abroad as we did on Thursday night. We have always loved the gorgeous view and beautiful setting of the restaurant, but for the past two occasions that we have been there, the food has not been good and certainly not up to the standard it was a few years ago. We decided after eating there on Thursday night it was our last visit to the restaurant.

This was the second time we ate at Harissa in the past two weeks, because we love the food! The pilaf is excellent, the spices on the kebabs are very tasty. We really like the caesar salad too, which is not too heavy on the dressing. Service is very good, and the ambiance in the restaurant is nice. Highly recommended!

Perfect in every way except one, and it is a shame to have to focus on the negative, but how else will you know?When I arrived on time for my reservation, my friend was late, due to traffic. The hostess seated me, and I told her my name and that of my friend. She assured me she would tell her when she arrived.Some 20 minutes later the lady arrived and was told there was no knowledge of either her or me. She was lost and confused. When she contacted me by phone I guided her to my table. Then when I queried the receptionist, it turned out she has relieved the former one but received no information about me waiting for her or her needing to be directed to me. My friend was greatly stressed. Spoiled her time with me.

Hatcho is a my favorite sushi restaurant in Santa Clara. The owners are warm and hospitable. There are some tatami dining areas, including a room with a western table for more private occasions. The food is VERY good. I ordered the chirashi. It was well presented (they take it up a notch with the use of Japanese lacquer plates) and the rice was perfect.

There were four of us in our dinner party, we all ordered something different off the menu and all of us loved each item at the table. The wait staff was very friendly and attentive and the ambiance of the restaurant was just perfect.

column4: 1131 Back Bay Drive Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: Except for the poor bar service our dining experience was very good. It took us 20 min. to get cocktails and they were not difficult drinks.
We had stopped frequenting the restaurant due to the food choicees. There is a new chef and the food is great. It is a great place that really lets you know you are in Hawaii.
Excellent ambiance in a beautiful historic building. Food portions are smaller but so is the price. Great food and service.
Always an eclectic meal and experience!
Our Tapas meal was lousy!!! The meatballs were swimming in grease. The chicken (on skewers) were dry as the desert!!!
Their reconstruction of the black forest cale is DELICIOUS! Dinner was great too! Maybe it's time to enter Iron Chef - winner is creativity, visual and taste'
With my reservation , I was greetedat the front desk and immediatelytaken to my table. Food was uniquewith complex flavors and freshness.Service was impeccable. Will definitelybe back.

column4: 9201 East Lake Hefner Pkwy Oklahoma City, OK  73120
column13: The view and service made up for the so-so food. However, I must mention this was our first visit. We will definitely be back to try something different. The filet was mediocre at best.
This restaurant is out of business. I made a reservation online and went to the restaurant but it does not exist. This should be removed from Open Table.
Great restaurant!!! Loved the food, drink and Tom the bartender.
FANTASTIC Irish food! Have found none better. Service is great bartender can build a perfect Guiness!

column1: Brendan's Irish Pub & Restaurant - Agoura Hills
column4: 30315 Canwood St., Ste #1 Agoura Hills, CA  91301
column13: Wonderful comfort food. Leave your diet at home!
it was a very good overall experience

column4: 3413 Cahuenga Blvd West Los Angeles, CA  90068
column13: Loved the games. Food and beer were great.

I am Italian and moved to Seattle from Italy 12 years ago. This is undoubtedly the best Italian restaurant in town.Don't expect "Americanized Italian". No fettuccine Alfredo or meat balls.This is what you should expect from fine Northern Italian cuisine.Try Piadina and Gnocco Fritti, the speciality from Romagna.The Italian wine list is simply unmatchable and has great wines also at $25!

column4: 672 S. La Brea Ave. Los Angeles, CA  90036
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: The food is unreasonably greasy.
The Food and service were great. I brought my parents here and they loved it.

column4: 1555 S. Palm Canyon Dr. Ste H-101 Palm Springs, CA  92260
column13: Always an outstanding experience. The overall best restaurant in Palm Springs.
I found this place from Unique Eats and made it a destination on our trip. It was the best meal I've ever had and loved the vegan and gluten free choices!

column4: 9111 W. Olympic Blvd Beverly Hills, CA  90212
column13: Food was amazing! It's a small caribbean restaurant on a busy street but parking is available in the rear. Great service and very flavorful food. I don't like spicy but was pleasantly surprised I had many options to choose from.

We went there to enjoy a traditional German menu. There were people in my party that were skeptical, but they were very pleased with their meals. The food was wonderful - our waitress was great; even with the kids! Great time - Glad we went!

It was very busy, noisy, but fine for our large group. The food was good, even the kids found something they really enjoyed. Okinawa sweet potatoes a unique and delicious side. Ribs fall off the bone tender and the fish was fresh and delicious.

column1: Tierra Sur at Herzog Wine Cellars
column13: If you like big portions, this is the place for you. I would have liked a steak option that was smaller.

column4: Waldorf Astoria Laquinta Resort & Spa 49-499 Eisenhower Dr. La Quinta, CA  92253
column13: Service and the food is always great. Best Mexican food and setting in the Valley

We went for my husband's birthday. He wanted steak and since I was surprizing him with tickets to Cirque du Soliel (at H&H) I thought it would be a perfect place. Little did I know he'd order stuffed halibit (go figure) and I ordered my restaurant staple, salmon. Both were fantastic. We ate on the outside patio which could get a bit noisy but it was an early dinner (for the 8pm show) and foot traffic seemed lighter than usual. Our table "greeter host" was a hoot (picking up on my sarcasm when he asked if we'd like to share some sort of sparkling water and me commenting that we'll share a pitcher of tap water instead). The real surprize was that our waitress delivered dessert and a Happy Birthday card. Loved the little touch.

I haven't been to hi-life since I've had kids and it's because I remembered being a nicer restaurant than a kid-friendly place would be. I require a lot of friendliness because I have 2-year-old twins. But, a friend told me it's actually very kid-friendly and they were right! We had a great time and the food and wine were very good.

I wasn't impressed with the limited menu. If I had known all but 3 items were fish I wouldn't have selected the Crows Nest. I marked the service down only because it took forever to get our food and about 40 min for desert. The wait staff was very nice.
One can never go wrong at this restaurant, especially for dinner in the summer on their patio.

column1: High Steaks - Thunder Valley Casino Resort
column13: Had a 6:30p reservation before a 8p show at the casino resort. We weren't seated until 7:15p and then the waiter didn't come until 7:30p. When we checked in, we let them know we had concert tickets. They seemed unconcerned. We were not able to eat. Would not recommend dining here before a show -- eat somwhere not at the casino resort!
anti romantic. Probably just this particular evening.
A local gem! Really diverse beer selection and delicious! Will definitely eat here again.
Tasty meal! Great live music! Great ambiance!

column4: 327 Newport Center Drive Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: Came here dining with my French husband and kids.Food was very good for $19 menu good luck to find a better price at Newport Beach.The service was also good, they served my kids first.We are a French family from Newport Beach and will be back to help Chef Pascal during the construction.Oups, i forget for $10 or $19 menu on top of that, they have Live music and complimentary parking.

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - Anaheim
column13: The food servers and hosts are VERY friendly and attentive. The food: uneven. My husband's Cobb salad was generously portioned, and the chicken was perfectly cooked - moist and flavorful. My shrimp and grits: not so much. This dish had a cayenne-ish heat: blistering throughout, with little flavor added. The flatbread we ordered was quite good. Just be careful what you order.The bar service: quite slow. It seems a drink we'd ordered was "artisanal" (I just thought they were busy). I think if drinks require special ingredients like fresh ginger, prep it PRIOR to opening the bar. The dining room IS the bar, so if it's a romantic evening this is not the place. However, as pre-concert eating at the venue goes, MUCH better than other places.

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - San Diego
column13: Unfortunately, I can't recommend too much based on our recent experience at Crossroads. It is convenient if you are attending a show at the House of Blues and they have a good beer selection for just $3 during happy hour, but that's where my positive review ends. The service was really slow. There were multiple billing errors and the food was just "ok".

column4: 1015 Alameda De Las Pulgas Belmont, CA  94002
column13: All dishes experienced are vary good. Good value. Friendly staff. Rarely a wait. Definitely recommended. One of my favorites.

Phone # listed is wrong, should be 541-593-8880. The made-at-our-table guacamole was very good. My halibut tacos were excellent. Good service. A step above the typical Mexican restaurant. Beautiful setting right on the Deschutes River.

I gave a poor rating for service because when I first arrived I stood at the front desk waiting to be acknowledged or greeted but never was. It was not until an older couple (60's) walked in when the "gentleman" at the front desk greeted them and asked if they needed seats. They responded "yes". The "greeter" said "okay, we will be with you right away". Thats when I stepped between the couple and the greeter and said "excuse me, I was here before them." The couple said Oh, i'm sorry. It was not there fault. They didn't know the greeter hadn't greeted or acknowledged me yet. The lady seating us looked at the greeter and his response to her was "well give him a seat". He never greeted or acknowledged me. Was it because I am a black man?
The perfect spot for a great dinner before a movie!
Best high class place in Utah county. The dining experience is elegant with great customer service. Lastly the food is worth the money you will spend.
Our favorite restaurant in Logan!

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: This is one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants.
Celebrated my 55th Bday with some friends. Had a wonerful time . Food was fabulous. Thanks for the $10. off coupon. We will be back.

column1: the restaurant at the Royal Sonesta Hotel Houston
column13: I had dinner when it changed to Royal Sonesta, great service, great food,

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Houston
column13: The staff was outstanding as usual...hostesses, wait staff, are bartenders are all exceptional. We had a great time.
Everything was great! including Brian bringing my Credit Card all the way to our Hotel after closing.They all go the extra mile! Kudos!!!

column4: 5061 Westheimer Road Houston Galleria Houston, TX  77056
column13: I got a call an hour before the reservation to confirm the lunch and for the # of vegetarian menus required as I had requested in my reservation. This just set the tone of the excellent service that was to follow. The server kept on checking on us every few minutes for beverages/food. Food was served v fast and the group enjoyed their entrees. One of them had requested an egg salad and when the plates were being removed mentioned a few pieces of egg shells being present. The server was v apologetic and within a few minutes wrote off the salad from the bill. Shortly thereafter, the manager showed up, apologized, explained how they use fresh eggs, and made amends immediately with a huge cake! Kona won everyone over in our group!

The staff was very attentive. The food was very good. I especially enjoyed the hot food and salad buffet that came with the Rodizio meal. The grilled meats were comparable to other well known churrascaria type restaurants that are more expensive.
Marco, our waiter, did an outstanding job. We will request his services on our next visit.
ALways an outstanding meal cooked to perfection. And the Lobster mac and cheese was unbelievable.

Benihana used to be one of my favorite places to go as a kid and I enjoyed taking my daughter there, but the place looks SO DATED! It really needs to be upgraded and improved. Also, I remember these big flares of flame and better presentation than was available on our night. Food was good, but think other Japanese steak houses / hibachi grills have improved on the Benihana experience.
Liked the whole experience. Will be back.
Half our order was delivered 20 minutes after the first was delivered. I actually had to ask for the rest of the order. Service was terrible.

column4: 5085 Westheimer Blvd., Suite 3125 In the Galleria next to the Westin Galleria Houston, TX  77056
column13: Very relaxing atmosphere! Pleasant experience.

Excellent service, food & atmosphere! I very highly recommend Bucca di Beppo to everyone!! We were celebrating our wedding with dinner at Bucca ... the staff made our experience on of the best we've ever had!!
Consistently very good food and service.
As always, amazing service and food! This has quickly become my favorite Chinese food restaurant in Dallas!!!

column4: 5840 Legacy Circle Suite D100 Plano, TX  75024
column13: As soon as we walked in the door and until we received our food, the only thing my date could say was 'pretentious' but all of this location (Legacy in Plano) is that way. Atmosphere reminded us alot of Houston's, Houlihans somewhat. It's not that it was bad but all in all it was 'just okay' Nothing out of the ordinary. I will say the service (or the waitress) we had was great, she was very attentive (yet not over the top), definately did not neglect us.

column4: 210 Don Gaspar Avenue Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Food was fantastic. Wait staff seemed inexperienced. Apologized frequently. Not all wine on wine list was available. We were the only ones in the dining room on a Friday night - some outside diners, but not many.
Excellent food. Amazing staff. I look forward to returning.

Max's is a good old neighborhood standby. They have very good food and accommodate large groups. This a great place for families . They have a huge bar area with smaller tables but you can get more intimate tables in the back, and there is a more low roar area on the other side. My only complaint is the servers can sometimes be the classic,"hi, my name is" cheerleader types and have a motor mouth that pushes you order quickly and you really have to insist to have a few moments with your cocktail. In their defense, most guests seem to want their food right away, and then pound it down, and then the table turns around for someone else. The lunch scene is more sedate and they have very good breakfasts.
salmon was the best we ever had, service was great
It was my wife's birthday, so we had a quiet family dinner with her and my daughter. The waiter was great and the food was great.
Go for the fresh organic food, great tastes and friendly owners! The bar and wine selection is very limited, so don't expect much there.

column1: Hyde Park Bar & Grill - West Gate
column4: 4521 B West Gate Blvd Austin, TX  78745
column13: Went to Hyde Park Bar & Grill- Westgate for my birthday dinner. I had made reservations prior, so that helped with getting the table for 8 that my party consisted of. We were seated on time. The waiter showed up right away, took everyone's drink orders, and asked if we wanted appetizers. Drinks showed up pretty soon after ordering. Then orders were taken for dinner. I ordered the basil grilled chicken with wild rice pilaf and spice roasted sweet potatoes. My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak with fries and steamed broccoli. My sisters had the pork roast shephards pie and grilled salmon. Their boyfriends had the potato-crusted tilapia and chicken fried chicken. Overall, everyone was pleased with their meals. Waiter had BAD BAD breath

We went here for someone's birthday. The wait staff was GREAT. The food was wonderful! Belly dancer was a plus. The only issue was the manager who wanted to argue with us and another couple about the locked door. We said it was locked. He said it wasn't locked and we did not do it right. Personally, I thought he should have said "My apologies on the door sticking" or something to that affect. That sort of started our birthday dinner on the wrong note.

column1: Primo at the JW Marriott Starr Pass Resort & Spa
column4: 3800 W. Starr Pass Boulevard Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: Go and enjoy the entire Starr Pass Marriott experince. Start with a drink on the patio. Participate in their nightly "salute to the sunset at 5:30". Then on to dinner.

column4: 2031 Mountain Road San Felipe Plaza Albuquerque, NM  87104
column13: We have eaten many times at Seasons before, and usually had excellent food and service. But Sunday night was quiet (which is great) with only a few diners. However, requests for a missing napkin when unheeded as did three requests to two different wait staff for butter instead of olive oil. The griddle cakes came out burnt, the chicken dry. It was sad. We wondered who was in the kitchen.

Service was great!! From the manager, wait staff to sommelier. The sommelier was super friendly, helpful & attentive. Some food courses were great & some ok. Raw oysters were fresh, cold, shucked perfectly but had too much vinegar in them (better to leave that on the side), my husband had the tuna/foie gras & said it was awesome. Salads were great but the entrees were disappointing. His fish was blad but salty & my filet was over cooked & the side potatoes were too salty to eat. Dessert was the molton lava cake & that was good. The beehive banana cotton candy was addictive!!

column1: The Ice Bar at Uley's Cabin
column4: Base of Twister ski lift on Mt. Crested Butte Mt. Crested Butte, CO  81225
column13: Once in a lifetime opportunity to enjoy great food and a spectacular view. Food was delicious, and service was exemplary.

Great sushi place in the greater San Diego area. Fish is fresh, or at least doesn't taste fishy like at any other place I've tried, reasonable prices (too bad they got rid of the 50% off menu at happy hour - $2 hand rolls were hard to beat - but the 30% off is still there), relaxing ambiance except for the terrible music.

Perfect evening. Our server was the perfect combination of respectful and attentive. The food was excellent in taste, presentation and value. The wine list was impressive and their notable selections for the evening were incredible. A wonderfully paced, relaxed and yummy dinner. A great evening out.

We never know what to expect when a new restaurant opens, which is the fun of trying new restaurants. We ate at Delvickio's for our first time recently, with a group of 6 of us, all adults. The specials were very good, and the amount of crab in one of the specials was outstanding! The sausage had just enough spice for most folks, and not over powering. We all were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the meals, size and variety on the menu. We all had meals, no one tried the pizza/sandwiches or calzones. The service was not rushed, and we very much appreciated it. We will be back! Thank you!

column4: 2901 Ocean Park Blvd. Santa Monica, CA  90405
column13: Pasta is always cooked to perfection.

column4: 9705 South Santa Monica Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Excellent penne al salmone and bruchettaPlace was very cozyGreat house wine

column4: 11400 W. Olympic Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90064
column13: Beautiful day so we sat outside for lunch. Their garden seating is between several large office buildings, but that makes it quiet and there is a pond and planted area that makes the experience quite nice. Food was good. Only complaint was I had to ask for a replacement cup of coffee since the first one was lukewarm. The replacement was steaming hot as it should be.

column4: 95 West Marcy Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Outstanding food. Excellent service. Since we went before 6 p.m., all of the appetizers, salads, pastas, and wines by the glass were half price, which was an added bonus. Loved the squid ink pasta, heirloom tomato gazpacho, arugula salad with apples, and gorgonzola ravioli. Will definitely come back.

My friend and I both ordered an arugula salad and pasta with artichokes and shrimp. Simple dishes--yet amazing! Fantastic! We sat outside on a lovely summer evening. A guitarist played unobtrusively. The kitchen was backed up, according to the waiter, so it took forever to get our food--but we didn't care. That's how great the ambiance was.

column1: India Clay Oven Restaurant and Bar
column13: India Clay Oven: The waiter disappeared for long periods of time and we had to ask another waiter to help us. The music was too loud so it was noisy even though the restaurant was mostly empty. I noticed none of the diners were Indian. The wine was poured from the last of an open bottle even though we were dining early, and it was too warm and not good. The lamb was over-cooked and dry. The only vegetables, even in the vegetarian dishes, were peas. Overall this is by far the worst dining experience I have had in a very long time.

India's Tandoori in Hawthorne is definitely a neighborhood gem. Hidden in plain sight in a non-descript strip mall, this restaurant delivers all of the ambiance and authenticity of a much more upscale location. The highlight of our foursome's meal was the Bollywood meets MTV music videos that played on a large hi-def TV in the corner. They've got a great selection of your favorite Indian beers and the food was delicious. Wait staff in general was pleasant and attentive.
We came here while on vacation after going the last time we were in Honolulu.Great food.
Very thick steaks that were not cooked very well. But they fixed it. Allowed substitutions. Friendly service staff.Somewhat pricy. Overall a good dining experience.
Our waitor was very attentive and massively attractive. ALways a plus.

Service was pretty bad considering that we were the only other table in the whole restaurant. The food was ok but very expensive. The one thing that really bothered hate as that they included gratuity of 20%(!) in the tab for a table of 5 people!! Very disappointing. And definitely not deserved.

column1: The Loft at NYLO Plano at Legacy
column13: First time and what a surprise to find such a funky restaurant in a hotel - reminded me of the W's we've stayed before. Service was a bit slow but the food was great - when it got there. Luckily we weren't in a hurry. A portion of our order never arrived but the tapas we had ordered were sufficient. Despite the minor hiccups, we'll come back again.

Loved the Ceviche - fresh and delicious! It was a beautiful night in the City, so the patio dining was perfect! We will definitely return - a fun place to share several dishes - we also had the heirloom tomato and quinoa salad and a chicken skewer - everything was wonderful!

column4: 2500 E. Orchard Rd Unit C Greenwood Village, CO  80121
column13: Wanted to eat here for a while. Visited with a table of six. Limited menu, perhaps six entres, but several additional pastas. Service was very good and attentive. Wine list only fair. My wife had scallops which were so large they could have been irradiated (just kidding!). I had pasta with house made sausage, shrimp (a bit overlooked) and mussels in a zippy marinara sauce. Very tasty. The room has practically no ambiance. Contrast with our last dinner out at the Squeaky Bean, which had a vibe and was gorgeous to behold. All in all, quite satisfied with the food, which, after all, is what it's about, isn't it?

I've been here a half dozen of so times in the past few months and have been patiently waiting for them to get their act together. Sadly, I have given up on them. This is exactly the sort of place that Old Torrance needs! Great atmosphere in a a great location. The food is very good for a reasonable price. However, the service is very, very poor. I try to give new places the benefit of the doubt, and anyone can have a bad night, but I consistently have gotten poor service here. Tonight, I timed it and it was 30 minutes from the time that we sat down until I had my drink - never mind about the food! Sadly, I don't think I will be returning.

column4: 1515 N. Main Street Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Food is always tasty here at 1515....nice job!

column4: 208 Via Rodeo Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: We dined on the patio with a great view of the Beverly Wilshire Hotel. Food was good, service was better. Beautiful night and a neat setting.

column4: 255 E Basse Rd Ste 940 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: This is a great place for a romantic evening or a social gathering. Be prepared to spend about $100 for 2 but it's worth it. The goat cheese is wonderful by the way.
Everything was excellent; the food was superb; the mixed drinks were delicious, and the service was superlative. The only small issue is that the two-person tables are little too close together.

column4: 601 Van Ness Avenue Suite F San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: excellent food, nice variety and flavors. Sashimi varied from very fresh to okay, but still tasty. nice atmosphere, the adult foodies in our group and the kids were all happy.

column4: 320 South La Brea Ave. Los Angeles, CA  90036
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: The decibel level was waaaaay too high that night. There were large groups of patrons who were very obviously having a good time. Next time we will sit outside! Other than that, the food was tasty (love the truffle fries!) and kudos to Erica for being very gracious!

overpriced. dont get halibut dinner, basically halibut with montreal steak seasoning.what really made me mad was found discount coupons for $25.00 off. i can do better at home. chicken was dried out with bone in.

Not a place for dinner. Place is more a sports bar. Food is not very tasty. My wife order the paella and it was terrible. After dinner, we move to the bar/music area and there are only 3 booths and they were all reserved. The only palce to stand was in the middle of the dance floor. I do not recommended it.
Great service and food, we will go back!
Amazing food & service. We'd absolutely go back. Loved the menu! Not crazy gourmet where it was hard to find something you wanted to order but lots of variety at the same time. Just my kind of place.
Adored the Heirloom Tomato risotto . Still trying to figure out a way to have it Fed Exed to Milwaukee.Wi!

A-16 restaurant is a VERY, VERY GOOD restaurant with VERY GOOD food, service, wine/bar area, and the GREAT QUALITY of their food, service, wine/bar areas are CONSISTENTLY VERY GOOD. We have eaten there for both lunch and dinner MANY times and the experience is CONSISTENTLY VERY GOOD, and A-16 IS a "YES, let's go back AGAIN and AGAIN" restaurant!

column4: 107 N Robertson Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90211
column13: Unfortunately our experience fell short due to a lack of professional service. After being seated, we sat for close to 10 minutes without a greeting from any member of the wait staff. Finally, a waiter (he never introducted himself) came over. We already had had PLENTY of time to study the menu, so we ordered. He returned few mins later to ask us what we had ordered (he forgot!). We NEVER saw him as our food was being served, while we were eating, or between courses. NOTHING; no check-in, or a "how is everything?" Waiter did not care at all! Food was ok... We ordered 2 desserts to share, but only received one. Pointed this out to the waiter; we had clearly ordered 2. There were NO listening skills on his part. NEVER going back.NOT WORTH IT!

column4: 973 E. Hillsdale Blvd Foster City, CA  94404
column13: Went for lunch and food is adequate, only went because of conveneient location. Service was poor; asked for my Coke three times before it arrived. Serving staff was not courteous and did not remove the empty dishes or come by when we had a request. Asking for the bil was another long wait and after four requests, fianlly received the bill. My colleagues and I will not be going back anytime soon.
Wonderful cuisine, great service! A little noisy, but a nice dining experience.

I've had good/great food here in the past, so I will likely go back, but I have to say that on July 17th, the entrees (a ravioli and the cornish game hen with polenta) were simply too salty to eat- and I love salt. Our server, Sterling, was excellent, catering to my dining partner, (who was new to many of the dishes), with respect and care, but the food was far below the usual quality.
Wonderful - Great to find a place with the perfect balance of food, service and setting Bravo
Was impressed by all the food, except the lemon verbena dessert.

column4: 200 Pine Avenue, Ste A Long Beach, CA  90802
column13: The fantastical fare and very cool air give Agaves both thumbs up. It is delicious & fun, a winning duo
Always a fan of Brazilian barbecue and agora is one of the best
My husband and I had dinner at Aicha last weekend. The food was tasty and the portions were generous. We would recommend the kebabs and the chicken tagine!
I've been here twice and only have good things to say about this place. The food is great, the service is even better.

Delicious meal and good service, we were promptly seated but never rushed despite the fact that one of our party was late, and it was quite busy. Just a tad noisy, but so many restaurants are these days.
We had a great experience at Akiko's: very good service and amazing food. We'll definitely come back there again.

column4: 2480 Canyon Blvd. Unit M1 Boulder, CO  80302
column13: Alba is delightful! We sat on the patio - a nice, quiet, charming atmosphere.

I've been here for brunch and dinner and was impressed by the quality of the food on both occasions. For dinner, my boyfriend and I shared the braised masala lamb and had empanadas as an appetizer. The lamb meat was tender and full of flavor, the spinach panner was equally delicious. The empanadas were true to the Filipino style and the chili vinegar sauce was a nice and surprising complement. They had a full selection of wine but passed on it at $9 a glass. I really enjoy the laid back, artsy ambiance, mostly locals from around the area. There is an impressive steel tree in the middle of the restaurant and funky art on the walls.

My husband and I enjoyed a lovely dinner on a Saturday night. While the restaurant wasn't very busy, the food was wonderful and the ambiance was romantic. It a great spot to enjoy a quiet, romantic dinner.

We went to this restaurant to celebrate a birthday and were disappointed with the service. They brought out the wrong wine, forgot about the coffee one of my friends ordered, and took a long time in bringing out our orders. Also, when we ordered the dessert, it was burnt and all you could taste is a charred dessert. We asked to send it back and the chef came out to speak to us. The manner in which he spoke was very rude. I understand he was trying to tell us that is how the dessert is supposed to be prepared but that doesn't mean he has to be rude to us. Of all the guests in our party, none of us were happy and felt like we couldn't come back here.
need to open patio for outside dining
My husband and I finally tried it a few weeks ago and and it was a great experience. Food, service, and ambiance was great.

column1: Alize at the Top of the Palms Casino Resort
column4: 4321 W Flamingo Road Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: Great setting and service. Food was very good as well. Pricey, ideal for a special occassion.

column4: 1602 S. El Camino Real San Mateo, CA  94402
column13: Terrific little place. Super food. The only downside was our server, an old Russian or Israeli guy who was gruff, irritated and unhelpful. He seemed like he hated being a waiter, so maybe he shouldn't be one.
First time! Was a different dining experience. Not cheap but well worth it. Food was very tasty and filling.

Great view of the boardwalk with nearby covered parking. Parking is free (validated) with dinner.. Food and service was very good. Had the ahi Tuna which was excellently prepared. Reasonably priced meals with a variety of fish, steak, and poultry items. Reservations recommended as it fills up fast even during the week because of its location.

Creative menu. Outstanding preparations. For me, the lasting impression was the bill. . . ethically, I felt guilty spending as much on my dinner as you could spend to feed a family of four for a three days.
Tasty, interesting entrees... good value.. loved the Salmon Fettucine and Cioppino.. We'll be back!

column4: 924 N. Sepulveda Blvd. Manhattan Beach, CA  90266
column13: This was our second dinner at American Farmhouse, and the first in their new location. The menu expanded, and all of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals. The wait staff were friendly and attentive without hovering. The beer selection is good -- I am a beer snob, and cannot comment on the wine. I appreciated the candle in the ice-cream for the birthday girl.

column4: 25250 Grogans Park Dr The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: I had to take the lamb home and feed the bloodhound.
The environment is great with old style decoration. But the food is just so-so. I was expected better because many friends recommend us to go. But the Service is great.

Make sure you print directions before you head out looking for Anchor and Hope. It is tucked down a side street but the search is worth it. The food is amazing and the service is top notch. I ate there 3 years ago and had to find it again when I was back in San Fran.
Hi, went on a Friday 7:30pm with reservations. After seated, took 15 minutes for someone to show up. Food was ok, Sangria was good, Service was poor. I would give a 2 1/2 stars total.

Interesting small plates, very accommodating, rather noisy but lots of fun. Our party of 10 was lucky to have a round table near the windows which lessened the noise level & everyone (vegetarians & omnivores) loved the foods, wines & specialty cocktails.

Never been disappointed by Andrei's. Our best restaurant in Irvine when it comes to foodies. Thanks to the french Chef. Bouillabaisse was excellent. And the home made sorbets drive you to Paradise.Enjoy.

I ate here in April 2012, and Angele is now the best it has ever been. We sat on the patio along the Napa River on a warm summer evening. The restaurant was full and lively with a relaxed but happy atmosphere. The service was attentive at all times, and the food was extraordinary. I had the salade verte with chevre and it was such a unique and fabulous recreation of this oft-seen menu item - delicate and delicious with fresh peas. I also had the scallops and clams in a light cream sauce - just a delicious flavor. Others in our party had and enjoyed the pate de campagne, risotto, and salmon. For dessert we all shared the raspberry sorbet with a rich and full flavor of raspberries & the creme caramel with fresh fruit was so delicious.
I really like this place. I loved the outside dining. They have heaters and cozy tables. The food and service was good. I would go back anytime!

My family and I have dined here several times and each and every time it has been great. Last time we ordered the lamb dish with the eggplant and I think it was one of the best dishes we have ever had. The staff is always friendly and many time we have ended up in conversation with the tables near us. Overall, I would definitely recommend Annapurna!

Another Monkey was a hit for me and my friends to celebrate my birthday. The food was good and the birthday dessert (coconut rice with mango slices) was really good!! I would definitely come back again!!

column4: 3800 South Plaza Drive Santa Ana, CA  92704
column13: Food and service were fantastic as always!
Good, enjoyed the music while drinking wine.

column4: 1111 S. Hope St. #100 Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: Very good food....can't go wrong with miso black cod and miso chilean seabass. Will definitely come back next time we are attending a show at LA Live or at Staples Center. The food is good and is not as pricey as Katsuya which is at the Nokia Plaza.

We were delighted with this restaurant. Their beet salad was delicious and as was their branzino. Be sure to leave room for dessert. We had their (mile hi) chocolate fudge cake - enough to split, plus. wonderful chocolate truffles and passion fruit lemon marshmallows (like no marshmallow you ever tasted). We're looking forward to going back soon.If we hadn't had the cake, a beautiful blackberry, blueberry, strawberry & raspberry pie had just come out of the oven and looked wonderful.

column4: 3334 West Coast Highway Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: I was very impressed with the food and overall experience at A Restaurant. Everything we ate was spectacular and the scene was very vibrant. I would definitely go back.

column4: 244 South 1300 East Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: Really tasty Greek food- we'll be back!
Service was prompt, professional, and friendly. Food (Short Ribs) was excellent. Putting green outside was a fun post-dinner activity.

column4: 30 Centerpointe Drive, Suite 1 La Palma, CA  90623
column13: Great little spot, good food and service. Location was a little out of the way.

column4: 8280 West Union Hills Road Suite 110 Glendale, AZ  85308
column13: Very romantic atmosphere with mellow music. The decor is soothing, the food is gourmet,and the service was very attentive and professional.

column4: 12012 W. Pico Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90064
column13: We didn't go because the place was too dark and we didn't like the atmosphere. We may just be too old for the place.
Celebrated our 3rd wedding anniversary. Go early as the place gets hopping at around 7pm or later. We enjoyed a quiet 6pm reservation. We split courses down the menu and enjoyed everything.

Our wait person was not very attentive. She left us for long periods of time -never checking in on us. The wait for our food was incredibly long and she should have come to give us updates on when our food would be brought out. It was a late reservation so I would have thought that she should come over and asked if we wanted dessert and if it was okay to bring it out even with a member of our party still eating. She didn't and so we didn't have dessert. (We let her know that she missed an opportunity for larger bill -and at tip.) While we were given complementary brownies, it was not the same as enjoying a real dessert.

We had the Chef's menu with wine pairing and we felt service could have been much better considering the money we were spending. The person dropping off the food talked way too fast and was in a rush to leave at every course. I understand it was a very busy night, but service should have been a little bit better. It wasn't bad service, but it definitely wasn't what I expected it should be. The food made up for the lack of service.
Slow service. Mentioned on reservation that we have a person in our group celebrating a birthday - no mention or recognition whatsoever... Food was pretty good, but oh so dry...
Charlie has done an amazing job to make this Italian eatery a gem! Their wine dinners are the best.
Special occasions only. Expensive and not sure if a good value
Very friendly reception. Waiter was very helpful and informative.

column4: 233 S. Beverly Dr. Beverly Hills, CA  90212
column13: A good casual spot for a quick meal......Found their lamb burger to be excellent.

column4: 234 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: The food wasn't great. Chicken and mushroom lettuce wraps were salty and had no mushrooms. Only came with 4 lettuce leaves. Lumpia was just ok. Probably won't be back.

column4: 203 East San Antonio Street Fredericksburg, TX  78624
column13: Nice place. Good food. I was a little annoyed that they were out of the two items on the menu that I thought were reasonably priced (the new York strip my first choice for $41, and the Pork chop my second choice for $25) were both sold out at 7:15pm. Then my only other choice for steak were $80 and $65. I'm sure they were probably great choices, but a little pricey for my budget. I ended up going with the "off the menu" choice of sea scallopes. Which was good, but not really what I was in the mood for. I understand sometimes restaurants run out of things, but really, the first two items on your menu and it's only 7:15 on a Saturday?

Meals not delivered as ordered. Waiter inattentive and did not return to table promptly after meals served by assistants. One meal returned to kitchen. That individual sat with no food while meal re-prepared as ordered. Everyone else eating their meal. Children running around playing loudly on back lawn. Celebrating birthday. No special welcome or courtesies extended. Unable to acommodate special dietary requests after Phillipe confirmed they were able to do so.
Was disappointed we wanted oysters and they had ran out of them, but otherwise it was a nice evening. We will go back another time

Celebrated my birthday. Hostess brought us free drinks to go with our chocolate fondue... also, I forgot my coupon for the free chocolate strawberries you can get for your birthday and they gave them to me anyway. I will definitely go back to celebrate other occasions and have already spread the word to friends.
We will return. Food was good and wait staff was attentive.
food was mediocre, atmosphere okay but energy picked up later in the evening, good cocktails and friendly bartenders
Food was very good but it was so noisy we had trouble talking and hearing the wait staff
excellent soup.companion loved bowl.chicken was rubbery.hated bench seating without backs.service not particularly helpful.

column1: Azucar Latin Bistro Mojito Bar & Lounge
column4: 71 E. San Fernando Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Although their menu was limited, the food was FANTASTIC!! KATIE took great care of us. She had to work extra hard, since they were short-handed.We'll be back again SOON!
What I love is that Azul is always consistent never lets you down. You always get the best, great service, great food, friendly people. Love going there. Wish it was closer to Sahuarita.

Menu was very difficult to order from.. Had small entrees. Thought we could order a few and share, but it says they charge $2 /plate if shared.I ordered something recommended by waiter, but it smelled so gamey, it was unappetizing. I couldn't eat it.
We are vegetarians. The risotto was the best we've ever had. Yum!
Overpriced for the portionsFood was fine but nothing specialWaiter was not attentive.We were a group of 8 and felt since gratuity was included we were atop priority
I have had dinner at the Back Wine Bar & Bistro about 5 times now over the last 2 yrs. The food has always been outstanding, I have never been let down.

Had been waiting a long time to try B&B, so perhaps it was a situation where I hyped the place up too much. I can't say anything was bad, but nothing really stood out for me either. The appetizers were good (octopus, trout) and the deserts were really nice as well. The consensus for the entire table (6 of us) was that our entrees were just ok. My miso cod started great but midway was just too sweet. Perhaps would have been better as an appetizer. I also thought the donuts would have been better without the bacon. Personally, I have other places that I have to visit before I return.

A very classy place perfect for special occasions. The food is amazing and the portions are huge and entirely worth the price. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They really try to make your dining experience a special one.

column4: 3355 Las Vegas Blvd South The Venetian Resort Hotel and Casino Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Beautiful restaurant, service was outstanding. We had the 5 course tasting dinner and the food was quite good. It did not blow me away however and for the outrageous prices that we paid for dinner I should have been blown away. Very good but far too expensive considering we ate at other 5 start Las Vegas restaurants on our trip and the prices did not come close to this
Great selection for plant based diners. Server Chang very helpful.

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. Their chow mein, honey prawns and vegetable spring rolls were delicious! I didn't love their pork buns but maybe I just don't like pork buns. I will definitely go back.
Service decor and the main food were great but the dessert was an over-priced disappointment and the prices a tad high.
Good turkey sandwhich but side salad should have more than lettuce and olive oil- perhaps a little tomoato! Tater tots are yummy. Restaurant Week menu dissapointing.

Authentic southern Italian food. Hard to choose as the menu had lots of delicious options. Excellent service. I have food allergies and the wait staff checked the entree ingredients with the chef so I could order without worry. We had a great meal and a great time. good value as well.

This restaurant is expensive for what it is, an average Mexican restaurant. The tables are jammed in so that the servers run into each other. Our server had apparently never waited tables before and forgot a lot of things. I think the kitchen is overwhelmed, so the food is slow to come out. For dessert, it took us 20 minutes to get an ice cream sundae!

Ridiculous food / wine pairings, flavors are unreal, the risoto, halibut and filet are an absolute must. Don't be shy about the six-course but know that you can't go wrong. Make a point to get a 'dealers choice' cocktail and desert.

The risotto was very good, but the rest of our food was disappointing. The bass was nothing special and the duck was terrible, it was over cooked and chewy.
