Would have complained to the server but he never came back to check how the food was. Didn't see him again at all until another server asked him to bring the check over. Service was extremely disappointing from the server, but the back servers were very attentive and friendly.

Great food. Had the 3 combination of spicy pork, tempura, and teriaki chicken. My wife had the combination also of spicy tuna roll, rib eye, and chicken katsu. Also had the california roll as a starter. All were excellent!

column4: 99 Convention Center Drive Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Great Meal and overall experience off the strip in Vegas. Better value than most strip restaurants.

Communal atmosphere with delicious fresh food. Smoked chicken hash was amazing for brunch; an intelligent combination of hearty ingredients and delicate farmers' market touches. A motivating start to the day.

If you're looking for authentic Basque cuisine, look no further ... Bask is the best in San Francisco! Great wine list (try the Banda Roja), and the tapas and appetizers are top notch. The paella was the BEST I've ever tasted! Go with a group of friends and you'll have a memorable night!

column4: 201 South California Avenue Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: of all restaurant eaten in the bay area, this is one of the best, price is expensive, but well worth it!! Service outstanding along with the 12 course...Servings are small, but at the end its enough ...As an Architect, eating here is like an Art, every serving is a design of itself.......keith

column4: 19620 Stevens Creek Blvd, Suite 150 Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: Food portion was way too small. The service was slow too. But, food was tasty. Would only come in during happy hour and not pay full price for such small servings of food.
My steak was just OK, hve had better there. Everyone else enjoyed their dinner.

Have been to BayWolf many times, but thought the menu this time had been reduced considerably, probably due to the economy. My husband had the duck, which was excellent, and I had the pork which seemed dry to me, but was o.k. The wines by the glass were limited which was disappointing to all 4 of us. We live in wine country for heaven's sake. All in all, a nice evening with friends but nothing spectacular.

column4: 525 E Cooper Ave, Suite 201 Aspen, CO  81611
column13: All around great: good service, creative menu, very well prepared food and reasonable prices. I'll be back.

waiter good, sceanic view,food ok-one order great, one order cold claim cowder and no spoon, but salad great, other order crab cooked to long, no middle meat, no crab utencils, no drawn butter, had to ask for bread-will come back......
Food was ok and the service was pour.
good food, good beer. wine list is good for the grape lover. had burgers...huge, sharable...go for the mac 'n cheese. located right on square. nice prices...would recommend.
The food was fantastic, portion size and price balanced. The place has very bad acoustics and we found it hard to have a conversation. We will go back for the food!

Food was unique, was presented well, and had good flavor. Loved the ambiance. Service was excellent. Hope the restaurant signage for the exterior is improved. It was hard to find if you have never been there before, even after looking on googlemaps. We had to call after circling the block two times and have them describe what we should be looking for. All they had to help you realize you were at the right place was the small menu on the door.

column4: 951 South Westlake Blvd Suite 102 Suite 102 Westlake Village, CA  91362
column13: The enclosed patio is very warm and inviting. The candle lights on the wall make a wonderful soft light. The wait staff is very attentive and can give great recommendations for your individual tastes. The burratta and tomato salad is delicious. The Italian movies (with sub-titles, no sound) played in the patio are a very unique addition and provide another layer of ambience.
The food was okay, but nothing special, and definitely didn't merit the prices paid.

I was very disappointed with Easter Brunch at the MayFair Room at the Benson. My family and I have been sharing holiday brunches at The Benson in the London Grill, hence that is what has made it a "fan favorite" with our family. With the closure of the London Grill the MayFair room was our only choice. The food was "fair" I almost tripped on the table cloth as it was dragging on the floor. We paid more this year for brunch and received a bad expreince. This was $200 not worth spending, we will not be returning.

Great view of the mountains. Food was ok (short ribs and cheesy polenta) but over priced for what it is. Decor needs to be updated (ie. table cloth looked old and had a few holes). Service was very friendly and attentive.
We really liked having the choice of a half size entrees. The portions were not overwhelming, for a nice change. The food was excellent. The wine list was a little pricy.
Too noisy and rather overpriced, we thought.

I had a horrible experience at this place. I am from Brazil, booked in advance and wanted to celebrate with my friends. We were seated and the hostess told us someone would come to wait on us soon. We waited for 23 minutes, no one came. The place was not crowded at all, that is why I could not understand the reason. We had to go to another place. I will never forget this day due to the fact it was my birthday.

I was a little disappointed in the steak. It was cooked perfectly and was tender however not flavorful. Got a great wine recommendation from the very nice waitress but for $100 a bottle it should be great. : )

Overall a very nice evening. My mom was visiting from Florida and wanted a real SF jazz experience - I think she got it. She and my Aunt really enjoyed the evening. She needed special accessible assistance and was given personalized service from the curb to our seat. Great place for that special evening out on the town.

Bistango is fantastic. It is everything that people have raved about. The menu is very diverse and has something for everyone the wine list is extensive and both the food and wine are very reasonably priced. The service was outstanding without being intrusive. The decor is terrific. The overall experience was wonderful. I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone.

What a happy surprise Bistro 1491 was. I booked the restaurant thinking it was another restaurant. Bistro 1491 is not elegant but the food is very, very good; the service was pleasant and appropriately attentive and corkage was gratis! The buttermilk fried chicken is sooo good.

It was a spectacular evening and we sat outside on the patio. For an appetizer I had the smoked trout. The waiter failed to mention that it was cold smoked--basically trout sashimi! This may have been an error on his part but it was spectacular and I am glad I did not ask! I have never tasted better!!! For the main course I had an off the menu special--"piella risotto"--it was also spectacular. The menu rated a 10 on my scale and it was very reasonably priced for Napa Valley. Coming from Scottsdale Arizona I am used to expensive restaurants that do not deliver. Bravo Bistro Jeantry!
Great view of Lake Washington, Steak Poivre was delish.
Fair French food, at fair prices, in good location.

Our server was the best! She directed us to the most fun, creative dishes! Poached egg in a crisp coating- just full of summer flavors form smoky corn, avocado, some frilly greens to start. Then halibut cheeks with delicious baby artichoke hearts and a crispy skin salmon with a sweet savory maple sauce. Fabulous!

ordered app. wanted to wait to order the waitress insisted she would hold the dinner off before we finished the app. here comes the dinner the server wainted to remove the plates we hadn't finished felt rushed it isn't a place to dine the want to turn and burn the west i will go to not bristro

Most unusual and excellent dining experience. Seafood chowder is outstanding, Sopped up every last drop with bread. Scallops very good. Pork belly with peaches and prawns very different and very good. Cheesecake was delicious and beautiful presentation. Our waiter was most informative about the wine, where to buy, cooking information, suggestions. Overall a wonderful experience, a little loud even dining early. Good stop before Cosmo cabaret.

A wonderful experience. We had just moved to Colorado two weeks prior to our visit. I asked many people in town where they would recommend for a nice birthday dinner for my husband, and it was hands down Black Hat Cattle Co. Highly recommend this location there was not a negative thing to say about this place or the food..

We enjoyed Sutting on the patio. . I had the goat cheese flan appetizer and my husband had the scallop appetizer. Both were good and either could serve as a small entree with a glass of wine. We had the szechuan shrimp for our entrees. It was very well prepared and full of flavor-not spicy. For dessert we shared the cheesecake. The prices are a bit high for the area and some of the combinations of flavors in entrees listed did not go well.
My husband and I enjoyd a wonderful dinner - best mushroom soup and flan tasted in a long time. All the food was delicious.
Our entree's took a little longer than usual, but other than that, Bleu Boheme performed wonderfully as usual!
Good food. Confusing and frustrating service. Took a long time to get served, never received my salad, server brought the wrong check and it took a long time to resolve. Never offered dessert.

I had seen good reviews for Bliss 525, so I was excited to try this new Long Beach 'hotspot.' We had requested to sit on the rooftop, but were seated on the patio. Which wouldn't have been bad, but the patio felt like you were in the midst of passing traffic. The service was terrible. Our group came separately and every one of us had to wait several minutes for the hostess to come back to her station. Our waitress was incredilby rude...she rolled her eyes when we asked for more time to look over the menu, as if we were inconveniencing her day. I felt like I had to apologize to her everytime we asked for something. At the end of dinner we asked if she would take a picture - she refused to do it. Food was mediocre at best.

All the food was really good & our server (Monica) was lovely. Great wine knowledge. Beef, grits, and mustard greens all delicious & portion size was great. Only two minor complaints. Appetizer needed salt & none on table. Entree was dropped on table by someone other than server while I still had 3/4's of appetizer to eat. Would certainly recommend/ go back.

column4: 8720 West Sunset Blvd. West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: The dinner was started off with the huge, tasty popover and so-so chicken live pate. The hemingway gin cocktail tasted great but there was too much ice in the drink. My friends and I came in for the DineLA menu which looked interesting. The appetizers were really yummy. We tried the flat iron steak and pork chops which were decent but less impressive than the appetizers. We tried all 3 desserts which were good, and one of my friends really enjoyed the chocolate, hazelnut brownie. The nice touches at this restaurant were the really good freebies that they provided. And, the service was really professional. Great experience all around and will definitely come back again.

You haven't lived until you have eaten at BLT at Camelback Resort! This was one of the best meals of my life as I was celebrating my 43rd Birthday there as well. The food and service was excellent! Paul our waiter was attentive and personable! The place was busy but we never felt neglected at any point. The must haves on the menu are the Grilled Double Cut Bacon and signature giant popovers a must! The Prime Hanger Steak was so tender and cooked perfectly medium with all of the sauces on the side it was even better! Desert was to die for it was a Strawberry custard something and it melted in my mouth. My wife and I both enjoyed this place and will be coming back soon as we can!!!
All good! Nice atmosphere, too.

Made a Friday night reservation but didn't really need one for 6pm. They had room. Food was nice if unspectacular. Service was prompt. They had a live musician who was a little too "lounge act" for my tastes but better than nothing. I'd go again.
Food always good. Hot night but the management managed to have the rooms relatively cool.

The four of us had a great meal on a hot summer Friday night. The cheese starter was a good place to start. My buddy selected a nice red wine. We followed that with a nice appetizer. My Salmon entree was great. We ordered another excellent Red wine. Our wives were enjoying their meals. For dessert, I had the chocolate torte. Jeremy was our server and he did a good job. Extra plus that Bluehour is in the passport discount program.

column4: ONE Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: .....just a well run, well organized from the back restaurant - the food is delicious, obviously lot's of care and thought in the kitchen - not fancy or over the top, service friendly, accommodating but never condescending. Best new restaurant I've come across in years!

- Though I rescheduled the reservation time thrice they were courteous and did comply- The veg pad thai was made in fish oil, after emphasizing that fish oil is not veggie in our consideration they made a special veg dish- The floor opened for dancing and it was fun too- We were there to celebrate our friend's b'day and we did so, she had a blast

column4: 7900 E. Greenlake Dr. N. Seattle, WA  98103
column13: been here twice now - will not be going back. Food is ok...not great...perhaps not even good...but ok. That said, it certainly is not tasty enough to compensate for the poor service. My GF and I came to the conclusion after two visits that it isn't a matter of being lazy or not caring...they aren't "bad" service people...they are incompetent in the most objective sense of the word, without bias or prejudice. They simply do not know their jobs - they do not know what they are doing. My guess is that the restaurant hires inexperienced staff, and also has a high turnover...

column4: 9200 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: Overal my experience was really good. Great food and great service!
Second time here and it's absolutely delicious!

Our most recent visit to one of our favorite places was a little disappointing. The plaza had live outdoor music event this evening making the atmosphere in the restaurant a little challenging. Also the pizza was a little over cooked. We will be back though, but not on a live music night...
You would never expect to find a lovely, quiet outdoor patio in the heart of North Beach. It was a very peaceful and relaxing spot.

We couldn't have been more pleased with our dinner. The service was some of the best we have ever had. The food was just outstanding. We travel a lot & we rate this restaurant among one of the best dining experiences we have had in a long time. Can;t wait to return.
BoHo was a perfect place to go to before the IRIS show. The beer choices were amazing and the food good. Our waitress was awesome.

My wife and I love coming here, the food is fresh, organic and local. The drinks are also amazing. The service is very good. We love going here because its a great price for the amazing food. Valet parking is free.

column4: 141 East Meadow Dr, Suite 113 Vail, CO  81657
column13: The food is amazing. Everything is good and beautifully presented.

column4: 405 North Vineyard Ave. Suite A Ontario, CA  91764
column13: My wife loves good Indian cuisine, so when I saw this restaurant on Vineyard in Ontario, I knew I would bring her. When we arrived at our reserved time of 6:30 PM on Friday evening, there were only one or two other parties. We were worried. We checked out the menu and it seemed reasonably priced, though most dishes were strictly a-la-carte. We ordered two soups, two entrees, Lamb Korma and Lamb Palak, with rice, naan, and iced teas. We asked for the entrees to be medium spicy. The food was tasty, but hardly spiced at all. This was disappointing for us, but not a deal breaker. Next time, we will have a little discussion before specifying the level of spiciness. And there will be a next time.

I always have enjoyed your delicious lunch buffetsWe dined recently in the evening. Delicious food as always, but for the prices you're charging, the quantity could have been a bit more generous. $22 for a lamb dish consisting of 3-4 ounces of meat?? Where's the justification in that? Guess I will just go for lunch. thanks.
I'm not qualified to comment on the authenticity of the food, but I will certainly vouch for the great taste. From the appetizers through the desserts, everything was excellent.
The cold Soba noodles is the perfect dish for summer. And of course the steamed buns are to die for.

column4: 4259 Bryant Irvin Rd. Fort Worth, TX  76109
column13: Our family took my sister here for her birthday celebration. The staff were very friendly and our server was knowledgeable and helpful. The ambiance was low key Western and pretty quiet--not too much noise. I had a super appetizer--grilled watermelon topped with grilled shrimp. It was delicious. My husband had the Texasfeller oysters that he really enjoyed. I had the trout entree; others at the table had the quail, the mixed grill, and the chicken stack. Everyone enjoyed it. We shared the dessert sampler. Had a nice pinot noir wine. We enjoyed the experience and would go here again.
NOISY! Ate there twice last week. First time the noise level was ok. The second time it was hard to hear my dinner guest or the server. The food doesn't taste as good when it's a strain to converse.

column4: 9 West Victoria St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: Very nice dinner after the California Wine Festival. Great food and amazing service, the manager was very attentive! Cute little place too!
I thoroughly enjoyed my birthday dinner there. Great steak, wine, and service.
Everything was great as always at this excellent restaurant. We took a guest, and he thought it was wonderful too.

column4: 800 W. Olympic Blvd, Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: went for kings final game so much fun!

Wow!!!! My husband and I went there to celebrate our anniversary and had a wonderful dining experience. All the staff were wonderful. The food was exceptional along with their enormous inventory of delicious wines. We can't wait to go back!!!!!

Great atmosphere and a solid croque-madame. Nice touches here and there that set it apart from the herd without coming across as trying too hard. Love the interior design, expansive, nice balance of space and number of tables, high ceilings. Prompt, unobtrusive service with good suggestions and stealthy speed. A great place to bring a client for lunch during the week or your friends for brunch. Do your best to avoid the temptation to cram fistfuls of frites in your mouth...good stuff!
What a great experience. The new menu is interesting and very approachable; something for everyone. We enjoyed oysters, quail, halibut, pork, it was all delicious.
As always a wonderful dinner. Brennans never fails to please.

We just happened to have made a reservation on Brexi's opening night, of the Summer season. We sat outside, on the patio, and the weather couldn't have been more perfect. We found the staff friendly and attentive and the food was excellent! Sommelier recommended a "good value" bottle of wine and the entire experience was great. Our favorite Aspen restaurant!

Our family has been visiting Breck for 12 years (1-2 weeks a year)and have never eaten at the Briar Rose. . .we thought it was THE BEST atmosphere, service, with amazing delicious food. (We could not figure out why it has never been recommended to us before.)
Limited overpriced food served a la carte.Rude waitress.Items on menu not available.
Bridges is a Danville gem and we dine there as often as we can. There is always something new and intriguing on the menu. Always great service. Tasty drinks, nice choice of wine and the food - yum!
Brix was a wonderful restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. The meal was outstanding and the service was impeccable. I would definitely go back when I'm in Napa.

column4: 413 N. San Francisco St. Flagstaff, AZ  86001
column13: Food was positively fresh and outstanding. Highly recommended.

I was looking for a restaurant that would take (and honor!) a reservation for 8 for Saturday brunch and was impressed by the Open Table reviews of The Brixton. Our experience lived up to those I read about. We had a terrific, comfortable table and the food was delicious. The carnitas hash and fried chicken benedict received particularly high praise. It helped that it turned into a gorgeous day and they were able to open the doors leading to their outdoor seating. They really helped make our event a success.
Food outstanding. Tables way too cramped, so prepare for a fun gastronomic evening while listening to your CLOSE neighbors conversation.

My family and I dined here to celebrate my brother's birthday. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, first seating us indoors and then allowing us to move to the balcony when a table opened up. The view of the ocean from our table was gorgeous and we thoroughly enjoyed the ocean breeze as we ate delicious breakfast dishes. Our server was pleasant and knowledgeable of the menu, giving us great recommendations of food to try. I would definitely go back to Brockton Villa.
This was our second meal at Brussels Bistro, and certainly not our last! The Belgium beers are delicious!

column4: 12995 El Camino Real Suite 21 San Diego, CA  92130
column13: Malarkey has chosen a new executive chef and it shows in the food quality!Delicious, every bite bursting with flavor. We will go back again fora special occasion.Price point is high so not a 'constant' restaurant for hubby and myself.Bar was lively after 9pm with the over 30 crowd.
Food was excellent......our server was so friendly and professional

Overall really good food. I went there looking for sashimi and got it. Great sashimi. Only thing was it was hard to determine how much food I was being served because no quantities were listed on the menu. We ended up adding to our initial order and wishing we had ordered the largest sashimi option insted.
Nice selection of small plates. Would definitely return.

column4: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay Street San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: If you are looking for Asian fusion, look no further. The dishes are imaginative and very well executed. The flavors are intricate and well balanced.
Very good food. Fine service; our waitress was very personable and helpful.
Food delivery was a little slow but the service (our waitress, Rhonda) and food were excellent.

The food was amazing and exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed the half-price sangria flight at happy hour and then jumped in for the dinner menu. The steak with grilled waterrmelon was beautifully prepared and delicious - totally worth the extra few dollars it cost. And my partner had the zucchini bowl which she loved and I had to keep my fork away from her plate! As a birthday meal it was perfect but it could be pricey for a casual dinner. Service was wonderful and the staff was very friendly! We sat outdoors which, while a bit crowded, was great although the indoor seating was also beautiful.

column4: 807 W. Washington St. San Diego, CA  92103
column13: Warm, informal, friendly without being intrusive and best of all, excellent food and service.

I had never visited Cafe Des Amis, finding my usual set of French restaurants wholly satisfying. Now that I have dined here, I will certainly return. The food was authentic and first-rate, the service transparent and the ambiance charming.

column4: 2845 Town Center Circle West Kingwood Town Center Kingwood, TX  77339
column13: I don't know why there were so few people in there. At first we were a little hesitant to go in since it appeared empty. It was about 8 PM so it was a little past the busier time. The food was DELICIOUS, the wait staff attentive but not cloying. The live music was beautiful. I would definately recommend it to someone for a romantic night out.
A great place for a girlfriend catch up visit. Quiet and fun food/

column4: 639 N. Larchmont Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90004
column13: One of the best spots for vegan options I have found, absolutley wonderful food, both entree and dessert. I will be going back soon!
Cafe Juanita is an outstanding restaurant. Ever time we go there they keep rasing the bar higher and their food and service is always over the top.
The food was decent, a little over-priced for what you get, bad service, no character, depressing ambiance. This place can benefit from some very basic TLC, some music, fresh paint, happy staff, etc.

Absolutely one of the most consistent restaurants in town. The only problem lunching here is deciding between slow cooked salmon or Asian chicken salad. They are both wonderful!!! Highly recommend! You won't be disappointed.

column4: 317 Manhattan Beach Blvd Manhattan Beach, CA  90266
column13: Both the Octopus dish and the Loup de Mar were just a little too oily for me. Both were still great dishes.

column4: 1020 Railroad Ave San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: Very romantic with excellent food.

My friend and I had dinner on a Tuesday evening. We were seated in a table for two just at the top of the stairs. We found most of the food to be quite tasty - she loved her salad and crab cakes. I was reasonably pleased with my sea bass- except I thought the fish was a bit dry and overcooked.
Excellent, everything, from beginning to end.
Everyone had a wonderful meal. The waitress was energetic and attentive. The interior is an extension of the outdoors with all windows open. You fell the energy of North Beach.

column4: 350 N. Canon Dr. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: The soups here are delicious. I've had better service in the past. It was alright, but not as good as when I was there about a year ago, so I'd say hit or miss on this place.
Great food and loved dining on the patio. They have a great field for kids to run around and play.

We had a nice dinner at The Calistoga Inn. The patio was beautiful. It was cold that evening and they had patio heaters in several areas. The jazz guitarist was good and added to the ambiance. Comparatively for the area, it is a good meal for a good price.

Set in a vineyard, the views are spectacular! You can eat in the dining room or outside. The dining room is open to the kitchen, so you can see the chef preparing your meal. We had a lovely, quiet meal!
Just a fabulous experience - keep' it "fresh"

column4: 610 First Street Oxbow Public Market Napa, CA  94559
column13: Pizza was excellent, although a bit saucy. Desserts are even better. Waitstaff attentive and charming.

column4: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA  90036
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Really delicious food, waiter knew his menue and helped us make some great choices. Lovely dininging experience

our experience was great! the service was very good; wait staff knowledgable & attentive without being annoying. The food was delicious; we had the lamb duo & the scallops. We will definitely be going back.
Wonderful food, place everything. Cannot believe we didnt know about this place for 3 years.

This is the first bad review I have written. The beer list was really impressive and my group was realy excited to try them. The menu of beers can be overwhelming and it took us a bit to decide. Then the waitress said they were out of the ones we wanted. we again looked at the menu and decided--ordered--again they were out. I wish she would have just listed the ones they had as they were out of most. This was a Tuesday not even a weekend. Then we ordered. The food was bad.The fish and chips was all batter and the little bit of fish inside was not cooked. The best thing on the menu was the soft pretzel!

column4: 34344 Street of the Green Lantern Dana Point, CA  92629
column13: I took my wife to Cannon's for our 10th wedding anniversary and I have no complaints. I ordered flowers with instructions for them to be on the table before we sat down and they were. The staff was attentive and eager to please. I would highly recommend this establishment to anyone. It's a definite stop on our list when we get back there!!

column4: Dolores St. between Ocean and 7th Carmel, CA  93921
column13: We had a fantastic lunch before heading back home. I was bit skeptical as it took a long time for our server to get to us. Seems like he was working all the tables and bar on his own, but once we got our order in, everything was perfect. We were happy and kids were happy. Excellent salumi!
I try to make it to Capannina at least once a week. It is an outstanding Italian restaurant. And Rocco is the best!
SIMPLY AMAZING!!!! A must go to place to dine.

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Best Malbec cellar in North America. Love the family that runs Carlitos Gardel and the warm feeling. Great beef and deserts.
The food was amazing as usual. Heirloom tomato salad was like no other. We had a large party and shared many different dishes. All of which were unique and scrumptious .

column4: 4500 S. Centinela Ave Los Angeles, CA  90066
column13: Always a pleasure coming here ! ..great food n great service !
Great food and service. Will be back!
Good beers, great waitstaff, great live music. Kitchen was slow a

food and service is good but the price is on the high side. Even though we booked through open table they did not have our reservation when we arrived. Don't know why but they were able to accomodate us.

column4: 14701 Via Bettona, Suite 200 San Diego, CA  92127
column13: This is a wonderful local restaurant. We want to try & encourage people in the neighborhood to go. The chef is very creative & the food is always wonderful!

column4: 1212 Coast Village Road Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: Always a favorite to visit when we are in the area! So glad you are still there!
We went on a Sunday evening and had the place to ourselves. The food was unique and very good. Excellent place for quiet dining and conversation. The prices were also very reasonable.

Been reading about Celistino Drago's restaurant for years, now I understand what the buzz is all about. This is Drago's gift to Pasadena. Everything about the restaurant is top-notch. Nothing in the area comes close for Italian fine dining.
Service is friendly and the food is good, but it takes too long for us to wait for our food.
We go to the Cellar every year for our anniversary because the food is excellent, and the staff makes you feel special.
The manager was awesome and the service was great. Thank you~R

food prep and taste excellent, service excellent, noise level from piped in music still too loud, Portions for first course soup at $13 way too small and same for salmon portions at $28. mentioned this in last time there and management still not paying attention. Food great but price for portions way off. Have eaten at every restaurant in the Bay Area and never encountered such stingy portions. get these people on the program.
Sit outside if you can. The noise inside is way to loud.

column4: 151 South Doheny Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90211
column13: Very good food, service in a well decorated restaurant. Both our kids were welcomed and had a great time. Keep up the good work.
Fun place, with surprisingly great food and great service.

The service was perfect. The setting was great. We were able to sit side by side. It was our 15th anniversary. We each ordered the specials....her a lobster tail and steak, my self a steak with bone in. Both were ordered medium rare. Mine came in more on the rare side....purple at the bone and they had to take it back to cook it a little more...came back just right. The fries that came with "surf & turf" we one th cold and tuff side but still accented them meal nicely. The cooked tomatoe that came with my steak was also nicely done. I would say the meal was a little pricey for what we got as it comes with little to no accessories or sides. Looks pretty small on such a big, hot plate. Again the service was perfect.

The atmosphere was great, we had dinner outside on the terrace.We ordered chantanee soup which I highly recomend and then we have Phad Phed Gang Dang and Havenly Beef which were delicious.We'll be back again.
Excellent experience all the way around. The food - different and delicious, thepersonnel - friendly and energenitic, the atmosphere -- good vibe.

Hands down one of our favorite places to eat. We are always looking for a reason to eat here. Food is great, servers all speak Italian and are quick with any requests. Can get busy on a Friday or Saturday night, but still we have never had to wait more than 5 mins for a table.
Awesome location in Waikiki. We walked from the Sheraton and enjoyed the al fresco dining. The food was very good - even the kids enjoyed the menu selection.
The food was fantastic and the service was amazing!
Had their signature steaks along with signature salad. Delicious!

column1: Chez Papa Resto at Mint Plaza
column13: We came for a friend's bday earlier this week. It was a Monday, so it was quiet, but that made it more intimate. The decor was posh..sort of like something you'd see in Vegas. The food was quite good! We shared several apps and sides, the ones that stood out were the beef tartare and pork belly apps. I had the halibut, as my entree which I thought was DELICIOUS! Perfectly cooked and flaky and a nice combo of flavors. Service was great. Overall a nice experience but the only thing I must gripe about is during dinner, my friend said he saw a mosquito! It was quite dim in the restaurant, and it being a nicer restaurant, we thought he was crazy. But he was right!! I ended up getting TEN mosquito bites on the tops of my feet!! GRRR!!
The chefs menu never fails to impress!
Perfect for a business lunch, with enough table separation for a fairly private conversation while providing an enjoyable and tasty meal.

Chimney Park did not have our reservation. The staff are less refined compared to Jay's in Fort Collins. The duck breat was small and therefore difficult to cook medium rare, it came medium. Espresso machine was broken for dessert.

column4: 3708 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Had a few good dishes but most of them were disappointing. There was a noodle dish that has mushrooms and bok choy in it that tasted only like vinegar. The hot and sour soup was also all vinegar and no spice. The chips did not seem fresh and the salsa was probably from a jar. The chicken soup (caldo something) was very good. If I go again I'll stick with that and maybe a few tacos.

I took four friends from out of town. They loved it! The food was amazing. The waiter was appropriately attentive. We appreciated the chef stopping by our table to ask about our experience. I definitely will go back.

Great place to go with a group! Must try the bacon wrapped mochi and mentaimo. We also loved the arugula beet sarada. We recommend the kakuni over the butta belly. Leave room for dessert so you can try the mini donut - so yummy!
Hailbut was cold, scallops were way too salty and my plate had fingerprints all over it. What a waste of an evening. Don't make the same mistake, please.

What a find! Every table had an outstanding view! We were greeted and seated immediately and even offered a choice of inside or outside even though the restaurant was jumping! We were seated in a small booth the hosted called "The snuggle booth" we sat side by side and faces the gorgeous lake and watched the sun set. The food was amazing both in taste and presentation! Rich our waiter was both charming and extremely knowledgeable about all aspects of both food and wine! The wine list was sensational. Christy Hill is now on my short list of favorite restaurants!

Santa Barbara is well know for having some terrific Mexican restaurants. Many of them are small store front establishments that serve authentic cuisine often adapted from family or traditional recipes. Cieloto is not one of these. It's located in the middle of downtown SB in a street mall adjacent to many chic shops and eateries. It has an innovative menu and contemporary decor that definitely makes it one of the more upscale Mexican restaurants in town. Unfortunately, the food is inconsistent. It's a great place to eat alfresco in the front courtyard, replete with fountain.
Well priced restaurant with good food in the middle of St. Helena. Helpful and well attentive staff.

The bottomless mimosas are not bottomless! Our party of 5 ordered brunch and bottomless mimosas on a Sunday morning. When we were sat we were the only customers in the place. We were told after our food and drinks arrived that they have a 1.5 hour limit on the mimosas. After being there an hour a glass got broken on accident and we were told they wouldn't serve us anymore mimosas. A 6th friend arrived and ordered brunch and bottomless mimosas about 10-15 minutes prior to the glass getting broken and they told her they would only serve her one more but still made her pay the $10 for the so called bottomless mimosas.

column4: 7111 E. 5th Ave Ste. E Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Food and service was excellent. Unique drinks and well known for their mixologist. All 5 of our meals were outstanding. The chop salad and chicken and waffles were on point. Short ribs were extremely tender and tasty. Filet cooked to perfection. Will definitely come back again.

service was great, we loved Frank. also, the food was amazing and came out quickly and at just the right cadence. they were not weirded out by our desire to order a bunch of things to share family style, and were overall very accommodating. GREAT dinner experience.

column4: 425 South Coast Highway Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: Over the phone they said they have great sunsets, however, when we got there the sun does not set over the ocean and you cannot see it well. Great view of the ocean although you can't hear the waves. Scallops were fantastic!

A high school friend and I had a great meal at clarklewis. Luckily we were in the back part so we could chat and catch up. Clarklewis is not a quiet place -- I think a train came by at one point. The good news is the food and service make up for it. I had a great meal with a nice red wine. My friend also enjoyed her meal. I ordered a nice dessert with a wine pairing. Our server was very helpful. It a bonus that clarklewis is in the passport discount program.

We were in the mood for very good Indian food and came back to an old haunt. The soup was especially good -- Parsnip and cardamom, an interesting combination. I had the seafood curry and the fish was exquisitely tender. We also like the lamb tika masala. My husband's lamb vindaloo was too spicy for him and a little sour. I had the rice pudding and that was just as good as I remember. Will defintely come back !

column4: 18070 San Ramon Valley Blvd San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: first time to eat there; fantastic breakfast, and superb service...will return!!
We enjoyed our evening and look forward to returning. The squash blossom flatbread was a great appetizer. Great wines by the glass
A great find in a shopping center. Great service and we loved the half price wine on Sunday and Monday.We will be back
Toooo noisy. I can hear the voice even at the same table.

Fantastic Sturgeon, salad and cheese plate! Signature chicken was overcooked and somewhat dry but the Faro accompaniment was incredible. We'll be back-very nice for a casual dinner when you want terrific food with no fussiness.

Coi is perfect for someone seeking a food and wine adventure. Each plate was artfully prepared and contained at least one item that took me outside my comfort zone. And I loved every minute of it. The server was knowledgeable and answered all questions professionally.

The food at Colibri is absolutely fresh and delicious! The potpourri of flavors of the carnitas, the tortitas de papas, the Mexican rice and beans is one that I'll need to experience again. This is a great pre-theater place, too!

went with a group of 9 to celebrate someone getting married soon. The staff was very polite and accomodating, and the food was good. The Ambience was good, not too loud but yet lively. Would definitely go again with a bunch of friends or on a date.

There is absolutely no lights In this restaurant wich meant you dont see what you are eating. Not a good thing of you're eating whole Fish and you have to deal with all those little bones. The food was good but I've been to better places

For the 7 course prix fix meal, 3 courses are rated A, 2 B's and 2 C's. Given the price of the meal, this is a disappointing rating. One course may actually be a D rating - combination of albacore tuna and seaweed - a very fishy combination and a very poor choice.
Contigo always has a great twist on Spanish tapas. Wish the portion sizes were a little larger.Definitely get the churros and chocolate for dessert!

column4: 5555 Washington Avenue Suite A Houston, TX  77007
column13: Definitely try the Spaghetti Pomodoro! We sat in the wine room in the back of the restaurant and enjoyed it tremendously. The flavor was there, not overly salty, not overly oily, just the right amount of seasoning and good ingredients.
Copia is a Gem. The restaurant was quiet, wine list moderately priced and nice selection. This was the best Trout I ever had.

column4: 4991 S. Alma School Rd. Ste 1 Chandler, AZ  85248
column13: We came for the tasting menu before the restaurant closed for the summer. Having been here for their happy hour fare we were excited to see what the chef could create. The food started out great. Perfectly cooked and seasoned. We tried all the different selections that were brought out to our table of 4 and there were plenty of ohhs and ahhs. But as the evening progressed and we moved to the entrees, 3 (hangar steak, couscous, and pork belly) of the 4 dishes were so incredibly salty, we couldn't finish them. The evening did end in a good note with beautiful desserts that were prepared with just the right amount of sweetness.
Hostess did not seat us before others that can in after us and we had reservations. Also she didnt ask if we had reservations.

The menu was limited and confusing, which could have been helped by more attentive service. We were a "share-table" apparently and our identified waiter arrived only with the wine and to present the check. Some of the rest of the staff was pleasant. The agnilotti were sublime, as was the pizza. It reminds me of a modern day, "to see and be seen joint." Overall, a disappointment.
Delicious food and excellent service by Fritz; we love going to the Cottage when we are in Flagstaff!
We had a spectacular meal and our waiter was extemely nice. We are already telling our friends about how great the food tasted and how much we liked it. Cowboy Ciao is a great restaurant. Thank you!

The mixoligist started the night right with the best Old Fashion I have ever had. The appetizer of homemade potato chips was tremdous. The shrimp and grits were great. Didn't have room for desert but looking forward to going back and try it.

We brought a party of 20 (had a reservation) and then proceeded to add another six people unannounced. Due to our own challenges we didn't sit down for at least an hour after we arrived, instead standing by our tables around the bar drinking wine and just commiserating. When we did sit down we ordered haphazardly and unintentionally didn't make too much easy for the staff.
Great food, fun place to hang out, super music.
Crudo was excellent.Mushroom dish excellent.
Our server, Fianna, was fantastic! I am so glad she recommended the heirloom tomato caprese salad with fresh mozzarella - it was amazing! The pappardelle with wild mushrooms was equally good.

Everything was great! I said kid friendly but I was there during the week. If the same little girl would have been running around making noise on the weekend I would have been a little less forgiving. Hopefully the parents would not allow that. Service was good, food was great and the price was fitting.
Food was good. I recommend the fiery brussel sprouts. Restaurant was loud, but there seemed to be a lot of people having fun.
Great to find an organic restaurant close by. Most enjoyable meal in a long time in the south bay.

We went early on a Saturday evening and were seated immediately outdoors, our choice of location. The waitress was very prompt in getting our drink order and bringing them. We ordered both from the tapa or "happy hour" menu and the regular menu. The tapas were outstanding - bruschetta, mini caesar, and caprese. Delicious and the perfect amount. The two entrees were lovely as well.One was a fabulous plate of mushroom ravioli and the other a simple spaghetti with marinara. An order of garlic bread was, of course, the perfect complement. Throughout the meal the waitress was attentive to our needs and the hostess was helpful in clearing the table and refilling the water. All in all, a great meal and a wonderful experience!

The food was good and the service was good...just one exception. We had bought the AT&T performance package. When our entree's was served, it was only asteak with a clove of roasted garlic on the plate. We were not servedthe potatoes and mushrooms that was suppose to accompany that. I should have questioned the waiter, but didn't. I don't really understand how a mistake like that could happen.I was so sure later that we were suppose to get a side dish I checked it out on the webthe next day.
fresh sushi, extensive wine by the glass selection, excellent service

column1: Opaque - Dining in the Dark, LA
column13: The food was absolutely horrible and overpriced. My chair had a big hole in it.

column4: 3800 South Plaza Drive Santa Ana, CA  92704
column13: Darya has really great Persian food. I love the chicken barc kabobs, rice, and tadiq. The ambiance is a little too Persian for my taste though. It is very upscale and almost too nice to feel really comfortable.

column4: 136 SW Washington Ave STE 102 Corvallis, OR  97333
column13: Definitely one of the best restaurants in Corvallis and a good place to have an 'adult dinner' with partner or friends and an excellent spot for business dinners. Since the loss of the Gables, this is one of the few classy, quiet, reliable restaurants in Corvallis. Interesting spanish-tinged selections, artfully presented, friendly staff and a wine list featuring many Oregon wines and Spanish wines.

column4: 6025 W. Las Positas Blvd Pleasanton, CA  94588
column13: Always a great and friendly place.
Service a bit slow. One person in our group ordered a salad that failed to arrive. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

column4: 1555 Camino Del Mar, Suite 102 Del Mar, CA  92014
column13: Fabulous, innovative and fresh, fresh food that pops with flavor. Prices are more than reasonable and the staff is warm, friendly and helpful if you have trouble deciding which of the many and varied dishes to order.
Food and service were very good
THE SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT! I had a great time. Props the staff they did everything i aske for. never going to forget it!

This was a fun and convenient pre-show destination before an evening at the Sacramento Community Center. Larger inside than it looks. The interesting layout creates an intimate "small pub" feel in a space large enough to accommodate after work or pre-show crowds.
Very nice - great when you have a visiting colleague who deserves a nicer lunch; too formal for bigger work groups.

In an area that is sadly lacking in fine cuisine, Vintana brings a breath of fresh air to North County. While unusual to have a restaurant atop a car dealership, they have done an amazing job with the decor, and the ambiance is wonderful. As usual, with a Deborah Scott restaurant, the flavors of the food were wonderful with a wide variety to choose from. We will definitely be returning to Vintana.

I'm worried. I heard the place may be renovated. This place has a very special ambiance. I'd hate to see it modified. Both the interior and the outside seating have a charm preserved from an earlier era of Americana. I hope the renovation is limited to things like plumbing, wiring, painting and touching up the small blemishes.The food is good and perfect for the setting; it's neither "fit for foodies" nor deficient.

It's in the heart of Downtown San Diego in the Gaslamp. So great location in the heart of the action. I mentioned it was my BDay when we put in the Open Table reservation and it was not acknowledged. Also order was messed up-no biggie on that. I thought the food was ok, maybe a bit pricey based on the quality. Those that want Italian and have the ability to travel a couple of miles might have better luck in Little Italy. But the Gaslamp is always a un dinner spot.

column4: 210 E. Main Street Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: GREAT SPOT WITH MATCHING FOOD AND SERVICE. BEAUTIFUL INTERIOR AND STAFF ALWYS GREETING ALL WITH WELCOME SMILE AND WILLINGNESS TO PLEASE.

column4: 4123 Cedar Springs Road Suite 110 Dallas, TX  75219
column13: Food and service were outstanding. We will definitely go again to try more dishes. The wait staff was very attentative and helpful with selections.
stellar food as always - the new bar is a great addition. can't wait to go back!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Loved, loved, loved finding this spot! What a treat before a symphony. Food was excellent and I loved that there was a cool bar scene separate from a quieter dining room. Will definitely return!
Thank you. Open table was very helpful. The menu at Dona Tomas is incredible. This is my favorite place to go for a romantic but fun, incredible meal.

Very well done. Excellent fish dishes and attention to detail. Hong Kong style Chinese food. Visited with Chinese relatives and we'll definitely go back. Parking can be a problem so plan ahead if you are driving and have a reservation.

I was told this was outstanding traditional mexican food. Ordered 3 of their tacos (at $2.50-$3 a piece) and i thought they would be more than two bites each. Seriously there was a total of 6 bites between the 3 tacos. 2 tachos@ with rice and beans (3" by 3" bowl) are $8, and 3 are $12. At $2.50 a piece, you really pay $3 for the rice and beans on the smaller portion and jump to $4.50 on the $12 plate. I am not impressed. It was nothing to write home about. On the upside, their chips are amazing!
Food was delicious, ambiance was nice. I would highly recommend to anyone who loves Indian food.

column4: 1507 Queen Anne Ave N Seattle, WA  98109
column13: After moving up to the top of Queen Anne nearly four months ago I've made the trip to Betty a handful of times and have been pleased with the service, drink list and service. They have a very good happy hour menu and $20 bottle wine menu. They are also one of the few places on Queen Anne that has a patio on the west side of the building allowing for some great outdoor dining on the days we get to enjoy the sun in Seattle.

Menu was fine; nice trout salad and bruchetta with chick pea/mint/green pea spread. Service was very good. My one complaint is that the music was so loud that dinner conversation was a bit difficult. We asked the wait staff to turn it down, which they did, for a time. However, by the time we left it had been cranked-up again. I know this is a technique restaurants employ to increase the speed of table turn over (i.e. people eat faster if the music is loud), but still annoying. If Crow seeks to be a neighborhood gem, they'd do well to keep at least the table area (as compared with the bar section) a bit quieter for those who want to enjoy the food and have meaningful conversation.

column4: 742 N Highland Ave Los Angeles, CA  90038
column13: Street has amazing, gourmet food in a relaxed atmosphere. I took my husband there as part of a surprise birthday treat (a week after his birthday). First we went to Street, then we saw the amazing Cirque du Soleil show Iris. What a perfect evening! Stacy was our server at Street. She is smart and sassy and picked out all of our food for us. (We requested vegan food, which Street has a large selection of. It is so nice to be able to eat cruelty-free, planet-conscious vegan food at such a great restaurant.) We had the laundry day fritters, the artichoke, the pancake, the candied dates and the tofu with a ginger sesame sauce. All were fantastic! And for desert, we had apple fritters. By then, we were too stuffed to finish dessert, but oh well!

First time to the Dock. It was a great place to spend our anniversary. We had a comfortable table with throw pillows, and a great view of the water. Get the grilled Romaine salad before dinner...it's delicious. The lamb and halibut were also delicous....no complaints here...it was all perfect.
The food was wonderful. The salad ingredients came in from the local farm that day. The soup was unusual yet wonderful. The duck and halibut were cooked to perfection. I will be going back.

Very expensive for an average experience. Interesting menu. Food is brought out as it is prepared so you could watch people eating as you wait for your dish. They suggest you share but I didn't really want what the others ordered. Staff is friendly and attentive but over all not a place I would recommend unless you want a noisy expensive different experience
Excellent meal and service...my only complaint is $9 for valet parking!

column4: 237 S 400 W Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: The bison Tri-tip and salmon entres were absolutely delicious, I got the bison medium rare at the recommendation of the server. Both were served with different arugala salads. The epic chocolate stout cake was incredible. Gnocci appetizer was also great. The server helped me choose a rose wine which I enjoyed. My fiance ordered a cocktail that he liked. We shared all the food and both left full and happy. I made a reservation online for 5:45 on a July Wednesday. When we arrived about 3/4 of seats were empty. By the time we left at 7:30 it was more than half full.

column4: 6024 C Paseo Delicias Rancho Santa Fe, CA  92067
column13: Pleasant and attentive staff in a quaint neighborhood restaraunt. It was so good the first night that we returned the second night in a row with equally good results.

column4: 2937 Bristol Street Suite A 103 Costa Mesa, CA  92626
column13: Food was marginal. Service was poor. No beverage, appetizer, or daily special recommendations. After the order was placed, we never saw the server again, and it took 8 minutes to get the tab when it was requested, and another 16 minutes to process the credit card charge. I will never return or recommend this. There are so many other options with better food and better service.

column4: 28544 Old Town Front St. Temecula, CA  92590
column13: Extremely disappointed! So overpriced it is ridiculous! My wife's food (scallops and prawns) was so bland and lacking flavor it tasted like rubber, I had the T-bone steak and it was probably the worst cut I have ever had a resturant. $30.00 to $35.00 for an entree that quite frankly was not ant better than eating a Norms! it wasa really sad way to celebrate our 30th wedding aniversary!
As always great food and service... excellent place.
Our waiter was great! Service was really above par..everyone had a great attitude!! I will return again and again and let other know..food was fun and tasty!

column4: 2555 NW Campus Village Way Bend, OR  97701
column13: This is a college teaching venue. Food was good as was the service. Need to understand that mistakes will be made as the students are learning proper service. The food showed no mistakes but not quite up to "fine dining" experience but is approaching that quality. The room is a bit of a multi-use room so ambiance is not wonderful. However, the venue was nice and the facility is new. Outdoor dining very nice if the weather permits. Beverage menu limited but good and diners can bring in their own wine. Expect a $10 corkage. All in all it was a nice experience and what made it all worthwhile was being able to interact with students learning the trade and being able to support their learning experience.

column4: 1677 N Main Street Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: menu a bit pricey then San Francisco.
everything was good but the restaurant was freezing.

column4: 1501 W. Magnolia Ave Fort Worth, TX  76104
column13: Once again Ellerbe's continues to impress us with a wonderful dining experience. The Summer Menu was full of items for all likings. The appetizers, especially the okra, were superb. Their wine list is simple and offers great wines across the spectrum. Desert menu could be amped up a little.
Beef fajitas were awesome and the margarita was good. Patio was a little cramped, queso wasn't great, but pretty good little restaurant.
The food was excellent. Good place for dinner.
Could up the quality of the bar options, food was great!
This is my go to restaurant. I feel as though I am in Europe on some exciting holiday and have found the perfect location for food, wine and people watching.
Food was just great! We were with other friends and they also like it.

Fantastic place to get together, family friendly, as well as great for groups or a romantic night out. Food was excellent! a twist on what we imagine to be mexican food...every one should try this out of the box restaurant!!

My wife and I are from Las Vegas,Nev.We have eaten at several nice places over the years,and this was the first time the waiter brought out our entree while we were only half way through the appetizer(we felt rushed).The appetizer we had was the grilled artichoke.While it had a good taste,it was almost impossible to eat(tough)
We recieved a gift card as a thank you and used it for our anniversary dinner. What a great evening. The food was outstanding. We truely enjoyed our evening.

column4: 1825 Queen Anne Ave N Seattle, WA  98109
column13: The receptionist was way too uptight. Not warm or welcoming. Our waitress was very nice and fun. Looking at our menus, we had two copies of one version, and three copies of another version. When we brought that up to the waitress, she didn't seem all that concerned. The brown wall color is horrid. I get that the theme is grain/earthy, but there are better ways. The cheese plate was great. I especially loved the truffle sea stack(sp?). The food took over an hour to arrive. When delivered, they got the tables mixed. My arugula salad was good. But my shrimp entree was nothing special. The sauted greens were bare of flavor. Fried tomatoes was just okay. The sauce was simplistic. No much finesse.

column4: 644 S. Figueroa St. Los Angeles, CA  90017
column13: love this place. i discovered it while working in LA a bunch of years ago. used to be a real firehouse, complete with the pole. (hey guys...if you get tired of the food business...open a gentlemans club...you already have the pole...) interesting somewhat eclectic menu. mixture of modern american grill and comfort food. great service, nice selection of wines/cocktails. had the dead hippie burger and a great beet salad. my dinner partner had the meatloaf. spicy fries were off the charts! all delicious. nice place for a business meeting if you want to enjoy, have a private booth, impress, but no look like you are trying to impress. i will be back when back in LA. highly recommended.

This is a true enoteca - Italian wine bar with very good food, very good service. The wine list is great, interesting. The wine flights offer a chance to taste a number of wines at reasonable prices. A definite must for anyone who appreciates wine and Italian food.
3 different entrees all designed well good flavor but all overbooked by cook. Nice atmosphere. Considering price for quality not likely to return.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Exceptional in every way! Put this superlative restaurant on your All-Time list and get there!!!

column4: 10000 Research Blvd. Suite B Austin, TX  78759
column13: The service was outstanding. Never waiting on the next cut of meat or condiments.

the waitress was clearly more attentive to a party of 8 that was ordering lots of cocktails and bottles of wine...she forgot about our 2nd glasses of wine, and was a vague about some of the menu items...The lamb sirloin tasted like it was the hanger steak on the wrong plate, it was too chewy..Weather was great as was eating outside, and we had our choice of tables
About our best dining experience on our Portland-Vancouver-Seattle trip. This place is a keeper!
Great food for a great price. Quite a variety and a lot of outside of the box ideas!
When Mark is in the kitchen- all is splendid!the service and the wait staff are top- notch- knoledgeable and personallove too his Sunday Brunch- a favorite ! And Sunday dinner- amazing fried chicken!

EVO is still finding its groove. The menu descriptions don't always match the food that is served which is a little annoying. Overall quality is good for the price but they need to tweak the menu and add some other options - just a little too limited. That said, it won't keep me from returning for a drink and nosh, I just won't go there expecting to have a "full" meal.

column4: 99 East San Fernando Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: This is more like a bar/lounge with very very good food.

column1: The Bistro - Fantasy Springs Resort & Casino
column13: Best spicy spring rolls I've ever had and beautifully presented.
They've gone from hit or miss to mostly hits.Thanks Farina!
Nice experience -- excellent food, superb wait staff.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: We went to Farmer Brown on a recommendation for a birthday celebration. We liked the ambiance of this place. Good music, not too loud. Kevin our waiter was attentive and friendly. We ordered the Fried Chicken and it was delicious. It was moist and favorful. We also liked the mini cornbread and the strawberry lemonade. One of our party wanted to switch the side dish that came with the meal but the kitchen wasn't accomodating. That was disappointing. Overall, it was a good experience.
One more thing - great if you have vegetarians or vegans in your party. Lots of choices for them, as well as plenty more for the omnivores. Loved the lamburger!
Excellent food with a beautiful outdoor view.

column4: The Ritz-Carlton, Dallas 2121 McKinney Avenue Dallas, TX  75201
column13: Beautiful atmoshepere and excellent food and service!
The chocolate cake was excellent. I had the shrimp with Parmesan grits. The shrimp was really good but the grits, I didn't like. I think it would have been better with mashed potatoes.

The service here is the best in the city. I thought the wines,although varied and good selection, were over priced. My main course was delicious but my husbands was very under-cooked. Overall, good for a special occasion but next time, we will sit in the bar.

I came here for their monthly FARM FRESH PRIX-FIXE DINNER, and all I can express is such of an EXCELLENT special menu! 12-course prix fixe was served in family style. Each every food item got unique and tasty flavor...its just FULL OF SURPRISES! The presentation to the flavors are exquisite divine and heavenly! Farm fresh salad from Tomato foam, squash, to Kapachi/Sashimi style: Scallop, Tacos, main courses to 3-dessert presented in a stone board just absolutely stunning!My guest and me were overwhelmed indeed. I definitely coming back for their next Farm fresh dinner special and I was always thrilled with their regular menu as well...just sadly they hv to let go w/their renowned Foie Gra/Chicken liver pate after the ban...a true gem!

We had a pleasurable experience. We enjoyed our meal. We sat outside and there was the occasional loud vehicle driving by that halted our conversation, but it was brief. Our server, Gina, was a sweetheart and fun. Definitely a place to visit again and try more items from the menu!
Our party of 6 had a most enjoyable evening. Everyone loved their food and wine and the music. This restaurant has become our favorite go to place.

Firefly has been a Noe Valley staple for many years. In it's early years, it was a destination restaurant and always busy. The original chef must have moved on and the food shows lack of focus now. While our meal was 'OK/Good', there is no more 'wow' factor. 2 of us ordered the grilled Sea Bass which came on the dry side for both of us and to me, tasted like Halibut. It had a good flavor but was lacking in sauce to make up for the dryness. The accompaning beans were overcooked as well. The dish was just not bad enough to send it back. Our other dining partner had the Stroganoff and like us, she stated that the pasta was too al-dente and stuck together. These are signs of lack of focus as this was a Friday night and not crowded.
It was a good dining experience for my wife and I on our anniversary.

Great restaurant, food right out of the wood fired oven, but out of hangar steak the night we visited, although disappointed the rest of the meal shined except for the pasta, the cavatelli were very tough and hard, but sauce was scrumptious as was the almond cake for dessert.
Terrific and unique food, coupled with fantastic service, made for a very pleasant evening.

column4: 162 South Rancho Santa Fe Road Encinitas, CA  92024
column13: My wife and I eat at Firenze's often. We especially enjoy the patio, it's quieter and when we have guest it's easier to talk.

column1: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
column4: 101 Cyril Magnin Street San Francisco, CA  94102
column13: Food was very good and wine selection was interesting. We were seated in the basement so there was littleambiance. Service was excellent.

Our meals were delicious. I had the pork chop which was seasoned and cooked to perfection and my husbands rib eye (the special) was to die for. I had read other reviews that were not complimentary regarding the service but we had a wonderful service

Lovely ambiance, and quiet enough to carry on a conversation without including the diners at other tables, unlike so many places these days. Mediocre service -- very friendly, but our waiter had trouble getting our orders right -- beginning with water and continuing to the entrees, and even mixing up who had which dessert. Food was decent, but would have been better with more professional service that paid more attention to the specifics of the orders. In a town with many other choices, I would not pick this one again.

column4: 1555 Camino Del Mar #322 Del Mar, CA  92014
column13: We were very disappointed in Flavor. We'd heard about the restaurant and were eager to try it. Risotto was ridiculous, like minute rice at best. Prawns were overcooked and hard; we didn't even eat them. Profiteroles were stale, and tasted like the day-old dessert from bakery. Vanilla bean ice cream was tasteless. We won't go back. Next time, we'll visit Pacifica next door, one of our favorites.

column4: 161 E. Orange Grove Ave. Burbank, CA  91502
column13: This was our second visit to Flavor of India, this time for dinner (last time lunch buffet), and it did not disappoint! Only wish portions were a little larger, typically when we go for Indian at dinnertime we end up with some for the next day's lunch. Buffet is probably a better deal but definitely delicious food at any time of day.

column4: 926 S Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78210
column13: Our meals were delicious! We started with oyster sliders and duck egg rolls. They, along with our meals (scallops & tuna) were incredible! The atmosphere is modern, hip, and unique - highly recommend trying Bliss!! We will be back.

column4: 370 East 900 South Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: One member of our party stated that it was, hands down, the absolute best meal that she had ever had in her life. Dining at Forage is not just a meal, it is an experience to be savored. the portions are tiny, but there are so many courses, and they are so packed full of flavor that we were thoroughly satisfied when we left. If you love truly fine food, work of art type food, memories for a lifetime type food, don't miss it.

This was our first time here and we very much enjoyed it. The food was great and the atmosphere was alive. They had a live band outside with lots of people enjoying the music and a full house inside with people eating great food. I would definitely recommend Ford's for good food and drink and great service.

Considering the attire doned my many of the restaurant patrons, It's located (to put it nicely) in a slightly more questionable part of Mission. The restaurant was jam-packed. My fianc and I were seated in the far corner of the interior, interior part of the restaurant so we had no cinema viewing expierence. We couldn't see the screen at all which, without that, its lost much of its niche. It became your run-of-the-mill, overpriced SF restaurant. That aside, the food was great and our server was outstanding.

We attended on a Saturday night with few other diners inside, so the place was quiet; the streetside tables were far too noisy. House salads tasty but ordinary. Fettucini Bolognese and Lasagna were very good; the Lasagne is prepared flatter than usual, but good. The best part of the meal was the dessert Budino: delicious chocolate. The menu and wine list are not extensive, but the service is attentive and the food is good enough to merit a return trip.

I wouldn't go back. We were seated at a table in the front that was so sunny I had to put on my sunglasses. The restaurant looked "shabby" and in need of attention. Table was no level, table was worn and in need of refinishing. No ambience at all. Just a warehouse looking place to eat. I expected more because we have dined at the Culver City Fraiche and really liked it. The food was good but not very interesting. Sorry. I really did try to like it.
Very attentive service. Knowledgable staff. Nice atmosphere but can be a little loud. Food was very, very good. House Wine by the oz was awesome. Definitely recommend Frances!

column4: 6263 S. Holladay Blvd Salt Lake City, UT  84121
column13: Franck's is quickly becoming our favorite place to eat. We've gone there for our last 2 anniversaries because of the spectacular food and knowledgeable wait staff.
Wanted to give it 4.5 stars, just because nobody gets 5..... Old school beats hipster in this one !!

Visiting Boulder, we picked this restaurant based on the reviews on Open Table. The food was good but not great and the concept of the restaurant--Friuli and NE Italy, locally sourced foods--was treated a bit too seriously.

column4: 15717 Bernardo Heights Pkway San Diego, CA  92128
column13: The restaurant advertised a Bastille Day dinner special that filled every seat in the house. They were not prepared for the turnout, although they had to know, everyone had a reservation. They were understaffed, the service was very poor, there was no one running the front of the house. They even ran out of silverware. The food on the special menu was not up to the restaurants usual standards.

column4: 24 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: This is my second visit, I live in Oakland and discovered this place visiting a friend who lives in Twin Peak area.Great food, excellent Sangria
Fringlae is a wonderful reliable SOMA gem, always consistent with a menu consisting of the tried and true, and a few new or seasonal dishes. I have never had a bad experience there.

Let's amke this simple: it was the finest meal I've ever had. The oysters Rockefeller appetizer, the sturgeon, the duck, the service, and everything else were divine. I can't recommend this place highly enough. If you want an amazing meal and don't require a large venue or live music, Fruition is simply spectacular.
The food seems to be getting better, the service was great....still too noisy.
A very nice neighborhood restaurantFood was good,fair price and good service. I would recommend for a relaxed casual dinner.

My husband and I have been to Garrido's many times, we took some friends of ours on Fiday for the first time. We got sat right away which is unusual since they are always busy but they were not actually kinda slow. The bar was not even packed. It took about 7 minutes before our waitress even came to get a drink order which took forever for her to return with even water. I asked to order some quac and queso as she was passing by, again it took a while to get. This visit was not what Garrido's is usually like, we love to go for the ambience, the food and especially the drinks. We have had better service when they are more busy, much more busy.

column4: One Embarcadero Center, Promenade Level San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: The food was just okay. Most of the dishes seem to have heavy cream in it; very rich. The service was prompt, but we felt a bit rushed. They tried to clear our dishes several times even when weren__t finished. The place was half empty, so we don__t understand why they__re rushing us.
The reopened Genoa is just as good as ever. The food is fabulous, the service quietly elegant, and the decor simple but also elegant.
The prices did not match the food quality. Ambiance was good but I felt more like I was contributing to the rent than paying for a good dining experience.

I really likes this last visit. I've been here a few times and it seems like a hit or miss. When it's a hit, it's really fantastic. I started with the soup special of the day, corn and asparagus with truffle oil drizzle. My entree was the ahi tuna. Both were delicious. The soup was one of the best I've ever had. This visit was great! The last visit was included a over cooked, over battered fish and chip experience. That was not good at all.

column4: 540 S Coast Highway # 108 Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: We arrived for our 7ish reservation and we were the only customers, but after about 15 minutes, the place started filling up. The owner, who we talked with for a while, is really delightful and the service was very good. Unfortunately, everything else was unremarkable....not bad, but not great. We live in Laguna and frequent our local restaurants. I am afraid, there are too many great restaurants in town that offer a better choice for dining. I really recommend they work to improve their food....that might make this a great place to eat.
The food was very good. The service was outstanding.will return.
Best Thai food!!! My favorite is the Sweet Sassy Sole & Pad see-u!!!

column4: 398 W. El Camino Real, #114 Sunnyvale, CA  94087
column13: Authentic tastes and quality foods in a contemporary yet warm ambiance. A variety of dishes to satisfy a range of price points.

The decor at gitane is amazing, the cocktails good and ambiance great. If only the food was a tad fresher. Everything we had was very rich with butter and cheese - and every dish had something braded or deep fried... I longed for just a simple bowl of olives as an appetizer. The bacon bonbons were good, but there were too many, and there wasn't anything to offset the flavors, fewer bonbons and a side of something fresh, like a salaf, would have been great. The main course I had, the chicken was nice, but again, the fried potato patties were too much. We didn't stay for dessert. Can't say it was bad. It was fine.

column4: 21 Bellwether Way Suite A Bellingham, WA  98225
column13: Wonderful place to eat. We sat outside and enjoyed the view of the marina with many boats visible. The steak was excellent and cooked the way we like it. Great service. We live in Colorado and were in town for a wedding. This restaurant was recommended by our hotel.
The food is fantastic; my party of 4 enjoyed everything that came out, especially the mushroom pizza and the strawberry-rhubarb crisp. Excellent service; knowledgable and professional but not stuffy.

column4: 330 South Pine Avenue Long Beach, CA  90802
column13: Two of us, wife and self. The $38 1.5 lb lobster was fine. It was a bit stringy. The vegetables were under-cooked.. The Mojito was great. The server was distracted, as if he was still thinking about the table he just came from. The calamari and the beer-battered fish and chips were a tad oily, and the chips seemed to be from the neighborhood McDonalds. The privacy of the high background noise level and the Mojito allowed us to still have some conversation and it was all good.
Food was fantastic! I rated the service 3 stars because we were double charged on our credit card and we are still waiting on an adjustment. Other than that, it's definitely worth a visit.
Always find a good meal and service here. Will continue going there when in Westwood.

This is an old school classic white table cloth establishment with regulars. Don't go in expecting a bar list, or hipster menus, or anything like any other foodie restaurant you've been to. You don't go here for the scene, unless you are a senior citizen, you go here for the absolute quality of the food and the entrees that are moderately priced. No sloppy plates here folks, no food comes undercooked or slapped together, everything arrives as it should in due time immaculately plated. They time things well, although this is not rocket science, so many restaurants get this wrong. The food is hands down great, perfectly cooked thick steaks, they let you split entrees for $3.50 and they also have live piano on weekend nights and a full bar.
wonderful service! Great food!! All 6 of us loved our meals!!
It was great to have this level of entertainment at a place we did not expect to find!

column4: 2701 N. Classen Blvd. Oklahoma City, OK  73106
column13: We were expecting food to be top quality; but would describe as alright -- just did'nt live up to our expectations We had been to 3 of the other restaurants and quality & taste much better.

column4: NW Corner of 6th & Mission Ave. Carmel, CA  93921
column13: We were expecting more given the reviews. We weren't wowed by anything, except the wine list, which one might expect given the location. We found it too noisy to considered romantic. Again, there was nothing particularly wrong with the food, service, ambiance, etc., but we found nothing "special" about it either. I wish I could be more specific, but maybe I can't because the dining experience left so little impression. Oh, by the way, the 2008 Raptor Ridge Res Pinot (yes, I order Oregon Pinot in Cali Pinot country) was fantastic.

column4: 23207 Bothell - Everett Hwy SE Bothell, WA  98021
column13: As always, a great evening out at Grazie! Staff is wonderful and the food terrific. We will be back!
Wonderful character and delicious food combine forces to support the amazing cocktails at this underground gem.
small(ish) menugreat foodgreat service
Great dinner even for late night...good service....live music in the bar was hard to talk over
Ask for table near window and view those Colorado mountains...

column4: 808 Fair Oaks Ave South Pasadena, CA  91030
column13: Great food and service. Got a little noisy when lunch was in full swing.

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Overpriced, small portions, average taste. The menu selections should really be called "small plates"Attentive and friendly server.

column4: 4800 Burnet Road Suite B-200 Austin, TX  78756
column13: Great happy hour specials if you get there early!
