I find it hard to give an accurate review of this establishment because of the date, I imagine the kitchen was understaffed due to the occasion (4th of july). The drinks were great, the food was passable, nothing special though, the waitstaff was friendly but slow, I arrived at 720 for a 730 reservation, I had the bar check us in, it took another 30 minutes to be seated. No matter how hard I tried I could not get the check until 930. Our waiter informed us that the staff likes to do everything at once, orders, food, checks, I nearly left cash on the table and walked out. Add to that the band playing music too loud to speak over fron 9 on and you get a pretty lame dining experience. I wont be back, but it wasn't a total disaster.
Extremely noisy in front!!! Otherwise great experience
Very relaxing, away from crowds, left feeling like we could not wait to return.

column4: Pier 39, Suite M.209 (Beach & Embarcadero) San Francisco, CA  94133
column13: The restaurant was actually located at the very end of Pier 39 although the map shows it near the entrance. For a restaurant on the Pier (not really known for quality restaurants) it was quite good and the view was wonderful.

The restaurant smelled horrible the night we were there. So bad that we moved out of the main dining room to the bar area. I had been there several times before and this was never the case, and it was embarrassing in this instance because I was bringing a guest who had never been. I hope they get that fixed!
good prices, great food, friendly staff - I'll be back.
One of the best restaurants in the entire South Sound! The food, presentation and atmosphere are always impeccable.

column4: 2100 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: Terrific Steaks at a terrific price.
Fantastic Food. Great staff. One of the best restaurants in LA. Period.

column4: 44 Webster St. (At Embarcadero West) Oakland, CA  94607
column13: The menu is limited and changes regularly, but everything looked delicious. Our server recommended some things -- corn soup, gnocchi, and cedar plank salmon -- and we were not diappointed. The cold corn soup was amazing!

column4: 5530 Douglas Blvd Suite #110 Granite Bay, CA  95746
column13: 1st Time visit. Food was excellent with good recommendations from our waiter. We'll be back.

Truly horrendous service from start to finish. Gave my table away as the hosts miscommunicated. Waitress was impossible to flag down, no dessert or coffee offered. Completely indifferent service. We won't be back.
Worst service I've had in years. Host/bartender/waiter was rude, disheveled, and had a bad attitude.
Other than a Noise level that was very high, almost drowning out all normal conversation, this restaurant is now my favorite place for food, ambiance, and service!
Good for theater at Balboa Park

I can't say enough great things about Hibashi. We have tried all of the other teppan tables in the area and this by far exceeds its competitors. They recently went through some staffing changes and things are drastically better. It is very obvious that management is finally focusing on service.....as their food has always been fabulous.
outstanding restaurant.

I went there for my birthday dinner, waited for almost an hour for my table, then the bartender was the only one who seemed to care that our party was standing around waiting for so long. Our server was not very friendly and a manager never came by to apologize. It was not a friendly atmosphere, the staff all just seemed annoyed that we were there. Being a server I understand that large parties can be a pain but that is in the job description of the service industry. The food was good but the restaurant was an overall disappointment for my birthday dinner.

Having not been there for years, i had heard good things about the new operation there.. Was not disappointed.. service was excellent, food was great and the outdoor deck is a great addition. I will be back for sure..
What a great little place. We felt like we were in grandmother's dining room. Warm, welcoming, and excellent food! You must leave room for desert!!
Good food & awesome service! The place is romantic and perfect for couples, family and friends!

The restaurant didn't have our reservation but it didn't matter because the place wasn't full. They were out of tuna, shrimp, and milk. Weird. The food we did get was good. The appetizers came out super fast but the entrees took a while and service was slow after the appetizers. The servers were friendly though.

column1: Holsteins - The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas
column4: 3708 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Food was good and server was very knowledgeable of menu.
Great food, live music, beer garden...so much to love!
Exterior is unassuming and the interior is plain though the furniture is becoming of the setting. The chalk wall with written specials helps add to the ambiance.

column4: 701 Stone Canyon Rd. Los Angeles, CA  90077
column13: Wolfgang Puck is a national brand, so we weren't sure if the food would be exceptional. We needn't have worried. We ate on the patio and did the Degustation Menu that paired exceptional food with perfect wines. All in all, a memorable meal. The only downside is the price. This is one of those restaurants where you ask "Do we order dessert or send the kids to college?" Great evening!

column4: 3055 Olin Avenue Suite 1005 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: We only had chips and salsa and drinks. Once the band started we could not hear each other talking so we took off. The server was excellent and the drinks were great.

This was a birthday dinner for my best friend. I had dined at the House before, she had not; she loved everything about it. She had the catch of the day (halibut) and declared it the best; I had the lemon chicken and smashed potatos, really would have preferred mashed. The appetizer was outstanding and we special ordered their sweet potato chips which are unlike any other - I asked for another order to take home. Dessert - sweet potato cake with spiced whipped cream and vanilla ice cream was just right and the coffee was excellent.
Amazing food! Would come here all the time if i lived close by.

Always like going to this spot. Nearby with a great bar/wait staff who have personality and great food. Cant ask for more. I guess you can actually. Their cheap carafe wine is usually pretty good too.

Service and food were excellent. Very good sized portions for a very affordable price. It was extremely loud inside the restaurant for as few tables as were there, so we moved outside to the deck, and it was great. Not a particularly scenic view (Schlotsky's and Lamar), but the deck is situated well for afternoon sun.
The tapas for dinner was excellent--the preparations were unusual and creative. Would certainly go back for lunch or dinner !

column4: 180 S. Airport Blvd South San Francisco, CA  94080
column13: This Hungry Hunter location could certainly use a face-lift. The parking lot is gravelled and unpaved, the place is beginning to show all classic signs of dis-repair.I ordered the steak medium well, and it arrived well done. Cooking a medium well steak is a lost art form for many eateries in the San Francisco Bay Area.

the service was just okay, the food was bland and we brought a birthday cake in and they charged us $3.00 per person to eat our own cake. They also had the nerve to charge a 20% tip for barely adequate service. I would never return.

column1: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
column13: The escargot and smoked salmon appetizers were excellent. The entrees were delicious. we had planned a table for two but ended up with a child coming and we were seated at a larger table.
Try the soft shell crab....delicious
Great food amazing service, bartender needs a little more experience

It had been quite sometime since our last visit. We were pleasantly surprised at the no pressure waitstaff, beverage selection and delicious entre's. The ample portions were complimented by a very reasonable price range. The availability of GF (Gluten Free) options is very welcome to those of us who choose to dine in such a fashion.
Wonderful meeting place for all kinds of events. Delicious food, friendly and helpful service.

column4: 11359 Santa Monica Boulevard Los Angeles, CA  90025
column13: The chef owner does a great job with his preparation, fine ingredients and well chosen menu.

Great waiter. Provided helpful suggestions for wine and desert. He gave us the privacy we wanted; yet kept a watchful eye out on us and was very attentive. Went for lunch and had the whole place to ourselves... luv that. Food and service was auwesome.
It basically was the same as it usually is.

This is the best Indian restaurant in Dallas-Ft Worth. The service, ambiance, and food are all top notch. Everything we tried was fantastic. I have nothing but praise for the delicious food. I would describe the restaurant as romantic and intimate. They also have a nice outdoor seating area. On the weekends they have a piano player who plays everything from classical to current pop. She is very good. I really liked this place and can't wait to return.
I have been going here for years. It is a great place with great food and excellent service. This is always the #1 place I recommend to people.
Absolutely wonderful - one of our hands down favorites.

column1: moZaic - The Inn at Palmer Divide
column13: Nice lunch menu. All items have a touch of uniqueness and we all enjoyed our choices. The bar even made up a special drink I requested -- a Vesper martini -- and it was the best I ever had.
very lovely place. friendly service. very efficient as well. Food delicious. Loved the beet salad! the best.

column4: 8788 W. Sunset Blvd. West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: This place has a bar, a small dining area and a cigar bar. So, I would say it's more of a bar scene. My husband and I ordered the ceviche, seafood taco (1 Tuna, 1 swordfish, 1 shrimp), a steak (very decent for $25) and a souffle for dessert. It was Sunday yet very busy, but service was prompt and the food was suprisingly good. I would recommend and would definately come back.

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Good service and friendly staff. The salmon was very good and apparently my girlfriend says the sushi was good but not her best. I am not a sushi eater but we would return here though.

column4: 401 Main Street Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: This new location for It's Italia is wonderful, and the food is still very good. However, the service was excruciatingly slow, especially given that we arrived on the early side (5:30). It took almost 45 minutes to get bread and salad. Everything was tasty but a bit tepid.

It was the music that drew us there. It is a good venue for jazz with a decent-sized stage, good piano, good house sound system, and good lighting. I don't particularly like the table arrangement for viewing the stage, but that's a problem anywhere. It lacks intimacy if you want to sit near the stage. The high ceilings seem to exaggerate the sense of being overly open. If I wasn't watching a band, I wouldn't want to linger there. The booths are at the far end of the room, so you have to choose between a booth with a poor view or a table with a good view. The bar is nice, and you have a good view of the stage from there. We've always had a good time there, since they book really great groups.
I had a great time at the Ivy. The food was great and the decor of the restaurant on the inside was very unique. The outside seating was great with a view and sound of the large fountain nearby.

column4: 111 South San Pedro Street Los Angeles, CA  90012
column13: I really enjoy Fu-ga. I think its one of the coolest places in Little Tokyo. I particularly like their happy hour menu. The service is great and the presentation of the food is done ever so nicely!

column1: Jack and Tony's Restaurant and Whiskey Bar
column13: Just a quick walk from the Hyatt Vineyard Creek hotel, this place was surprisingly good and fun. Picked mostly for it's proximity, the cocktails were well made by a friendly bartender, and the pork and fish entrees were really very good. Nice decor, but the lighting was a bit too bright after the sun set. Overall, a good choice and would eat there again.

column4: 664 North Palm Canyon Drive Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Great food, great service. What else can I say? Jake's is a must-do when visiting Palm Springs! Just keep in mind, they do close for the summer, so make sure they're open before you go.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Food was outstanding and overall experience was very good. Cocktails were subpar.

column4: 123 College Ave Suite 104 Fort Collins, CO  80524
column13: Excellent food! My husband and I went for our Anniversary and to that end, it was very noisy and the tables are too close together. I get that it is a small space and they need to make the most of it, but definitley not romantic or easy to talk. The food though was amazing and the Mexican Chocolate Cream Pie to die for!

column4: 135 W Oak Street Fort Collins, CO  80524
column13: Our server Chris K. is awesome! We've had him several times here and he is the best. Food is always good.

column1: J&G Grill at The St. Regis Deer Valley
column4: 2300 Deer Valley Drive East Park City, UT  84060
column13: Service was excellent and friendly people.
LOVE the new menu at Giovanni's! We had a delicious dinner. Loved the chopped salad! My husband was crazy about the Seafood Brodetto! He raved about it! Service was awesome! Great evening!!!

column4: 3335 West Village Road Teton Village, WY  83025
column13: Scallops and asparagus ravioli were outstanding. Staff was very accomodating as we had a couple of last minute changes. Outdoor dining was great. Chocolate torte was a great finish to a great meal

I cannot recommend this place enough! We had an amazing Sunday Brunch!!We sat in the back outdoor area (very cool and comfortable even in the heat). The food was amazing! We all didn't want the meal to end!You HAVE to go when you are in Santa Monica/Venice area!
A wonderful evening. The dining room offers great views of the vineyard. The service was attentive, with a great recommendation for wine. Loved the short ribs!
Johhny's Harborside is my favorite restaurant when going to the Santa Cruz Harbor. Wonderful view and marvelous food.
very enjoyable. we were 10 minutes late for reservation and hostess had a little attitude. I would have understood except it was not very busy.

Very fine restaurant with excellent American food, campfire trout a specialty, and fine service. We came for the LA Dine prix fix dinner which at 45 dollars a person was definitely worth the money for a nice three course meal. I love their corn chowder. The desserts are great; the chocolate bread pudding is outstanding. Not inexpensive, but worth the money.
First time dining there and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Service was a tad bit slow, but we were all relaxing and enjoying ourselves so it wasn't concerning.

column4: 1000 Bristol Street North Suite 11 Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: I was very disappointed with this restaurant especially after reading good reviews online. The food was blend, the waiter couldn't come up with recommendations. I would not recommend this restaurant and will definitely not go back.

I'm coming to the conclusion that Portland may be the best town for foodies in the US. First meal at June -- just spectacular. Low key unpretentious in a true Portland way -- the restaurant is a rehabbed auto garage-- with food that scores on every level. Not to be missed by those looking for great food.
Great options on menu...one can make a meal with appetizers.
Wonderful romantic dining experience. Great intimate setting. Recommend the wine pairing with meal

Menu indicates only Price Fix 3 course dinner. After dinner we found out that individual courses can be ordered. Server indicated "I should have told you".Food mostly excellent. Ribeye tough and tiresome.
A recent remodel opened the room and added a spot for live music, but made dining noisy.
Excellent server and very good food. LOVED the Travel Zoo coupon. Would not have driven to Dallas to try the restaurant with out the coupon.

column4: 5100 Belt Line Rd Ste 764 Dallas, TX  75254
column13: Most say that Kenny's Wood Fired Grill is the best of the group, but I actually think Kenny's Italian is the best. Try the meatballs as an appetizer; you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They have half price cocktails Monday nights.

column4: 5000 S Beltline Rd Suite 775 Dallas, TX  75254
column13: As always, the service and food was outstanding! I'm in the food and beverage industry, and Kenny's is a well run machine, dedicated to a great guest experience.
The Beer dinner series is a fabulous deal and Chef Graham and his staff always does a terrific job pairing delicious food with the beer from each brewery. We love the beer series.

The staff was top notch. Two of us came for dinner, but the bar area seemed to be buzzing. The night we were there, the bar crowd dwarfed the dinners. Our dinner- roll, braised ribs, salmon, caesar salad, Brussel Sprouts (!), craft beers- excellent!
We always enjoy the food and dining experience at one of our top Houston restaurants.
We have been to other Kobe Steakhouses which were much more friendly feeling. The chef was good but the wait staff was just mediocre . We would not say we had a great dining experience.
VERY DISAPPOINTING. FOOD WAS PRETEND THAI. THERE ARE SO MANY OTHER CHOICES IN THE BAY AREA FOR TOP NOTCH THAI FOOD. THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM
Great food; You will not leave hungry or wanting.

First off, Kupros is in a beautiful old Craftsman house. Very nice. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. We both ordered the Seared Calamari Salad with green beans, kalamata olives, red onion, fingerling potatoes and a poached egg on top. Excellent. Wine was La Creme Chardonnay. Kupros is quite interesting menu with many tempting choices like their Chioggia Beets Salad and White Truffle Mac & Cheese. From Burgers to Niman Ranch Steak au Poivre, everyone will be happy here, which is why we'll return. As to noise-the dining room is upstairs and pretty quiet. Also, it's not hot-has overhead fans and west shade from outside trees. Outdoor dining on upper balcony. Bar area is downstairs. We recommend Kupros!! Oh, they're open Fri/Sat till 2!
Food was ok, would not recommend it to a foodie.

column4: 72 West Marcy Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: some of our group arrived a few minutes early and the table was ready. one in the party has a service dog, and the dog and his owner were treated with respect. 4 of the 6 were from out of town, and they loved it. we locals do, too, and we will return often. thank you very much.

column4: 620 Santa Monica Boulevard Santa Monica, CA  90401
column13: We w3ere unfortunately at La Botte on a very unusual night, which greatly affected our enjoyment of it. Evidently the waitstaff all called out and we were attended by a very capable (but very overworked) bus boy rather than an actual waitstaff. This guy did an amazing job at not only acting as host and serving, but keeping his calm under pressure as the restaurant filled up. I don't know why the chef or sous chef didn't help him out more by bringing plates to the tables at least. The food was great but occasionally a little cold since it sat waiting to be brought to the table. I am sure this is usually an excellent restaurant but we won't go back because this first experience ruined it for us. Too many other great places to try.
Great atmosphere and service. The ceviche is excellent.
With out a doubt the best upscale Mexican food I've had anywhere.
It's amazing how this establishment has gone from ordinary to extraordinary!

column4: 9785 Santa Monica Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: The Sintra

We went to La Fiorentina for a friend's birthday dinner and were absolutely blown away by the service we received. We were greeted by the owner and promply seated. Our waiter was very knowledgable about the menu and wine list and was extremely accommodating. The food was delicious and I was very impressed with the variety of specials. I will definitely be back!
The food and drinks are not what it used to be. The restaurant side door to the main dining room was opened the entire night directly out to the street. It ruined the atmosphere of the restaurant.

Great little restaurant that sparkles at night when sitting outside. The inside feels a little cave like, but perhaps that's just because the outside is such a warm and sweet area filled with quiet ambiance. Food is very good with some less familiar spices, vegetables, and ways of cooking both meat and vegetables. Nice selection of vegetarian choices. Unusual and delightful non alcoholic drinks.
A diamond in the rough ... what a gem to find hidden along Rainier Avenue.
We had a hard time getting our waiter's attention--for water, for silverware, for bread.... but enjoyed our food immensely once we were served!

column4: 3520 East Coast Hwy Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: We had dinner Sunday @ 630pm and we were the only ones there in the dining area. The patio had a little crowd probably because of the happy hour. Our waitress was slow, didn't even offer us the specials for the night and only knew about it when another couple sat next to us and was offered the specials from another waitress. I ordered the prefix sunset dinner for $30 which was a good deal (3 courses). When my desert came out didn't even offer my husband to even see the desert menu/desert drink list. I haven't been here in a year and customer service was sure poor this time which I don't understand since it was SLOW.

We had lunch in the rear garden on a sunny day, which is a treat during a foggy Berkeley summer. It was delightful to eat under the trees and enjoy the flowers. I had one of the daily specials, a tasty sandwich of sliced sausage on a baguette with an excellent Cote du Rhone and was transported to the south of France. The place is not fancy, but comfortable and pleasant.
A nice meal. A safe menu. Good service. Will go back.
Wonderful. Perfect place for my delicious 50th birthday celebration
Food was great. Mango Margarita a big hit.

column4: 3700 S. Texas Ave. , Ste 300 Bryan, TX  77802
column13: The food was cooked perfectly and correct as ordered. The wait was short as well - perfect night out!

column4: 845 Market Street, Suite 400, Westfield San Francisco Centre San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: I have been 3 times before but this time it was the best.Service was really good and we did not have to wait even though it got very busy.Love it that their bottles of wine are 50% off during the month of July.We had: Cesar salad,sformato with fava beans, peas with fresh ravioli,caviatelle w. pork and sauce and a pizza bianco. All very,very good.Dessert was raspberry sorbeto and rhubarb crostata w. vanilla ice cream.Can't get better than that.

This was hands down the best food we had the entire time we were in Vail. It is a bit off the beaten path in the summertime, but completely worth the extra walk. Everything was delicious. Service was spot on. Worth the money.

column4: 23501 Cinco Ranch Blvd, Suite F140 Katy, TX  77494
column13: Las Alamedas always delights the senses with exceptional food, great wines and excellent service. They continue the fine tradition established in the Memorial area and it is now a pleasure to dine with them in our local neighborhood!
Great Mariachi performers! Nice menu selections and well prepared.

The service was really disappointing. We ordered 2 appetizers, a salad, and an entree - the salad was delivered first and the appetizers following within 2 minutes - nothing like feeling rushed. The waitress could not make eye contact and it was hard to get her attention. The flatbread was quite tasty and the food generally very good, but the poor service overshadowed. We won't go back.
service, presentation, taste allsuperb!

column4: 5709 Woodway Dr. Suite J Houston, TX  77057
column13: We had a very nice dinner. Service was great. Owner or mgr. (not sure) came around & was so friendly.

We tried La Torretta on a Monday night when practically no one was there. I LOVE Italian food like you find on Columbia St in San Francisco. So far, I haven't found a spot in Phoenix that really hits the mark, including La Torretta.

"La Tosca" like always, I've to this little nice place several times. I never been disappointed:* Service: Super friendly staff* Food: Delicious, fresh, authentic,* Athmosphere: Romantic " Dinner time"* Drinks: Tasteful* desserts: a must " awsomeOverall prompt service, my glass was never empty.
This food was awesome. Everything from the app, salad, entree, dessert, and the strawberry shots they finished us off with. We loved everything.
our 2nd visit and Nico the host was excellent. gave us a lovely table for 2 at the window, quieter there. the food and service was terrific and we look for ward to returning.

column4: 417 Washington Blvd. Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: Great food - really unique menu with a lot of high-quality, high-nutrition items to choose from.

column4: 11938 W. Washington Blvd. Culver City, CA  90232
column13: Gourmet food that is healthy and appealing to everyone. Leaf expanded their menu to include cooked vegan food. Originally it was only raw vegan. In my opinion, it is similar to Real Food Daily, but more green and health conscious and affordable. Inspiring dishes and classes...this is a restaurant to return to again and again.

column4: 127 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angelese, CA  90004-3704
column13: Dedicated staff. Good food quality but limited menu options.

Bastille Day-we ordered the set menu. After 1 hour we got bread, another 1/2 hour we received the first course. I love breakfast but they were not prepared for dinner. The crepe suzette was the best part of the dinner.

Everything was great, the staff and food. It lives up to its reputation. However, one problem which was, we had to wait 25 minutes for a table. We appreciate that this can happen, but what made it annoying was that received a call the day before reminding us of our reservations and to be on time.

We booked a reservation here based on the website menu and the general feel we got based on the website. When we arrived we were incredibly disappointed. The waiter indicated they had 'cut their menu down' which actually translated into a very small selection of overpriced food. We actually walked out without ordering because we couldn't find anything that interested us. It also didn't help that the place was dead on a Saturday night - the atmosphere was bland and boring. However as a plus, the wait staff were very friendly and when we let them know we wouldn't be staying they were not rude to us at all.

Arrived for dinner before show at Pantages Theater. The service was excellent,the food very good and because we were there early,the outside dining area was almost empty. The mussels and pizza were great and the wine,while expensive, was very good. No negative comments about our visit.

We have been enjoying The Lighthouse since they opened and have found the food and the service consistently wonderful. It is becoming a neighborhood favorite and run into many people we know from sailing as well as just the Point Loma area. The meals are very, very good, the portions are generous and the service is wonderful.
MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN THE CITY. THE FOOD IS INDESCRIBABLY AMAZING, SO FRESH AND FULL OF DELICIOUS FLAVOR. I WOULD COME HERE AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN.

column4: 1001 S Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94110
column13: I really like the food and drinks here but I'm always dreading being seated downstairs. Although it's a vast improvement having proper dining tables and seating instead of the club/lounge-like, coffee table furniture, it always smells like cleaning products down there! It's a bit unappetizing.

Delicious and unusual food, we were well attended to. Limo is a great spot for and we enjoyed a fabulous anniversary dinner there. There was a loud table of birthday party celebrators with raised voices which made it difficult to had at our table, but it was happy noises and tolerable. I recommend Limo, the appetizer of shrimp and coconut with yuca was sublime.

column4: 3808 N Williams Ave Ste 127 Portland, OR  97227-1468
column13: Lincoln continues to be one of my all time favorites, especially for visiting guests.
Tables were too close..could hear conversations next to us. Food was very good and uniquely prepared
It was tasty food, artfully arranged!

This was one of the outstanding restaurants on our recent visit to Scottsdale. When we walked in to Local it was packed, and seeing how it was more a neighbourhood spot we figured it would be good. We were treated to an amazing meal, wine and service. Would certainly return on our next visit.

The food at Local was enjoyable, but the service ruined the dining experience. I went with a large group on a Saturday night, and accomodated a change in our group size the day prior. We arrived and waited over 40 minutes to have our drink order taken, and by that time our water glasses were empty. Our server only came after we brought this to the attention of the hostess and was not apologetic. The wine we selected from an already limited wine list was out of stock. The food would have received an "excellent" review, except the lamb that several people at our table ordered was overcooked. Of note, it was brought out at about the pace of the drinks. I want to want to come back, but don't know that the service is worth it.
Everything we tasted was beautiful and delicious. The details were lovely. Portions could be larger, even the larger option was a bit small.
Fodd prep very good. Service excellent. Music still a little loud. main course portions still too small..\

Great food, our server was perfect! The right blend of helping and leaving us alone. Did was delicious ( you HAVE to try the duck!) a bit noisy, but that's just the type of place Overall ? I'd go back - if that tells you anything and would recommend this spot to friends.
the food was mediocre. the service was rushed and amateurish.

I'd read generally good things about Locavore, but when I walked in the door at 7:30 on a cold, foggy summer mid-week night and only saw about 8 patrons, I was suspicious. The restaurant is one big wide room with "bohemian" finishes. I did look forward to actually being able to hear dinner conversation for a change, but a little buzz is desirable.

column4: 5532 North Palo Cristi Road Paradise Valley, AZ  85253
column13: Very nice...but pricey dining experience.
Typically cold in the restaurant, and I bring a sweater. This time it was awfully warm. We even asked the waiter to turn up the air conditioning, but not sure that happened.

We think Lou's Food Bar is awesome! We have been several times and it has always been good. Last night we had the fried chicken which was the best I have had in Denver. It was crispy, juicy and flavorful. The potatoes lyonnaise which I substituted for the whipped potatoes were great. My husband loved the calamari salad and I loved the lyonnaise salad with duck confit and a fried on top. It is totally casual and a comfortable neighborhood spot. Frank continues to be one of the top chefs in town!

I went there for mexican with 9 more friends. Their appetizers are great, but their hamburguer with garlic french fries is not that good.The awful thing about the place was the insanely loud house music that was on. People were watching baseball, others were just trying to have dinner and a conversation - and yet the music was loud at if this was some kind of disco. I really don't get it. I had to scream in order to make myself heard to the people right in front of me at the table. It just doesn't make sense. The price was fair, though. Turn off the loud music and it's a pretty fair mexican restaurant.
Wonderful pairing of ingredients in every course, the staff makes knowledgeable suggestions and the evening is well paced.

column4: 1279 Coast Village Road Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: WE loved the place, the food was exceptionally good from the salad, to the staeak and potatoes and vegetables to the dessert.The service was extremely good. The whole experience was wonderful. One of our best dining experiences.

We had their 5-course tasting meal with wine paring. It was our 4th visit to Lucques and what made a difference this time was our server Luigi (alias Luis)whose professional attitude and knowledgeable recommendations with food and wine made this dinning experience memorable. Lucques was a "good" neighborhood restaurant in our books, Luigi single-handedly made it an "excellent" one. We'd make our future reservations based on Luigi's work schedule!
Food is good. Very popular place. Big crowds on Friday night. Glad we had reservations on Open House.

column4: 3975 SH 6 South Suite 100 College Station, TX  77845
column13: We went there for our anniversary and it was very romantic. There was live music and our waiter was wonderful. We just moved to College Station and were happy to find a nice place to go for our celebration.

We always stop at Lula for lunch when we visit California. We have been coming for over 10 years. The service is great, very accomodating. Food is good- something for everyone. We love sitting outside in the back.

column4: 1023 Chorro Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: The people I went with knew the chef, so we gave him a budget and dietary restrictions, and he gave us an inspired and inspiring meal. The waitress had fun with it too. Absolutely top-notch!
As ALWAYS, LYNN'S STEAKHOUSE is head & shoulders above ANY Houston restaurant!
A nice place. Great happy hour. The food was excellent. Had to wait a bit for service when we arrived.
Service, drinks, and food were all truly outstanding. One of the best meals ever.
A Gem of a place with fantastic food

column1: Alex Madonna's Gold Rush Steak House
column4: 100 Madonna Road San Luis Obispo, CA  93405
column13: Excellent steaks, done perfectly. Sides and salads basic fare, not innovative. Service spot on, but not intrusive. Wine list has modest selection of different varietals, with emphasis on Central Coast wineries. Decor is over the top Alex Madonna (check out the website for the Madonna story), but makes for a fun evening. All seating is booths, private and quiet.
Went with vegetarian friend, perfect choice. Sat off the street on a pretty day visiting Long Beach.
food was very good. portions were bit small. bread was excellent. wine choices were excellent, especially the French wines. service was good.

column1: Mai Thai Restaurant and Bar Downtown
column13: If you like Thai food, Mai Thai is always a good place to go in downtown Boise.
We loved it! Great food and awesome outdoor patio. Tapas were outstanding and we had a good spanish wine recommended by the waiter. We will be back!

The food was excellent & the service very attentive. The only downside was it's rather noisy. However, we have gone to Malabar many times & certainly will go again. We do prefer late lunches as it's much more quiet then. We do recommend as a wonderful place to have delicious and very reasonably priced food. The apple peanut slaw is not to be missed!!
Great service, casual but elegant atmosphere, beautiful out door scenery. Will come back again.

Have been here many times mainly for the ability to sit on the terrace which overlooks the ocean (wonderful view). Food is pretty good, but service is consistently lackluster (you will order and the food will come out an hour later). This is not a one time issue, as we have been here probably 8-10 times and the service has lagged probably 75% of those visits. But, you can't beat sunning on that patio during lunch, so if you have lots of time to kill the lack of server attention may not be an issue for you.

column4: 515 W 7th Street 1st Floor Los Angeles, CA  90014
column13: A return visit with friends was very successful. None of us were disappointed in our choices and only wondered how they thought of the dishes. Staff was very engaging and knowledgeable. The Leches cake was so fulfilling, yet light, that I felt virtuous eating it. Mas Mas Malo for me.

I visit Mama Mia's multiple times a year. And for the most part it is a great/romantic little spot. I would highly reccomw d this Ittalian gem. Food is excellent and the service is usually great. I will however say that my last experience was unpleasant. Maybe the server was just having a rough night. I used to wait tables myself so I am very jnderstanding and patient when it comes to poor servicei. But this last time was so bad that I even complained to the manager. That MIHHT be on a once in a 5 year time frame. Although I will eat there again, I will have a hard time forgetting such poor service. Great food and usually great service. I guess we just happen to eat there on an off night. Thank you

Mama's Fish House was Outstanding, in every sense of the word. I was lucky enough to receive a gift certificate to Mama's from friends for my 50th birthday. They had been there while vacationing and knew we would love it just as much as they did. The grounds were amazing, definitely arrange dinner during sunset- do not miss those views!! But the food- oh my- every foodies dream!! The flavors, presentation and service were spot on. For a starter we had the lobster guacamole-lobster in every bite and presented in a martini glass surrounded by delicate lightly salted chips...the macadamia crusted mahi mahi stuffed with lobster and crab is a must have. Beautifully prepared and presented. The Ahi tuna was perfectly seared. A very special place
I love it! I would like to eat there once a week!The owners are delightful.
This was a wonderful classy place for a nice dinner. Lots to choose from and you really can't go wrong with what you order!

column4: 333 S. Alameda St. #305 3rd Floor Los Angeles, CA  90013
column13: A great place to celebrate an occasion with a big group.

We have been to Manresa many times over the last 10 years and each visit seems to be even better than the last. I think this may have been our favorite meal yet. The "classic" wine pairings were done perfectly with the prix fixe meal. We hope to return before another year has zipped by!
Really had a wonderful experience. A fantastic service staff and wonderful food. Paid great attention to the notes and special requests we entered when we made reservations. Highly recommended.
Really good foon, chairs could be more comfortable, but everyone was very happy with fDinner!

Hands down, this is the best meal we've had in a long time! We chose to sit at the counter without realizing that it would put us in direct contact with Chef Marcellino. He took care of us personally, sharing the fresh made pastas, chatting with us, selecting a special dessert for us, helping with our wine selection. Besides the chef being charming, the fresh pasta was outstanding. Mine was small sheets of pasta with shaved truffles on top - seriously?! My husband had saffron pasta with fresh Manila clams and broccoli rabe. Fantastic! We started with imported bufalo mozzarella and prosciutto with basil grow in the chefs garden - who does that? We ended our meal with a lovely lemoncella with lemons grown in the chefs garden. OUTSTANDING!!!

Had a reservation for 6:15, but were seated promptl when we arrived at 5:30. Stuffed squash blossom was a whole battered squash deep fried, tiny blossom with bland filling. First course plates swept away just as I was eating the last bite, main course plonked down immediately and clearly had been kept warming.Chewy duck, orchiette dish did not come together. I love spicy food but this was spice with little flavor. Waiter offered to decant our wine but only "remembered" when it came time to present the bill. It was Bastille Day but not a single celebratory touch except a mention on the menu. The best thing was the lovely outdoor garden.

column4: 3335 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA  90007
column13: We were looking for a place to eat that was close to the Galen Center. This was a great choice. Walking distance to the center, great food and great friendly staff. We wanted something that was moderately priced and not a steak house or fast food. They are hard to come by within walking distance of the Galen Center. Try it.

column4: 218 Sir Francis Drake Boulevard San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: The meat in the Tacos Carne de Asada has been getting to be of lesser and lesser quality. Last night both of us ordered it and had to spit out most of the meat because it was unchewable. This restaurant is owned by Insalata's--a wonderful restaurant. They should know a decent cut of meat.

This was my wife and I's first time at Marjorie. We truly enjoyed the foood experience -- several unusual items on the menu as well as some standard fare, and a great, friendly service. The patio is tucked away jus stepts from the street but it doesn't fell at all like you are eating on the sidewalk. We've been looking for a local gem and we have found it. We will definitely be going back inthe coming weeks.
No corkage all the time. We both had the ribs-very large portions. We could have shared. Received a complimentary birthday Rice Krispie treat.
Great deviled eggs as always. Crab Louie and drinks were great. Table and desserts didn't measure up to rest of meal.

column4: 3940 Fourth Ave. Suite 200 San Diego, CA  92103
column13: The best array of martinis I've seen! Happy hour prices can't be beat.
Excellent patio and friendly, helpful service. Dinner was scrumptious. A perfect place to catch up with an old friend!

Menu has changed significantly from our previous visit. Mainly a tasting menu. Set expectations, only 3 entrees on the menu, rest are all small plates. Food was good. A little expensive for quantity of food.

column4: 2625 Marys Lake Rd Estes Park, CO  80517
column13: The waiter's English language skills resulted in a few instances of miscommunication. For example, he indicated that our caesar salad would be prepared table-side. It was not. We indicated we would be sharing it - he brought us one plate instead of two.
Flavors popped on every dish. Squash blossoms were excellent as was the Tuna Carpaccio. Wood fired pizzas are delicious.

The service at Masala was indisputably the worst I have ever experienced. My husband and I were kept waiting for over an hour despite being told mulitple times that we would be seated at the next available table because the hostess opted to seat other guests (groups of three people, whereas we were only two) each time a table opened up. Both groups arrived after we did and, unlike us, did not have a reservation. After an hour, we ended up leaving hungry and frustrated. The hostess and manager were aware of the situation and did not even offer to comp the drinks we had at the bar while we were waiting. Suffice it to say I will never go back; there are plenty of other Indian food restaurants that know how to run a business in the Gaslamp.

Love this place! Great venue to have dinner with a large group of friends that like a vibrant atmosphere and live DJ. It can get a little crazy, but we like crazy, especially if we're surrounded with delicious freestyle sushi, awesome friends, and great music.
Yummy food. Good service. Good ambiance. Go there. You'll like it.

column4: 155 South Palm Canyon Drive Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Nothing better then a little sushi to start in their tempura shrimp roll, followed by a great pizza and a fresh beet salad. Healthy kind of, and a great view of the strip.
Food mediocre. Plastic chairs bolted to the deck., crammed together. Boat is old and never left the harbor area. A disappointing experience.
Interesting and excellent prix fixe for Bastille Day. Accompanying wine flight was well chosen and good value.

I was looking for a nice restaurant for a business meeting in Fresno for four of us with no idea where to go as it's been a long time since I spent much time here. After a short internet reseach, came across this place and thought it fit the bill. Max's totally fit the bill. Though tucked away in a small shopping center, this place was very nice inside. We were promptly seated and then from start to finish the food and service was great. Highly recommend.

column4: 855 El Camino Real, Ste. 110 Palo Alto, CA  94301
column13: I like this place for private conversations. Booths are high and allow you to focus on who you're with even with a loud bustling room full of people around you.
our first discovery of persian food and we are really satisfied: delicious appetizers and fine entres with excellent service!

Service was super awesome. Waiters were on point on bringing out the food and made sure to check up on us, also I'm so happy that they did my request for a special dessert with my fiances name on it for his birthday. Will be coming back here soon and bring my friends with me.
First the fabric on the booth seats were ripped and torn, not good. The food was fair, not sure how to describe it but it was very different (had the meatloaf) not, awful but not great.

Fantastic food, the taste were home grown and delicious. I hope they can heed to rendering the sound issues. It was difficult to hear anything or anyone. You have to go if only for the food and drinks.

column4: 5100 Belt Line Rd Suite #544 Dallas, TX  75254
column13: As always, a fun night out. The food and service are consistantly great -- and the wine slection is awesome!!
The food and service at Meriwether's is always wonderful. We're so lucky we live near by.
Service started out pretty slow. Took a while to get our drinks and to order. Food is on the salty side for me but was still very delicious. Chef came out to greet everyone. Very friendly.
They food was medicore. I would rate Gloria's and MiCocina higher. Service was unattentive even when the crowd vacated. Ordering food at the bar took three requests (chips and salsa.. come on!).

column4: 401 N. La Cienega Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90048
column13: Although the service at the bar was incredible (great customer service at the bar), once I was seated at my table our waiter wasn't that attentive. My friend and I ordered the chef's selections and if those dishes were what the chef recommended I dare not go back. The food was less than flavorful, seemingly thrown together and since when did churros become a mediterranean delicacy? I was anxious to taste what Mezze had to offer but will not be going back for the food.
I had forgotten about this place. It is tucked away. The light menu here is a brilliant idea. Less food, the serving size a normal person should eat, for less money.
Food was not ad great as it usually is. Off night.

column4: #7 Mickey Mantle Dr. Oklahoma City, OK  73104
column13: The food was good, the service was very good and the ambiance was very good. However, I can only give a fair overall rating because the food and wine was WAY overpriced. I never mind paying a high price for dinner at a nice restaurant. I paid approximately $65 for a bottle for wine that I would estimate could be purchased for around $12 at a liquor store. That is too much money for too little value.
Thoroughly enjoyable I will come back

column4: 9162 West Olympic Blvd., Beverly Hills, CA  90212
column13: LOVe love love this place! The garlic edamame is so addicting ...the burgers are great! YUM!
We went for the Burger - it was good!
First time to this restaurant. Had the Miyabi Nabe which was very tasty and filled with veggies, seafood! And chicken.
The food and service were great. The Bar Specialist selected wines for each course. She was thorough in her explanations of the wine. The food was delicious!

column4: 1035 S. Winchester Blvd San Jose, CA  95128
column13: I believe there food quality has declined
Fried asparagus is our favorite. We were made aware of this resturant through Open Table.com and are returning customers.
Outstanding food at a reasonable price. The drinks weren't anything special.
Yummy Italian with lovely ambience!
I was at the restaurant with a group of friends and talking was our main objective. Speed of service was a little slow, but we enjoyed the evening.

This is a great bar spot and good for music on Thursdays and Saturdays. If you're looking for ambiance and a nice place for dinner forget it. Having said that I must admit that the food was good, though overpriced. The drinks were served to the brim and overflowing. Even the coffee was overflowing. The ambiance was a notch above a fast food place. Although we mentioned that it was our wedding anniversary when making the reservation, we didn't expect any special attention and certainly didn't get it. If you want table cloths, a bread and butter dish and spoons with your table setting, this is not your place. At a price for two of $100 including tip (with drinks and one dessert) this place is way overpriced for what you're getting.

Was very disappointed with the food. The caesar salad was very dry with very little parmesan and almost no flavor - even after asking for and adding an extra side of dressing. The prawn linguine was tasteless. Very little flavor in the pesto like sauce and the shrimp were bland with no taste. We had been to Mona's a few times before, but after this experience we will never be back.

column4: 10 Wailea Gateway Place, Unit B-201 Kihei, HI  96753
column13: We had a great night at Monkeypod. The service was good and the food was delicious. They also had a couple of guys playing nice background music. We spent a week in Maui & went out to dinner every night. Monkeypod was by far our favorite. Don't Miss it.
The food was decent, but expensive. And $20 for the buffet was too much considering the limited selection.

What a find! I have only one little suggestion: It would have been easier if the kitchen divided the salad we had decided to split prior to serving it. Other than that, the presentation was outstanding and the food was wonderful.

column4: 16165 SW Regatta Lane, STE 1000 Beaverton, OR  97006
column13: food and service were GREAT! we will be going back for sure! The waiter was very friendly and honest when asked about menu.

First time here. Party of 6, and all had different entrees (salmon, veal, lamb, pork, steak, chicken). Not a single disapointment. Have been to more expensive restaurants and been less impressed. Will definitely return, and recommend to others.

Make sure you snag an awesome booth with a view of the ocean. Oh yeah, the food was pretty darn good too: seafood appetizer platter, scallops, salmon and a nice Santa Cruz Petite Sirah. Good food in Pacifica? Surprisingly yes!

buffet was full of unhealthy food, and poor quality...yuck! the sushi was nasty, mostly california rolls and the one with the unagi (eel) on it was like a dried piece of mystery meat. it actually had the scaley skin on the bottom, tough and chewy..yuck! and the one called spicey tuna looked exactly like cat food. yuck!the salad bar was wimpy and wilted, dessert bar was pretty but not a big deal.don't go! don't waste your money. i wish i hadn't!
Pizza was good. Shortrib was very tasty. Seafood pasta was disappointing. Veal was very good. So, three good ones out of four.
Fabulous food!!! Loved the Rock Shrimp Tempura, Tuna Pizza & Spicy King Crab Legs!!! Wow!!!!
Nice restaurant, great food and wonderful service.

Artisan cheese plate was very good. Tomato bisque was good but not memorable. Other than that, the peach salad didn't work (elements didn't go well together), pizza was doughy and french fries were average.

column4: 1740 South Coast Highway Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: The quality of food was great but the food service was very slow. Waiter and manager claimed this was due to orders from couple of large parties.
Four hours of great teaching and great food. Well worth the cost
Too noisy! Music was so loud, we could barely carry on a conversation. Not enjoyable this time. Perhaps we just got a lousy table. It will be a while before going back.
reasonable prices and great sunsets plus WillieK on wednesdays

The host who said she was owner was wonderful. She was the best they had to offer. Waitress service poor. She forgot to offer cheese on the pasta, we had to remind her to bring ketchup, coffee seconds and she mixed up one of the orders. Food was average. The fried prawns were very over cooked as were the meat balls on sandwich. Pasta side with dinners was bland. Most pasta dishes seemed to be OK.Attractive place and hostess was very friendly and welcoming. Wish them well as they become more experienced.
Great food. Honored reservation punctually.
The food was exceptional. I've been dreaming about it ever since.
Very affordable, and our favorites tasted just as we remembered them from our last trip to Jamaica. Restaurant was casual and comfortable. The sweet potato fries are FANTASTIC.
as good if not better than The French Laundry at less than 1/2 the price.

Everyone who went with me agreed that most Indian restaurants serve dishes that have lots of gravy and little meat but Namaste is the opposite! Hearty servings - good value for money. Very good service - in fact, we were given a free serving of naan with our order. Because the ceilings are so high, I wouldn't call it a "cozy" setting but all-in-all, very nice.
We both had the New York steak and it was really good. Service was great. It's the second time we've been and we'll definitely go again.

Unlike a trip to Napa or Sonoma, you get to taste and enjoy a variety of wines from Europe and the rest of the world!!! The Lounge is friendly, comfortable, and the music soothing. A surprise is the bar food, which was totally delicious!!! Sample taste is a generous 2.5 ounces (full glass = 5oz), and you can purchase full bottles of what you sample at RETAIL prices!!! Wonderful way to relax, chat, and have fun. Then take a bottle (or two) to continue at home. Parking is always iffy in the Marina. Pricey public lot a block away ($2 for 1/2hr).

Ned Ludd was great! The food was outstanding. The wait staff were informative and friendly. The flatbread was incredible, as were the pork noodles, the charred broccoli, the salads, everything! Go with lots of people and try everything!

We loved Nettie's. The atmosphere made you fell as if you were in Half Moon Bay a bit. But this is a nice neighborhood spot. The food was superb, especially the Dungeness crab roll. I thought the roasted Dungeness crab was a bit pricey, considering you could do the same thing at home at half the cost. But no big deal. Love this place, and the obvious attention Nettie pays to her food and customers.

We have dined outdoor there before and we found it lovely; it was stormy on Saturday evening when we were there so chose inside. We find this a romantic experience with elegance and flare. The food and service is delightful and we have been there several times.

Everything was great until the end. My wife and I were celebrating our 9 year wedding anniversary and were very impressed with Nick and Sam's. Went to leave and valet lost our car. They tagged our white car as a black car and had trouble finding it. Had to wait awhile which usually is not too big a problem except we were late to our next reservation. Dinner and service was exceptional in the restuarant.
It's a joint. Nothing special - the food is predictable and average. It's close to the beach, but not on it. Lacking pzzazz.

column4: 5083 Santa Monica Ave. (TOP FLOOR) San Diego, CA  92107
column13: The location is outstanding, the service was impeccable, the servers were most animated and personable, the overall experience was exceptional.
I will return to this restaurant because it is not so loud as many. Our group of 4 could actually have a conversation without screaming.Good place!

The quality of the food, service and decor of this up-scale restaurant make it a natural to be a special occasion selection. Unfortunately, going to this not inexpensive restaurant for a special occasion is not a good choice as one is surrounded by diners in shorts, t-shirts and flips. This is especially the case in the summer. For that special evening choose another high-end restaurant whose customers don't look like they're dining at a burger joint.

Very interesting menu with lots of enticing options. It's definitely geared toward an adventurousness palate with options such chicken hearts and bacon wrapped mochi. A truly refreshing spin on tapas. A great place to go with a large group so you could try a spectrum of items. Service wasn't particularly attentive but that didn't bother me too much. They had their hands full dealing with the electrical issues that evening. I'd definitely go back again.
Food here was very nice - although very little of it was absolutely mind-blowing. It is simply food that has been executed well, and the service is nice.

What a treasure. We were greeted warmly, seated immediately. The service was impeccably attentive and friendly but managed never to intrude on our conversation. Drinks were replenish unobtrusively. But the menu was a great surprise. The menu includes things often only seen on more expensive restaurant lists. Our two entrees were plated beautifully and absolutely delicious. The sense that someone was thinking about what was served was refreshing. The prices are excellent and fair. For a casual dinner, a place to meet for lunch this is a gem.
The concept of shared dishes is great. The scallop and pork belly is to die for. Love the wood fired food

column4: 1628 Oak Lawn Avenue, Suite 110 Suite 110 Dallas, TX  75207
column13: Will definitely eat here again!!!!
A group of 6 went for an early dinner. Everyone was very pleased with their selection. We enjoyed the appetizer of flat breads with dipping sauces

column1: Okura Robata Grill and Sushi Bar - La Quinta
column13: This is exactly what we wanted. Sushi and it was yummy. Enjoyed eating here very much.
Amazing food and great service!

column4: 770 Road to Sixflags Drive St. 100 Arlington, TX  76011
column13: the initial server abandoned my party. creamed corn pureed,good flavor but no resemblance to corn. sandwich bread,1pc. dry no oil or butter,other pc.1/2 tsp.on half of bread,certainly not even a slather..desserts very good otherwise..forgetful..both my companion and I said we would not see a reason to revisit Olenjack

Really enjoyed it...recommend sitting downstairs. Ambience is much more interesting...you can see the wine room in one direction, the kitchen in another, and the patio with large oak tree in another. Upstairs is darker and more subdued. Happy hour until 7 so good deals on apps and cocktails.

This is a small, intimate restaurant. The first visit we sat near the small bar and felt in the way as people walked by. This visit we were in the dining area and much better. The service was slow, but the staff recognized it and brought over an appetizer and an apology. I don't mean to sound harsh or overly critical--the food was great and we'll go back.
Food was good and the service was exceptional.
We came here to celebrate my wife's birthday. 5 stars all around.

column1: On the Rocks Bar and Grill
column4: 12752 Valley View Blvd. Garden Grove, CA  92845
column13: First of all, I made reservations for 2 at 6 P. M. When I got there....they had no record of me making a reservations. I was saved by the fact that there was plenty of seating. Secondly, it was more of a "sports bar" than I realized it would be and as such a bit noisy as men came into the bar after work, watched the ball games on t.v. and rooted for their favorite teams. The food was mediocre and the service was okay but, I had to wait for my bill for a long, long time.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: This was the most amazing restaurant I have been to.
I only went in to try the Beef Carpaccio. It was excellent.
The meal was outstanding. It was one of the best steaks I have ever had. The Ore House had GREAT attention to detail in both food and service. I can't wait to go back!
Tasty home-made, organic, well-executed, consistent, neighborhood Italian in a quiet, pleasant room. We've been many times and have never had a bad meal.
The food and service were great. The ambiance was good but I think getting rid of the formica (though trying to go retro) would be good. Some of the seat cushions in the booths were stained.

I am a huge fan of Indian food. I have eaten at some of the top rated Indian restaurants in NYC and London. Origins is now at the top of my list. There were three of us and we each ordered something different. Each dishes flavors were so unique. Lamb, chicken and fish were each done perfectly. The fish melted in your mouth. The lamb was succulent and the chicken divine. Our waiter, Abel, provided us with superb service and recommendations.The next time I am back in Las Vegas I am going here the first night so that I can go the second night too. It is that good.
The Kobe beef burritos are superb.

column4: 2855 Stevens Creek Blvd Westfield Shopping Mall San Jose, CA  95128
column13: I love the pan Asian fusion cuisine Oryza provides. It has authentic Thai you can find as well as variation of Thai twisted with other Asian countries cuisine!
Service was fantastic food was fantastic great value for what your spending will recommend to everyone

column4: 58 S. Federal Place Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: The sea bass special was phenomenal. I was blown away by the use of local heirloom tomatoes in the sauce. Also had the beet appetizer - roasted to perfection and surprisingly paired with cucumbers and radishes. Refreshing and delicious. I will definitely visit this restaurant again. The only suggestion I would make is to spiff up the white wines by the glass. How about a verdicchio and a sauvignon blanc?
We had a lovely table outside, the waiter was great, the support staff was okay. The food was just okay. Not bad, just not WOW! I would probably try this again, but prefer Osteria Angelini.

There were 4 of us and we dined early on a Friday evening. We have several of the appetizers and each had a different pasta dish for dinner. All of the food was outstanding! The only negative was that the restaurant is a kind of cold, uninviting space. Otherwise it was a very good experience.

Different type of Italian restaurant - not the traditional lasagna, spaghetti, and other dishes you find at a typical Italian restaurant. You can get a meal, a pizza (for 2), panninis, antipasto, or salads. We got a meat and cheese plate to start and it was excellent. We shared a salad and pizza. All was excellent and plenty of food. I would highly recommend. This is our second visit and it was just as good or better than the first experience. The food was well presented and staged appropriately.

Food is overpriced for the Pt. Reyes area, especially for a pasta that is as ordinary as orrechiette with sausage & broccoli rabe, which needed both salt & pepper and a bit more parmesan. Service was not particularly attentive, especially by the wait staff, considering we ate there 3 times (2 dinners & one lunch) within 4 days; service was more efficient with the bussers. Our lunch waiter came once for our order & then once again when we asked the busser for the check.

column4: 3355 Las Vegas Blvd South The Venetian Resort Hotel Casino Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Fabulous atmosphere, food was delicious and service was superb!
Perhaps because it was Sunday, but Sfizio was "out" of a lot of items on the menu e.g. manilla clams, salmon special, pork chop...This seemed excessive.
Great Thai.Great atmosphere. I really like the big tables.

column1: Bar of America & Pacific Crest Grill
column13: Recently met friends in Truckee for dinner at the Pacific Crest Grill on a Saturday eve in April 2012 There was good menu variety, reasonable prices and good food. The grill/bar area has a nice ambience--natural wood and brick. I would recommend this restaurant for a low key evening out.

We enjoy the food and the "local" feel and ambiance . . . BUT it is way overpriced. We keep coming back but are always stunned when we get the bill!! Way overpriced although we enjoy the food and so just do it anyway. People need to know that it is more expensive than many very upscale places with views and much nicer in other ways. Just come knowing you'll pay a lot for better than average food.

column4: 878 S. 900 E Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: I had the lamb which fortunately was cut very thin, otherwise it would have been unchewable and cool.Coupled with a couple of unidentifiable slices of root vegetables, it wasn't much to write home about.

column4: 2 West St. George Blvd. #22 St. George, UT  84770
column13: This was not my first trip to the Painted Pony, more like my fifth or sixth and I live in California and only get to St. George once a year. This will not be my last trip either. This is the first time my husband got to go, usually St. George is a girls only trip. He loved it too. The wine, the food, the service is always top drawer. Can't wait for my next trip!!!

Came to Palihouse for a client entertaining dinner, and we were all very impressed, and very well taken care of. Thank you, specifically, to William for making sure our reservation and dining experience went on without a hitch!
I love the vibe at this place, food is great and service is outstanding!
Thanks Nelly!! Well done as always!!

We've been to many churrascarias (Brazilian Steakhouses), so we know a thing or two about top notch food and service. Although the quality of the food is high for the most part, some of the meats were slightly overdone (flank steak and chicken hearts). The rest of the food is high quality and recommended. Perhaps the biggest drawback of this restaurant is the service of the meat runners. In fact, it's despicable. We weren't served our first picanha (top sirloin) until more than 30 min after we started eating, and that's only after I asked for it repeatedly. There was way too much dinner time where my plate had a big hole where meat was supposed to be. This is supposed to be the staple of a churrascaria, what gives???
Loved this restaurant! Food was delicious. Our server was pleasant and informative. We were not rushed!!
We always went in for their fabulous vegie/vegan dish. It is now gone and so are we! The food is generally very tasty and the piece is reasonable.

column4: 333 West San Carlos Street San Jose, CA  95110
column13: This was my second visit to Paolo's and they did not disappoint. My wife had the ossobucco and I tried the veal saltimbocca. Both were excellent with hearty flavors and fork tender meat. Our waiter was great - very attentive without being obtrusive. Overall a very nice evening and one we look forward to repeating when in San Jose.
Great experience. Will go back for sure.

Didn't look like much from the outside, but inside, the atmosphere is warm and wonderful. The place is a lot bigger than it looks, and is nicely decorated/laid-out, etc. It was pretty noisy - out of our party of six, we mostly talked to the people immediately next to or across from us - but we've been to worse places, especially on a Friday night. Some times it was hard to get a waiter's attention, but once we did, he was very nice, charming, helpful, funny etc. Everyone loved the food they ordered - we were all very satisfied with our dinners and dessert - the seafood dishes especially, but not exclusively. All in all, we were extremely happy with the way the whole night went. Wonderful, wonderful place.

Our waitress, Norria, was absolutely immpecable. Service was firnedly and super attentive. The food was amazing and sitting out on the patio was gorgeous. They could have a slightly darker rooftop shade for the patio during the lunch hour.
Third time dining at Firenze and it has been consistently delicious! Had the chicken breast with a citrus sauce...it was serviced with delicious oyster mushroom!

We dined in Il Garage overlooking the wonderful garden. The heirloom tomatoes and other veggies were freshly picked from the garden. Adding to the ambience was DiFazio with his romantic music. The food was so flavorful and really different from the usual novelle Italian that everyone has. The classic dishes were exceptional. We were really impressed with the wine list and had a wonderful Grgch Merlot followed with a Gott Cabernet Savignon. Finally, we were served a lovely tiramisu and chocolate souffle. We can't wait to return.
Almost there for three hours, slowest service I have ever experienced.
My group had a great experience; loved the food and atmosphere! Our waitress was very attentative and knowledgeable. We will definitely come back again.

column4: 2909 Paseo Suite A Oklahoma City, OK  73103
column13: Excellent food and great service. Tends to be a bit pricey, so it's better for special occasions if your budget is limited.

Interesting excellent food, a bit pricey. Hard surface inside doesn't absorb noise, so by the time we were into dinner, it was so noisy I could barely hear my guest across the small table for two. But it's obviously a happening place. Our waiter was great fun, and went out of his way to help with our request that my guest, who had had one special $5 drink at the bar waiting for me, could have a second at that price in the dining area. Seemed ridiculous we couldn't take advantage of happy hour bar pricing, but he solved our issue. We both ejoyed the food and the interaction with our waiter.

The food was delicious and our server was very helpful in making a wine recommendation. Loved that their wines are priced at almost retail and that they have an extensive selection. We had the oysters (best ones we had during our weekend in Norcal) and mussels (a bit small but the broth was great) to start, followed by the halibut and scallops. Overall great experience.
Positives: Excellent food and serviceNegatives: Almost unbearably noisy (too many hard services to reflect the sound)

This was our second time to eat at Pastiche in about 5 years (we rarely go out to restaurants). Both my husband and I were very satisfied, in all regards. I've been watching my calories and the serving was ample, yet I was not tempted huge portions on the main dinner plate. I would have loved to try the desserts, but kept to my resolve.

Good selection of tequilas, margaritas and other drinks. I had the Chiles en Nogada. It was delicious but the portion was small and I was still hungry when I finished. I helped my wife finish her tamales which were good, not too special.

column4: 231 East Gore Creek Drive Vail, CO  81657
column13: We reserved a table 4-6 weeks inadvance, were shown to a table between the servers station and a table of 17 people, I asked for the quieter table behind us,was told it was reserved, no one ate there the whole time we were there. They rushed us through dinner, glad we ordered a drink to slow service, a drink and three course meal in 30 minutes, are they trying to compete with the drive through window at McDonalds? We deserve better than this. Hostess sure was crabby.

column4: 448 S. Hill St. 13th floor Los Angeles, CA  90013
column13: I looked forward to eating at this restaurant with some excitement, since it looked like fun. I arrived this morning at the appointed time and was shown to a table on the empty far left patio. I sat there for 15 minutes but no server (or anybody else) came to the area, so I went back to the reception desk and told the receptionist that nobody had come to my table and could somebody either come or could I have a new table. He said "sorry" but did not otherwise respond. He and a waiter got into a lively discussion about whether anybody was even assigned to my table and after a while I left. Not a lot of fun!
excellent for a business meeting. Food was disappointing.Wait staff excellent.
Great food and service. Menu offers unique dishes and all great choices. Really look forward to our next visit to sample other items.

column4: 440 S Rampart Blvd #180 Las Vegas, NV  89145
column13: Very good value. Not a large selection menu but good food at fair prices.

Great food and great service. We came for my spouces birthday and they were very accomodating especially on last minute reservation. Very nice garden and overall atmosphere. A must see and dine when you are on the South side of the island.

column4: 514 Via de la Valle,  Suite 100 Solana Beach, CA  92075
column13: Wonderful food, professional and impeccable service, in an unpretentious atmosphere.

column4: 1981 Sunny Crest Drive, Suit #100 Fullerton, CA  92835
column13: Delicious, creative, memorable, and perfect! Presentation phenomenal, Vietnamese food prepared the way French chefs endeavor to do...each bite, an adventure in taste!I will not be satisfied until I try every item on the menu. AND yes! There is a "secret" menuwith items like an unbelievable seared Ahi Pizza! Hello! How's that for different? It will be the 1st item I order upon my return visit this week!

column4: 1800 Post Oak Blvd Suite 6110 Houston, TX  77056
column13: Very interesting menu and not the average fare. new twists on standard dishes
The food was better then I expected. Highly recommend this place to anyone.

Piacere has had its up and downs over the years in terms of consistency. The waitstaff has gone up a notch and with the female chef at the helm it continues to grow and expand.We have been eating out side as of late and it has been lovely.

Good food overall (Caesar salad was a bit boring, chicken perhaps a bit overcooked, veal was very good), nice setting on Shelter Bay, extremely competent wait staff, good wine list with fair prices. A very nice evening.
Great food, though very loud. I had a very hard time conversing with my dining partners.

column4: 9575 West Pico Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90035
column13: We had such an amazing time. The food is very authentic, I am Peruvian and can attest the authenticity of their dishes and their drinks. It is rare to find a good PIsco Sour or Seco de Cordero. Just reading the menu truly made me feel like I was back in Peru. I can't wait to go back. The scene is also very fun, great bar scene and drinks.

We love this place and always dine here when we visit from the Central Coast. The decor is open and airy, an "Italian-lite" style. The owners have orchestrated a wonderful dance among the staff and not one of them misses their beat. We think of Piccola's food as "new" Italian with a wonderful, innovative spirit. A menu with something for everyone is complimented by some truly unique offerings on the daily specials. There's a well-considered domestic and Italian wine list, with corkage available as well.

column4: 28731 Los Alisos Blvd, B3 Mission Viejo, CA  92692
column13: As always the food was excellent. The homemade pastas have great texture and incredible flavor. The wine list is very reasonably priced.
Always reliable eating experience - great!

This is the second time we have been to this resaurant, and everything was great! It is such a great local Italian restaurant. The service is GREAT, and the food is yummy! We haven't disliked anything there. I definitely recommend this place.
They recently started offering a brunch menu and it is AMAZING!
Excellent, as always! We brought friends from Wyoming; and I know they will go back during their next visit to Denver!

This place is in a convenient location to the 16th street mall without being right on the mall. It was a good place to take the kids, and the pizza was delicious. There were no other diners in the restaurant with us, as we went at an unusual time to accommodate another commitment, yet the service was slow because they "had a lot of deliveries." We will go back though, because it is overall a great pizza place, with a fun atmosphere and reasonable prices.
Very good food. Owner/chef very friendly and personable. Very interested that you had a good experience.

We love having Friday lunch at Pizzeria Basta. The little romaine and lemon salad is lovely along with a delicious pizza. Service is always very good. We were motivated to go for dinner based on an extremely positive review in the Daily Camera. Unfortunately, we did not find the dinner exceptional. The steak had no finish to speak of, and the Burrata appetizer was good, but not outstanding. The competition in Boulder is stiff. We'll stick with lunch at Basta.

I was told by my son and my wife that the food was great, the pizza especially tasty. I thought initially just another pizza place with a wood burning oven. Well, it was so much more than that. The pizza was outstanding; the crust and the flavors were exceedingly good. The dessert, chocolate cake, cassita(sp) which we normally do not order, was also outstanding. Good wine, good food, good service and good ambience, what more can you ask for? Price! Well worth the cost.
Excellent food, great staff, tasty drinks... A hidden gem in a not so hidden space. Will become a regular and hope to take friends here as well.

column4: 37029 Cook St., Suite 101 Palm Desert, CA  92211
column13: Traditional Italian food with creative presentations and consistently good. Waitstaff always upbeat and ready to make suggestions.

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Awesome! Food was absolutely delicious. Don't leave without trying the thai tamale! Drinks were awesome.

Took my wife here for her birthday. Outstanding cuisine and service. Each dish was well balanced and thoughtfully prepared. I had read mixed reviews online, but was really pleased with our experience.
This was the third time we have been to this restaurant and it was the best time. Each time in the past we thought it was good but not great. It seems they have stepped up there quality and service.

The bar looks very fun and lively. We went for lunch, but it appears like it would be a good night out spot. The food was excellent, including my friend's birthday dessert. The drink menu was also unique and good.
We had a wonderful time and a delicious meal.
Had a great experience, excellent food and overall pleasurable dining experience. Would highly recommend it to others and will return there often!

nice...tasty...bu small portions considering how pricey....the side dishes were in thimbal size containers. 24.00 for the meal plus drinks..plus coffee and desert....gets pricey for that kind of casual dining.

column4: 440 Heliotrope Ave. Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: A delight - good food - great service - a little out of the ordinary which is good

Our waitress was very good, the food was awesome but two things went wrong. One and the most important was that we had to wait over 30 min for our food after we had our appetizer & salads. To make up for that the waitress gave me a free dessert. With over half the place empty and we were early for our reservations, the hostess still had us wait 15 min to be seated. Still can't understand that.

column4: 1125 SE Division Street Suite 102 Portland, OR  97202
column13: Delicious food and great service!!

column4: 7167 East Rancho Vista Drive Unit 111 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Posh is one of the best restaurants in Arizona. The food is fabulous, and they serve items not found on many other menus in the valley. On my latest visit, the most notable items were chicken hearts, quail, pork belly, fluke, littleneck clams, red wine poached white bass, and venison. In the 15 courses I had, there wasn't one "miss".
