Every dish was flavorful and well thought out. Posh is a restaurant I highly recommend to anyone wanting modern American fare with a twist. I also recommend sitting at the counter to watch the cooks/chefs in action. The craft cocktails are also excellent, and they have a lot of unique cocktails on the menu. They have a notable wine list as well.
A great place for lunch of dinner. Anytime.

column4: 1550 Lake Pointe Parkway, Suite 500 Sugar Land, TX  77478
column13: The sea bass was spectacular. It was served over a bed of cabbage in a delicious broth with other veggies around it. The cheese bisquits were served warm and often and were yummy. Service was great from Ken. Highly recommend the restaurant!
the food was excellent as was the service. we made sure to come when David Geist was playing upstairs. we had a perfect evening of fine dining and great music.

Had a business lunch. Unfortunately, a large party took a table next to ours and the noise echoing off the hard surfaces makes it difficult to carry on a serious conversation. There is a back dining room which should have been used in the first place; much quieter. The menu looked pretty good and original. However, the Caesar salad I ordered is not work a repeat. Because of the large party, our server was unable to keep our coffee refilled or otherwise pay much attention to us. The bar area looks good and I'd go back for that.
Funky and fun--this upscale diner is definitely worth a trip to the Presidio. Food was excellent. A really nice place for a lunch date.

column4: 1547 W. Katella Ave, Suite #101 Orange, CA  92867
column13: We continue to go there and always enjoy our meal. This is a very nice diner house and the cost is moderate. I really like the atmosphere and the bar is great.
Consistenly great food...but pricie

The service was great and helpful with a rather confusing menu. The portions of all meals were quite generous but the steak was unflavorful. Maybe that's how the chef prefers to prepare, but a hint of salt goes a long way. The place is very loud because it is small and the music volume was way up. Nevertheless, this was a good place for a group. They handled my OpenTable reservation for ten without a problem. I would go back but make special request for how to prepare my filet.

Food was amazing! Wait staff very helpful and knowledgeable with everything on the menu. Menu changes with the seasons so worth going back just to see what unique items will be on the next one. Went on a Monday and was very quiet and relaxed so not sure how it would be on a weekend but regardless the food and service is worth it.
our server and the guy playing the acoustic guitar that afternoon was great. thanks.

I was asked where to take our vendors for dinner and thought of Prospect. It was a perfect setting to not only talk shop; it is a place with ascent to see to be seen. The meal was perfection. The staff inCredibly accommodating ad gracious. I don't think I can say enough great things , or share how spectacular of an evening we had. Our experience sent our vendors home both impressed and delighted.
Service Outstanding. On time with reservations. Food excellent.

column4: 3355 S. Las Vegas Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: It is a shame. The food was pretty good but it was runied by portion size: My short rib entree could not have been more than 3 ounces of meat. And our waiter was too busy trying to show his goofy personality and really did not make it a great experience

Local restaurant, we eat here often, not because its convenient, because the food is good. Nice golf course view. Food was very good, service was also very good. Our server was very friendly, she made sure we had everything we needed.

Overall, this restaurant is excellent. The only negative part of our experience this time was that our server was not very good. I felt like he judged us based on how we looked (a younger couple that perhaps didn't make as much money as his other customers), and wasn't as attentive to us as he was to his other tables. This was somewhat surprising to me because we've dined there before and had an excellent server. However, that aside, the food is excellent. Just make sure to get a reservation in advance, otherwise you won't be able to get in since it's a small restaurant that's quite popular.

column4: 2550 Moose Wilson (Teton Village) Road Wilson, WY  83014
column13: We've been to The Q many times are usually happy with our meals but this time they missed the mark. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was lively, but with the exception of the bison burger (which was delicious) the food was flat or just outright bad. Our salad starters were just ok and the flank was below average. The accompanying brussel sprouts were inedible. To the Q's credit, the chef recolonized his gaff on the vegetables and offered us a glass of wine as compensation. Because of its convenient location and quality customer service, we will likely give Q another chance

column4: 3224 Pacific Coast Highway Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: Romantic ambiance and friendly staff. Scallops were delectable and the fish was expertly prepared. A pleasant surprise was Monday night 1/2 price bottles of wine on most that they serve by the glass. Overall a memorable night.

From valet parking through the entire meal everything was perfect. We didn't have to shout to be heard and the servers were charming, helpful and knowledgable. The food was top notch with all sorts of unusual combinations and tastes. We have eaten there twice before and each time I visit we will go again.
We brought friends that were from Canada to eat there and the fresh food experience was wonderful.
The quality of the fish and other dishes was excellent and the dishes were well-presented. My party appreciated the decor and Japanese hanafuda-themed artwork.
Excellant as always. Enjoy coming here.
Delicious food from the chef from Burma SuperStar. A fabulous treat now in downtown Palo Alto.

We haven't been to Rafael since the menu changed to a small plates format. Though my husband doesn't usually prefer "small plates," even he was pleased with the quality of the food choices and the elegance of the preparations. This remains one of the most beautiful rooms - and the outdoor seating is lovely, weather permitting.
Awesome fresh produce, grass fed beef and ambiance!

We were very pleases with our experience at Red Bird. We dined in the formal dining area, but next time will probably just sit in the wine bar area. We used a gift certificate which had been mangled by our new puppy and was still graciously accepted. We will definitely go back, but stick to the less expensive wine bar menu, which really seemed to be more our style. However, the food was excellent, service was fantastic, and we very much enjoyed ourselves!
The food was in general good. Arrugula prosciutto pizza had a good flavor but dry. Outstanding was the Quail entree. I think James the sommelier made our evening. His effervescence is contagious.
Redds has never failed us in quality x's 50. From my above checks to current day. We have brought family and friends fromaround the world and they also have never had better food. Kudos!

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Everything about his place was amazing.
An absolutely top-notch dining experience. Food was excellent and perfectly seasoned, beautifully presented and served quickly.

Once again the food was incredible, service wonderful. Had to sit inside for dinner as the 100 degree heat outside was too much but returned after our show for a vodka nightcap and enjoyed the outdoor sitting with the highly energized crowd. One of my favorite restaurants in town. Though doesn't list GF menu, they took very good care of me as I have celiac and I was able to get a very tasty, flavorful meal.

column4: 550 Via De La Valle Solana Beach, CA  92075
column13: Perfect food and a more-than-perfect wait-staff.I would definately recommend this restaurant as a special occasion place for a wonderful meal.
We had a great experience with the exception of the waiter. Alan seemed to be a little short with us and seemed to be a little full of himself.

Everything we had was melt-in-your-mouth amazing and the service was fantastic. Very nice people and very attentive even though it was busy. It's not a very large space, but there are tables, a space outside (looks like it would be great for a party/large gathering!) and seats at the bar looking into the kitchen! Overall just a great spot with higher quality food and fantastic service!
Nice to watch everyone FM COMCON walking by.

column4: 2080 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: We stop in for appetizers, they were great.

We had a group of 9 people with 2 kids and a baby and the staff did not blink an eye. They were supportive of our large group and delivered the delicious food with a smile. As families know, it's hard to find a comfortable spot out with the kids and we will happily go back to The Republic both with our kids and without. Drinks were also creative and tasty!
Lovely neighborhood spot; great service. Lively for a weeknight.

My husband and I decided to go before our play at the Pantages. Service was amazing as usual. We were both a little upset on the couple items they took off there menu that we love. I ended up getting stuff off the dinela menu. The dessert I had picked they were out f, but the server was nice and ask me if there was any dessert I would want instead.
Comsistently great food from Chef Michael since he opened. Some turnover on the service side noted on this visit, but servers have always seemed professional and knowledgeable about the concept.
This restaurant is just right. The food is wonderful, the staff attentive and it was bustling without being noisy.
Great experience, again. Our favorite restaurant.
the food is excellent. there is always a seasonal surprise.
surprisingly excellent
Food was great! Richard the owner greeted us, and Amy our server was all over us!!! Great service!
great food and service...we will return

column4: 6435 South Decatur Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89118
column13: The restaurant had 2 servers for the night but accepted reservations anyway. They got all our orders wrong and they took forever saying they are cooking the correct dinner for me while my dinner companion's dinner is getting cold. After awhile I ask them to cook my companion's dinner again as well because it had gone cold waiting for mine but they refused. When I asked to see the manager, I was told he was very busy. We walked out after paying for the portion of our order we did get.

column4: 5922 S. Holly St. Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: I was embarrassed by how immodestly the hostess'es were dressed. It really spoil'd the mood for me
Awful service, went for a celebration and will never go back again. Very differnt experience than the Park Meadows location.

While the food preparations were creative and innovative, the prices were still high for the portion size. The shaved brussels sprout salad was unique and of good value. The service was a bit rough given that one dish that was ordered was never delivered and a request for an "entree" size portion on an appetizer was neither delivered or explained that it could not be done. Also, a request for some crackers resulted in an additional charge of $3.00 with no advisement up front. The server compensated for this with a complimentary dessert which was truly appreciated.The atmosphere is comfortable with nice lighting and wonderfully opened to the outside through large windows and doors.

Best meal and dining experience we've had in a long time in Boulder! The scallops were prepared to perfection and the brussel srpout salad was unparalleled! Thanks for a wondeful evening and we had great service with Matthew.

This is one of our favorite spots. The staff is friendly and helpful. Every time we dine here we have fabulous meals. The atmosphere is warm and cozy and the wine list is very diverse. Our party ordered the delicious tomato crab bisque, short ribs, eggplant and one of us ordered a risoto and each dish was perfect. We chose a very fine, nicely priced primitivo.

We had a great meal here. The octopus starter and the pasta were fantastic! Pizza's were good, but not great. Tuesday 15/30 deal on wine was a real plus (they offer 15 different wines at $30). We will definitely go back.

This a great place and all the food I have ever had here has been excellent...especially the veal piccata. The service is good and you can sit outside on a summer evening...such a treat for those of us from Berkeley. Try it you'll like it.
Excellent experience. Despite being crowded the service was fast, friendly and patient! Great food too.

Service was super-friendly but food was very inconsistent. Burrata appetizer was off-the-chain, but the seafood risotto was banal and fishy. The pork loin, apparently a new signature dish, was also just fair.
Always great---but very pricey!
.Great outdoor patio seating by the river====Fried green tomatoes were OUTSTANDING//// Server was competent, but slow.JA.

column4: Mandalay Place 3930 Las Vegas Blvd. South S Suite 134 Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: The Ice Cream Challenge and Cliffton, our waiter, were excellent. We went specifically for the ice cream challenge since I saw it on the Tavel Channel. Pleasantly surprised for the food as well.

column4: 27741 Crown Valley Pkwy #325 Mission Viejo, CA  92691
column13: Everything was great except the hostesses. Not the brightest people around. The chefs and servers on the other hand are top notch.

column4: 800 W. Olympic Blvd. Suite A-160 Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: Great Food. Love the Tri-tip, artichoke dip and spicy shrimp appetizer!

column4: 422 South Coast Highway Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: Our waiter forgot to bring out our appetizer and the entres came first. The manager was making his rounds and stopped at our table to ask how everything was, and we told him that we never received our appetizer, so he did go and get it for us. After we paid we were sitting at the table finishing our drinks and then the manager brought out a complimentary bread pudding.
Had to change restaurant venue because Vermont Kitchen and Bar was remodeling. An update on the website would have allowed me to avoid the trip.
A great venue for lunch. The view is outstanding! Service was friendly and attentive and food was good.
Just a great place in Scottsdale, overlooked to often because a little far from old town but not north Scottsdale. Just great building and food

Went here for the Breakfast with the Beatles live broadcast. Nice, fun place to go to. Lots of Rolling Stones memorabilia to see. The employees are friendly. My food was cold, but I didn't complain. Next time I will just specify that I really like my food to be hot. (I was really hungry & I didn't want to send it back.)

column4: 3350 Avenue of the Arts Costa Mesa, CA  92626
column13: It was very relaxing and quiet, a very beautiful ambiance.We had the best servers, they were very helpful and attentive.The Mimosas and Bloody Marys were fairly good.We brought friends for lunch recently, 3 of us had salmon that was very tender but very salty. Scallops were an appetizer, but were very small and also quite salty. One order of salad also salty, one order of hanger steal very tough. One order of corn soup that was excellent to taste.

column4: 665 South Palm Canyon Drive Palm Springs, CA  92264
column13: First off, the Mojito was particularly good. The wild greens salad quite good, the swordfish dinner excellent (the rather rich sauce, usually a dangerous thing to try with fish, was surprisingly good - very distinctive), and the coconut cake also excellent. I'm one who's come to be prepared and even expect disappointments dining in Palm Springs, and can be quick to give negative feedback, but this meal was first-rate - and all 3 courses bundled together cost only $22.
Great Indian food even if it is a bit overpriced. We love it.

We had dinner before a show at the DCPA. The waiter was very good at making sure we were on the right pace to have plenty of time to make the show. The only disappointment was the wine list- as 3 of us enjoyed a glass of wine from the "wines by the glass" list, and when we wanted to order a bottle of it, we were told there wasn't any more. Not only that, there were no other wines in that same category - a simple Torrentes white wine. So, they offered a Pinot Grigio, which isn't typically like a Torrentes, and we said no - how about a Chard. So they brought a Chard in a fancy bottle, told us they'd make up the difference in price (which they did NOT), and we did not like it on tasting, but they poured it in all 4 glasses anyway.

column4: 1621 W. Sunflower Avenue Santa Ana, CA  92704
column13: Food was pretty bad, it is not really an Indian food, very westernized.Extremely expensive. Probably the worst Indian restaurant in this area.I will not go back.

The only complaint we have is the slowness of the service. It took close to 30 mins for our appetizer to be served (we thought they forgot about it) then another 45 mins for our main entrees to arrive. The restaurant wasn't that busy (3/4 full). We nearly finished an entire bottle of wine waiting for our appetizer (and we were sipping our drink very slowly).

column1: Addiction at Rumor Vegas Boutique Resort
column4: 455 East Harmon Avenue Las Vegas, NV  89147
column13: It's amazing Addiction is not more popular. Small but cozy, Addiction is tucked in the corner of Rumor Boutique Hotel's lobby, overlooking the courtyard and pool. You get the feeling of dining in a Palm Springs or Miami resort -- no clanging slot machines or obnoxious music. The menu is mostly made of interesting takes on comfort food, served tapas-style. The service is attentive, relaxed and friendly. And because of its "hidden" nature, getting a table is as easy as walking right in.
Took my mom and dad out for dinner looking for good BBQ. Some of the food was cold,brisket had way to much fat, and the sauces yuk. I don't mind paying higher prices but please serve some good food.

We go there for the gourmet hamburgers on brioche bun, served with excellent fries. In the one with bacon I find that the bacon, although it's very good in itself, overpowers the burger, but the regular one is delicious. For appetizers, we've had a very good quail, as well as a good salad of heirloom lettuces. They have a good variety of wines by the glass. If you like noisy hot spots,where you hear every word from the tables on either side, you might enjoy the ambiance more than we do. We go there regularly in spite of that.

column1: Wild Sage at The Rusty Parrot Lodge
column4: 175 North Jackson Street Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: Of all the places in the Jackson Hole area this restaurant was our favorite "hands down"! Awesome food, great service, phenomenal wine list! My wife had the Waygyu beef and I had the venison. Awesome!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Salt Lake City
column4: 275 S. West Temple St. Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: My husband and I went to Ruth's Chris to celebrate an anniversary, and the staff was fantastic, friendly and welcoming from the moment we pulled up to the valet parking, to the rose petals on the table, to the "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate on our dessert plate. Upon hearing that it was our anniversary, many of the staff stopped by to give us their good wishes and congratulations. And the steaks were wonderful, too!
Overpriced mediocre food lacks imagination will not be retuning
Somewhat eclectic menu. Limited choices. Dessert was great; had the semi fro with mango and strawberries.

This out-of-the-way restaurant is well worth the trip. Great ambiance in an quiet location at the foot of the mountains sets the stage for a very enjoyable evening, capped off with an excellent meal with many choices. The service was outstanding as the staff really made you feel welcomed.
Very nice place and worth trying

column4: 1638 N. Las Palmas Ave. Los Angeles, CA  90028
column13: The patio is really the star here. the food is GREAT- but definitely secondary to the patio.

column4: 1143 San Carlos Ave. San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: The food was very tasty. The only comment , I would like to make is we were presented with a complimentary appetizer. It was some kind of tiny pieces of chip/ Unfortunately , it was stale. I looked around the other tables, and almost everyone didn't care for it. So serve it fresh and crispy or don't offer it all as complimentary.

column4: 6585 Greenwood Plaza Blvd Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: We've been hunting for years for really good New York style Chinese food. Forget the name "Saigon", this place is it! Although there are Vietnamese dishes on the menu, the real stars are the Chinese items. The pork spring rolls, the won ton soup, the pineapple combinmation fried rice, the garlic shrimp, the seasoned pork were all standouts. Even have a decent wine list. The dining room is well designed and, surprisingly,quite contemporary. The service was caring, prompt and helpful. The negative is the location. It's off Arapahoe road but not visible from the road. Once you're there, you won't regret the hunt. I only hope they stay because this place is a genuine find! We were blown away!

Best sushi restaurant in Coronado. We try to eat there as often as possible. The miso marinated black cod appetizer is out of this world. Try to make reservations because the place is small and fills up quickly. We usually order the King roll (the soft shell crab makes for a unique crunch) and the signature Saiko roll and whatever sashimi is on special. Everything is fresh.
First time to eat at Saint Ann's and we loved it.

went for the first time for my birthday/college graduation dinner (Go Broncos!), and loved every bit of it! the chef was wonderful and the pricing is very fair. i would definitely recommend the sweet shrimp for the adventurous types!
Good dinner at Salt House. The best items were the entrees. We each selected a fish dish. Very tasty and nicely presented but we were in no danger of over-eating.
Very personal service and attention. The veal dishes were outstanding and the wine was reasonable priced.

column1: Sam & Harry's Steakhouse - Marriott Newport Beach
column4: 900 Newport Center Dr Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: This restaurant is not a JW Marriott, but it is not at a strip mall either. I was expecting the service to be better, seems like the morning wait staff was either on or off. They talked to each other and should have been servicing their tables better. Just a couple of bad days for them or perhaps they have been at this restaurant so long, they are burned out. One thing I did not like, were they pre made scrambled eggs. Do restaurants purchase this stuff and prepare it from a can or a bucket? Definitely have the chef make fresh eggs for you! On the plus side, the front staff of the hotel is excellent!

column4: 207 North Harbor Drive Redondo Beach, CA  90277
column13: Nice! Meats are great....the only issue is my cousin ask for well done they said fine well we still waiting for well done meat, I think they say yes only for them not to say NO...other then that is good...

It was uncomfortable to have to wait for the whole party to arrive when you have a large party. I would rather start within a few minutes of arrival or reservation. The timing and scheduling of the meats did not fit our party's taste. It would be nice to be able to schedule it for your party. Great restaurant for meat lovers with options for others.

column4: 1955 West Morena Blvd San Diego, CA  92110
column13: Excellent food and service at this old style Italian gem.
Sapori was excellent!! Great food with great service. Heavenly bread with amazing seafood dish
Food and service were great. Ambiance was a cross between a Victorian bordello and Disney' haunted mansion

column4: 451 Manhattan Beach Blvd #D126 Manhattan Beach, CA  90266
column13: Noisy. Ok restaurant. Don't order their Mojito.

column4: 3202 W. Anderson Lane Ste #205 Austin, TX  78757
column13: Another delicious dinner at Satay ... our favorite neighborhood Thai. I am now hooked on Dr. Foo's speciality, Bai Thong -- Red Snapper cooked in banana leaves ... spicy, but oh so good! Service, as always, was excellent.
The food was wonderful, interesting, lots of great flavors. Wow!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Try the special whiskey at the bar with the lemon sugar swizzle!
Food and service was good. On a funny note, we were the only non anglo people in the restaurant!
Disappointed with the food. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't good.
Restaurant was very nice. Beautiful view. Food was excellent.

column4: 22341 Marine View Dr. S. Des Moines, WA  98198
column13: This was the third time we have eaten at Scotch and Vine and all three have been great experiences. Top-notch drinks, outstanding cheese selection and really well done food at a reasonable price will keep us coming back.
Perfect place to dine before attending the theatre. Food is always consistantly good.

The Beer Co had a sports bar feel; food was average (I'll give them extra points for their loaded tater tots, though). They have a decent beer selection and their brews are pretty good as well. I thought the service was a little slow especially considering that they didn't look that busy, but they were pleasant enough, and once the food was ordered it came out pretty quickly.

column4: 30 E. Ortega St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: The outdoor seating is right next to the street and not very pleasant, but once we moved inside, the food, service and ambiance were all wonderful. It's pricey, so I consider it to be a special occasion restaurant, but it was lovely. Note, however, that the menu is somewhat limited and not very vegetarian friendly. Everything we ate, however, was delicious.
Food was just o.k. The ambience is great, but if you are expecting a great meal, go elsewhere.

The Sunday morning Pajama Brunch is a dream! Kids get to play, watch movies and enjoy a cereal/pancake bar while parents get to feast on great food like cracked yolk tacos and the best "bacon and eggs" you've ever had. Perfect Sunday morning!

A bit frustrating that my main dish order was wrong in two different ways but it took so long to get it, I didn't want to wait for it to be redone. Waiter confirmed that it was turned in correctly and he apologized for it but would have been better had it been done right. They also forgot to put the dressing on the salad for my dining partner and waiter brought it out. And they refused to make the dessert the way I've ordered it dozens of times previously and it was all wrong.

Conditioner continued to run even on a cold evening, everybody inside the place was freezing, atmosphere far from cozy. Certain items on the menu were fantastic, others were a bit subpar. For the price, the portions are pretty tiny.
Some constant good items on the menu and always something interesting, new and yummy

We liked the ease of the online reservations. We included a note in our reservation that we were celebrating a special wedding anniversary. When we were seated, we were brought complimentary champagne, and our dessert was comped. Service and food were excellent, and prices are reasonable, too.
Superb. Finest food we had during a 10 day visit to California. Don't miss the flavor filled pork chop. An equal to Eleven Madison Park in New York.

column4: One Letterman Drive, Bldg D, Suite 150 San Francisco, CA  94129
column13: The space is great and the service was fabulous. The food just somehow miss the mark. It seemed neither Southern nor anything else. Too many combinations that were just odd. For example; the deviled eggs were good but the addition of deep fried chicken livers was unnecessary, salad was fresh and delicious but slices of ham on top (?!) just strange. I hope the menu gets revised as I would love to go to Dixie often as it is such a pleasant space.
Wonderful! We'll be going again.

Great location with a spacious dining room. It was a Monday night when we were there with no ball games across the street so quieter than usual. We had a wonderful meal with the exception of the oysters that had a lot og grit in them. They graciously took them back and removed them from our bill. I will definitely go there again whenever I'm in San Francisco.
Great place for business lunch. The portions were great. Calamari was excellent.
My new favorite "let's splurge" place

The scallops wrapped in salmon and the flat iron steak were both very good. However, the halibut was dry and overcooked big time. The chef needs to work on that entree. We have eaten here many times, and we always enjoy the clam chowder and warm sourdough bread with garlic butter. Our waiter, Ralph, was very efficient and personable. He was also waiting on a table of about 10 people, but he took very good care of our party of 4. We will return, but will not order the halibut.

column4: 1555 Camino Del Mar Suite 201 Del Mar, CA  92014
column13: Fresh, innovative, and delicious sushi tucked away in the Del Mar Plaza. Most definitely a gem of a restaurant I'll return to.

Omikasa experience is truly memorable, equal to or exceeding any I've had in New York or San Francisco.Quality, variety, and presentation are exceptional. Chef's Counter is highly recommended. Memorable and highly recommended.

column4: 9625 E. Arapahoe Rd Unit H Greenwood Village, CO  80112
column13: Food was great, but experience wasn't. Chef couldn't read waiter's notes, so he prepared the wrong entree for my wife. OK, it happens. I ate my dinner and then we waited until her correct entree arrived. Waiter was non-apologetic and didn't even offer to comp her meal or even the slice of baklava we ordered for dessert. Missed opportunity to turn a mistake into a positive.
Many selections on the menu unavailable. Food was creative and very good.

column4: 2981 Bristol Suite B5 Costa Mesa, CA  92626
column13: The marinated kale salad is excellent as well as the Spanish tapas platter. Good for 'healthy' food. Comparable to Native Foods, but 118 degrees is much better. The ingredients are fresh and I don't feel like I am eating fake anything. Very friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.

column4: 1425 N. McCulloch Blvd. Lake Havasu City, AZ  86403
column13: The food and ambiance were wonderful. However, the star of the show was the service. Kelsey, our server, was spectacular. She was friendly, knowledgeable and efficient; A wonderful combination!

column4: 2932 1/2 Beverly Glen Circle Bel Air, CA  90077
column13: It is a good neighborhood restaurant, that is a true hidden neighborhood gem in Bel Air. Great fusion Japanese, but if you're looking for a real authentic Japanese, this place is not it. The miso-marinated cod was great, but much sweeter than the one at Nobu. Fish were fresh, but nigiri sushi were not authentic at all. Stick with the specials (daily updated menu) and avoid nigiri sushi. The staff were extremely nice and really enjoyed my time there.

column4: 333 D Perry Street Castle Rock, CO  80104
column13: The Siena at the Courtyard continues to serve up a refreshing and tasty menu; this is the second time I have been there for lunch. It is a great place to meet a friend for lunch...the server was respectful of the fact that we wanted a "long lunch" where we could sit and talk. The Cobb Salad special was very tasty and filling and the service was excellent. I will definitely go to this restaurant again; perhaps for dinner next time.

column4: 9500 W Sahara Ave Las Vegas, NV  89117
column13: Great service this time around! Ask for Todd

column4: 3909 Park Drive El Dorado Hills, CA  95762
column13: I thought our server cody was excellent. He had a trainee with him and it was the Trainee that surprised me with a Scallop dish....excellent choice. I let them surprise me with my meal.
Contemporary change of pace with excellent food and fun dinning experience. Trout was especially good.
Overall experience was Very Good. We will definitely place this restaurant on our list to frequent again.
Had a party of five for a birthday on a Monday and we were put in a private room -- how fancy! Service was GREAT. Food is good and drinks are plentiful.
Really outstanding Indian food. And, their wine special - buy two glasses and get the whole bottle is hard to beat.

column4: 12000 E Big Cottonwood Canyon Rd Brighton, UT  84121
column13: We had dinner while staying at the Solitude ski resort. It is very convenient to the lodging and is an attractive place. We stayed at the end of the ski season so it was probably less crowded that it would have been otherwise. We had wine in the small bar outside the dining room - the wine list is fine, but nothing to write home about. We moved to the dining room for dinner. It was uncrowded and our service was very good. The dinner was very good as well. I had quail and duck breast that was flavorful and well prepared. My had scallops which were also nicely done. Overall it was a good experience and I would recommend St. Bernard's.
What a wonderful local hot spot! The food was hot, fresh and tasty! They had a extensive gluten free menu! Service a great! Will definitely be back next time I'm in town!

Great new option in Westwood. Beet salad and minestrone at lunch were delicious, service was excellent, and the skylight room is charming. It's great to have this beautiful space back in use (formerly the Gardens on Glendon).

column4: 3930 Las Vegas Blvd South Ste 120 Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Good menu selections beyond pizza. Pizza very good, but expensive compared to similar places in Las Vegas. Excellent bar drinks and nice locale in the Mandalay Place shopping area.

Had a party of six and made a reservation through OpenTable. It was our first time at Slow Club and we'll definitely be back. Great food and service. We waited about 25 minutes after our reservation time and they proactively comp'd us some appetizers!
Best nice place in entire Central Coast. Traditional fare with lots of twists. My friends all wanted a lighter meal and each LOVED their salads! Can't beat the steaks and pasta.

column4: 10351 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90067
column13: Great service. Accommodating. Great beer selection. Must try the pretzel with the cheese dip.
It's like a step back in time. Love this place

This was my second visit to Smoke and I would definately return. Reservations were a breeze. Sevice was outstanding. On each visit each memeber of our party ordered something different. From a burger at lunch to the lamb porterhouse to the salmon/scallop entree all meats prepared to perfection. The house made pastas were delicious.
Gnocchi light and tasty. Grilled peaches -- excellent. Small menu, great choices.

We needed a place to eat while my brother had a short layover at the airport. The restaurant is a quick hop from the airport and there is ample free parking. Excellent service and the food was delicious. The decor and ambiance were warm and inviting. Wines are reasonably priced, plus on Tuesday, many are discounted by 50%. My brother commented this was a great find. I agree, and will likely return.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Perfect place for "before the theatre". We enjoyed the food and service.

column4: 115 South College Avenue Fort Collins, CO  80524
column13: We had another terrific evening at Sonny's. Great food, great service, outstanding music. We continue to be impressed by this restaurant and will be back again often.

We had a memorable experience. The passion of this staff is quite impressive. Their enthusiasm is unsurpassed. My favorite part was to watch the kitchen and chef Duncan prepare our 8 courses with fist pumps, high fives and body slams as each was created. Art on a plate! Thank you to all the staff on a job well done!
My wife and I will definitely be going back. Great experience all around!

I can not recommend this restaurant and am quite surprised they are in business in a town full of great restaurants. I chose the spot from the recommendations on Open Table for a special occasion and this experience has a big disapppointment. Simply, the food was poor. Bruschetta was spreads from jarred condiments spread on toast on a bed of lettuce. My chicken was tough with rubbery noodles in a sea of sauce that must have come from a jar. The carpaccio was tasteless and not much of it. My companion had the steak and was completely unimpressed.

column4: 9575 West Pico Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90035
column13: I had heard a lot of hype from friends and I was so glad Sotto lived up to the LA Magazine review of Best New Restaurant. My date and I thoroughly enjoyed every plate (pizza, meatballs, and octopus) and I will concede that the pizza I had (forgot the darned name, but it was magically melted with prosciutto and goat cheese) is my new favorite pizza in LA. I'll DEFINITELY be coming back. Not to mention any restaurant that mixes Andrew Bird, followed by a classic early 60's rock and roll song, and then easing into the Psychedilc Furs as background music, will keep me smiling for hours. Sotto was balanced perfection from staff, to atmosphere, to food. Job well done!

Mother's Day brunch. Not nearly worth the price of admission. Added gratuity to the price. Service was terrible. Drinks empty for long periods. Brought kids cups with no lids. I ended up going to the server station multiple times to refill my tables drinks. I would have left little or no gratuity for a buffet meal where drink service was bad.

column4: 417 South California Avenue Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: Really enjoyed our evening and our dinners. The lasagna was fantastic!!
Always a great meal and great service. Truly Italy!

I havee tried nearly all the German restaurants in the Bay Area (not that many of course) and Speisekammer is 1) by far the best, 2) the most authentic, and 3) an amazing value for the money. The addition of a full entree list (including half orders of some of the most popular items) to the lunch menu makes this an incredible go-to spot for lunch.
We always enjoy Spencer's, especially the outdoor lanai dining area.

column4: 4909 Rainier Ave S Suite 102 Seattle, WA  98118
column13: Love the food, very authentic and full of taste. A stand-out in a city full of Thai restaurants. The only draw-back is the service. I have been several times. They need just one more server. The owner is the bartender, takes orders and rings people up...very difficult to do all those things quickly and efficiently. Needless to say, it's not the quickest service in the world. It is always friendly, though. I am hoping this is all improving, as the last time I was there, it was better.

Our meal was excellent, as was the service. The restaurant and server seemed very knowledgeable about our need for a gluten free meal and were very accommodating. Our server was also very knowledgeable about & helpful with appropriate wine pairings.

Wow, what an amazing dinner! From the moment we were greeted with a HUGE smile, to our server who actually got our coats and walked us out to our cab (which he called), this was an wonderful experience. It was suggested we try some of the new seasonal menu items, which we are glad we did. Sablefish - amazing. My wife says it was the best duck she's ever had. Our table wasn't ready when we arrived (a bit early) but were shown into the packed bar where we were somehow able to get a drink pretty quickly. Everyone should try the Greyhounds' Tooth - it was delicious (I had another at the table). We were suggested this place by a friend and what a find. Can't wait to go back to my new favorite restaurant in the city!

It was my first time dining at Stage, and I absolutely loved it! The servers were spot on, always attentive and definitely knew their stuff when it came to both the dishes and wines. The waiter gave great descriptions of the entrees and answered all of our questions with ease.

column4: 30832 South Coast Highway Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: Great happy hour menu, they provided a little extra dessert for a birthday. Great food combinations.

"Unpretentious sophistication"-- indeed! Station 1 offers some of the best produce around (heirloom tomatoes were divine), and also some of the best waitstaff. It is such a fantastic place, the cuisine is very impressive and of good value (wagyu steak a must-try), and the ambiance seems to serve a variety of occasions, from date to birthday to business to family. Will definitely come back.

column4: 601 Old County Road San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: Nice convenient location. Great service & food.House wine was good value for money, good wine.
Food very good - wines half price on Sundays; a good deal. Desserts always excellent

column4: 3000 W. Olympic Blvd. Santa Monica, CA  90404
column13: I took my customers for a late lunch on a weekday.The waiters and the rest of the staff had checked out. Barely took care of us, made a mistake in the order. Bad experience overall.

Food was great but service a lot left for improvement . The waiter spilled soda on me & apologized but sheepishly served us the rest of the night. There was no offer of paying for dry cleaning for my dress or taking something off the bill. Poorly handled this situation and this left bad impression on restaurant . Even though the meal was good the service ruined the experience for me!!

Went there for dinner and found the menu to offer some really well thought out dishes. Fresh ingredients, high quality, appealing presentation, but best of all.... tasted GREAT! Service was also really good. Attentive and well informed on the items on the menu.
For a "seafood" restaurant they have a very limited selection of seafood!

The appetizer of pork face meat, not cheeks, was mediocre. The trout entree was wonderful and the dessert of meringue, berries and creme anglaise was delicious. The wines by the glass list was short and the wines we tried were not drinkable. They did have an extensive list of wine by the bottle; however, pricing was a little on the high side. The staff was very attentive and our server was very helpful.

Definitely an Irish gem! The food was delicious, the drinks were strong & yummy, the servers were so friendly & had the best recommendations! The ambiance was perfect for a Sunday lunch with my husband, we coul enjoy each other & the Giant's game on the bar tv:) We will totally be back!!!

column4: 800 W. Sam Houston Parkway Suite 940 Houston, TX  77024
column13: Very noisy; hard to hear my companion's voice from across the table. Main courses were served when we had only half-finished our appetizers ! Food itself was excellent.

column4: 10111 Inverness Main Street Unit B Englewood, CO  80112
column13: This was a great find for us. The food was very good and the setting was very nice.This is one restaurant that we will be back too many times and recommend to anyone.
Outstanding in every respect. We never heard of Sugarbeet and took a chance our first time. Better steak than you'll find almost anywhere in Denver. There's a real chef in the kitchen. GO! GO! GO!
The competing soundtrack music and the band warming up in the next room made neither one listenable. We enjoyed the food, but next time we will come earlier to have it a bit mmore quiet.

column1: The Tower Bar at the Sunset Tower Hotel
column13: Ambiance was awesome for a quiet and romantic dinner yet, total Hollywood hidden hot spot for celeb sightings!! We went twice during out trip to L.A. Thursday night was more fun and we had better service & sightings than Sunday night. Sunday night was too quiet. Service was not as attentive on Sunday night.

I took my department of 7 to lunch and we were seated a couple of tables pushed together that were normally sit 6. We didn't really have enough table space to make it comfortable. The restuarant is small and is better suited for groups of 4 or less. The sushi rolls, bento, tempura, and teriyaki were very good. Wait staff was OK. Since our table was so small, it would have been nice if the wait staff were more proactive to remove unnecessary dishes and garbage. But I would go back (by myself or 1 other person).
Outstanding! THe best Sushi in the Northwest. Taichi is a master.

column4: 4318 North Western Avenue Oklahoma City, OK  73118
column13: We have been to Sushi Neko a minimum of 25 times over the last 4 years and it has never disappointed us. We have tried other Sushi restaurants in OKC but always went back to Sushi Neko afterward because of their consistent high quality dining experience.
We had a 6pm reservation---the food was served at 6:45pm after we have had follow up status of order!! even 2 kids meal was not served earlier....Tuna salad came at 6:50 or later!
As always - FANTASTIC! The food is always outstanding, fresh and creative. I cannot say enough about Sushi Roku - it is worth every penny!

We came to Suzanne's to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We were seated promptly when we arrived. Our table was on the edge of the restaurant overlooking the beautiful garden. We enjoyed the Limoncello pom martini and St. Germaine gimlet over a shared crab corn cake appetizer. The crab cake was awesome. Big on crab, not fillers. We split the pear spinach salad. This salad was very tasty and refreshing. This salad was generous and our server was correct in recommending we split it (especially since we had the appetizer). I had the grilled golden trout and my husband had the salmon. Both dishes were amazing with great flavor. For dessert we split the Cafe Liegoise desert which was incredible. The staff was warm and attentive.

column4: 193 Gore Creek Dr. Suite 201 Vail, CO  81657
column13: A dependable choice as one of Colorado's best restaurants. Not to be missed if you are in the Vail valley!!
The kitchen is always keeping the dishes new and fresh. We especially loved the Tuna Tatak and antelope steak.

column1: Hoist House Restaurant at Swiftwater Cellars
column4: 301 Rope Rider Drive Cle Elum, WA  98922
column13: Bit of a train wreck. Waited 45 minutes for food and it was not ready to be served. Clearly a problem with the kitchen but made worse by the server. Surly, outwardly hostile about the delay. Towards us? Towards the kitchen? Hard to tell leaving us extremely uncomfortable. Had to cancel resi for next night. Comped two entries but treated us poorly at the same time. Note to establishment. Don't refund customer money AND make them mad.

I would NOT recommend this restaurant. Extremely over-priced and the food was sub-par. The hostess acted as if we were bothering her when we checked in. The waitress was not very attentive. I reserved this for a 50th birthday dinnner with 5 of us attending, and when i asked if they did anything for birthdays, they acted as if I had 2 heads.
Appetizers were ok, burgers were very good, salmon was upscale and very good. We'll be back.

Our evening at Table 6 was outstanding. Foodies delight! From our appetizers to dessert, everything was perfect. Each one of us in our party of 6 ordered a different entree and they were all perfect. Great flavors, freshest ingredients. Couldn't have been better. Keep the salted caramel begniuts on the menu!

column4: 926 Turquoise Suite H San Diego, CA  92109
column13: Wonderful farm to table chef ownerWould love to have Matt present with dinersMore oftenWe have been there many times and have never met himFranco at Enoteca Adriano also in PB is always coming over to everyoneThat restaurant is wildly successful due to this and their great food

I love TAG but this last time I went with family from out of town and was sincerely disappointed in the service and the food seemed to be somewhat less than what we were used to. At this time, it's unlikely that TAG will be my primary choice to take out of town guest like it use to be.

As usual, the food was wonderful, but this is the second time I've noticed serious lapses in service. We had to stare down our waiter to inquire about dishes we had ordered that mysteriously did not appear, the water glasses were never refilled, and what service there was seemed to be indifferent. In all honesty, given the prices ($90+ lunch for 4 people without wine), I would have expected more.

column4: 1911 W Sunset Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90026
column13: Our first time at Taix and we were very happy with our evening with friends. On Bastille Day, no less! Would love to return and explore more of the menu.
Tamarine is one of my favorites. Fabulous as always.

outstanding service with delicious food. Moderately pricy but well worth it. the Tango dancers on saturday certainly add to the South American ambiance.if there is any negative is the lack of any kid sized portions.
there was a huge Graduation party there. The servers never lost sight of our needs.Definately will return.

Improved food w/ well prepared halibut and a very tasty paella. The smelt were crisp and flavorful and the salad properly dressed and fresh. It was our 4th visit and we hope they continue to build upon the improvements made so far. Good luck!

column4: 50 N. La Cienega Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90211
column13: The food and service was excellent. Certainly one of the best Indian Restaurants in town.

column4: 3377 S. Las Vegas Blvd., Suite 2025 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Too loud and we got stuck right by the kitchen doors. Waitress was great, but we had to yell all the time due to the noise level.

column4: 7114 E. Stetson Dr. Suite 210 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: We love Tapas Papa Frita! It's in our neighborhood downtown, so we walk over for a light snack during happy hour, or for a full dinner a little less often. The service is excellent - it has never been anything but perfect. Same with the food - Spanish, with a lot of Spanish wines. We are big fans of the seafood soup, the lamb chops, and the tomato salad. Highly recommended. A reservation is recommended on Fridays and Saturdays.

The food was very nice with the French flair I was expecting. The service was proper and classic. I was impressed on the appetizer portions and the delicate presentations. The food was properly seasoned. My visually impair parent really enjoyed the outside comfort. The noise level was nice. If I would to return I would try other items because the ones we had were so nice. We celebrated my Dad's birthday and we had a pleasant time. We will be back for dinner next time we are in LaJolla.

column4: 115 S. Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA  90036
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Have been here several times before, but today wasn't so hot. Service was fair at best. Waiter was disengaged. Menu item description didn't match what was served. Deep fried pickles were extremely salty and showed up late. When we told waiter he just stood there with a blank look. Hope we just caught them on an off day. We'll come back, but it needs to be better.

column1: The Tasting Room at City Centre
column4: 818 Town and Country Boulevard Suite 100 Houston, TX  77024
column13: Surprisingly good lunch - great for business meetings. Food was superb.

column4: 11648 San Vicente Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90049
column13: The food was fabulous, Five of us had lunch here, and all of us agreed that we'd love to come back. Three of us ate the white fish special and there wasn't a morsel left on any of our plates. Great experience.

Tempranillo has the best outdoor patio in the valley. We dined outside and the evening was perfect. We loved the Spanish beer and found many healthy and authentic Spanish items on the menu. The service was very good and the food was excellent. We will be back.

Took a group of co-workers here for a birthay lunch. Our server was overwhelmed, slow and forgot about us. It seemed as if he had too many tables or just couldnt keep up. It was very disappointing. We wanted to order some additional sushi but he never returned to our table after he placed our inital order, the restaturant missed out on additional sales/revenue. For a lunch time restaurant, one would expect expeditious service and that was far from what we received.
Terra Mia is our Livermore favorite.
A really unique, well thought out dining establishment; captivating design and decor, wonderful locally grown and tasty faire. Staff was professional and efficient. Loved everything about it!
Terra is fast becoming one of my favorite restaurants.I am introducing it to my family and friends.Great healthy food and service.Convenient and easily reached from Hwy 8
Yummy sushi at fair prices and no one on Ventura does Rock Shrimp like Teru.

column4: 8384 W. Third St. Los Angeles, CA  90048
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: The food and atmosphere were great. The service (other than the hostess who we were sitting next to) was HORRIBLE! I cannot believe a half empty restaurant at a non-peak hour with plenty of staff running around could offer such service. The hostess saved the day and made up for the bad attitude our waiter had.

column1: Little Boston Bistro - The Point Casino
column13: What a terrific surprise! Everything was wonderful. The food, service, decor. Did I mention the food? Wow. The best steak, Alaskan King crab legs, French onion soup, yum... We will be back. Once seated, you would never know you were at a casino.
Very good restaurant! Saganaki was absolut fabulos!
Warm and personable staff. Concise two page menu. Extensive wine list. European portions which is great. Fantastic view. An excellent dining experience.
Breakfast at Beachcomber is quickly becoming one of our favorite Summer traditions!

Had a great time with the wife, kids and family for Mothers Day. Everyone loves sports so this was the perfect place to have lunch, have a few beers, enjoy the afternoon games while spending time with the family.

I made a reservation a week ago and they claimed not to have it, despite showing them the confirmation on my phone. The person who was "helping" us was both rude and dismissive. They did nothing to fix the situation and offered us a seat at the bar despite several open tables. We were dressed appropriately for the restaurant so I'm not sure why they didn't seem to want to seat us. We will not try it again as there are too many other restaurants in Portland with great service and good food.

Not the first time I have been here and brought people and definitely not my last! This place is wonderful and I place it at the top of my list of must-goto restaurants. Thank you Blue Star for a fantastic Colorado Gem!

We'd heard about this place, and looked forward to dinner. It's a gem! If you like food with tantalizing flavors, go here! The service was attentive and the atmosphere was energetic. There seems to be plenty for herbivores and carnivores to enjoy. We had vegetarian dishes - egg rolls, curry tofu, and sweet potato cake. I'm not a dessert person, but you gotta try the cake. The ribs and chicken dishes looked amazing! When we looked around, only emply plates were going back to the kitchen. Excellent rum choices! We look forward to going back.
Was another great eating experience!

column4: 7134 E. Stetson Drive Ste 300 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: The casa Blanca lounge was absolutely fantastic. I try to avoid old town Scottsdale as much as possible. Usually in old town the wait staffs act like the are doing you a favor by serving you, its packed all the time and the music is so loud your ears bleed. I was very suprised with Casa Blanca Lounge it was the complete opposite of my stereotype of old town. The wait staff was attentive but not annoying, the music was just perfect and the drinks were amazing. This has to be the best posse in AZ to get drinks. If service and the quality of what you pay for is important to you go to Casa Blanca you won't be disappointed. m
Wonderful dinner. The white bran cassoulet was amazing. Very reasonablely priced wine was quite tasty. Will be back for sure
This was our first visit, but certainly not our last. We were celebrating my wife's B-Day.

An example of marketing making a restaurant look so much better than it actually is. The dining room was very worn and tired looking. I ordered the Colorado lamb and it was simply awful. My dining partner had a vegetarian dish that she did enjoy, but I don't think it made up for my entree being so terrible. The two waiters attending us provided good service, however the service did not make up for the poor quality of the food. Perhaps this restaurant has seen better days, but I will not be going back.

column4: 74950 Country Club Dr. Palm Desert, CA  92260
column13: Took my parents here for dinner. We all loved the ambiance (dark, wood, plush), food (beautifully presented) and service (prompt and courteous). We also thought the prices were a good value for what we received. I highly recommend this restaurant.

column4: 2325 E Coast Hwy Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: More bar than kitchen, but the kitchen turns out great food. If you like a little heat, try the blackended halibut sandwich. The wine list is full of interesting bottles, but interestingly is predominantly European. There are only a handful of Californian wines, some of which are available by the glass.
The breakfast buffet is worth the 7 hour drive. It is fun and elegant. My 16 year old daughter and I both feel special when we are here. The food is as exceptional as the presentation.

Our high tea experience was wonderful. The food was very good, the service outstanding, and the owners took time to visit personally with us. It was a great experience, and I will definitely be returning!

column1: The Farm of Beverly Hills (Beverly Hills)
column4: 439 N. Beverly Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: We've had many breakfasts/lunches, here, but it was our first time for dinner....and it was a pleasant surprise....and wondered why we hadn't come for dinner, here, before. We would definitely be back for dinner, again.
Eric Greenspan was there hanging out with the crowd. Great to see a celebrity chef so down to earth and friendly.

ove the French Bulldog. It is my new Favorite in Camrillo. Finally we have a top notch restaurant that can campare with any in Thousand Oaks/Westlake. The Filet Minion Sliders melt in your mouth, the best red wine is 6th Sense, very mellow, and absolutely wonderful with the Chocolate truffles.The other dessert that is a must is the Tira Misu. the madelines are madein house. Gael is a french trained chef in both pastry and cuisine. His darling wife is a designer and brought great style to the place. Very fun, energtic and mouthwatering place!

column1: The Gambling Cowboy Chophouse and Saloon
column13: We recently moved to Temecula and saw this place in Old Town and immediately thought it might be a tourist trap with fair food and expensive prices. Then our neighbor told us they frequent the bar for their dinner specials and love the food, so we thought we should give it a try. Oh my goodness....soooo good! My husband can be a food snob and after his first bite of prime rib said, "I would definitely come back." We wanted to try everything so ordered too much food - an appetizer, salad and entree, but the good thing is we were able to enjoy it the next night as leftovers.

I can't believe anyone would write a negative review for this place! The food and price was outstanding and the service was superb. We will definitely recommend it to friends and would go back in a heartbeat!

column4: 501 South Spring Street Los Angeles, CA  90013
column13: Best food we had in LA on this 3 day weekend trip.
Wonderful, as always. That's why we keep coming back.
Ate on the patio for a sunset dinner. The view and the food were great. I recommend the filet and the chocolate bread pudding.

The setting is beautiful and very quiet for an early-ish dinner, the service very very good and the food comes in third. The drinks, however, were well executed and if there was a drinks rating I would give them six stars, according to Open Table's ratings system. Overall, a very nice experience and we will go again, especially because it's in our neighborhood. In fact, I enjoyed myself so much I looked into the hotel itself for booking a romantic weekend "away" (down the block but a change of scene can be nice).
Great food and wonderful fresh cocktails

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: No atmosphere at all. But the food is wonderful. Too dark inside.

Like all of the Kitchen locations, e.g. Kitchen Upstairs and Kitchen Next Door, top quality. Original menu, excellent food and service. You can't beat the local food to table concept that all three locations ephasize. Top quality and one of our favorites in Boulder!
While the service started out a little slow, the big cube drinks and wonderful food more than offset the initial ramp up. We'd go back!

Wow. I have been to many fine dining establishments and consider myself quite a foodie. I can safely say this is the best dinner experience I have ever had. The best not-kept secret in Sacramento. I will return as soon as my pocketbook allows me to do so.

column1: The Lake Chalet Seafood Bar & Grill
column13: Great location! Hard to believe this is in the middle of a city. Service was good. Very disappointed there wasn't roasted crab since it was on the menu. The server explained it was seasonal but it wasn't indicated on the menu. The manager came by and apologized and said he would take my suggestion to indicate seasonal on the menu.Gnocchi was good but not great. The duck was cooked appropriately and was tasty.

This small plate restaurant was a very pleasant surprise and we have already recommended it to others. Located in an old laundry building in Steamboat Springs, it is a unique, open, sort of industrial looking room that can get a bit noisy. Not too noisy, however, to enjoy sharing exquisite food and infused liquor drinks at reasonable prices. We were a party of two sharing two salad plates and three entre plates and one dessert. Portions were plentiful. If you go there, try to leave room for the gorgonzola cheesecake! Oh, and the service was great -- everyone who worked our table was friendly and knowledgeable, answering any questions we had about the plates. If you go to Steamboat and don't go there, you'll be missing out!
Food had excellent ingredients but lacked a little creativity in spices. Banana crieme pie was stii top-notch.
The food and service were great. We just caught it on a grey Monday at lunch so it was very quiet. I am sure there is much more going on when the weather is nice and on a weekend.

column4: 2700 W El Camino Real Mountain View, CA  94040
column13: Good food. 6:00 pm only one other table with customers. Would go again.

Food was decent - $10 bottomless mimosa and bloody mary's are the draw. It's still a night club with cocktails servers trying to be waitresses so the service was spotty but it's a vibrant scene with good music...
Always a favorite, live to bring visitors.
Food here is very good. They do everything from ramen, bento boxes ( waguyu beef bento box is very good ), and yakitori. Very nice menu in that there really is quite a variety.
Very noisy. Food isnt that great. Not a one I would want to go back too.

column4: 101 S. Westlake Blvd., Thousand Oaks, CA  91362
column13: Going early is the key to having a nice quite meal. If you like vibrant bar scenes then this is the place for you. The after work crowd takes advantage of the early bird prices and it gets noisy quickly. Food is good but not great.
Fabulous food. Great location. The _touffe and Gumbo are to die for. Highly recommended.

We chose to go to the Peasant and the Pear for our anniversary lunch. I had the pork ribs and they were delicious. The meal was excellent all around and the service was outstanding. Chef Rodney even stopped by the table to say hi and congratulations. For dessert, Chef Rodney sent over a complimentary special pear dish drizzled with chocolate. It was a very relaxing Saturday lunch.

We thoroughly enjoyed our experience, the service was excellent and the view was breathtaking. Both of us each tried a different preparation of the fresh fish (which was Ono and another which was similar). Both preparations were unique and very well executed. I can't recommend it enough. Worth a visit.
Good food, good beer, good & entertaining staff. It was a little noisy, but to be expected in a bar stool style place. I would go back again.

column4: 1250 South Fair Oaks Avenue Pasadena, CA  91105
column13: We were thier for the first time. We were celebrating our 59th Wedding Anniversary.Everything was perfect for a special evening.

column4: 741 W. Washington St. San Diego, CA  92103
column13: Delicious food, great service Love the garden grown, fresh vegetables and the tender cuts of meat.

A great meal while we were in town for a short tip. Picked the location based on recommendations from OpenTable. The food was amazing and the service was more than we could have asked for. All of the comments about the Chocolate dessert are right on and it was a great end to the meal. Both our appetizers and entrees were perfectly cooked and the extras made the meal. If we are ever back in town we will be back for sure.

column4: 40 South Locust Ave Long Beach, CA  90802
column13: We came for DineLA on a Friday night with 6:30pm reservations. Overall, everything went smoothly. We noticed a gap between ordering our second course and it arriving, so the three of us requested drinks and our server promptly said they would be on the house due to our wait time, which pleasantly surprised us. She was very helpeful, cheery, not pushy at all, and made the dining experience quite nice. The restaurant started off quiet but quickly picked up to a dull roar as the night wore on, but, that's to be expected I suppose; it wasn't intolerable, just noticeable. This was my second time for DineLA and I will definitely be back again, as will, I suspect, my two dining partners. We all enjoyed our night.
Amazing food! Service was great, too! We tried it out for our anniversary and will definitely be coming back.

LOVE the Sonora Grill! Always a special treat to eat here. Tried something new and it was FABULOUS!!! Even my "particular"eaters love the options and Sonora's willingness to modify according to their needs or preferences. Food always tastes fresh, never run of the mill. Service was tremendous. Of course we'll be back!

column4: 114 S Central Ave. Los Angeles, CA  90012
column13: Tastes just like my Chinese/Malaysian mom used to make but with top end ingredients!

column4: 117 Manhattan Beach Blvd. Manhattan Beach, CA  90266
column13: Overall experience would be a 2.5 stars, saved by the food and view. Poor slow service- we sat without acknowledgement or even a glass of water for a few minutes while we watched our waitress help other tables. When she finally told us she was going to put plates down then would be back to help. She came back and made her way to all other tables AGAIN before taking our drink order.
Food was good, ocean view was spectacular but restaurant was a bit dated inside. Service was outstanding

Our only complaint was when we arrived at 5:30 p.m. on a Sunday and after ordering, our waiter explained to us the restaurant was out of several menu items. Of those being chicken and waffles and grill cheese. Grill cheese???? Also out of fruit?! We had reserved patio seating so we had a beautiful view on the top level overlooking the Yampa river. The restaurant also has a small park adjacent to the first floor patio level where the kids can play. Great idea! All in all, other than the management issue, we enjoyed our dinner but were disappointed in the loss of the menu items as that was the reason we chose this restaurant over others. We will hesitate a return visit.

column1: The Sycamore Inn Prime Steak House
column13: I've been patronizing Sycamore Inn since 1977. Always glad I ate there too!

We had a group of 8 for dinner at Tipsy Pig. It was the first time for all of us. We really had a great dinner. The food was excellent (we had salmon, chicken pot pie, and a beef dish). This is a 'pub' style restaurant, so I didn't have high hopes for the food, but was pleasantly surprised at how good it was. Wait staff were prompt and friendly. It's a noisy restaurant, but not so loud that you can't talk. We had a great booth table by the window.
This is your place if you want consistently great sushi and variety. Tok fries are a must. Dan Dan was great. Sushi was superb. Fresh and pleasantly presented.

column4: 330 East Amado Road Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Palm Springs is lucky to have this gem of a restaurant in it's mix. Good fun, good service, lovely ambiance - Tropicale has it all.
surprisingly tasty ,well prepared food and good service . Decent wine list. very busy and very noisy
Service was very efficient, waitress very accommodating. Reservations promptly kept. Food excellent.

It was a great outing to celebrate over dinner. The staff was incredibly friendly and it was great to see fresh flowers on the table. Every dish at the table was excellent, and I would highly recommend the Elk medallions. I would highly recommend this as one of the top spots for food in Breck, and will be back next time I am in the mountains.

column4: 729 W. Washington St. San Diego, CA  92103
column13: We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and the live music. The restaurant is small and intimate, though a bit dark. I loved the Laphroaig Scotch and Vodka martini! They stuff their own blue cheese oliver. The veggies come from their own garden, and the homemade bread was wonderful.

You seldom see the Chefs out and about the restaurant - delivering the plates, visiting with the customers. That is a definite PLUS! Makes the diner feel very special. The food was excellent, drinks were a little weak and the young hostess must've been new and we confused her by wanting to sit side-by-side in a booth. We asked the waitress to take our picture to commemorate our anniversary. A few minutes later, she delivered complimentary champagne - how gracious! Loved It!! Will return for Special Occassions.

only had one beer on tap (not as their menu suggested). Small menu to start and they were out of soup ( had an alternate with cream so NO), out of their beet salad, out of their brussel sprouts (had a substitution) and out of the wine we chose off the menu. The gluten-free option for the burger was less than favorable since they didn't get their order that day. Very sad due to the fact that it is our favorite restaurant on the riverfront. With two of the owners present at the time, an apology would have been in order. The waiter was clueless as to what the restaurant had and didn't have. It was well into the 30 minute wait for food that we were told.
Nice atmosphere - view of the river. We've had brunch there twice and food was delicious.

column4: 360 North Palm Canyon Dr. Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Our waitress was the most inattentive waitress I have ever seen. One waitress for the whole place and she still stood around. Our drink bill would have been doubled if was a good waitress. Two of us ordered a special martini off the dinner menu and no one knew how to make it. The manager sat in the corner and smoked cigarettes and did not have a concern in the world.
The location and setting is wonderful but the food and service average. I had the antioxidant salad and added tofu and avocado but it still didn't have much flavor. The other diners agreed.

Awesome little local place with great food and wine. 4* only because of the noise. A large party would be making the noise, so not to worry! :-) I'd go back again in a minute. Some Italian wine you won;t find very often, and sold by the glass... Many organic ingredients and enough vegan and vegetarian food so that all will be well fed.
My rating is based on sitting outside in the patio.The inside noise is impossible to tolerate.

column1: Tintos Spanish Restaurant and Wine Bar
column4: 2015 W. Gray Suite J Houston, TX  77019
column13: waiting staff was extremely helpfu with wine and food selection.

After years of searching for just the right place to celebrate our anniversary, this is it. But, we think it's so good that we now go to T. Maccarone's before each of our Walla Walla Symphony concerts.

To start, the drinks were a bit heavy handed...I'd usually never complain about a heavy handed drink but my buddy's drink was so heavy handed that it was tainting his palette to the extent that he wasn't able to taste the food over the alcohol. The octopus salad was very good, the veal meatballs were good but the pasta (ravioli and black pepper fettucini) dishes were not seasoned properly.

column4: 1250 Coast Village Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: Terrific restaurant. Some of the best food we ever tasted. Great staff and Mollie her self comes out from the kitchen to make you feel comfortable and often will give one a free dessert or starter. A must to go to while in Santa Barbara/Montecito.
Very good sushi, but they forgot our order twice and it took hours before we got all our food...

Place and waitress were nice however the food was mediocre. The chicken katsu was really tasteless, had better chicken katsu at other Hawaiian fast food restaurant. My friend barely touched the pork she ordered from the bento box. However we do like the ambiance tho...good for lunch but they just need to step it up on the food quality.

column4: 655 Montgomery St./ Financial District San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Made a lunch reservation thru Open Table for an employee's birthday. The Hostess & Head Waiter greeted me by name and made me feel like a VIP. Very elegant surroundings, prompt service. You know it is classy when there are charger plates on the table.

column1: Tommy V's Urban Kitchen and Bar Scottsdale
column4: 7303 E Indian School Rd. Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: I was pleasantly surprised by the food and service at this "neighborhood gem" - our waiter Chris was outstanding and helped make our dining experience memorable. The pasta was terrific and the portions were large enough to share. Prices were good and I would return for the Happy Hour - thank you!

column4: 2 N. Central One Renaissance Sq Ste 102 Phoenix, AZ  85004
column13: We sat on the patio. I really enjoyed the brisket!!! Our waitress was very knowledgeable and attentive. We will return.

Went here for my wife birthday. Good was good however service was below avg compared to other high end dining restaurants. I would give a recommendation only because the good was good and it had a great view.

column4: 301 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: 2nd time eating here. Food was good but not exceptional. Bar service is slow. Waitstaff is polite, pleasant & attentive but unpolished ... clearly they are lacking in training.

We were there for an early dinner, so we used the Happy Hour menu. The service was very friendly and attentive. The pizza and gyro were very good. Caprese salad was disappointing. Cheese was grainy, tomatoes were not ripe, very little basil or dressing. I would not order that again.

Overall it is a good place. We had been here a year ago and the food ( appetizer, entre and desert) were much better then. I had the pork chop this time. It was ok. Cooked very well but the flavors were unremarkable. I ordered the Pliny the elder to drink and was amazed at how much they marked it up. Service was good, it got noisy as it got busier and the tables are too close to each other ( deffinitly not in compliance with fire code).

Food was very good and the waiter was excellent. After dinner we moved over to the bar. I only wish the bartender had been as attentive as our waiter. He should be reminded that his tip depends on good service - not indifferent service.

Really great cocktails, good atmosphere. On warm evenings, the walls of windows on two sides of the restaurant are opened so that it's an open air sort of feel. The foh staff and bar staff were exceptional, but our dinner waiter was not. Overall, though, it was a fun evening. We were there for my wife's birthday, and I was tryin to surprise her with some friends. The foh staff did everything they could to help facilitate the surprise and to make my wife feel special on her birthday. The food is okay, not great by any stretch. But, the cocktails were great and very well executed. Fun place to go with a large group where the evening is centered on good company, atmosphere, and plenty of drinks. Again, all but our waiter were exceptional.

column4: 201 West Bay Area Blvd Webster, TX  77598
column13: Repeat customer, but thats for a reason. Great, friendly service! Impeccable at that! Food was delish..if you eat meat, then you must go NOW
Excellent food, beautiful restaurant. Very interesting menu

The space felt very open and airy; no feeling crunched and sandwiched next to other diners! The service was phenomenal. Staff was always very aware of everything going on willing to help. The food and cocktails were delicious and I can wait to try more.

column4: 68-718 East Palm Canyon Drive, #401 Cathedral City, CA  92234
column13: Great food and service! Ordered off the Local's Prix Fix menu which had a ton of food for really cheap. The appetizer salad was really a whole salad. I left feeling nice and full. Whenever I return to Palm Springs, I would definitely go back to this place since the food was excellent. Everyone needs a good Italian Restaurant destination where ever they travel to.

The food was exquisite, well though out, and beautifully presented. The service was impeccable. Best service I've ever had! Been to many upscale restaurants, but the service here was incomparable. It was truly a dining experience.

column4: 75 Yerba Buena Lane San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: Great food and service. It was great to have a very different take on Mexican food. I met the GM on the way out and had a nice conversation. The staff seemed to be more mature and in control than some other Mexican restaurants I have been too.
It's OK not great reasonably priced food arrived quickly. Unremarkable but OK.

Really enjoyed my cocktails. Was happy to see our reservation was honored because it was very busy. I think its more of a bar with food than a restaurant. To be considered a restaurant, another page of menu selections for food should be offered. I will definitely come back - for snacks and drinks.
Excellent food and great service

Dinner at Tuscany was wonderful. Service was great, food was amazing and the ambiance was chill. BUT.... The noise level was outrageous!!! I couldn't believe how loud it was in there. I could barely hear my bf speak. Maybe next time we'll go a little earlier.

column4: 2832 East 6200 South Salt Lake City, UT  84121
column13: The occasion was my husband's birthday and everything was outstanding, including the valet service. I called the restaurant 3 hours before our reservation to request "easy access" seating due to a mobility problem. My request was taken care of immediately. The food preparation and presentation along with our server's knowledge of preparation and content of the various dishes were outstanding. Our party of five would have changed nothing. A very pleasant experience.
A good place for a good Italian meal! I recommend the calamari alla mama for a unique appetizer.
Arrived early, 5:00 PM. Welcomed by name. Menu and Special selection where excellent. Wine list was great. Enjoyed the evening greatly, always found dinning here a good experience.
