Every bite was delicious. Enjoyed the special price for ordering 1 item in each category. Wait staff very attentive and knowledgeable. Would love to come back each month to enjoy the menu changes.

We have been several times and service has been great (we went early), but this last time the service was really slow due to the fact that they service the wine bar across the parking lot. They utilize the servers and the kitchen to supply the wine bar which slows down the service at the restaurant, so go early if you want good service.
Fabulous! If you love great food, you will love Uchi. Every dish is special, I can't pick just one to recommend.
We enjoyed a phenomenal tasting journey at the bar where we watched beautiful composed dishes being created. The staff is very skillful and knowledgeable. Great night out.
fantastic food, service, look. hope to enjoy this treasure again and again.
Fabulous location and extensive wine list. Would have liked more food choices on the menu.
Food was excellent. My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our dinners.

Great Bar & Grill food with a gourmet spin! The Basil Caesar Salad was deliciously savory with added texture from the bacon lardons and crispy croutons. The basil was not overpowering, just a light background note. Soup of the day was carrot coconut curry. Yum! The delicious burger brought back warm memories of eating a juicy homemade burger as a kid. I was skeptical of the Blueberry Pie with the corn meal crust but it delivered on texture and taste. I can't wait to have it again! Service was awesome too!

My first time at Upstairs 2 was great. There was a long wait despite the fact that I had a reservation. But the hostess kept checking on our party while we waited at the bar. The reason for the delay was the it was DineLA and folks were obviously enjoying the food and didn't want to leave! We were finally seated, our server was really friendly, but she must have been really busy because it took a long while for her to take our actual orders. But the food was amazing! Definitely recommend the pork belly and cole slaw for 1st course, the lavender dusted sea bass for 2nd and the Marcona almond pie for dessert. Highly recommend the wine pairings. While the waitstaff was busy they were very friendly. Definitely going back!!
As always, the food is great! This is one of my all time "safe" restaurant. I wish they have a bigger menu though.
I thought the portion sizes on beef way to big I would have preferred smaller piece with reduction in cost
It was awesome! I absolutely loved the selection and will DEFINITELY be going there again. Their dessert is to die for!

I enjoy dining at URBN more so than Basic though the food selection is basically the same. I really really dig the couch seating (great for big groups) and it's not so loud in there that you can't hold a conversation (which is I often feel at Basic). The bourbon cocktail is killer! Love the spicy hot wings and the sausage stuffed pepper pizza. Will definitely be back again and again!
Chicken Tikki Masala was delicious! Sitting outside was fun especially on a cool summer night.
#NAME?

The restaurant is quite large and lively. There was a band playing, with a female vocalist, which was kind of fun. The service was poor - it took a long time to get a drink while we waited at the bar, and when it finally came it was time to go to our table, and they asked that I pay my bar tab before sitting (always annoying). Then it took a long time to get someone to take our dinner order, and while the food came quickly, I was almost done eating before the waiter remembered that I had asked to see the wine list for a glass of wine. The food was uneven - one app was great, our pizza was undercooked and soft, but the ravioli in brown butter was delicious. It seems like a fun neighborhood place, they just need to work on their service!

column1: Va de Vi Bistro & Wine Bar
column4: 1511 Mt. Diablo Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: The food was fantastic! There were four of us and we all loved the food! Service was good. Unfortunately, the person who brought my husband's red wine spilled some of it on my cream-colored jacket. She put "Wine B'gone" on my jacket right away which removed the red wine stain and offered to pay for my drycleaning. It was a good thing that the stain seemed to come out, because frankly, this offer is not practical for me to bring back a receipt for my drycleaning to get compensated since I'm not from this area.
As always it was very good -- the menu selections, the service, the food and of course their fantastic wine list!

Fridays and Saturday nights 8:30-10:30 this place has Karaoke with a LIVE band. It is so much fun! We were there for a birthday and were very accommodating at letting us bring our own cake and sitting us by the Karaoke. Fun evening, good food.

column4: 164 South B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: The mushroom ravioli were excellent along with the special macadamia nut crusted halibut. The risotto cake that was served with it was very good. Our server didn't check on us that often. Some of my dining companions thought the food was lacking salt. I would still go back.

What an absolute treasure of a restaurant. The Veranda is a truly local restaurant where the food is incredible, and you get to know the owners personally. My wife and I had just landed at Houston Intercontinental and I used OpenTable to find a good restaurant. Relying on the great reviews, we decided to try the Veranda. I can honestly say that meal became one of our favorite restaurant experiences of all time. The food was among the best we have ever had. The owners, who are musical artists, also interacted with us personally and genuinely. They have had the restaurant at the same location for 16 years. Quaint and excellent. Very reasonable prices. On our list of "have to go to" places when in Houston.

column4: 830 University Drive East, Suite 400 College Station, TX  77840
column13: A top restaurant for College Station or anywhere! Wonderful food, wine, and service.

column4: 1700 McHenry Ave. Suite I-46 Modesto, CA  95350
column13: Wonderful food and service considering how late we were. As always, the fish was fresh and amazing.

Was very impressed with this 5-star restaurant. Food and presentation were excellent and the staff did a great job, as we had to send back a drink that was mixed incorrectly -- they were both gracious and attentive. While the menu is a bit pricey, if looking for a special occasion and money is no object, this is a perfect restaurant.

column4: 301 N. Canon Dr. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Food was great. We got bumped on our service because the lead singer from Stone Temple Pilots was there and in a hurry. But, no biggie. Food was delish!
As always - an enjoyable place to have a great meal! Also they serve a gluten-free pasta, have a gluten free menu, and are very accommodating.
horrible to find parking which will keep me from going back.

column4: 690 Higuera St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: Food and service both just so-so. Fried Calamari for appetizer; portion size was WAY too small for the price. Ordered 2 glasses of wine, one was maybe a 6 oz pour and other was more like 4 oz. Way too much stuff on the menu (almost always never a good sign at a restaurant). Lasagne and pizza were good; spaghetti puttanesca was ok (not bad but not great either); veal scallopini was literally inedible and a very small portion for the price, probably one of the worst things I've ever tasted in a restaurant. Sides were very mediocre - small salad with gelatinous Italian dressing, very small portion of veggies and pasta with veal. Waitress was scattered, lasagne arrived 10 mins after rest of food. Should have had a better experience for $100.
Be sure to request to meet Executive Chef Francis Dimitrius. This USC-graduated hottie is much hotter in person!

column4: 3870 Valley Centre Dr San Diego, CA  92130
column13: While not "knock your socks off" food, uses fresh, good quality ingredients to produce enjoyable meals. Prices are reasonable -- portions are of good size (share a salad). Recommended.
Great as usual, which is why we're there every Sunday!

column4: 48 E Beaver Creek RD Avon, CO  81620
column13: We have been to Vin several times over the last year or so. We are impressed with the consistently high level of quality and great service. Bin is one of those must stop placed in Avon.

column4: 800 N 10th Place Suite E Renton, WA  98057
column13: Excellent spot for leisurely dining with great food and drink.
What a great little find. great wine, nice live music, and food that was enjoyable and gresh. The roasted vegetables and the wrapped dates were fantastic! Great little neighborhood find!

Wanted to sit outside today and always love the food and wine here. Fast lunch under umbrella outdoors was one of the best meals I have experienced at this wonderful restaurant. Service by Jimmy excellent and prompt. Plate presentation wonderful. The red snapper in lemon picatta sauce over a bed of spinach and mashed potatoes was beautifully plated but even more pleasant to the pallate. Wonderful.

column4: 15411 W. Waddell Rd Suite 108 Surprise, AZ  85379
column13: The best thing about the entire dinner was the pineapple tarte tatin. Thought it was overpriced for the quality of the food and we are foodies!
Great wine list and service; the food is innovative and different (fusion). Will definitely return!
food was excellent and atmosphere is casual yet elegant.

The food was good, the portions were ample. I had the Clay Pot, with chicken, prawns, and beef, rice and vegetables. The crunchy rice at the bottom of the pot was very good!We asked for quick service, as we were due at a jazz presentation. The staff complied, and food was ready very quickly. Attendance at Vo's was sparse, at 6:30 PM Friday, so the staff had more leeway to prepare our food quickly. Good service.

column4: 12234 S. Draper Gate Dr. Draper, UT  84020
column13: Great atmosphere inside and out. We sat on the outdoor patio with beautiful views of the valley at sunset.

At 1:00 PM on Sunday could only order from the breakfast menu, not even brunch, despite the fact that chalk boards were promoting fresh fish, apparently available only at dinner or if you relocate upstairs to the bar.

We were a party of three with two different appetizers and three different entrees. The Lettuce Wedge was very flavorful and fresh with quality ingredients. The Crab Cakes were 95% crab with a shrimp mousse as a binder. The aoli sauce was so good I even dipped bread into it! My Rex Sole was very delicate and perfectly cooked and paired well with the rice. My sister had the Halibut again perfectly prepared. My wife had the Chicken Florentine (stuffed with crab!). We would fully recommend all items and my wife are going back tonight!

column4: 2900 Travis Street Suite F Houston, TX  77006
column13: We waited 15 minutes before our server showed her face. We shared the Chicken Yakitori which came with 4 skewers--was good & actually perfect amount. Husband had the Crave hibachi-filet mignon plate--he had 4 strips of beef about 2 inches long about 1/2 inch wide, 1/4 inch thick---about 2 tbsp of veggies & a very small scoop of rice. I had the salmon ceviche which was okay & Hamachi sushi & 2 other kinds which were small as well & I can't remember what kind they were as they were only so-so as I have had better. Service was poor & I didn't understand that as our server only had 1 other table beside us--we went on a Wednesday night & there was only about 10 other customers there. We won't be back--over priced for sub-par food & bad service.
The best steak house in North County! Great food, great service, what more can I say?

WhisknLadle was the hot spot. Lively scene. A little loud once they were full. Our tables was ready and waiting. We made reservations for 6pm and we needed to push back to 6:15pm. WnL was most gracious. Our server was very patient. I had out of town guests - some were out of the country guests. Jeremiah helped us thru the menu. Everything was presented well and tasted delish. The Summer salad stole the show. Corn, Avo and grapefruit. The salad completely captured the essence of summer in California. The only down side was the parking. We parked at a lot the advertised $5 all day (Hotel Paresi) In fact they charged us $12 and were considered preferred parking for WnL. What's up with that? Anyway we will be back - maybe we will take the bus!
Truly memorable meal. Superb gazpacho, sides and steaks. Great menu makes it hard to choose.
The server was great, the food was very overpriced for what it was. Very unimpressed, middle of the road and without a discount I would have been insulted at the bill.
Delicious food and specialty drinks!! Thoroughly enjoyed our girls-night-out!!

column4: 481 E. South Temple Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: We arrived for our reservation and were seated promptly. Unfortunately our experience went downhill quickly from there. We waited almost 20 minutes before being greeted by our server and then didn't receive our drinks until 40 minutes after being seated. Our appetizers finally came after we had been there for over an hour. The food was fine but I've had similar dishes at other restaurants around town that I've enjoyed much more than at this restaurant. I'd read the menu online before making our reservation and it just looked like the kind of restaurant I would enjoy so I was really excited to dine here but found it to be very underwhelming. It's not the worst restaurant around, but I'm in no hurry to return.

column4: 800 NW 6th Ave at Union Station Portland, OR  97209
column13: The new decor is an improvement. Food and service were outstanding. A bit expensive though.

What a pleasant surprise, we loved our meal, and the menu was amazing, so muchvariety and unusual preparations, everything we ordered was spectacular, especiallythe Smelt dish....go there!! CRM San Francisco

column4: 4404 Old Redwood Hwy Santa Rosa, CA  95403
column13: Great food and detailed wine selections with great recommendations from staff. Will definitely be back.

column4: 150 S. San Fernando Blvd. #20 Burbank, CA  91502
column13: I had a student years ago(hello Aldo) who was one of the early employees of Wokcano and he urged me to try it. it only took me 8 year to take him up on the offer and am I sorry. What a great find!. We started with the Lettuce cups and the chicken dumplings-both great. For entrees we had the Pad Thai and the Honey Walnut Shrimp-delicious. The waiter, Kiko, was doting and made the evening go off without a hitch. The nice thing is that after dinner, one has San Fernando Blvd to walk off the meal .It was a great evening.

column4: 640 North Lake Blvd. Tahoe City, CA  96145
column13: Has an asian flair that was not described well in the menu - no specials on a saturday night?

column4: The Ritz-Carlton, Bachelor Gulch 130 Daybreak Ridge, P.O. Box 9190 Avon, CO  81620
column13: The wait staff left much to be desired. In a restaurant that is so expensive the waiter should be more attentive and less condescending. We waited over fifteen minutes for drinks, had to ask for the bread basket...not right! That being said, the food was outstanding.

Convenient spot for before (Pantages) theater bite but very pricey for what you get! We're two tiny people and we were still hungry after a $100 bill. Would have liked to have had decaf cappuccino available!

My wife and I have eaten there many times and we go mostly for the Prime Rib on Friday and Saturday nights or the all you can eat Ribs on Tuesday night. Both are excellent and the ribs are a good bargin. Some of the other dishes such as the Prime Rib is a little pricey. The wait staff have always been friendly and helpful. Overall, well worth the trip out to Snoqualmie.
Oysters Oysters Oysters and a crab!

Was disappointed to see that they changed their menu.Liked the other menu much better.Was even more disappointed when they wouldn't make something from the old menu even thoughthey still have all the ingredients on the menu.
Overall good, the calimari salad is very spicy, but does not indicate that it is.

Joined friends for brunch there for first time - the breafast food item was very good and reasonably priced ($9) - but the tea and dessert were over-priced. For these three items by the time I left, including tip, I had spent $29. Way too much money for what I received. The waiter was nice, but we were left unattended at our outside table for very long periods of time. This place is interesting based on all the tea selections available, but definitely not worth the money or all the fuss I had heard about it. I won't be going back.
Excellent dinner. Will definitely be back.

column4: 362 North Canon Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: We invited our friends to dine with us. It was a beautiful evening and it is very nice to sit outside. That area was improved upon.That being said, the dinner was the worst I have ever had there or at any Chinese restaurant in Los Angeles.To be brief, everything came cold.....The chicken cashew was overdone -- it had obviously been sitting around all day.The shrimp (honey walnut ) had no taste, no glaze, infact the shrimp tasted medicinal. Thebuddha's feast which at one time would be ample for 4 people, was barely enough for 2. Again, it was obviously not preparedwhile we were there. Mushu was again, underwhelming. The wrapper was hard so it was not cooked properly. Less food, highercosts, poor preparation. Never
What a find; great food, service and personal attention by Xiomara
Yakuza burger was super, as was the snap pea salad. Excellent local beer on tap, although it took forever to get it. Restaurant is attractive with a very pretty garden area.
Great food. Perfect for a special occasion

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: This is my second trip to YamaSho and it's really quite a lovely experience. Situated at the corner of Van Ness and Post on the outskirts of the Tenderloin, it is a great spot for a romantic dinner, a big group or a karaoke party. Whatever your mood, this place is very nice and the food is delicious, although a little pricey. Worth going to for a special night.

You can count on Yankee Pier for delicious, fresh fish and seafood on every visit. The half-price wine in July was a nice surprise. Service is always friendly though, on this visit, a bit slow. Usually we find that another waiter, manager or bus-person will always come by if our server is busy with another table. They were just too busy this time. The manager always stops to ask how things are. Overall, a very cheerful, welcoming place with a great menu for all ages and to-die-for fresh food from the sea.

column1: Yellow Rose Steak and Chop House
column4: 890 Parker Square Dr Flower Mound, TX  75028
column13: Overall I felt this was a "Good" experience, however the food was a little less than I expected. I ordered the Ribeye and while this cut should be expected with moderate marbling, this particular cut I received had extreme amounts (25% waste). Clearly the chef should have trimmed this cut prior to cooking.

column1: Yojie Japanese Fondue and Sake Bar
column4: 501 W Olympic Blvd Unit 102 Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: Service is slow and a little sloppy but the food is good. Nice to be able to choose from the bar or sit down seating. Goma sauce is too watery and too sweet. Need to provide bigger soup bowls for the noodles at the end.

column4: 260 N. Beverly Dr. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: My wife and I ate here for our annniversary. We chose the Dasai Sake pairing. Dasai Sake is excellent and hard to find in the States. We are foodies and truly enjoyed our experience. The food was amazing! Excellent Japanese fusion cuisine. Yojisan is extremely dedicated to providing a delicious experience you will not forget. We can't wait to bring our friends and family back.

column4: 601 S. Central Ave Los Angeles, CA  90021
column13: The food was delicious, the drinks were good, and I definitely liked the twist on Mexican food.

The food is delicious, the service is very good, both from hosts and wait staff and I love Wednesday's pint night. The appetizers and drink specials are amazing, particularly the shrimp pesto fontina pizza, which is a favorite, but the steak salad is amazing, too.

The restaurant was uninspired. I had the housemade vegetarian burger, which was good, but nothing unique (the housemade veggie patty from the Rialto in El Cerrito is significantly better). My friends had what was essentially meat and potatoes. Our drink orders took forever to fill, and the cocktails were mediocre at best. Staff was friendly but service was slow. I'll definitely go elsewhere for my next evening out--not because the restaurant was bad, but just because it was so mediocre and uninspiring, and this is the Bay Area afterall, we have tons of inspired restaurants to choose from!

Extremely noisy - opposed to "vibrant bar scene". Very diappointed.The waitress never came back to take our order even after the appetizers were served and almost halfway through - we had to track her down to give her the order (she was surprised that she hadn't taken our order - there was only one other waitstaff there)Poor wine list __ very few choices in terms of quality and variety.We ordered the blue fin toro at market price ($30 for 5 slices) and was served half frozen grey fish. Very unappetizing. Also ordered a couple of spicy rolls which were actually good. But generally, the food, the ambiance and the service was disappointing.
Always love this restaurant, so lucky to have it in my neighborhood.

I went here with my boyfriend. I chose it because we love Italian food. Turned out to be very good (though I have been there before)! Not like less nice Italian places. Dishes aren't do basic and are great! Mediterranean pizza was great and so was the buratta. Will go again for sure!

I eat out two or three times a week but it had been a few years since I had dined at Zikiki's. We enjoyed Ziziki's as something different. However, it won't become one of our "regular" places. The tables were shoved too close together, making it less than cozy; and the noise level too high for my (and my date's) comfort. This was a Friday evening -- that may partly explain the noise and the crowd. I think we are a little more sensitive to noise than most people.
Fun and great service. We were in town and decided to try a late evening dinner and drink destination. Server was friendly and helpful and food, drinks were great. We'll definitely go back!

Service started out difficult but with another server stepping in things smoothed out. The 6 of us moved from a table to the sushi bar. Sushi Chefs Chris & Jay took fantastic care of us all. Their recommendations and combinations were exceptional! ( ...like eel and mango or spicy tuna and avocado...) The food was fresh and completely over the top. The best experience at Zushi is definitely at the sushi bar!

A slice of Palo Alto in Berkeley. Located on a block of sleek trendy stores, in an otherwise somwhat gritty marina neighborhood. Stylish, nice eatery, excellent meal. I would eat there again without hesitation.
We had Brian as our server for the second time. He recognized us and served us with such enthusiasm and knowledge. He is a keeper.
160 Beers on tap is nice, but the food wasn't anything special, especially for $12+/plate.
We had an excellent dinner before catching a plane back to Honolulu. The service and meal was superb - a great ending to a too short weekend vacation on Maui.

The guacamole made at our table was the best we've ever tasted. My cucumber lavender margarita was fantastic. We loved the patio, the lighting, and the general feel. Great for a date night or group of friends.

Tried the restaurant for DineLA week. So delicious! The service was great, she made some wonderful recommendations. The music was fun and not too loud, so my group could enjoy a nice conversation without having to shout. Would definitely come back.
Good food. Reasonable price and good service. Noisy.

column1: Andre's at the Monte Carlo Resort & Casino
column4: 3770 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Went to dinner with a group for my birthday. The seared fois was amazing and the stuffed lobster is my favorite entree. Server was very professional. As always Tanya made sure that we were content and well taken care of thru out the night. She continues to go above and beyond every time I done there. There are a lot of options in Vegas but I always continue to take my guest to Andres where I know it will be a memorable experience! Almost forgot... These busser have the best attention to detail that I have ever seen! Thank you to the whole staff!!

The sound is loud enough to knock you over, but the charm of the front of the house and the very delicious food make you forget you can't hear anything. The raw Summer squash salad was a revelation, and the lamb melted in the mouth. Can't wait to go back.

column4: 535 Zang St Suite C Broomfield, CO  80021
column13: Although better food than many of the other Indian restaurants in the area, food is mediocre at best. The decor has no Indian feel to it. I would be surprised if everything was made to order from scratch.
Happy Hour Specials were fantastic.
Visiting from Denver and found this gem. Great food & service, try it!!

Serevice was excellent. Risotto and crab pasta were exceptional. T-bone lamb was almost inedible because of gristle. Butcher did restaurant no favors on the lamb. I would return to this restaurant. The lamb was unfortunate.
creative and subtly complex. masterful use of high-end techniques for interesting and harmonious dishes. one of my top ten meals ever.
We really enjoyed the food at THe Coterie Room. The place can be noisey so it's not the place for a quiet romantic dinner but if you're in the mood for action, it fits the bill.

The service was excellent and extremely accommodating. I ordered the white sea bass, which was a bit on the dry side, but the dish accompaniments (white bean puree, I think) were excellent. The seafood platter came with good dipping sauces, although it was overall on the pricey side for what we received. The two tier was a small appetizer for 6 ppl at $90. I'd give the place another try, but next time will skip the platter.

I found it to be expensive and the food was not very good for the price. It was like bar food. To many types of food on the menu and not very good at any of them. Good place if you are a beer drinker, but definitely not to eat. Fist time there and wanted to take my husband and kids for something different. Website looked good but it was not what it appeared. It was a birthday celebration as I had mentioned and waiters made no comment on that. Probably will not go there again.

column1: Blowfish Sushi to Die For - SF
column13: Great service and the food was excellent

Service was outstanding! There was a bit of a wait on the dessert but we were informed when we placed our order; the wait wasn't that long (5-10 minutes) so we chose to wait.The honey toast was well worth the wait! Everything was presented beautifully and tasted incredible. We tried some of the unusually items (sushi pizza,etc) and were surprised that they were items we would recommend to others. Our only complaint is that the tables would slide very easily on the polished floor. Definitely a value establishment. value = quality/price. Approximately $85 for party of four.

column1: Blowfish Sushi to Die For, San Jose
column13: We had such a good time last Saturday night. We were very well cared for at the bar by everyone. We really noticed that all the bar staff went out of their way to suggest different refreshing drinks, wines and sushi. We just had so much fun. We have already recommended Blowfish to our friends and we will be back for sure.

column4: 616 N Robertson Blvd West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: Gorgeous ambiance reminiscent of my favorite hip spots internationally. Great music, delicately flavored food and a cozy-chic decor. I was expecting something completely different from the name and was more than pleasantly surprised.

Had a wonderful dinner, with beautifully presented, tasteful treats. Had hoped to dine with other friends, but reservations would not accept a group our size (9). This location is away from the beaten wine track, a lovely surprise.

Very nice dining experience, but we had the last seating and the service seemed to disappear as the meal went on. Service was friendly and knowledgeable just inconsistent. It would also be better to have one primary waiter/waitress instead of 4 "helpers". Otherwise the food was very good and well executed and presented.

column1: The Restaurant at JUSTIN Vineyards & Winery
column13: Excellent food, great atmosphere, superior service.

We are locals and have eaten here a number of times. The Sunday brunch is outstanding and dinners are Very good. The B&B along with the dinning room are in new hands and the food, service and attention to detail has not changed.We would highly recommend . A special place for a special occasion.Frank and Peggy Connolly
We sat out on the deck on a nice evening. Dinner was great and the views were fantastic.

Phenomenal resto in the Mission. Had the tasting menu that impressed at every turn. Liberal use of liquid nitro an other trickery to create popcorn pure, frozen horseradish cream domes, Douglas fir mousse and more. Server was enthusiastic and helpful. Host was accommodating. Wine pairings were flawless. Can't say enough about this place.
Usually think of Gruner as excellent- close to dB Bistro in NY, but this visit was a little disappointing- but still very very good.
My husband & I each ordered what we got last month. (very good last time) this time food was mediocre. food inconsistent.my pasta was very salty.
Great place in the north end of the Pearl. Fantastic wine by the glass selection!! Dined outside and the noise was minimal to moderate.
It's a quiet little spot with a focus on serving great tasting food to finicky people. They do gluten-free with flair. Only EVOO. The mango chicken is the best chicken I've had in forever.

column4: 120 Sir Francis Drake Blvd San Anselmo, CA  94960
column13: We depend on Insalata's for consistent quality in every dish, intelligent service, and the casually elegant atmosphere that's lighted by the huge paintings of persimmons, pears, plums, and peaches. This restaurant is a treasure.
Loved it! Excellent brunch, great environment--not too crowded, not too noisy, perfect ambience.
Seems like a nice place, good location, but the food is just OK. Went on a Saturday night and there were only 4 other people in the place but the music was cranked up just slightly too loud.

The wait time was kind of crazy, lucky i had booked a reservation prior to our arrival. Besides that our waiter was awesome he nicely told us how busy they were and even brought us extra bread...nice!! best service we ever had a Bucca.
This restaurant is always a hit! Whether you eat cheese, meats, or dessert--the food is always wonderful!

column4: 2961-A Michelson Drive Suite A, Building 10 Suite A, Building 10 Irvine, CA  92612
column13: We were celebrating our anniversary, so wanted to go for "special". The food was amazing! The filet was to die for and the summer salad with the strawberries was excellent! So much food that we left very full and the dessert in the take home bag. :)
We go to Daily Grill often and it's always good in every respect.
great neighborhood gem. food was very good and wine is 50% off 5-7pm weekdays, can't beat that!

This was my second visit here. It is a great little cafe, with wonderful food and great specials. The service is professional, the owner is usually there to ensure it all goes smoothly, and the live music can be either really cool or really odd, depending on who is playing.

Being from the NYC area, my standards for good Italian are pretty high. This is not your usual fare - the sauce was bright, the lasagna, chicken, and vegetables cooked perfectly. Definitely a date night repeat for us!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The food was extraordinary. I can't say enough good things about our dinner there.

We had heard many good things about Buon Appetito, both from friends who recommended it and various reviews. So we went with high expectations. We were disappointed. The food was competently prepared but not noteworthy. The pasta dishes had huge quantities of pasta, which may or may not have been freshly prepared, but were unremarkable. Sauces and spicing were boring and unimaginative. The waitstaff were attentive and helpful. Noise level was quite high, which made the experience feel more like a club or bar than a restaurant. There are few really good Italian restaurants in San Diego. Sadly, this is not one of them.
Tasty preparations of middle eastern food. Love the salad choices.

column4: 555 N El Camino Real, Suite E San Clemente, CA  92672
column13: Since I enjoy Blues Roots music I was interested in dining at Iva Lee's and catch some music with dinner. The music was very good, band was in the bar and the dining room is aligned to see them play while seated at most tables. My wife and I enjoyed the dinner, the service was very polite and attentive, but the cocktails, while not inexpensive, were not up to par and felt watered down. I think I would stick with the pints of beer here and not risk the weak drinks.
Beautiful views and very special and attentive service. Helped me make a special birthday for my family "wonderful" ..... Thank you Luminaria's!! You are number one in my book.

This is one of the better places on the Westside for a late night meal, as it is always open. Nothing fancey, but a large variety menu for any late night craving, not great food, but certainly decent with huge portions
Really good food and service was good. My only improvement was that it was really dark in the booth and difficult to see the food - a personal preference

column4: 2400 West Coast Highway Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: One of my favorite restaurants, mostly because of it's unique (for OC) cajun/creole menu. Service has improved now with OpenTable. Previously, I could never get a reservation, since my group size was typically 4 or under. Commonly, I would find myself sitting outside shuttering in the cold ocean breeze for 40 minutes for a table or, if lucky, inside the top "bar" area that did not really serve drinks or food. After almost 10 years of loyalty, we were about ready to give up on the place that treated up like red-headed stepchildren when it came to getting a table. I am so glad OpenTable could resolve this one problem we had with the place.

column4: 2391 San Diego Ave San Diego, CA  92110
column13: Food was good but the menu is rather limited. Veal Picata was superb as weee veal parmigiana and eggplant Parm.

We had the breakfast buffet, and I highly recommend the made-to-order waffles and pancakes. The best I'd ever had, and I don't even care for pancakes. The omelette station was very nice, with good and fresh ingredients, and the chef is super sweet. The servers were all very attentive. Definitely good for a special event.

We had the mango salad without the 'faux' ham and the lemongrass tofu.They were both extremely flavorful and delicious.The menus is AMAZING if you love 'faux' meat.And, of course, the people were amazingly kind and attentive.
Wonderful service, views and food. Couldn't be more perfect unless it was free!
Excellen food and service! They were also very accommodating to menu changes. A pleasureable experience and I will return.
This was my first visit and definately not my last. The lamb special was AMAZING!

column4: 2616 W. Colorado Ave. Suite 24 Colorado Springs, CO  80904
column13: We loved the grape leaves and the zucchini appetizer. My Lamb Kabobs were delicious and the wine list was very impressive! (I chose a delightful Greek wine) I will recommend this restaurant to friends!

Everything about this restaurant was fantastic. From the second we walked in until the second we left. The food was amazing with excellent service. As we left that day we were sad to hear from someone in the bar area that Craft was closing at the end of July 2012, I can only hope that this is not true.

column4: 1800 East Palm Canyon Palm Springs, CA  92264
column13: In my opinion the best place in the desert. The food is wildly creative and different. The wine list is unique and expansive. Most food served as tapas so a great way to sample many new dishes. My only criticism is that the concrete floor and high ceilings make for a very loud environment.
La nourriture y est excellente de m_me que le service, mais les portions sont petites. De plus, le spaghetti co_te 25 $, ce qui est un peu cher.
Thank you for making my Mom's birthday special!
I like very much the surprise element to the dishes - different tastes, presentations and colors. I'll go again.
This is one of the premier steak houses in the Northwest. Food is always excellent as is the service. The only complaint is the price.

column4: 8 S. San Marcos Place Chandler, AZ  85225
column13: Excellent pub food and great beer in a fun atmosphere.

This is a very inconsistent restaurant. Ate there a month ago and had a good (not great) meal. Ate there Friday and had a miserable time. First the air conditioning was not turned on eventho it was over 90 degrees outside. Very uncomfortable and not conducive for good dining. Food quality was very mediocre for the price charged. I won't be back.

Food was great. Price to portion was a little on the high end. Unfortunately, they were out of the bottle of wine we selected and instead we had to pay "by-the-glass" prices. Would have liked the waitress to be a little more accomodating when paying the bill.

I've had dinner at DeCarli's many times and always come away satisfied. Salmon dinner was excellent and just the right amount. I was dining with an old friend who I hadn't seen in a few years so we had a relaxing dinner getting caught up and the waiter did not rush us and let us enjoy the evening.

This place has some really unusual and tasty middle eastern dishes you're just not going to find else where. Like the feta and tomato pizza made on a base of falafel rather than dough (just try it - it's delicious).

column1: Buri Tara Thai Cuisine - Redwood City
column13: Excellent presentation and taste. Unfortunately the place was so busy they couldn't keep up and the service was slow. Perhaps they will improve with time.

I say that Japoix has a "vibrant bar scene" only because from what I saw of the restaurant/bar it looked like an okay place to grab a quick drink. I would not recommend Japoix to anyone looking for any food. It is your below-average "bar food".The service was horrible, even on the slow night we were there.
Used to frequent Japon - been going here over 10 years. The service definitely is not the best, but the food is still good.
Very interesting and eclectic menu. There are Argentine items on the menu that are authentic and taste great!
Excellent view and easy acces to the marina for all your water sports needs!best in Tx !

The prosciutto and fig pizza was amazing, as well as the boneless wings ("haute wings" - much nicer to eat at a nicer restaurant than regular wings ) we sat in the pub area because we just wanted a few appetizers. I was slightly disappointed that "two and a half men" was showing on the tv screens.. Not really an appealing show to watch. The balsamic vinegar was delicious and the naughty balsamic martini was a perfect cocktail. Don't expect a to the brim tini though- it is Utah so only 1.5 oz pour and it's $10. Overall, the food was wonderful and I would love to come back to try the prime side of the restaurant. Love the creative twists they put on pub food. It was fantastic!

column4: 1660 W. Lake Houston Pkwy Ste. 105 Kingwood, TX  77345
column13: If you want to just sit and enjoy a quiet riverside evening in greater Houston, this is the place. A shared bottle of wine and some snacks, or a complete meal. Can't beat the view or ambiance. There are a couple of excellent formal restaurants next door, this is my pick for a quiet romantic evening

column4: 1530 Blake Street Unit A Denver, CO  80202
column13: We had a group of 5. Wait staff was knowledgeable and helpful / attentive. Food was good; try the fried pickles! Reasonably priced. Nice atmosphere and not too loud.

We had a terrific Mother's Day Brunch. Three-Course Menu was unique with just enough of a variety for everyone (i.e., kids) to find something they liked. Portions were not too large but not too small either. Wine pairings were a nice touch. Highly recommend The 2nd Floor.
The sea scallops dish was superb, the best I've ever tasted!
Awesome! Our waiter was friendly and excellent communication / customer service skills.

column4: 12252 North May Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73120
column13: For the price, the food was a bit average. The mushroom risotto though was excellent.

We've driven by Jason's hundreds of times and never made a reservation; but a Foodie friend told me it was one of their favorites in Marin! We gave it a try on a Tuesday night, and had a wonderful experience. Excellent food and the wine was 1/2 off that night (bought a better bottle than we normally would). Didn't know they had outdoor dining as an option, but it was a warm night and very quiet outside so we definitely appreciated it. Overall great food and a great experience... and since Monday is 1/2 off lobster, we'll definitely be back!

column4: 6370 N Campbell Ave Ste 160 Tucson, AZ  85718
column13: Excellent local jazz band was playing on the patio the Saturday evening we had dinner here. Food was mediocre--our waiter was fantastic, though. Stay away from the flatbread and try the fish tacos. Beautiful spot for outdoor dining with a spectacular view of the Catalinas.
Service slowed at the end, as it became busier so it was understandable but Vincent our server had three helpers who were lovely.
the food was disappointing and below our expectations, not to mention below the described fare listed on the menu. the high price did not match the level of the food.
Menu didn't reflect what was on line. Very casual ! Expected tablecloths andA much better dinner menu. Out of trout which was theOnly special choice. Service was poor. Overall very disappointing.

column1: Canal Club Wood Grill & Sushi Bar
column13: Service to the table for sushi was slow wven though they appeared well staffed and the crowd was not overwhelming
Excellent food and service; gorgeous view. Only slightly negative note: Not all the tables were filled, and it was still difficult to hear across the table.

The Yankee Pot Roast was the most memorable dish that we tried this evening. We had very good service and the birthday girl was treated special the entire dining experience. We will most definitely come back for another Pot Roast and the Apricot, Blueberry Crisp.

Food was very good, service was adequate. Really appreciated the fact that you could have a conversation w/ tablemates. No need to scream over the music or voices of other diners. That was an unexpected bonus!
The food was very good as was the service. The potions were small, prices were high and the ambiance was a step or two above a nice diner.

column4: 220 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
column13: They had no idea we even had a reservation.

column4: Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino 3770 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Great place! The food is almost as good as the beer selection, Which is phenomenal. Our service was great, Joae took great care of us. We will be back next time we are Las Vegas.

column4: 100 N. Hayford Rd Airway Heights, WA  99001
column13: We went to Masselow's for the first time to celebrate our anniversary. We went early on a Saturday evening and it was not busy yet. We were served attentively and pleasantly. The food was wonderful. We both had the free-range chicken and it was done to perfection. Moist and flavorful and the sauce was yummy! We had Bananas Foster Flambe made tableside and it was delicious and the server was very pleasant. I also enjoyed a triple berry Martini that was very good. Our experience was very positive and we will dine there again.

Very good service. The host and our waiter was very attentive and accommodating.Started with dozen of oysters and lobster bisque-Excellent!Main course was the Thai seared halibut-Amazing!!!!My husband main course was t-bone steak-Excellent!

column4: 2250 Apres Ski Way Suite C315 Steamboat Springs, CO  80487
column13: We celebrated our wedding anniversary and couldn't have been more pleased. The hostess made us feel welcome the minute we walked in and added to the enjoyment by knowing it was our anniversary. Jeannine, our server, was incredible! She too, acknowledged our special day as soon as she came to our table. She did a wonderful job describing the menu and answered any question we had. Everything from the wine to the appetizer to the main course was amazing! It was truly a great experience and my wife and I are already looking forward to our next visit to The Truffle Pig!

column4: 233 East Houston Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Staek was prepared as ordered.Patrick is the Perfect waiter. Everyone should ask for him.
The Room was decorated beautifully. Our lunch was delicious and our service was perfect. Thank you for a very special occasion. Jo Ann Laird (Mrs. Calvin Laird)

This was my 3rd time coming here, and I was taking my nephew for his HS graduation dinner. The other two times the food was great. We had the steamed clams and a tomato, basil and mozzarella bruschetta to start. The bruschetta was good, but the steamed clams were rubbery. My nephew ordered the lasagna special and loved it. I had the salmon, and unfortunately it was over-cooked and a bit dry. For desert I had the lava cake, which I also had the other two times I'd eaten here. The other two times the chocolate oozed out of the cake. This time, it was pretty much cooked all the way through...I don't know if they just had an off night. I really hope so because this is one of my favorate places to eat...I'll still give it another try.
One of our favorite places in the Colorado Springs area!

Loved the Chef's Mercy. I'm sure the regular menu was fantastic as well, but there's something really cool about having the chef design a meal on the spot. Price was very reasonable ($59 for 5 courses, $79 w/ a wine pairing) and they were even able to accommodate the fact that my friend (keeps kosher) and I (pregnant) could and couldn't eat very different things. Would come back just for that menu item.

column4: 2025 Avenue of the Stars Los Angeles, CA  90067
column13: A group of us are staying the Hyatt Regency Century Plaza this week, and I was very excited to try Breeze after seeing that the reviews were not bad. Unfortunately, for this level of restaurant, I__d expect the food to arrive if not hot, at least warm, but not cold (side roasted potatoes that came out were cold, as if it was taken out of the freezer and didn__t get warmed up properly), and didn__t come out the way that my colleagues ordered them. Our server was excellent though, I really wanted Breeze to work, since I made reservations for 4 days in a row, and planned to dine here every night with my colleagues, but after the first try, I cancelled the rest.
Very cool spot. Definitely recommend the tasting menu so you can get a bit of everything. Neil Guillen and everybody else we encountered were spectacular!
Excellent? My favorite restaurant in Denver!
Our first time here- we had friend join us outside on the patio. great meals for all of us-we will be back!
Excellent service and food. Five course menu is a deal.

column4: One Mickey Mantle Dr. Oklahoma City, OK  73104
column13: Food was good and ambiance was fine. Nothing overly impressive. Wine and dessert lists were great. Service was also wonderful. Overall, there are other reataraunts in the metro I would pick over nonna's.

column4: Hilton Austin 500 E 4th St. Austin, TX  78701
column13: The food was great! My boyfriend and I decided to have dinner here while we were visiting Austin for the weekend and I am sure glad we did. Our waitress was wonderful so friendly and very helpful. This is a place I would surely come back to.

column1: LA Prime at The Westin Bonaventure Hotel
column4: 404 S. Figueroa Street Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: Our waiter Alex was outstanding. Food and service excellent
fabulous meal up and down the line. good cocktails, very knowledgeable wait staff.

column4: 123 E. Pikes Peak Colorado Springs, CO  80903
column13: Excellent food and drink. Cost was reasonable. Had a table for 8, all had a great time. Don't miss the bar next door in the hotel. Quiet place for an after dinner drink.

great service and a fabulous birthday celebration! however, i wish there were more options for vegetarians and/or vegan that weren't smothered in cream and cheese. it says vegan entrees available by request, which is fabulous, but if you are in the mood for lighter fare, a smaller meal or on a budget, there aren't enough options for vegetarians and vegans.
Great food. Exceptional service. Very expensive but I guess you pay for Rodeo Drive views and Ferraris driving by. Definitely better food elsewhere but yo gotta eat here for the experience.

column4: 4720 Washington Avenue, Suite B Houston, TX  77007
column13: I had been wanting to go to Max's for some time to try their fried chicken. I finally made it. All 4 of us ordered the same dish - fried chicken. It looked so good on the plate. One bite in - no seasoning on the batter, no seasoning in the meat. It did not appear that the meat was brined. I was so disappointed. I might go back to try their pancakes. They looked and smelled good. The service was fine - not too friendly, but just fine for a late night crowd.

column1: Jer-ne Restaurant + Bar at The Ritz-Carlton
column4: 4375 Admiralty Way Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: Delicious andscenic dining at this harborside venue with attentive and welcoming service.

Ouer experience at Hurley's was mixed. The mussels and calamri left much to be desired but the Sockeye Salmon entree special was quite good. Our server Christin made the naight as we had a blast with her. The aloow you to bring wine with no corkage which is a big benefit.
A bit of a drive to get here but ALWAYS worth it! Great food, lovely ambiance and attentive service.
The service was excellent. I liked the atmosphere. I will be back. Thanks

column1: Bridgewater Grill at The Golden Hotel
column13: Food and service was very good and the setting right along Clear Creek is beautiful.

column1: The Boon Fly Cafe - The Carneros Inn
column13: Wonderful food, especially if you want comfort food. The mac and cheese and truffle fries are amazing! Friendly staff, cool decor, and it's Napa!

column4: 14160 Palawan Way Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: The waiters need a lot of training in how to serve people as opposed to reaching across the table. Waiter serving the wine poured too much in the glass for the taster and requests were long to fulfill.

There were four in our group and three of us ordered the Ancho Chili Smoked Steelhead. Wow, this dish was pronounced the best fish I have ever had by two of our diners and the third loved it as well. The layers of flavor were so spectacular. Not just the fish but also the wonderful potato/corn cake that accompanied this dish. The other diner in our group got a mushroom dish and also loved it.
Ffish taco weak-time between order and food excessive
Ffish taco weak-time between order and food excessive

column4: 2301 Santa Monica Blvd. Santa Monica, CA  90404
column13: Excellent food, great service and the ambiance of an Italian bistro. Highly recommended!
Had a nice dinner before the Angel game. Great food and the server took great care of us!
Outstanding food and wine selection. Gracious but attentive service. Beautiful beachfront ocean view.

column4: 251 N. El Camino Real Suite B Encinitas, CA  92024
column13: The service was very poor throughout our evening. The waiter was inattentive from the beginning, the one cocktail ordered sat at the bar for several minutes - took at least 15 minutes and someone else had to deliver it. The food was served to the wrong person and basically just dropped at the table. I worked in the restaurant business and know you can get busy, but this waiter was inattentive and had poor customer service - it may be he was busy too, but there's a way to work with your customers even when you are busy.

great meal of chicken florentine, mashed potatos, and greenbeans, all very savory and well prepared. excellent attention from the servers.red wine was served at about 75-80 degrees however, and when i complained, the server couldn't replace it with a chilled one. instead she poured my drink into a chilled glass. better, but why not use their basement to keep wine at celler temp???? am i the 1st to notice the warm wine?

There are so many steakhouses in Dallas, that it's been a while since I have been back to Chamberlain's. I had forgotten how good this restaurant is. The service was outstanding as were all the dishes that we ordered, especially given that it was a busy Saturday night.

column4: 5370 Greenwood Plaza Blvd Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: Restaurant was a bit tough to find - signage could be improved. Service and food quite good. Just an awkward location.

column4: 5844 W Manchester Ave Los Angeles, CA  90045-4419
column13: It was very good, we like the food a lot I asked them to make one extra than I can take home. I am so pleased & same my friends.

column4: 502 Santa Monica Blvd. Santa Monica, CA  90401
column13: We always love Jiraffe with the glass walls that open to the vibrant Santa Monica scene. We loved the seared Ahi app with the various accompaniments. The roasted halibut with mussels was tasty and the Farmer's market ravioli were delicious. Of course the signature chocolate truffle cake was wonderful. We went for dineLA week and give the experience a 10 - 11 out of 10.

I recommend Sazon for those who want a first taste of Peruvian-inspired food (it's not the classic, traditional style) and have time to relax and savor. I scheduled a dinner for 10, knowing that the restaurant is quite small and was prepared for it to be an adventure.Indeed, the service was entertaining, but erratici - some of the appetizers we ordered never appeared, others were inexplicably multiplied. The mango shrimp ceviche was outstanding, but all the starters were a hit. The entrees were less evenly successful. The seafood stew (billed as paella) was overly salted and lacking in other distinctive flavors. In general, this venue seems like an experiment with lots of potential and room to improve. I

Moody's is our "go to" place in Truckee. We average once or twice a month. Casual, excellent food and good wine list. If anything the food has improved over the last several months. Would recommend to anyone who finds themselves in Truckee and in need of a meal.

Food was very good and reasonably priced. Waiter however made repeated errors on the bill initially giving us someone elses, then not subtracting a gift certificate etc. We were in a rush to leave and it was delayed.
The entree was wonderful, as usual. However, the lump of plain white rice on the plate added nothing to the dinner.

Jake's Grill has good food, but it's not worth the prices. Jake's Seafood is much better. There also seems to be items that are not on the menu, like a kid's menu and appetizers for parties. Our waiter suggested we get a larger appetizer, but didn't tell us the price (about $60). If you want a steak or nice dinner, there are better places, even within the McCormick & Schmitt's family. Been there for happy hour before, much better for that.

column1: 9545 Restaurant at Inn at lost Creek
column13: Off season menu was quite small and misrepresented on their website.

column4: 544 South Grand Avenue Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: Good, but way over-priced. Get the shellfish platter app an get out of there.
Without a doubt these simply prepared lamb chops are the best I have ever had..........they are always consistent! Ambiance is wonderful. A mainstay of our visits to San Francisco!

This was our first time to eat at The Articoke and it was over the top good and worth every bit of the hour drive to this place. The salads were so fresh, the portions were plentiful...we didn't leave hungry, that's for sure. The cheese stuff mushrooms were so flavorful...you could easily get addicted to these. We will definitely drive the extra miles to eat here again.
Great food and service for an old style steak house. A bit on the pricey side but OK with the $50 coupon and for a change.
Great experience! Food was delicious, drinks creative, service top notch, and the scene energetic. Will definitely return.

Terrible service. First time for 2 foodies used to traveling into PDX for great dinners. Only one other couple at 6:00 on a Thursday, waiter took our order and never visited us voluntarily again, even after dropping off steak (ordered medium rare, was almost raw in middle). Had to flag down to get steak recooked and again to request desert menu (waiter never returned to ask if we wanted desert or another cocktail)again to request salt. Food here is well prepared but pricely so I expect to be waited on and this was a dissappointmen; we will not return

column1: J. McKinney's at the Hotel Fredonia
column13: The wine was wonderful, new menu items devine, we will be back each month for Wine and Dine.

column4: Vail Mountain, Game Creek Bowl Vail, CO  81658
column13: Simply one of the great restaurants anywhere. Creativity is stupendous. We always arrive early for a cocktail on the deck. Service is perfectly understated yet highly attentive.
Food was incredible and at a great price. Fantastic wine list. Chef Tim Fitzgeralds wine recommendations were wonderful. Can't wait to return!!

The food was excellent. To of us had lobsters which were perfectly cooked. one of us had ruby trout(Great) and the other had sea bass(well cooked).All in all a lovely dinner. We live in Green Valley, so the food had to be cooked forus to travel about 25 miles.

column4: 4500 West Tropicana Avenue Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: My guest and I both had Osso Bucco and it was delicious. Our waitress was very friendly and seemed to know the wine list by heart! We will definitely return.

column4: 7200 E Greenlake Dr. N Seattle, WA  98115
column13: We felt truly welcomed when we entered the restaurant. The guy who welcomed us was also our server, and he was equally good at that role. The tomato basil soup was the best I've ever had. I'd love to get the recipe. The hamburger sliders were very good--so filling that I took one and a half of the three home. I want to go back and get one of the great sounding desserts--maybe just for dessert and coffee.
I was a bit skeptical at first but the food turned me around! Fabulous fish dishes. Try to get a table near the window. Service wasattentive and friendly.
Had a great meal. I think people sometimes forget that Luce provides a great dining experience. If you haven't tried it in a while, you should go again.

column4: 1 North Kaniku Drive Kohala Coast, HI  96743
column13: I have had the great fortune of eating at many nice restaurants on islands in the Caribbean and Hawaii, and without a doubt, I feel Brown's ambience and view is as good as it gets. We recently celebrated my wife's 50th birthday and were treated to a table at the edge of the lanai closest to the ocean, to a very kind and attentive waitress and to an excellent meal. Along with the Beach Tree at the Four Seasons, I think Brown's is in the elite class of places to enjoy a special occasion dinner. Get a reservation time prior to sunset, order a nice bottle of wine and enjoy a great evening.

column4: 3300 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Great place to go for a 21 st birthday party.

This place has history. Founded in 1958 by the current owner's parents, they felt that Sutter had found gold in California, and they would too with this restaurant A perennial San Fernando Valley landmark, they did land office business from local fans for generations. Then the son moved the business up to Simi Valley.The Valley's loss is our gain.They are old school in every sense of the word. That means the menu is filled with comfort food you'd expect at mom & dad's steakhouse. Having said that, know their suppliers are the absolute best. The beef, the vegetables, everything starts with great ingredients. The chefs have stayed loyal to lessons learned over seven decades.

column4: 651 E Blithedale Ave Mill Valley, CA  94941
column13: The food here is decent American-Mexican. Their self-described 'spicy' beans option aren't spicy at all. So if you want spicy, you'll have to add it yourself! We were there on a Saturday night and it was packed -- and quite noisy, with several large parties. But the price is certainly right and the margaritas are great!

column4: 190 E. Stacy Rd Ste 1000 Allen, TX  75002
column13: The food was pretty good but the service horrible.
Food was outstanding and at a very dood price. Everything was fresh and had wonderful flavor. This is a great find!

column1: Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak & Stone Crab - LV
column4: 3500 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The menu is great for sea food lovers and you can't deny the quality of the crab, lobster and oysters. Unfortunately despite reserving a table for 8.30 we were hurried through our chosen courses within an hour, the service was extremely forced and our waiter although attentive, his small talk was not sincere and he failed to explain the menu to us even though we advised that it was our first time at the restaurant, we overheard other waiters going in to great detail to assist other diners. Great food but sadly the service was very poor and hasn't created a great first impression Joes.

column4: 196 South Indian Canyon Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: our waitress was very good and energetic however she constantly interrupted our conversation rather than approach the table and wait for us to end the sentence we were on. She was more mature so I expected that she would have know the proper way to approach a table. Otherwise the evening was very nice and we did not let her bother us although by about the fourth time my guest was getting irritated.

column4: 3551 North Escala Court Park City, UT  84098
column13: Went for the "Pig Roast" Buffet dinner. It was awful! The pig was cold, the person serving it did not know how to cut it, so he sort of "scraped/shredded" the meat, the sides were inedible, IE: the corn on the cob was old, frozen dried out, no BBQ sauce until we asked, the only bread available were cold hotdog/hamberger buns, hambergers/hotdogs were pre-cooked and sitting in a dish-cold, cole slaw tasted like it had come from an industrial kitchem, pickles were situated right by the dessert, sheet cake and pickle juice had dripped all over the cake (poor food arranging). There was nothing attractive about the food, so after talking with the manager, we left.

column4: 8687 North Central Expressway Suite 2000 Dallas, TX  75225
column13: There were 4 of us today for a lunch meeting. I'd been there before, but it was late afternoon or evening. A bit loud for a lunch meeting, but the food is worth it! Great salads and our server was unintrusive, which was very good with our meeting going on. I'll keep going and tell my friends as well!

column4: Waldorf Astoria Laquinta Resort & Spa 49-499 Eisenhower Drive La Quinta, CA  92253
column13: Wonderful musician, Paul Douglas, at the piano bar!

The hand made pizza is still the best deal. The humus was a little dry this time, so they had to redo it, but still wasn't as good as last time - must be the variation in the chefs. Still this is a great spot and their private dining room is also a great place for a large family or gathering with friends.

Awesome food, goat cheese cheese-cake is a must appetizer. Happy hour with $6 wines, 2 for 1 apps, quiet restaurant, choice of sitting, and excellent service is the value way to go. Definately a new favorite.

column4: 4404 W William Cannon Dr., Ste L Austin, TX  78749
column13: Great food. Delicious catfish dish and chocolate pecan pie.

Excellent food and service made our brunch experience a wonderful one. It was nice being at a restaurant where the noise level wasn't so loud. I would recommend to anyone who is looking for a nice place for brunch.
pasta was thick and rather boring in taste. al dente? nope, unknown. maybe we just had a bad day ... i will give them another chance, but not with company guests!

column4: 3900 Paradise Rd, Suite A Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Excellent tapas, sangria and ambience. Firefly is an great spot for couples and large groups. Plates are infer 10$ and the sangria and mojitos are wonderful! It is located off-strip about a mile from Bally's. We were there with another couple. Check was about 125$ for the table. The Ambience will remind you of the great Cuban cafes of Miami or Tampa. Bottom line - the tapas and sangria were as good as those I enjoyed in Barcelona. 'Nuff said.

Although this place has been a neighborhood favorite for years, my last experience here made me feel like I will wait a while before coming back. My halibut, typically perfectly cooked, arrived overcooked. The service was very slow, even in bringing the check out.
Could not taste any alcohol in my martini at this "martini bar". Food quite expensive per person for Cheyenne, $30/person during happy hour.
My pork sandwich was very tender and extremely tasty. I cleaned my plate. The sweet potatoe fries were excellent, but there weren't very many of them.
Always been a great experience at the rok! Make sure that you ask the waiter for wild food menu! kangaroo meat roks!

I was impressed when I got a call back to confirm our reservations-a birthday celebration-and to make sure we were seated where we wanted to sit. In our converstion we discussed seating options and finally determined that a booth was best and available. I confirmed my birthday and was very impressed with the whole, "we are here to make you happy," thing. I even told my husband how impressed I was. When we got there, we were NOT seated in a booth as we had determined earlier on the phone, AND the dessert plate said, "happy anniversary!" Really?! I am stunned that after all that, the seating and the dessert were messed up. All that time on perfection and still getting it wrong. A 1st in all my 53 years-specially after confirming!
Food was delicious and very well prepared. Service was excellent, attentive without hovering. Warm and engaging environment.

column4: 8960 University Center Lane San Diego, CA  92122
column13: I've been going here for 25 years. It's always been fantastic.

Although we've been here a few times, and the food and service are always very good, this recent visit was a surprise in terms of the number of families and children. As a result, it was a bit noisier than we prefer.
We were suprized with veru fine dinning experience with teasonable price. Service was also excellent !

The food was good but nothing outstanding. The pumpkin ravioli didn't have a good flavor. We expected to be a little sweet, but instead it was kinda bland. My side salad was wilted. What also made this experience less than desirable was that we dined there when the temperature outside was about 100 degrees. We decided to sit inside because we thought it would be cooler but we were wrong. There is no A/C and no fans to help cool you down. It was a miserable evening.

column4: 2151 Avenue of the Stars Los Angeles, CA  90067
column13: Great for dinner. Delicious food!
Tapas restaurant with your not-so-typical tapas dishes. The menu was extremely creative and all four items ordered were unique and amazing. I'd need to go there again to try the rest.

Lovely meal, we liked it better than the Kauai Grill, also in the St. Regis. Both are priced similarly and the food is much the same - excellent focus on local ingredients. However, unlike Kauai Grill, most tables at Makana are on the covered terrace and take advantage of the view. Atmosphere is relaxed but dinner service is excellent with a mostly older and experienced waitstaff.

column4: 222 N. Tejon St Colorado Springs, CO  80903
column13: Good Mexican and Tex-Mex food at reasonable prices. The place is often packed and there is usually a wait---another reason to make a reservation with Open Table. We walked through the waiting crowd and got seated immediately. Definitely will return on my next visits to ColoSprings.

column4: 5710 S Carefree Circle Colorado Springs, CO  80917
column13: As always, very enjoyable. Drinks were great and we love the green chile! Even saved room for desert. Overall great experience.
Excellent staff and food was great!!!
Tusca was bad! From the Internet it looked appealing. Friday nights option were depressing so I ate at the oc bar. I even made reservations at opentable!

column4: 545 West 700 South Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: The food was wonderful and innovative. Loved it and great service.

column4: Bellagio Hotel & Casino 3600 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Had the tasting menu. It was excellent. Taste and portion size were perfect
Food was amazing. Service the best. Highly recommend.
We loved our experience at Pietro's and will return!

column4: 20 Waterway Ave., Ste 105 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Emjoyed service, food and music. So fortunate weather allowed us outside which was special treat.
Bit disappointing, expected better atmosphere and seating for group of 8. Service good, food OK, needed more choices in menu. Parking a hassle
Not crazy about the changes. Paper over the table cloths, concrete floors in entryway (is this just a transition?), entry straight into bar area.
Good casual Thai cuisine, good service, very reasonable price for quality food

column1: Sky Room at La Valencia Hotel
column13: The knowledge and personality of the staff made the entire experience a lot of fun, and the food was fantastic!
Delighted to know about Royal Sixty. Fun atmosphere - good food, but service was slow and uncertain. Almost awkward. They weren't crowded, either.

Food was fabulous, especially the appetizers and the desserts. Not inexpensive, but the portions are ample, so sharing works well for getting lots of delicious tastes.My favorite appetizer: the padrone peppers. Favorite dessert: the incredibly delicious chocolate cake.

This was my second visit to Hodson's in a week's time. It was so good the first time that I created an opportunity to return quickly. They have a great wine list, but also fun, unusual drinks--even a jalapeo margarita that tempted my husband away from his usual glass of wine. The food is eclectic and delicious and their patio in the summer simply can't be beat if you're a flower fan!

column4: Waterfront Hilton 21100 Pacific Coast Highway Huntington Beach, CA  92648
column13: really pretty place and very helpful hotel staff; entrees all very good but the award-winning crab cakes were only average

The best tortillas I have ever tasted! Excellent range of menu items and great atmosphere for TEX MEX dining. I drive 60 miles round trip once a week for their "India"(large fried flower tortilla topped with beans,cheese,shrimp, chicken or beef fajita meat, lettuce, and pico) corn tortilla's and spicy carrots.

This is a great restaurant with a big interesting menu, lots of friendly counter seats, delicious food, and a friendly neighborhood feel. Will definitely return when I'm on the Peninsula and will recommend to others.

The food was just okay but overpriced. The service is extremely slow. We went on a Thursday. There was only one other couple when we arrived. We sat for about 10 minutes until we were finally able to flag someone to take our drink order.

column4: 3555 Las Vegas Boulevard South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Way too loud and the food was mediocre at best. We were there in the afternoon and seated outside. If you don't mind yelling when having a conversation, this is place for you.

Over priced with tiny portions. I ordered the 'rack of lamb'. It was over spiced and cut into four tiny lamb lollipops that I could have consumed in a single bite. The lamb was over cooked, likely because it was cut so thin that the 'chef' couldn't get it off the heat fast enough. On the side was four thin potato sliced that were under cooked and tasteless. The lamb was priced at $30.

A unique and wonderful program. The students do all of the jobs and it is a delight to be there as they learn. It is not for everyone. It is a culinary school. No fuss budgets should come. The stuents are learning and there are some small errors. The food cannot be beat. It is a favorite of mine.
This was our first time this restaurant and it was wonderful food and the service was excellent. We will definitely go there again.

column1: Garden Terrace at the Hotel Jerome
column13: We actually enjoyed our dinner at the Hotel Jerome, but when we stopped back by the Bar after a show that night, the bartender was such a complete ditz, she spilled hot water all over my arm, and didn't even notice. We'll not give them a good review for that reason and would recommend against anyone visiting this place.
This place has great food and wonderful service. My girlfriend and I thought is was very romantic and quite and the atmosphere was great!
Local, fresh, innovative, delicious. Wish more chef's would cook like this.

While the noise from the bar area was a little more than I would have liked, the jazz guitar still carried through without being overbearing. The food was great, the waiter very attentive, and the menu was difficult to narrow to a single choice. We are not wine snobs, but found the list to be more than adequate. Winewood is a little more expensive than a regular stop for us, but is a top runner for special occasions.
Our food was excellent (fresh and well presented) and the service was wonderful.

column1: Kai - Sheraton Wild Horse Pass Resort
column4: 5594 W. Wildhorse Pass Blvd Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: Lovely dinning experience. Food and service were over the top good. There were even 2 bottles of water and some chocolates in our car when we left!

The food and wine we had were very good. Although they had just run out of the special, so that was a disappointment. The server we had was friendly, but not very attentive. We ended what was an excellent meal, waiting having to have the server found just to get our bill.

column4: 1279 S. Kihei Rd. Ste. B -201 Kihei, HI  96753
column13: Great food, great service. Comfortable setting.
Thank you K&L fot the best tuna tartar ever. This a great place for luncch or dinner.

column4: 7862 Warner Avenue, Suite 109 Huntington Beach, CA  92647
column13: Awesome food, the best service EVER, and great atmosphere.

column1: Kai Sushi Bistro - Ritz Carlton Kapalua
column13: Great quality food.. a bit pricey it's the Ritz so I was expecting it. They were very willing to make specialty rolls since what i eat wasn't on the menu. Very good staff and food!! Wish the restaurant was open everyday of the week, we would have eaten here more during our trip
Such a lovely place. Family and love show through in all aspects of the dining experience. Food is delicious!!

We LOVE this place! The fish is fresh (recommend the Wild Hamachi!!), the sake is super tasty (especially love the Hou Hou Shu Bubbly Sake), the only downside would be the bill (a little on the steep side).

column1: Sante at the Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn
column13: Outstanding food. Preparation of each dish was special, deserving of the praise we've heard for years. So glad our travels took us there to enjoy it. Morgan and Kawiki (sp?) are a great serving team. Wine list is impressive and well represented by the sommelier.
The food was actually very good. However, the dishes we ordered were very salty. I would go back and try it again and ask that they use less salt. Otherwise, I nice experience.

Enjoyable experience from start to finish. We both had the delicious salmon as main course. Huge dessert was perfect for sharing. Dining area is a bit cozy, but perfectly fine once you get accustomed to it. There appeared to be only one server on the Tuesday we dined, and there was a bit of a wait between the time we were seated and the time she came to our table, but service was perfectly fine after that. Disappointed that our bottle of white wine was simply placed on the table and not in a wine bucket to keep chilled during the meal on a very warm day.

column1: Katia's Russian Tea Room and Restaurant
column13: This is a store-front restaurant and except for the vase of flowers on each table it has no personality. Katia looked out from the kitchen a few times but did not come into the dining room. The gentleman who DOES IT ALL in the front of the house appeared to be completely overwhelmed. The three of us were the only ones there for about an hour, and when a few more people did come in we were concerned that he might LOSE IT completely. The food is all right, but we have had better elsewhere; however the desserts are good. The restaurant has been there for a long time so obviously others don't agree with me, and I am sure they work hard and I wish them well, but we will not be returning.
unique seafood orders to complement your traditional favorites. good service but load your wallet

Had a reservation for dinner. Showed up to the restaurant and waited for several minutes for someone to come seat us. Not a big deal, but odd since there were no customers. After being seated our waitress came over. She didn't introduce herself or even say hi, just asked us if we wanted something to drink. Her demeanor was that of complete indifference, as if she could care less if we were there or not, of which I'm sure she would prefer the latter. The food was mediocre and overpriced. If you want Japanese, go to Toranoko in Little Tokyo. The food is the same price (maybe a little less), but far, far superior, and they actually act like they want your business.
Not as elegant as the one in Brentwood.

Katsuya is very expensive; for the prices I would rather go to Uchi's for the uniqueness and better service. Food was good not great, drinks are expensive $14 but the most disturbing part of the bill was the charge of $16 for water-really? We were asked if we wanted flat or sparkling water - I said flat thinking it would be tap. If we are going to be charged that much for water I feel the waiter should have said it is artisian or Fuji water that is $8 per bottle. The water was put in a glass carafe in an ice bucket. I thought they were keeping the water cold since it is an expensive restaurant. Sadly I won't return as I feel like I was taken advantage and would prefer to give my money to other upscale sushi restaurants such as Uchi.

column4: 858 South Coast Highway Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: Dissapointed to find that happy hour and kids night destroyed a night of fine dining. It also did not help to have waitstaff in training. We felt like we were being practiced on.

column4: 800 W. Olympic Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90015
