column13: When we got there at 5:30PM, the service was very quick and foods came fast but as it time passes by, our second and thrid drinks and foods took much too long!

An uber-hip restaurant, Katsuya is a Nobu knockoff that reminds us of how good Nobu was in the early days. Can't beat the creative cocktails and seafood preparations. The only problems with the restaurant are the noise level (high) and the pace of service (all the dishes came at once). It's also a pretty hip crowd so oldsters (like us) may feel a little uncomfortable.

column4: 23501 Cinco Ranch Blvd. Suite Q100 Katy, TX  77494
column13: The 4 for 4 was a great offer. It showcases one of the finest restaurants in out area that which we were unaware.

Merrimans has a downstairs cafe and an upscale restaurant upstairs. I dined at the upstairs Merrimans for my birthday on 7/22 and the food was excellent. Lobster Poke with avocado, orange segments and a little jalapeno is my fave appetizer. Also, don't miss the foccacia with goat cheese and daily homemade jam - it was papaya, guava, strawberry that night I went. Also had an excellent melt in your mouth filet and banana lumpia for desert. Awesomeness!! The service could of been better but it was very busy so I understood. Did I mention the drinks! Best Lemondrop I've ever had!! YUM YUM YUM

Had not been to the Iron Gate in years. My wife and I went there for my birthday. A visit to the restaurant is like going back in time. Waiters in suits, some dishes prepared at your table. Excellent food, service & atmosphere. Great "Special Occasion" restaurant.

column4: Kawaihae hbr lower level Kawaihae, HI  96743
column13: Great food, great service...simply put, a great find.Wish we had this restaurant on Oahu.Will definitely go back whenever we find ourselves on the Big Island.
Great lunch selection. Was able to obtain the small private room for a special business lunch. Service was great and staff attentive.
Went for the Saturday Steak & Seafood buffet; unspectactular food, but if you're a big eater (which I'm not), then $38pp is a very good deal.

column4: 2865 NW Town Center Loop Beaverton, OR  97006
column13: This location is best for meeting family from multiple locations. The whole dining experience is great.

column4: 325 Sharon Park Drive, Suite A2 Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Food was fresh and a couple of the items were good but the rest was bland and the portions were miniature. We arrived at the tail end of the lunch hour so that the kitchen was closed by the time we finished our order and realized, $100 later (with only one sake sampler between the two of us), that we were still hungry, despite the fact that we are not big eaters. We actually made a second stop thereafter to have another bite.
Ok food. Drink prices were outrageous. Pretty dissapointing.

Really great food and a great experience all round. however we did notice them squeezing groups of 6 into booths that are probably better for 4 people. we were a foursome on a table and it was perfect.

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - Los Angeles
column13: We had a great time! The food was surprisingly good and the service was even better. The blues band added great ambience during dinner. I can't wait to go back!

Who would have ever thought that Brussels sprouts could be delicious? Our server, Ray (he was excellent!), talked us into ordering them (appetizer) and we asked for the recipe -- they were that good! Both pasta entrees were delicious as was the Tiramisu dessert. And we like the flexibility of customizing 3 oz flights of wine to go with the meal. An overall fabulous experience.
The Coach House is consistently wonderful. Great service, friendly staff, excellent selections and very nice presentations. I love every thing I have ever ordered.

The petite was Filet Mignon was very petite. I ordered it med-rare and it came out well done. They took it back and made a new one but it tasted like charcoal. We also ordered buffalo wings and they came deep fried with dipping sauce on the side. These are not buffalo wings and they should let you know they are going to deep fry them.

column1: Kendall's Brasserie at the LA Music Center
column4: 135 N. Grand Ave. Los Angeles, CA  90012
column13: Always great! The staff is amazing and attentive.

column4: 78-6831 Ali'i Dr., Ste D-125 Kailua-Kona, HI  96740
column13: Kenichi is my favorite sushi restaurant on the Big Island. The food is fresh and the service is great. I recommend the steamed vegetables as a pupu.
Our experience was outstanding. We were celebrating our 28th wedding anniversary and couldn't have been more delighted with our evening.
Excellent service and wonderful menu... the desserts (yes, we had more then one) was to die for..

Expected better food frankly. The butternut squash ravioli were really good though the sauce very sweet. The waiter warned me but I liked it. However, the sweetness is definitely not for everyone. Fried calamari were excellent. On the downside, the artisan pizza was a disappointment. Felt like a simple flat bread with uncooked arugula. No sauce. Had to return it as it just did not have much taste. The tiramisu was way to moist.

column4: 115 East Reno Ave Suite B Oklahoma City, OK  73104
column13: The food was great but our group was disappointed at the special menu for the Thunder game - it was so limited, there were only 3 entree choices. Overall, it was great though. Will definitely go back.

Although hotel restaurants are sometimes hit-or-miss proposition, this one is a hit. Its simple, sleek interior matches the menu approach, nothing too elaborate or pretentious. However, the flatbread specials (which vary daily) are some of the best in town. Excellent pasta dishes as well.
our server Eli was the highlight of this restaurant - I would never return
The service is the best thing about this place. Their staff remains great even in these times, when customer service is not a priority ANYWHERE anymore.

This year we had lunch, the year before we had breakfast. We were disappointed both times and my husband and I decided we will not return there to eat in our lifetime. the service is mediocre; the food just okay. And when the dinning room is that empty as it was for lunch we should have gotten the best table with a view and we didn't instead we were stuck in the middle of the dinning room. As I said very disappointing...

column1: Blue Stove at Nordstrom Thousand Oaks
column4: 346 W. Hillcrest Dr. Thousand Oaks, CA  91360
column13: Decided to stop into Blue Stove for a quick lunch while doing several hours of Early Access Shopping. Found the menu to be a Limited, but interesting tapas one. The olive oil with a few small olives which was brought to the table with a small plate of bread was delicious. Enjoyed the chicken tacos which a Nordstrom sales person had recommended. Despite the restaurant not being very full, the service was somewhat inattentive and I had to seek out server's attention.

Service was spot on, never felt rushed or ignored, all the staff was very attentive without being overbord. Food was terrific, filet was one of the best ever. Perfectly cook and seasoned - was delicious!

Wow, I wasn't even aware of this, but it is the antithesis of aggressively loud SF restaurant. I really enjoyed a romantic dinner for two, and could actually have a nice discussion with my partner. Love the decor..it's a very dark room with splashes of color, with very thoughtful lighting. And the sushi is inventive and delicious. A real find, and I will be going back soon.

column4: 440 J Street, Suite #108 San Diego, CA  92101
column13: Overall food was good. Just needed something more. Maybe like a stir fried udon with black pepper beef/filet mignon. Although food was good it lacked in so many ways.

The food was good and there was nothing to complain about the service. The waiter was very attentive, and the sushi chefs were very nice since we sat at the sushi bar. If you see a review here from a lady complaining about not getting her custom-made scallop roll or whatever, ignore it. She kept asking for a roll that didn't exist on the menu, then wasn't willing to pay the cost of the custom roll (scallops are expensive!). The waiters and chefs were very apologetic, and I commend them for maintaining their composure and professionalism, since she threw a giant fit over one sushi roll. Now we know why she was dining alone . . . Anyways, all in all, it has a great atmosphere (especially since you get to dine in the basement).
Still one of the best restaurants in Vail.

column4: 12000 Big Cottonwood Canyon Road Solitude, UT  84121
column13: We went for a summer brunch based on a friend's recommendation. The service was welcoming, friendly, and unobtrusive, the food was delicious, and the view was spectacular. We lingered for almost two hours and there was only one or two other tables filled at any time (maybe not best for business, but it was nice to have a quiet, peaceful meal). The rain and weather had us eating inside, but I look forward to coming back and dining around the fire pits outside.
Really enjoyed the delicious food and excellent service in such an accessible place!
Food was very good but they don't have a full bar only beer and wine.
The food was great as usual, and the staff was friendly. But without AC even on a hot summer night, it was the only drawback.
I was there celebrating my birthday with friends and family. The food was OUTSTANDING! plan on going back really soon.
Anthony's is always excellent. It's the perfect place to take friends and guests for perfect seafood.

column1: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Kirkland
column13: Great Salad and fish entrees! Always enjoy coming back here. Their daily special menus are always changing and is just fantastic.
I've been dining here since it was "Klinken Dagger Pittstaff and Pits". It's outstanding! Don't forget to order the pea salary - it's wonderful.

column4: 1540 Camino Del Mar Del Mar, CA  92014
column13: Excellent service with good menu. Our combined opinion is that we like the previous menu better.
Excellent choices for reasonable prices for lunch. Quick and quality service. Thank you.

As always my most recent dinner was beyond compare. The ability to share exceptionally delightfully prepared and presented dishes and enjoy a conversation in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere though right downtown is exceptional in this loud, abrasive city today. Thank you for being here and please keep up the good work. Your new chef is delightful and very talented I would say.

column4: Mirage Hotel & Casino 3400 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The pasta tatsted like rubber and the bacon was hard to chew. and the sauce for the bread was to hard to eat. the menu was not in englsih so I had no real idea what i was ordering.

column4: 300 E. Wigwam Boulevard Litchfield Park, AZ  85340
column13: A hidden gem alerted to us by another restaurant manager when we asked where he would go for a great steak. He was right. My wifes filet was outstanding and my pan seared halibut was great. Although we ate a little early ; around 6:30, the staff was on their game. From the hosts to the chefs and wait staff everyone was very friendly and courteous.at almost 100 years old this resoprt has it all not only a great restaurant.

column4: 3377 Las Vegas Blvd. Suite 2440 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: We were recommended to Canaletto because we were going to the Phantom. The waiter was hard to understand, and not seeming Italian in a charming way. My fiancee ordered the duck special, and was informed some time later that they had sold out. He reordered, and when our entrees came we had a tenderloin and a sea bass....on the exact same garnish. Approximately 16 oz of sauteed spinach under both cuts. I usually expect a little more creativity.

column4: 3600 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The food and service was fabulous! First class service!

column1: Ko at The Fairmont Kea Lani
column13: I took my wife out for a birthday dinner and thought to try Ko based on a friends recommendation. From the reservation online to all of the service at tHe resturant everything was exceptionally well managed. We both had the Lobster tempura was devine. Our waiter was knowledgable and friendly and wasn't afraid to make recommendations when asked for an opinion between dishes.

column1: Kobe Japanese Steak House, Teppan & Sushi
column4: 3001 Old Ranch Pkwy Seal Beach, CA  90740
column13: We had never eaten at Kobe Japanese Steak House before, but we will again! We really enjoyed the food, the teppan grill and chef was very entertaining and the service was great!

Fresh, delicious sushi in Santa Fe. We were looking for a nice light dinner before a concert. This was perfect. And a special treat as well...it was my husband's birthday, which I had noted on the reservation. I had hoped for a special table, which we were given, but the hostess and waitress also brought out a nice dessert with a candle, and did their very best "Happy Birthday from San Q".

Grilled octopus was great...flavors you can't get through any other preparation. Quail was excellent, nicely seasoned and very moist with the wrapping of the grape leaves. And they do great Turkish--oops, Greek--kahve!!

While not even the priciest restaurant at the Four Seasons Hualalai, eating at this restaurant isn't cheap. If one can get past the sticker shock (which is a necessity I believe in Hawaii), this restaurant is a special treat. The dining space is spacious and comfortable with a relaxed feel. Take a few minutes to find the time of the sunset and book your reservation 45to 60 minutes in advance and you will be treated to an incredible view, one of the two most beautiful spots on the island, in my opinion. For our recent dinner, we celebrated a special occasion and the staff and waitress were simply fantastic; highly attentive and never pushy. The menu is great and our dinner was thoroughly enjoyable. This is a special place.

column1: Bite Me Fish Market Bar & Grill
column13: Found it well overrated. Limited fish selection for a supposed local favorite for fish, and what they did have was prepared poorly. Poor service also - waitress seemed put out by our presence. Not worth it at all!

Koto has not disappointed yet. Three visits and counting, with a different excellent teppanyaki chef each time. A great value for excellent food. Our dining companions all agreed. The filet mignon and fried rice are my personal favorites. I feel lucky to live near this restaurant, but would drive a distance get there if I had to.

Our first time to a Moroccan restaurant. The waiter was very friendly and helpful explaining the dishes and making recommendations. The food was all delicious. The chicken tagine was just melt in your mouth delicious as was the lamb shank. We will be going back.

column4: 8140 Haven Ave Suite 101 Rancho Cucamonga, CA  91730
column13: One of the top Indian restaurants in the Inland Empire.......you will not be disappointed.
The melting pot was delicious. The chocolate fondue was especially amazing.

The energy in the restaurant was great if you want a casual but nice open feel. I was visiting fa. in Tucson and my 23 yr old nephew took us there. It is a young adult to parent feel, probably because it was close to the U of A and there semester soon to start; parents were dining wtih there college bound kids. I don't know what it is like when the University is closed, or once school is in full swing, but I can imagine it is happening for college dates.It made me feel young...I'm 51.It was fun!!

The wine list was excellent and very reasonable priced. The presentation of the food was lovely and everything was delicious. Our waiter was very attentive. We would definitely go back and recommend Kris Bistro.

column4: 100 W San Carlos St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Service was outstanding, waiter checked up on our table when needed. Food was very tasty! Beautiful restaurant inside the hotel.

love the ambience of this place, best outdoor comfortable but refined dining. Returned for my favorite lobster tacos and to share place w friends, but overall feel less accomodating this time. bartender was rude when asked for a margarita without sweet and sour, and snuck in sweet and sour anyway. Waiter helpful with menu suggestions, but overall service slow- drink refills, not offering to refill chips, not offering sides etc. first time dining outside which was beautiful, but not the level of service we are used to receiving inside at la hacienda, and it seemed adequately staffed. medium guacamole prepared table side was bland, lobster tacos as an entree needed a side dish. no longer my go to place, my friends wished we went to Rokery
Our meal at Brasserie was fabulous, the trout, the gratin potatoes, oh my! Everything was delicioius!

column4: 6272 E Pacific Coast Highway Long Beach, CA  90803
column13: Great spot to meet friends. Food & service are good though the noise level is a lot higher than "energetic". Great views!

column4: 6714 N. Western Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: West's menu is very interesting and always tasty. The waitstaff was accommodating and friendly, but not intrusive. The clientele is quite diverse. One sees families, couples, young adults and older couples, a healthy bar population--something for everyone without severe overlap in activities. If you want a quiet conversation, do ask, in advance, for a quiet booth and they will accommodate you.

column4: 401 East Amado Road Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: The noise from the casino is very annoying. Poor planning in design. This is a very expensive steak house and the ambience is destroyed by the constant noise of slot machines. Overall the food was very good but certainly not worthy of the very steep price. This is my 3rd visit and will be my last.

I love their menu approach. You can pick the protein source of your choice (chicken, topfu, pork, prawns, etc) and the presentatino of your choice (noodle soup, stir-fry noodles, cashew in brown sauce, etc).

column1: Capri Restaurant at Miracle Springs Resort & Spa
column4: 10625 Palm Drive Desert Hot Springs, CA  92240
column13: Terrific beef - love the food. Prices including drinks are very reasonable. Worth the drive to Desert Hot Springs.
Good for happy hour in the bar. Restaurant itself was pretty boring.

column4: 12222 New York Ranch Rd Jackson, CA  95642
column13: The food at the Lone Wolf was excellent. A couple of problems that we had was that the waitress did not advise of the size portion of one of our appetizers. It could very easily feed four persons. Also, when we asked for boxes to take the excess home she just brought out the boxes and set them on the table leaving us, the diners, to box them up. The four of us that dined together were dressed "business casual", unfortunately few of the other patrons were. Most were wearing shorts and t-shirts, tank tops or the like. A dress code should be recommended. Even the wait staff were wearing Levi style pants.

This restaurant was very good with a menu full of tasty-sounding dishes. I had the seafood alfredo, and where other restaurants skimp on more expensive meats like crab, my dish at the Adobe had lots of sweet, delicious crab. The service was very attentive and friendly. The only aspect that didn't quite live up to my expectations was the salad bar. There were a few, fancier salad additions, but overall contained few choices. Desert, however, was fantastic!
Interesting food. Great service. Lively atmosphere. Definitely will return to this fun restaurant.

column4: 555 East Ocean Blvd. Long Beach, CA  90802
column13: I prefer their steaks to Mortons, Ruth Chris and Mastro's plus they have a better wine list than any of them.

The menu offered unique items like my Salmon wrap and my spouse's Halibut burger (more like a sandwich than a burger, but still...). They had some different beers on tap (Lost Coast Tangerine Wheat that I had). The owner was our server and everything was just so pleasant. It's a bit hard to find, tucked into the corner of a shopping center but if you find Raley's turn around and you'll see their sign. I'm so glad we found this place. It was nice to have something different for lunch than the typical burger and fries lunch! The owner says the place really gets hopping in the summer so it might be a fun bar scene in the middle of summer, but our spring lunch was just nice, quiet, and relaxed.

The building is very unique and the service is phenomenal. Employees are very attentive and will even tell you stories about special menu items. Be sure to try the Nichols Pickles. The chicken fried steak was a little chewy but everything else was spot on.

column4: 1875 S. Bascom Ave. Suite 2500 Campbell, CA  95008
column13: Service was great, food great, and the cook was entertaining. Great for family dining.
This is my son's favorite restaurant, and we celebrate his birthday there every year. We thoroughly enjoyed the fondue experience.

column4: 10006 Scripps Ranch Blvd, #104 San Diego, CA  92131
column13: It is a neighborhood gem! Great food, great service. The owners Gigi and Victor are there to greet you and make sure your are welcomed. Go back often. Recommend if you want to get away from the 'norm' of restaurants.
Great place..just like good old east coast back in the 90"s..but kid friendly

column4: 8400 Santa Monica Blvd. West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: Very cute restaurant, lots of good table options. Came for DineLA, only thing that bothered me with the food was that the seabass option didn't specify it was served with bacon. As a pescetarian that's an ingredient I would expect they'd mention on the menu. Wasn't hard to eat around it, but they should try to note when food is served with things that not everyone can eat.

column4: 9634 Fair Oaks Boulevard Fair Oaks, CA  95628
column13: This had to the worst food I have ever had in my entire life. Very expensive for what tasted at best like food that was old and re-heated. They will most likely be shut down by the end of the year. The waiter was very nice...unfortunately, that is the only positive comment I can make at this time. I go out to resturants (nice resturants) almost daily. I do not mind spending money for a nice meal. My date and walk away trying to remember the last time we had such a bad meal...our conversation continued for the next day and obviously we concluded we would never go back.
Great service and top quality entrees and first courses.

column4: 9565 Wasatch Blvd / Little Cottonwood Canyon Sandy, UT  84092
column13: I took my husband to La Caille for his 30th birthday and was no disappointed. Yes it was expensive, but the ambiance, service and food were exceptional. I wish I had known that after you eat you can walk around the grounds, would have planned a lot more time to enjoy the beautiful property.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Ste 25100 San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: One issue wiqth an undercooked meal but theey were really on top of it zand tok care of us without us having fo ask.

It took a very long time to get our order. By the time we got the steak and the fish dishes, they both were cold. We ended up asking to have the food warmed up. Still neither of the dishes had any flavor. I had high hopes for this place but was very very disappointed.

We ordered the Pakora for an appetizer, it was OK, but the sauce was excellent. We had the lamb karma, chicken tandori and koftas for the main course. The koftas were outstanding. You get spinach or chickpeas with the rice, the chickpeas are much better :-) Overall very good, would dine again.

Very welcoming and friendly service. But their execution varies from one visit to the next. Some visits are memorable, others disappointing. An overdressed salad. Spaghetti with bottarga too heavy on the pepper flakes to enjoy. I love the neighborhood feeling, the crowd, the wine list. I wish the food were more consistent.
The ambience was not what we had expected after reading about L'Affair's reputation..but the food and service was good.
The food was good overall, although there are better french restaurants in the city. Service was great.

Food is always good. I often will have wine by the glass (wife does not drink) and they served my wine at the right temperature (i.e. cooler than "room temperature") which is something I don't see nearly often enough.

column1: Tommy Bahama Laguna Beach Bar & Grill
column4: 400 South Coast Highway Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: Great food and service, but very lively and loud. If you are looking for a quiet romantic spot this is not it. We could hardly hear each other across our table, which ruined the opportunity to visit with some family members we handn't seen in a while. But the food, drinks and service for very good. So if you are looking for good food and a vibrant atmosphere TB's Laguna Beach is the place.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - La Jolla
column4: 8970 University Center Lane La Jolla, CA  92122
column13: Excellent steaks. The 3-course Prix Fixe dinner is a great deal! Gets very noisy once the dining room fills up, so go early or late if you want a quiet dinner.

column4: 2182 Avenida de la Playa La Jolla, CA  92037
column13: Needs help with their waiters attentiveness.

column4: 8980 Villa La Jolla Drive La Jolla, CA  92037
column13: On of the choices on the kids menu was make your own pizza. One of my children wanted to make BBQ Chicken instead of the regular cheese or pepperoni , they accommodated him! We all had such a good time! We are definitely going again!
Nothing too exciting food was so so, best thing was dessert

column4: 900 Ranch Rd 620 S, Ste B108 Lakeway, TX  78734
column13: Good Fathers Day brunch. The reservation gave us a perfect place to see & hear my 2 teenage guitar students who were performing. All in all a good time.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - LA
column4: 800 West Olympic Blvd, Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: The kitchen lost our order. Salads didn't come until 30 minutes after we placed our order. The waiter did offer another round of drinks on the house to make up for the delay. We were there for 3 1/2 hours. Otherwise, the food great.

Took my mother for Mother's Day and we had a very nice meal. We had the green papaya salad and the scallops wrapped in Betel leaves--both good and the papaya salad was a big portion. For entrees, we shared the short ribs in wine--these were very tasty but a little too fatty. We also had the pork/shrimp in clay pot--this was excellent but the shrimp were a little overcooked but I would totally have this again. The other dish was the garlic green beans which were excellent. Will totally return. We actually recommended Lo Lot to a local resident walking past the front door as we were leaving :)

column1: LA Market Restaurant by Kerry Simon
column4: 900 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: Lobby location isn't very secluded, but the food is really excellent! And the service impeccable.

There always is a welcome greeting upon arrival. The restaurant was not busy on the Tuesday evening when we dined at 7:30 PM; by the time we were finished our meal shortly after 9:00 PM we were the last persons in the restaurant. The food is presented in a tasty manner; the sliced Italian bread is freshly baked with olive oil on the table as well as butter. I wish there was another choice of salad with the entree. No need for dessert after a delicious main course.

column4: 201 East Gore Creek Dr. Vail, CO  81657
column13: Had some light rain the evening we were there, but Vernor and Matt and others quickly moved those diners who were seated outside to inside tables. Exceptional customer service, as usual, at Lancelot.

column4: 5380 Greenwood Plaza Blvd. Suite 101 Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: music is too loud, people tend to talk louder when music is loud. Conversation is difficult. Make a decision as to whether you want to be a restaurant or bar, but with such a loud atmosphere dining with a small table is tough.

Food was cooked and presented excellently. Very tasty. Service was solid without "hovering". This is the third time we have dined here prior to a program at the Orpheum. We are now thinking of it for other times as well. Important--make a reservation!
This has been our fourth visit and has become our favorite place to dine

column1: La Plazuela at La Fonda on the Plaza
column4: 100 E. San Francisco Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: The restaurant was very busy when we arrived and we had to wait 25 minutes for our table. Too bad as usually La Plazuela is perfect service and wonderful food.

La Posta consistently serves up some of the best food in Santa Cruz. Although the menu is not terribly long, the choices are always interesting and feature local ingredients prepared by an expert hand. Our party of four enjoyed one of their incredible thin crust pizzas as an appetizer, which was out of this world. (A great bottle of Italian wine as an accompaniment didn't hurt!) Two of us had one of their house-made pastas--a triangular shaped ravioli that melted in your mouth. I had the tri tip and my dining partner the ling cod. We all cleaned our plates. We split desserts, fresh peach sorbet and a lemon pound cake with lemon verbena gelato. Delicious! I highly recommend La Posta for a fine dining experience in a casual setting.

column4: 755 North La Cienega Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90069
column13: The food is very salty.The waiter is friendly but the manager level has attitudes like they do not care too much about their customer. May be that is the reason the place is almost empty around 8:00 pm Friday night .
Great porterhouse for two, and the filet is superb.

column4: 452 First Street East, Suite H Sonoma, CA  95476
column13: What a wonderful hidden gem! Will definitely be back. Don't skip dessert.

La Scene surpassed my highest expectations. This is a terrific place to dine in the theater district of San Francisco just before a play. It was a wonderful experience overall. The chef's sauces make every dish, from entree to dessert, a special treat.

I thought the Restaurant decor was nice, the managers and servers were great. And, the cook Fernando was handsome and performed an awesome show while cooking! However, it was super hot in the restaurant! Beginning by a grill made it that much hotter, so they definitely need to figure out a way to make it cooler. Other than that, I would go again in the future.
The food was delicious. More outstanding was the service. Thank you for a very pleasant evening.

column4: 306 West Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: This is a great place for Spannish food. While the Paella is not as good as my last trip to Spain it certainly a great choice in San Antonio. The tapas were well thought out and tasty; there was an even assortment between vegetable adn meet; the standard offereings such as Jambon were there as well as unusal ones.

column4: 3200 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Fashion Show Mall    Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: We've been to this Maggiano's several times and it's always consistent with the food, service and friendliness. Will be going back again next Sat. and looking forward to another Great meal...

column4: 412 East Flamingo Road Las Vegas, NV  89169
column13: Simply enjoyable... good food, service and friendly staff. It pays to pre-order for scheduled dining party.

column1: Jaleo - The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas
column4: 3708 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: It's a really fun place to go with excellent service and excellent food. Recommend going with a group... It's a bit too loud if you want to spend an intimate night with a date or a friend.

column4: 6605 Las Vegas Blvd South #147 Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: The best Sushi in Vegas, better than sushi Samba.

column4: 750 S. Rampart Boulevard Fashion Village at Boca Park Las Vegas, NV  89145
column13: no brunch !!!! I reserved with open table based on the sunday brunch promotion that open table advertised. the fact is, kona grill does not offer a sunday brunch !!!

column4: 3720 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Suite 244 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: This was the perfect place to treat my girlfriends for some fine dining!

column4: 3355 Las Vegas Blvd. So. Las Vegas, NV  89113
column13: This was our second visit to Pinot Brasserie and we were extremely disappointed in the food and the assist staff. The waitress, herself was very personable and was well trained. She was not supported in any way by the secondary staff, who were abrupt in placing food, had a very bothered attitude toward us. They had to be asked to place knives and forks on the table, the appeared only once and never returned. The restaurant secondary staff were undertrained and need instruction in how to approach and serve diners. The food was average, the chicken was tasteless and not well seasoned, the steak was average, the creamed spinach was also average and was just the usual vegetable. When we return to Las Vegas we will not be returning.

column4: 3200 Las Vegas Blvd South, Suite 3300 Fashion Show Mall Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Was a very good place to eat. The cost was comparibale to other nice restaurants in the Vegas area. $$

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas
column4: 6635 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Food and service are always superb

column1: Lawry's The Prime Rib - Las Vegas
column4: 4043 Howard Hughes Parkway Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: A great place to celebrate a special occasion. The staff were attentive and courteous. The entire meal was scrumptous - the salad, the prime rib, and the veggies. Will recommend to friends and go back again.

column1: B.B. King's Blues Club - Las Vegas
column4: 3400 Las Vegas Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Great music and service. Food was good.

column4: 3355 South Las Vegas Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Service was terrific, Waiter was very friendly - liked him. Food was wonderful. Thank you for our anniversary surprise.

column4: 800 West Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: The food is a little different from other Mexican restaurants and it's great. The guacamole is fantastic, but a bit expensive at $14. We told our waiter that we had a concert at 8 pm, and they did an awesome job getting us served and out of there so that we weren't late. Love Rosa's!

I really liked the fish special I had for lunch. Have had good prix fixe lunches there before as well. If you want to spend $16-20 for lunch, you will have a great lunch here. If you get the lower price foods, you will like them just fine. The specials and higher priced foods will be Very Good and "Fit for Foodies". That has been my experience at this restaurant. Their small plates for happy hour are delightfully yummy but definitely small.
The food was creative, spicy and exceptional, as were all the salsas. The host and wait staff were very friendly and professional. An exceptional Mexican restaurant.
My mother, sister, and I always love going to high tea on special occasions! The food is always delicious, service outstanding, and the ambiance is always relaxing and fun!

column4: 8465 Park Meadows Center Drive Lone Tree, CO  80124
column13: While the service was fantastic, I won't be going back. I miss the menu from when it was Nordstrom cafe. I am especially disappointed that the selection of salads has changed and the tomato basil soup is only available on Mondays.
My wife and I really enjoyed our wedding anniversary dinner at Spindletop. This was our first time at Spindletop and had a great experience, the service, food and view were great.
Delightful neighborhood find. Friendly service, accomodating for those with food allergies, outdoor seating for those with pets. Menu had many options. Would not recommend for young children.

The restaurant has a lot of potential but it needs help in many areas. 1. they need a new chef, stop using can black beens, stop passing carne asada for rib eye, salty beef, the lamb was hard like the sole of an old shoe. Bad, bad, bad they need restaurnt impossible help.
Steaks here are outstanding. Every visit the food quality has been consistent. You will enjoy.

column4: 748 W. Heritage Park Blvd Layton, UT  84041
column13: The waitress was horrible. Luckily, the manager stepped in and made things right. Food was outstanding. We will try Roosters again.
Attractive atmosphere, delicious food, and impeccable service. I highly recommend the restaurant.
a good place but for what you get it's over priced.

column4: 3500 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: I have dined at The Palm in Dallas once a week for years and several other cities when out of town it is my favorite restaurant. That said the Palm in Las Vegas is the best. They got me a corner booth as requested and our server recommended a great bottle of wine which was very good, then my wife and I split the tomatoes and mozzarella which was very good and larger than I have had. My wife ordered the swordfish and our waiter recommended it blackened and she loved it. I ordered the filet medium rare and it was perfect. I had the half and half as a side and the onion strings were crispy and the cottage fries which my mother swears by were delicious. We skipped dessert because we were headed to Garth Brooks. Outstanding cant wait to return.

column4: 615 Town Center Drive Costa Mesa, CA  92626
column13: I tried phoning the restaurant to speak with Christian, manager, but they do not answer their phones until dinner time and one cannot leave a message. I waited 45 mins to get a martini, and my friend did not received either salad or entree until 55 mins has passed. I got both courses, and had to eat in front of her. I told waiter, Parker that we had a show and had to be out w/inan hour. He delivered my salad to several other tables, even after I told him it looked like mine. What a nightmare;no one even offered to comp the meals or anything for that matter! We spent over $128 and I would like to have my money back! No one even bothered to see how things went and no manager came to check on this new employee who did such a disastrous jo

Having been a visitor to Italy and married to an Italiana, I am rather particular about Italian cuisine in restaurants. Visconti's is further notable because it is in a tourist town, which tends to draw poor imitations of any cuisine. Instead, Visconti's has been a pleasure at every visit.
One of the best translations of a true French Bistro That I've found in this country. I go as often as I can. Well thought out wine list. Great place for a mealtime conversation.
fantastic brunch. make a reservation so you won't have to wait.

Fascinating food in minimal portions and totally over priced. But we were hungry when we left after $120 for 2. Great wine list. Creative treatment for a warehouse type building, but in the end the dining area is lackluster. Industrial.

column4: 72-624 El Paseo Ste C7 Palm Desert, CA  92260
column13: Definitely lived up to its reputation to have the best linguine and clams in the desert. Best salmon and spinach I've ever had. The only things they need to work on are the bread and the salad. They were not the greatest. Great service and nice quiet atmosphere.

column4: 85 Liberty Ship Way Ste 109 Sausalito, CA  94965
column13: Great restaurant, but for a "Garage" I think the prices should be about 15% less. Pleasant dining experience.

My wife and I had a very special evening celebrating and our dinner at Red Star was superb!Our waiter, Rusty, was energetic, entertaining and very informative about weaving our way through the dining experience.He did an amazing job and at the end of dinner we discovered that he only recently started working at the Red Star. His level of service and knowledge of the menu rivaled that of the servers at Jake's!

column4: 811 Wilshire Boulevard 21st Floor Los Angeles, CA  90017
column13: Location and view from the 21st floor from patio seating are great. Food was ok and portion sizes are decent but not worth the price. Service was good. Katsuya at nearby LA Live is 10x better for the same price.
food was excellant, service was excellant, tables are close together, noisey, hard to have a conversation.
Spectacular service. Great food. Well done!
Bad sushi. Neighborhood grocery store is better. Mac and cheese ok. Nothing great about this place. Pass.
FUN!! place for breakfast or lunch and so sorry I didnt get a tshirt... Delicious mash ups of flavor, freshness and real food!!!

column4: 231 South Ellsworth Ave. San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Amazing service, amazing food, beautiful wine list. Courtious, patient and attentive staff. Very friendly and professional. I will DEFINITELY be back!
Very good although seemed super expensive. The beignets are not to be skipped! One of the best desserts in Boulder County!

column1: Rocks Modern Grill at Beaver Creek Lodge
column13: We were called 2 days ahead & told that they don't open until June 14 so we had the concierge make reservations elsewhere

We've been to D&C before but this experience was below par. Our server seemed to be distracted or having a bad night as we had to request the bread basket we saw on tables around us and my coleslaw was served with the meal even though she told me it would be served ahead of time as a salad course. In general it seemed to be an off night for her. However, we enjoyed looking at all the memorabilia and the food itself was very good.

column4: 3200 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The food was definitely a notch above your average Mexican restaurant. The grilled vegetables were especially good, and so was the tableside guacamole. Those who got the pulled pork said pineapple was listed as a main ingredient on the menu, but was not detected in the dish. If you're there in the hot weather, there are misters which help to keep you cool.

column4: 2000 N. Main St Santa Monica, CA  90405
column13: We were sitting outside, and when they turned on the airconditioner for the inside part of the restaurant, the noise was so loud and disturbing we could barely carry on a conversation.
since I found this place in May I've been back three times and each time it is a new experience. Wonderful food, very creative!

column1: Lido Restaurant at Dolphin Bay Resort & Spa
column4: 2727 Shell Beach Road Pismo Beach, CA  93449
column13: The service was amazing as well as the food. I love this place! Will be back. The staff was courtious.
Warm and attentive wait staff. Terrific food.

Billy Bob's is awlays my favorite when visiting Las Vegas! It's a hidden gem with their 24-oz bone-in rib eye steak. The food quantity and quality are great! Also try the double pork chop! And be sure to finish your meal with the foot long eclair dessert!

column4: Arizona Biltmore 2400 E Missouri Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at Wright's. Our head server was somewhat unfriendly and seemed impatient, but the assistant servers made up for it. We started with the terrine (foie gras), which was very tasty, and the lobster bisque, which we found overly salty and bland with no depth of flavor. It seemed like a lot of tables were ordering it, and it looked gorgeous with the golden puff pastry on top, but alas, not a winner. I had the beef wellington--fantastic and the star of the night, while my husband ordered the lamb rack. He thought it was cooked well, but didn't have as much seasoning as he would have liked. Wright's kindly gave us a complimentary chocolate souffle for dessert. Delicious.
such great and interesting food....service was outstanding which is why we come back!!

column4: Hilton Salt Lake City 255 S. West Temple Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: food was very good. although, it was on the expensive side for the portion size. Bartender was not very friendly, but other staff members were friendly.

Angela's Bistro & Bar was a hit the moment it opened on Central Street in Alameda. The open kitchen gives everyone a view of what is happening as you walk through the restaurant. The service is professional and friendly. They feature fresh and local produce. The menu changes frequently with what is available locally. The lamb is always outstanding! On Friday evenings Angela's features a wine tasting of some of the excellent local wineries! It's nice they finally put their reservation service on Open Table. Angela's is a favorite and recommend to others.
Been here many times. Always a great experience.

column4: 5755 Mountain Hawk Way Santa Rosa, CA  95409
column13: We always get a great meal at Lisa Hemenway's Fresh. Ingredients are wonderfully fresh and menu changes often, but favorites don't disappear. Whether you want a full entree meal or something lighter, it's all there. The Reuben is the best I have ever had. They also have great take out.
Jayme is the best waitress at Grace - amazing service and recommendations! Grace is the best restaurant in Fort Worth,Texas!

column1: Marco's at Huli Sue's Mauna Lani
column4: 68-1050 Makaiwa Pl. Mauna Lani Golf Clubhouse Kamuela, HI  96743
column13: The restaurant was nice, it was not busy when we arrived so we were sat right away.The restaurant indicated it was Italian, yet there really was a limited selection of Italian choices.. I did order the Spagettii with meat sauce, but the sauce was more of abeef broth color instead of the more authentic tomato base, along with the flavor.The best dish was the Chocolate Cake.. Not to be missed.. May try it again.

Drinks, salads, appetizers and entrees were mostly very good. Artichoke appetizer was slightly "oily/greasy" compared to usual cooking methods. Service was friendly but slightly inexperienced. A few minor near mistakes with orders, and the server had trouble dealing with a credit-card-plus-cash payment of the bill. Could have dealt with it internally rather than asking us to re-do our payment mix. Not a big deal but could have been avoided.

column4: 7 East Anapamu Street Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: The courtyard dining was charming, and completely shaded. The service was great; the food was great. I highly recommend their pumpkin soup. My only teensy weensy complaint was that they make their sandwiches so tall you can't possibly pick them up and eat them like a sandwich. I had to use my fork. But really, it was so good, I didn't mind at all!
Excellent meal. Service was great. Would definitely go back.

column1: Little Buddha Restaurant Sushi Bar & Lounge
column4: 4321 West Flamingo  Rd Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: Went for a nice dinner and received bad service. The waiting staff keep stopping by trying to take out plates and the up sale food and drinks. We felt rushed and didn't enjoy our time. Tables with large groups were there before us and after us. Didn't enjoy it.
This family owned gem serves delicious Eastern European food with friendly service!

We took my dad there for Father's Day brunch and the food,setting and service were all fabulous. We all tried something different from Eggs Benedict, The Reuben, Crabcake Salad, Lox, Sausage Trio plate and my 2 year old especially loved the mac n cheese fritters. We will certainly be back. We had fun feeding the ducks across the street when we were finished too. 5 Stars across the board!

The trend for my 28th birthday this year is dining at restaurants within hotels on the West side. I first saw a promo offer on Gilt City, then I was amazed by the hotel and restaurant decor. I was very lucky that the restaurant provided us the private dining room, which is really an awesome experience. However, I was disappointed by the food as whether it's Lamb Chops or Seared Wagyu, they all tasted a bit too salty. Although I do have to say that the Dog Point Sauvignon Blanc, Marlborough 2008 was fantastic, never had a such a memorable Sauvignon Blanc, and it made me want to just to keep a bottle at home. Didn't really get a chance to taste the dessert as I was too busy talking to peeps. I probably won't go back for the dinner.

The Kitchen by far was our favorite dining experience in Jackson Hole. So much so that we made a return visit. The ahi tuna, grilled calamari and flank steak were fantastic. Best of all was the chocolate chip skillet cookie with ice cream. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable regarding the menu and pairings.
Out of key ingredients for 2 of 3 drinks I requested. Out of one of their "signature" dishes. It was 7 PM on a Thursday.

The bellini's are wonderful. My chicken scallopine was very good. We went for an early dinner to celebrate my Mother's 81st birthday and the music was so loud we had to constantly ask them to turn it down, we could barely hear ourselves think. Can't remember our waitress' name but she was very good and adorable.

A real gem. After a day at the beach, if you are looking for something that is healthy, friendly, delicious and even a little bit decadente then head over to Leroy's. The food ranged from delicious burgers with truffle fries to beet salad to yummy salmon benedict or sweet fruit granola and yogurt. The staff was very friendly and helpful and seemed to really enjoy their job. Another great plus, if you are a doggy lover, is that they have outdoor seating that is mutt friendly. They even brought out a water dish for our thirsty dog. The price was right too as nothing was overpriced.

My wife and I went here to celebrate her new job, I requested a specially printed menu, and that's what I got! Our server was outstanding and made some outstanding recommendations. The food, wine, dessert, and views were great!!
One of our FAVORITE restaurants in San Diego, and we're so fortunate to have one minutes from our home. Thank you for a GREAT evening!

Outstanding food! The parmesan-crusted halibut was one of the best seafood dishes I've ever had. Absolutely flavorful and cooked to perfection. I will go back again just to have this dish! Service was impeccable.

Very pleased with the restaurant. Attended with a group of friends (5 of us), and the food was excellent. Everyone was pleased and had a good time. They thanked me for introducing them to the Village Cork.

column1: Afternoon Tea at the Brown Palace
column13: We had most of our tea foods left and asked for a box. The waitress did it away from the table.it was deplorable how it was boxed and it was not our food.

column4: 4059 Lincoln Blvd. Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: Was excellent on all counts last month, but the chef has changed and the dishes are now simply ok as opposed to great (the tomatoes were heirloom, now store bought, the carpaccio was perfect, now smothered in arugula, the wild boar pasta was one of the best, but now it's simply a bland buttery composition).
I was really looking forward to going to the Townhouse but I was disappointed. Everything was just OK.
I enjoyed an excellent meal andthe service was exceptional. I will continue to return to an excellent reataurant.

column4: 6451 E Millcreek Canyon Salt Lake City, UT  84109
column13: The ribeye was amazing. The wine and waitress (Chelsea) were exceptional. The sirloin was a little tough but the lobster was soft and tasty.
The food was very good and nicely presented. The decor was muted but warm and inviting.
Not the best tasting Spanish food I have had, should have gone across the street to Alegrias.

column4: 3750 Wailea Alanui Dr. Suite B-22 Wailea, HI  96753
column13: An excellent find in the Shops at Wailea. The waiter, Shamus, was knowledgeable and fun, and recommended the perfect seafood dish for us.There's nothing inexpensive here, but in this location you don't expect it.

column4: 16641 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Typical Texas hotel food, except probably pricier since it's a Westin.

We had heard mixed reviews on Stella from our friends and family - both for food and service. We had a great server and the food was also very good. However, I felt like we were cramped into an awkward space in the dining room with not enough room to maneuver. the table and chairs was set so that the people on the right or left of us had to move if we left or we had to move if they left. Otherwise I thought it was better than I had expected! We will go back for sure.

I'm not sure the staff was ready for the Mother's Day crowd. The service was slow, especially getting refills on the "bottomless" mimosas (I had to go the bar at one point). The buffet was really unattractive, so we ordered from the menu. The food was good for a sports bar, but not great. The table we reserved for 9 was small and awkward. I would recommend this restaurant for happy hour, but not much else.
american style food mostly overpriced service was mediocre and food is fair

column4: 903 N. La Cienega Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90069
column13: great restaurant, definitely have the wagyu steak

column4: 800 South Figueroa Street Suite 100 Los Angeles, CA  90017
column13: The food was good, but very overpriced. The service was lacking. They had to be reminded to fill our water and bring a drink. The calmari was tough and overly breaded and needed the sauce on the side, not drizzled over it. The seafood was very good. They said in order to have the chocolate molton cake it would take 20 min, but it took that long just to get our dessert .
one of the best run restaurants in LA, if not the best

We had a set time to be done with dinner and let the server know that. Everything was very prompt until we ordered dessert and an espresso. Then we felt like we were pushing the clock because it took about 5 minutes to serve some gelato and the coffee. Overall, it was a great dinner and we had a good time. We made it to our next destination on time, but just barely. I would definitely go back but allow more time on my part.

column4: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines Road Cedar Creek, TX  78612
column13: Ate Christmas Brunch in the Firewheel Cafe. Nice selection but the food was just so-so. Overall a nice time and the service is excellent.
Not as "famous" as other restaurants in the Fishermans Wharf district, but a standout nonetheless. The food was superb, as was the service. We heartily recommend it!

column4: 5971 Sky Pond Drive Suite C-106 Loveland, CO  80538
column13: This was our first time at the BentFork Grill. The food was really good. Great menu choices and a lot of great-sounding specials to choose from. We had amazing service and got helped quickly. All of our questions were answered. We did not get checked on every 5 minutes, which was great, it seems like the staff knows when to ask if you need another drink or anything else. It was pricy, but a very well-versed menu and it also had adequate lighting. We will definitely be dining here again!
Wonderful organic options creatively prepared. Tuesday nights offered Pinot and Pizza which we enjoyed.

It is much more a bar than a restuarant. The waiter was rude at first and made faces when we asked for more coffee. The place was nice and I think it would do a lot better without this guy or waiters like him. The food is good and service was par.

We enjoyed another wonderful dinner at the cliff house. We were seated by the stone fireplace and enjoyed the view, atmosphere and ambience. Food and service were excellent as always. Enjoyed the special per-fixed dinner pricing. The restaurant is in the midst of renovations, but it didn't seem to affect quality of food or service.

column4: 71 N. San Pedro Street San Jose, CA  95110
column13: Our waiter seemed pretty out of it when talking to us and describing menu items, but he was still on top of serving us for the most part. The food was delicious! We enjoyed the bruschetta and crab cakes for an appetizer, caesar salad and spinach salad, duck and new york steak for entrees (which we took half of home and had for leftover lunch the next day), key lime pie and chocolate cake for dessert, along with a glass pinot noir wine. delicious dinner!

column4: 3939 Ocean Bluff Ave San Diego, CA  92130
column13: This restaurant is attached to the Hilton Garden which is not noted in the Open Table listing which made it difficult to locate. Don't let that deter you from this place. The food was very good and the atmosphere is relaxed and not fancy.

My husband and I really enjoy going to Lawry's although it is certainly a special occasion place for us. It is such a treat! We love the spinning bowl salad and of course the prime rib! Don't under estimate the cheaper glasses of wine. We had a lovely time celebrating our anniversary in a romantic setting but mainly the food is absolutely incredible.

column4: 10850 W. Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90064
column13: At Westside Tavern the food is usually very good - some dishes are standouts (such as their flatbreads and grilled cheese with tomato soup) others just tasty. If only the service ever matched the high quality of the food. Servers are friendly, but often absent when needed.
We love Roti8 and recommend the restaurant to all our friends - the chicken is superb!

We enjoyed a dinner chosen from a focused and well-varied menu. The cheese stuffed squash blossoms were light and delicious; we knew then we were off to a good start. The prawns were also good; the smashed potatoes silky. My duck breast was a litle overdone for my taste but then I like duck barely cooked. The duck was tender and flavorful.
The food and service was amazing. I love this restaurant. Food is very fresh and tasty. The service was amazing. The servers are very knowledgeable and friendly. 5 stars to be sure.
Michelin star (over)rated. A nice spot and excellent service but could have had more fun across the street at Buca Di Pepo and saved a lot of $

column4: 4700 Camp Bowie Blvd Fort Worth, TX  76107
column13: We went during crab fest, 1lb of crab makes a great meal.Enjoyed the quiet sunny atmosphere and friendly service.They have the best cold martinis here, served with a small carafe ofextra martini in an ice bucket on the side.Only criticism would be the corn on the cob side was soggy.

Went there for Breakfast. Was offered juice and coffee before being told that we should get the over priced buffet since we would already be charged $10 per person for the coffed and juice. The buffet was terible with long lines for omlet or waffle.

We celebrated our 18th wedding anniversary by having the four course fondue dinner. The service was excellent. We were seated in a semi-private enclave with a Happy Anniversary banner. The bread, salad, veggies, chicken, beef, and dessert were all very good. There was so much food to enjoy! And the ice cold Spaten made everything taste better.

column4: 8048 W. Third St. Los Angeles, CA  90048
column13: Great healthy options for an Italian restaurant. Excellent veggie dishes and gluten free noodles.

column4: 125 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Noisy and a large amount of elevator traffic. Not well suited for special occasion dining.
Great food, good service, mediocre location
Our server was great. I liked the pizza very much. The beet salad was not special nor were the other 2 dishes that were selected.My real problem with LuLu is the noise.

column4: 200 S. Palm Canyon Drive Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Although the service was good, the waiter was excellent; however, servers are just that, servers, don't expect anything except the food being placed on the table. I guess they are to busy to respond to requests or thank-you.

WE hadn't been hre in quite a while,and are so glad we went back. All three of us ordered the grilled trout, which was sublime (though it would have been just as good with a bit less olive oil). The dessert menu had more variety than some similar restaurants, and the gelato/sorbet flavors were varied and interesting (the blackberry tasted very fresh and yummy!). I would definitely go again!
Fun and vibrant with lots of authenic character.

Buca di Beppo is a family favorite. You always get good food and it's pretty consistant. The prices are pretty high though even though it's family style. I think they have lowered the amount of food for the higher prices. Not happy with that. It is one of the only places around that you can get veal and that's a plus. Don't like the fact that they took our favorite salad and added $2.00 to add the two ingredients that they were putting on for free before. Why didn't you just add the $2.00 to the price and not tell anyone???Not a smart move people...other than that, it was a good experience.

column4: Pier 23, On The Embarcadero San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Just a solid bar spot on the water. Nothing fancy or advanced from a culinary perspective, but the drinks are good and the views are even better.
Every visit we have had has always been awesome!! Keep up the good work.
So consistently good and has been for years.

When we got there they said that they did not show a reservation for us. But said they would have a table in 5 to 10 minutes. They did.Food was not a good as normal. But they tried to make it better. Excellent service. Managers took great care of us. We will always go back.

Terrible steak for a steakhouse. The waiter seemed to lack confidence in almost everything on the menu. He actually said sorry we don't have the cuts available that can be cooked rare or medium rare. My husband thought his prime rib tasted and looked like it had been boiled. My filet medallions were over cooked and the salad was wilted. The appetizer and dessert were good but we won't be returning.

Bite at the Murano hotel, trendy and beautifully decorated hotel, has the look and atmosphere you can find in Miami or NYC . although the night we went was very quiet .. but Tacoma is quiet , no ?I had linguini & scallops, creamy ( a little bit too creamy) and rich in flavors . My husband has a kobe burger that he didn't enjoy .The berry sorbet was good . The overall experience was good .

column4: 555 Golden Gate Avenue San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: We went there for the band playing that day - no disappointment in that domain -
the breakfast buffet was not great. No pancakes, no waffles, no smoked salmon. Dissapointing because these are the items you would usually see at a high end hotel in a breakfast buffet.

column4: 1400 Pacific Coast Highway Seal Beach, CA  90740
column13: Best sushi around, bar none - six stars are appropriate, when you find something that is clearly one step beyond. My nine-year old loves eating here, but I only being her before about 7PM - not a place for kids in the evening. Great live music often. It gets *packed* but the crowd always seems fun. Staff is great - they obviously enjoy the place and want you to, as well.
The food was excellent as well as the service. The seating seems cramped and the ambiance is not very good. Prefer Boulevard or Prime Red.
Trendy, excellent service, a wine lovers delight and a foodies fantasy

column4: 730 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: I live very close by and had never been tempted to try Koi. It always seemed too "sceney" to me, but I'm happy that I finally gave it a try. It was excellent. Dine LA was the perfect excuse to try it. I'm now a fan.

Sardines were impressive. The ambience is unique being that it is a converted house. Guests must be patient because it has a very laid back neighborhood speed to the service. Be friendly, smile and just take it all in. Food was impressive.

column4: 118 E. Main St. Round Rock, TX  78664
column13: We had a wonderful time at Main Street Grill. The food was excellent and prepared as we requested. The staff were professional and knowledgable on all menu items. The desserts were fantastic.

We had someone recommend. Did not know the restaurant even existed.It is very well hidden and needs better signage.I had read reviews which were mixed.We had a delightful dinner from start to finish. We were there ona Tuesday before we went to the Ahmanson. Would definitely go backagain. Food was very good, service good.
The waiter was helpful in recommending dishes and helping us to divide a gazpacho order. The four of us all enjoyed everything we ordered.
Small packed loud and jumping scene with great margaritas and fresh mex food. Very similar to Frontiera Grill in Chicago but smaller

Love this place. Food is consistently great and service is fantastic. Haven't had anything I didn't like and always have a difficult time deciding on which thing to order. Don't let the fact that it is located in a little strip mall make you think that it can't serve up authentic Italian food. It REALLY is great. Plus, they have always been super accommodating to large groups and you can't beat walking out the door with a Dum Dum. :)
I've eaten at Mamma Melina several times. The food is usually quite good and the service friendly. It's expensive for what you get!

Good food, but not the warmest reception when we checked in on Mother's Day for a scheduled reservation made on Open Table. The woman at the door acted as if she didn't know what Open Table was. The waiter was less than informative when we asked questions about items on the menu. The specials seemed well thought out and the food our 6 people all ordered was good to very good. We will return with subdued expectations for the service.

A great menu! It was SOOO difficult to make a selection! That NEVER happens to me!! And the food was absolutely amazing. From the oysters on the half shell, to the shrimp cocktail, to the filet mignon with the most decadent Cabernet Souvignon glaze! Out of this world! Unfortunately, the servers were extremely inattentive and appeared inexperienced. This restaurant is doing itself a disservice by hiring inexperienced kids and trying to pass them off as servers in what would otherwise be an amazing fine dining establishment. Seating a party of 2 next to a large, noisy dinner party is definitely a rookie move. Hiring kids might be a good idea for summer camp, but not for a fine dining restaurant. The experience suffered because of it

The menu was poor, on an old often used sheet of paper..The menu selection was just O.K. My Hangar steak was great once I got it into my mouth. Cutting it was a chore. My friends Pork ribs could have been cooked a tad longer. They were hard to cut apart. The desert was outstanding, Alas no espresso machine... I have been to this restaurant before. It was my favorite restaurant in Ventura. I won't go back there.

column1: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
column13: I always love coming here and the food, asian-fusion is terrific. Everything on the menu is good:)

The food was good... not just pretty good... but solidly in the "good" category. The wine prices really got me. I'm not sure what they retail for, but the list felt sort of pricy in terms of overall choices. I think that restaurants like Flour+Water and Loconda strike a better balance between the wine list and prices. I'm not saying that each bottle was necessarily over-priced, but the whole list needs to be better edited to reflect the market I think. I would have gladly drank more and felt better about the bill if it felt more reasonable.
Tasty and innovative Vietnamese food; just a few miles from Disneyland, and worth the trip.

column4: 1010 El Camino Real Suite 140 Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Good family based italian fare, just as they advertise. All menu items we tried were very well done. Could sense the family tradition in many of the items. It was disappointing to see so few people dining when we were there (7:30 on a Saturday). Only complaint was the cost of the meatballs as a side dish. $14 for three small ones is on the steep side, although they were very good and tasty. Would order again even at that price.
Came in for lunch to meet a business associate. Absolutely delicous appetiser (poke) & salad (brussel sprout) to the main course of adobo ribs. Outstanding service. Overall great experience.
Limited wine selection, especially by the glass. Wine pour was about half a glass. No specials. No bread served. Waitress not friendly. Food was pretty good. Dessert was great.

column4: 125 E. Sir Francis Drake Blvd Larkspur, CA  94939
column13: Resturant really nice. We went for dessert and it was really good. Only downsides kept having to ask for water refills

column4: 1401 N Loop 1604 W Suite 105 San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Steaks were very pricy but all other things on the menu were very reasonable. Very nice place.
Fantastic craft beer. The brewmaster is terrific. He sat at our table and talked to us about troubleshooting Dad's home brew and walked us through his own process.

According to our waiter a petite filet mignon is the most difficult meat to cook - first time it was overcooked and the second time it had so much fat on it. So please save yourself some attitude from the staff and order the 10oz filet ;)
Great food,great location. Very pleasant atmosphere.

Difficult to find parking was our first impression. We had made reservations, but weren't asked when we arrived. Server brought the 'lemon water' I requested without lemon--twice. Every other table got bread; we had to ask for ours. The entrees took a LONG time to come. The food was average, nothing special. The salmon with lobster sauce that I had was the special. It tasted like BBQ sauce, but the salmon was pretty good. I would consider coming back for lunch if we got an outdoor table; but, probably won't come back for dinner. Unimpressive,

I give it one star. The server did well until the food arrived, then he made himself scarce. Concerning the food, I can cook better than what we were served. Both my wife and I received cold vegetables. My chicken was dry, along with the side of crawfish risotto. She ordered the lamb. It was cooked medium rare, but it was not seasoned at all. The meat on both of our plates were also not warm enough. To top that off they are way over priced for the small portions that are received.The only thing that this restaurant has going for it is the ambiance. I would definately not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The summer in Tucson is supposed be slow for restaurants. But NOT for Tavolino. The place was packed and "alive". The atmosphere and energy level were great. And, the food - as always - is incredible. Our favorite wine is from the family vineyard a Pietro Rinaldi Barbera - bricco. WOW. The homemade bread with a dip into the really good olive oil they use and a glass of wine are about all I needed to think I was in Italy. Great restaurant - glad to have it Tucson. The location is spectacular and close to home. Best of both !

column4: ES Sacramento 100 Capitol Mall Sacramento, CA  95814
column13: I ordered the Miso glazed salmon. By connotations one would consider that the chef would be using a traditional glaze with a miso base, however when I received my dinner all the chef had done was take a giant wad of miso paste, smear it on the salmon, and then torn it a little bit. It made me feel as the the chef had no idea what he was doing, all you could taste was the overpowering miso - which unless you're a miso conosieur, is not a good flavor in overly large quantities. Luckily, my dish was salvageable by scraping off all of the miso paste and the broth he had made for the soba noodles was quite good. My date had the roasted chicken, which even though was a little over, was far better than my entree.
I'd been here once before but my other two guests were both surprised and delighted by Corso. Moderate serving sizes, great price. Will eat here again.

The food was delicious, the crab cakes were fantastic, and the ambiance was horrible! It was freezing cold and we were the only two in the restaurant. I enjoyed my meal immensely, but I will not be back. It felt like I was stuck in a restaurant from 1988!

I love this restaurant. I spend a lot of money here. It's one of the few places I'm willing to eat sushi in Utah. I've been a customer for a long time. I have used open table checks and VIP rewards over and over. Most of the staff is great too! If I had one complaint about this restaurant it is that they do not greet me by name. I'm a regular and have been for a few years. You'd figure the staff would figure out your name after scanning your VIP and credit cards so many times. I hope the next time I go in I'm welcomed like a friend of the business and a valued patron, because that is what I am. Thank you Tsunami we 3 you!
My favorite restaurant currently. Love the food, service, and the place. Thanks.

column4: 55 West Cherry Street Walla Walla, WA  99362
column13: Great space- loved the open kitchen. My date's pork was a little dry but my salmon was amazing. Our server was attentive and well informed. Definitely a "must" when staying in Walla Walla.

Zinfandel Grille had fantastic food and a wonderful patio. I think the server may have been a tad too busy, I had to ask the busser for my wine I requested with dinner and it took an exceptionally long time to get our check.
We went on a Wednesday night for Ladies night. Great time and the food was wonderful!
The food is beautifully presented and very flavorful. Service was very good.

Enjoyed an excellent meal with good friends. Food, ambiance and service were more than anyone could ask for! Congratulations to Mandaloon for making this more of a dining experience than a dinner! Thank you!
This is a nice place for reasonably priced food. The staff is very attentive and eager to please. Enjoy!

column4: 7862 East Pacific Coast Highway Newport Beach, CA  92657
column13: Not your average Indian restaurant. You won't find the typical dishes. Everything was delicious. Don't be afraid to try something new. Chickpea Chaat appetizer is great.

We used to go to Ginza at least twice a month; we loved it. Then 30 days or so ago, we went there and had a poor experience. I wrote it off but my kids kept asking if we should try it again; we did, on the 4th of July. WHAT A RELIEF: the food and presentation were back to the standards we once new! I guess it was a slip-up....
Both myself & my friend had the salmon.It was nothing to write homr about.Just too dry for my liking.
Best view in the city, with a beautiful staff and food to match.
Chicken Tikka Masala buffet was actually just Chicken Masala; the meat was not all white... This place was much more inviting when it was on Broadway.
The Rosewood Mansion Restaurant on Turtle Creek was delightful. The service is impeccable and the food was outstanding. My mother and I had a wonderful time.
We've lived in Austin for over 30 years but triedManuel's for the first time a few months ago & loved it.Now it's among our favorites (one of the top 3).

I was very disappointed with the price of my Tostada Nortena, $12.50 for a small tostada, with tomatoes, lettuce, guacomole, black beans. It was the size of an appetizer for two. Taste was good...prices not so much. And it was quiet because people were not coming out in the storm...the tables were quite empty. I would not go back for dinner...maybe happy hour.

The service was great and the food was as good as we remembered from our last visit. We found this place through Living Social and it's a great place to get a well prepared meal in a comfortable setting. We recommend that you give it a try.

Our first visit and definitely not our last! Excellent fried chicken and the best homemade kimchee! So many items on the menu are homemade. Our next visit will include the Cheeseburger! And a special shout out to Mai our server who was delightful!
Live music was great. Food was good but nothing special. Service was mediocre.

column1: Westbank Grill at Four Seasons Jackson Hole
column4: 7680 Granite Loop Road Teton Village, WY  83025
column13: Buffalo rib-eye was very tough...stopped eating because I was tired of chewing. My wife's filet mignon was well done and she ordered medium. The restaurant was almost empty and there are valid reasons why. Obviously, this restaurant relies on people staying at the hotel to eat at the restaurant instead of just putting out good food. The outlandish price was laughable.
Food and service are always exceptional. Enjoyable relaxed setting for dinner. Lunches are also excellent and reasonably priced. One of our favorite restaurants for a special occasion.
One of our favorite restaurants for the past 16 years. Marco and his terrific staff are consistently a+

column4: 8200 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA  90046
column13: We enjoyed a nice dinner and evening outdoors.
The best homemade pasta in Marin County. We like it so much that I have made it my goal to work my way through the entire pasta list
Go on Tuesday's and look for Aaron!! Best sushi chef EVAAAAARRR! ^_^

Worth a trip for the bisque en croute alone, but come for the warm clubby ambiance, fun crowd and friendly service. Waiter Mike, bartender Rene, and owner Paul Dobson (a former matador!) and the rest of the longtime team make every visit a treat. Plus, the classic cuisine delights the whole crowd--even finicky or snobby types.

We arrived early and when I told the front desk person we had reservations by open table they said they did not know anything about open table and when I said I needed them to put it in so I could get my points they said they had nothing to do with open table and that her manager would have to handle it. And just blew it off. She turned around and then led us to a table with an attitude. Thankfully we had a great waitress who helped out with that.

After living in Italy six years, their pizza is as close as it gets to real Napolitano style pizza. The restaurant was noisy so we were seated outside, but shortly after a wedding party showed up that was spirited. So the noise was large in and out. However, it was a great time at an average price and for the noise, management treated us to free beverages!

It was my first time trying African cuisine, and the senegalese food this place offered was great, the sauces they use for there dishes were delecious.And the cocktail menu was good too, it was different and refreshing.They had Flamenco dancers at 8!

This restaurant was a pleasant surprise. The food was extremely good, the portions were generous and the three-course dinner for $30 is a good value. The atmosphere was casual and welcoming and our server was very friendly and accommodating.
The wine was tasty, the lamb was delicious and the desert was yummy. The ambiance was great.
Food was good, but our server took way too long checking on our table. We had to wait quite a while to even see a bill after dinner. We were not even asked if we wanted dessert.
Only covers lunch -- never been here for dinner.
Warm, welcoming, with excellent service and wonderful food. Wonderful!!
The woman who greets you is wonderful, our service was terrific, and we all loved our food choices. I had grilled salmon over little grilled vegetables and it was delicious!!

column4: 2757 Shell Beach Rd Pismo Beach, CA  93449
column13: Don't know about the rest of our group, although no one did much bragging about the food. My dinner was hit and miss -- worst salad ever (BLT), fish way overcooked and bland. Side dishes and desserts were very good. Overall, a disappointment as I expected more.

column4: Hilton Anatole 2201 Stemmons Freeway Dallas, TX  75207
column13: Nana was a little more 'old school' than we expected, but it seems that's about to change. We actually caught their current set up on it's last night. I actually enjoyed the smartly dressed staff and the lovely place settings. I thought the food was good, though it ranged from just 'good' with a couple of stand outs.
