We're definitely interested in checking it out after the remodel to see how the experience differs.

We were one of two tables in the entire restaurant on a Thursday night. We found this to be a bit odd. Our service was superb. Wilfredo did everything to make us feel comfortable. The scallops were well cooked and above average. The risotto was perfectly cooked but over-seasoned. The biggest knock would be the outdated decor. But who can complain when you are watching a bay side sunset?

column4: 35325 Date Palm Drive, Ste 111 Cathedral City, CA  92234
column13: Good food. Nice neighborhood find

column4: 246 Via Antonia Ave Las Vegas, NV  89119-3527
column13: Awesome experience..... well recommended to everyone!! You will definitely love it as much as my husband and I did.

Food was delicious and definitely worth going back for. Very large menu with plenty of options for every palate. The beers were also very good. My family enjoyed the BBQ tri tip sandwiches, the schnitzel and a burger. Even the french fries were tasty! And the fresh fruit that was a side with the tri tip sandwiches was also very good-and fresh! My only suggestion is to have a more extensive kids menu as there were only three items on it.
Had a great burger and fries sitting outside!
Very good food. Thursday night is a great event and value
I had a wonderful lunch there with a coworker and look forward to many more!

column4: 44400 Indian Wells Lane Indian Wells, CA  92210
column13: The food was excellent, the service outstanding! The waitress was very friendly and very attentive, especially since there were children in our group. The experience was so wonderful, we returned the following morning for brunch. A+.

column4: 21500 Pacific Coast Hwy Huntington Beach, CA  92648
column13: my gf and I went there during the week. We sat outside by the firepit. It was a wonderful night and both Brandon's were excellent servers :)Didn't get to look at the wine list because I was driving.The hotel (Hyatt) grounds were beautiful...take a fe min to walk around after dinner.

column4: 4905 Santa Monica Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90029
column13: Had an amazing meal here, the owner is a very friendly helpful person making sure your meal is exactly what you want. I highly recommend this little gem in the heart of L.A.
The lamb cooked with prunes was delicious!
Great fun restaurant, Moroccan experience with friends!

column4: 24011 New Hall Ranch Road Valencia, CA  91355
column13: I really like this restaurant a lot. I have been there several times for dinner and the servers have always been friendly and knowledgeable and provided us with great service. The best part for me is that I have multiple food allergies and gluten intolerance and they are totally willing to accommodate that. I have always been able to have a delicious meal there despite my food restrictions. They have a decent wine list and the parking is easy. I would definitely recommend it!
Really great atmosphere and service. The food was wonderful and I'd recommend this restaurant to my friends.

This was the most overpriced and lackluster food we ate the entire time we were in Vail. Our server was insulting when ordering a bottle of wine that was over a $100 a bottle, he asked if we were sure we really wanted it as it "very mineral." The steak was gray and I have had better beef at the Sizzler. The lobster mac and cheese was dry and had very little lobster in it. The restaurant was very bright, when we asked if the lights could be dimmed a bit we were told that there were older guest that couldn't see well. The only hightlight ironically was the magician--and I am not a fan of magic. We not go back for dinner and apres ski on the patio maybe but otherwise skip this place.

column4: 11111 NE 8th Street Level Two Bellevue, WA  98004
column13: We had excellent food and impeccable service. Not only did our waiter know the ingredients of everything we asked about, but he gave good service.

column4: 202 Newport Center Drive Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: My favorite restaurant for over 20 years!

It had been years since I had been to La Mere Michele and I was pleasantly surprised. The food was quite good - I had the filet mignon with bearnaise sauce and it was cooked perfectly. We had a very pleasant open-air table. All the benefitsof being outside without actually having to be outside. Wonderful service too.

the service was poor and the food portion/size looked like 'leftovers'. my party and I were talking (catching up) and the waitress was very impatient. she wanted to serve us and didn't appear to care whether or not we were ready to order or change courses. I had such high hopes for this restuarant; however, I was very disappointed. I will not revisit.

I would've rated this place better, but who knew July 3rd would be a busy night to go out? Our waiter did everything he possibly could to get our orders right, but just couldn't get it together...and how could he...he was basically the only one there..the manager wasn't helpful at all. Probably on a different night, it would've been a nice place to dine.
The trout was outstanding...5 star

I just had the most horrible entree in recent memory. Lamb loin with a carrot puree that was so overspiced with cumin or some horrible addition that I couldn't eat it. Oily bell peppers and practially raw coins of squash also on the plate. The lamb loin itself was ok but not up to SF standards. My companion's scallop entree with mushrooms and cauliflower puree tasted better, but was awfully salty. Haphazard service. I won't return and can't recommend it.

column4: 3121 West Benjamin Holt Drive Stockton, CA  95219
column13: Dessert is still AMAZING. But the food was fair at best. We were disappointed.
We enjoyed our time. The location seems upscale for a bowling alley. The staff was helpful and music was fun!

Because it has personalized their roll options to special features of tulsa is only one of the reasons I adore this restaurant!!! It has a great location and it ideal when your attending an event downtown. The atmosphere is fun and modern and not to mention its delicious! Some are uneasy with the notion of sushi in Tulsa, but I find that this spot could compete with all the major cities in which I've dined.
As usual the food was exceptional! All the ingredients were fresh and locally sourced. The Plate Shop is a hidden gem and even bests Poggio when it comes to creativity and quality in its dishes!
Great place and food. Service was great and the dinner menu unique too. Love the size of the place...not too small or too big. And with it even being packed you could talk at a normal pitch.
Swiss Chef is a gem of a restaurant in a location that is a little bit questionable. I can only hope that they can stay afloat there.
Very creative cocktail menu and an outstanding list of beers on tap. The burgers are delicious and definitely don't leave without trying the Black & Tan dessert.

column4: 360 Via Las Brisas, Suite 110 Newbury Park, CA  91320
column13: Gorgeous sweeping views, lovely fireplace and a playground steps away in case you want to take the kids! Such a lovely spot and the food was great.

Food tasted great. We ordered grilled shrimp and grilled chicken and enjoyed it very much. We even stayed for the entertainment and danced the night away. Haven't done that in a long time. Will definitely look for this band again when they return to our area. So fun!
Great brunch. Will definitely be going again.

column4: 2323 Van Ness Ave. San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: As always great food, great service.

column1: Tulalip Bay at Tulalip Resort Casino
column13: Great dinner, the steak was delicious!

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - Mauna Lani
column4: 68-1330 Mauna Lani Drive # 101 (located in KoHala Cove) Kamuela, HI  96743
column13: We choose Tommy Bahama's because it was close to a Hawaii Performing Arts event at the Fairmont. We had a 5 PM reservation and thought we did not need to make one as just a few tables were filled. By 6 PM the restaurant was pretty well full with diners.The food was delicious. The vanilla creme brulee in a pineapple shell dessert was wonderful. The prices are a bit on the high side but the food quality and service was worth the price.
Very good and cordial service, especially with our group which included 2 young ones. They tried to accomodate all our special needs, and did it with a smile.
5 STARS -- GREAT BIRTHDAY EXPERIENCE.
Great restaurant! AC was out, which caused some discomfort. They brought in portable units, but it was still hot.
Not much to look at from the road, but don't let that deter you from going inside.

Outstanding food with very good service. Came an hour before close and staff was pleasant and attentive. Wine list was quite good, with prices reflective of that quality. In fact, all prices here are h higher than you may be expecting. The food is worth it.

I had a comfortable window table for my solo reading. Service was pleasant, unhurried, small special requests such as extra butter were handled quickly. I went specially for the Vegetarian Stuffed Potato and it was superb as always. A real treat that I've only found at Max's.

column4: 601 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Food was good. Large menu. Very nicely decorated. Enjoyed the piano music but we must have gotten there when the players break was due because there was only music for about 15 min during our visit.

column1: Max's Opera Cafe of Palo Alto
column4: 711 Stanford Shopping Center Palo Alto, CA  94304
column13: we can always count on great food and service....

column4: 1001 El Camino Real Redwood City, CA  94063
column13: Thank You! I had a fantastic time!!

column4: 525 S. Flower Street Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: waiter service has consistently been poor, especially when it comes to drinks. You order and the drinks never arrive until you ask for it.

column4: 400 N. Toole Ave Suite 100 Tucson, AZ  85701
column13: First visit to Maynard's for Saturday brunch. We were very impressed, the food and service were outstanding. We had the croque madame and the red velvet pancakes, and both were excellent. Our waitress was very pleasant and efficient. We will definitely be back to try the other brunch menu items and probably for dinner also.

column4: 225 North Canon Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Chef Freddy prepared an incredible dinner. Each dish was better than the one before it. Highly recommend it!

column1: Prime -  La Torretta Lake Resort & Spa
column13: We went for Easter Sunday Brunch and had expected a wide variety of food including ham, fresh vegetables, and many desserts. Everything we ate was decent, but just not the selection we anticipated.
An excellent choice for a business chat or catching up with a friend over lunch. Food was well prepared and tasty and service was just right--there when you needed them but not intrusive.
Overall experience for an expensive steakhouse was poor...would not return

column4: 435 Shoreline Village Drive Long Beach, CA  90802
column13: Parker's was actually our 3rd choice for the evening. And it turned out to be the best one! We had a short wait eventhough we had a res, then got seated only few minutes after we got there. A window seat looking right out over the shoreline and the Queen Mary. Craig was an attentive waiter. Food, grilled shrimp and seafood combo over linguine was outstanding. But the Chowder was perfect! Topped off w/ and Irish liquer drink for dessert... Great night!

column1: The Mediterranean at La Valencia Hotel
column13: WE had an exceptional dinner! We'll be back!

column4: Hilton San Francisco 333 O'Farrell St. San Francisco, CA  94102
column13: Nice comfortable restaurant in the heart of SF- good place for families and visitors who want some good food in an unpretentious setting.Also, they did a good job getting us to the theater on time.
Very good food at a reasonable price!

column4: 536 Golden Gate Ave San Francisco, CA  94102
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: The lunch buffet was good with EXCELLENT service. I would not hesitate to come here agan for the lunch buffet. However, I would like to come for dinner next time to check out the food and service during that time.

column4: 1611 South Catalina Avenue Redondo Beach, CA  90277
column13: Went for the Trust the Chef Lobster Night. Loved it! The clams Rockefeller were out of control good, as was the hazelnut blueberry cobbler. Can't wait to go back!!!

column4: 600 Stockton at California Street San Francisco, CA  94108
column13: My husband and I had a late evening dinner there. We had a few drinks and the Chef's Tasting dinner. Everything was delicious!
Great food, great service. It is in the Four Seasons Hotel which brings it a bit down on ambiance but overall great. Recommended.

column4: 5825 N.W. Grand Blvd Oklahoma City, OK  73118
column13: We used Open Table to find a restaurant at the last minute because we were taking a friends elderly mother to dinner. Cafe 501 accomodated her wheelchair and we had a lovely meal. However our order appeared to get lost and the server appologized when the food finally came. The food was good but the wait was longer than it should have been.

column4: 134 West Pierpont Ave Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Both my wife and I have been going to Christopher's since the original location in Bountiful Utah and it's closing and the SLC location originally being at the Peery Hotel and now being at 134 West Pierpont Ave in SLC. The service and the food has always been excellent. We will continue to use Christopher's as one of our cherished special dining locations.

We had a party of 8 the night we went to Honu and everyone was impressed and happy. The crab sandwich seemed to be the overall hit, but the pizza's and other seafood were amazing as well. We had outstanding Mai Tai's also. The tables on the water are priceless. Our waitress was amazing and we look forward to returning to this restaurant on our next trip to Maui. We go to Maui every year and are always on the lookout for new and amazing restaurants. We are happy to say that this one will be on our MUST list every year. Their sister restaurant, MALA, right next door, is just as amazing.
Steaks were over cooked and under dressed. First time in years that I was disappointed with our meals.

Really enjoyed just about everything, just be aware that they over charge on corkage, $35 first bottle, $45 second....don't know any restuarant in the city that does this. Somewhat of a downer given the high level of food and service, I think they need to rethink this policy.

column4: 2 N B Street San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Very disappointed:-had a 9:00 pm reservation. Didn't get seated until 9:30. The hostess was not professional- Never actually had a server. First server came, took our order and never returned. The next server came 10 minutes after the first one disappeared and said she was our server and retook the order we gave the first guy. Then another server came and said our 2nd server had gone on break.-sat with empty glasses on the table the entire dinner. Asked 3 different people for refills and had given up: a fourth person came by and asked if we needed a drink.- when our waitress returned from her break, she rushed us through our dessert. Never offered us coffee or even refills on our empty glasses-overall, an unpleasant experience

column4: 4000 Five Points Blvd., Suite 119 Arlington, TX  76018
column13: We had a great time. Our waiter was the best. Would highly recommend it to everyone!!!
Food good. We all enjoyed our meals.
Great for Vegans in Contra Costa County where no purely Vegan restaurants exist.

We were seated next to a lady who was talking to imaginary people throughout the meal. Since other tables were available and she is a regular and the staff knew about her, we should have been seated further away. It was so distracting, we took our food home to eat.

column4: 9077 Santa Monica Blvd. West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: The food was excellent! Great food options. Easy to share with friends. Will be back for sure!!

Everything was perfect. Food, staff, table location, noise level- we were able to talk and me heard which was nice for a business dinner.Food could not have been any better. I had the tuna which was heavenly. Prices were just fine for the quality. Some places charge equal and don't deliver- Mercury delivered. Can't wait to go back and try some other menu items.

column4: 1730 South Val Vista Drive Mesa, AZ  85204
column13: We had a group of four adults and one child. They sat us at a table barely big enough for four people. It was awkward. We ended up snagging a chair from the table next to us. Our food was delicious as usual and our server was flamboyant. A little bit pricy so we don't dine here often.

Friendly (even over friendly) service, but the food was less compelling than our previous visit. The menu needs to evolve, and have more seasonal offerings, otherwise there is little reason to return from season to season. Nice wine list, and good summer Rose selection. Salmon dish was a very small piece of fish, with uneventful accompaniments. Needs a taste uplift and more seasoning variety.
Our "go to" restaurant. Always good food at a fair price in a nice setting.

column4: 6418 N Western Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: Outstanding! The food and service where top of the line.

Unusual fusion of Mexican & Italian cuisine. The dishes were very good, having a number of the smaller plates in order to sample, could not get enough. Menus was extensive, all fresh ingredients. The calamari & chorizo pizza were just two that were fabulous, must visit & experience.

column1: The Derby Deli & Dueling Piano Bar
column4: 27741 Crown Valley Parkway #221 Mission Viejo, CA  92691
column13: I'm glad i called to confirm my Open Table reservation, because they had no record of it, but the restaurant was awesome and they made of 12 reservation for me for the same time!!!

column4: 395 Santa Monica Place, #305N Santa Monica, CA  90401
column13: the best guacamole after 4 years !!

column4: 17603 Interstate I-10 W San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: excellent experiance....will be back
The food,drinks,and service was awesome made a great start for the evening.
The restaurant had a gluten free menu and lots of options!

column4: 3767 Las Vegas Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The food and service were tremendous. Julian was our waiter and did an outstanding job. We had the table off the kitchen, which was wonderful as we were celebrating a special occasion. Many of the Vegas steak restaurants try to get the NY feel, but Smith's does it well. We lived in NY for 15 years, and it made us feel right at home.

column4: Arizona Biltmore 2400 E. Missouri Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: I had high hopes for this restaurant, but reality fell far short of my expectations. The space and the food both seemed, well, tired and unimaginative. Disappointing, especially considering the inflated resort prices.

column4: 845 Main Street Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: I found this place on opentable and after reading reviews decided to try it last night. Beautiful building, gorgeous decor with hardwood floors, fireplace and white linen tablecloths. Our Fixe Prixe meal for $25 was outstanding, my Raspberry Lemon Drop was perfectly prepared and the service was the best we've had in Half Moon Bay, other than Navio @ The Ritz-Carlton. Our server was very on top of things and never skipped a beat. We never felt rushed, the owner was in house, pouring wine and chatting with diners. This is THE place to dine while in Half Moon Bay, we will definitely return again. We are very picky diners and this place receives a perfect ten! :)

The James Mazzio inspired menu matches the beautiful mountain setting in this Snowmass hot spot. Great reasonably priced wine list, killer beer carpaccio, outstanding kale salad, excellent lobster po'boy and cod. Be sure to try if in the area--Aspen quality and half the prices of most Aspen eateries.
This is a terrific little neighborhood hang out. Great italian at nice prices and a good wine list. Highly recommended.

column1: Timberline Grill - Ameristar Casino Black Hawk
column13: I was making reservation for 15 people at 6 o'clock. When I tried to call them they never answer the phone(I called them more than 20 times over 3 days). I invited 14 people over there so I could not cancel it. But there was no way I could make a reservation. So I just made 2 reservations over the website. And finally when I called them some one answered so I told her what I need she put me on hold. I was waiting for 10 min and hung up and called them again. I tried 3 times but 2 times I heard voice message and last time someone pick up the phone and said nothing and hung up. I don't know how they operate but they seriously need new management.

column1: NM Cafe at Neiman Marcus Topanga
column4: 6550 Topanga Canyon Blvd. Canoga Park, CA  91313
column13: Love their seasonal specialtys and cocktails.

column1: JW Marriott San Antonio - High Velocity
column13: We were just going to eat & have some drinks, then the Hostess let me know about a Special Beer Pairing Dinner. So glad she did. We had a group of 6 & we all had a Fabulous time! We will definitely be going again! Thanks!

column4: 2424 Kalakaua Ave. Third Floor Honolulu, HI  96815
column13: Kamaina discount is 10% but if you get the Ohana card it is 20% your bill. The card is free just ask your sever for details.

A very nice meal in a stylish dining room overlooking Washington Square Park. The service was very good and the food was almost all excellent. My only two notes of constructive criticism are that the dining room is very loud and that my much-anticipated hamburger arrived well-done despite being ordered medium-rare. I'll return for sure, but probably will skip the burger next time.

column4: 10885 N. Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd. Scottsdale, AZ  85259
column13: Loved the food and live music, perfect night.
We went for a birthday party on Friday evening and we had SUCH a romantic and special time. Our server was the best BEST BEST. I can't wait to go back. Everything was wonderful!!!

column4: 1555 Simi Town Center Dr. #565 Simi Valley, CA  93065
column13: For a steak place the steak was overpriced. My ribeye was thin. The asparagus side was only 5 spears and was cold. I did have a good martini with chopin vodka and blue cheese stuffed olives. If I had to pick a place to go for steak this would not be it. I would take monty's or ruth's chris over this place any day!b
Excellent service and the food was very good.

column4: 1329 N Main St. Walnut Creek, CA  94696
column13: Not crazy about the deep fried food.

we have always enjoyed dining at the Far Western Tavern, and introduced other friends to the establishment; everyone enjoyed themselves and the food was great, as usual, but this time there was a surprise since a new chef was in place; the tavern will be moving to Orcutt and there are some elements that are in progress/change; still, it was and is a great place for special events, and dinner enjoyment; we will continue to visit this fine establishment....

While pictures may be worth a thousand words (the pics on their site gave a good impression), but don't expect too much out of this place. The food was adequate; not great. The wait-staff performed like rejects from other finer establishments. As we went through our meal, we had to ask for our dishes to be taken way although pushed to the table perimeter (not hint enough). A dinner cocktail one person ordered was not made correctly, and instead of the bartender remaking the drink properly, the wait person took the drink back to the kitchen and "acted" as though she remade it -- it was not; we we were able to see her walk to the back and noticed what she did (or rather didn't do). Basically: All show, no substance and substandard quality.

It's generally a great place and you can see belly dancers and have live music with good food. However the night we went the 9:30pm show was cancelled and we ended up havIng to wait for the 11:30pm show which we couldn't stay for anymore. I gave 3 stars for the service due to the wait.

Very sad! I had reservations for 7pm when I check -in at the front desk I immediately notice something was very wrong. NO CUSTOMERS! For a saturday night it was very slow. After eating their food I know why.I think they are trying to do a good job,but they need some help in the kitchen and perhaps in marketing.
35th Street Bistro delivers a wonderful, leisurely meal. Even the salads are remarkable.

column1: Mignon - Prime Steaks, Seafood and Cocktails
column13: There was a wedding rehearsal party in the main area with a band. We were seated in a separate room but they would not shut the door for a more relaxing dinner. Our waiter was slow, my husbands's meal was late, then he got my husband's order wrong, our dessert came 30 minutes after our meal. I go there often and have always had great service. I guess they are not used to having an event and having their normal dinner guests at the same time
We made reservations for Sunday night and OPen Table did not tell us that the restaurant was not open on Sunday evening. Not good.

column4: 4029 Lincoln Blvd. Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: I love this restaurant. I drive over there from West Hollywood rather than driving to Koreatown which is much closer to me. My whole family loves the kalbi and bulgogi including my picky 3 year old. I also love their kimchee jigae, kimchee tofu and bibimbops. I want to try other items but I always gravitate towards my favorites. I highly recommend Wharo!

Our dinner experience there was very good. The great weather for eating outside helped. We arrived at the restaurant earlier than our reservation and they promptly sat us. Our server was very helpful and informative with our wine selection telling us a story of the winery which was local. I've had salmon at three different restaurants on this trip and the one at Barking Frog was the best by far.

column1: The View Restaurant at the Historic Crags Lodge
column4: 300 Riverside Dr. PO Box 480 Estes Park, CO  80517
column13: Great view with historic ambiance. Well prepared entrees from a diverse menu offering appetizing veggie options as well as tradtional fare. The Jamabalaya had a nice kick to it! Lemon cheesecake was delicious and home made. Service was very friendly and capable. The live music was a wonderful treat!
Food was ok, service was not friendly and very disappoiting. Parking was also a problem.
Best German restaurant in oklahoma by far.

column1: Paul Martin's American Bistro - El Segundo
column4: 2361 Rosecrans Avenue, Suite 180 El Segundo, CA  90245
column13: Fun and yummy.Love the banana cream "pie".

column4: 6855 4th Street NW Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, NM  87107
column13: Everything was excellent. This was our first time to Vernon's and we just loved it. I could not have been happier with our experience. We were there celebrating my fiance's birthday and we had an amazing time. We will definitely be back and telling all our friends about our experience!
This was the first time we had eaten at 4th Street Chophouse. Wait staff was great and food was outstanding. We loved the 1930's decor.
we came in not really knowing what to expect and and left knowing we will come back again.

column4: 6009 Paseo Delicias Rancho Santa Fe, CA  92067
column13: I had been to Mille Fleurs once before, so I wanted to take my friends. We were in Rancho Sante Fe, for another event, so it was also convenient.
The Chicken Anastasi is fantastic!
Great food, of course. Just a tad pricey. I understand the quality of food means it must be.

My wife and I spent our first anniversary there, and it was metiocre at best. The server was good, but as a whole, they could do a lot better. The chef could execute a little better, as the menu describes better than actual. We might try again for happy hour, or something more casual than our anniversary.
Awesome food and great service by all - especially Raoul, Bruce and Natalie. Special thanks to Daniel for whipping up such a wonderful menu that leaves you wanting more.

column4: 131 Mirada Road Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Great food, great service, great view. I've been to here twice and have no conplaints so far.
Fantastic Location, Nice Family Style Decor, best of all, Fantastic Food. Best value if you went in a group and shared, because the portions are BIG

The experience was memorable. Great service, gourmet food, beautiful ambiance...however, for us this was a special occasion, worth the price tag that was somewhat above our dining out norm for a routine Saturday night out dinner...at least for us.

column4: 24031 Marguerite Pkwy Ste C Mission Viejo, CA  92692
column13: What a nice surprise! The food was very good with nice balance and freshness. The four people at our table were all "foodies" so there was lots of discussion regarding each plate or entree. Crab cakes were light and perfectly seasoned, the artichoke stuffed poblano was delectable and the scallops were scrumptious. We all had the "family" portion of Nirvana greens with balsamic and it was a wonderful salad. Filets were buttery and in a yummy demiglaze reduction. None of us are huge dessert people but each dessert was nicely balanced.....chocolate cake was best.

Our first visit to this fine long established French Bistro, and we wondered why we took so long coming here. Excellent food in a very nice place with fine service. I loved my branzino for the entree,and my wife her lamb chops, and the smoked salmon appetizer was great. Excellent chocolate souffle for dessert. We hope to return soon.

A Avery beautiful restaurant and the view is the best. Try and ask for the table over the water fall for the best seat in the house. The sushi bar is great as well. This is a all around fun place with great food...
Wonderful, delicious food and great service in a casual place. The chef creates creative dishes that are fabulous and the staff is welcoming and efficient. All in all a lovely experience.

column1: District American Kitchen and Wine Bar
column13: We ate a late dinner here after attending a Cirque du Soleil performance out in Glendale on a Saturday night in mid-July. The food was outstanding, starting with the best calamari appetizer we've ever had. One of us had beef, the other chicken. Both were perfectly cooked, with nuanced, flavorful sauces and to-die-for side dishes. We chose a modestlypriced cabernet that we had not had before and were pleasantly surprised.The service was attentive and friendly. A great find in downtown Phoenix.
Excellent food and excellent service.

column4: 3950 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: The food and service were absolutely fantastic, as was the view. Our reservation was at 7, and there was NOONE in there. It did pick up by 8, but it was a little strange, and our voices echoed through the place. The other issue was the expense. It was very, very expensive. I think open table said something like $50/pp. It was more like $100/pp. I have no regrets--the meal truly was fantastic.
Everything from top to bottom was great from salad to dessert and the service was exceptional. Everything was so fresh and such a relief from the typical Preserved meals at Other restaurants.

column4: 62-100 Mauna Kea Beach Drive Kamuela, HI  96743
column13: Remarkable beachside setting, quality food selection (fresh seafood - lobster, crab, Ahi tuna, shrimp, oysters; prime rib; wide variety of desserts and salad options) , friendly service. Hard to beat the clambake for a memorable dining experience in Hawaii.

When we entered Zephyr, we immediately liked it. Very friendly service, warm ambiance, and excellent service. Bread and butters were amazing as was the prawns provencal. The pasta was great - perfectly prepared. So many places undercook (too al dente) the pasta but Zepher's is perfect and I am Italian by marriage! We'll definitely be back to try other entrees - you can only eat so much at one sitting. I'm really wanting to go for the chicken dinner on Sunday and also I want to try the meatloaf sliders.

column1: The Loft at Montage Laguna Beach
column4: 30801 South Coast Highway Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: The location and our server were delightful!

column4: 75-200 Classic Club Blvd Palm Desert, CA  92211
column13: Our meal was not really very good. We had a beet salad that was not crunchy as it should have been. Our scallops were cooked well but on a bed of home fries with apple shreds. There was a honey sauce around the dish edge that was strange. Very bland. All in all, disappointing.

column4: 5371 Topanga Canyon Blvd. Woodland Hills, CA  91364
column13: Solid Steak house with the best Key Lime Pie Martini's!! I enjoyed my dinner and drinks very much!!

The food here was very tasty and well served and presented. The only negative is that the outdoormre needs. Good cleaning nd spruce up. It felt very neglected and a bit run down. If they fixed up the patio I would have felt better there.

I had been to this restaurant twice before with a group of 4, 2, and lastly 12. The first two visits were more positive experiences. The service was fine but the food was just average for me. Let's just say that not one of the 12 people that ate there gave me any feedback whatsoever. I ordered the fish and chips and regretted it right after I saw it. The fish looked like a fast food fry and was absolutely tasteless. Fries were just average, nothing special. I did not finish the meal as it was too bland. My co-worker ordered a very nice spinach salad but his black bean soup was delvered cold. it took the waiter about 10-15 minutes to come back to the table to even notice it. My co-worker had time to complete this whole salad.

Outstanding experience for a special occasion trip to the small town of Murphys. Food was absolutely outstanding, service good, pleasant, helpful. Wine list good. Wines very good in a wine country setting. Very nice setting, indoors and out. Will return.

column4: 7014 E. Camelback Road Suite 1433 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Based on the time of our reservation, 6pm, the dining room was empty and very quiet. The bar area though was full with maybe two tables open. Second time dining here and we enjoyed the food and service. The reason for 4 stars on food is because the pork tenderloin didn't meet our expectations but I believe that is personal preference. Otherwise no complaints and will definitely return.

column4: 9636 East Arapahoe Rd. Greenwood Village, CO  80112
column13: After an order snafu, they recovered with style and great customer service.
This is one of our regular haunts. Love it so much that I tell everyone I meet to go there!!

column1: Mandarin Bar - Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas
column4: 3752 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: Very cool, yummy, exPENsive drinks. I had the Spicy Cucumber cocktail for $18 but loved it and got to enjoy it while facing the best view of the strip. Also had a spice cake cupcake that was awesome to look at and eat. There are very good mocktails too if you're not in the mood for drinking.

column4: 3752 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: The Bento Box Dinner, a selection of 6 small plates from a very large list of Asian dishes was excellent. The atmosphere is elegant but relaxed and the service excellent. Just what you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental restaurant.

column4: 3752 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: Love everything about this place. Food, service, and location.

column1: Twist by Pierre Gagnaire - Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas
column4: 3752 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: I was in LV for 5 nights. This was the greatest meal that I had in LV. I would nominate Twist as amongst the 5 top restaurants in the US. An amazing meal!!!!Impeccable attention to detail in every way!

The staff was wonderful and attentive. THe champagne was lovely. The food was mediocre at best, the pizza was soggy and needed to be better seasoned, very disappointing. The salads were ok, it's very expensive for what it is. The setting is lovely for lunch.
Best sushi I've had in Seattle!

column4: 2985 East Cottonwood Pkwy. Cottonwood Heights, UT  84121
column13: The Clam chowder wasn't sweet enough and not nearly enough "clam" in the Clam chowder. There were three tiny pieces of clam in the entire bowl.The main course was tasty, Atlantic Salmon, portions were way too small.Services was good

column1: Mon Ami Gabi - Las Vegas - Main Dining Room
column4: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Food was fabulous, service excellent a great place to celebrate birthdays

column4: 8440 W. Sunset Boulevard West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: Great View. Good portion of food.

Do not recommend: Cannot explain how it made Forbes top 100 list as the food is not worth the money nor deserving to be in same company as others on the list. Service was almost nonexistent and repeatedly had to ask the server for refills from water to cocktails. The server showed no interest in the menu and had to be prompted to describe specials and other menu items. The food, although different which is why we went, left us still hungry and bad taste in our mouths.

column4: 68-1330 Mauna Lani Drive, Suite 111 Kohala Coast, HI  96743
column13: Not only was the food subperb, our waiter was extremely knowledgable and attentive. It is hard to find a place where food and service are delivered at such a high quality.

Wonderful dining outdoors and the service was fantastic!! Our outdoor table was not ready when we arrived so we walked around town and the restaurant bought us a glass of wine......we loved it all! I'd recommend calling to confirm your time during high season.

Spectacular views, comfortable chairs, great service, wonderful wine, and delectable food made our dining experience delightful. The white bean hummus and the caramelized onion and cherry vassi (assorted flatbreads and crackers with a mini Mason jar of your favorite topping) were so good, we almost didn't save room for our next course, the white kale salad with roasted stone fruit. Which would have been tragic, because that was the best salad I have ever tasted. As vegans, we were already in heaven, and it only got better when the gnocchi with arugula pesto arrived. Our view of Camelback Mountain and the exquisitely comfortable chairs contributed to our decision to dine at Prado again and again.
You are paying for the view and ambiance, not the food.

column4: 233 West Santa Clara St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: We had a 6:30 dinner reservation. Upon entering, there was a large group loitering. They were waiting for a large table. Several restaurant staffers were in the restaurant reorganizing tables. We waited quite a while to get someone's attention. I ordered the grilled prawns and fava bean appetizer, and my date ordered the pasta special. The cocktails were nice. The grilled prawns were overcooked and still in the shell - HUGE - not visually appealing. The fava bean salad was good. My date was delivered the wrong pasta dish, and he had to leave the table to find the waitress to correct that. Overall, a rather disappointing dining experience.

They need more servers the lady who served us was not really happy for whatever reason. She made us feel unwelcome. She should not do this job if she doesn't like it. If you pay so much money for dinner your service should be fantastic. The food was great.

column1: Steak House at Desert Diamond Casino
column13: We have ( there are two of us ) eaten here before but never in the evening. We have never been disappointed with anything.The restaurant is well appointed; seating, tableware, glassware, locations.We might differ with the chef on his choice of vegetablesbut they came well prepared. The wine list is not extensive but their Agave house wine is more than acceptable and morethan reasonable. Their chardonnay is better than many wines costing twice as much. The service is excellent without beingoverbearing and with that we are comfortable.
The food and menu keeping getting better.

The commitment to an elevated dining experience shows in every aspect of your visit to the Marine Room. From the friendly hostesses, the superlative wait staff, to the tiniest touches that decorates each plate. You can tell that work went into the planning and compilation of every menu item, the layers of flavor delight at every turn. The food is as beautiful on the tongue as it is on the plate. So much attention is devoted to perfecting the balance of flavors and the details of the presentation that you cannot help but feel special, as if the chef prepared each dish especially for you.

column4: 143 North La Brea Los Angeles, CA  90036
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Enjoyed outside dining. Pasta dishes were particularly good. Wine list adequate. You will have a good meal if you go to Amalfi, but there are so many excellent restaurants in LA that you probably don't want to go too far out of your way to visit this nice but not outstanding place.

Fantastic place! I never miss an opportunity to dine at Aureole when in NYC and am thrilled to be able to enjoy Charlie Palmer's incomparable cuisine at his new outpost right here in downtown San Francisco. What a gem! Don't miss the cornmeal crusted oysters and the bone-in New York steak - to die for! Great wine list and the service is right on the mark. Finally, prices are fair for the ample portions of such masterfully-prepared offerings. I brought a friend who is a restaurant manager at a well-known local establishment and she was blown away. I look forward to being a regular here.

column4: 15 N. Robinson Ave. Oklahoma City, OK  73102
column13: Each time I have been to Flint has been a wonderful dining experiance.The Food is spectacular, we had a Special with Steak, Scallops, and mushrooms that I wish was on the menu every night.The service is first class, all of our meals came out promptly and simultaniously,and everything was hot and delicious.I love taking friends there for thier first time, and have plans to do that again, and again.

A Caberet experience....dining while enjoying a theatre/singing performance by the very talented cast of "Lucky So and So"! Terrific servers and great bartender, Marcie...a wonderfully different evening out!
Over all a great experiance for the eight of us.

Wife's Birthday. The host sat us right in back of a large noisy group. I could not even hear my wife's voice because the group was so loud. We asked to be moved. Now the rest of the whole entire restaurant seating was available. They sat us down in the far corner away from them. Then sat someone else on the other side of us as if the other 30 tables couldn't be used. Host made horrible choices. Waitstaff was great and the kitchen cooked great food. Wine was excellent and the $210 spent was worth it on my wife and I.

column4: 321 West Katella Ave, Suite 109 Space 109 Anaheim, CA  92802
column13: Waiter and mngr not knowledgeable about Landry card. Beer was way too expensive.
The food and service are always terrific at each of the McCormick's restaurants.

column4: 206 North Rodeo Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: It may have been an off night but the restaurant lacked atmosphere. Our server looked unsure of the menu when asked for reccomendations.
Absolutely outstanding in every way. My favorite restaurant in the country!! Be sure to ask about the large appetizer for a group of 6 or more that doesn't appear on the menu.

Every thing was fine! Appreciated the General Manager stopping by to welcome us as this was our first time here, altho we have dined at other Landry`s restaurants both here in Denver and other cities! Always #1! A Pleasant experience with excellent food! Howard Goodman

The service was very good, I appreciated the placement of my dinner party. Through an online reservation I asked for a private are for a business setting quiet enough to hear conversation. Food was great. The only suggestion would be to provide a patron with more fresh vegetables or salads this time of year. Seafood was cooked perfectly. I could tell we were the only reservation, I didn't need to say who I was before the greeter said the table was ready. Just a thought if I were a guy with a date...even fake it looking up my name just for the appearance of having a reservation being important, don't come out and indirectly say ''you're the only person that made a reservation''. The chair I was sitting on had some sticky gunk on it.

column1: Lodge Restaurant at Carmel Valley Ranch
column13: We were very pleased with the restaurant. The quality/price proposition is very compelling. The food was very good. Wines were good but not over priced. The ambiance was energetic, full of life, lots of action, nice architecture and good views. And the service was superb. What's not to like. We will be repeaters for sure. Highly recommended.

Attended business lunch at restaurant. Was quiet enough to be able to talk freely. Lashonda (our waitstaff) didn't hover and was very gracious with limited interruptions when she noticed that we were discussing business.

column1: The Mahogany Grille at the Strater Hotel
column13: The food was ok, but the service was very, very slow. Is was way too loud as well. Price was too high for what you recieved.
the sandia gazpacho was why we camewe usually eat at the T&C locationit was good

column4: 791 Town & Country Blvd. Suite 160 Houston, TX  77024
column13: We had our daughter's 18th birthday party. They bent over backwards to make her evening special. The food and service we excellent.

We were celebrating two anniversaries. Lin was our server althought the receipt said Daniel. He was excellent. Best service I've had recently. Food was very good as were the adult beverages. We ordered dessert as well and everyone enjoied their selections. Great time, great food, great atmosphere.

column4: 633 West Fifth Street, 4th Floor Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: Thomas was our waiter and really helped to get us to the theatre on time. This made our family evening work just the way we wanted it to.

column4: 335 Hughes Center Drive Las Vegas, NV  89169
column13: The smoke alarm went off when we were there. Food was good.

column4: 675 L Street Omni Hotel San Diego, CA  92101
column13: A great place to relax and enjoy a meal! Lunch was quick and delicious ?

The occasion was my brother's 75th birthday. It couldn't have been better!The food was outstanding. Our steaks were perfectly prepared (he had filet mignon;I had rib-eye). Our waiter, Brian, was extremely helpful. He suggested a wine whichturned out to be an outstanding Oregon pinot-noir. The evening was a total success!
Nice location, I liked the happy hour menu, good prices even in what wasn't included in the happy hour. The Bar area still private.
Once again, McCormick and Schmick's is second to none. Thomas was our waiter again and gave us excellent service again. Steve and Mina are also our favorites. Food was perfect.

column4: 2101 Rosecrans Avenue, Ste. 1280 El Segundo, CA  90245
column13: Rolled in very late on our reservation...later than I had even called in...like 30 minutes late and the restaurant was very accommodating..got us seated right away and service was excellent. Thanks!
We frequent McCormick's for their San Francisco ambience and their delicious fresh fish menu.

Met a dear friend for lunch. Greeting and the table given was fine. Waitress was a bit snippy and just flopped things on the table. Regretfully, I still tipped her well out of empathy, not fir good service. Will not be going back to that restaurant - there are lots of other choices.

column4: 900 North Point Street at Ghirardelli Square San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: The beginning of our dinner was a bit disappointing. It took 20 minutes to get our wine and 25 minutes for the salad and soup to arrive. After a slow start the beet salad was a good size portion but a bit too much vinegar. The clam chowder was very tasty. I had the Halibut and my husband had the Copper River Salmon and both were very good. The view is wonderful and the tables at various levels allows everyone to enjoy them.

The dining experience overall was a good one but I, and my friends, felt that we weren't taken seriously because of our youth. Money is money, and whether I'm spending it at your establishment or at another makes no difference to me. Stop treating youth as if we're not valid patrons. Beyond that, the view was spectacular and I could happily eat your food all day long, it was delicious.

column4: 170 South Market Street San Jose, CA  95113
column13: We loved the food. The service was a little sparse and they seemed very busy. I would still go back because my cashew crusted tilapia was brilliant. The reservation system online was a huge help...we were seated at our reservation time and saw others (without reservations) around us given a longer-than-an-hour wait time.
A very nice lunch spot. Fresh seafood though not a large menu.
The food is delicious. The atmosphere is very romantic. Great place to take a loved one for a special occassion!

When you're in the mood for seafood, this is an excellent and reliable choice. My sockeye salmon was grilled perfectly. They also have half-bottles of wine, which is nice when your spouse will only drink one glass. When the bar is full--which is normal--the noise can carry over to the restaurant tables.

column4: 3600 Las Vegas Blvd S. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Beautiful Bellagio fountain show seeing.

Indian food in the Bay Area has been getting much better in the last few years, and this place is raising the bar even higher. The "Kurauni Jhinge" special (prawns with milky almond coconut gravy) was extraordinary, and the Navratan Korma was rich and flavorful. The special naan (stuffed with coconut, cashew, raisin and cherry) was light, yummy, and crispy with no burnt spots, and the drinks (a lemonade and a lassi) were delicious and as beautiful as fancy cocktails.
A moderately priced hibachi grill restaurant. Great entertainment with chef. Good food and sushi/rolls.

column1: C-Street at The Crowne Plaza Ventura Beach
column13: The Chef's menu hinted at a bigger talent than what was offered by a fairly limited menu. Nonetheless, a worthwhile hotel restaurant! Quite enough for a romantic but casual meal.

column1: Mountain View Restaurant at Cheyenne Mountain Resort
column4: 3225 Broadmoor Valley Rd Colorado Springs, CO  80906
column13: I liked this restaurant. The food was tasty and hot. They had a lunch buffet that was reasonably priced but we opted to order off the menu. The kids pizza was small, round and frozen. I did not like the fact that the soda drinks were $2.79 each even for the kids. My 12 year old had the club sandwich and it was huge. I had the rueben and it was a bit dry but I enjoyed it nonetheless. The view is beautiful and if you get a chance to eat outside you should. We had to eat indoors but got a window seat. Bad choice. The sun at 1PM beat down on us throughout the skylights. They should have some cover for it. The service was my only complaint. Although the waitress was nice, she was not attentive. I would go back.
We celebrated a friend's birthday. Everything was great! Service, food, drinks!We willbe back.

column4: 839 Paseo De Peralta Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: It is definitely a locals place. If you enjoy food, then you must try "The Bomb". The only draw back was the lack of a full liquor license wich ment no margarita with great food.

column4: 495 S Grand Central Pkwy Suite A116 Las Vegas, NV  89106
column13: Overpriced for Mexican cuisine. Good tasting but not exceptional.

I havent been here for a while. Decided to try the Sunday brunch once again. Open Table noted to confirm if available, so I phoned and the voice on the other end was receptive and inviting. Experience was lovely as I had remembered from previous visits. Good service and delightful selection.

Our 3-night mid-week stay at "Cavallo Point--the Lodge at Golden Gate" was made even better by the excellent food and service and friendly energy of the Murray Circle Restaurant and the entire Cavallo Point staff!A great combination of beach resort and the Catskills of old. Great view of San Francisco Bay and the Golden Gate Bridge from the porches of the restaurant and our room, easy walk to several excellent viewpoints. Very nice!
nice japanese tapas place, just like the one in santa monica & Torrence, will go back for sure.

Upon arriving, the host did not know our reservation was made through Open Table. Clearly they had not looked at it because tables in the area where we requested seating were not set. We were led there anyway, then sat and waited for several minutes before any staff approached. We finally got up and retrieved menus from another table. The waitress was inattentive and unprofessional. The appetizer of veggie fries was good. The Caprese salad and Caesar salad were good but VERY overpriced. The gnocchi was much too heavy and the pasta with meatballs was not good. We've tasted more interesting tomato sauce out of a jar and the meatballs were dry as a bone. We didn't even bother staying for coffee and dessert, and won't be going back. Too bad!
The Blackened Scallop Salad was fantastic. We were able to sit outside and enjoy the magnificent view. Good value for the quality.
We had a great time. The service was extra ordinary. We could talk and not have to shout which was wonderful for the evening.
We were in town celebrating my husbands birthday, and it was the perfect place for a romantic dinner.

The food is fantastic but the service was very slow or maybe just culturally relevant!Don't go if you are in a hurry!The atmosphere is more cafe style and outdated, could use a good sprucing up...BUT, again, the food was wonderful!

Service was not the greatest. We ordered some sashimi and rolls and asked that the sashimi come out before our rolls. Needless to say all the food came out at once. Wait staff never came by after our food was brought out to ask how the food was or offer any drink re-fills. I could have understood some of these actions if the place was busy but there were only a few tables occupied. The food overall was ok. I've had better rolls at my local Publix Grocery Store.

column4: 2892 South Coast Highway Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: Love Tabu. Always go there when visiting Laguna Beach.

column4: 41 Hugus Alley 1 Colorado Plaza Pasadena, CA  91103
column13: This place is tucked inside of a plaza between Fair Oaks and Delacy on the northern side of the block and offers a simple menu. We had the portobello fries, the portobello sandwich and the angus burger. The fries, onion rings, and portobello fries needed some salt, but other than that, was fried perfectly. The angus burger had a nice flavor, but was nothing special. The portobello sandwich is a definite must-try. It is probably one of the best vegetarian burgers I have ever had. Outdoor seating on the patio is nice, and indoor seating was nice as well. The decor was simple and modern, and the waiting staff was very helpful and so was the manager.

column4: 534 Washington Blvd. Marina Del Rey, CA  90292
column13: Mouthwatering Delicious pizza. Everyone should try one of their specialty pizzas!

column4: 800 W. Coast Highway Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: Food was great! Although, if you're not a "foodie" you may have trouble with the menu. For instance, the pizza had Speck on it (smoked prosciutto). I had to ask the waitress to explain several dishes to me because they use a lot of Italian food items with no explanation, but she was very pleasant and helpful in doing so.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - NB
column4: 455 Newport Center Drive Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: Went for a family birthday celebration and we had a table in the wine cellar. It was very quiet and ambient. The upstairs restaurant is very loud. The staff were excellent and very attentive. We all ordered different entrees and the food was great.

column4: 251 East Coast Highway Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: Their unlimited mimosas for only $10 are a steal and the waitress never let our drinks fall below the half way mark. Food was a pleasant surprise: chilaquiles were surprisingly light and refreshing, and their french toast was rich and decadent. Will definitely be back and have been telling others about this place.
Food was over cooked, veggies had no flavor and server misserved an order and replated onto correct diner-awkward ! Service was efficient.

column4: 453 Newport Center Drive Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: I tried the butterfish for the first time. I had high expectations since a lot of reviewers recommend it. Well, let's just say that after taking my first bite, I knew it was overrated. I mean, it was decent. But not worth the price point at being one of the most expensive items on the menu. It was soft and tender, but nothing special. Good thing there was dessert: chocolate souffle. That made up for it.
Very friendly and attentive waiters.

column4: 120 N. Robertson Blvd. West Hollywood, CA  90048
column13: Disappointing experience. The food was very salty.

column4: 60 West Market Street Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Food very average. Not worth the price. Service was very good.

column4: 2620 Regatta Drive Suite 106 Las Vegas, NV  89128
column13: Had a wonderful time. Great food, music, atmosphere. I would recommend this place to many of my friends.

column4: 136 Country Club Drive Mountain Village, CO  81435
column13: Incredible view, food and service. My new favorite in Telluride. Bacon Mac and Cheese is very good!
Great place for both dining and live music!
Great ambience and food at Trace. Real makeover from the previous E&O. Food was great.

Deno's is a dining institution in Winter Park. Their happy hour is very good. Our favorite waiter made the dining experience delightful. They have lots of tables on the patio for al fresco dining when the weather permits.

My date and I had an excellent time. It was our first visit at the restaurant and we were very impressed with the service, food, and atmosphere. It was very pleasant and I highly recommend this restaurant.

column4: 3600 Kirby Drive Suite H Houston, TX  77098
column13: An excellent meal - the salmon and watermelon was as good and as creative as anything at Uchi, the smoked duck salad is becoming a favourite of ours and the signature rolls were perfection.

column4: 3190 S. Lincoln Ave Steamboat Springs, CO  80487
column13: I describe it as High End Blue Ribbon Cuisine but this locals favorite restaurant has great food and is family friendly. It is especially great out on the patio in the summer with views of the mountains. It is next to the Holiday Inn but do not let that scare you as it is locally owned and operated.

Our business group meets several times each year at the DFW Hyatt Regency for a two day conference. We always look for a great restaurant near the hotel to kick things off. Ferarri's without question is the best we've ever found! From the warm greeting by the owner, the beautiful display of specials and appetizers, the spectacular wine list, the wonderful and creative menu to the superior service, this place cannot be beat! It was fantatic!

The last time we ate at Gaido's was more than a let down. This time was superb. Our waitress, Katya, was very attentive and made the experience five-star worthy. Way to bounce back, Gaido's. I will recommend you again.

column4: 453 North Canon Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: We enjoyed everything we had here. The Vodbox is a neat and different way to learn about vodka...worth the extra price for a one time photo opp and experience. Would like to see a few more appetizer options on the menu, but that would be my only suggestion

column4: 570 Higuera St. Suite 130 San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: We are always delighted when we eat at Mama's Meatballs. The service was great and the food was excellent, as always.

Pleasant restaurant connected to local hotel. Seems like locals go here. We went early on a sunday @ 8 a.m. because it is one of few places open near the Angel Island Ferry. The food was just fine; nothing fancy not great; not bad.
The 48hr braised beef short rib was AWESOME! tender and literally melts in your mouth (:
Great customer, the food and wine was just divine...every bite of my steak was an explosion on my tastes buds going crazy...hands down the best steak I ever had!

column4: 315 Main St. Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: Great sauces. Wonderful lasagna. Really good desserts. Very friendly and attentive staff.
Excellent food and great service, was crowded when we arrived, but we were able to grab a bottle and wine and chill outside until our table was available.

"I loved the coziness and a very homely feel of this place - very relaxed and comfortable. I definitely would return to try more dishes. Between the four of us we ordered three lamb dishes and we shared them all. All of them very tentalizing to a foody. It was very well cooked and tender meat, everyone loved the food. Service was well-timed and friendly."

Amazing scotch selection and an extremely knowledgable waitress to guide us through it. Great food and service in a stylish atmosphere. We will defintiely be back the next time we are in San Francisco!
The Dine LA menu was inventive and fun. It was a great value, letting you pick 5 choices from 4 categories. We plan to go back!
The meal was excellent, all of our party were very happy with the selections and the quality of the food. The service was very attentive and professional.

column4: 3713 W Sahara Ave. Las Vegas, NV  89102
column13: Don't let the outside of this place fool you... THE FOOD IS AWESOME! Now we are not exactly "young folks" so when we walked to a very dark and a bit loud eating/bar area - my wife and her mother were a bit taken aback, and not sure where I was bringing them! After a bit of resistance at first, which our server RONNIE did a fantastic job of handling - we settled into a nice booth in front of a magnificent bar playing ratpack movies. I tried one of the many creative cocktails which are neatly presented in their menu. Happy hour offered some REAL BARGAINS on delicious and juicy steaks! And the Wedge Salad was one of the best and biggest I have ever enjoyed! If you are looking for a fun and festive eating experience... this fits the bill.
Food was great, I really enjoyed the steak that I ordered. Service could be a little more attentive.

Eight of us arrived for dinner on a Sunday night, and our table was ready and waiting for us as we walked in. We were served immediately and had delicious bruchetta as an appetizer. We ordered various pasta dishes including veal ravioli, chicken fetachini, seafood linguini and traditional spaghetti bolanese (pardon the spelling). Each dish arrived piping hot, with a generous portion on the plate, and lots of flavor. We shared a number of desserts from fresh berries to chocolate cake and they too were delicious. We felt the value was very good for the meal we enjoyed, and each of us said we would return to try out some of the other dishes on the menu. The painted murals on the walls also added a lot of character to the restaurant.

Beautiful location, great food and service. Got the table I requested. Prices have gone up a bit, but still pretty good! Nice little bar with good beer selection. I hear they have live music Thurs-Sun and never a cover! I look forward to going back when music is happening. Lots of good pub food to choose from. I have had the Pretzle Chicken w/mashed potato & vegi's twice in a row, so delicious. I must move on to the Fish and Chips, Tri tip sandwich, Mac and Cheese sounds great. Many fish dishes too. Saw the Fish/Chips,they looked really good. The Onion Ring appetizer was great, enough to share with my wife! We love it here, friendly attentive staff. Nice little pub in a beautiful setting to get away and have some good food,drink, & music!

First courses were lovely. Never miss the heirloom tomatoes grown on property. The main courses were not up to the same standard. The black cod while perfectly cooked, needed some seasoning. The NY steak was over cooked and lacked any seasoning. Desserts are exquisite, not so much the coffee (decaf was burned and appeared to have spent too much time in pot). The service was spot on.
Great food and location. Make sure to have reservations. It is a small place.

column4: 1111 East Burnside Fourth Floor Portland, OR  97214
column13: I had one of the best dishes in my dining experience there... with produce from the rooftop garden and such a fresh and interesting mix of flavors... it was awesome! Called Campfire S'mores it had fava beans, quinoa, mole and ricotta cheese cakes, cleverly arranged to look like S'mores. Best of all, it was delicious.

column4: Hard Rock Hotel, 4455 Paradise Road Las Vegas, NV  89169
column13: Server was funny and attentive.Food was amahzing- a little on the oversalted end but fish was Fresh and everything was great tasting.Be prepared to spend quite a bit for small portions.

column4: 1119 N 1st Street, Unit A Grand Junction, CO  81501
column13: It's nice have some place different than the same old burger or Italian joint to eat at. The restaurant has a hip ambiance to it.

column4: 9255 Sunset Blvd Suite 100 Los Angeles, CA  90069
column13: Came because of a coupon - we loved it! The food was great especially the grilled branzino. Our waitress, Kelly, was one of the best waitresses we have ever had. Really worth a try

Calm and relaxed environment. Small dining area, but never even noticed other people dining. Wonderful service, great food, and a great wine list. We were also very excited to find out we came in on a free wine tasting night! Recommend highly to anyone looking for a nice date location, romantic dinner, or a nice lunch. The prawn gnocchi was awesome and my fianc loved the chicken dish and the beef carpaccio appetizer. Also, a wonderful dessert menu.

column4: 3325 Las Vegas Boulevard South Palazzo Hotel and Casino Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Best steakhouse restaurant in LV!The bar tenders (Cooper and ??sorry) were amazing! True drink mixologists extrordanaire! They even allowed me the priviledge of sampling a few spirits to educcate my palate such as Buddha's Hand Vodka and Mertelli. Their suggestions for dinner were spot on! The steak tartare is the best in the US. The Colorado lamb chops were pretty amazing!Thank You!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

column4: 4200 East Palm Canyon Drive Palm Springs, CA  92264
column13: This was not our first visit to the Parker Palm Springs. We knew what to expect--great food and service in a "happy chic" resort. We wandered the beautiful gardens and visited the one-of-a-kind lobby bar before dinner. I love that each past occasion the experience has been unique and exquisit.
Great restaurant! I frequent the Kierland location as well. This locations menu is a little different as I learned it is where they test new items. Loved it! Go, go, go here!
Again, North was spectacular. We love this place and will continue to dine there.

This website asked, "How was the North Beach Restaurant?" You don't ask that question about this restaurant. It is a Classic with a capital C, and always has been. They couldn't do anything wrong if they tried.
$12.95 pasta special (get one now, and and get a complimentary order to take home) was a HUGE hit with our group of 11. Great food, always enjoy eating here.

We sat at the 'kitchen table' - actually in the kitchen! Service was fantastic, all the waiters showed us what they were serving and what was in it - a blast for everybody at the table. It's a little noisy, but worth it!

column4: 15024 N. Scottsdale Rd, Suite 160 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: I have been to North twice before and the food has become bland and mediocre. The highlight of the meal was the bruschetta, which is not a good sign when the entree cannot compete with the appetizer.

this was our second trip to Nosh. We arrived about five minutes late and ended up at the bar for at least 30 minutes. I spoke with the owner and he told me he could not remove people from a table, which I appreciated...but then.... He was,however, most attentive with our table and made sure we were happy with the rest of the evening.

column4: 121 South Tejon Street Suite 121 Colorado Springs, CO  80903
column13: While we were able to make a 9:00 reservation, we felt pressured to order so the kitchen could close down. Interesting concept of small plates. Great apportunity to try chicken & waffles, which were good but would have preferred boneless chicken. Calamari wasn't great. Beet salad was good & hummus was pretty good. Tried 2 desserts- chocolate cake was ok but icing was a a bit waxy like a ring ding! The lollipop sampler was great- loved them!It looks like it would be a happening place on the weekend, but was VERY slow on a Thurs night. Very loud techno music was a bit of a turnoff.

When are we going to have good Brazilian food in Marin? We were so excited to be there on a day the chef made feijoada and it was delicious! We'll definitely be back. Everything written about this place is true - really good food in generous portions with extremely personable service.

column4: Palms Casino Resort 4321 W. Flamingo Rd. Palms Hotel Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: My filet was well-done when I had requested medium so I sent it back since I'm not paying $55 for something I didn't order. The worst part is the fact that they came back and told me that the chef said it was actually cooked to a perfect medium so the lighting must have been bad in the dining area. I don't think I've ever felt so insulted in a restaurant in my life. On the plus side they did bring me a new steak that, of course, was cooked medium-rare but at that point my date was half done eating her bland chicken dish and we had a show to go to...
My chicken was undercooked rubbbery and douced in oily wine sauce with un-cooked garlic. when i sent the plate back for plain spaghetti, they charged me 7 dollars for it.

column4: 726 Higuera Street San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: I had the salmon salad. I enjoyed everything in the salad and that it was a light dish. My friend had the duck mole. He really enjoyed the duck and mole, but wasn't impressed with what accompanied it.

column4: 8112 East Coast Hwy. Newport Beach, CA  92651
column13: Always a nice way to end the evening with great food, wine and music in an upscale environment.

column4: 19263 E US HWY 24 Woodland Park, CO  80863
column13: Slow, Slow, Slow....I expected so much more after reading their sister resturant was the Pepper Tree.

The restaurant is lovely. The food is okay--nothing special. The night we were there, the service was terrible. They apologized again and again--in between keeping us waiting for ten minutes or more each time. It took 20 minutes to be recognized and ten minutes more just to get water. They kept telling us they were very busy--there were several empty tables all around us. Even the wine took about 10-15 minutes to deliver. We were disappointed.

column4: 330 S. Hope St. Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: Delicious food, good service, and can't beat the no corkage fee.

column4: 1730 W. Randol Mill Rd. Suite 146 Arlington, TX  76012
column13: Was everything I expected and more. Wait staff was very friendly and patient, explained all of the dishes to us and even gave us a history on some of the dishes. The food was delicious and the presentation was actually better than the pictures on the website. This was our first experience with Peruvian cuisine and we will definitely be making this a regular stop .

column4: 3790 S. Las Vegas Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89103
column8: New York New York Hotel & Casino
column13: We never fail to visit Il Fornaio when traveling to Vegas. Food and service are consistently very good.

We were enteraining an out of town guest and used Opentable to make the reservation while enroute to the resturant. After arriving and checking in with the host we were seated immediately although 30 minutes early. The meal was excellent as usual.

Perfect place for a pre theatre dinner. The staff was friendly and very efficient. Delicious halibut, perfectly prepared. Scallops and salmon were moist and tender. They made sure we made it too the theatre on time.

column4: 5061 Westheimer Rd Suite 8050 Galleria Houston Houston, TX  77056
column13: This is a resturant that my wife and I have gone to several times for our own dining. I was confident that it would be good for a business lunch. I was wrong.

column4: 1029 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Great neighborhood place. Food is excellent. Interior of restaurant looked pretty worn and tired, but service was great.

column1: The Oak Room - The Westin St. Francis
column13: My husband loved his prime rib!
Wonderful service despite a large fundraising event outside.

column4: 400 J Street Gaslamp District San Diego, CA  92101
column13: Came here in a rush before a play at the San Diego civic theatre. Deffinitley need to come back to enjoy everything. Started off with the amazing crab cakes very good and reccomend! The fish was amazing I believe I had the sea bass and it was really good! Did not have time for the dessert but the next time we stop in I will make sure to leave room for their specialty dessert! Deffinitley coming back!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: I had the Chicken Scallopini and it was very good. The Apple Struedel was wonderful!

Restaurant did not live up to our expectations of a gourmet chef at a beachside location. Tried it on DineLA week, but had to ask for DineLA menu, as it was never mentioned. They tried to push the regular menu. Outside dining was all right, but not enough heat lamps. Food was quite average. Shrimp with cous-cous quite minimal-they sliced shimp in halves. Main course of their take on Boulabaise was just a fish soup with various fish. Not good. Think this is a restaurant for guests of hotel, but not a destination for others. Had a guest, and everyone was underwhelmed

column4: 17500 Depot Street, Suite 180 Morgan Hill, CA  95037
column13: I had the special skirt steak and my wife had the salmon, both were excellent. The service was very good for a weekend which was nice since we were seated outside in the garden area. We had the scallops for a starter which were very tasty. And my wife always enjoys the tzatziki. And the Jason Stephens, Estate Zinfandel was nice for $13 a glass.

I loved the food. It was a little pricey in the end though. I believe that what was lacking was the ambiance. I love those little Japanese hole-in-the-wall restaurants, however, they need to clean their carpet to get rid of the strange musty smell they have. Other than that everyone and everything was fabulous. My boyfriend and I make it a hobby to find good places to dine at but for the price I paid, I would say that they need to clean up their carpet or their chair upholstery.
Burrata people! Burrata! So delicious.

This place seems very apropriate for the 20 or 30somethings who want to hang out, drink, and look at scantaly-clad girls. It was not a good place for any sort of date due to the noise. Decor was very interesting. With the way the servers were dressed, I would only hope that Saddle Ranch is not a 'kid-friendly' place.

column4: 1000 Universal Hollywood Drive Universal City, CA  91608
column13: Good place to go before going to the Gibson. Terrific menu. Service good (it was Sunday evening - quite busy). Very "active".
Had a great date with my wife. The food was very good , our server Bert was great he took great care of us and all his other tables.
Excellent, fresh and creative cuisine and the service was fantastic.
Really impressed by the warm welcome, cheerful service and wide choice of high quality Western food.
Great food and service easy to see why they were voted best restaurant in Monterey for last ten years. I had the Alaskan Halibut. The chef really knows how to do fish it was perfect.
Made my boyfriends 40th Birthday really special! Perfect food and service!

i've been here once before and i thought it was a wonderful place so i decided to take my girlfriend here for the first time and made some reservations online beforehand. i get there on time and end up waiting nearly 30 minutes to be seated. i understand that when it's full and people stay longer its difficult to reserve a table. but what's the point of a reservation if these accommodations can't be met with reasonable time? To top it off we got sat in that little corner table that to me, seemed like the neglected corner table. no view and just crammed in next to the fireplace. we ended up getting moved to a better table so it made things better. But overall, pretty good food and great ambiance. Just work on the reservation timing part.
Sushi ran delivers the very best in sushi in the bay area. it is an icon that has stood the test of time.Yoshi is a genius.

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: The food was decent, if unexceptional, but service was so poor as to completely overshadow the experience. I understand that they experience a higher volume of customers than they are used to for Dine LA week, but their inability to anticipate and adjust to that fact destroys my faith in their ability to provide a high quality experience the other 51 weeks of the year.
Sat outside. Good view. Fabulous lasagne and salmon. Casual with great food.

The Off Vine for sure has great history and ambiance, however the food didn't match up with the charm and the service of the place. The wine was warm, and I mean above room temperature warm. For the price they charge for the wine, I believe they could definitely invest in a wine chiller. Service was very pleasant, and we did enjoy our visit, but as for the food, there are much better choice in the neighborhood for sure.

Everything about Roosters was just okay. We had the burgers, which were okay. The onion rings and homemade root beer were okay. Our waitress was okay. The patio was nice and surprisingly breezy and cool on such a warm day. My advise is to choose one thing and do it really well, because right now you are doing a lot at a mediocre level.

column4: 3645 Las Vegas Blvd South Bally's Hotel and Casino Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The service was the worst I had ever had! This place can't handle the busy time at all!

column4: 420 W. Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The food was excellent and the service was top notch.

column1: The Mantel Wine Bar and Bistro
column13: This is the third time my wife and I have visited this restaurant and we absolutely love it. The food is delicious. The sea bass is incredible. They have great steaks which I have gotten every time, but I just may have to get the fish next time. We are always wanting to find cozy little establishments with great food and this one fits the bill. The atmosphere is perfect. Great for a special occasion or just a romantic evening. We have tried a of other restaurants in OKC and this one is quickly becoming our favorite. If I had one wish it would be that the chocolate chip bread pudding could be a year round dessert. I am counting down the days until it returns!
