Good Food, great service....prices are high, so I would save this for a special occasion.
The sashimi and sushi are always super fresh. My husband loves to order the different combo dinners that include sashimi. Always delicous!

Food was good, actually really good. The setting is great right in Old Town. But honestly they need to get their service in line. The waitress served us two sake drinks with our appetizers and then asked for my I.D. when I ordered a Long Island Iced T?! Since I had left it in the car, she wouldn't serve me the second drink. Since we apparently had more than one server, I asked the other server that came to the table and he got it. They need to structure their staff better (or in the first place). And from what I've seen online this isn't the first time a service issue has popped up for this establishment...honestly would never come back because of that.

In the main course for my wife the chicken was tough. When the waiter did eventually come by and ask how the meal was, he did take it back and provide another. The chicken was better, but still not really tender. My dish had beef and shrimp. These and vegetables were tasty, but the beef was chewy.Service was poor. The waiter did not bring rolls until we requested them and took a long time to come by to check on our food.The table was for 2, but was very tight.

Food was delicious and plentiful. Really enjoyed the Chorizo Cheese Crisp. The waiter was friendly but not the best at refilling drinks. Signage suggests some good Happy Hour prices. Parking is iffy in Old Town Scottsdale. Would definitely return.

column4: 7135 E. Camelback Road, Suite 195 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: This was my first visit to the restaurant and I thought it was nice and the food was good. However, my husband ordered the Monk fish and the portion was very small for the price. I think I would keep this on my list for lunch and not dinner for that reason.

column4: Jack London Village 14301 Arnold Drive Glen Ellen, CA  95442
column13: This is the second time we have been to Olive and Vine. The food is excellent and the wait staff very attentive. It is very warm in the restaurant even though they have fans going and a door or two open. On a hot day, not the place you want to be!!!

column4: 111 North Post Oak Lane Houston, TX  77024
column13: FIRST TIME DINING THERE. Had a party if nine. Not sure if waiting over one hour for food her is the norm. I had shrimp sandwich and fruit. sandwich was good and fruit fresh.

July 2012 update Renamed Cucamonga Brewing. Basically same place same interior different wait staff. Ho-Hum is the best I can say. It was Compass Creek, then Omaha Jack's, now Cucamonga Brewing. OK for a deserted, quiet lunch, in a big dark room with friendly wait staff.

Little resemblance to a French Bistro. I have no comment about pastries which I have not tried and which are alleged to be backed on the premises. Quiche was mediocre, not even close to the quality one finds in an ordinary restaurant in Paris. Salmon Omelet was fair. "French toast" (the menu says it is made from crushed croissants) is soggy, overly sweet glop.
Our favorite for dinner. We've tried many, and always come back to Le Papillon. It should have Michelin stars.
They did a great job with our group of nine. Great food. Vibrant scene.Below ground setting makes a bit of a hideaway.Wonderful for having a different experience.

First visit for me; my date occasionally visited the lounge/bar for live entertainment. It was a very enjoyable experience. Service was impeccable; our waiter was quite knowledgeable and my date, who was raised in a fine dining environment, appreciated his suggestions. It was almost empty when we arrived early (6:30) on a Saturday, since we wanted plenty of time to chat and peruse the menu. Quiet enough for one of the chefs to overhear my date's animated and informed comments regarding the menu items and wine list. He surprised us with some delectable morsels that even my unrefined palate was able to appreciate. Menu included 'cordon blue' selections, along with simpler fare (mac n' cheese and delicious pizzas); all reasonably priced!

Our first time and, wow, what a great experience! Our waiter (unfortunately, we didn't get his name) was phenomenal. Great suggestions on everything, from the cheese platter right through to dessert. We'll definitely be back and we'll bring friends with us.

column4: 3760 E Inland Empire Blvd Ontario, CA  91764
column13: Very good time, and food was good. Would have liked the chef to be alittle more exciting. But everything else was good.

column4: 2550 S. Rainbow Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89146
column13: Good Greek food in Las Vegas has been difficult find, but this is one with authentic ambiance and food. The adorable waitress was efficient, knowledgable and willing to make suggestions.Our guest had never eaten Greek food before, so the sampler was a great choice. It consisted of dolmades, roast leg of lamb, meatballs, mousaka, gigantes, potatoes and vegetables. A great way to experience tastes of Greek food. Other foods sampled included flaming Saganaki, Greek salad, vegetarian combo, and grilled chicken breast served with lemoned potatoes and vegetables.A very nice meal was enjoyed by all. I believe that there is music played on certain nights, but the weeknight we were there there was no music, thus it was a nice quiet dinner.

column4: 5455 East High Street Suite 115 Phoenix, AZ  85054
column13: We were pleasantly surprised to find Ocean Prime within a short jaunt from our condo at Marriott's Canyon Villas. The tuna and the crab cake appetizers were awesome. French onion soup was as good as homemade. The entres ( scallops, twin lobster tails, and filet were excellent. Really enjoyed this place. An interesting wine list, along with the enormous cocktail pours rounded out the wonderful meal. Service staff was excellent and even had a quick chat with the GM who had relocated from Columbus. Decor alone was worth the trip.

My wife and I celebrated our 13th wedding anniversary at Ocean Prime. We did not know what to expect, as it was recommended by my manager. We found our experience to be delightful. There were rose petals shaped like a heart on the table when we arrived. The staff acknowledged our anniversary over and over again. The wait staff was excellent and the food was wonderful. My wife especially loved her scallops and her shrimp cocktail. Our waiter was knowledgeable and helpful. Everything was 5 star. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a great place to celebrate an anniversary or any other significant event. Very romantic evening. Great job Ocean Prime.

Went to Ocean prime to celebrate both my wifes and my own 30th birthdays as well as our anniversary, all of which are with in give days of each other so we we're looking for an experience fit for such a rate occasion. Ocean prime was more then we could've ever expected everything was amazing the food was unbelievable, some of the best we have ever had. I would highly recommend the ribeye it was ridiculously delicious. The service was the most impressive part of the night very polite,genuine, professional and work perfectly like a team. I'd you are looking for a place to celebrate or want to take some one out for a special night this is the place. I can't wait to go back.

column4: 206 N. Santa Cruz Ave. Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: We spent our anniversary here.
very positive experience, server was great,food was excellent,a real upbeat and in restaurant

column4: 44500 Indian Wells Lane Indian Wells, CA  92210
column13: consistently good! can't beat that!
Excellent staff and very personable. Can not wait to return.

column4: 3143 Stevens Creek Blvd San Jose, CA  95117
column13: I've been here several times and it's been great. After this time I will never return. Service terrible, energy of wait staff non-existent, food terribly oversalted. Very disappointed.

column1: The Country Club - Wynn Las Vegas
column4: 3131 Las Vegas Boulevard South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: This place is the best kept secret in LV!

Would help if the wait staff speak louder when the music is up.Uncovering of plates not coordinated and one of the 5 meals was not hot. All in my party like coming; of course we like the price, too. Staff missed offering coffee with dessert. We take into account that everyone is learning....we'll be back!

A group of us from work came here for a welcome lunch. The place had only about two other tables of guests. Although the food was very good, it took a very long time to get served. It's so frustrating to be in an empty restaurant and have to wait over 30 minutes to get your lunch order. This has happened before at Belden Taverna. We would have ordered dessert, but there was no time as we had to rush back to work. Unfortunately, I probably won't go back for lunch again, because I never have that much time to kill.

column4: 14694 Orchard Parkway, Suite 400 Suite 400 Westminster, CO  80023
column13: The blackened fish tacos were very good. Highly recommended
Our family enjoys the shelled peanuts in the barrel as we enter and at our table.

A business associate and I went to Borobudur for an early dinner. A very pleasant atmosphere and attentive service. There was a nice large selection of dishes and the food was served promptly. Both of our meals were very tasty and I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Had a reservation for 3, was seated at my table, asked the staff to make sure my other two people were aware that I was seated. After being repeatedly told that my other guests were not there, I discovered they were there 20 minutes later when they texted me. Beautiful room, great location, food not flavorful, weak waiter/hostess.

column4: 1814 South Pacific Coast Highway Redondo Beach, CA  90277
column13: This is not a restaurant I would have picked on my own. We heard about it from one of the girls that dined with us. Before I get into the food, our waiter Martin needs to be commended for his fun personality and warm hospitality. All of the food was delish, with ample portions! The chips are so good!(homemade) They are not too thick and they were brought out hot with the salsa (very good as well). We added Guacamole. OMG!We got another basket of chips! I ordered a Chile Rellano to go and tasted a bite. When I go back, I am ordering this! BTW-you gotta try the Pomegrante-Ginger Margarita!TDF!

column4: 1 S. Main St Las Vegas, NV  89101
column13: Just outstanding! Celebrated my husband's special birthday there and made a whole "mob" theme. Visited the mob museum and then dinner at Oscar's Steakhouse. The dinner was the icing on the cake. Good menu choices and great food. Our waiter and bus person were wonderful and everyone was very attentive including the broads. Had a great view of Fremont Street which added to the fun. We will be back!

One of the best places I have been to lately. John the wait or was extremely helpful and cordial letting us know about the history if the restaurant. Food was awesome. The outdoor seating was large and roomy and the sounds from the fountains reminded me of Italy. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants an incredible dining experience.

column4: 11712 San Vicente Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90049
column13: Consistently solid every time. With all the Italian restaurants in the area, Osteria Latini continues to stand out as Owner/Chef Paolo prepares wonderful, flavorful dishes at reasonable prices. Our favorite!

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: This is a tiny restaurant with a modern, clean look. The fish is extremely fresh and the sushi pieces are just the right size to be eaten in one bite... lots of flavor and no extra rice to fool you. Best sushi I've had in SF. I recommend a reservation, because the place seems to always be full.

column4: 1225 S. Fort Apache Rd. Ste 100 Las Vegas, NV  89117
column13: This is the best of the meat-on-a-skewer @ your table Brazilian restaurants in Las Vegas, although it's hidden in a neighborhood off-Strip location. Inside is gorgeous, but the gourmet salad/soup bar & more than a dozen meats carved tableside are the main attraction. An extremely professional staff hover nearby to immediately bring more food, refresh your drink, refold your napkin when you return to the salad bar, or tempt you with dessert. This is my go-to place once or twice a month when I want outstanding food & service in a great atmosphere, including a water fall & glass wine enclosure. The new Sunday brunch is another reason for me to visit there more often. I get special offers as an E-club frequent diner. Via Brasil is a keeper!

column4: 1606 North Main St. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Chef Valentino Luchin has established an Italian gem in Walnut Creek. He produces elegantly crafted dishes that avoid the americanized flavors and textures of many Italian restaurants. He also served us at the table, and given this was a special occassion (anniversary), he, personally, treated us like VIPs, allowing us to taste dishes we were interested in but decided not to order (e.g. smoked sturgeon, prosciutto and wild board). He provided succinct and interesting background on dishes and gave us private time to enjoy the intimate setting. Great wine and apertif lists too. One of my favorites in the bay area now.
Food was fresh, delicious, and imaganitive. Wine list was excellent and reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend.
Outstanding and original as always... first time back in 17 years and still incredible.

First time dining here. Had a wonderful time. Wait staff was very attentive. Food was well prepared and exceeded our expectations. Wine list was good and the dessert was wonderful. Will make this a regular stop when we're in the neighborhood!
We did the Chef's Choice meal............Fabulous!

column1: Oyster Bay Seafood and Wine Bar
column4: 3663 Las Vegas Blvd South Suite 560 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Nice place with decent selection of seafood and pastas.

When I first walked in, I was a little hesitant because it looked more like a bar than a restaurant, but there are actually quite a few tables. The service was great...super friendly, and the food was very good as well. The presentation for the waffles looks amazing. Oh, the flavored mimosas are tasty as well! The only complaint I have is that the jazz band got a little loud at times, making it hard to hold a conversation. The volume would have been fine for 11pm, but at 11am it was a little much.

Great food and atmosphere--went for my 52nd birthday and had an amazing time. The food was superb and we had a fantastic waiter, we tipped him 30%, he was excellent! We were even surprised with a special b-day dessert, without request or expectation. A nice touch P17, awesome experience! Best Vietnamese food I have ever eaten, and I have lived and dined in nine different states!!

Really enjoyed our meal here. I had the goats cheese and strawberry salad which was delicious. Really appreciated the extra blackberries on it soaked in port. Would recommend Pats. Good, honest food in a relaxed environment. Lovedit and would definitely go back.
The food and service were exemplarary. Very open, not intimate.

column1: Sheila's Place Wine Bar and Cafe
column4: 330 N. Lantana Street Suite 32 Camarillo, CA  93012
column13: You would never expect what is inside from the bland mini-mall exterior. The decor inside is beautiful with dark, rich colors and a bar that goes on forever. There is a nice area up front with comfy couches and chairs for enjoying a glass of wine. The service was great, the food really good. The kobe burger was perfectly done and served on delicious crispy light ciabatta bread. And they had a really nice selection of wines by the glass. They told us they had been there for 8 years but I hadn't been there before. Really glad they joined opentable because I probably would have gone another 8 years without finding them otherwise.

We dined at Padri for the first time this week based solely on a recommendation from a friend. We were very pleased with the entire experience. We were welcomed at the reception desk and felt like we treated as valued guests from that moment. Our waiter was friendly, knowledgable and prompt in his care for us the entire evening. Food? Yep it was exceptional......Fresh, well prepared an presented. Truly this was like dining at a friends Tuscan home. Thanks Padri for a grand experience.

column1: Palace Arms at the Brown Palace
column13: The restaurant staff was excellant, and attentive. We had a wonderful dinning experience.The tableside preparation of Steak Tar-Tar was entertaining and delicious.

Food and service were 4 star! The four of us started with a bento - tomato bruschetta which was tasty and beautifully plated. The men shared the lobster corndogs, my friend had the fried green tomatoes, again beautifully presented, and I had the gazpacho with shrimp. Two of us had the lobster entree, one the salmon and one the pork tenderloin with blackberry sauce. Everyone was happy! But the best was our dessert - the banana creme brulee boat. The serving dish was boat-shaped with a spun sugar sail, gorgeous and edible. The creme brulee was perfect and plenty for the four of us to share, although we may just skip the entrees next time and go straight to the boat! Good job, Palace!

column4: 2 New Montgomery St. San Francisco, CA  94105
column13: Guests are always delighted and amazed by the beauty of the stained glass atrium. Food was ok, but not specatular but very easy to eat to 'food coma' stage. No lines at the omelet/crepe bars.

column4: 115 N. Santa Cruz Ave. Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: The signature margaritas here were phenomenal.. Food was nothing special but the servers were friendly and well-versed. Major negative was that our water classes were never, not even once, refilled after they first gave us water. Bad, bad.

I have now been to the Cafe Cubano 3 times, being Australian you have to admit this is a hard thing to do, but we loved the food so much we just go back when we can. Great food, great staff, great restaurant, thanks
While noise level is "energetic" it's a bit loud, making it difficult to hear converation with meal partner(s). For conversation purposes, I'd recommend going to Pallette's during non0busy hours.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Palm Desert
column13: Ruth's Chris has always been our favorite steak house (we have dined in many, from New Orleans to San Francisco). The steaks are always the best, and the service is usually impeccable. This is definitely the best steak house in the Coachella Valley!

Interesting concept of picking your own wine bottle and then heading on to dinner. The menu had a good creative selection of items. However, when the food came, everything was just a little too salty for us. Not enough to send it back but salty enough that we failed to really taste the potential of the food because of it.

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - Palm Desert
column13: I didn't give it a 5 Star rating because I think their prices are way too high but the food was excellent.However, if you wanted a vegetable with your dinner you had to pay extra! I had the crab stuffed shrimp & my husband had the 20oz rib-eye steak. Mine was excellent. His was under cooked even after the waiter came back saying reason for the wait for our food was because they had to put his steak in the oven since it was so thick.(He asked for well done!).But it was still pink inside but he said it was edible the way it was. The bread before the meal was a little too hard for my liking.Beautiful view even from inside since the restaurant is upstairs. This was our 1st time so finding it was a little tricky. Had to ask inside the store!

column4: 3740 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: Unhurried patio dining. Had the expresso burrito and a glass of red wine. Very good and relaxing.
Food is more expensive than it says ($$) , and its just fine. not a killing for flavour.A crying kid made the dinner horrible, parents should control their kids.
I always find the food quality very high for the price.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - PA
column4: 180 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94304
column13: I love this restaurant--I go out alot all over the Bay Area and Flemings is one of my very favorites!! The food, service and ambience are top notch!!!
Nice casual restaurant. Outdoor seating was lovely. Food and service were very good, complemented by great wine flights.

column4: 1020 E Desert Inn Rd. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: We had a group of 6 people and everyone enjoyed the restaurant and the food.

column4: 3663 Las Vegas Blvd South #610 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Having been to a Brazilian style restaurant before I had very high hopes. My wife had never been to one. She was very wow'd with the amount of food and just how good it was. Awesome choices of food and the service was just right.

column4: 400 E. Sahara Avenue Las Vegas, NV  89104
column13: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. The food is wonderful and the waiters are friendly with great personalities! The vibe is calm and cozy. Great for date nights.

Waited more than 20 minutes - for a glass of wine, after asking the bus boy to send over the waiter or a glass of wine. After the waiter finally came over 15 minutes later took another 10 minutes for a glass of wine. The salad arrived before the wine. The restaurant was not even half full. Bartender and waiter were joking around behind the bar while I sat waiting for service.
Food was great and served in large quantities! Quick service as well.
I took my wife here for her birthday. We have been to all of the other Pappas restaurants and received the same great service.
Simply the best in Houston. From steaks to sides to desert, it is hard to beat Pappas.
Came to see Saif, was not disappointed!

column4: 884 Portola Road A-1 Portola Valley, CA  94028
column13: We were 5 girlfriends celebrating a b'day. Waiter was fun, & informative about specials.Food was great. Will take my husband there, next time he's a good boy.

Small restaurant that serves authentic French food based on the cuisine of Provence.High-backed wooden booths provide a sense of privacy and keep the noise at a comfortable level.Food is excellent. so are cocktails (including their signature French dacquiri)--good service, good vibe, full bar.

column1: Mustangs & Burros at Estancia La Jolla
column4: 9700 N. Torrey Pines Rd San Diego, CA  92037
column13: While the outside area is very small, it is beautiful and a great place to share a few appetizers and a bottle of wine. We would return again.
Excellent Food and Service. Salvadore, our waiter was excellent, very attentive & informative
It was very tasty and it felt like good home Italian cooking :)
I love Roy's pasadena. We always come here for birthday and anniversary celebrations.
My first visit to a Ruth Chris was memorable. This was a business dinner and the choice of Ruth Chris was a perfect venue for our discussion.

column4: 9749 Santa Monica Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: all good except for service was just so so. Forgot to tell us specials and rushed us out to turn over table.

column4: 6204 East Pacific Coast Hwy Long Beach, CA  90803
column13: My husband and I enjoyed the first bite as much as the last. Great Italian wines. Decadent pastas and fresh seafood. Homemade desserts. Highly recommended. We cannot wait to come back and try everything on the menu.

The food was delicious, creative and authentic. Service was very good. The restaurant lived up to all the positive comments of other reviewers. We chose to dine outside because main dining room seemed full and a bit noisy for us. The outdoor fountain was a pleasant focal point for our table.
Excellent food; off the beaten path in Jackson Hole. A real treat we visit every time were in town.

Overall a good italian place and pretty casual. There were a few things missing like good bread! That to me is a must in an italian restaurant. Had the linguini in clams; pretty good. Ahi carpaccio was not that great and wouldn't order again. I'd go back but not at the top of my list.

The food was very good at Pasta's Trattoria - I am especially fond of the tomato bruschetta that they serve before the meal. However, on this night for some reason our service was almost backwards.There was a very large party in the same room with us, and I suppose that accounted for our service not being so great. We got our water, then ordered, and got our salads, and THEN after our salads we got the bruschetta and then our bread. It seemed like we should have gotten the bruschetta, bread and water all at the same time. Then our entrees came. It worked out okay, but we got a lot all at once instead of spaced out. It was perhaps because of the large party, which made our room kind of noisy, too. Overall, it was okay and I would go back.

column4: 141 South Grand Ave. Los Angeles, CA  90012
column13: Patina has it all for that special occasion - ambiance, five star service, excellent food, and a first rate wine list.

column4: 140 South Santa Cruz Avenue Los Gatos, CA  95030
column13: quiet place to eat. we eat breakfast/brunch here as it is quiet and clean. food is fine, nothing of note.

column4: DoubleTree by Hilton San Jose 2050 Gateway Place 2050 Gateway Place San Jose, CA  95110
column13: Food was poorly prepared. Very expensive. Been going for years and it lately it has gone down hill

column4: 405 N San Pedro Rd San Rafael, CA  94903
column13: Splendid service and excellent menu.

The Limelight Supper Club offers a very convenient location to have dinner before a show at the Denver Performing Arts Center. My wife and I had dinner there before a recent show in the Buell. Overall, our experience at Limelight was very good. The service was excellent and the food good. We both had rib-eye and they were seasoned well and very tender. My wife tried the new watermelon salad and really enjoyed it. The only thing about the experience that we thought wasn't great were the prices of salads and deserts. While both were very good, there wasn't anything special about them to warrant the high cost. We felt the entrees were priced well for the quality of the food. Our experience at the Limelight was good and we would go there again.

The music was so loud we could not hear each other or our waiter. Food was overpriced and absolutely horrible. Our server brought my meal 10-15 minutes before bringing my husband's. The place was empty (at 7 pm on a Friday) so there was really no reason for bad service. Two thumbs down!

column4: 514 W Balboa Blvd Newport Beach, CA  92661
column13: This quaint little restaurant was withen walking distance of our beach house rental so we thought we would give it a try. Unfortunately they were short on help that evening and even though we were the first table seated (and the only one for a while) we still had to wait too long for water, wine glasses and our food! The food was excellent and the waitress very nice but just not able to keep up.
The food was really fresh and tasty and our server was friendly and amazing. Loved the outdoor seating option on a rare warm summer evening in Seattle.
delicoius bbq, great service, dont let the location and look discourage you. it is worth the trip

column1: Tula's at The Beverly Garland Hotel
column13: We were practically the only customers inside and wanted to have a business meeting. The music was so loud that we could barely hear each other. we repeatedly asked them to turn the volume down to now avail. Finally we moved to the terrace where the music was equally loud. We were very disappointed.
We asked for a quiet place and they found the quietest in the restaurant, thank you very much.
Good food and good atmosphere. Somewhat inconsistent from first try to second visit.

column4: 3801 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: We had a wonderful dining experience at Bacio. The waitstaff was attentive and helpful without being intrusive. There are some fine selections on the menu at reasonable prices but we decided to go with the fixed price menu. This menu also had great options and all three courses, appetizer, entree and desert were full size portions. The only issue some people may have is some of the tables are open to the concourse, where hotel guests pass by. The noise wasn't bothersome but you do sacrifice privacy. I would summarize our experience as excellent service and food at a reasonable price. We do recommend Bacio and would dine here on future trips to Las Vegas.
Wonderful food from a large variety of choices. Impeccable and friendly service. Quiet, beautiful surroundings.
Appetizers were excellent. Bar tender not overly friendly, more into the TV. The steak for dinner was over cooked. The waitress Tilly was outstanding. The prices high for off season Desert.
Ribs were great and their fish selections are always good. Large diverse menu, love the parkview lunch specials, too.
Love the salsa groupings and guacamole very good. I especially love the margaritas. Always fun and delicious!

This particular trip to Hamburger Mary's was VERY disappointing, although I like the restaurant generally. I made the reservation for 12 people about 2 months ago, upon arrival they crammed us all into one uncomfortable booth. We were almost literally siting on top of each other. The food was kinda nasty, several burgers showed up terribly undercooked, several food items showed up wrong/not as ordered. The floor show MC, Honey Bee, was great, but one of the singers, Todd Allen, was nothing short of painful to listen to. We were glad when the meal was over so we could get out of there. Ended up feeling embarrassed to have invited friends to go there for what was supposed to be a fun birthday celebration.

column4: One Tramway Road Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Hawaiian store bought rolls. Horrible tartar. Lamb over cooked. Not worth the price. Tables sticky. Took three attempts to get a dinner menu instead of lunch.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria
column13: The carrot cake and out waiter were outstanding!

The Peppertree is great as always. Not cheap, but very good, and most unusually, the wait staff are well-trained. That's pretty unheard of in Colorado Springs, including the Broadmoor. The only thing I'd like to see is a little more inventiveness with their nightly specials for the main course & dessert.

This is a wonderful neighborhood restaurant on Potrero Hill. They have a good selection on their menu with great food and reasonable prices. The setting of the restaurant is very nice - soothing colors and artwork. The wait staff are very friendly and kind. It is a real treat to eat at Pera!
Are you sure this is a restaurant?

Front hostess stuck up and not so pleasant. Had a 9:15 res and got there 45 minutes early in hope of getting seated earlier since we had our 3 & 4 year old with us. Not a chance and even got seated 20 minutes after our reservation time even though she said she will seat us at 9:15. We were the only ones waiting for a table at the end, reminded me of something about Mary when Ben stiller was trying to board the plane.Other than that, the food was superb and our server was attentive and made great recommendations.
I go to the Persian room frequently and it is one of our favorite restaurants. But why do I not get points when I book through OpenTable?

column4: 605 Queen Anne Ave North Seattle, WA  98109
column13: Great value for your money. Superbly prepared food and extensive drink menu

This restaurant is one of my favorites in the area. Menu is always creative and food is delicious. Service is friendly and efficient. We sat in the breezeway next to the main dining room and had a lovely breeze on a warm evening. Noise level was refreshingly low so we were able to enjoy pleasant conversation. All in all this was a very enjoyable evening.

Very friendly service. Really good food if you are a vegetarian. The baba ghanouj, dolma and pita were great. The wine list is quite good. The falafel was okay and the chicken was not super juicy. Portions are huge so be careful while ordering.
Such a welcome surprise. Food and service were fantastic. We will definitely be back!

column4: 321 N. Robertson Blvd. West Hollywood, CA  90048
column13: The reviewers have it right. A bit of Paris, on roberson Blvd. Delicious and creative.

column4: 1464 South Coast Hwy Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: The food was pretty good, I got the filet mignon and it was very very tender, ordered exactly as I liked. My girlfriend got the quail, which was also very good, as I had a bite. Our waitress, however, was a bit short with us. She didn't seem very amiable either, one noteworthy example is when she walked by, put the dessert menu in front of us, and walked off. No "I suggest ___" or "May I interest you in ____" Just straight up walked away. This type of attitude has been experienced by my girlfriend and I at many locations; she's 19 and I'm 21. I understand I'm not going to be the customer who buys the $500 glass of wine, or leaves the $200 tip, but it's not like I walked in, ate the free bread and drank the free water and left.

column4: 3490 Long Beach Blvd. Long Beach, CA  90807
column13: Five of our group of six arrived on time while the remaining errant member was late. The hostess sat us at our prepared table immediately and our orders for beverages was taking. Upon arrival of our last member, the server waited on us and took more beverage orders and appetizer order. Great service, excellent food, good ambiance. The restaurant was busy with couples and parties and parking was a breeze. The appetizers were large and delicious. There was a good variety of food, the Chilean Sea Bass was excellent, others had beef, chicken, or shellfish. All enjoyed their meals. Passed on after dinner drinks, coffee dessert as we were all too full to enjoy more.

I always look forward to the food and service at the Great Northern. Have either lunch or dinner there at least once a week. However, this trip the service left a lot to be desired. We had to wait 15 minutes after being seated for anyone to come to the table. Meanwhile, tables seated after us were already being served their beverages. This continued for the entire meal. I know it was a busy night, as all Friday nights are, but I don't understand why service was so bad.

column4: Hilton Seattle Airport 17620 International Boulevard Seattle, WA  98188
column13: Suprisingly outstanding Steak house near Seatac airport.

column1: Polo Lounge at  The Beverly Hills Hotel
column13: The service was impeccable and our lunch was very good. We were glad to kick off our visit to Beverly Hills at the Polo Lounge - very nice.
The food was very good. The margaritas were exceptional.

column4: 18 West Market St. Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: by far the very best sushi in salt lake!!!

column4: 5310 E. High St #101 City North Phoenix, AZ  85054
column13: We were in a party of 4. Two of us ordered the Korean Chicken, however, one of us received a Caribbean Chicken. After a discussion with management we kept the Caribbean Chicken at no charge.
The food at Roy's is always memorable, and this visit was no exception. Try the Misoyaki Butterfish--it will change your life!

column4: 2201 E. Camelback Road, Suite 106-A Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: This was our first visit to this location. We have been to many other locations around the country. On this visit we were disappointed. My husbands filet was as he described it "gamey". My filet, which was a bone in filet was wonderful, I would highly recommend it. The server was wonderful, very attentive. The manager stopped by our table toward the end of our evening to talk with us about the dinner. We expected that a manager visit would have happened immediately after the main entree was returned. Our wine was lovely, the rest of our dinner was as expected for a Ruth's Chris. We would have rated the visit higher if not for the one instance of the meat and the length of time it took for the manager's visit.
Very nice service...Accomodated my very detailed dietary request, except the scallops had a seasoning with garlic, and I don'tthink the waiter or cook realized this.
Food is outstandingThe summer wine Generous Pour program is a real wine steal
Food was ample and good, service excellent. Terming the noise level energetic is an UNDERSTATEMENT.

column1: Palo Verde at The Boulders Resort
column4: 34631 N. Tom Darlington Drive Carefree, AZ  85377
column13: A very beautiful setting, serving excellent food, with terrific wait staff and manager.

column4: 410 N. Canon Dr. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Great food, wonderful service. Eggplant Parmesan was delightful and short rib of beef you could eat with a spoon. We will definitely come back!

Imagine the night before the AVON Walk - Houston. 8 women ( 4 from the Chicago area coming just to walk Houston) getting ready to walk a total of 39.3 miles in two days for Breast Cancer Awareness and Research... Anxious.. Hungry... ready for a bottle of Chianti. Needing to "Carbo load!" ... our environment was wonderful, relaxed... sitting off in the private room... laughing, crying... enjoying the comradarie and companionship.. before the big day... after being sufficiently satisfied gastrononically : ) and emotionally we had bid farewell to the our wonderful wait staff and our kind and gracious host, Mr. M. Retzafflt!
Juan our waiter was fabulous handling our big group. Many thanks.

This is a great spot! It has a virbrite bar in the front, old style italian pizza feel, also in the front. It also has plenty of room for romantic dining towards the back where there a small initimate tables for two. There are also, large booths, some under a meditrannian open air conopy. And, there are tables on the outside patio. The food is delicious! It is also presented in careful and artful arrangement. I would recommend this place to anyone!
Great place for a girl's night out. Not too dark inside, decent food, and great wine! Will come again soon!

column4: 5900 W. Flamingo Road Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: There was a private party going on so that perhaps affected the service but no excuse for putting in the entree order along with the salads which meant both arrived at the same time. Also, when bread brought to table, no butter or oil or cheeese to go with it.

column1: Pier Market Seafood Restaurant - Pier 39 SF
column13: We were seated where we requested. The food was terrific. Everyone was happy in our group of 4. Angle our waitress did a fabulous job with the pace we liked and made us feel extremely welcome and happy to be waiting on us. We highly recommend.

I've lunched at Place Pigalle a number of times but this was my first dinner. When I arrived, the place was nearly empty and we were a small party, so I was a little disappointed at the table we were given (I felt crowded and the view wasn't so great). I could have asked for a different table, of course.

column1: The Pineapple Room by Alan Wong
column13: The server we had gave us excellent service.
Perry's Italian is always a great occasion!

Enjoyed the small plates although the baby octopus was tough--when informed, they took immediate action and removed the item from our bill. No A/C, but big fans. Very small venue and very friendly, but food wasn't memorable. I had much higher expectations.
I love this place! The staff is amazing!
Everything was fine. Not much more than that.

This was our 4th visit to Pinion's and, as always, it was perfection. We realized just how great the service and ambiance are at Pinion's when we dined at Ellina restaurant tonight - which was a complete disaster (I will post that review later tonight). We highly recommend Pinion's for excellent food, service, and ambiance - don't miss it when you travel to Aspen!

I went to Piola with a friend who wanted pizza. Since we were both from New Jersey where good pizza is not hard to find, we were surprised by the quality of the crust and the flavor of the pizza at Piola. We did not think that we could find such good pizza in Houston. I highly recommend Piola for anyone who wants pizza while they are in Houston.

column4: 1356 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA  90019
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Lovely restaurant with good food, very pleasant ambiance and service AND ENTERTAINMENT! What more could you want??

column4: 9161 W. Sunset Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90069
column13: This place is right by the office; I have seen their lunch menu specials and thought I would give it a try. As we walk in we are greeting and told to sit anywhere we like, the server gave us menus and asked us if we would like something to drink._
We were able to get a reservation at the last minute and had no problems getting seated and the food was great. It's a great spot down by the Strand to walk around before or after you eat.

column4: 3500 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Excellent service and great food. Good value. We took party of 11 with 6 children (12-15) and everyone found excellent food.

Delicious food. Waitress seemed a bit distracted and could have been friendlier. She also forgot to inform the kitchen about one of the orders in our group; however, she promptly apologized and comped that meal.
Naan was the best part of our meal...

wonderful surprise, live in San Mateo and had never been here before, to my surprise it was great! Wait staff was very attentive, and friendly. Food was excellent, my skirt stake and truffled mashed potatoes were melt in your mouth delish! Desserts to die for!All around a wonderful meal, bring friends and enjoy!

column4: 2725 Shelter Island Dr. San Diego, CA  92106
column13: Great food, moderate prices. They could have had a better wine list, but they have some great specialty drinks. The service is pretty good, I wish our food server had spoken better english (he didn't seem to know what a champagne cocktail was and just brought a bottle of champagne instead, which we happily drank), but my in-laws spoke spanish pretty well I guess, so we got by just fine! The fish was all great, the swordfish especially! We will go back again and again, I'm sure.
It is a Pretty Good Resturant. Kids like it because of the free Ice Cream, however the ice cream machine was not working right. Other than that it was great...
Service was excellent and the pre-printed menu card with our name and anniversary was a very nice touch. Food was excellent. Definitely a special occasion place for us.

Had a 7:30 reservation but didn't get seated until almost 8:30 but the manager took good care of us with a round of appetizers for our table of 10 people. Food was excellent as always and the waiter, Eddie, took very good care of us. Highly recommend for a fabulous steak.

column4: 22601 Pacific Coast Highway Suite 100 Malibu, CA  90265
column13: The food was great, however the service was so slow it was beyond belief. I have never waited this long for food in all of Los Angeles, even at high-end restaurants that give you lots of time between courses, etc. To be blunt - no one had appetizers, and it was 2 1/2 hrs between time we ordered and finished. In addition to that, we had two small children in our party so of course that family had to leave before the food even got to our table. One hour...
Very nice restaurant, especially to go to after a performance at the Benedict tent.

The food was surprisingly very good. Our server did provide good service. The atmosphere was more like a coffee shop then that of an expensive steakhouse. For special occasions you want a little more pizazz in the design and furnishings. There was no music only silence.
A very hip restaurant (plus friendly service) in a very hip part of town.
The food and service was great!
We love Poggio. Everytime we travel to SF, we stop by Sausalito to eat at Poggio for lunch. Very special and very fun!
Food, presenttion and service all outstanding! Price was appropriate for value of meal.

column4: 60 E. Third Ave San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: It is always a pleasure to dine at this restaurant. The service is always exemplary and the three-course special dinner for $35 is reasonably priced for such good quality. The dishes are always prepared very well and beautifully presented by a very attentive staff. Having an owner oversee a restaurant is always a good sign. Recommended as a great place to have an enjoyable and satisfying dining experience. Bravo!
Great location, smack-dab in the heart of downtown Portland, with the MAX commuter train stopping literally at the front door for people coming in from various locations.

Best steak I have ever had! And I have dined at Ringside, El Goucho... Love them as well, but this was superb. The only odd thing was that everything had a calorie count. Kind of depressing when you are craving a good ribeye and its 1400 calories... My much lower calorie filet was FANTASTIC!
Service was wonderful. Food was fine but nothing special.

We waited 40 minutes for our table WITH a reservation. Food was decent but nothing special and overpriced for what you got. Really great waitstaff however (not their fault the management overbooked). Plan on limiting my visits here to appetizers and cocktails in the future.
Good Food and Service but quite loud on a Friday Night

This was a perfect place to take a visiting out-of-town aunt for lunch. The service was wonderful (we had a trainee,) and the food was very good. We shared a mud pie for dessert- and it was so large, we couldn't finish it. (Unfortunately, mud pie doesn't do well as a left over!) I will definitely go back.
Parking lot is very small...waited 40 mins to park the car.
I did not know what to expect, but the food was very average. I would not go back.

We found this restaurant on Trip Advisor and reading their reviews. This was our first time to eat there and definitely will go back. Our server was great and the food delicious. They also took care not to place other diners right next to your table, so it was easy to talk and visit.

The food was good. Had the seafood chowder and the asparagus with the poached egg. Both were delicious; the sauce under the asparagus had sort of a strange color. Great light meal before a performance. The wine list is overpriced, especially if you just want one glass.
The food and service were great. Our waitress was funny and hospitable. She served great Margaritas!

Ordered the Lobster Risotto; I think I received the "Loobster" instead - very rubbery and disappointing. My husband ordered the Chicken Parm - he seemed to enjoy his meal more than I did. Went there based upon Zagats rating - WAY off! Food was average and unremarkable. I would not go back. However, the service was outstanding!

Service I received on this visit was EXCEPTIONAL.... I am there almost every Sunday, but had begun to gravitate away because of the noise (music/dj)... I always have a group of 8-15 and we like to converse and catch up on the week, this wasn't possible the last two weeks because of the noise level, but this last week, we sat at the table in the bar which was away from the speakers, so it was quite enjoyable
Had the Sunday special 2 for 1 prime rib. Outstanding food at an outstanding price!!!

column1: Primarily Prime Rib - South Point Casino
column4: 9777 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89183
column13: The food, as always, was excellent. My group all had the prime rib and each was done exactly as ordered.

column4: 6538 S. Yosemite Circle Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: Everything we ordered was delicious. Crystal, our server, was very personable and took very good care of us. There is a new happy hour special menu with great values in food and drink from 4:30 - 6:30 pm; we'll be back.

Our waitress was a bit haughty, we ordered drinks and bread before lunch. We had to ask about the bread which arrived moments before our lunch. Would have preferred to have the bread with our drinks. Otherwise, it was a good lunch; great food!
Perfect for our birthday celebration!

First time to dine at pinot provence at the Westin food was delicious my second and last i invited my daughter to join me and told her what a wonderful meal we were in for . Wrong A crying baby was so loud my daughter and I could not hear one another talk . The people at the next table made an early exit The menu changed I ordered the salmon it was served burnt around the edges No lemon . not a good quality . The service was good . would not go back .
Although the restaurant was quite empty, the service and food was delicious. A great place for an evening out with friends.
We love this great little gem in the neighborhood. Been going since it opened in 1996 and it has been consistent every time.

column4: 288 Prairie Star Rd Santa Ana Pueblo, NM  87004
column13: Always love coming here-beautiful view, stellar service, great food and wine list with a bar that is loaded with premium drinks. If you're looking for a first class experience, this is it.

Definitely a great surprise! The location (in the restored 1920's Roosevelt Hotel) is in the heart of "tourist" Hollywood -- across from Grauman's Chinese Theater, and one would not think a restaurant of this caliber could be in such a location. The farm fresh food is not only "just picked", it's incredible. Th chef knows how to mix taste and flavor exquisitely! Everything we ate was fabulous!! The service was excellent as well. We will definitely be back when we are in the area. This is a true Gem!
I haven't been to Benihana's in decades. I've been to copy cats, and I always found their food bland. Benihana's was a welcome reintroduction to really flavorful Teppanyaki.

column4: 1100 Sgt Jon Stiles Drive #106 Highlands Ranch, CO  80129
column13: We were celebrating a birthday with 12 people around the hibachi, it was alot of fun.
A nice, clean, and friendly place. The food was very good. it is a great place for everyone to enjoy really great food and excellent service.
Restart is clean and cozy.Food is fairly good.

column4: 239 Snowmass Club Circle Snowmass Village, CO  81615
column13: The food was very good but not outstanding. We went on Tuesday night which features prime rib which was only average. The salads were outstanding. The menu seemed more interesting than in the past and next time we will order something different.
Friendly staff and excellent food. The food was noteworthy. We were a bit over dressed as it has a bit of a casual "golfing" ambiance, almost like a nice sports bar/restaurant.

column1: Q on the Riverwalk - Hyatt Regency
column13: I was suspicious of a bbq restaraunt in a major hotel and I should have followed my instincts: we ordered the baby back ribs and when they arived the presentation was appealing however the ribs were tasteless with a blah sauce. Our server was great and the wine ist was acceptable. If Q can ramp up the food, this could be a geat dining experience.

Our large group of 12 went to DREAM CAFE for a pre-theatre dinner. Everyone raved about the unique menu and delicious food. The server was friendly, accommodating, and efficient. It was a great experience...one we would repeat!

column4: 1111 E. Cabrillo Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93103
column13: A good but relatively unimpressive meal, served on the slow side by under-experienced wait staff, who didn't seem to know Santa Barbara, never mind the menu...

Good addition to the neighborhood, but the food/menu is a bit confusing. This is northern California so I get the whole fusion thing, but from the 5 dishes we ordered all were just okay- and somewhat inauthentic (empanada dough/crust all wrong, chimichurri spicy-lacking garlic...not true flavors to the namesake dishes. They were also out of red sangria the night we went-6:30 pm on a Friday night! On a positive note mixed cocktails are good.

we've probably had every zadin dish offered over the years and have loved them all! this time however our dishes (spicy eggplant with tofu, and the pan-fried noodles) were nothing special. both dishes were lacking flavor and the presentation didn't even look the same as they have in the past. is there a new chef or something? dining at zadin always felt like a treat but this time it was no big deal. it'll be quite a while before we return.

Quinn's is a long-time waterfront fixture located in a former lighthouse. It features a spectacular view of boats of every kind on the Oakland Estuary and directly across from Coast Guard Island. Quinn's large menu features excellent seafood, great chowder and salads as well as plenty of choices for non fish eaters.

column4: 544 B Agua Fria Unit B Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Very sweet helpful staff. We found the food very rich . WE were hoping for a lighter style of Indian food. We had a delicious Mahi Mahi.Intimate small & cheerful.

column4: 2915 El Camino Real Redwood City, CA  94061
column13: The entire experience was simply outstanding and we appreciated your passing on the fact that it was our 55th wedding anniversary!
Horrible location, wonderful food!

Everything was right about this place. We were a group of six and there wasen't a table for us just yet. One of the patrons saw us looking around and within a minute, offered to move to another table so that the restaurant can put together some tables. The food was delicious, the prices were better than reasonable, and the service was awesome. The kitchen had a small mix up with my burger so i received my entree last and the waitress took it off the bill. Overall, great patrons come here for great food and great service.

column4: 9595 Six Pines Drive, Suite 860 Suite#860 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: The sushi is so fresh. The food is outstanding!
The service was highly impressive. The staff was so attentive. The food was DELICIOUS. We will definitely return.

The Ranchers Club is an old favorite. It is just too "staugy" to go more often than once every two years. The service is very good but at times it seems too much attention as everyone stops by the table to see if everything is OK. We have experience eating out and can get the wait staff attention if needed. We related the pesky attention to a nurse coming in your hospital room at 4 AM to draw blood. As for the food, we always find the menu interesting. The decor could use an update swank western touch.

column4: 1090 Point Lobos Ave. San Francisco, CA  94121
column13: If only the food were as spectacular as the view! Alas, it's not. The tuna tartare appetizer ($20) was flavorless, and the presentation made it look like a hamburger patty. My butternut squash and zucchini ravioli was tasty but nothing outstanding. Though we ate an early lunch (11:30) in a nearly empty dining room, service was lackluster. I hate having to beg a waiter to refill my empty water glass, but that's par for the course here. The best features were, of course, the view and all the nicely framed memorabilia from the nearby (now in ruins) Sutro Baths.

Not what I expected had higher expectations and the food was just okay not comparable to the other high end steak houses. Boulevard much much better to take your significant other. Noise an issue and also service was more like we were doing them a favor and it should have been where we felt like they cared about us. Will not go back.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Rancho Mirage
column13: Absolutly loved this place !! Went for anniversary and had a great time !

We let them know that it was our anniversary and they saved a nice table for us. We brought our own bottle of wine and it was only a $7 corkage fee. Our waitress was very friendly and provided thoughtful and prompt service. The food was delicious and the portions were generous. The bread and olive oil was great and the Italian Sangria was really nice too. We had a great time would definitely go back again.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Rancho Cucamonga
column13: Food absolutely amazing, however was muted by a particular servers poor service. Upon completion of each course, plates sat on table at least 20 minutes without being tended to or our table checked upon. Overall experience was good, would recommend highly. See server: Stephen Ralston, avoid female server Alex at all costs to have a pleasant experience.
outstanding food and service. Great Job Crew works as a team.
This was a great experience. I had never heard of Rancho Pinot, the food was the best I've had in a long time. Would love to go back.
We were traveling and it was a great break.

I bring my family to Randy's probably 3 to 4 times a year.I was very disappointed in the total service, atmosphere and quality of food.First of all on the quality of the food that was served to us.The filets were all(3) under cooked. I am a little flexible on mine so I did not send mine back. My wife's (ordered medium) and daughter's (ordered medium +) did get sent back. Bad mistake. My wife's came back almost well done and my daughter's came back still rare on the one side but almost well done on the other. Also the outside was burnt.Terrible - and if that isn't enough. We told the waiter and nothing was ever done. Never heard from anybody the rest of the night - I was expecting staff to come appologize.We will not be back
Very tasty Indian food, very comfortable and pleasant dining room and very attentive service.
Outstanding service and great food. The waitress was very helpful and informative/

With restaurants opening and closing in Seattle with dizzing speed, the established classics sometimes get left out of mind. Ray's Boathouse maintains its status of one of Seattle's finest restaurants. Discrete service, amazing wine list, comfortable yet not dowdy atmosphere. Ray's Boathouse is in the pentacle of Seattle cuisine.

column4: Aria Hotel & Casino 3730 Las Vegas Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: The tasting menu and wine pairings were amazing!

I LOVE RUTH'S CHRIS! Absolutely our favorite restaurant, hands down! Oysters rockefeller, barbequed shrimp, and crab stuffed mushrooms are our favorite appetizers. My boyfriend loves the cowboy ribeye and I love the new york steak. Potatoes au gratin, mashed potatoes au gratin, sauteed mushrooms, and creamed spinach are our favorite sides. The creme brulee is fantastic as well as the chocolate duo. The food is amazing and the steaks are buttery and cooked to perfection. Service is always impeccable and the restaurant is classy. YUM!

column4: 900 Front Street Space A-3 Lahaina, HI  96761
column13: ANDY, OUR SERVER WAS EXCELLENT. CRAIG, THE ASSISTANT MANAGER WAS CHECKING EACH QUEST

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Kohala Coast
column13: Caesar salads (3) were premade and soggy.
My compliments goes out to our server Dean great service and the busy manager David busing tables and asking if everything is OK. Thanks we'll be back again

Our overall experience was very good, however we did get off to an "unpleasant" start. After making the reservation, noting a special birthday, answering the call to confirm, going by the day before to pick out a particular table and being told by a very nice gentleman to arrive early, we did arrive early and encountered a less than happy hostess that asked "who told you to come early". "I cannot give you that table.....you may have this one." (right inside the door next to the hostess stand). No smile, no look of concern at all. We accepted the table by the door and made an effort to forget her unpleasant nature. We enjoyed the rest of the evening.

column4: 320 Main St Ste A Seal Beach, CA  90740-6382
column13: I loved the feel of this place as a whole, the service was great.... a nice bubbly enviornment just a a small stroll from the beach. YUMMY food! I will definately be going back, SOON!

column4: 28201 Redondo Beach Drive South Des Moines, WA  98198
column13: Very Nice Staff- good food but a bit pricey.

column4: 1670 South Pacific Coast Highway Redondo Beach, CA  90277
column13: they made my moms birthday experience great !!

column1: Red Room Food and Wine Bar
column13: We loved this place so much, we drove from Riverside County 2 weeks in a row to eat here. The service is outstanding & the owner is down to earth. Everything on the menu is good and the wine is commendable. Be sure to sit outside on the patio to enjoy the fresh air.

column1: Reds at Sedona Rouge Hotel & Spa
column13: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner at Reds. Thank you to the staff for their extra attention and well wishes.

column4: Hilton Santa Fe/Buffalo Thunder Resort 20 Buffalo Thunder Trail Santa Fe, NM  87506
column13: Tortilla soup and salmon were outstanding. The modern decor is tasteful, but as tables fill, the sound level bounces, making quiet conversations difficult.

column4: 4000 The Canyons Resort Dr. Park City, UT  84098
column13: Best margaritas ever. Wonderful breakfast menu. Fabulous southwestern lunch menu. Friendly and helpful waiters, plus Chris the best busser, and joe, the involved manager. Also a great hearty dinner menu. So much better than the old docs.
very good Russian food; the place is very clean.
We've lived in Park City for 3 years now but just ate at Reef's for the first time. The food service was great ... this will become a regular dining spot for our family.

column4: 2000 S. IH 35 Suite D-1 Round Rock, TX  78681
column13: My wife and I like to go to different places just to try them out. I saw Homefield Grill online and thought it would be worth a shot. We shared the cheddar bats, the chicken cordon bleu and the beef short rib with mac and cheese and truffle. The smashed potatoes that came with the Chicken were our least favorite, though still good. Everything else was outstanding. We ate too much to get desert, but since we plan on going back (probably again and again), we'll catch it next time!
We had a wonderful dinner. Thanks so much to Applewood's entire staff for the memorable dining experience!

We love this restaurant but this night it was not so great - there was a rehersal dinner in the main dining so our table was in the bar which is fine - we like to eat in there. We had escargot to start - it was not really hot enough. The calamari was excellent. salads were not really cold and sort of wilted even, but my son loved his. I had veal picatta but it was just not up to the usual - no capers even. I am guessing the kitchen was strained with the large group in the rehersal dinner. Also - our waitress was very sweet but not great at clearing the table of finished dishes. We loved the live music as usual. I don't usually complain - and we will be back but if it is like this again then probably not after that.

Fabulous! Had a Living Social. It was the first time that I have been there. I took my 9 year old daughter for brunch last weekend. Our table overlooking the bay was lovely. My oysters and crab cakes, with a glass of Prosecco, were delicious! My daughter enjoyed her "gourmet" grilled cheese! We will definately be back! Free valet parking was a plus. Do make a reservation on the weekend.

column1: Rattan Pan Asian Bistro and Wine Bar
column13: I had visited Rattan once a few years ago for dinner and thought it overpriced, but returned with a group from work for lunch to try it again. The restaurant space is light and bright, and the service was OK, but the kitchen was very slow causing our lunch to run too long. The waiters did not offer us the lunch special menu, someone who was aware of it had to ask for it. We were offered an appetizer platter and made the mistake of saying "yes" without asking about the price: $48!!! The food was quite good but there are other good options for Asian food not far away that are a better value.
Awesome, fresh seafood at a fantastic price.
An excellent neighborhood place with good food and friendly atmosphere. A local gem.

VERY AUTHENTIC ITALIAN, especially NAPELS - Beautiful Italian glass art, great dip for break, special Italian dishes, LOVE THE OWNERS! WORTH the 30 minute drive from Los Altos for a special dining experience!

We ordered a $20 Ribeye and $25 Filets Oscar, and sent both back for being overcooked-the first time we have done so in 30 years of dining out together. We requested Medium Rare. The filets were Medium Well, the Ribeye Well Done with no char on the outside. It was an anemic gray color. The waitress, a sweet, pretty girl but CLUELESS and timid--explained that an employee cut the steaks too thin, therefore it was difficult to cook such a thin steak anything but well done. And I have to agree. The ribeye was as thin as a bone-in supermarket pork chop. It had to be 1/4 inch thick (or thin!!). Why serve steaks that were incorrectly cut too thin and charge $20!!! We won't be back.
Have had two large parties here and have been wonderful service. Highly recommended for any event.
Service was average, food was fancy but not especially tasty. Given Rioja's reputation, we expected more.

While the bar is the focus, the food is very good. We tried three entrees - fried chicken, burger, and salmon. All three were delicious and served with different sides. The waitress checked back often enough (although dessert seemed to take a while.)

column4: 1450 Ala Moana Blvd. Suite 3001 Honolulu, HI  96814
column13: Friday night dinner... Got a great view of the fireworks going on at the hilton! Dinner during happy hour... Bit noisy til happy hour ended!
Excellent pacing of courses! A delightful experience for our party of 5. It was quiet so conversation was easily heard. The wine pairings were the perfect choice for the courses
Amazing food, best sushi in sf!
Very good middle-eastern menu. Enjoyed the spanakopita and stuffed grape leaves. Meat skewers were well done, and the Turkish coffee was a nice endto our meal.
The cocktails were mediocre. Meal portions did not match price category. Although the service was good, the value and quality of food does not elicit a return.

column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: BLD is overpriced for what it is. I thought our waiter was lacking in wine knowledge. My friend didn't like the wine he recommended and sent it back, but he charged us for it anyway, which I thought was poor form. Overall, it's just okay. I'd rather eat at Terroni.
I've dined at Geronimo's for the last 10 years and never a bad meal or service. Never!!
Excellent this was one of the best meals I had!
This was our second trip to Maui in 4 years. The restaurant has not lost any of its qualities. Perfect location, organic local sourced food, ambiance. Don't miss the chance to dine here.

We had the Chicken Liver Pate for starters as we usually do; its the best in town. Our entrees were excellenta as they normally are. We dine here about once a month. We try all the finer restaurants in Portland and this is my most favorite.
good service and very good food!
Friendly service, beautiful view, cosy room, good food -- what more do you want?

column4: 3550 N. Central Ave Suite 120 Phoenix, AZ  85012
column13: Our birthday work group loves Alexi's. The waiters are outstanding, very attentive and funny! The food is always high quality. I love your new way of getting reservations also--on line. We have been to this venue many times.

True to the reviews I read before booking. Angelino is a nice neighborhood Italian with great view of the water. We had a lovely dinner. The Service was prompt but a bit abrupt and the server seemed rushed although the place was not that crowded. What was lacking was that Personal touch. When I booked, well in advance, I mentioned we were on our honeymoon, but there was no mention of it when we arrived.
Great vegetarian and meat options, huge pizza's and willing to half-and-half pizzas. Always a great pizza!
Good scallop entree, beet salad was standard. Wine list was good. Service was good once we got past the hostess. Bar was nice for a before dinner drink. Just nothing outstanding other than the view.
Food was outstanding. A great find, didn't expect it to be that good. Nice menu selections.

This was our second visit and it was not as good as the first one. Our server was a young guy with no personality with a tendency to mumble. He had no enthusiasm for the food. The artichoke app was good and the tequila and sangrita were also still delish as from last month. But the halibut was dry and 3 out of 4 in our party ordered it. Insider note: ask for a table in the front since the back gets smoky from the grilling in the kitchen.
The food and service was great as usual. Will attend again soon

column4: PO Box 700  4900 S Highway 7 Estes Park, CO  80517
column13: We never come to Estes Park without including a visit to Baldpate, and we enjoyed it this year as much as ever. Especially enjoy watching the hummingbirds while we eat.

In my personal opinion, this place is overselling itself. The general rundown of my experience here was that my girlfriend enjoyed her meal and I did not. I found the food to be overpriced and a little bit more in the realm of a friend inviting me over for something their "trying out" rather than a chef trading me $20 for a "well executed plate". She was very pleased to be able to order gluten-free, however.That being said, one thing that she and I were in agreement on was that the service here was very much sub-par. After receiving our desert menus, we waited nearly 20 minutes to have an order taken. It was long enough that I asked the server to bring our check along with our desert, which she failed to do. I don't think I'd go back.

I have been to Bella Italia two times in the past two weeks with two different groups of friends. We had six different entrees and all were excellent. We had a carafe of the house red which was great. Service was friendly and efficient. We all loved the decor which was charming.

column1: Bentley's Grill - The Grand Hotel in Salem
column13: Was definitely disappointed. Went for our anniversary. Server was pleasant and timely. My husband & I both ordered a steak (same cut) and the waitress stated they tend to undercook so I asked for mine medium to medium well - I do not care for it bloody but like a good amount of pink inside (and explained what i wanted to the waitress) When it came, mine was so hard I could barely chew it while my husbands was extremely tender and he asked for it medium. I told the waitress about it but didnt send it back - should have! I hoped she would comp one of our desserts but no offer was made & I'm too chicken to ask & didn't want to make it a big deal given that it was our anniversary. The actual ambiance was nice but they sat us right next to the
our second time.... just as wonderful as the first!looking forward to returning.

column4: 203 S. St. Mary's St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Biga has a great reputation and for good reason. The food is above average (the oyster appetizer is fantastic) and the service is top drawer. It is rather loud and th arrangement for large parties leaves a little to be desired. However over all an excellent evening of great food and wine. I would strongly recommend it for those visiting the Alamo City.

column4: 641 Santa Cruz Avenue Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: I love Bistro Vida, very authentic European bistro. The food is always good and the service is excellent.

column4: 350 South Grand Ave Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: Inventive food and great atmosphere makes the Blue Cow a must-try new restaurant

The chicken fried steak was pricey, flavorless and thin meat. Wouldn't buy again. TWo others at my table liked the scallops and chicken fried chicken. My other guest didn't care for it or the house salad. Too little dressing and way too many onions. Probably wouldn't go back.

This was my first lunch experience here, I've always been a dinner patron here for 15 years. There was no change. Excellent lamb shank, fantastic green goddess dressing on the salad, friendly, fast, polite service. Couldn't ask for more. TRY THE STONE CRAB CLAWS, THEY ROCK!!

column4: 3421 W. William Cannon Dr., #127 Austin, TX  78745
column13: Surprising little restaurant tucked away in a nondescrpt strip center location. Don't be put off! Well worth the visit....and many returns. Tastefull interior design and music. Liked the playlist. Interesting selection of cocktails and the menu offers lots of delicious choices. Fresh and imaginative. Food is both lovely and lively. Great waitstaff who are attentive and know the menu. I've had Brunch, Lunch and Dinner here and loved every dish!
Their trio of friends is excellent as is their chicken and waffles!
the chicken and waffle was not what i expected. It was just okay. Nothing to brag about.
I have to be slighty honest. I don't know if they could have found a smaller container for a "cup" of soup. The cup was about the same size my 4 year old played tea party with. $8.00, really?

Catch is always great. I'm always eager to go there and do so pretty regularly. The fish dishes are always prepared to perfection (I LOVE the halibut dish), and the accompanying veggies are always delicious and interesting. Great salads and other apps too, and the wine list is quite nice. The half-off pricing on bottles of wine has us there for dinner on Tuesday a lot. If you get the right table on the patio (which we prefer), it's possible to keep track of the Giants game on the TV at the bar (an added bonus at times.) Service is always pleasant and efficient. We take guests there a lot and no one has ever been disappointed.

I had eaten in the Miami location two weeks ago and everything was great. This location needs more help. Food was very good but service totally lacked. Waited over 20 minutes for a waiter to bring a drink. That is not acceptable.

I had been back to Central 214 since Blythe Beck left, but I can tell you the food and menu are better than ever! The Redfish, pasta, sweetbreads, etc. all cooked perfectly.We will definitely be back. The new chef is outstanding.

column4: 3570 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The food was better than average and they had a great selection of draft beers. The restaurant is off to the side of the hotel lobby and made an interesting location to people watch if you sit at the bar.

column4: 1332 Park St on Redwood Square Alameda, CA  94501
column13: The food was good, portion size good, and flavor very good. I would go back and was pleasantly surprised with the overall experience. I had the spaghetti peperoni con salcicce which i enjoyed and the desert of the apple in a pastry was awesome (of course a la mode). I wish the presentation was little better - e.g. soup came in a huge bowl but entree in a small microwave reminiscent dish. Wait person was good and available but would have liked it more if they were more informed and sold me on how prepared and flavors of each dish i asked about. The list of specials was long but tough to remember and the wine list unimpressive although half bottle were offered for several of those on the list.
Good deal on their $20 Summer Special (if you like NY Strip Steak). A no nonsense old time local dinning spot. Good service from our young waiter "Bananas"?
The best restaurant in downtown Dallas by far.
This is best place for a special occasion and you can't go to Paris. Ambiance, Food and Wine, Wait staff, THE CHEF, all lovely.
I intended to rate the ambience as outstanding but it would not "stick."
Food is always good, for lunch or dinner great salads, sandwiches and entrees. All time favorite is the Chinese chicken salad, originally from BUNS restaurant.
My wife and I really enjoy Cosmo's. It is our favorite restaurant in town. Over the years we have celebrated many special occasions there and look forward to many more!!

column4: 300 West San Juan Avenue Telluride, CO  81435
column13: Great location and wonderful food!

One of the best experiences I have had at a restaurant. Superior to the French Laundry or Bouchon in both atmosphere, food and service. The entire restaurant should be proud of what they have achieved.

column4: 3325 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Always have great service and quality food. We like the added bonus of viewing the new cars added to the showroom each time we go, both classic and exotic.They are very accommodating about requests and if the weather is right you can view the fireworks from the TI hotel across the street. Inside, there are great booths and tables and even a private wine room that seats up to 10. Always a fun place.

column1: Agriculture Bar & Kitchen at Dawn Ranch Lodge
column13: Loved this place - what a great find. Had a delicious dinner here - pulled pork raviolis, amazing salad with goat cheese ranch, hamburger (yum), ribs! So delicious. Great atmosphere as well. Great place to come for a stellar dinner without any pretentious attitudes or atmosphere. Also a great cocktail list - I ordered the cucumber cooler and really liked it. We ate inside as it was a bit cool outside but would like to go back and sit outside on a Warmer summer night. And one last note - order dessert. Had a chocolate something and it was "to die for."

column4: 620 Gothic Road Mountaineer Square Crested Butte, CO  81225
column13: We had a great time with 8 adults and ordered one of everything! It was all great buyout favorites were the ravioli, gnocchi and the Brussels sprouts!

Most of the support staff was very good but our primary server was terrible. It took him 15 mins from when we sat down to get to us by that time we had decided our drinks, appetizers and main course. Surprisingly we got our lukewarm appetizer first within 5 mins, then our drinks ??. It seemed that they were in a rush to hurry get us out since our main course arrived 2 mins after we finished our appetizer.As for the food, the cocktails were great. Both of us had the Vada Sambar as the appetizer which was ok, the lentil puffs were too big and dense although the sambar was good but surprisingly lukewarm. I had the Spicy Basil Dosa which was very good but looked like it had been sitting for a while. I would go back on a slower night.
Best restaurant I have ever been to and I have been to some great restaurants.

Our waiter was very friendly but he was not as attentive as he could have been. During the entire meal we were only able to get one refill of our drinks dispite that on 4 different occasions he or others came to the table for various things and must have noticed nearly all glasses were empty. After asking we did finally get drinks midway thru dinner and again needed refills during dessert. Again after several passes by the staff and no offer to refill someone came by and asked if she could remove the glasses. I told her we still hadnt received dessert and we would like some refills. She replied "Russell will have to get those for you" and left. Wow, left irritated after dropping $225 for poor service. To bad i expected better at Dukes

column4: 5550 E Lincoln Dr. Paradise Valley, AZ  85253
column13: Eaten here several times, and always had a great time. Setting is beautiful. Nice bar.

My husband and I have lived in Reno for decades. La Strada is our favorite restaurant hands down. In all the years going to La Strada, the food and service have never wavered from being absolutely excellent. We love to take friends or family there when they visit Reno, and they all rave about it as well. We always go there for our anniversary, special occasions- and often, just because! The Carano family and Eldorado, as well as La Strada are elegant and wonderful.
