All these years they consistantly join food, wine, service, dessert and ambience and hit them all out of the park, every time. They make every experience special. Thank you so much. Simply perfection- don't change a thing!Nicole and Steve Hadley

column4: 3801 N Capital of Texas Hwy Ste. C-200 Austin, TX  78746
column13: We had GREAT service, an excellent meal and the prices are very reasonable. We'll be back...often.

On the positive side - what a beautiful setting-and inside was very nice also. My husband had the buttermilk fried chicken which was very good. Our friend ordered the filet mignon medium, I ordered the scallops. Now the negatives. The waitress returned to tell me they were out of scallops. This was 6:30 on a Friday night - would not have expected that. Changed my order to filet mignon medium. The food was brought, the waitress left, we cut into our steaks, and both were completely well done. Flagged down the waitress and ordered new steaks. In the meantime my husband ate his dinner. We got our second steaks - cooked perfectly. Now my husband got to sit and watch while we ate. Apologies, but nothing else offered. Will try again

column4: 4336  Van Nuys Blvd. Sherman Oaks, CA  91403
column13: Very good neighborhood Italian with reliable food. I like their pastas and my wife likes their veal parmigiana. Large portions usually, so you probably will be taking some food home. Friendly servers, too. You get your money's worth here.
After dinner there was a graduation ceremony for the students who successfully completed the program. It topped of a very pleasant evening.
Super view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge.

You know the food is fresh because it is not in a big tray that sits there for hours on end. The food is prepared in small quantities even though it is a buffet. The downside is that the serving dish may be empty for a little bit until the dish is replenished. But the quality of the food you get is well worth the wait.

I've been dining at Fontana's for about twenty five years even before it was remodeled. The food has always been consistently great. I love going there for good food and a lovely atmosphere. Unfortunately the cliental has changed in Cupertino. Fontana's needs now to have a dress code, no tee shirts, flip-flops, baggy shorts, nose-pickers okay that's hard to enforce but I'm all for trying.

column4: 5717 E Santa Ana Canyon Road Anaheim Hills, CA  92807
column13: Service was very good. Food was below average.
Superb food and presentation. Great service. What a find!

column4: 1113 N. Harper Ave West Hollywood, CA  90046
column13: this place is a classic spot...i guess because it's so "cheesey" but we won't be returning here. the food did not live up to the price we paid. you can get more atmosphere (cool 1940's), better food at half the price at El Coyote. the one thing we did like was the server had some shtick that was funny and charming....not enough to give it our recommendation though.
Great meal in a great place. Decor is great. The food was excellent as well as the service. Reservation needed as the wait time can reach easily an hour. Very busy place.

Been going to Hal's since it's opening years ago, still a happening hip place. Love the mixed crowd. But if you are looking for good food, this is not your restaurant. Very mediocre food, very overpriced. I has the salmon, a tiny piece, a few shreads of corn and spinach, $30...really ? I was hungry when I got home. The menu is rather limited too. I would only go for the burger....it is the only meal on the menu that is not outrageously overpriced.
Great spot in the heart of Venice. Food was creative and well executed. Happening sushi bar.

column4: 2920 W Jefferson Blvd Los Angeles, CA  90018
column13: I've been there before, and this is the best Creole food anywhere. I start salivating from the amazing aromas just walking to the table.The service is always above and beyond.There's a reason they've been there for so many years - quality
The steamed clams were very little in size and no flavor
Good place to eat. Service was great.
Great flavors and decent portions. Service was attentive without being overbearing. I preferred the Middle Eastern flavors over the Italian ones.
Enjoyed the dinner and service here. The romantic packages were the icing on the evening.

Good for bros and hipsters and people who enjoy fatty, saucy, stuffed with cream cheese sushi rolls that do not show off the flavors or textures of the fish or come close to resembling what sushi is all about. I felt like I ate dinner at McDonalds after those rolls. Uchi has made me unable to have sushi anywhere else. But, if you enjoy those fried, fatty, saucy rolls have it. You will fit right in.Plus my fiance ordered a ginger mojito, I do not think there was any alcohol in it, it was the weakest drink I have ever had.

column1: J&G Steakhouse Scottsdale at The Phoenician
column13: The food was delicious and one of the best meals I've had in a long time. It's in a resort so there were lots of people in casual wear, with kids and unfortunately one super loud family (6 adults yelling). The table next to us asked us if we were at a ball game. Beautiful view and a great place to have dinner and then move into the patio and enjoy the view
Attentive service. Very good food. Menu somewhat limited because the only use sustainable ingredients.

column1: Island Breeze Luau at the King Kamehameha Hotel
column13: We have been to other Island Luau's and this one was by far our favorite. The atmosphere, entertainment and food was great. It was an experience that our family will never forget.

Went for brunch. Not very much information out there about their brunch, except that it is good. It would be nice if they put information on their website. Apparently, they change the items as lunch time gets closer. I thought that this would be a "mexican food" buffet. It was normal breakfast items with a couple of omlet stations and a few mexican specialties. I probably will not go back or if I do, it will be later in the morning.

Food was fantastic. My friend and I ordered 4 small/share plates plus a cup of soup and grazed our way through a great meal. The heirloom salad with fresh mozz was out of this world. Service by Rebecca was friendly, efficient, and accommodating. One of the nicest places to dine in Salem.

column1: BlueFire Grill at La Costa Resort
column4: 2100 Costa Del Mar Road Carlsbad, CA  92009
column13: Placed our order via Open Table. Unfortunately, Blue Fire did not recognize our request for outdoor dining which we had put on the Open Table request. We were seated inside - but then the waiter noticed it, and said he would make it happen. So nice! So, they moved us and it was a perfect table outside. The food was amazing - soooo flavorful. Service was excellent. We would return, though it is a little bit pricey.
Always consistent! Lisa was great. We will be back.
Very Gormet , food selection excellent and plenty of choices. Presentation and service top notch. On par with the Zaggats best around Country.

I was seated under an airconditioner that had an occasional large drops water landing on my beautiful outfit throughout the evening! Requested a window seating when arriving as stated in the Open Table while making reservations. Was told I would have to wait an hour. Had arrived for my 7pm reservations but my party had to wait nearly 40 mins! Why thevOpen Table reservations or any at all?! Could hardly understand our waiter and trouble hearing him through the noise.

Excellent food. We had a special occasion so we had a big group so we had to order the same number of courses, but they didn't restrict us to a fixed menu. Everyone ordered what they fancied and all were happy with their choices from the kids to the adults. They were very friendly and the food was exquisite.

Dining at Aubergine is enjoyable from beginning to end. The restaurant is comfortable, decor attractive, and the greeting warm. The dining area sits a dozen couples. Dining is by reservations only and seating is immediate upon arrival. The menu has a four course prix fixe with an option wine pairing as well as a chef__s tasting menu. The sommelier is extremely knowledgeable and personable, the wait staff is attentive and helpful, and the executive chief Justin Cogley is phenomenal. Every course is remarkable in presentation, creativity, and taste. The ribeye entre was prepared perfectly and accompanying smoked cherry juice, bay leaf, and amaretto was outstanding. Executive pastry chief Ron Mendoza completes the total experience.

We ate in the lounge area which is an airy atrium and with the weather that weekend, it was lovely. The food was served promptly (but not overly quick!) and the service was excellent. The waiter was helpful but not overbearing and was considerate in making various menu suggestions. The food was excellent! Before the meal was over, we were already discussing the next time we would be coming for a meal.
We enjoyed ourselves, but the fish was too well done. It's our only complaint, as we do love fish.

This is our fourth or fifth time at the restaurant. We love it and enjoy taking tourists with us to give them a local flavor. This time the service just seemed a little off. The food for the most part was wonderful, but the selection just seemed a little lower than usual.
Drinks and service are great. The food is good but not really equal to the price.
Overall it was an awesome experience. I highly recommend Luciana's to anyone.

After having gone to Luella for years, I have to reluctantly admit I was shocked and saddened by my recent meal. I don't know what happened but everything we had (we ordered some old favorites) was dramatically worse than what we have previously experienced. Quality was sub-par on the Tuna Taco and the Watermelon salad, The chicken pot pie lacked a cohesive taste, my salmon just tasted...bad, and the dessert special, a strawberry rhubarb pie was inedible. I would have expected the usually stellar wait staff to notice our large uneaten portions. I would like to think that this was an off night, but the chef was there. Sadly, this was such an "fall" from our expectations that I am reluctant to return. Sorry guys.

The initial server asked if we had been to the Madrona before. We said this was our 7th or 8th time. She ignored our answer and proceeded to explain the menue/how to order from the menue. In the past during the meal, the usually attentive staff would of noticed that I or my wife were without a utensil as a new course was served. A couple of times they did not notice. We each had 5 courses. The food was good. The ice cream prepared at the table was , like always , very good. Overall sense was that the restaurant lacks an experienced ,personable and forceful maitre'd to oversee what's going on. Madrona uses alot of wait staff (division of labor ) to serve the meals. Perhaps again without an on top of things maitre'd, things get missed.

The food was just ok. Not terrible, but not memorable. But what really turned me off was the decor. It is just tired, in need of a re-do. Maybe if they turned the lights not so bright I wouldn't have noticed. This is a great space, and with some tlc and some dishes that 'wow' it could be great.

From the moment we were seated in a spacious booth, I could tell this was going to be a special experience. Michael and Bernard were solid servers. The manager, Jeff, welcomed us tableside and wished my wife happy birthday. As for Tre's food, it was the most balanced and well thought out I've enjoyed in five years. The lump crab and spicy calamari were great starters. My bride enjoyed her shrimp and grits entree, while my smoked pork chop was absolutely the best. The portion sizes were sufficient and the prices were very fair for such quality. I will go back as soon as I can.
Wow, a fantastic, small restaurant in downtown Anchorage. Food was superb. A great place for our last evening on a 2 week trip to Alaska.

Had a great time at Michael's as always. Had a new waitress this time and some things were a bit odd. Wine was very good for the price, was a house special this night. Had the pork chop and it was massive and quite good. My wife had the Redfish special and it was a large portion as well and also very well executed.

column4: Parker Palm Springs, 4200 East Palm Canyon Drive Palm Springs, CA  92264
column13: Great staff -- Steven and Ryan made sure we had everything. Menu: standard hotel --- with a hip clientele, why not branch out?

This place is absolutely amazing. We come to Breckenridge at least once a year and always make it a priority to come to this restaurant. It is obvious that this is the owner's passion and that he wants to not only provide the best experience for his cutomers but also take care of his employees. If there is a table that needs to be bused he is right there helping out. The waiting staff is always willing to help out their customers in anyway possible and will go above and beyond what is expected from a waitress. The food is spectacular- my favorite is the Mushroom Pappardelle. You can tell that it is all freshly made and by a spectacular chef that knows what he/she is doing. I would recommend anyone going to this restaurant.

Our second visit, and not nearly as good as our first. The drinks were tasty, the bread was warm, both entrees were excellent ... probably the most perfectly cooked Salmon that I've ever had (and I *always* order Salmon). We were thrilled to get a table with a great view after making our Saturday night reservations that same afternoon. The big disappointment was our waitress. She was slow to take our order, never offered drink refills, never asked if we liked our food, and brought a dessert menu 10 minutes after another employee delivered one. The rest of the staff were attentive ... water refilled frequently, dishes delivered & cleared promptly. We skipped dessert because we couldn't wait to leave ... had our birthday dessert elsewhere.

column4: 7001 N. Scottsdale Rd Ste 147 Scottsdale, AZ  85253
column13: Very loud, the entertainment was in the dining area, made it hard to visit with my friends...often found myself shouting to be heard. Server seemed to loose focus, often had to re-order coctails before actually receiving order.

First time there, brought In-laws, had a great meal and experience. Highly recommend. We were given great, personalized attention by our server, Jesse. The food was incredible. After lunch were offered a tour of the kitchen, what an amazing place! Worth every penny.

column4: 100 S Main St Santa Ana, CA  92701
column13: Very friendly place always makes you feel welcomed!

column4: 133 Corte Madera Town Center Corte Madera, CA  94925
column13: A nice restaurant to eat at when you want to meet a friend to catch up or to eat as a family. The food is fresh, the wait staff friendly, and the service is prompt.

column4: 142 W. Palace Ave Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: We chose this venue in order to try their patio. It was very pleasant with only a few tables in use. I noticed a very nice room inside that presumably is available for a group. Inside looks like a good place to be deemed "romantic" however months ago when we ate inside the bar noise would have negated that. It seemed very much a "hot spot" that evening. I understand that this noise has been corrected. The patio is more "friendly" than "romantic".

Very enjoyable dining experience. The food was delicious and the wait staff was friendly and checked on us often. Seafood entrees were cooked to perfection (blackened salmon). Would definitely return for another delicious meal and wonderful scenic views!

DO not go to this restaurant in the summer. It is just too hot. We made a reservation for 3 o'clock in the afternoon thinking we would have "linner". I hoped it would be cooling off. It was not. The hostess set us under the misters & at a table where we would "get a cool breeze". I hate misters & it was more like gale force winds.The service was Ok as was the food.From our experience I do not understand the appeal of this place.

column4: 587 St. Helena Hwy (Hwy 29) St. Helena, CA  94574
column13: One of the very besr restaurants in a very competitive neighberhood. Combines great food, excellent service and attractive ambience. Worht the price! One of thfinest California Cabernet lists to be found - anywhere.
I love Prima! We don't live in Kailua but whenever we can, we take a trip out there just for Prima!

column4: One Remington Place Oklahoma City, OK  73111
column13: This is our second visit and the wiat staff for our table was the same gentelman. He was again outstanding with service and race track tips. Will plan to come again.

column4: 380 S. US Hwy 89 Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: another wonderful meal with Danny waiting on us. We had lamb chops and venison. Both were great !!!

column4: 1050 S Flower ST #102 Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: Food was very good. Non-descript on the outside, but quite nice inside. Waiter was very engaged, without being intrusive.

This place is fabulous! I would always choose to go there. The food was exquisite and the service, impeccable. I had the lobster and it couldn't have been prepared better. The wait staff was attentive, but not obtrusive, the sommelier, very knowledgeable. Worth every dollar!!

Outstanding experience. I can't compare it to French Laundry since the experience is so different, but it was equally as magical and enjoyable. Very creative kitchen, outstanding tasting food, excellent and friendly service, and excellent wine pairings. Easily ranks as one of my top meals ever.

column1: The Dining Room at Salish Lodge & Spa
column13: The Salish Lodge was lovely. The service was outstanding. The food was delicious and the prices were more than reasonable. The view from the restaurant was spectacular.

Went for a business meeting and was seated in the corner (which was nice). Views were great as was the food. We both had the short-rib pasta special. I think the service was a bit overbearing as we were interrupted every few minutes with questions. I would bring business contacts here again for lunch.

column1: Technique at Le Cordon Bleu -  Scottsdale
column13: Food and service very good. Students do a fabulous job! The table setting is super.

In my neighborhood. I've eaten at Serafina soooo many times. Always wonderful. Love the melanzane. The outdoor eating is a hidden gem. I didn't put good for groups because it can get quite loud. But, I've been to a fabulous wedding there.also, Some of the other special features may be true and I haven't experienced them..
I want to live Shiva's more than I really do. It's in a really convenient location. But the food and service don't measure up.
As always everything was excellent. This is one of our favorite places to dine in Reno.

column1: SkyCity Restaurant at the Space Needle
column13: The stunning view makes this a worthwhile trip. Most of our food was quite good, but the steak turned out terribly. It was too bad because the rest of the experience was very enjoyable. If you go for the views, make sure you get a table by the window. There are a few interior tables and I'd have been really disappointed to be stuck there. As it was, the slow turning of the restaurant offered spectacular views uninterrupted by the bars of the observation deck, so the restaurant is really an awesome place to get the whole Space Needle effect. Go for the 360 degree vistas and choose your food carefully.

We found the patio to have a great view but the live entertainment was too loud for our liking so we ate inside with the piano. Rudy was excellent in his attention to serving us and the meal was magnificent. Loved the piano. Portions were HUGE. This place was a "find" because of OpenTable listing.

column4: 17 Monarch Bay Plaza Dana Point, CA  92629
column13: I just love Stella's....and it's right around the corner from my house. Good food, awesome homemade garlic bread, and good service.

We had to wait for our food for about 45 minutes after we ordered. The food then came out cold. Our waitress comped our dessert, but that took another half hour to receive. Great tasting food, but very slow kitchen. Our waitress tried her hardest to make up for it.
We did all you can eat sushi as usual, however this time it was a big disapointment
Chef's tasting menu and beer/wine offerings were right on the mark. Service attentive and pleasant. Location and interior decor is average.

column1: The Corner Office Restaurant and Martini Bar
column13: My only complaint - which is a big one - is the after effects that both my mom and I had from the MSG loaded dinners. The food was actually tasty, but had that 'too flavored' taste to it. Pretty quickly, we both felt extremely bloated, headaches...and my mom had heart palpitations and sweating from the MSG overload. They need to STOP using MSG in their food.

Pricey, bad seating and unimpressive beef might have made for a less then remarkable night at Cowboy Star. I had no delusions of leaving C~Star without spending some money, not counting the healthy pours of Bourbon and decent wine list, the food, especially the beef did not live up to the hype and cost.
Good food but very expensive for small portions. Sea Bass for $34 is a bit pricey.

I have visited The Merk multiple times when traveling to San Diego - the food is always great. Aside from an isolated encounter with one of their hostess/waitresses, the service has always been great as well. I love that they serve breakfast until 2pm so I can still get breakfast for lunch if I want (I finally got to try chilaquiles) and they have a great deal on bottomless mimosas - you don't have to beg for the next one, they just keep bringing them!Even if you don't stop in for dinner - go see Shay at the bar and have him make you a REAL margarita on the rocks. No nasty bottled mix at this bar!

column4: 55 Music Concourse Drive San Francisco, CA  94118
column13: What a wonderful environment, great food and service.The Moss Room is a welcome rest from the crowds above. If you plan to visit the CA Academy of Sciences make a reservation at the Moss Room for lunch. You will be glad you did!

column1: Easy Street Brasserie at The Sky Lodge
column13: Great food, best desert menu in town
will go again for atmosphere not necessarily for the food.

column4: 19308 Cottonwood Drive Holiday Inn, Select Hotel, 4th Floor Parker, CO  80138
column13: Great place service was nice, but took to long for are order
Excellent food, and service!!!! Outdoor patio was great - good for people-watching!!!

Had an excellent Halibut here. Cocktails were good, but very small for the price. Outdoor patio seating area is very nice. Window tables inside are nice too. This restaurant is in a newer Sheraton Hotel.
Service was VERY slow. Pleasant, but slow. Get the feeling that the amount of business has swamped their infrastructure.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in town. Only complaint this time was that the noise was the loudest I've ever heard it there and we couldn't hear each other across the table. But that's not always the case here. Great food and service, as always.

column4: 9550 Waples Street, Suite 115 San Diego, CA  92121
column13: Always a solid choice for dining out. Interesting menu, fabulous wines. Went for the Bastille Day menu and wine pairing. Even at lunch the food is well prepared, the meal well timed and thoroughly enjoyable. The hard part is getting out of the place without spending a lot of money in the wine shop downstairs!

Historic spot in a great location. And food and service are both really improving. Still a need to spiff the place up a bit, work on some service refinements and cater to other than just the "deal chicken" mentality...

column4: 207 North Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: I eat at Zinc all the time. The food is outstanding and it's easier to get a table here than at its sister restaurant Boudro's. The Shrimp Po-Boy is a must on your visit if you like a great Po-Boy sandwich. Food is always very consistent and the bar scene gets very vibrant. Outside patio welcomes cigars, so it's a great place to enjoy a good cigar and a glass of wine. Huge wine list and full bar. Hamburgers are also excellent as well as everything else on the menu.

column4: 395 Santa Monica Place, Suite 323e Santa Monica, CA  90401
column13: Everything was great ! We had the locals menu on Wednesday if you have a Santa Monica/Venice Drivers lic. BEST deal in town !! Sat outside an ate on the desk - will go back next Wednesday for sure.

column4: 419 N. Canon Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Jaime the waiter was incredible! He kept up laughing and entertained all throughout dinner. The Dine LA Menu was great and offered great options for a good price. Each time I go to LA from Chicago, I make sure to stop into this great little Venezuelan gem of a restaurant and relive old times with friends. My favorite on the menu is the Chicken Pabellon - it combines a great mix of shredded chicken, black beans, plantains, and arepitas. (They aren't literally mixed together, but on the same plate). Loved it!

Tillmans is a wonderful place! We enjoyed our dinner and drinks. I had an amazing chefs special lump crab crusted filet that you could cut with a fork!!! We will be going to Tillmans again in the near future!!GREAT PLACE!!
Awsome food and service. The menu is classy and gives a lot of options for the different tastes.

column4: 395 Santa Monica Place, Suite 300 Santa Monica, CA  90401
column13: My husband and I really Enjoy dinning @ the Sonoma Wine Gardens. The ambience is super, The meals are great and the service is always good. Highly recommended.
Try the albacore Ni_oise, wonderful.

column1: Rawhide Steakhouse at Wild Horse Pass
column4: 5700 W North Loop Road Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: Although this is practically sitting in our backyard, we had not visited the new Chandler location since it opened. We had 7 guests visiting from out of state and we all had a ball!! I would highly recommend this for a night out with children.

column4: 2801 Prospect Park Drive Rancho Cordova, CA  95670
column13: There have been a few changes since we were here last. In the dinning room one can't get happy hour prices on wine which I thought was not a nice way to treat dinner guests. There were so other specials that were only available at the bar. It gives less of an incentive to meet here now with a group. We still like the all day breakfast and lunch menu options although you can't beat the filet mignon for taste and value. But no more $10 glasses of wine for us!

column4: 1200 Getty Center Drive Los Angeles, CA  90049
column13: lovely, they should be open more frequently
An extremely bold and successful variety of flavors on both dishes we tried! Great job of staying away from a 'cookie cutter' twist on a southwestern theme.
This Restaurant is amazing! The food is incredible and creative! Should be named a top 3 restaurant in Austin!
The restaurant was really pretty. It was well staffed with friendly people and the food was great.
Very nice atmosphere, great food, and service!...Perhaps the best dinning in Lawton for a romantic evening, first date, or special occasion. 5stars!

column4: 1200 Alta Loma Road West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: Great outdoor hideaway. Food average, my fish was overlooked and it was just a ok dining experience.

As always, the food and service at Table Mountain were excellent. It is a very relaxed experience with a great southwest fusion menu. We can always find something to enjoy. The vegetarian tamales are to die for!

The service was very attentive. The bread was excellent. The wine list had an extensive selection and reasonable pricing. The food was not particularly pleasing. It seems as if the chef tried to do too much with too many ingredients and left a bit of a cacophony of flavors in the appetizers and main courses we tried. The food was not bad, just a bit confusing on the palate. Overall, it was a pleasant experience due to the very friendly and attentive staff. Maybe just a bad night for the kitchen?

The food is absolutely fabulous!! Do the wine pairing flight. The pairings are spot on and totally compliment your course. The service is fantastic and Michael is very attentive and do let him make choices for you. This is a family favorite for our special occasions.

column1: Palm Terrace Restaurant & Lounge - Island Hotel
column4: 690 Newport Center Dr Newport Beach, CA  92660
column13: My friend had been here a few times, but for lunch with buddies. He liked the food and wanted to bring me here, so we came for my birthday dinner. They had listed on Open Table that they were participating in L.A. Restaurant Week, and I reserved on that page, but they totally misled the public on this one. O.K, so we wrote that off. I cannot fault the service, food, or atmosphere. All were great. Prices, tho', are very high and the entrees come with precious little accompaniment. I ordered a dessert off the menu cuz no mention was made of a comp birthday dessert - - then they brought my order PLUS a comp dessert... very odd. Wine list is super, but VERY expensive!! We won't go back.

column4: 428 Agua Fria St. Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Very cool little restaurant, eclectic menu, intriguing fusion combinations, friendly and knowledgable serving staff -- look forward to going again. And again! Reasonably priced for Santa Fe.
We happened to go on trivia night for my parents' anniversary so the ambiance was just ruined. The food for some reason, while good, all came out too salty to really enjoy.

column4: 1110 E. Champlain Ave, Suite 101 Fresno, CA  93720
column13: We were there on Sunday at 5:30 pm.I had read some poor reviews elsewhere,but decided to take a chance.Our waiter seemed a bit inexperienced.We were not offered a prix fixe option that I overheard later given to another table.I had lobster ravioi and my husband had the salmon.Both meals were excellent.We've been living in Fresno for about a year and finding really fine food has been hit and miss.Hopefully,the quality of food we had on Sunday will be the usual and not just a fluke.

Birthday dinner with the "girls." prime rib sandwich with sweet potato fries delicious and good portion. Thank goodness for opentable and search function because I wanted near around Mission Viejo with outdoor seating. O'Neills was a definite find! Outdoor patio with that incredible view of the golf course was exactly what I was looking for. My only negative was the waitress was not attentive, took me 3 times of asking before I received my place setting. And we went the whole time from receiving drinks until food was served to get refills. And the only reason for refills is because we asked the waiters who served the food for more ice tea. Salads did not come out ahead of entrees, waitress blamed the kitchen. Food was great, will be back.
Very expensive, lousy menu , would not go back.

column1: First Cabin at Balboa Bay Club & Resort
column4: 1221 West Coast Highway Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: Beautiful room overlooking a beautiful part of Balboa. Attentive service and very good food. I would probably have rated the room quiet on the noise level if it weren't for one loudmouth discoursing on politics who happened to be seating next to us.
Superb menu choices. Excellent wine and cocktail listings. Gracious and attentive service.

column1: The Whaling Bar & Grill at La Valencia Hotel
column13: Food was outstanding. Try the Paella , awesome. Always a great atmosphere and great for an occasion!
the Lamb had no favor had to put my goat cheese on top

The food was AMAZING! the appetizers (sausage and grits and spring rolls) were great, the salad with watermelon and pork belly was TO DIE FOR! The pork belly and the "liquid pumpkin pie" were our favorites. Entrees were good (osso bucco (sp?) and Salisbury steak) not as good as the first 2 courses but still tasty and by the time dessert came, we had to take it to go...STUFFED! (the berry crumble was amazing...bread pudding not as much but maybe cause I ate it at midnight)The place is small, quiet and the wine list is great. The paintings are whimsical and brighten up the place. The service was perfect! We never had an empty water glass. WE WILL RETURN with friends!

This was my second visit over the past two months. Ate inside this time as the temperature outside was just too hot. We had a fantastic Saturday lunch/brunch. Our first two wine selections were not available, but the third one was perfect, which made up for not having the first two. Lunch was fantastic. We each ordered something different and we all shared bites from one another. We only had two desserts, the chocolate chocolate cake and the tiramisu. Both were heavenly. Everything about the place is fantastic. The food presentation is top notch.

column1: The Glitretind Restaurant at Stein Eriksen Lodge
column13: Sarah our waitress was phenomenal. Any questions asked were given a complete and comprehensible answer. The meals came out with bigger portions than expect, which was awesome due to the quality of the dishes. My wife had the Striped Sea Bass which was done to perfection and I had to try the Kobe Pot Roast, which was like butter. One must also try the Crab Soup from the menu as it is not only amazing on flavor, but unique with popcorn. It was a perfect meal for my wife's birthday and we will be back for other occasions and to try their Sunday Brunch.

column4: 404 El Paso Blvd Manitou Springs, CO  80829
column13: Always an enjoyable experience!

Andiamo's always delivers a great dining experience. Service was exceptional even though there were a number of graduation groups that would create chaos in lesser establishments. The pasta was perfect. We will be back soon.
Good Persian food at a reasonable price.

first waitress was like a robot; with little personality; did not make us feel like this was a special dining place; but was repalced by the waiter Henry who changed our opinion. He was quite professional; what one would expect of a place like this. ordred the carnitas, but got an end cut that was quite fatty and very little was eatable. Henry finaly made it back around to check on things and when we explained the problem he immeately exchanged the entire plate. very nice, but that was half way thru the meal and so she was begining when i was ending. friday special grilled prokchop was quite large and very good. not a good first impression.

Loved the Rhododendron Restaurant while staying at the Inn at Virginia Mason for a family wedding.We ate dinner once and breakfast twice and everything was delicious and the service was excellent---thank you!!

column4: 4930 W. Flamingo Road Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: Food, as always was delicious, served at the right tempurture....after more than twenty years still GREAT!!! Our server,Sacramento, like all personnel seem to really enjoy their job, making the experience pleasant from the front door to the bat to the dining room.

Grappa Bistro has a unique location with both indoor and outdoor dining available. Private parking is a great plus. Food and service were perfect. My lunch guest was late by 30 minutes, but the staff was very understanding and accommodating.

column4: 2334 North International Parkway Terminal C DFW Airport, TX  75261
column13: This place is right out of a movie, a movie you wish you were in. I can't even explain this place in a way that does it justice. It is comfortable, quit, dark and wonderful. The entire dining room has a mahagony-red glow and feels like you are in a classic gentleman's lounge. The steak had a good pure flavor without over seasoning and was prepared just as I asked. The lobster bisque had a nice complexity to it and very large pieces of lobster mixed in with the caviar garnish. The scotch selection was disappointing but it had a good port selection.
Pricey for what we got. Limited menu.

Had a really excellent meal here! Started off with the Queso Fundido con Chorizo de Casa...WOW...A+. Perfect blend of cheese and chorizo with a side of guac inside corn & flour torillas. We also got the Camarones en Mole Verde (A), Enchiladas de Camarones (A), and Cochinita Pibil en hojas de Platano (B). Both the red and white sangrias were average. Chips & salsa were addicting. Will definitely be back!
Loved it, server was a little slow to greet us and serve us water and take drink orders. Food was great.

column4: 17535 Ballinger Way NE Lake Forest Park, WA  98155
column13: I found the food tasteless and bland. I had the Buttermilk Chicken, the thigh was still red in the middle, the potatoes I could have hung paper with. The slaw was passable. My daughter had Beef Stroganoff. It was nothing more than a few chunks of meat(?)on over- done noodles. The wine was good tho.

column4: 3607 Alameda de las Pulgas Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Food was delicious....very special....although quite pricy. Service was amazing. The owner greeted us personally. Wish we could afford to eat here more often but will have to save it for special occasions only.

Went here with a group of 6 (which can be pretty hard in SF). They were very accommodating and had a decently-priced wine list. Reccommend the eggplant parm, buratta, gnocci, butternut squash ravioli, pasta carbonara, tiramisu. Overall a very nice experience!

column4: 827 Santa Cruz Avenue Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Very nice local restaurant - food and service very good, relaxed environment, family friendly.
Pros:
We love this place! We are trying to go as often as possible before they close on August 12, 2012 :-( If you've been thinking about trying this beautiful food, HURRY!
The noise level was so high as to be almost disqualifying. Conversation was almost impossible. Isn't there a better euphemism for "outrageously noisy" than "energetic"?

column4: 10722 South Riverfront Parkway South Jordan, UT  84095
column13: Fantastic service, fantastic food!

column4: 2525 S. Grand Ave. Glenwood Springs, CO  81601
column13: What a pleasant surprise to find a restaurant of this quality in a quite residential area. A must visit when in Glenwood Springs!

A great place for a romantic dinner or for a group. TheTapas selection was great. Highly recommend the black rice paella and chicken empanada. The short rib was alsoExcellent. Only item that was not a hit were the medallions. Overall service was good, the waitress was friendly and informative. I will definitely be back.
Food was fantastic. Service great.
The chef overcooked my steak at first, but the new one was brought out quickly. They even gave us a free desert to make up for it. Excellent service.

column4: 1701 N. Market Street In the West End Dallas, TX  75202
column13: Lots of menu options, but not your typical Mexican food. Delicious and our server was awesome! Very friendly, helpful with menu choices.
Fairh was an excellent server with a good knowledge of wines. Pleasant dinner. Thanks
Usually very good. This evening was an exception. Will never order the rib eye as it was gristley and tough.

column4: 3801 W. Temple Ave, Bldg 79 Pomona, CA  91768
column13: The atmosphere was wonderful! The students of the university were the servers, hosts, and chefs. Being a student at the university, it was great to see some of my peers working and enjoying themselves. They were very knowledgable about the menu and answered all questions we had with ease. I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone who is looking for a top-notch dining experience and a staff with lots of enthusiasm.

This was an excellent steak house. The steaks were delicious, they melted in your mouth. I had the crab bisque and it was the best I had ever tasted. I would highly recommend it and would definately go back.
Excellent service and food with a comfortable surrounding

column4: 5000 Spring Gulch Road Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: North Grille's best feature is its location! It is a great place to dine for those with homes or anyone staying north of town. The view of the Tetons over the golf course is beautiful. Although the kitchen can be sluggish, the food is good and worth the wait and the waitstaff are very helpful and friendly. Everyone was pleased with their entree selections which varied from salad, to burger, to salmon.

column4: 7335 Bollinger Road Unit C Cupertino, CA  95014
column13: Our overall experience was excellent. The dishes we had, mushroom pizza, coffee glazed ribs, sea bass, bacon fried rice, and miso glazed chicken were excellent. The basil eggplant wasn't quite what we expected but we had plenty of food for 5 of us. I would also recommend the desserts, creme brulee and lava cake. Both were really good. Our servers were very attentive, knowledgeable and helpful. Although it was really busy on a Friday evening, our meal felt relaxed and we weren't hurried. However, I would recommend reservations since I noticed walk-ins had to wait for a table.
I feel the prices on some items are on the high side.

column4: 1875 S. Bascom Ave #550 Campbell Campbell, CA  95008
column13: Had a great time at this resturant and the food was amazing. Very glad that they had a gluten free menu I have already recomended this resturant and plan to return.

column1: Shizen at the JW Marriott Resort & Spa
column4: 221 N. Rampart Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89145
column13: Overall a very good restaurant. We enjoyed our meal and the service was great. The place was not crowded, but with the hibachi service going, it was fun. The rock shrimp appetizer is a must.
Great spot for brunch. Buffet was very nice, varied and fresh. Omelet station very good. They were a bit slow refilling chafing dishes and clearing plates from our table.
Food was ok. This place is using it's menu to draw people in but the execution is only one step up from a diner. The impression I got was of a neighborhood bar with pretensions.

This small neighborhood restaurant is perfect. Friendly staff, excellent cocktails - finally someone who can make a great martini outside of Bellevue - and tasty dishes make a pleasant and quiet meal with your spouse. They do let you sample the wine before you buy and that was very helpful. We fully plan on being back again even though it is a bit of a drive for us!
Great location in downtown Redlands. Very tasty menu with fresh ingredients. I will be back!
Lovely restaurant with great menu choices. We had a lovely brunch there this morning...highly recommended!!

column4: 120 Manhattan Beach Blvd. Manhattan Beach, CA  90266
column13: Our experience at Rock N'Fish was great. The service, food, and atmosphere was excellenet. The waitress and hostess were professional, attentive, and very personable. We will definitely come back soon and often!!

column4: 260 Capistrano Road Half Moon Bay, CA  94019
column13: We celebrated my mother-inlaws' 87th birthday. There were 8 of us including her great grand daughter (2 and 1/2 years old). It was wonderful and they brought a little chocolate dessert with two candles on it for her (I did ask for some sort of treat at the end). All went very well and we said "We will go back there."

column4: 17900 S Clackamas River Dr Carver, OR  97045
column13: As always the food was incredible. The service was prompt, friendly and always appropriate for timing for the courses. Wee always want to come to Stone Cliff when celebrating....anything. thanks for the wonderful evening.
Went there for Easter brunch. Food was fresh and tasty. Portions were large. Coffee was excellent although the cups were too small!
Absolutely the best, authentic, Japanese food using premium ingredients. If you want authentic upscale Japanese food, this is it.

The service was impeccable; everyone was so attentive. We sat at the bar and ordered specialty rolls which were delicious. The prices for the rolls were very reasonable and the quality of the fish was very good. It was our first time there. Overall enjoyed the experience very much. It was very lively and everything was so yummy!

column4: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Love the atmosphere of this place! I think this place is more for a special occasion because it is very different and fun. But I guess you can come here on any night in casual clothes and have meal. We ended up going for dinner because of all the celebrity hype. The drinks are $13 and so worth it! We bought 2 sunset tea drinks (not sure what the exact name was) and shared with 3 other people. Defintely got buzzed from that since each drink has 8 shots. My sister ordered the bubble gum martinee which was delicious and so cute! Make sure to order food with the sugary drinks otherwise you will get a headache. I ended up getting the steak salad. Made perfectly! I can't complain about the place.
The linquini with clam sauce had great flavor, but the clams were very tough. Also had to ask the waitress for utensils, bread and water, which was dissappointing.
Good Chinese food, however, it's way too overpriced. You will be paying more for the ambience and the service rather than the food.
Best dry-aged steaks in the Houston area.
Loved everything will be back again

column1: High Finance  Restaurant - At the top of the Tram
column13: The ride up was amazing. The sunset was beautiful. Thinking about it now I wonder if they're open for breakfast? Sunrise from the other side of the restaurant is probably breathtaking as well.
Loved the people working there and the food was exceptional.
Creative menu, thoughtful presentation, a real gifted way with chocolate, kind accommodation with dietary needs - overall very satisfying birthday celebration. Definitely will return.

Excellent flexible service (I was able to change my reservation time) but the waitress was not super friendly and did not offer any suggestions or give any info. about the restaurant (such as - we don't have nightly specials every night it is a different meal.) Atmosphere is nice and not too loud so you can hold a conversation. However, the food was so-so. I had the stuffed calamari with potatoes and it seemed like it was not seasoned. My friend had the shrimp and was dismayed to find out that she had to peel the shrimp herself. We stopped by later on our way home and one of the waiters (who was from out of the country - can't recall his name) helped us grab a taxi so was super helpful!
Better than average food and service

I had not been to Crush 29 in a couple of years. I received a gift certificate and was not looking forward to going to Crush because I had found it too noisy in the past and the food & service so-so. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised and plan on returning. I usually go across the street but now I have two places to go for food spirits. The service was excellent and the food was spot on. They were accomodating with my special requests for my food selection.

This is my 2nd visit to Roseville. The service was not great. I had to wait a while before someone came to my table. The waitress was helpful in that the wine she suggested was great for me but it took forever to get it. When my guest arrived, we ordered a bottle. She brought an opened one and said that I would get more if I took that one! My guest loved her cannaloni but my scallopine was tough, overcooked & cold. It took a while to get her attention to change it and they just cooked it more! She got the manager who really made an effort to satisfy me by asking for another chance to cook a new one. It was much better & he did take it off my check. It was 1+ hrs to eat. Ordered dessert sampler, good except apple crepe-dry and pasty.

Enjoyed a friday evening out with our friends. Service and food was outstanding as it has been on our last three visits before this one. Cedar Plank Salmon is always incredible and the Heirloom Tomatoe & Burrata salad was fabulous.

column4: 1185 Galleria Blvd., Suite P-120 Westfield Galleria at Roseville Roseville, CA  95678
column13: Went for my 70th bday and quite impressed with service from server Justin and all other servers. Steak was just too greasy (ribeye) for my taste.
Great bar with excellent selection of beers. Free range grass-fed beef cooked exactly as ordered.

column4: 2407 E Coast Highway Corona Del Mar, CA  92625
column13: One of our favorites. Great food, good value and good service. Unfortunately, server ordered the wrong fish from the kitchen so made for a longer wait. But she did make it up to us in the bill when it came. Things happen sometimes Just one of those off nights. But we will continue to go back and introduce our friends.

column4: 53 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: Roti continues to be a favorite, especially for the food, which is always outstanding. I had the braised lamb shank and the meat was falling off the bone, delicious, and gargantuan enough to conjure images of Fred Flintstone being served a rack of dinosaur ribs. I could write on and on and on about how terrific the food is at Roti, so just go and you'll see.

The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great. The Chicken Kiev and the Borsch was super yummy. The Pierogi, Zrazy, and Deruny were just as fabulous~! Can't wait to try other things on this menu.

column4: 7 W. Carrillo St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: One of our favorite places in Santa Barbara - my daughter requested to have her 18th birthday dinner there. We particularly enjoy the soups which are always excellent.

We were very concerned as we were the only party there on a Saturday night while other local places are bustling. I guess this is undiscovered as we were pleasantly surprised. I had the Halibut ($22). Fresh, grilled, high quality and presented beautifully with grilled vegetables and a nice sauce on the side. My wife had the salmon, same quality and a large portion. One caveat: avoid the house wine (I wisely asked for a taste and rejected it, switched to beer. Maybe BYO or select from small list).

column4: 55 Cyril Magnin Street San Francisco, CA  94102
column13: Convneient if you are staying at the PARC 55, but significantly overpriced for the quality of food. 2 individuals in the group had the buffet and both commented how bad the scrambled eggs were. For the others that ordered off the menu, the of the 5 orders were inaccurate,(wrong meat, wrong eggs, wrong bread, but took quite awhile to arrive so we did not have time to bother switching. Due to party size of 8 the waiter added an automatic gratuity of 18%; or nearly $40 bucks. Lucky for him....10% or $20 bucks from a 200 dollar breakfast bill would have been too much for the service recieved.

column4: 5969 S. University Blvd Greenwood Village, CO  80121
column13: Wonderful evening. Celebration of a family birthday. We were treated wonderfully, Food super great and service excellent.

column1: The Flying V at Loews Ventana Canyon Resort
column13: The duck tacos were sublime! They are exactly the kind of imaginitive appetizer one could expect at a upscale establishement in Mexico City. The chef and kitchen get my applause since they executed them without a hitch, especially considering the fact that duck is often botched by the inexperienced.

column4: 505 E Twain Ave Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Not so friendly or put together staff, took 15min for me to get my ice tea( just a regular ice tea...) When the food did come out it was amazing. Waiters never stopped by to check on us.

column4: 6300 S Pacific Coast Highway Redondo Beach, CA  90277
column13: Service was very poor, waiter never came to ask about food. We'll wait awhile to return.

column1: Cast Iron at the Omni Fort Worth
column13: The service was excellent. It is a romantic setting from the viewpoint of cozy booths and reduced lighting, however the openings to the lobby detract from that. The food was good. Solid and tasty but nothing special with the exception of the salad which was superb. The free valet parking is a very nice touch and the people watching is tons of fun. I would definitely go there again and think it is a good spot to take out of town guests as well.
We had a lovely evening, great ambience, lovely food and great people!Will definitely be coming back!
Servers were nice and quick. Food was surprisingly good. Its difficult to find a pan asian done right. This is one of them. We don't visit Everett often but if we do again, we know where to eat.
Great dinner on their outdoor patio. Waiter was excellent and checked in on us just the right amount. Food was outstanding, and very authentically italian. Loved everything about this place!

column1: Le Grand Bistro and Oyster Bar
column13: The food was great but it shouldn't take 2.2 hours to eat two courses (soup and main dish). We waited often for the server to return and found that numerous tables had received and completed their meals before we had even received ours on Friday night. The restaurant was full but not overly busy.
This is one of those "fabulous for the price" places--homecooked Indian food--they make their own yogurt--the coconut rice--YUMMY--owner exceptionally accommodating.

We had a wonderful time at Rudy and Paco! Definitely going back soon. This was our (my husband and I) first time there ever. Our server Katy was very kind and helpful. She guided us through selecting a wine and our dinners. Wonderful experience cannot wait to go back!
Staff are extremely courteous,helpful and timely. Seafood was as great as usual.

column4: 20109 Aurora Ave N Suite 101 Shoreline, WA  98133
column13: very good sushi, rolls, sides. Nice atmosphere, very friendly and responsive staff. Generous portions as well.
Food was tastey, service was unfriendly.

This place is obviously loved by the locals and tourists who try it for the first time - they all keep coming back. The food is fantastic, prices are reasonable and the decor and ambiance fit this open grill restaurant - a great option to the other restaurants on the wharf. It's a busy place on Saturday night so make sure you reserve.
Got there for the soft opening, prices were reasonable, but we over did it, so our bill was alittle on the heavy side.

column4: 4269 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: Food was good, not great. Drinks are the specialty. However, the restaurant is closing in August.

column4: 8419 Park Meadows Center Dr. Lone Tree, CO  80124
column13: I was disappointed. I fully expected a fabulous meal, but was served food that was merely average. My dining companion, a chile rellenos aficionado, thought the food had been too "Americanized." The chipotle shrimp were good, but I expected great...

column4: 3800 W. Starr Pass Boulevard Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: This is a very nice place!! Our server was not attentive at all!! I had to call for the floor manager a couple of times when we needed service. The NY Strip steaks were over cooked. I'm sure they would have tasted awesome if they were cooked the way we asked for them. When you order a glass of wine and ask for a another the server will bring out a premeasured craft of wine and pour it into your glass, which fills the glass to 1/3 full. What happened to the days when you ate at a restaurant and asked for another glass of wine, then they would bring out the bottle and top you off.
Had a great romantic dinner. Our server, Tuesday, was very friendly and helpful. Love this restaurant -- will be back for all future special occassions!
Beautiful venue. Great location. Food and service, so so.

column1: ENVY The Steakhouse at The Renaissance Las Vegas
column13: Third time here and each time service and food quality have gone down
Was not what I expected. I wanted a more energetic atmosphere. Only dining customers with 2 people at bar in entire restraunt
Awesome as always!! We love Nid!!!
Rather disappointing experience this time. The interesting dishes on the menu are no longer (the duck fessenjoun was one) and the new stuff was not great.

Had a great dinner here. Everything was small bites or tapas style. The bites were a little too big for my wife, but still were great tasting. Has some old favorites and some new things. The things we like the most were the oyster and uni with tomato water. What a great bite. Then the black cod kaarage was excellent especially with the fried fish bones. What a treat. The big eye tuna sashimi was very good also. All in all, we had 6 dishes and it was really good. Would definitely go there again

Ultimately this review is tempered by the fact that this is Bakersfield where there are a total of two restaurants on OpenTable, despite a population of 347,000 which is almost half of that of San Francisco. So our expectations were low. However, the specialty margaritas (not the regular ones) were quite good, salsa was also very good, and the service was friendly. Fish tacos, shrimp tacos, and a seafood fajita platter were good enough that if we were in Bakersfield again, we would probably return.

column1: Rio Grande Mexican Restaurant - Lone Tree
column4: 9535 Park Meadows Dr Lone Tree, CO  80124
column13: There were 6 of us, we had a great time, our waiter was fun and very efficient. Service was fast and food was good
Food was great,it took an extremely long time for our main course to arrive though.

Excellent Food and Excellent Service after we were seated. The hostess was not very friendly and did not seat us according to our reservation time. We will definitely return for the wonderful dinning experience.
Met my brother and wife there... hadn't seen them in a year. Food was very good, I was surprised at the pricing (a good surprise). The attentiveness of the staff was amazing. We'll definetly be back.
My favorite restaurant. What else can I say?

column1: Canyon Cafe at Loews Ventana Canyon Resort
column13: enjoyable in all aspects, impeccable service

column4: 1075 Sutter Street Hotel Carlton San Francisco, CA  94109
column13: We went on a busy Sat night and it was quite noisy. Liked our server and the food!

column4: 6900 N. May Ave. Suite 7B Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: We are so glad to have found this great Bistro. It is hard to find really unique dining in OKC and this fits the bill.

column4: 265 S. Palm Canyon Drive Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Heather was the best waitress, she examples the menu & told us jokes

The food was exceptional, well presented with considerable care, and everyone in a diverse party enjoyed it very much. While there were some longer delays in obtaining service, the waitress was excellent and very accomodating. We had a great time sharing the appetizers. I think you just need to expect that the detail in these dishes requires additional time.

Mother's Day brunch was set up as a special event at the Boulderado, and both my mother and wife felt it was a big hit! The buffet was excellent - having two omlette chefs working was smart so as to avoid a bottleneck forming - the food quality and variety was very good. Service and ambiance were well done even though we were in the conference room, not the restaurant. That plus the Boulderado's inherent charm made it special, which was the main objective!

column4: 3711 W. Cahuenga Blvd. Studio City, CA  91604
column13: Delicious, healthy food; attentive, friendly service. What more could one want? Sun Cafe is proof that a plant based diet isn't boring. Love this place.
Risotto dish was pink and not very appetizing. Chicken lollipops were great.

column4: 3355 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Didn't even refill my water glass. Vegas is the desert
Our server was very friendly and upbeat, knowledgeable about the menu.

I found Salt just by searching for restaurants on open table, and it was one of the best meals we've ever had. I can honestly say that the gnocchi is the best gnocchi both my husband and I ever had, and I can't stop thinking about the potatoes either! Desserts were to die for!! The service was top notch, and I loved the decor and vibe of the space.

column4: 165 S West Temple Bldg #1 Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Usually Benihana is one of my favorites but we haven't been in a few years. They have changed things around a bit and it seems a bit cramped. We had what I am assuming to be a chef on his first day. He was horrible. I ordered the filet and shrimp as I always do and it was very bland. He had no idea what he was doing. Also our waiter was clueless. I ordered a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon and about twenty minutes (yes it took that long) he brought me a white wine. Obviously not a drinker but then tried to tell me I ordered the Kendal Jackson and it was white. Oh dear. This was our only bad experience we have has there but I had brought a friend that had never been there and I'm sure she won't be back.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - SLC
column4: 20 South 400 West Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Had a great time at Fleming's tonight!The food was excellent, the service was tremendous, the place was packed!Probably the best steak I have ever had. No joke! The Chef was ON!!!Great, as always.

column1: Buca di Beppo - Salt Lake City
column4: 202 West 300 South Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Good food; fast, friendly service; nice atmosphere. I really like the decorations and photos on the walls __ entertaining and interesting. Prices are fair for what you're getting. Only complaint was that we made a reservation for a particular time, but they just got us in the same as everyone else, which made us late for our next appointment. Nice place, though, and we'll probably go back.

column4: 191 South Rio Grande Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: We met family we hadn't seen for a while and were allowed time to visit with them. We did not feel rushed. We got there when it was not busy, but then the dinner crowd hit and still we did not feel pushed out. We liked that.

Food was ok, which is Austin isn't good enough. Service was spotty. Overall the experience was good but there are too many great restaurants in Austin so good isn't good enough. They also seem overly anxious about turning over the tables.
Was terrific. Great view and the foold very good.
The food was great and fresh. We enjoyed everything we ordered. Its very authentic. If I lived in Dallas I would go here regularly.

column4: 6464 E. Tanque Verde Rd. Tucson, AZ  85715
column13: We made our reservation about 45 minutes prior to arrival and when we got there, were told that they just received it and it would be another 10- 15 minutes. About 2 minutes later we were seated. Our waiter stopped by within a couple minutes and took our drink orders. Then the manager stopped by and asked how we were and if everything was alright. He apologized and let us know that over 100 folks had shown up for a high school reunion without making reservations and that our food might take a little longer due to this fact. I didn't find the wait to be unacceptable and really appreciated the manager taking the time to let us know. The waiter was absolutely attentive and it was a great experience. Food was quite good too.
Great steak...good service...loud...wine list overpriced

column1: Sam Choy's Breakfast, Lunch, Crab & Big Aloha Brewery
column13: The food at Sam Choy's is fabulous.
Looks sort of questionable from outside, but very nice inside.Flamenco guitarist great

column4: 108 West Channel Road Santa Monica, CA  90402
column13: Would absolutely go back - MaitraD was fabulous - servers were the best -Food excellent and flavorful-Will definitely recommend to friends -Jo

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - SA
column4: 255 East Basse Road Suite 200 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Table was ready on time, the bone in ribeye was fantastic and prepared perfectly. The service was attentive and timed well. My only drawback was the "noise". I guess it was more "energy" than noise. I was there with my daughters for a special dinner and the 3 of us noted there seemed to be more stimulation then at other similar restaurants.I will go back though, FYI. Great overall.
Everything was perfect...food, service, atmosphere and the jazz band that was playing was an added plus for the evening! Thank you!

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway The Shops At La Cantera San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Enjoyed the food and service! My dining companion had the pork loin, which I had a bite of, it was delicious! I had the mac-nut chicken, so tasty, reminded me of Hawaii! We will definitely return to Kona to try other dishes.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Suite 22200 San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Clearly one of the top two meals of this type I have eaten in San Antonio in the last 10 years. Every course was better than the one before. Great service, flexible atmosphere.

column4: 7720 Jones Maltsberger Concord Plaza San Antonio, TX  78216
column13: Still the best steakhouse in town. First on our list for special occasions.

column4: 1170 E. Commerce Street Sunset Station St. Paul Square San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: As requested, we had the priviate dining area downstairs and it was just perfect for the business that neeed to be conducted! Thank you for your extra efforts!

column1: BeachFire Bar and Grill - San Clemente
column4: 204 Avenida Del Mar, Ste. D San Clemente, CA  92672
column13: Have eaten at this restaurant many times over the years. This was the first time we have been since it changed hands. I was very happy to see that most of our favorites were still on the menu with some interesting new additions. We have the Calamari appetizer and it was great like always. Both my husband and I had the Penne Bistecca. The flavor was right on but both of us had tough and chewy meat. It used to be made with filet and I'm not sure what they are using now but it was not the same quality as before. We will try again and hope for a better outcome.
The food and service was very good. A very nice night with lots of activity. We will definately return on our next visit.

column4: 2825 Sand Hill Road Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: My stake wad cold. I had been there before,but this time food was cold and the service was ok not excellent as we are used to.

column4: 477 Camino del Rio S San Diego, CA  92108
column13: Good food - prepared very well by cook - enjoyed show by cook
I will surely come back to this place. everything was awesome!

column4: 353 Fifth Avenue Cross Street Between J and K Street San Diego, CA  92101
column13: We have been to Spain on numerous occasions and therefore it is a treat to find a restaurant that serves authentic tapas and paella. The food was very good as was the service. Quite an enjoyable evening.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - San Diego
column13: Entire staff was outstanding - not just professional, but super friendly and made our dining experience memorable. The food was excellent - the molten cake superb. However it is the staff at this location that takes it over the top.

Overall excellent food as you would expect for Nobu (I have eaten at the New York and LA versions), but not as excellent as you would expect for the price. Hugely overpriced for what is was at lunch. It may have been price gouging for ComicCon. It did sour my taste for wanting to return
Service was good but the food was average.

column4: 333 West Harbor Drive San Diego, CA  92101
column13: Our waiter, William, was superb. Very professional and warm. We had fireworks over the water just as we were ordering. Very memorable evening. Fabulous food!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Diego
column4: 1355 North Harbor Drive San Diego, CA  92101
column13: We went to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. I requested a nice view, we looked at a building. It was disappointing. After being seated the server didn't come to our table for quite some time. While it was a bit busy, it would have been nice to at least be acknowledged. The food was good. The steak was great, however the potatoes were disappointing. They were not cooked completly as they were hard. I have dined there before and I must say I was disappointed, especially since it was a very special occasion.The parking lot was under construction, you only had valet service, for $6. That was also disappointing as you had no choice but to valet.
First time there and loved the new rolls. Food was fantastic and it was such a nice relaxing atmosphere for lunch. Will def come again!

The food was excellent, & we loved the ambiance. Our server, however, was not very friendly, and he came across as having a dry personality. We observed other servers to be very friendly and cordial. We will go back for their delicious food. However, next time we will make sure we get a table with one of the other servers.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: My friends and I have always enjoyed dining at this restaurant. The food is consistently good.It's a wonderful place to bring young children - they are child friendly and thet enjoy theentertainment of the cooking of their meals

The food was excellent!! The service was well intended and they were very nice but just a little finessing would be great!! Taking my coat, putting my napkin on my lap, sweeping the bread crumps off the table, and just a bit more focussed attention would be great!! This wouldn't prevent me from coming back at all but if they are contending with top restaurants in a top restaurant city then service expectation is high when the prices are so high as well.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
column4: 1601 Van Ness Avenue San Francisco, CA  94109
column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Great service and best steaks in town!!!

Everyone was extremely friendly, vivacious and entertaining from the moment we stepped foot inside! The food was excellent! We were completely entertained w/ the show that came w/ the dinner! Definite must go to!!!
Always great service and great food!

column4: 3055 Olin Avenue, Suite 1000 Suite 1000 San Jose, CA  95128
column13: Every experience we've had with Maggiano's has been positive and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to a friend or family member for any romantic dates or group get-togethers. The hosts are very friendly and helpful, and the servers are extremely pleasant, which reflects very well on the management. Most of the food is great, with a few dishes sometimes a bit salty. We always order the stuffed mushrooms, and at least a couple of pastas, no matter the size of the group. Good ambiance, great desserts (especially the lemon cookies and dark chocolate cake), and always a good time.

column1: Buca di Beppo - San Jose - Oakridge
column4: 925 Blossom Hill Road Oakridge Mall Suite 1529 San Jose, CA  95123
column13: the place was not busy, more than half the tables were empty, still the service was slow. how ever the server was polite and said sorry for being late. food was OK, but the main drawback was lack of individual portions.
Fun, they had live music that night and the drinks and food were good.

column1: Cedar Creek Inn - San Juan Capistrano
column4: 26860 Ortega Highway San Juan Capistrano, CA  92675
column13: Excellent menu choices. Food very tasty and plentiful. Wait staff excellent. Very reasonable prices. Will return.

column4: 2015 Crow Canyon Pl. San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: Large menu and servings with options for every diet.

I had a reservation for 7 for our department at work. We were very tight on time, so I decided to have everyone leave early for our lunch arrival. I had the advantage to call in our orders at 10AM and I was greeting warmly to that idea. Needless to say we had our meal shortly after we sat down and had 30 min to chat and travel back to the office.

The service at Santa Catarina was very good and the restaurant has a nice "feel", but no one in our group of four liked their food. Our opinions ranged from OK, a c-, to very bad, an F. There are many options in the area with much better Mexican food. Do not waste your time or money on Santa Catarina!

column1: Louies Cajun Kitchen and Bourbon Bar
column13: The food was delicious. we were there on a Tuesday night and it was pretty quiet sans for a few tables, and some guys watching sports at the bar. Large drink list (I got a delicious cucumber cocktail). The waiter allowed my aunt to add fish to the portabella mushroom dish and modified it to make it even more delicious. I had swordfish that was flavored and cooked perfectly. If you are looking for a nicer meal in a more casual town like Santa Cruz, this is a great place!
Our chef was terrific - entertaining and clever.
Pwefect for a visit with our 4 grandchildren!Great lobster ravioliPlenty of chianti was a plus!
Good Italian food and goot value for the money.
beet salad was excellent, the chicken with prosciutto was good. The gorgonzola sauce on the gnocci was too heavy and there was too much of it. The gnocci themselves were fine, light and creamy

column4: 1200 South Coast Hwy Laguna Beach, CA  92651
column13: I have never had a bad meal here. It's my favorite in Laguna Beach.
Very nice place! Everything was excellent. Wish they would have told me about the Happy Hour menu vs spending a small fortune

Came to the front desk. Was treated in a very aloof fashion until we told them we had a reservation and were early. Seating was horrible! They must be expecting clietele over 6' tall. My wife and I are 5'8" and 5' 4" and the table wss ridiculously high. The restaurant was basically empty. We looked over the menu, didn't like the food offering, it seemed to cater more to the sushi roll crowd than a japanese steakhouse. Waited for the server for about 10minutes in the empty restaurant. Server/Waiter/Waitress didn't show, started to feel uncomfortable, got up and left. My wife and I typically like quiet places. Rated the food good in order to submit the review, but we never ate.

column4: 132 West Water Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Food and service was excellent. We were celebrating a birthday and the Coyote Cafe made it special. The sign of a great restaurant is their willingness to take extra steps to make special occasions even better. Thank you, Coyote Cafe!
Love that reservations are now available. LOVE the grilled salmon salad!

column4: 1611 S. College Ave. Suite 100 Fort Collins, CO  80525
column13: Went early on a Sunday afternoon. The service was great (we were the only customers, I said it was early). The food really was very good. Will be returning.
Excellent, experienced chef-owner, and enthusiastic manager who does his best to make guests feel welcome.Terrific food and wine.

Wonderful, well prepared and presented dishes are served here. Service is top-notch. Both seafood dishes that we had were cooked perfectly and accompanied with complementary side dishes. Plus, if you are lucky enough, you will be seated by the window for a wonderful view of Tacoma and Puget Sound. A great pick for a delightful evening!
We had the shrimp linguine and the burger. Both were good.

column4: 600 E. Market St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: For our first visit, we went specifically for the daily buffet. We arrived @ 130P, the buffet ends @ 200P, and we NEVER felt rushed; instead, all of the food, including the beef tenderloin, lamb, chicken sausage, and the guy that carves them, stayed available until we were finished. We enjoyed *everything* that we ate. Of special note was our server, Beth - attentive but not too, friendly but not too, available but not too - we hate "hovering," and Beth was perfect in every way. She is also a genuinely interesting & delightful person. My partner and I felt completely comfortable w/ her, and w/ all of the staff @ Achiote. We will definitely return on our next visit to SA - may even go back for dinner tomorrow.
Delicious pasta selections, yummy sausage and one of the best desserts in town in the Cinnamon Roll Sundae!

column4: 3773 Willow Glen Drive El Cajon, CA  92010
column13: I have been here for lunch 3x and its so different on the weekend evenings. Daytime brings in the casual breakfast and lunch deals. Extensive menu choices all day and night. Dinner is a bit more expensive unless you go to the back menu pages. The waiter was happy to guide us with a couple recommendations when I asked and was very knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list. In fact it was Exceptional!!! The weekends can get loud with the live music but the band was great and had people dancing next to their tables. Not the place for a quiet romantic dinner, but perfect for good food and a fun evening. The bar area was very busy, drinks were served fast and it looked like everyone was having a good time.

column4: 31161 Niguel Road, Ste A Laguna Niguel, CA  92677
column13: The staff was very occomodating for our large group which changed from a group of 20 to 15. It was a beautiful place to take a group photo too (infront of the mural of Venice). And the food was outstanding! Everyone ordered a variety of salads and sandwiches, from the Warm Goat Cheese Salad, Ahi Salad, Endive Salad to the Marinated Portobello Mushroom Sandwich. I had to try them all (the inner foodie in me!) and I must say, they were all beautifully presented and tasted better than I could have made. I know everyone had wonderful comments about their meal. Then, the birthday cake came -- we experienced thee best chocolate mousse, ganache, cake I think, no I know, I've ever had! Overall, we had a memorable experience at Savoie Fare!

column4: 14175 West Indian School Rd. Goodyear, AZ  85395
column13: The meal was mediocre at best but the service decent.

We called ahead to let them know we were running late. It was a dine LA reservation and they were busy. Our table was occupied but the hostess was gracious and offered us corner seats at the bar. Same menu, and attentive service from the two bartenders. Great experience and delicious food.

column4: 401 NE Northgate Way Ste. 1106 Seattle, WA  98125
column13: Been to Stanford's four times. Never a bad experience.
Had High Tea - JUST LOVELY !!!!!
Great standby -- something for everyone. Fun, lively, food is always good

column4: 9595 Six Pines Drive Suite 1120 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: A true neighborhood gem! The food is fabulous and service is great. I really like the cozy feel of the restaurant.

column1: SC Prime Steakhouse - Suncoast Hotel & Casino
column13: Another visit to the SC Steak House and no complaints. Our server Brenda was superb and they did a good job of keeping the ice tea glasses topped off. That is one of our main complaints concerning service in Las Vegas. We tried the special and it was just out of this world. Will return VERY soon!

This place is very fun. There were two of us. The place is small, really a cafe in size. The food was excellent, particularly the carpaccio, the seafood appetizer, and the oricchiette with sausage and broccoli rabe. The seafood risotto was good, but not in the same caliber. The tiramisu is fabulous. Michaele, the waiter who appears in other reviews, is indeed, a reminder of what makes us all want to move to Italy. The owners, husband and wife, seem very nice and certainly the real deal. It wasn't cheap, but not onerously expensive, and one begrudges them nothing because the quality is there. I would happily go back.
We enjoy the menu at the grill. The fresh specials are always good.

Service was fantastic. Very clean restaurant, solid menu, good beer and drink selection. I was on a first date and we stayed at the table long after dinner, I really appreciated how polite the server was after we closed out the check. I had the Dancing Pines Bourbon Pub Steak. Very good.
Great food, great service - our go to restaurant (weekly)!

column4: 740 S Decatur Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89107
