column13: Great atmosphere in a hidden area. Excellent food at a reasonable price.
you will never leave there hungry, ever!

First time in the many, many visits I found the friend rice to taste pasty. I notice when the rice was being distributed to those that ordered it, there was some chunky portions that the chef through away and he had to add another small portion to complete my husbands bowl. I didn't make a fuss as we were their with family but it was really the worst I have tasted. THe rest of the meal was good.

First time there. Staff was wonderful and friendly. The decor is marvelous. Was on first dated decor keep us very busy naming different people. What most impressed me, while walking out thru kitchen ypur workers were diligently scrubbing kitchen

column4: 7014 E. Camelback Road Scottsdale Fashion Square Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Good place for lunch meetings ...try their sweet chile glazed salmon salad...
Food and service were great! I'll be back.

column4: 7001 N. Scottsdale Road, Suite 290 Scottsdale, AZ  85253
column13: excellent diner n waiter was very good

column4: 15323 N. Scottsdale Rd Suite 195 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: Last Saturday night was our first trip to SOL Cocina. The menu was creative, but not quite coastal Mexican as advertised I don't recommend the lobster tacos. The SOL ceviche' was very good and was a huge portion, although not served as described in the menu. The margaritas were very good, if a little small. The service was excellent. The restaurant was very noisy... not ambiance, just people talking.... likely to be heard over others.. but the prerecorded background music, my wife, and the waiter were very difficult to hear. Portions were large. Definitely a "bang for the buck" eatery, but just didn't quite live up to the hype and the Scottsdale Quarter nightlife. I wouldn't use it for a special occasion or to impress a date.
outstanding!!! the Generous pour special is a must try for wine lovers...
The food was delicious and the service very good.
Terrific service! Ask for Jasmine when you go - she'll take awesome care of you :)
Enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere. Waiter was very knowledgable about the menu. Best meal so far on this trip. Would definitely return.

column4: 1333 North California Blvd. Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: Scott's has always been good so with their new coupon book we tried the Sunday Brunch. While a little pricey ($40/person), you do get what you pay for. There were plenty of seafood options, including (all you can eat) crab cake benedicts. When I asked if all they had was the prime rib prepared medium, the chef immediately retrieved a rare cut for me. And, the OJ, sparkling wine and mimosas were all free flowing. The price actually comes down when you only need a snack for dinner after this brunch.
Consistently fine dining - well prepared food, great service and fine wines. Extremely friendly personnel.

The food is excellent - although pricey for "comfort food". Pork chops were huge - grilled -potatoes au gratin, remarkable. Went before theater - very close - walking distance. Thought I had paid only $5 the week before to park with the Valet to go to another restaurant next door before going to the theater - not sure why it was $8 this time.

column4: 2543 Lake Tahoe Boulevard South Lake Tahoe, CA  96150
column13: Mama Mia! An Italian restaurant with no expresso machine?!!I wouldn't call that very Italian....

column4: 4035 N Loop 1604 W, Ste 102 San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: 6th dinner visit with friends. Good, dependable, but not a standout. However, everyone left happy.

From the beginning with a greating and ending with a nice discussion with the owner, it was a wonderful evening. The wine list was thorough with some unique selections. The meals my wife and I had were excellent from the Wild Boar Osso Bucco to the beef filet our meal was perfect. A cannoli was shared for desert and again was very good. I'd highly recommend this for lovers not only of italian food, but for good food in general.

column4: 750 North Harbor Drive San Diego, CA  92101
column13: As always, great food with an amazing view.
Great fun! A great way to unwind after a long meeting! Lots of laughs and we weren't rushed. It was the first time for all of us and we all had a great time. The food and drinks were good.

column1: The Grille at Shadowrock Sedona Hilton
column13: Great food. We really enjoyed the atmosphere on the patio. Service was outstanding.
great to see Mizu back at it....dinner was as great as it used to be
Sears is a charming local find with great ambience! The food is superb, service is friendly, and portion sizes are good , but not overwhelming. We enjoyed it so much we went back!

column1: Seasons at the Four Seasons Hotel
column4: 757 Market St. Four Seasons Hotel San Francisco, CA  94103
column13: It was our 9th wedding anniversary. We have come to The Four Seasons now for five years and every time they seat us at our table they usually gave us a glass of champagne each. Not his time.After the dinner they usually gave us complimentary desserts. Not this time.Also they had changed their menu and there were no longer many of my favorites there, goose liver patee.Many of the side dishes for the main courses were over salted and dry.
A local favorite. The menu varies. It's still one of the better restaurants in town.
Not a bad pub food restaurant, but nothing spectacular. They forgot an appetizer and acted like they were making a concession taking it off our bill. We just chalked that to a miscommunication.
Always a fun time. Yummy food served family style. Large portions - luckily the staff packages take-home boxes very well.
We were a group of 14 and had a great meal, excellent service and a fun night thanks to the whole team at Il Fornaio Seattle. Special thanks to Lee for making our night super!

column1: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Seattle
column13: Excellent, consistent! Love this place!
My filet was cooked medium and was dry. For the price, not a good value.

I use to dining here, i loved the service there. But I guess depend who is going to be your waiter. I had my favorite waitress, she is very sweet and friendly. But last dining with Capital Grille. It's my Bithday fall in to the weekday. It's was slow and everything not really great like it use to be. To me the service is the number #1, good food is coming #2. Doesn't matter how good the foods are, but if you don't have a good service, it's ruin everything.
The food was great,as usual. The Chicken Pot Pie is a show stealer and has been one of our favorites for years. I would highly recommend that one tries it.A great evening.
Decent French food but service was slow and inconsistent.

I really like Mediterranean food. However, many restaurants allow hookah smoking if they have an outdoor dining area. I'm not too fond of that while I'm eating. The manager/owner was kind enough to not allow it during our dining experience which was very nice. Food was exceptionally good for Mediterranean food. The chicken kabob was a little dry but everything else was great.
Awesome food and great service!

This was a very weird experience. Basically, there was no one there. The waitstaff was nice but not polished or what you would expect at all. The waitperson was lovely but had really bad and noticable body odor. What a turnoff. The spare staff of 2 seemed to have other duties as well. The saving grace was that the food was very good. Not sure that I will ever return and cannot recommend. Too weird.

Stunning. Amazing food presentations, delicious flavor profiles, excellent service (if not a bit overwhelmed). The "tacos" we're exceptional. The skewers amazing. A great blend of some traditional sushi favors and some awesome fusion spins. Don't skip the sesame ice cream!

column4: 3131 West Coast Highway Newport Beach, CA  92663
column13: Our large group enjoyed a fabulous dinner with delicious food, service and view. We thoroghly enjoyed our experience and highly recommend Villa Nova with their extensive and fairly priced menu. We look forward to returning!

column4: 1201 San Carlos Avenue San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: greasy food. so and so service. Not worth going back.

column4: 3720 Factoria Blvd SE Suite C Bellevue, WA  98006
column13: The service was really good. The food and decor are the same as every other Mexican restaurant. Food was not bad, not outstanding. Would go back if I was in the mood for Mexican. Do wish they had something different; more authentic.

Like it every time we go with friends. Service is perfect as are all staff inside and valet with their friendliness and smiles. Makes one feel as if they are happy to have you there.We have never been disappointed.
The food,service and ambiance at Curbside Cafe was outstanding!

I have been to Daily Grill a few times and will go back again. I like the ambience, the clubby feeling. The food is straightforward with good quality ingredients. The service has always been nothing short of excellent.
Staff and food were great! The place was quiet and romantic. I just had a hard time with the prices. I figure others do as well because we were one of three couples there from 8:30-11pm

column4: 9737 Santa Monica Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: This is our second visit at Sfixio. We recommended the restaurant to our friends with whom who celebrated their 44th wedding anniversary. We all loved it.The menu selection and house specials were outstanding. Don't miss the delicious Tiramisu for desert. From start to end the service was friendly and we felt treated like family and friends. We highly recommending Sfixio to anyone who appreciates good food, great service and pleasant ambiance.
Our first time here. Everything was delicious! Service was outstanding. They have more seating indoors than I thought they would... so plenty indoor and outdoor seating.

We had a group work lunch and everyone was very pleased with the food they ordered - something for everyone, a great variety of dishes. We were able to visit at normal conversational levels, which was very nice. The wait staff was personable, attentive and just plain wonderful. We will definetly be back! The "boss" was especially pleased with the food and service. :-)
Great fresh food and great service

column4: 400 S. San Vicente Blvd. Beverly Hills, CA  90048
column13: The lamb and kibbeh was a true find. Simple, and authentic. Hallal meat allowed the whole family to eat together, and the staff was very patient and understanding regarding other dietary restrictions and allergies. We will be back.
1 of us had great food. 1 of us didn't.

column4: 1432 N. Main Street Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: We were seated in the back room which lacked the vibe of the main dining area. The food was excellent but the service was not. We were pretty much forgotten and had to flag other staff down to request anything.

This place was fun. Beachy atmosphere, wood floors like decks/piers, lively conversations around us. I loved the beachy decor on the walls. The food was delicious. The grilled shark tasted fresh. I want to go back and try more of their fish selection. My husband was able to get a rare ribeye, even though our server cautioned it may not happen due to their style of preparation on the meat. Our server recommended the champagne viniagrette on my salad and he was right! Very good. I accepted the suggestion of bread for the table (because I love bread) but didn't realize until it came that it was prepared garlic bread. Would have liked plain, warm, crusty bread. I do look forward to going back.
Service can be inconsistent but almost always great with oldtimed servers.
I had a cabana table on lanai.It's was a nice night view & sunset,so romantic.We had a wonderful time for our wedding anniversary!!!

We were a family group of seven, ages 12 to 84, out for dinner after a day in Golden Gate Park, which is across the street. Even though they were busy, our Open Table reservation was honored immediately. Everyone on the restaurant staff was extremely pleasant. Each person in our party found something to their liking, and the opnions on the food ranged from good to excellent. The food came out without delay, but no one felt rushed. The service was great. It was the perfect place for our neeeds, and we will definitely go again.
Excellent job of staying in touch with the customers.

column4: 9595 Six Pines Dr #900 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Why do I wait to be seated when I have reservations

The people were nice, the portions were tiny, and this is not longer a tapas bar at all. We bought some caramel corn there and the sugar was slightly burnt. The maker of the corn was Armstrong I believe. Not for me I will not go there again.

Though we had a very nice evening, the food was unexceptional, and though the staff was attentive, there was a 10-15 minute wait for the fourth person in our group to receive her entree. The snapper (locally available) was skimpy, and not prepared the way it was ordered. Veal chop was good, but do to the delay in serving, the other dishes were getting cold while waiting. This would have been more tolerable if the server would have explained the wait. All in all, the fault was most probably with the kitchen and their timing.

column4: 2050 University Ave @ University Circle East Palo Alto, CA  94303
column13: Nice restaurant, nice food, nice waiter. Limited menu (we were there on Sunday). Not a lot of people there.
Not what we expected for the price.

Atmosphere was red and gold traditional Italian - furniture was nothing great. Food is served family style or individual servings which is nice. Great wine list. Good place for large groups. Everything we ate, piccata, eggplants and fresh mozzarella salad for 2, was fresh and good.

column4: 11180 Highway One Point Reyes Station, CA  94956
column13: The Station House has been a favorite for many years primarily because of its location and the lovely garden. Food can be a bit inconsistent but is generally good and the dining experience is usually relaxing and pleasant. Makes you glad to live in Northern California!

Went to celebrate a birthday and our family LOVES sushi, especially the fancy type rolls. We ordered so many they wouldn't all fit on our table. Favorites were the Jalapeno Poppers that were special that day, the Dragon Roll, Honey Crunch Roll & Spider Rolls. All were fresh, crisp, and absolutely delicious! Ordered a sake bomb for the b-day girl, we had a glass of house chardonnay that was served nice and cold. Other visits included the Tempura plate but this time we went just for the sushi. A great place to take your friends and family. Service was attentive, friendly and the food came quickly.

Had heard so much about this place and was excited to finally go. Calamari and spring rolls were really very good. The rest of the meal went down hill from there. No flavor. service was mediocre at best. Really really loud, not the place for a romantic dinner.

Disappointed with the food.Roti was overcooked and greasy - seems that it was reheated from pre-made.Steamed seabass was tiny, for $18, I was hoping for something bigger than McD pattie size.String beans were good.

column4: 75-5799 Alii Dr, Ste. C 3 Kailua-Kona, HI  96740
column13: Good food - one the best non-resort Japanese restaurants on the Island. Very consistant and reasonable for the food they serve. We've never had a bad experience over the years.

column1: Ship Tavern at the Brown Palace
column13: I've always liked the feel of the Ship Tavern. That hasn't changed. But I was disappointed in the food. My fish and chips were over priced. The fish batter was a bit heavy and the large cut chips were mushy. They suffered by comparison to the much better one's I had two days before at half the price at Tommyknocker's in Idaho Springs.

I usually love everything about this place and still do, and will still plan on coming but the waiter gave us the check too early! We would've had another round of drinks! He was very attentive and gave us fast service I just wish he would've asked if we wanted anything else before he brought the bill.

column1: The Shores Restaurant - La Jolla Shores Hotel
column4: 8110 Camino Del Oro La Jolla, CA  92037
column13: We were a group from the Registrar of Voters and were celebrating five birthdays. We had a wonderful time. Thanks! P.S. the salmon was super.

column4: 5040 Wild Horse Pass Boulevard Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: The best service and steaks ever

We had an excellent experience. The food was somewhat slow in coming, which I take as a good sign; it is not preprepared and heated when you order, but actually crafted at the time you order it. The presentation was terrific on all dishes, as were the flavors. The drinks are limited, but tasty, using soju.We'll definitely come back.

column4: 2375 Alamo Pintado Avenue Los Olivos, CA  93441
column13: Mattei Brothers are alive and well at this new site. Previously Patrick's Sidestreet Cafe--the restaurant is charming--the food is wonderful.......
Great food and atmosphere! Forgot my phone there, but they had it in the office for me to pick up the next day! A wonderful experience with incredible service!
Very pleasant outdoor dining. Greeted nicely. Woule like to go again!

ice you can afford $110 prix fixe 4 course meal plus wine plus tax and tip, you,ll love the gorgeous scenery, excellent food and service. A less dramatic, but truly gorgeous alternative with outside seating was the Ventan Inn and Spa on the east side of Hwy 1 way up in the hills overlooking the coast.
Silo, is a beautiful restaurant, we were impressed with its looks, atmosphere and food. We will recommend it to our friends and make it a place we will frequent as well. Great first impression.
Kobe-style beef special was wonderful. I took pics of my beautiful heirloom tomato salad to recreate for dinner party entertaining! Service was great!
Our waitress was great. She made the experience great and was very helpful with the menu.

column4: 1651 S. University Dr. Fort Worth, TX  76107
column13: The Silver Fox does it right! The staff was well organized, professional, and welcoming. The atmosphere was classic, not too upscale and not too casual. To top it off the food was spot on. Just the right portions and the plate presentation was perfect, not to mention it was quite tasty! We enjoyed celebrating our anniversary here and will most certainly recommend to others.

Our experience at Silver Fox in Grapevine is always wonderful. We go there to celebrate Special occasions. The food Is consistently fantastic. We are treated like royalty by the entire staff. Even the manager/proprietor comes to every table to make sure our experience is everything we wanted and more. My wife and I reserve The Fox for spoiling each other. July 18th was our 37th anniversary. Of course, we celebrated it at Silver Fox in Grapevine and it was just as fabulous as every time before. We have never had a complaint about anything at this marvelous place.Try it. You will return as often as you can.

column4: 100 Ocean View Ave. Pismo Beach, CA  93449
column13: We had a wonderful warm shrimp and mixed green salad that was excellent. The wine, Opolo Mountain Zinfandel, is the best! The steak and lobster, not so much. The lobster was good, but slightly overcooked. The steak (a filet, which is my favorite cut) was tasteless and way overcooked. I won__t order a steak there again. The crme br_le was excellent. I wish the bar was further away from the dining room though. The bar noise is too loud to enjoy a nice, relaxing dinner.

There was only one table seated inside. When I showed up I told them I was meeting someone. They said no one was there waiting. 10 minutes later I called my friend who was meeting me to find out where she was. She had been sitting at a table outside for 15 minutes! How could they miss that? Two of them at the podium seating--didn't even ask me about her. Really stupid--or lazy. Server was great!

The music is pounding when you enter, but luckily things are quieter in back. Service was friendly (I used to get very surly waitresses), though when you order dim sum there will naturally be lulls. The basil in the Thai basil soda oxidized when it was chopped, which made for an unattractive drink, though it was delicious. The lo mai gai was hearty and generous, and the pork shu mai and shrimp ha gow were fine examples of the genre.

Enjoyed the food! Fried chicken was wonderful and worth returning for. Shrimp and grits were decent but not as authentic as expected. Only complaint is the noise level. Once the room began filling up, it was too difficult to carry on a conversation or hear anything the wait staff or my wife had to say. Outside on a busy street waiting on the valet was very much welcomed with a much quieter environment. I hope they can address the noise factor as I would only return off peak times in hope of a lighter crowd.
Very good, creative Indian food.
Place was good! A little pricey but perfect for a date or special occasion. Service was meh but it was busy, so it wasn't a deal breaker. Unique menu with lots of choice.

column4: 544 West Alma Ave. San Jose, CA  95425
column13: We had a reservation for 6:30 and waited for about 15 minutes for someone to sit us. No one came. They were just finishing up a banquet of some sorts and there were very few tables ready to sit at. I cannot review the food because we did not sit down to eat.

column1: The Grill on the Alley - San Jose
column4: 172 South Market St. San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Very expensive for quality of food. There are better places.

Being a first time we were somewhat skeptical about a neighborhood Persian restaurant. But it turned out to be quite a pleasant surprise. Food was very good, Prices are reasonable and service was good.
A team of seven went and the food was perfect. We arrived early and was seated.

The wait staff is friendly, unpretentious, and attentive. The interior decor is warm and welcoming with a nice outside patio as well. The primarily seafood menu is creative and eclectic. The 4 of us had a few of the basic entrees: halibut with black miso sauce (divine!), nicoise salad (abundant and tasty with a poached egg), and the rich risotto with scallops (absolutely wonderful). But next time, we'll check out the other more intriguing dishes. I don't usually write reviews but we were extremely pleased with our meals and service. We arrived at 5:00 on a Sunday and by 5:30, there were several parties dining. This area of SF is quiet on the weekends so people were obviously coming to their destination: SKOOL.
Good tortilla soup; shrimp tacos were very poor...soggy, tasteless, pretty much inedible. With such a beautiful setting, its a shame that they can't do a better with the food.
Went for my Birthday, and had a great time. The food was awesome. I recommend the Tequila pasta, rich taste.

Music a little loud. Waitress did not describe sauces, nor ingredients at all....training staff is key. The very young inexperienced pastry chef was enthusiastic but must perfect her art...be more creative. Head chef did come by the table, that was nice. We were the only diners the night we were there! :( yet the food was fresh...how do they do that? The shrimp cocktail was very good! A must....the pork chop made with apple butter was outstanding. Staff knowledge, and care about the resaurant failed them, courtesy did not equate into food knowledge, they can not afford that! For the location, they may need a family night special treat, a little cheaper offering to drive the attitude and get the word out....homemade sausage? May-be! :)

column4: 189 The Grove Drive Los Angeles, CA  90036
column8: Beverly / Fairfax / La Brea / Third St.
column13: Always great outside dining. Great service.

column4: 465 S. La Cienega Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90048
column13: The best tapas in a modern style provided. Super tasty and super fun

column4: 465 South La Cienega Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90048
column13: I was not as impressed with the food at Tres as I was with The Bazaar. The service was also lacking, though this may have been because we were there for lunch and there weren't as many customers so less staff. I absolutely adored the decorations and design of the restaurant (but, again, still more impressed with The Bazaar).

column4: 2501 Colorado Ave. Suite 190 Santa Monica, CA  90404
column13: We eat there quite often, and love it. Good quality food for the reasonable prices. They have a no charge corkage policy that is very refreshing, excellent service, and do NOT soak their patrons. Very nice in our present economy.Quite the opposite of "El Covo" restaurant in West Hollywood,that USE TO BE a wonderful restaurant at one time , and has gone downhill.I RATED IT LAST MONTH!
This was our 4th visit. The food and service as expected were excellent!

column4: 2727 W. Memorial Road Oklahoma City, OK  73134
column13: I can't write enough positives about our visit. We took advantage of the whole experience. The hostess was very nice. The server was very knowledgeable. The food was absolutely amazing. So much flavor! The prices were very reasonable. Everything was the perfect portion. I will definitely want to come back every time they change the menu. If you go this summer, I highly recommend the duck for your entree. :)

Dinner was great! The lasagne was delicious - the sauce tasted was homemade and full of flavor. The scallops on the other dish ordered were fresh and cooked to perfection. Good wine list, too. We will go back. The wait staff was cheerful and on top of everything - refilling water, removing empty plates and checking to see that everything was ok. And the chef/owner and his partner both came out to welcome us.
The lobster special is the big draw here for me!

column1: Top of the Market - San Mateo
column4: 1855 S. Norfolk St. San Mateo, CA  94403
column13: You can't beat the local fish selections like Petrale Dore and Wild King Salmon - always fresh, hot, perfectly cooked. New chef is doing some imaginative pairings of sides like the lentils with the salmon - one of our favorite presentations. Service is always outstanding. One of our favorite and regular spots.

column4: 40928 Hwy 6 & 24 Bldg B # A Vail, CO  81620
column13: We like Ti Amo very much and make a point of going there at least once every summer when we are in Vail for ten days. The atmosphere is friendly, and the restaurant is not pretentious. Service helpful and friendly. We recommend Ti Amo to others.

column4: 7628 N. May Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: I was surprised at the quality of the food here. Also, our waitress was literally on her first day and did a remarkable job. I will definitely be going back there!

column4: 3720 S. Las Vegas Blvd. South #241 Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: The basic rolls are sub par, and I wouldn't recommend the sashimi - we didn't have any, but based on the fishy flavour of the salmon in the Salmon Avocado roll, the sashimi won't be the freshest. I'm biased as I'm from Vancouver and a hole in the wall sushi joint can deliver Nobu-esque quality.
Great food and love the patio dining.
The food and service was good, we will be returning again!
Good for a quick meal in downtown San Francisco and the price is reasonable.

column4: 4820 Washington Ave Ste. A Houston, TX  77007
column13: I like SOMA, but the sushi was dry this visit. Just not as fresh as it should have been. The green tea ice cream was delicious.

We took some foodie friends to Yeti for their first visit.We all loved the food. They were also impressed with the decor.Everyone had a different entree and we shared (Please don't tell Miss Manners).From fish to chicken to lamb to curries, every item was wonderfully seasoned and prepared.We all will return frequently.

column1: Son'z Maui at Swan Court - Hyatt Regency Maui
column13: By far the best dinner we experienced on Maui. The outdoor seating is very romantic the service was excellent and all of our dinners were perfect! I would highly recommend the restaurant and it's number one on our return vacation!!!

I've been to Tsillan Cellars in the past, and fell in love with it. I really looked forward to trying out their new restaurant. The weekend after the 4th (notably busy for Chelan), I took 10 of my friends out there from Seattle. This was definitely the highlight of my trip! The patio seating was large, but they still managed to keep their intimate ambiance. I hoped to do a tasting before our reservation, and called before to ask how early we should get there. They suggested we give ourselves at least a half hour before dinner. Unfortunately, it was difficult getting 11 people coordinated and on time, so we only got there with 5 minutes to spare. The manager was very understanding, and let us do a tasting, even though it was very busy!
First time to eat at the restaurant. Absolutely loved the fresh baked bread and baked garlic! Steak for special was not my favorite. Would try again with new entree.

column4: 908 S. Barrington Ave Los Angeles, CA  90049
column13: The food and service was great, but we were seated next to a really loud, obnoxious party. Luckily the awesome food and wine helped us deal.

column4: 3333 Bristol St St 1876 Costa Mesa, CA  92626
column13: The table side guacamole and the millionaire margarita are worth the trip alone. Perfect Tex-Mex experience.
Had my anniversary there, book reservation thru opentable and when i got there no waiting. food was fantastic, my wife loved it. would definitely go back...
Steaks were tender and cooked to perfection. French apple teat was served cold instead of warm. We will be going back
Great waiter,excellent food and a fun atmosphere.
We love to find these quaint restaurants when we are traveling. The menu is very imaginative. Great place for fish. The preparations were outstanding and plentiful especially at a reasonable price.
A delightful French bistro in a pleasant location. Will definitely return. Has a great prix fixe.

We live about 70 miles from the Sow's Ear and have wanted to go there for years.It WAS worth the drive.Only bad thing I could not have wine cause I had to drive.We were there when they opened at 5 pm and it was quiet.Waitress was exceptional.My husband's steak was cooked correctly and very tender and flavorful. I had fresh trout and it looked raw when they brought it to me, but, it was perfect. They make great ice tea and garllc mashed potatoes.My husband had french fries with his steak and they are fresh cut and he said they were great. Don't miss the cookies for dessert. They bake the chocolate chip cookies after you order them so they are served right out of the oven with ice cream. AWESOME with LOTS of chocolate chips. You Must Go there
Excelent food and service. Only downfall is you almost always need to use the valet parking 7 bucks plus tip due to lack of street parking.

column4: 3500 Las Vegas Boulevard, South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Great food. We love their fish.
Wonderful Warm Cabbage Salad and great Pastas. Sit outside and watch the people walk by while you have a wonderful meal.

We stopped at Spazzo's on a Wednesday evening. We were greeted nicely and seated outside right away - the restaurant was not that busy. Our waiter seemed a little preoccupied. It was a while before we saw him and he had to have us repeat each order over. He did get everything right though and the food was very tasty - and nice an hot - always difficult at outside tables.
Have been eating here since I was a student at UC Berkeley in the mid-60's. Good reliable seafood, nothing fancy. Great clam chowder.

Great value, tasty food. No it's not gourmet, just nice Italian food. Friendly staff and fast service. Veal dish and Chicken piccata dish served with pasta on the side, soup and salad bar included and two beverages for $30.00.. great deal!

column4: 33 West Portal Avenue San Francisco, CA  94127
column13: Excellent menu, helpful and attentive service. Great ambiance. Awesome location in West Portal. Recommended for a romantic Italian meal.

column4: 2011 N Highland Ave Los Angeles, CA  90068
column13: We were pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. The food was great. Service was great. Very small, make your reservations early. A very nice alternative to spending a fortune eating at the bowl. All the pasta and sauces were homemade!

column4: 223 East Fourth Ave San Mateo, CA  94401
column13: Consistently great and priced so that you can come often. A nice bruschetta start, great spinach and bacon salad, and a wonderful lasagna. My guest had a rib eye pizza that was delicious. A very enjoyable lunch

column4: 6873 North Lake Blvd. Tahoe Vista, CA  96148
column13: Avoid. Began poorly when not acknowledged upon entering.Poor service, very long wait for dinner. My entree was appetizer size, which whenconveyed to my waiter he ignored me and walked off. My family was surprised by his cavalier attitude.We're not difficult people, we just don't like be snubbed by our waiter.Whole experience was disappointing. North Lake Tahoe has so many other fantastic choices please try them instead.

Still one of my favorites! They've got great regular choices on the menu and we always end up getting at least one of their specials; we are never disappointed in our food choices. The wine list is extensive and the service is always superb! Although the restaurant is small, the dining experience never lets me down.

column1: Los Gatos Brewing Company - San Jose
column4: 163 W Santa Clara St San Jose, CA  95113
column13: Nice place to celebrate my husbands birthday with friends
Our server Drew made the experience a great one!

We were very much looking forward to our dining experience at SRG. But overall we were not impressed. Caesar and arugula salads were good. The tempura green beans, hanger steak and elk chop were all served luke warm. Service was rather slow and did not keep up with drink orders.
Food eas superb. When we got there however the place was packed and the noise was deafening.

Imagine arriving on Mother__s day to a restaurant with 9 people including your Mother, and the restaurant doesn__t honor your OpenTable reservation!We had an OpenTable confirmation and no meal. The beauty of OpenTable is that there exists a __social contract_ between the consumer and the restaurant, built on trust that the consumer shows-up at the correct time and that the restaurant has a table available. Restaurants who do not honor this system should not be part of OpenTable.
Wow! What a wonderful meal! Everything about it was superb!

column4: 14801 Kruse Oaks Blvd Lake Oswego, OR  97035
column13: Close to crowne plaza hotel, easy walk.

It would be hard to find better food or worst service for the price. I have been there quite a few times in the last couple of years and might still go back but only for early lunch or at low trafic times - they simply do not have enough staff to handle rush hours.
We love Starlight. The food is always amazing and the service is great. The wine list is solid and the ambience cannot be beat in Sebastopol!
La spcialit au canard tait excellente. L'entre au crabe cake tait aussi notable.

column4: 8852 E. Pinnacle Peak Road Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: The food was excellent. I expected the food prices to be high, but the drink prices were ridiculous...$69.00 for 3-drinks was outrageous. The waiter "recommended" a new vodka, that turned out to be $13.50 per shot, so a double was $27.00.

So happy to no longer drive to downtown Reno for a five-star meal. This restaurant has only been open a week, but you would NEVER guess that. The service was impeccable. The steak was the best I have had in Reno, and was cooked exactly as I requested. While the prices are a little high for this end of town, the food quality, amount of food and service more than compensate. It was a little loud the night we were there - the restaurant was full and we actually had an 8 person group that they placed in the center of the room, which tends to make it noisier. However, the perimeter of the room is all booths - big, comfy, upholstered booths that I imagine are very quiet and comfortable enough to fall asleep in after this awesome meal!

This is one of our favorite restaurants but this visit was not quite what we are used to. The new menu is fun (who wouldn't love the new cheese item with bacon and Fat Tire in it?), however, the portion size seems to have been reduced a bit. The most disappointing thing was the service. We had an early reservation so there were only 2 tables filled in the restaurant yet it took a very long time to get our food. We were actually late for our theater event that we told our server we were attending. We will be back and will cross our fingers that the service is back to par soon.

column4: 9545 E Whittier Blvd Pico Rivera, CA  90660
column13: Prime Rib was outstanding, seems to be rare to find these days.
The steak was melt in your mouth good!

Restaurant wasn't prepared for our party of 8 despite the online reservation; ended up being squeezed into a narrow, outside back corner of the restaurant. Our waiter was new (3 days on the job), did his best, but forgot 2 orders. The "bowl" portions are good. Pass on the chips & salsa.

Amazingly good! Without a doubt, it was our best restaurant experience BY FAR of an entire week in Napa, which included dining at Auberge du Soleil, Angele, & Bouchon. Every dish was better than the previous one.... fabulous crab cake tacos, mouthwatering boar meatballs, burrata, flatbread pizzas! Steve, the owner, even stopped by to make sure everyone was happy. We'll definitely return here on our next trip to Napa.
We love Duo's farm to table approach. Between three of us we did a pretty good job of covering the menu. They were all great.

column4: Hilton La Jolla Torrey Pines 10950 North Torrey Pines Road San Diego, CA  92037
column13: We stopped into the bar before our reservations to have an appetizer and cocktails. When our cocktail waitress was there to provide service, she was good.

Great experience. We had a big group and good food even for the kids. Wagyu Montana rib eye was my favorite. Elk was quite good as well. Bison was just ok. I love dessert and the crepe cake and strawberry rhubarb was my fav. Recommended if you are around the Big Sky area.

column1: Steve Fields Steak and Lobster Lounge
column13: service was just ok. steak was delivered but had to wait 3-4 minutes for a steak knife.
Excellent brunch on Father's Day... would return

The Dredge exceeded our group of 14's expectations! The service was exceptionsl, the food very good, and the unique setting was great. We were celebrating our 50th Reunion of friendship as Jefferson County Colorado teachers and it was indeed a special celebration thanks to the Dredge!

Servic was good but food was average. Food presentation was good. My filet appeared to be prime cut but food was cold. My wife's prime rib was bland her cut of meet had way too much fat. Thank goodness for sauce. Lamb fries were good but way too greasy. Not the quality one should expect when purchasing steak by the ounce. There are better steaks in OKC for less money. Atmosphere did not make up for quality of food. Ready to go back to Cattlemans.

column4: 565 Mountain Village Blvd - Tomboy Telluride, CO  81435
column13: Very creative spot in Mountain Village area of Telluride. Super nice, welcoming staff. Best bar in Mountain Village with wonderful infused drinks. Kudos to management for providing a great new option in the area...we'll be back for sure!

Vic & Anthony's is by far the absolute best steakhouse in Houston and certainly one of the best in the country. We've been dining there every other Saturday night for the past year or so. The steak is always cooked perfectly and the service is second to none! The restaurant is a consistent hit and a half!!

column4: 8200 SW Scholls Ferry Rd Beaverton, OR  97008
column13: I enjoy coming to this restaurant. Food quality, quality of service and setting are all good.

column4: 900 San Ysidro Lane Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: The service team was great and in an excellent setting. The food was underwhelming particularly the Halibut. Would not visit again and this has been on our special occasion list for several years.

column4: 3667 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Taking in to account everything over all, Striphouse was "just ok". Service was alright not awful and our waiter was courteous. However, he did not hear one of our orders and we ended up waiting a while to receive it. By the time we did, out steak was cold and my husband was nearly done with his meal. Now to the food. We ordered the 28 day dry aged rob eye. Against better judgement and because of our waiters suggestion, we ordered it medium well. It came out VERY DRY and tough. I had a hard time cutting throughy steak. Also,the steak was very over seasoned and salty. Needless to say i was very disappointed. No wonder this place was empty on July 4th at 9 pm.

column4: 3465 North Pines Way Suite 103 Wilson, WY  83014
column13: Sudachi IS the best place for sushi in the Hole.

Outstanding food and service. Charming wait staff. Very attractive property. Party of 5 (originally planned 6) was seated at an OVERSIZED table for 8....cold and certainly not conducive for conversation

column4: 2223 South Highland Dr #E3 Salt Lake City, UT  84106
column13: Great food along with fantastic service.

column4: 2579 Town Center Blvd N Sugar Land, TX  77479
column13: i love this place send me more coupons :-)

column4: 2115 Town Square Place Sugar Land, TX  77479
column13: Perry's was a great experience! The service was excellent. Augustine was courteous and friendly during the whole meal and made my wife's birthday dinner a special experience. Not to mention the table-side carved pork, which is the best pork dish I've ever tasted. If you want a nice steakhouse experience, I highly recommend Perry's.

column4: 320 W. 5th Avenue Fifth Avenue Mall Room C01 Anchorage, AK  99501
column13: The only real problem I had was the crab seemed to be very salty but all the other food was very flavorful and tasty. The service from the waitress was outstanding and since I was their with my mom on her birthday the waitress gave us a free dessert to celebrate the special occasion.
Steaks overcooked, but overall a good meal.
Very good steakhouse. Everyone's meal was excellent. Great service as well

column4: 73505 El Paseo Suite 2600 Palm Desert, CA  92260
column13: Sullivans is always excellent. Great place to go. The service and food are terrific.Ask for Ericka to serve you. She is wonderful!

Every staff person we met was very friendly and helpful, and the service was flawless. The food was really delicious, from the chowder and French onion soup to the perfectly grilled filet mignon to the vegies. This was a perfect place to celebrate my son's 35th birthday!
We do fine dining very often but the best fine dining restaurant in Tucson is Sullivan's.

column4: 7690 West Lake Mead Boulevard Las Vegas, NV  89128
column13: Always a good experience. The staff is accommodating, friendly, and on top of their game. Nice casual atmosphere.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - LV
column4: 8721 West Charleston Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89117
column13: They were very accommodating when one of us wanted to have an entree prepared like one of their appetizers -- i.e. sliced filet with shiitake risotto rather than whole filet with potatoes. The steaks themselves were good but not outstanding. Las Vegas has so many steakhouses that it's hard to compete.

column4: 400 S. Rampart Blvd. #190 Las Vegas, NV  89145
column13: Very nice restaurant. Great service and they met our reservation requirements. Prices are reasonable.

column4: 8701 W. Charleston Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89117
column13: We had a wonderful dinner. They reserved a booth for me as I requested and everyone told me happy birthday, they even had special printed menus! What a nice touch. We shared the beef carp with truffle oil and great onions. It's was nice and light, with great flavors! Our server I think Christine was great. Perfect timing and wonderful recommendations! I had the shellfish trio, was delicious, scalop was my favorite. My boyfriend had fish trio, they each had their own sauces. Very good but next time I would specify I would like them cooked med rare to med instead of letting it come out med well to well done. But they were still enjoyable. Soy beans at table just a little spicy for my taste but boyfriend loved them!
Very accommodating as my we had a couple requests that were asked for ahead of time, and met completely by the staff. Thanks!
As always, a spectacular experience at the Summit House...service was outstanding, food was fantastic and the view was one of a kind...we'll be back, and back and back....

column4: 1921 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA  94306
column13: Great place for Steak and wine and cheesecake and Oysters and...

column1: On Sunset at Luxe Hotel Sunset Blvd
column13: Overall good, but there was a dearth of tuna in my seared ahi salad...a little chintzy.

column4: 8570 West Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: I have to say they weren't busy but still the wait staff and hosts were super attentive and we got seated and served quickly. I had the red sangria which was great and we ordered the guacamole for the table (spicy), everyone loved it. everyone liked their entrees and we did not have dessert. I would go back anytime.
This restaurant continues to be one of the best tables in Santa Fe!

The food taste/quality was very inconsistent. The spicy shrimp salad was delicious. The main course of tempura and beef teriyaki with rice was not up to par for a restaurant in that price range. Even the rice did not look good. The ice cream for dessert was gummy. Thrifty's serves better ice cream than that. I was a bit shocked.

We had the fabulous Chef's Omakase meal, which included 13 courses of the freshest pieces of sushi we had ever had. Service was excellent, explaining how to eat each piece of fish presented to us. Definitely, amongst the top 3 meals I've ever eaten in my life. If I lived in Honolulu, I would come eat here every month.
just a place for business lunch especially for a bigger group

We have only ever sat at the sushi bar. The sushi chefs are fantastic; very personable and fun to watch. Their food is top-notch. The server we have had both times at the bar, he had left a lot to be desired, but it has never stopped us from eating here.
We went to the restaurant they were not open.
The food seems to have gone down in originality and presentation.

column1: Suzie Wong's World Asian Food & Drinks
column13: This restaurant is amazing. The service is very friendly and attentive. There were 7 of us in our group and we all ordered something different to share. We were all pleased with our dishes and will definitely return. The owner Dawn came by to check on us a couple of times to make sure everything was up to our standards. We all left extremely happy and with plenty of leftover. The portions are huge and very reasonable. They even served us a free dessert with out entree. You don't see much of that anymore. Give it a try. YOU WILL LOVE IT.

column4: 15 W. Thomas Place 4th Floor Beaver Creek, CO  81620
column13: Food and service was very good. This was our first time visiting. The presentation of the food was very pretty and it tasted very good. Our server was very attentive.
Historic setting and great food, what more could you ask?

column4: 1920 Squaw Valley Road Olympic Valley, CA  96146
column13: Not as good as pasted visits but still above many others. Yes, we'll be back.
The food was excellent, the service was 1st class!

Brasserie Max and Julie was impeccable. We arrived on a Sunday about 5-10 minutes before opening time, but they let us (and the couple in front of us) in, sat us and gave us water (tap in bottles just like France) and menus to peruse. We were there for Sunday brunch and it was our first time at the restaurant so we kept our choices safe. The onion soup is perfect and the crepes are light and delicious with many offered toppings. I enjoyed the nutella crepe for dessert while my mother had a savory crepe for breakfast. My husband stuck with the waffle and jambon de paris. Everything that came out was great and the service was brilliant. We will definitely be returning.

One disappointment....we arrived at 5:30 pm and were seated in the dining area. We specifically arrived at 5:30 so that we could take advantage of the happy hour specials. When we asked our waiter what the specials were, he said there weren't any. When I mentioned seeing them advertised online, he stated that we had to be sitting in the bar section to get them. Our table was 5 ft from the bar (restaurant and bar share the same open space).

The Woodcellar is not well marked. This is a bar with a few tables in the back. The pulled pork sandwich was good. The bacon, lettuce, avocado and tomato sandwich had dried out bread. The salmon was good. The turkey reuben was not flavorful. The caprese sandwich was ok. The sweet potato fries were good. Overall, it was ok.

column4: 78930 US Highway 40 Suite 3 Winter Park, CO  80482
column13: The ah_ nachos are incredibly delicious. We tried one pizza and there was so much cheese on it that it was nauseating. Luckily, they agreed to replace it with another pizza (wine and cheese), and it was very good. The waitress was OK. Both times we've been there lately the waitresses have acted very bored.
Just opened so no need for reservation - great restaurant !

I attend a math conference in Houston every three years and always go to t'afia, origninally recommended to me by foodies here in Portland OR. Never disappointed! We are a mixed crowd of eaters and everyone always leaves happy. Most surprised are the NW and CA wine aficionados who are always amazed Texas can make fine wines!

column4: 2999 A Oak Road Walnut Creek, CA  94597
column13: Great restaurant near the BART station in Walnut Creek, with convenient validated parking in the Embassy Suites lot. I had the salmon linguini, which prior reviewers had raved about. This was a good dish, though the Alfredo sauce was a little heavy. My wife had the roasted chicken and mash potatoes, which was exquisite in it's simplicity. All in all, a great experience with wonderful service and food, at a reasonable price.
Just keep the kids seated away from the open grill... They had fun toasting the marshmallows!
Great food and service - everything was delicious.

column8: Civic Center / Hayes Valley / Van Ness
column13: Oniuon soup and Croque Monsuer excellent. Appetizer of lamb kabob Asian fusion I would guess and had too much vinegar in the mix.

I guess it's a good thing when a resturant is crowded, but it also means it can be very noisy. If you want to catch up with old friends, you have to ask them to repeat their story on occasion. Piano music and conversation can compete with each other. Love the decor and neighborhood vibe.

column1: Chart House Restaurant - Tower of the Americas
column4: 601 Tower of the Americas Way San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Excellent dining experience. The only drawback was the wait for our reservation. The reservation was for 7:30 and we didn't get seated for a little over an hour. It was Saturday night and I requested a window table. When we were finally were seated, we were directed to a booth across from the window that would have seated at least six. I told the host that we were only a party of two and would like what we requested. We were promptly seated at a window table for two. The hour wait was spent in the bar and it was very nice too. I had looked at the menu on line and had an idea what I wanted. We ordered and one of the entrees ordered was not available and the dessert we were looking forward to, the souffle, was also not available.

column4: 2002 N. main St. Santa Ana, CA  92706
column13: A lovely restaurant at the Bowers Museum!!! Great ambiance and food..good service and culture to boot!!!

Flavorful lamb tanjin, but a bit on the dry side. Excellent vegie tanjine, eggplant dip, cous cous. Bread was meh.belly dancer is a fun addition. Baklava, have had much better. Mint tea finishes up the meal perfectly.

Delicious and innovative food, bustling atmosphere. We had the tasting menu, an excellent value. Squid and octopus appetiser, magical chilled pea soup, prosciuto and melon, excellent pasta, and duck with orange-balsalmic reduction. Excellent (if mostly pricy) wine list. Seating in several areas: lower level in front (our preference), kitchen (very noisy), upstairs, outdoor. Only negative was the noisy cappuchino machine drowning out conversation, it could use a sound-deadening enclosure.
Tapalaya was something of a surprise to me. Great food and atmosphere. Loved the small plates that we could share around the table and the waitress was exceltional for us.

What a find. I had planned on going inside the loop for a celerbration dinner when I heard about Tapas Capriccio through Open Table and decided to try it out. The food was wonderful. There were five of us so we all tried different dishes and traded tastes of everything. All the dishes were favored differently and deliciously. I hate going to a restaurant and all the dishes taste the same. If driving in town is getting up down then try Tapas Capriccio for another reason to stay in the suburbs.

My husband and I enjoyed Tapas de Espana back in October and had an incredible experience! My recent experience, unfortunately, was not incredible. It was good, but not incredible. The stuffed piquillo peppers and albondigas were both pretty bland. The shrimp, however, was delicious and perfectly cooked. The restaurant was fairly loud with tables fairly crowded together. On a final note, although I may go back, I find the concept of two restaurants in one venue a little confusing. This restaurant is housed in the El Senor Sol building on 7th.

This place was TERRIBLE! It took 17 minutes for a waiter to acknowledge my date and me, he had no recommendations from the menu (apparently hasn't eaten there??!) and brought the wrong drink and disappeared.The appetizers tasted like they were prepared from canned food. We didn't even bother with ordering dinner after that.

column4: 9045 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA  90069
column13: Serendipitously came across this restaurant and it was a very pleasant surprise. Four of us meet from lunch and the food was a very fresh and excellent quality, we enjoyed it very much. Also, one of the best mango lassi's in town. Will be coming back.

column1: Logan-Ives House at Long Meadow Ranch Winery
column13: Really good time. Make us feel like we are guests in their house

I ordered the grilled ham and cheese sandwich and the edges were completely burnt and black. Not sure how this passed hands from cook/chef to server without anyone noticing but I was a little disappointed. Other than that, I felt the food was creative and after I pulled the black bread off the sandwich, it was still okay.

There was no need to make reservations. Maybe 3-4 other tables were occupied. We got plenty of refills for our water, but that's about it. Towards the end of our meal, we have to get up and approach the server that we were ready for our check. The food was good. A bit overpriced. Poor service.

column4: 1215 Avila Beach Dr. San Luis Obispo, CA  93405
column13: Very fresh seafood and farm fresh sides. The quality is tasted in the meal and the love and expertise of the chef. etc. Service was excellent. Looking forward to revisiting soon. A real gem in the San Louis/Avila/Pismo area.

column1: The Restaurant at the Standard, Downtown LA
column4: 550 South Flower Street Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: Good business lunch in central downtown location. Bright and cheery place with attractive people (staff and clientele) wandering about.An "unstuffy" alternative to the local clubs and posh places.About $20 to $25 per person for lunch.Salad Nicoise is back on the menu and is a good choice.Outside patio is the more popular but the inside tables/booths are better for serious talking.

The "Italian" buffet was disappointing, I was expecting more pizza/pasta options than the one that was available. We opted to order from the menu, the food was very nice but the 5 pieces of ravioli in the bowl was a major let down.
Not a bad place, a little cramped with strange horseshoe shaped boothes and they never refilled the wine after initially openning the bottle.

column1: T. Cook's at The Royal Palms Resort
column13: A good spot for great food and service. Brunch at the T.Cook's is always relaxing and enjoyable!

column1: Noe at the Omni Los Angeles
column4: 251 S. Olive St. Los Angeles, CA  90012
column13: My steak was tasty. It was overcooked the first time, but the staff replaced it immediately. My wife liked the salmon. The rest of the meal was fine, but not great. Table service was prompt, but bar service was amateurish. The patio is a nice spot for a drink, nestled among downtown skyscrapers. That setting is probably not to everyone's taste, but I like it. Overall, a perfectly acceptable meal, but not one I will be remembering fondly a month from now.

Beautiful location with the beach in the background but the food was definitely not worth the price - overly salted filet mignon and did there sampler which was so so. Not very impressed for the price. Expected a much higher quality meal
Rumfire is our favorite place to catch the sunset on waikiki. The food is wonderfully prepared and the drinks are creative and fun.

We have eaten at 333 Pacific twice now. The food and drinks are very good. The noise level is extreme and it is very difficult to carry on a conversation even when you speak loud. The service is slow but the servers do have good knowledge of the food and drinks. The hostesses haved a funny habit of walking through the restaurant with pen and paper marking things about the tables, it's weird.I would strongly suggest that the servers pay better attention to their customers and be more attentive.

column4: 880 Harbor Island Drive San Diego, CA  92101
column13: The overall experience was good, but the mussels were awful. They were very fishy and the sauce was very bland. Usually it is great to dip bread in the sauce but not this time. Otherwise the lobster bisque & steaks were very tasty.
Had a wonderful time. First time at this restaurant great food and atmosphere.
Excellent Japanese food! Will definitely go back!
Very good food, great service, nice ambiance.

column4: 2000 E Rio Salado Parkway Tempe, AZ  85281
column13: We had a group of 12. But could not reserve one table together. So had to put it in in 2 reservations. But when we arrived they were nice enough th accommodate and put all 8 of us together( 4 cancelled).They took a little time to get the tables ready. It was my daughters 20th Bday. Very nice setting and decor for the younger generations. Especially girls who like sushi and light healthy dishes. Very well chef'ed food. Appetizers were excellent and savory.Negative: took them 10 mins to get us forks and knives! Gotta know how to work chopsticks!
Very nice resturant, with very good food. The corn bread was fantastic, I could have eaten the whole pan myself.

column4: 3720 Las Vegas Blvd. S Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: Excellent food for a bar type of atmosphere. Roast duck buns are amazing. Pretty much everything from the carvery is delicious. Amazing beer selection. Well done.

The evening started out well, our waitress, Krystal was helpful with the menu and even suggested drinks since it was our first time there. My girlfriend ordered a margarita, but she brought the wrong one. We ended up not having to pay for it but I did have to ask twice if she could bring the correct drink. When we received our food, we only had one set of silverware and when I asked Krystal for an extra set she said she would bring one. Well, if it hadn't been for another waitress stopping by to check on us I would have never eaten my food. It took the other girl 3 seconds to get another set of silverware and Krystal didn't check on us until AFTER we had already finished our food. I also had to ask for my check twice. Prob won't go back.
Been dining here for years. Consistently good food. Busy atmosphere. Great place to dine after the concerts at Ford Amphitheater.
We had excellent waiter service and the food was enjoyable.

I was anxious to try their revised menu but my dining experience was fair, at best. My server did not ask if we wanted wine; she was too anxious to take our food order. I had to request a bottle of wine, then I had to ask for an ice bucket. My companion order spaghetti al vongole - there was much too much sauce, so the pasta was swimming. The clams were tender. I ordered pasta pomodoro .. the pasta was gummy as if it had been sitting for a long time under a heat lamp. It was also overcooked. I won't write them off yet, but I was very disappointed.

column1: La Gran Terraza - University of San Diego
column13: Great dining for all of the reasons checked above and probably many more that we haven't experienced yet!

Restaurant staff was very friendly. As we entered the parking lot, we were greeted by one of the staff members and he guided us to the parking lot. We made reservations and arrived a little bit early but they didn't waste no time accomodating us. The food was awesome and tasted very fresh. Definitely will come back again and will recommend to friends and family!!

column4: 4 Embarcadero Center Street Level San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Taco Tuesday from 4-7pm and the beef bulgogi is delicious, perfect combo with beef.

column4: 3702 Via de la Valle Del Mar, CA  92014
column13: The best resturant in San Diego
Trs bon restaurant Simple et relax, mais avec des produits de qualit On s'y sent bien et on y mange bien

I've now been about 4 times. Twice for lunch w coworkers and twice for dinner with family. Each time the food took a ridiculously long time to come out. Latest time: Kids got their meals 20 minutes before we got ours. Ordered carrot cake and shortcake for dessert took another 20 minutes. It took so long that I think the waiter was concerned and reordered it, bc another set of desserts arrived at our table 5 minutes after we finally got ours! People are nice there but they really need to work on getting the food to the table. Not looking for fast food service, but it really is outrageous how long each course takes to arrive at the table. Good food, but only go if you have about 2 hours available- for lunch or dinner.

column4: 31878 Del Obispo Street, Suite 109 San Juan Capistrano, CA  92675
column13: Incredible food, great personal service. The best!

The patio seating is great! Wonderful garden views, perfect for the neighborhood. The beautiful red brick walls keep the street noise from ruining the atmosphere. Servers are very friendly, but need some reminding. The food leaves much to be desired. If they went with traditional comfort food and stayed away from "fine dining" the food would make this place a great local find! But... right now, the food is not worth what you pay.

column4: Mid-Vail area on Vail Mountain Vail, CO  81658
column13: Our favorite place to eat on "the" mountain! We enjoyed a delightful lunch our last day of skiing at Vail for the year! Thank you ! Great server too!
The food was very disappointing, down to the cappuccino.

This is one of my all time favorite spots in Santa Barbara. However, since their menu change, the food taste like Denny's. The staff were really great, except the one who was assigned to our table, who kept on giving us attitude about sticking with water -- we had to, due to one of our guest's dietary reasons. I think the restaurant needs to go back to its old days.

column4: 28190 N. Alma School Pkwy #209 Scottsdale, AZ  85262
column13: Pizza, salad and wine! Perfect. The entertainment was great that night too!

column1: The Blue Fish Japanese Restaurant - North Dallas
column13: I took a friend here for his birthday. The food was amazing and the level of service was outstanding! Thank you so much for such a wonderful dining experience. We will definately be back!

column4: 1050 Contra Costa Blvd Pleasant Hill, CA  94523
column13: The atmosphere is pleasant, but old fashioned. It needs updating. The food was good, but way too much sauce on all the dishes.

This place has a great view of San Francisco and the Golden Gate Bridge. The ambience has white table cloths, real flowers on the table and plays classical music. They are willing to substitute and take requests. Their wines by the glass are pricey and limited. There are only 4 varied wines for both the red and white. Two of them in each category feature two domestic and two international wines. My meal of roasted pork tenderloin and coconut rice was delicious. I'd go back.
Me and my husband love this place, the food and the desserts are awesome!!!!!

In dining alone, I only needed wine by the glass. The waiter offered very little in the way of California Chardonnay to go with my delicious chicken pasta with prosciutto and peas. The sommelier happened to walk by and I asked if he had a reasonably priced CA chard. He offered me a nice Piedmont selection. Had he not happened by, I wouldn't have had a nice accompaniment to my dish. The house made balsamic viniagrette was good, but the greens were nothing to write about as they were straight out of the bag with only a couple of grape tomatoes and a little chopped olive.
Fantastic in every way. Barbara was one of, if not the best, server I have ever had. Will be coming back.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Austin
column13: Great service - the food was excellent. Asked for a booth and a specific waitperson - no problem. The service here always seems to be among the best in town. The Ahi tuna small plate was wonderful. Our steaks were cooked to perfection. Will be returning, undoubtedly!
I will come back again again and again for their foodie-worthy fried chicken in a bucket!

Our party of four had a good experience for a first visit. The onion ring appetizer is fantastic...crispy, seasoned batter and enough for four people to split. Although none of us wanted more than a burger, they were excellent including a portabella mushroom burger. Great martini to boot! Service was solid and the friendly manager even dropped by to see how things went for us. The place had a good buzz on a Thursday night and the ambience is nice. I can see how it might get a little rowdy when packed as the concrete floor will reflect noise upward with little to stop it. But for us, there were no noise issues. Portions are ample as well. Like!

column4: 1800 Spirit Dance Road Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: The view is the best in Jackson Hole. Both the elk tenderloin and bison were good but sides were lack luster. Menu is very pricey for less than innovative dishes. Serves and view were great. Not overly impressed with food. Worth a visit for just the view - maybe best for just drinks.

We were disappointed with our dinner.. Chef got my main course wrong then left my wife's Gnocchi to congeal while remaking mine... Food was ok when we got it,,but otherwise a letdown.. Service was great,, our waitress was embarrassed. Desert was great !!:)All in allI felt like I was eating at the 19th hold of any golf club.There's a lot better places in Napa,,like the Rutherford Grill!!:)

column4: 34631 N Tom Darlington Dr Scottsdale, AZ  85377
column13: The ambiance and service were very good. My dinner was delicious; my husband felt his dinner was good/fair.
The fish is always outstanding. Probably the best in San Antonio.

column4: 2360 Gruene Lake Dr New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: Greeted and welecomed in a very professional fashion. We were seated in an area which I had asked for as a "quiet and cozy" and as it turns out, most of the area we were in was just that.The server was "Davey", she was very knowledgeable on the menu and kept us well attended to.Our company here in town has used this restraunt before on other business venues, but for a personal outing, it serves quite well.

column4: 2 Embarcadero Center., Level P San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Loved the old school bartenders. Would drink before a movie or eat some snacks at the bar agin.
Acoustics are terrible and it's too loud in there. Cannot have a conversation. Food was very good, but too loud - will not go back.
The location, dining room, view, and service were all very good. If you just work on making the food a little better, it would be an amazing experience.

column4: 7350 Pine Creek Road Colorado Springs, CO  80919
column13: My wife and I sat outside where most tables were occupied. Service was prompt and polite.We both had the Manhattan steak. The steak is the center of a new Your cut and they were about an inch thick. The steak was on a bed of garlic mashed potatoes and crisp green beans, topped with sauted mushrooms, spinach and a red wine reduction. That was topped with fresh Italian Parsley. there was also a quarter of a tomato, lightly grilled, on the side.

My wife and I came here for our 3 year wedding anniversary. They had a card signed by the staff and rose pedals on the table when we arrived. Very cool. Our waiter Steven was great, very helpful as it was our first time dining here. Good place for adults to have a nice dinner, something different. Great experiance.

column4: 14855 Blanco Rd,  Suite 110 San Antonio, TX  78216
column13: Our server G was the best and we would go back on a night he was working any day! The food was great have been to two other melting pots and this one might be my new favorite!

It was our first dining experience with the Metropolitan Grill celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary. The service was outstanding, and the food was divine! We started out in the bar for a couple of drinks. The Bartendar was attentive with great wine recommendations. Even though the bar was packed we felt like we were the only ones there. Our Servers recommendation of the scallop appetizer was an excellent choice. We also indulged in Crab Cakes, Skirt Steak, and Lobster Claw Fettuccini. Everything was cooked to perfection. Our Server even brought out a complimentary Creme Brulee in celebration of our anniversary which added to the wonderful experience. We can't wait to celebrate another night out there again!

This was my first visit to The Mint and after reading the positive reviews, I was disappointed in my $25 lunch as was my dining companion. Service was fine but our server didn't utter a word to us other than, "Something to drink?" I had the salmon in curry which was fine but for $20, I expected more. Great location and atmosphere/design is excellent. The place was packed. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing....would give it another try.

The cocktail menu was interesting and the drinks were unique, very good. The hush puppy appetizer sounded good, looked good but was bland. The Jambalaya was flavorful but the gumbo was not spicy enough, the chicken and shrimp didn't have a seasoned taste. Expected more of a traditional New Orleans experience. Overall disappointed in the food but the location and the physical restaurant were very nice.
Terrific customer service!! Delicious food!!
Old Warsaw served the best asparagus soup I have ever had; all the food was perfect and so was the service as well.
Excellent food and service.Great for special occasion.

Afternoon tea is almost a thing of the past. Not at the Phoenician where it is still done with bone English china, a great loose tea selection and wonderful ambiance. It has gotten a little pricier than when I first started going however for something special, it is worth it. You leave full and happy.
The prix fixe dinner menuu is a real value. Better than average wine list. And because its located on Indian land, there is no sales tax.
Lovely little bistro on the square...awesome waitress! Wouldeat there again anytime.

Date night was very good at the Porch. The food was good, the atmosphere was good and the service was good. All around it was a good time and we will surely go back. My wife liked the fact that they do a different menu every day and it has today's date on it as well. Very nice touch.

column1: The Pub BBQ at Ghiradelli Square
column13: We were "fished out" at Fisherman's Wharf" and looking for something else to eat. The Pub BBQ provides good pub food with a southern twist. I recommend the fried chicken with sides of jalapeo cole slaw and sauted kale. The beer is good and cold.
Having gluten-free items made it easier to accomodate all in our party. Excellent gumbo, excellent duck entree and bread pudding to die for.
This place rocks! A little Asian a little southern! So yummy! Go during college football season! They have great sport bar atmosphere!

column1: Mayo Reserve Room - Mayo Family Winery
column13: We turned out to be the only ones at the wine and food pairing on a weekday at 4:30. What a treat. We had the full attention of the chef/server. He was very knowledgable about the wine, food, history of the winery and the area.A nice change of pace from the typical vineyard tours. The food-7 tasting sized portions was outstanding and the accompanying wines were all good. We bought a case of the Meritage. No wonder this stop receives such great reviews, it was our favorite stop of all the pairings we've done. And a great deal at $35 per person. Not a full meal but a wonderful experience. Go late in the day, then have dessert and coffee afterwards if you still need something later in the evening.
Absolutely delicious. I've been to The Richmond twice with my lady, and we'll keep on coming back.
Service was rushed. For a seafood restaurant, not mant fish choices.

Too bad they cannot get the service right. The food is very good but had to wait over 25 minutes just to get a drink. Had to ask to have the table wiped and the hostess stopped over to the table and told us a couple of times that they were very busy. Talked to a friend who also visited and ended up leaving because they waited over 15 minutes and could not even get a drink at the bar.

column4: 11516 South District Drive Suite 500 South Jordan, UT  84095
column13: overall a good experience and great food.
Excellent find while on vacation traveling through Colorado.
From the moment of arrival to departure, the smell of smoke from the bar was very unpleasant and unappetizing.

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - The Woodlands
column4: 9595 Six Pines Drive, Suite 700 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Excellent experience with friends from out of town!

column4: 2000 E Rio Salado Pkwy Suite 1041 Tempe, AZ  85281
column13: Incredible experience again. Food and service outstanding. It's no wonder Thirsty Lion is packed when other local eateries are not.I went for the second time this week and they were on a wait, ON A THURSDAY!Great music, looked to me that everyone was having a great time!The managers should be commended for having such a great staff, good looking too!

column4: 10205 SW Washington Square Rd Tigard, OR  97223
column13: Just wonderful. Food was delicious and service was great.

column1: STK - The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas
column4: 3708 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Took family members for dinner and we're still talking about it a day+ later. It was my third time there and I'm a new regular. It stands up against any of the best steakhouses in Vegas and lacks any pretentious nonsense a lot of restaurants like to flaunt. The Wagyu beef, tuna tar tar and king crab salad are all excellent but even the sides are approachable and not over-thought. They focus on basics and making them great! Think incredible sweet corn pudding and good old fashioned straight-up mac 'n cheese. With a moderate snag in service smoothed over gracefully, the consistency is what will take me back again and again. I have two other upper-end favorite steakhouses but for overall vibe and experience, this is my current spot to beat.

Fried chicken and snapper were excellent. Grab a seat in the high back seats near the bar area next to the fire. Service was friendly and unobtrusive. Cocktails are overpriced but food and wine are moderately priced.

column4: 110 Vintage Park Blvd. Suite P Houston, TX  77070
column13: Great service,unique and delicious food. Chef Paul is very friendly and hospitable. He visits with guests tableside and makes you feel really appreciated as a patron!

We went to dinner at Thomas Hill Organics for my husbands birthday and they more than impressed. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. He did not hesitate to pick the perfect glass of wine to pair with our meals. I ordered the day boat sea scallops and my husband ordered the hanger steak. Both were excellent, with the exception that my husband ordered his steak cooked medium well, which made the steak a little less than perfect. At the end they presented my husband a absolutely scrumptious brownie with vanilla bean ice cream and caramel for his birthday. My husband enjoyed every moment. We will be back.

column4: 205 North Moorpark Road Thousand Oaks, CA  91360
column13: My OpenTable reservation had us seated the moment we arrived!

column4: 2087 E. Thousand Oaks Blvd. Thousand Oaks, CA  91362
column13: Wonderful Boys night out, great service from Tracy. Shrimp Cocktail was great as always. KC Strip was a beautiful cut and cooked to absolute perfection, very tender and amazing flavor. Berries and fruit for desert are always just right ripe, sweet and delicious, really a nice and lighter way to end a meal. Thank you all!!

column1: Bogart's Bar and Grill - Thousand Oaks
column4: 166 West Hillcrest Drive Thousand Oaks, CA  91360
column13: Disappointing. Ok for drinks and appetizers, but not for a meal. Weak menu, food tasted ok, service was ok.

column4: 1945- G South Kihei Rd Kihei, HI  96753
column13: Delicious food and great service. We are definitely going back.
basic barbecue, waitress came over to table once after taking order-never saw her
DOn't be fooled by the 'cafe' moniker. It's a rather good restaurant.

column4: 31727 S. Coast Hwy Laguna Beach, CA  95651
column13: It was a really nice place. Romantic but the food was not good at all. I took my girlfriend to Te Amo, thinking it was going to be a great experience. The food was plain with no flavor. My girlfriend couldn't even eat it. For the price that I paid I think we could have had a better dinner at Olive Garden.

This is just not my kind of "mexican restaurant". I really wanted to like it because it is walking distance from my house. It's just kind of odd & I think they pride themselves in this fact. Small & quirky. I'll bet there are people who are Tila's lovers as I am not.

I think this is our new favorite place. Bistro has a large menu of delicious food items and a large selection of wines to choose from. The wait staff is friendly and easy to work with. Overall, a great place to eat with family and friends.
Third time here, and the staff are wonderful, and food is amazing. Great date/special event, but not too crazy priced.
we actually frequent gracies fairly often and have not been disappointed ever. the food and service are always excellent.

column4: Hilton Houston Westchase 9999 Westheimer Rd. Houston, TX  77042
column13: Overall, we enjoyed our evening at Rio Ranch Steakhouse.

We expected more from a well-reviewed wine country restaurant. It was a slow night, and perhaps an off night.
