Our server was not at all knowledgeable about the very local wine list, nor was she particularly pleasant or attentive to us all night. We're not tough to please, or demanding. The service was slow, and we left most of the dishes in our party of 5 half-eaten. My duck was overlooked, and my son's gnocchi dish was a mess. I saw a menu on the wall from 1996 that was far more inventive and fresh-looking than today's. The desserts followed the same low-risk formula that you might see at a hotel, with one chocolate dish, a creme br_le...you get the idea.

column4: 221 N Rampart Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89145
column13: Servers were personable and very attentive. Rather pricey restaurant for a local establishment.

It was a wonderful meal and setting. Great for my vegetarian wife, they had a full veggie tasting menu, well considered and delicious. Plus the space is wonderful with big windows looking to the sea and mountains. Great option in Big Sur.

column1: TJ's Steakhouse - Las Vegas Hotel & Casino
column13: This was our first time at TJ Steakhouse and will be a repeat cutomer. Our waitress Sonia was very pleasant and had a real nice personality. The food was excellent and served fast presented very nice. My husband and I both had the Prine Rib and it was cook just the way we like. Would certainly reccommed it our friends. TJ's is difinitely worth 5 stars all around.
the restaurant did not have our reservation which we had made on this site. fortunately there were tables available. i don't know if i'll use this site again

column1: The Lobby Lounge at The Langham Hotel Pasadena
column4: 1401 S. Oak Knoll Ave. Pasadena, CA  91106
column13: The service was excellent at The Lobby Lounge at The Langham Pasadena.

column1: The Terrace at The Langham, Pasadena
column13: Went with a friend for brunch. great patio or indoor seating options. patio seating offers a nice view of the hotel pool. waiters were attentive and its very quiet. also saw a big room that would be great for group dining.
Just fantastic. By far my favorite place in Davis. Excellent food, wonderful service, and a cozy atmosphere. Not sure what else I could ask for!
The almond wood fire grill was an exceptional touch. Cucumber in the water was very fresh.

column4: One Ocean Trails Drive Palos Verdes, CA  90275
column13: The brunch at Trump is by far the best I have ever had. I've been there probably 10 times and it never disappoints. It is a bit pricey at $75/each, but that is unlimited bubbly and bloody mary's as well as the best brunch buffet around.

column4: 3685 Thousand Oaks Blvd. Thousand Oaks, CA  91362
column13: I love this restaurant. Our waiter was without personality, charm, or attentiveness so it was a good thing my friends are I were there for the food and each other without great importance to the dining experience itself.

The food is better, more refined than when the building housed Stoke's. A little less casual than before, for better or worse. Service is good and the food is as good as most places in San Francisco at a much lower price than you pay in the City. All in all, maybe my new favorite place in the Monterey area.

We chose Grand Cafe as a recomendation on the Les Mis ticket web site. It had a french theme in a beautifully historic SF building. However, the staff did not seem to be informed as to the theater promotion on the web site and we had to push to get served and out the door in time for the show. More communication is needed between the two venues!!

column4: 10702 South Riverfront Parkway South Jordan, UT  84095
column13: This was our first time Market Steet, we were celebrating our anniversary. It was very fitting for a special occasion. The menu had a good variety of seafood choices and some great values. The food was excellent! We'll definitely be returning! The service was a little slow but we weren't in any hurry.

A wonderful special meal pairing beer with food. Wonderfully done, with a delicious, creative menu. We also had a lovely time with the other diners we met at our group table. Jump, if you get a chance to enjoy one of these lovely evenings.

column4: 155 S. Palm Canyon Dr. #B1 Palm Springs, CA  92562
column13: Sitting outdoors on a balmy April night and watching the world go by in downtown Palm Springs was a pleasant experience. The margaritas were good, the food was fine, but hardly revolutionary. My server was pleasant and attentive without hovering, always a good thing when you just want to drink your drinks and people-watch.

Another outstanding dinner at Todd's. There is a reason they have been voted the best gourmet restaurant for several years in a row :) Todd is always in the kitchen and takes great pride in his culinary gems. The menu changes often and there is always something new and interesting on the menu.
Good dining experience. Very nice people. Waiter was great!
Had to leave early from this reservaton. It was too loud to have a nice dinner. The noise level was not what I expected.
The carne asada was wonderful. The house specials on the beverage list for wonderful as well. Awesome waitress.

OK Mexican food, but nothing to write home about. The hostess was clueless about OpenTable, so the reservation was pointless. Fortunately, they had room for us. The dining room was dark and windowless; the fajitas ordered by a large group smoked up the whole room: there was poor air circulation. The server was friendly.
Top notch food paired with top notch service. Our personal Park City favorite.

column4: 1240 El Camino Real San Carlos, CA  94070
column13: Don't have highchairs. Tough to use a booster seat with a one year old.

column4: 2150 Harbor Island Dr San Diego, CA  92101
column13: Ambiance on the water. Great views of downtown San Diego. Food just average. Nice presentation but lacking taste.

column4: 55 Tamal Vista Blvd Corte Madera, CA  94925
column13: We like coming here with a big group and getting a table full of appetizers and smaller plates. We often come with older children. The food was great and we had a good time at the large table. Service was just fine, but I got the impression that once we ordered a slew of appetizers and not entrees (we ordered one), our waitress seemed to lose interest in us. She came over but would hurry away to other tables and not really spend any time with us. The restaurant was not crowded at all when we were there.

This was my 2nd trip to the Tavern in a month. My server on Tuesday was Matthew, what a great guy, suberb service! I have ordered the Thia chicken both times, it is delicious. My husband had the fish/chips. We will diffently visit the Tavern again. I have been bragging about your establishment to my family/friends.
THE BEST HUMMUS I EVER TASTED!!!!! SALAD WAS SUPBERB!!!! BUT THE SERVICE WAS INCREDIBLE. Going back next week with girlfriends!

column4: 6935 Pacific ave Playa Del Rey, CA  90293
column13: We went with friends. It was their first time. They were delighted that we shared a special find with them. They, like us, will come back again and again.

column1: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont SF
column13: it was so much fun, so unusual, great music too
Tasty and reasonably priced. Excellent service. Portions are quite large-I recommend sharing.

column4: 18001 Bothell Everett Hwy SE Ste 103 Bothell, WA  98012
column13: Our dinner was outstanding and the service superb. My only suggestion is that they find quieter entertainment. Even just a single guitar player was loud on the night we were there. Fortunately, we had a table as far away from the performer as possible so we could still hold a conversation. Not sure that a place that size really lends itself to live music.

column4: 550 Stanford Shopping Center Palo Alto, CA  94304
column13: the bread pudding was incredibly delicious

column4: 385 West Tahquitz Canyon Way Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Great atmosphere and lovely outdoor space. The scallops wrapped in filo dough were unique and perfectly cooked. The duck was seared perfectly crisp with a cherry reduction that was amazing. The lamb, unfortunately was under seasoned and bland.
Great restaurant and bar. Staff is awesome, and the brunch was delicous! Oh yeah, Mimosas and Bloody Mary's served in giant glasses.... hallelujah!

We just discovered this gem of a restaurant, now under new ownership, with the beloved former chef hired back to do the deeds in the kitchen. This is a lovely and quiet restaurant, with very attentive and friendly service--our wish was their command. Pasta dishes are homemade, rich in taste, and very generous in size. Our Caesar salad was prepared for us at our table! There is no question that we will make return visits. The newly designed menu will appear in mid-July.

column4: Number One Nob Hill San Francisco, CA  94108
column13: It's pretty special to go up there to see the view but my crab sandwich was pretty bland, the roll seemed stale and the crab mix had little flavor. For a small sandwich and glass of wine for $35 I just didn't find it worth it. The service was good though.

The restaurant is easy to find. We appreciated the complimentary valet parking. All the staff in the restaurant was super friendly and inviting. The view for dinner was great. We had the whole outside seating to ourselves for most the night. Our waitress, LaVita, was excellent. We will definitely request to sit in her section the next time we visit. The food was scrumptious. We enjoyed the Atlantic salmon and roasted chicken entrees. The restaurant offers a wide variety of wines, beers, and specialty liquor drinks. It was a great place to spend our anniversary dinner.
Food was great! But too quiet there hardly any people there. Service was great too. Definitely will be going back!!! Prices were also very reasonable.
Nice way to celebrate with $30 birthday certificate.
Much much improved. These guys are working hard to make up for a lapse in food and service and we've started coming back. yeah!
Service and food were outstanding. The menu offers a nice selection of dishes which will make this a restaurant to visit often.

column4: 10250 Santa Monica Blvd., #192 Los Angeles, CA  90067
column13: Food came cold. Pasta was pastey. Last time I visited pizza was good. Waiter was friendly but seemed that he had too many tables. Forgot about us. I'd go back only for pizza and convenience--sitting outside at night in century city.

column4: 601 Queen Anne Avenue N. Seattle, WA  98109
column13: Delicious New Orleans cuisine with an extensive menu that includes something for everyone.

column4: 788 W. Sam Houston Pkwy North Houston, TX  77024
column13: Excellent host, excellent food, excellent wait staff and excellent visit. as usual.

I travel to Emeryville on business twice per month and eat here everytime. The menu is diverse with strict attention to detail for each dish. The staples are the avocado brushcetta, bbq ribs, fish special (halibut with stuffed crab), grilled vegetable platter, chicken marsala, blueberry cobbler.
Good food and service only dissappointment was that two items on menu were not available early in the evening.
We enjoyed everything about the evening, can't wait to go back.
My favorite place for a quiet, excellent lunch with a dear friend.

column4: 900 Bellevue Way NE, Suite 100 Bellevue, WA  98004
column13: My overall rating would be a C+. Although the service was good, I felt that the quality of the food was average and the prices seemed a bit high. I'm glad I tried it, however there are many other restaurants that I would prefer to go to.

column4: 800 W. Olympic Blvd Suite A120 Los Angeles, CA  90015
column13: There were three of us ladies who stopped for dinner at Trader Vic's before the Il Divo concert at the Nokia on 7/19. The food was excellent, and it was very convenient to the theater.

They could ot find our reservation from open table! BUT, after 12 minute wait, they found a nice booth for us. my friend pronounced the Salmon, the best he'd ever tasted! My veal was delicious as well!

column4: 1151 Coast Village Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: This was my second time at Tre Lune. Both times the food and service have been awesome. Thank you Louis. My husband is a picky eater and they worked with us to provide him with an excellent meal.
Food was good but service was nonexistent.

column4: 1077 El Camino Real Menlo Park, CA  94025
column13: Tables a bit close together. Otherwise, everything else great. We liked the slice of tiramisu they provided for our occasion.

column4: 221 Las Colinas Blvd East Irving, TX  75039
column13: My 16-year old twin daughters and I were guests at the Omni Mandalay and dined at Trevi's on Friday, July 6th at 9:30 a.m. for breakfast and what a treat! We ordered their fabulous French Toast w/carmelized bananas which was to die for and the pancake breakfast which included eggs, bacon and hash browns. The fresh fruit tray was exceptional as well. The service far exceeded my expectations. We definitely had to return the next day for breakfast which included their buffet offering made to order omelet's! We will return soon.

We started with excellent service, but 20 minutes into the drinks and appetizer, it decreased dramatically. Sporadic--- 5 minutes of attention, and 20 without. Very poor timing of courses. The food was OK, but definitely overpriced. My recommendation is that it is a good place for drinks, an appetizer, and the view. But, save the big dinner bucks for better food and service.

The setting was gorgeous. the restaurant set us up based on our request for a round table in advance. They were very accommodating to my no dairy, no gluten requests and the chef even specially prepared hot gluten free bread with olive oil. Very thoughtful gesture! The steaks were perfectly cooked. The chicken was the tastiest chicken we have ever had at a restaurant and beautifully presented. Our waiter was perfect. All in all a wonderful dining experience. It's also a great place to spend an evening as the walk along town lake is beautiful.

column4: 45 South Glenwood Street Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: Third visit to this restaurant. Another great meal, good service, great ambiance.

column4: 707 North Palm Canyon Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Trio is a very happening place and seems to appeal to locals and tourists alike. We had a great meal and experienced wonderful service. Love this place! No complaints, would come back again and again.

column4: 6405 South 3000 East Salt Lake City, UT  84121
column13: Very good food, excellent service. Be great if there were more vegetarian options. The special pasta was fantastic.

column1: Triple J Chophouse and Brew Co
column13: Our experience was good, but not great on a busy Tuesday night. There really wasn't one thing that was outstanding or even excellent that stood out. Service was good for the amount of people that nearly packed the restaurant at 7 p.m., and when the JJJ is packed, its very noisy and hard to carry on a conversation. I've had better meals here, and the place seems to be succeeding on reputation, not quality or innovation.
The food and service are very good in a beautiful setting.The price is a little high since you are in a resort area.

Great for pub food, which is good for a pub! Recommend the Fish n Chips (Mahi) and the on tap beer selection is the best I've seen on Windward Oahu. The British Pastie (like a pot pie) had a great presentation but was quite undercooked (read hard carrots and potatoes). I'll try the gourmet burger next time.
We've been going to Tango for years. They continue to provide an all-around excellent experience!

Brookwood is a gem. Staff / service is outstanding. The food is delicious with great presentation. The environment is peaceful and beautiful. The cafe is outstanding, the gift shop has something for everyone, and the gardens / plants are fabulous. Everyone I have taken to Brookwood say it was so much more than they imagined. A truly wonderful experience. Bring your camera! Hats off to Brookwood for not only a consistently great job but what an outstanding commitment to society and their community!

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Addison
column13: Magical!!! We went for my wife's birthday - and WOW! Incredible food - delicate tastes that harmonized perfectly from one dish to the next. A great find for "foodies" - and we will DEFINITELY be back.

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Austin Arboretum
column13: Always a fan of Trulucks. The food is outstanding. The service was a bit slow on this occasion, but no problem as we had plenty of time.

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Austin Downtown
column13: Fantastic experience. I highly recommend Trulucks Downtown. Service was impeccable from the mgmt (Andrew) to the wait staff (Tiffany). Food was awesome!

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Dallas Uptown
column13: Great meal for a special occasion as it is quite pricey. We ordered a variety of items and everyone was please with their food. You won't have room left, but order the carrot cake for dessert - it was delicious!

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - La Jolla
column4: 8990 University Center Lane San Diego, CA  92122
column13: Went for our Anniversary. Outstanding food! Customer service was perfect! Recommend to everyone.

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Southlake
column13: Honestly, I have a pretty bad track record with more expensive restaurants. It seems they usually serve food that I could get for a quarter the price, or even less, with servers more concerned with their own etiquette than with your dining experience. This was not my experience here. The service was great, and the food was phenomenal. I've already recommended it to several of my friends.
Great ambiance and wonderful overall experience. Very courteous service, and quality food. The only negative was the somewhat limited menu, but we all found choices we were happy with.

column4: 2121 E Craig Road Las Vegas, NV  89030
column13: The service was only good because the poor treatment at the reservation desk offset the excellent table and waiter service.

The food was excellent. The drinks were great (and I asked for a non-menu item and they made it). The service was spotty (we were asked if there would be anything else, said no, and waited 15 minutes for the bill in a less than crowded restaurant). For a while we were the only ones there and we were worried but then the food arrived. The only negative was the warmth of the seating area. I don't know if their air conditioner was out or not but they had the front door open and it was 90+ degrees outside and in.

column1: Houlihan's at the Holiday Inn SF Airport
column4: 275 S. Airport Blvd South San Francisco, CA  94080
column13: Enjoyed every starter we had...from the spinach and lovsh, the chicken wings, and the big bite rshooms. Then the main dish...scalloped risotto (yummy), enjoyed every bite.
The food was amazing, but the food took a really long time.. and they didn't seem to be super busy. Our order of sashimi took about 30 min to get to us- we didn't time our other entrees.
Good food and phenomenal whiskey cocktails.
The Salmon Eggs Benedict was really good, atmosphere great, I believe most seats are outside.
Once again an awesome experience - exquisite food, outstanding service, and quiet enough to carry on conversations at the table. This has become one of my favorite dining experiences!
Great place! Friendly service! Unbelievably good food!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Tucson
column4: 6360 N. Campbell Avenue Suite 180 Tucson, AZ  85718
column13: Nice people doing good work. A steady kitchen and a wait staff that always seems to enjoy what they do and make guests feel comfortable. Many repeat visits for this local favorite which is only coincidentally part of a chain.

column4: 7395 N. La Cholla Blvd. Tucson, AZ  85741
column13: I had a wonderful experience, the server was very nice and did a great job. The food was delicious and I would recommend it to anyone.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Tulsa
column13: Steak was excellent and the wine selection is very good

This is definitely a restaurant for romance. it is dim and quiet and intimate. my husband and i spent our 2 year anniversary here and it was so perfect. we had a tiny booth for two and great service. The food is different and so very tasty and if you do not go in with intentions of having the chocolate fondue at the end of your meal, you are cheating yourself out of the best part! pricy, but so worth it!

column1: Miyama Japanese Steak House and Sushi Bar
column13: This is a difficult review to write, as Miyama is a restaurant that I enjoy terribly and frequent often. As the fun of going to Miyama is to enjoy the show as much of the food we didn't like the idea of one our group being sat behind the cook. We asked politely to be moved to a different table. The hostess initially was uncooperative to our request and then began whispering to the waitress, which I can only assume to make unflattering comments. She eventually moved us to a different table, but appeared put off by this request. Once sat, it took over 40 minutes before our dinner arrived to be prepared. The food was wonderful, our cook was very entertaining and our waitress was great, but timing and the hostess put a damper on the evening.

column4: 1 Old Golf Course Road Monterey, CA  93940
column13: It was just okay. Good hotel restaurant. I would not seek them out for any occasion. Food just okay. It was surprisingly pricey.

column4: 968 S. Westlake Blvd. Suite 4 Westlake Village, CA  91361
column13: The food was quite unremarable and the service was definitely sub-standard. After delivering an appetizer to our table, the server disappeared for twenty to thirty minutes and only reappeared after my complaint to management. If this is truly one of the better restaurants in Ventura County, all I can say is "poor ventura county".

We had a terrific meal. Group of seven heading out got the evening. Everyone enjoyed their meal. I had the lentil soup and Divine Gnocchi, which really was divine. No great view. Sometimes live music. Reasonable prices. :)

We came to celebrate a birthday and I was embarassed. Booked on open table, but they didn't seem to know about the reservation when we arrived. The service was good and the fresh bread is good, but all the entrees were marginal at best. Salads were small. Veal Piccata was tough and dry with pasta that was chewy and bland. Stuffed shells were dry (not enough sauce) and meager. This is really a bar that is trying to place itself as a restaurant and prices reflect that but quality does not. Maybe the pizzas and burgers are ok but don't go to Tuscany Tavern for a dining experience.

The food was great. You should eat here if you are a meat eater. Vegetarians have less options as they can probably only eat grilled veggies (that are grilled on the same plate as the meat). The thing I liked most was the service. The waitress was very nice and helpful in walking us through the menu. It was a great experience overall!

We have been to this restaurant before--some time ago and it was quite good. It has gone downhill since then. They tried but just seemed to not know what to do--the servers and the food was so bland it was almost tasteless. The veal was tough with a lot of grisle. My partner only ate a small portion--it wasn't worth the effort.
Rate Tutti Santi very high, one of our local favorites. Been there several times, never disappointed and recommend to all of our friends.

In the neighborhood, but never tried it since it was the previous restaurant. Happy to see they kept the beautiful interior. We all ordered different pastas. My husband was licking the plate from the ravioli. Everything was enjoyable! Very good service from Josh, the waiter.
We went there for the Mai Tais, we stayed for the food.

So I made reservations for 7 pm on a Saturday night, knowing that since it was a weekend night that the place would probably be packed. I had never been there before but I looked at their website and saw plenty of tables for dinner and the food got okay reviews on Yelp. When I arrived at the bar it was standing room only because there was a massive group at place taking over everything! They had one of those fundraiser events with wristbands and there were just sooo many people there. The hostess station said "if there's nobody here, seat yourself." Needless to say I never got my table (because they didn't hold one for me). It was a very fun atmosphere, I just wouldn't have picked this place for dinner if I had known about the group event.

Great food, great service, but the decor is really tacky and needs to be updated ASAP. I realize the decor has no connection with the food, but it really kills part of the experience, all these caricatures on the walls need to go.

column4: 3333 Blue Diamond Road Las Vegas, NV  89139
column13: Excellent food and service was fantastic. The cedar planked salmon and the scallops are wonderful.
I look forward to a meal or two at Ketchum Grill every time I visit my sisters in Sun Valley. The ambiance and service are outstanding and the food is always deeply memorable. Don't miss it!

Our server, Julia, was the best ever! The presentation of the gazpacho was exquisite! We celebrated a birthday and the dessert, a chocolate croissant bread pudding was absolutely delicious! The entire staff, including the host and manager were friendly and accommodating!

column4: 535 South Grand Ave. Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: There were 4 of us, the only thing good was the puff pastry as a garnish,Food was awfull, shrimps were mealy, 3 of us ordered fish all were over, over, over, cooked.all of our orders were too oily, salty and peppery.Dessert - short bread, tasted like a stale rubbery something.There was an assortment of breadsAll were dry, no tast, old, and just bad.Again the only thing good was the puff pastry that was the garnish andOne of us is gluten free and couldn't even try the only thing that was good.Nothing was fresh.This is a sad restaraunt,

column4: 3221 Donald Douglas Loop South Santa Monica, CA  90405
column13: Typhoon is unique in that regardless of time of day or night, this is the perfect place to come!! Gorgeous landing strip views through the panoramic windows (in daylight or during the twinkly-lit evening), great service and delicious food. I recommend this restaurant to everyone for every occassion, from first date to anniversary, and everything in between. Oh, and they have live jazz now too!

We were on our honeymoon, so we were hoping for a quiet dinner with a great view. We got a very good dinner, but the tables around us were quite noisy (big parties) and blocked some of our view of Puget Sound. It was still a very nice evening.
Absolutely great view, great service, great food. I was very happy. The salmon chowder was fantastic.

When the sun shines it really gets busy in Mukilteo. We enjoyed our waitress at Ivar's, Janet who did a great job of taking care of us. The dinner was exceptional salmon.The parking is hard to come by as Ivar's lot was filled up.

We enjoyed our dinner, but it was very loud. Difficult to hear my companion across the table. Are the tables too close together? I could hear the person at the table next to me better than my companion. The food was very good, but 3 scallops for $28? Maybe a bit over priced. Loved the risotto. Brussel sprouts were roasted too dark for my taste.
This was our third visit to Uncle Yu's in Livermore and this was by far our best experience yet. If you are debating on giving it a try STOP and make a reservation.

A quite charming elegant restaurant with warm services and the food was delicious. Ordered their Fish Tacos and it was the best fish tacos by far in SF! I would recommend to anyone to try this Perry's on Union Street. I will have to go back once more to try their Fish and Chips.

column4: 1000 Universal Studios Blvd. Universal City, CA  91608
column13: Our server was polite and happy! He tended to our needs and was very accomodating! A great afternoon for a Birthday lunch !
Out for a special dinner with our 15 year old. Food was good and our server was terrific! there were two large parties in the area we were seated, so sometime a bit louder than was comfortable.

column4: 223 Gore Creek Dr., Suite 103 Vail, CO  81657
column13: Beware!! the online menu is much broader than reality. While the food was good there were only 7 Entrees to select from for dinner. Very disappointed. Ended up with appetizers and soup as our meal.
They handled our large group with two food allergies (chicken and gluten) with ease. The waitstaff went above and beyond and the food was delicious. I would recommend them in a heartbeat.

column4: 3950 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Was ready to pass after reading all the negative feedback on open table. But out dinner at the china grill was great. Still delicious. Bannanas in a box is the best thing ever

column4: 174 E. Gore Creek Drive Vail, CO  81657
column13: Average at best. Steaks over cooked and artichoke dreadful.
The food was great..customer services was excellent... and well worth the price....

column1: Mariposa at Neiman Marcus - Ala Moana
column13: Very good seat outside where we could see fireworks at Hilton. Also we had delicious dinner with my family. I would like to come again!!

This was my first experience and I was not sure of what to expect but was pleasantly supprised. this is a gem located inside the Hotel and it offered a cozy brunch atmosphere to my delight since it was the Mother's Day brunch I brought my aunt to. I do not think they offer a brunch menu outsied of special days but i would recommend when they do that you be sure to enjoy. Food was fresh and well seasoned. Great Recommendation Open Table!
Waiter was rude. Salad wasn't very good but main courses were okay.

The food was good but overpriced. My salmon dish for $25 came with no sides and just the vegetable stuffing, which was predominately carrots(the cheapest vegetable possible). My son's steak was excellent, but his vegetables were cold. The garlic potatoes were hot on the inside but cold on the outside. The waiter disappeared after he brought the entrees and did not reappear until we were finished eating.The service is better at Islands. At least the waiter there came by frequently to refill our sodas. We only came because we had a gift certificate.This dinner repeated our previous experiences there.We came for dinner because the last time we came for lunch to use the certificate, the service was slightly better but the food was overcooked.

column4: 434 W. San Francisco Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: The restaurant is okay. Wine list is nice and decently priced. It is more interesting for the bar scene and the music. Very nice wait staff.

On Friday, July 20, my family and I dined here. My family was visiting from Germany, and the waitress let us know that the chef was from there as well. He came to speak with us, and explained their dishes in German for them. It was a nice gesture, and completely unexpected. We tried the special, and were amazed! The food was very creative, and presentation was lovely. We all had a great experience. Thank you so much to the chef and staff for our dining experience.
half off wine wednesdays are the best!

column4: 3667 Las Vegas Blvd. South (Planet Hollywood Resort) Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: First time to this location. Wasn't as busy as expected but the service was great. I am lookig forward to bringing more friends and having a great time.

The grilled octopus was so tough - like chewing on rubber bands! When the waiter asked how we liked the octopus, I told him was tasty but too tough. He didn't know what to say, infact seemed afraid to come back to the table. Two waiters switched tables at that point. My entree a rosted duck dish was also very tough. It was loaded with a thick layer of fat and even with a sharp steak knife I could not cut the meat. Terrible! The drinks however were good. So I recommend this place for drinks as the ambiance is quite nice.

column4: 5121 S. Yosemite Street Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: We eat out a lot and this was one of the best meals we have had in a long time. I would go back next week.
This was a fantastic place with excellent food and wonderful service, they don't have allot of booths but the ones they do have are excellent. Views!
I had mentioned in my online reservation that we wanted a table outside. It wasnt even offered to us. They had a bunch of tables open. Would of made the evening better.

This is a staff that knows how to read its patrons and deliver its services to highlight the mood the patrons have established. Toni was a fantastic server ready to recommend dishes, answer questions, and play into the mood of the table. Shannon, too, made sure we felt like valued guests. Thanks to all for Fred's birthday dessert...he devoured the cobbler! Next time we will dine at about 7:00 and stay for the music!
Excellent fresh food, good vegetarian option, good selection of wine and beer, moderate prices.
What a terrific meal we had! We tried the homemade gnocchi, the caesar salad, the mussels, the Chicken Piccata. FANTASTIC! The The homemade pasta is a real meal, nice portion sizes.

The food was WONDERFUL! We had a group of 6 and we ordered the beef shin. It says this serves 4... we each had 2-3 tacos and were full and ended up going home with a TON of leftover meat! Enough for another meal of 6 for sure! It was delicious and I would definitely recommend ordering it with a group. We also had the white fish dip and the hummus - both very tasty. The only thing I would've liked to be different would be to have some a/c inside... it was 100+ degrees outside when we went.. although the fans helped.
The food and service, axs always, was excellent.
While the food and service were fine, the noise level in this fully packed place was very, very loud and definitely detracted from the evening.

column4: 10100 W. Charleston Blvd. Suite 150 Las Vegas, NV  89135
column13: Celebrated my birthday here two years in a row... each time - Wonderful!

column4: 569 S. Coast Highway 101 Encinitas, CA 92024 Encinitas, CA  92024
column13: Excellent calzone and lasagne. Also able to cater to my wife's gluten free needs. Will come again next time in town.

We have considered dining at Vidal since it opened. Now, we are sorry that we waited so long to try this undiscovered gem. We found the quality of food that we love at Tila's with the service and atmosphere that has disappeared from this old favorite of ours. It's not a spot for families with the erotic artwork and club-like feel. Kudos to the staff for a great dinner!

we wanted to try this after seeing a play in San Diego; we brought friends and were very disappointed. Maybe this was just a bad day and we will give the one in a Lecudia a try sometime. Service was and staff was very attentive, we just had a bad experience with the food

column4: 2330 Proctor Valley Rd. #101 Chula Vista, CA  91914
column13: There were 7 of us. All was excellent. Food, Service, Ambiance. Could not have asked for a better dinner with the family.

This is one of our favorite restaurants in town! There seasonal menus offers something unique and always perfectly prepared. Portion sizes are just right and feels like you should be paying more! Love it before a play!
Great food in a beautiful setting along side the Russian River. Well selected Sonoma county wines on the wine list. We give it our highest recommendation!

column4: 6886 South Clinton Street Greenwood Village, CO  80112
column13: The place was empty on a Saturday night. Maybe because of the thunder storms??? All th food was good, except for the octopus appetizer. It REALLY needed to be cooked more. It was seasoned well, but very TOUGH!
A pleasant, energetic restaurant even on a Monday evening. Pizza very good (thin crust) as was the salad. Limited number of pasta dishes. Wine list seemed overpriced.

3 generations went there for the All You Can Eat Spaghetti and Meatballs. There wasn't just one type of sauce, but 4! And choice of meatballs or italian sausage. Salad and bread included. The food was wonderful! The service was great! It was a hot day, we were there in late afternoon, and were able to sit outside, in the shade. The ambience was perfect for everyone. Totally recommend Jacobi's to anyone looking for fantastic food and service!

Chef Lorenzo is by far one of the finest Italian chefs in the Phoenix area. If requested, he will vary any item on the menue to fit the taste of the customer. Also, the wait staff (Giovani, Dino, etc) is extremely professional. Everyone at Tomaso's takes pride in the food, the service and making certain that the customer is satisfied.

column1: VINeleven at the Napa Valley Marriott
column13: We have wonderful experiences here in the past but this time we had 7 people plus a baby and it took an extremely long time for us to get our food. Our server was very nice but seemed to be spread pretty thin. The food received mixed reviews from our group. Some people loved the food especially the ribs, the lettuce wraps and the chickpea fries. But our hamburger eaters felt the meat was a little overcooked for "medium". And one person had the chicken salad and said it was pretty light on the chicken. We do normally love this restaurant and will definitely be back.

column1: Vineyard Rose at South Coast Winery
column13: While on a trip to Southern California area, we spent an evening dining at South Coast Winery. We found the entrance landscaping very nice and inviting which made us feel welcome. We chose to be seated outside on a covered deck overlooking rest of grounds and found the view to be nice. Service was fantastic as our server gave us alot of attention, but was not constantly bothering us. We did not feel rushed. We ordered appetizer of Coconut Shrimp with excellent wine. My wife ordered the clam chowder and I had the vineyard salad with fresh mozzarella which was quite tasty. I had the New York Strip and my wife had the Sea Bass and both were very good. We ended by each having an excellent dessert with a nice port. Overall, the atmosphere, meal,

Took the Family to Mother's Day brunch. Arrived at 9:50 for our 10am reservation, There was a long line to get in I asked an employee if we had to wait in line if we had reservations? He said yes. I don't know why we had a reservation then?

Was expecting good food but it turned out to be exceprional. The grits are delicious and the steaks are superb. Skybar has a nice view and the waiter brought complementary champagne and sorbet throughout our meal which added a nice touch. Will definately go back... A little pricey. A two person date featuring appetizer, two entres, wine and one desert was around $135. Very nice place though.

We enjoyed a delicious dinner 7/17/12. Service was excellent and server was knowledgeable. The calamari, shrimp and scallop appetizer was tender and cooked perfectly. Salad with mixed greens, strawberries, ricotta and candied pecans was fresh and dressing very good. Veal chop with mushrooms was cooked perfectly. Freshly made papparadelle with cinghiale was as good as those I've had in Italy. Lemon tart was the perfect end. Excellent wine list.

Service was slow and the sound was terible....couldn't hear person next to me talking. Tables too close for privacy! They charged the wrong sales tax for restaurants as the stadium bonds are paid for and the 10% sales tax is no longer used for restaurants.
Music was way too loud. Would not go again if there is live music. Wine list was mediocre. Food and service was excellent.

Great place to meet and eat but they have screwed our reservation pretty much every time. I specifically request an outside table when booking via Opentable but this wasn't acknowledged, even though my message was on the screen when I checked in. Not good enough. Love the place, the beers, wine, appetizers and pizza but they've made mistakes with both my and friends' reservations too frequently. C'mon Vinz - Tango is snapping at your heels!

column4: 3600 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Very expensive with very small portions although the food is very good.

column4: 333 S. Grand Avenue, 54th Floor Los Angeles, CA  90071
column13: City Club has a nice view, but the atmosphere is dated and the food is average at best despite being quite expensive. I would head to The Perch or WP24 where you can get both before ever coming back to the City Club.
The chef knows how to prepare grilled salmon perfectly!
Food and drink was good. The website says it has Denver's best view. That needs to change since condos have been built right in front. NO VIEW AT ALL.
Our next door neighbour is an Italian lady (from Italy). She only dines at Vivace. Her son is a fan too, and so are we now.

Expected more, it's just an ok place. If the chicken wasn't cooked at the table with a horrid sauce, or if we had plates to eat off of instead of a scorching hot cast iron skillet I'd have appreciated the meal more. Sorry, but those high marks aren't deserved, not to mention they ran out of the trout and wanted to say the team raised Austrailian Salmon and they're claim is "local and fresh."

Do not allow the signs on the door to intimidate or prevent you from entering the lounge. The Margherita and pizza with prosciutto/arugula were excellent. This is a high compliment since eating Napoli pizza at Settebello restaurant. It was a surprisingly pleasant experience for non-drinkers.
Above average hotel restaurant but not a destination
If you would like to talk and hear each other speak, sit in the back dining room.

The main negative thing I have to say is that you come out of the restaurant smelling like cooking oil (or something), at least if you sit near the sushi bar, although the kitchen is enclosed behind the sushi bar. They need to do something about kitchen or sushi prep area ventilation.

column4: 5418 N Western Ave. Oklahoma City, OK  73118
column13: Waitress Katie was very attentive to us and very knowledgable about the menu. When asked what she would choose between a couple dishes, she very quickly knew her favorites to suggest. Outstanding service as usual! Thank You!
The food was fabulous and the service was excellent! This is a restaurant where the patron is treated like royality. The place is small so I do recommend making reservations.

An exceptional culinary experience! I recommend trying the omegache, a six course chef's choice meal complete with dessert. My husband and I were able to taste many signature dishes. The tuna tartare with caviar has a delightful presentation served over ice with a demitasse spoon. The red snapper sashimi with yuzu sauce was absolutely unique and divine. The service was second to none.
PF Changs is a long time favourite and such a treat. We visited Waikiki where it was extremely beneficial being able to reserve a table. Consistently good food.

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - Wailea, Maui
column13: The service was horrible, it took thirty minutes just to get water and place our order. We were a group of three adults two teens. Over two hours to get food and leave. I also asked the waiter if he could make a substitue on the kids menu for shrimp, he sa I'd he would as to my suprise charged me more than the adults meal. I pointed out my dis satisfaction , we would have made another selection had this been a problem. I am very very unimpressed with lack of customer service
The Best in the Desert for a special meal. Excellent food, impeccable service always.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Walnut Creek
column4: 1685 Mt. Diablo Boulevard Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: This place has replaced ruths chris for us. I eat out once a week and I love checking a website out for good specials. Flemings has a great summer menu that changes weekly and is a great price for salad, meal and dessert. It is on the website in detail. The service has always been really good. We like Stephanie. She is on the ball for a server and is knows her menu. Being an ex server I can feel her pain when it comes to waiting on picky people..The manager always stops at the table to check on your meal and he has now recognized us as regulars..This past meal I did not like the dessert and the manager promptly replaced it with 2 desserts to go. Very generous..I love that..We will be back..I'm sure next week..

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Walnut Creek
column4: 1553 Olympic Blvd. Bldg. E Walnut Creek, CA  94596
column13: We enjoyed our dining experience here with friends last weekend. We were running late and I called and asked if we could come in later. The front desk person was incredibly nice and accommodating. The food and service was great!!

column4: 146 E. Cheyenne Mountain Blvd. Colorado Springs, CO  80906
column13: Overall it was exactly what I had expected in relation to its Reviews.

Good food and great service, but the parking situation was abysmal!! Took forever just to get into the lot and have the valet take the car. Then, they had to track us down inside to say we didn't leave a key (despite the fact that the valet was driving away in the car as we were walking into the restaurant). We reminded them that the car had a push-button ignition and a smart key which was IN THE CAR. Then when we got ready to leave, we had to wait about 20 minutes to get the car. They did give us a complimentary chocolate cake because of the car issue, but it was pure torture for me, since I'm on a very low-carb diet. They didn't need to do anything to make it up to us, but we would have preferred to have just gotten a small credit o
We went here for a birthday celebration and they treated us wonderfully. We had the best time that night. The food was amazing! Every course we had was great!

column4: Pier 7 on the Embarcadero San Francisco, CA  94111
column13: Seafood plate was totally over priced compared to the content of the plate. Entrees were ok, nothing spectacular. Desserts were a positive surprise. Waiting staff was friendly but busboys were a bit too eager to clear plates. We were among the last to leave and busboys were circuling us waiting to clear the table.

column4: 31250 Palos Verdes Drive West Rancho Palos Verdes, CA  90275
column13: Good service. A nice experience of dining.

column4: 399 The Embarcadero South San Francisco, CA  94105
column13: Having lunch outside on the waterfront is lovely on a warm day. The first courses are small and the main courses are large, so I ordered two first courses for lunch!

It was my wife's birthday and as a family of 5 we were celebrating her special day. I couldn't get a reservation timed around sunset to take advantage of the scenic view (my fault for waiting too long to make a reservation) so we were in at 6 p.m. We were greated promptly and seated immediately. The restaurant is older and the decor is nothing exceptional but again, its the scenic view and the outdoors which set the mood here. The service was exceptional. The food was great. I thought it was a bit pricey but it was a special occassion and it's not the type of restaurant I would frequent regularly. I am interested in returning to the bar area and taking advantage of the outdoor patio on a future summer evening.
Freshest and best seafood in East Bay.
Appreciated that the waiter graciously returned the duck to the kitchen for additional cooking.

column4: 1400 S Congress Suite B100 Austin, TX  78704
column13: Very good food, but a bit overpriced. $28 for a small piece of (excellent tasting) fish with no sides.

column1: Ruby River Steakhouse - Salt Lake City
column4: 435 S 700 E Salt Lake City, UT  84102-2805
column13: I found the service to be jovial and with a good sense of humor, and the food was excellent. While our initial appetizer was out, the waitress recommended a substitute, which was the superb, a coconut shrimp with orange dip. Dim lighting, cowboy-themed decor, and buckets of bar peanuts while ordering. Great place for a quiet and romantic meal for any occasion.

column4: Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino 3770 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The food was amazing! Our waitress Alex provided excellent customer service, and the rest of the staff was great! Even though it's right off the casino floor, the outside noise didn't bother us and the music wasn't too loud either.
This was my second time dining at this restaurant and it was even better than the first. Great food!
Beautiful setting in Estes Park. Great service and food!

column4: 3124 Crow Canyon Place San Ramon, CA  94583
column13: Nice, comfortable, neighborhood Italian restaurant with consistently good food and friendly service.
Excellent food and a wonderful wine list.
What a great place!! We'll be back.

column1: The Grill on the Alley - Westlake Village
column13: Excellent food and service! Strongly recommend the delicious _Double R_ Tomahawk Rib Chop!!!! Mr. Jay Anthony (the General Manager) always makes sure that all customers enjoy an excellent experience, which we appreciate.

column4: 170 N Church Lane 17th Floor of Hotel Angeleno Los Angeles, CA  90049
column13: One would think, with such a great view, there but be a drawback somewhere. If there is, I couldn't find it. The food was fabulous, perfect balance of textures, colors and flavors. Maybe a little high on the butter and salt but that's what makes it good, right?
In a bad location and they have no atmosphere. Food was just ok.
The service was not great. The food was pretty good.
THEY HAVE NEW OWNERS SINCE LAST OCT 2011. THEY NO LONGER HAVE THE WILD CARD BONUS.. THE MENU HAS CHANGED.
Amazing place to have a special occasion!! Food was wonderful, service was outstanding and I will definitely come back!!!

A colleague recommended this spot for a brunch I had with an out of town guest. I've lived in Dallas 8 years and had never been here. It was very relaxing and perfect for Spring and Summer weather. Next time I'm bringing my bathing suit! EXCELLENT service and atmosphere.

Great location on the West end of the 16th Street Mall with cheap underground parking right across the street. The Trash appetizer was impeccable and I LOVE that my salmon came with wasabi potatoes and brussels sprouts. Make sure to ask your hotel for a appetizer voucher before going.

We went to celebrate my future mother in laws birthday... Which I clearly indicated on the open table reservation. The birthday was not ever acknowledged. Our server was Wilfred and his knowledge level of the menu, communication, and overalls service was certainly not in line with the price point of this restaurant. Although I was pleased with our menu choices, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
I was there with a party of ten and the service was on the slow side. Food was quite good. Music was a loud and interfered with easy dinner conversation.

column4: 16335 W. Northern Ave Litchfield Park, AZ  85340
column13: Great Staff, Great view of HUGE shark tank and Great food..
Other than the missing reservation via Open Table it was fine.

column4: 151 South 500 East Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: We love your menu and have never had a bad experience. My only complaint this visit was we were bombarded with flys and fruit flys. We had out of town guests and they were not as forgiving. But I will be back! Thanks!

Amazing food and atmosphere!! Will definitely be going back again and again. The food was delicious and had beautiful presentation. The server was knowledgable and helpful with menu decisions and was sure to get us fed and paid in time for the show.

The restaurant seemed overwhelmed from the hostess that discourteously told us we would have to wait even though we had reservations to the lack-luster service once we were seated. The food was good, and the apple dessert was excellent. We also enjoyed the complimentary take-home entrees the next day. We are willing to give them another try, but only because the food was good.
Quite nice. Very good and authentic Italian food. If just two are dining ask to sit at the two seat area overlooking the chefs.

column4: 19 East Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924-9703
column13: Great find! Dinner and wine were only outdone, by the knowlege and engaging staff. We had dinner at Wills Fargo and found it to be a lovely room, great staff and fabulous food. The salads were crisp and fresh and our main courses were prepared perfectly. My wife, son (15) and daughter (12) and I loved the entire experience.

column4: 400 Old County Road Suite 1 Pacifica, CA  94044
column13: Great selections of wine and friendly service. Not really a place to dine as food selection is very limited to empanadas & cheese plates. Great place to relax and enjoy nice flight of wine, listen to the live music.

column1: I Love Sushi on Lake Bellevue
column13: Wow! What a find! Everything from the location to food to service was amazing..I will more than definitely return to this location.

column4: 445 N. Canon Drive Beverly Hills, CA  90210
column13: Just for reference, I have only had lunch here. I have lunch there on a regular basis, and I really enjoy it!

column1: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Woodinville
column4: 14459 Woodinville Redmond Road NE Woodinville, WA  98072
column13: The Woodinville Purple restaurant is a warm and friendly destination that is woven into the fabric of the community. The staff is welcoming, friendly, and always attentive to making making the customer happy.

column4: 6100 N. Topanga Canyon Blvd Woodland Hills, CA  91367
column13: Food was ok but the sound level made it hard to hear anyone at a 6 person round table. The dim lighting was tough on the seniors in the group. Our server's charm was forced and did not make up for mistakes on our order or inattentive service.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Woodland Hills
column4: 6373 Topanga Canyon Blvd. Woodland Hills, CA  91367
column13: Usually give Flemmings a "very good" rating but service this evening was slow to start. Sat at table for about 10 minutes before we saw a waiter. Busy, noisy evening adn service could not keep up.

column4: 6363 Topanga Canyon Blvd. Woodland Hills, CA  91367
column13: Pricey-without coupon we wouldnnotnhave gone

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Woodland Hills
column4: 6100 Topanga Canyon Blvd Suite 1360 Westfield Shopping Towne PromenadeWestfield Shopping Towne Promenade Woodland Hills, CA  91367
column13: Absolutely positively the BEST!

Food was ok. I ordered the delux. The lobster and steak. Lobster was over cooked and steak was dry. Not impressed by food. Also, the waiter forgot a few drink ordersa. Wich took forever to correct. I wish this place had some better skilled people. They were nice, but not impressed

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - The Woodlands
column4: 1201 Lake Woodlands Drive, The Woodlands Mall Suite 305 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: consistent - never disappointsFriendy waitstaff & great food
This was for our anniversary amd they made it very special.
Great presentation and excellent food. Service excellent.

column4: 711 Pacific Beach Dr. San Diego, CA  92109
column13: Fabulous view, wonderful food and great service... Highly recommend! We ate dinner and watched the sunset. Gorgeous...

column4: 3799 Las Vegas Blvd South MGM Grand Hotel Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: We enjoyed our return trip to this restaurant. We had a lighter dinner which included the signature home made fries with blue cheese (excellent!) , a burger, and ravioli, both were very good. Service was also very good with good suggestions on cocktail choices. We'll return again when in the area.

Once again we had a wonderful meal, excellent service, and a most enjoyable time eating on their patio on a lovely Friday evening. Okay, we needed our jackets, but it was sunny and felt good to be on their inviting patio at last.

column4: 1121 White Rock Rd El Dorado Hills, CA  95762
column13: We went on a Monday night so it was very quiet. Very nice decor...outstanding service and excellent food.

Went to Coronado Beachhouse 1887 to celebrate my daughter's graduation - it was a great experience. The waiter told us stories about the history of the place and suggested great fish to eat. Had a great bottle of wine - and when the four of us finished it off before dinner was over, our waiter let us know that we could order more by the glass rather than encouraging us to get another bottle which would have made it difficult to drive home safely. He also brought a special dessert to help my daughter celebrate - and there was enough of it for all of us to share!It was not inexpensive - $250 for four - but it was a great place for a special celebration - I'd recommend it!
What a wonderful find for lunch! Right off the freeway! Tri tip sandwich was great. French onion soup probably one of the best I've ever eaten. And the hostess and waitstaff were great. Thank you!

column4: 11604 San Vicente Blvd. Los Angeles, CA  90049
column13: We all loved it so much, we are returning tonight, three days later. It was recommended by a friend from Italy, who lives in Santa Monica and steered us away from some of the more known, overpriced, Italian restaurants. She was very effusive about the quality of the food and how authentic it was to what she was used to back home in Italy. The food was wonderful, beautifully presented and there were many great choices for two of the vegetarians in our party. We dined very early that evening and at that time it was not crowded.

Ok so the food was great when we finally got it (right after they turned the lights out on us). They have a great idea but terrible management which every waiter, host, and bus boy let us know every chance they got. Ultimately we paid over $200+inforced 18%gratuity to watch people heavily smoke hookah around screaming kids while we shoveled food off unsteady ottomans (they used as tables) as they indirectly kicked us out but not before hearing every complaint from the staff. Also they illegally used the only open parking spaces for thier valet. I'm positive there are better things to spend money on than this place. I wish I could send a personal message to the owners cuz this place deserves a slap in the face.
Fun spot. Surprised by the brunch menu from this cupcakery!

column1: Next Wood Fired Bistro & Vino Bar
column13: The food was really good but service poor. It was Saturday night and there should have been more waiters.

The Teppanyaki was tasty, the service was good and friendly and the meal was enjoyable overall. I cannot say this was the best Japanese I've ever had but certainly a solid lunch option at a reasonable price. There were three of us for lunch at roughly $120 and we were all full afterward. I had the chicken and tempura which was well cooked and tasty. Appetizers were also well seasoned and tasty. I would go there again.

column4: 4757 West Park Boulevard Suite 108 Plano, TX  75093
column13: It was too Americanized. Was looking for original chinese cuisine -- didn't even have chopsticks. Service was slow, confusing and they mixed drinks up twice - one was that I ordered Clo du bois wine - said it repeatedly and pointed to it and they charged me for La Creme - which was $4 a glass more expensive! Sweet and sour shrimp had such a thick, sticky and too sweet a sauce, no one who ordered it could finish it, nor wanted to do so. When I walked in and said my name for reservation, they mixed that up and accused me of getting their too late (reservation was for 6:30) and I told them my reservations were at 7:00 pm (and we were there at 7pm) and even received an email confirmation.... irritating from the beginning. Very disappointed!

The restaurant was very busy but our table was ready when we arrived. We had a window seat with a georgeous view, everyones food was excellent and our waitress was attentive and friendly. This is a public restaurant in a private country club, but you are treated like a member.

The world is a better place because of Chef Nei, and I am a better foodie! RESERVE your table for an unparallelled dining experience that takes you on an "Iron Chef" demonstration of tastes to satiate the palette and soul. STRICTLY for the artistic gourmand who values quality, intention and aesthetic above all, an evening at JAI YUN treats you to a colorful and fresh prix-fixe menu reflecting Chef Nei's vision of one man in the kitchen, only food purchased that day is served that day, and each chapter from appetizers to entres evolves the sensations of bitter, salty, sour, sweet and umami. Dining at Jai Yun is a complete and pure "Special Occasion" on its own, and frankly, not for everyone. The FOOD is the center of attention at Jai Yu.

column4: 3667 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: The food was quite good, interesting menu and a little different then the typical Mexican Restaurant. I had the Short Ribs which I'd recommend. The restaurant design/decor was nice, but the service was poor. The initial greeting was horrible. The hostess glared at us when we arrived and seemed put out she had to show us to seats. The waiter was okay, but very unattentive. We waited a long time for him to get our drinks order, in the end we went to the bar ourselves. It wasn't a bad evening despite that, but not a place I'd bother going back to. Too many other great Mexican places in Vegas.
There are many, many better steakhouses in Dallas. The service, atmoshere and most importanly food was just average...

Ive been 3 times. My on as visiting from Oregon so we took him there for dinner. The only thing i need to say thats not in Positive light. Is All 3 times i have ordered a Steak Very very well done aske for No pink! All 3 times ive had to send my steak back to be corrected to my liking. It frustrating when Everynes eating and Im sitting there. Other than that Foods Always been well and Servers are great! Just wish that would stop happening with my food.

column4: Doubletree Denver Tech 7801 East Orchard Road Greenwood Village, CO  80111
column13: The hostess was friendly, but had some severe dental issues that were very off-putting for a first impression of the restaurant. Our waitress was great and very helpful. Both of our meals were impressive. Great serving sizes for the price. From the description on the restaurant website, we were under the impression that this was a business casual environment. I think we were the only patrons not wearing shorts or jeans or that didn't have a child running around uncontrolled. The other patrons definitely brought down the overall experience for us, but the food and staff were great. We will be back.
The food was delicious, and the service was very attentive. They even gave us a complimentary appetizer. I will definitely be back.
Excellent. Service and food. Will go back several times.

We were running late and had tickets for the symphony later that night. The server did everything to make sure we got our food quickly and got to our show on time. There was no stress, because we knew she was on top of it. It was great service and the food was really good!

Red Fin was average at best. The place was empty (although it was early in the evening) and they appeared to be struggling from just recently getting their liquor license back. They only had one server working and this made the pace slow because he had to wait on everyone (only three or four tables in the whole place were occupied, however). The sushi was just ok. The sashimi tasted reasonably fresh, but I have had much better tasting sashami before. The rolls seemed uninspired--looking like something out of a grocery store case. It was fine for a reasonably quick early dinner, but we didn't feel like we made a very good choice with all of the options in this town know for its fish.

I have been looking for great neighborhood sushi restaurant for years. Well, this is it!! The food was amazing. Mouth watering nigiri and beautiful, creative rolls. The staff very friendly and attentive; The prices extremely reasonable. We talked with the manager, I think, and he said they have been in business only a few months... It's the kind of place you really want to do well, but you kind of want to keep a secret for yourself!
We had good sushi for a reasonable price. everything was good and nothing was outstanding. we will likely go back for sushi in the area.

column4: 5753 A East Santa Ana Canyon Road Anaheim, CA  92807
column13: The food and service are ALWAYS EXCELLENT. Our server was attentive but not intrusive. He was very familiar with the menu and, since we were celebrating a friend's 73rd birthday, he was especially gracious to our birthday lady.
Their signature rotisserie chicken is amazing.But what I thought was the most underated dish is their side of rice; it's fantastic.

The special appetizer tacos were excellent. Will definitely return for another nice bottle of Ribera del Duero and the food. I do wish the wine like would list the regions the wines are from rather than juse listing the varietals.

Chef Edgar always delights from the kitchen. Since I've ordered everything on the menu, I now typically lean toward the special because it's always delicious, unexpected, and something I wouldn't (or couldn't) cook at home. Dawn and Christina in the front of the house are superb: efficient and concerned about the food and service. I couldn't ask for better in a restaurant.

Everything about this experience was AWESOME!!! The food was excellent, the service was GREAT and i appreciate that you brought an ice cream sundae out for my friends Birthday. Thank you for a great night!

We've been a few times---keeps getting worse and worse. This will be our last. We're pretty sure this hotel and restaurant are now just used for some kind of money laundering. They are constantly [extensively] remodeling the hotel and never seem to have all that many guests. They honestly don't seem to care about the restaurant at all. The food was all microwaved, but they might have used a toaster oven for the fries and fried catfish....the service was inattentive at best, it was really comical. There were only 3 tables and 5 service staff standing around and we waited forever. Such a beautiful space--it should be packed....but again, they don't seem to care if they have people in there or not.....something shady is going on there

First time to visit... We felt very comfortable and welcomed. Nice recommendations from menu. Attentive service, with plenty of privacy. We ate early so there were a few younger families, but still felt that it was very special. Nice variety on menu. We'll be back for sure.

Although it seems to be very quiet and not as well attended as it has been in the past, Zibibbo is always high quality food, a solid wine list, and recently, really excellent service. Maybe due to the "what have you done for me lately" attitude of most University Ave visitors, I think people continue to overlook Zibibbo as a solid option for your dining plans.

column4: 500 Pacific Coast Highway Huntington Beach, CA  92648
column13: The restaurant was not crowded and the service was REALLY slow. It took us almost 15 minutes just to get our drink order from the bar. For 4 ppl to eat dinner it shouldnt take 2 1/2 hours.

column4: 198 S Palm Canyon Dr Palm Springs, CA  92262
column13: Great calamari, and shrimp with risotto was cooked perfectly. Delicious, we will be back, also a great server, very attentive, whitty, and gave us great recommendations.
Good food, good service, good location - while nothing was outstanding on its own, the overall experience was terrific!
Fantastic food! Your salmon special should be a permanent dish on the menu!
The food was great and the atmosphere was fun. Wish we had been there when there was a live band!
